Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Revenue and Taxation
=====================================================

Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Chapter 1 - General Taxation Policies
**********************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-101 Definitions.
-------------------------------------------
As used in this title:Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-101(1): "Commission" and "tax commission" mean the State Tax Commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-101(2): 59-1-1402 "Deficiency" is as defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201 Composition of commission -- Terms -- Removal from office -- Appointment.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(1): The commission shall be composed of four members appointed by the governor with the advice and consent of the Senate in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 24, Part 2, Vacancies.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(2): Subject to Subsection (3), the term of office of each commissioner shall be for four years and expire on June 30 of the year the term ends.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(3): The governor shall stagger a term described in Subsection (2) so that the term of one commissioner expires each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(4): A commissioner shall hold office until a successor is appointed and qualified.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(5)(a): The governor may remove a commissioner from office for neglect of duty, inefficiency, or malfeasance, after notice and a hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(5)(b): If the governor removes a commissioner from office and appoints another person to replace the commissioner, the person the governor appoints to replace the commissioner:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(5)(b)(i): shall serve for the remainder of the unexpired term; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(5)(b)(ii): may be reappointed as the governor determines.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(6): The individual the governor appoints or reappoints under Subsection (5) shall be made with the advice and consent of the Senate in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 24, Part 2, Vacancies.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(7)(a): Before appointing a commissioner, the governor shall request a list of names of potential appointees from:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(7)(a)(i): the Utah State Bar;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(7)(a)(ii): one or more organizations that represent certified public accountants who are licensed to practice in the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(7)(a)(iii): one or more organizations that represent persons who assess or appraise property in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(7)(a)(iv): one or more national organizations that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(7)(a)(iv)(A): offer a professional certification in the areas of property tax, sales and use tax, and state income tax;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(7)(a)(iv)(B): require experience, education, and testing to obtain the certification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(7)(a)(iv)(C): require additional education to maintain the certification.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(7)(b): In appointing a commissioner, the governor shall consider:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(7)(b)(i): to the extent names of potential appointees are submitted, the names of potential appointees submitted in accordance with Subsection (7)(a); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-201(7)(b)(ii): any other potential appointee of the governor's own choosing.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-202 Qualifications of members of commission.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-202(1): (2)(a) Each member of the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-202(1)(a): shall have significant tax experience that is relevant to holding office as a commissioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-202(1)(b): shall have knowledge of tax administration or tax compliance;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-202(1)(c): shall have executive and administrative experience; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-202(1)(d): (2)(a) except for one member who has substantial knowledge and expertise in the theory and practice of ad valorem taxation as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-202(1)(d)(i): the theory and practice of excise taxation;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-202(1)(d)(ii): the theory and practice of income taxation;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-202(1)(d)(iii): the theory and practice of sales and use taxation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-202(1)(d)(iv): the theory and practice of corporate taxation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-202(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-202(2)(a): At least one member of the commission shall have substantial knowledge and experience in the theory and practice of ad valorem taxation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-202(2)(b): At least one member of the commission shall have substantial knowledge and experience in the theory and practice of accounting.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-202(3): The membership of the commission shall represent composite skills in accounting, auditing, property assessment, management, law, and finance.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-203 Conflicts of interest -- Salaries -- Ethics.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-203(1): No person appointed as a member of the commission may hold any other office under the laws of this state, the government of the United States, or any other state.  Each member shall devote full time to the duties of the office and may not hold any other position of trust or profit under the Constitution nor engage in any other occupation that would create a direct conflict with the duties of a commissioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-203(2): Title 67, Chapter 22, State Officer Compensation The salaries of the commissioners shall be established by the governor within the salary range fixed by the Legislature in
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-203(3): Title 67, Chapter 16, Utah Public Officers' and Employees' Ethics Act No commissioner, executive director, or consultant shall engage in political or charitable fund raising activities.  Commissioners and commission employees are governed by
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-203(4): Title 63G, Chapter 24, Part 3, Conflicts of Interest A commissioner shall comply with the conflict of interest provisions described in


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-204 Oath of office.
----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-204(1): Before entering upon the duties of office, a member of the commission shall qualify by taking the constitutional oath of office.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-204(2): (1) The oath described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-205 Chairman -- Quorum -- Voting -- Sessions.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-205(1): The governor shall designate one of the members of the commission as chairperson.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-205(2): 59-1-502.5; (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-205(2)(a): Three members of the commission constitute a quorum for the transaction of business.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-205(2)(b): 59-1-502.5 A quorum of the commission must participate in any order that constitutes a final agency action on:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-205(2)(b)(i): a formal adjudicative proceeding over which the commission has jurisdiction;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-205(2)(b)(ii): an informal adjudicative proceeding over which the commission has jurisdiction; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-205(2)(b)(iii): 59-1-502.5 an initial hearing conducted pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-205(2)(c): (2)(b) If a commission vote results in a tie vote on any matter described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-205(3): The commission shall be in session and open for the transaction of business during ordinary business hours each day.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-205(4): The commission may hold sessions or conduct investigations at any place in the state to facilitate the performance of its duties.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206 Appointment of staff -- Executive director -- Compensation -- Administrative secretary -- Internal audit unit -- Appeals office staff -- Division directors -- Criminal tax investigators.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(1): Title 63A, Chapter 17, Utah State Personnel Management Act The commission shall appoint the following persons who are qualified, knowledgeable, and experienced in matters relating to their respective positions, exempt under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(1)(a): in consultation with the governor and with the advice and consent of the Senate, an executive director;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(1)(b): an administrative secretary;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(1)(c): an internal audit unit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(1)(d): an appeals staff.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(2): Title 67, Chapter 22, State Officer Compensation The governor shall establish the executive director's salary within the salary range fixed by the Legislature in
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(3): Title 63A, Chapter 17, Utah State Personnel Management Act Division directors shall be appointed by the executive director subject to the approval of the commission.  The division directors are exempt employees under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(4): Title 63A, Chapter 17, Utah State Personnel Management Act; (4)(a); (4)(b); 53-13-105; 49-15-201; (4)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(4)(a): Title 63A, Chapter 17, Utah State Personnel Management Act The executive director may with the approval of the commission employ additional staff necessary to perform the duties and responsibilities of the commission.  These employees are subject to
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(4)(b): (4)(a); (4)(b); 53-13-105; 49-15-201; (4)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(4)(b)(i): (4)(a) The executive director may under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(4)(b)(ii): (4)(b); 53-13-105 The executive director may designate investigators hired under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(4)(b)(iii): 49-15-201; (4)(b) Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(5): The internal audit unit shall provide the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(5)(a): an examination to determine the honesty and integrity of fiscal affairs, the accuracy and reliability of financial statements and reports, and the adequacy and effectiveness of financial controls to properly record and safeguard the acquisition, custody, and use of public funds;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(5)(b): an examination to determine whether commission administrators have faithfully adhered to commission policies and legislative intent;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(5)(c): an examination to determine whether the operations of the divisions and other units of the commission have been conducted in an efficient and effective manner;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(5)(d): an examination to determine whether the programs administered by the divisions and other units of the commission have been effective in accomplishing intended objectives; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(5)(e): an examination to determine whether management control and information systems are adequate and effective in assuring that commission programs are administered faithfully, efficiently, and effectively.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206(6): The appeals office shall receive and hear appeals to the commission and shall conduct the hearings in compliance with formal written rules approved by the commission.  The commission has final review authority over the appeals.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1 Definitions -- Background checks for employees.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(1): 53-10-201 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(1)(a): 53-10-201 "Bureau" means the Bureau of Criminal Identification created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(1)(b): "Return information" means the same as that term is defined in 26 U.S.C. Sec. 6103.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(2): The commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(2)(a): require the following individuals to submit to a nationwide criminal background check and ongoing monitoring of that nationwide criminal background check as a condition of employment:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(2)(a)(i): an employee or contractor of the commission that has access to return information in the custody of the commission, regardless of whether access by the employee or contractor is authorized; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(2)(a)(ii): an employee or contractor of the commission that has access to information in the custody of the commission in the Utah Criminal Justice Information System, regardless of whether access by the employee or contractor is authorized; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(2)(b): require the following individuals to submit to a nationwide criminal background check and ongoing monitoring of the nationwide criminal background check:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(2)(b)(i): an employee or contractor of another state agency, or an employee of the office of the attorney general, that has access to return information in the custody of the commission, regardless of whether access by the employee or contractor is authorized; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(2)(b)(ii): an employee or contractor of another state agency, or an employee of the office of the attorney general, that has access to information in the custody of the commission in the Utah Criminal Justice Information System, regardless of whether access by the employee or contractor is authorized.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(3): (2); 53-10-108(13) The commission shall collect the following from an individual required to submit to a background check under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(3)(a): the personal identifying information required on the fingerprint card; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(3)(b): 53-10-108(13) consent, on a form specified by the commission, for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(3)(b)(i): an initial fingerprint-based state, regional, and national background check by the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the bureau upon submission of the application; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(3)(b)(ii): 53-10-108(13) retention of personal identifying information for ongoing monitoring through registration with the systems described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(4): (2); 53-10-108(13) For an individual required to submit to a background check under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(4)(a): an initial fingerprint-based background check by the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the bureau; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(4)(b): 53-10-108(13) ongoing monitoring through registration with the systems described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(5): 53-10-108(15); (2) The commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(5)(a): 53-10-108(15) submit any fees required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(5)(b): (2) identify the appropriate privacy risk mitigation strategy that will be used to ensure that the commission only receives notifications for individuals described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(6): (4) The bureau shall provide all the results from the state, regional, and nationwide criminal history background checks and monitoring performed under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(7)(a): (3); (2)(a) collect the information and consent described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(7)(a)(i): were employed by or under contract with the commission prior to May 8, 2018; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(7)(a)(ii): are employed by or under contract with the commission; and

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-206.1(9)(b): information in the custody of the commission in the Utah Criminal Justice Information System.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-207 Administration plan -- Executive director's functions.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission shall prepare and implement a plan for the administration of the divisions and other offices of the commission which do not report directly to the commission.  The plan shall, by rule, establish the duties and responsibilities to be delegated to the executive director.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-208 Offices.
---------------------------------------
The main office of the commission shall be located in Salt Lake City.  The commission may establish branch offices necessary for the convenience of the public and the efficient performance of its duties.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-209 Official seal -- Authenticated copies of records as evidence.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission shall adopt an official seal, and shall file an impression and description of the seal with the Division of Archives.  Copies of any records in the possession of the commission may be authenticated with the seal of the commission attested by the signature of the commission's administrative secretary, and when so authenticated shall be received in evidence to the same extent and with the same effect as the originals.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210 General powers and duties.
---------------------------------------------------------
The powers and duties of the commission are as follows:Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(1): to sue and be sued in its own name;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(2): to adopt rules and policies consistent with the Constitution and laws of this state to govern the commission, executive director, division directors, and commission employees in the performance of their duties;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(3): to adopt rules and policies consistent with the Constitution and laws of the state, to govern county boards and officers in the performance of any duty relating to assessment, equalization, and collection of taxes;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(4): to prescribe the use of forms relating to the assessment of property for state or local taxation, the equalization of those assessments, the reporting of property or income for state or local taxation purposes, or for the computation of those taxes and the reporting of any information, statistics, or data required by the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(5): to administer and supervise the tax laws of the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(6): to prepare and maintain from year to year a complete record of all lands subject to taxation in this state, and all machinery used in mining and all property or surface improvements upon or appurtenant to mines or mining claims;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(7): 59-2-303.1 to exercise general supervision over assessors and county boards of equalization including the authority to enforce Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(8): to reconvene any county board of equalization which, when reconvened, may only address business approved by the commission and extend the time for which any county board of equalization may sit for the equalization of assessments;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(9): to confer with, advise, and direct county treasurers, assessors, and other county officers in matters relating to the assessment and equalization of property for taxation and the collection of taxes;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(10): to provide for and hold annually at such time and place as may be convenient a district or state convention of county assessors, auditors, and other county officers to consider and discuss matters relative to taxation, uniformity of valuation, and changes in the law relative to taxation and methods of assessment, to which county assessors and other officers called to attend shall attend at county expense;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(11): to direct proceedings, actions, and prosecutions to enforce the laws relating to the penalties, liabilities, and punishments of public officers, persons, and officers or agents of corporations for failure or neglect to comply with the statutes governing the reporting, assessment, and taxation of property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(12): to cause complaints to be made in the proper court seeking removal from office of assessors, auditors, members of county boards, and other assessing, taxing, or disbursing officers, who are guilty of official misconduct or neglect of duty;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(13): to require county attorneys to immediately institute and prosecute actions and proceedings in respect to penalties, forfeitures, removals, and punishments for violations of the laws relating to the assessment and taxation of property in their respective counties;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(14): to require any person to furnish any information required by the commission to ascertain the value and the relative burden borne by all kinds of property in the state, and to require from all state and local officers any information necessary for the proper discharge of the duties of the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(15): to examine all records relating to the valuation of property of any person;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(16): to subpoena witnesses to appear and give testimony and produce records relating to any matter before the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(17): to cause depositions of witnesses to be taken as in civil actions at the request of the commission or any party to any matter or proceeding before the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(18): to authorize any member or employee of the commission to administer oaths and affirmations in any matter or proceeding relating to the exercise of the powers and duties of the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(19): to visit periodically each county of the state, to investigate and direct the work and methods of local assessors and other officials in the assessment, equalization, and taxation of property, and to ascertain whether the law requiring the assessment of all property not exempt from taxation, and the collection of taxes, have been properly administered and enforced;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(20): to carefully examine all cases where evasion or violation of the laws for assessment and taxation of property is alleged, to ascertain whether existing laws are defective or improperly administered;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(21): to furnish to the governor from time to time such assistance and information as the governor requires;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(22): to transmit to the governor and to each member of the Legislature recommendations as to legislation which will correct or eliminate defects in the operation of the tax laws and will equalize the burden of taxation within the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(23): to correct any error in any assessment made by it at any time before the tax is due and report the correction to the county auditor, who shall enter the corrected assessment upon the assessment roll;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(24): to compile and publish statistics relating to taxation in the state and prepare and submit an annual budget to the governor for inclusion in the state budget to be submitted to the Legislature;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(25): to perform any further duties imposed by law, and exercise all powers necessary in the performance of its duties;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(26): to adopt a schedule of fees assessed for services provided by the commission, unless otherwise provided by statute.  The fee shall be reasonable and fair, and shall reflect the cost of services provided.  Each fee established in this manner shall be submitted to and approved by the Legislature as part of the commission's annual appropriations request.  The commission may not charge or collect any fee proposed in this manner without approval by the Legislature;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(27): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act to comply with the procedures and requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-210(28): 26B-1-308 to distribute the money deposited into the Rural Health Care Facilities Account as required by Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-211 Uniform system of accounts.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-211(1): The commission shall establish a uniform system of accounts and when established it shall be followed by all taxing entities within the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-211(2): The commission may make rules directly relating to the administration of a uniform system of accounts and shall periodically publish these rules and distribute them to all taxing entities.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-211(3): The commission shall certify a list of all taxing entities that do not comply with the laws and rules pertaining to uniform accounts to the county attorney of the county in which the entity is located.  The county attorney shall immediately notify the official or officials charged by law with complying with them.  If the official or officials fail to so comply within 60 days after receipt of the notice, the county attorney shall commence proceedings in district court in mandamus to require performance.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-213 Annual report on Internal Revenue Code changes.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission shall annually provide an electronic report to the Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee on or before the October interim meeting concerning the impacts of the reliance of this title on the Internal Revenue Code, including:Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-213(1): any modification to the Internal Revenue Code that is likely to have a fiscal impact on state revenues:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-213(1)(a): that became effective:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-213(1)(a)(i): if the commission is preparing its initial report in accordance with this section, during the previous calendar year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-213(1)(a)(ii): if the commission has prepared a previous report in accordance with this section, after the most recent report prepared in accordance with this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-213(1)(b): that have been enacted and will become effective prior to the end of the calendar year that begins January 1 following the current report prepared in accordance with this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-213(2): (1) the fiscal impacts a modification described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-213(3): (1); (1) statutory or administrative options to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-213(3)(a): (1) implement the effects on this title of a modification described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-213(3)(b): (1) change this title to prevent this title from implementing a modification described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-213.1 Public meeting on revision of commission publication.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-213.1(1): As used in this section, "nonsubstantive change" means a change that does not alter the meaning of a publication.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-213.1(2): (3); Title 52, Chapter 4, Open and Public Meetings Act Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-213.1(3): The commission is not required to hold a public meeting on a nonsubstantive change to an official numbered commission publication.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-301 Payment under protest -- Action to recover.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
In all cases of levy of taxes, licenses, or other demands for public revenue which is deemed unlawful by the party whose property is taxed, or from whom the tax or license is demanded or enforced, that party may pay under protest the tax or license, or any part deemed unlawful, to the officers designated and authorized by law to collect the tax or license; and then the party so paying or a legal representative may bring an action in the tax division of the appropriate district court against the officer to whom the tax or license was paid, or against the state, county, municipality, or other taxing entity on whose behalf it was collected, to recover the tax or license or any portion of the tax or license paid under protest.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-302 Penalty for nonpayment of certain taxes -- Jeopardy proceedings.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-302(1): Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 3, Municipal Energy Sales and Use Tax Act; Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 4, Municipal Telecommunications License Tax Act; Chapter 10, Part 4, Withholding of Tax; Chapter 12, Sales and Use Tax Act; Chapter 13, Part 2, Motor Fuel; Chapter 13, Part 3, Special Fuel; Chapter 13, Part 4, Aviation Fuel This section applies to the following:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-302(7): (1); (1); (2); 59-1-1411
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-302(7)(a): (1) In a hearing before the commission and in a judicial review of the hearing, the commission and the court shall consider any inference and evidence that a person has willfully failed to collect, truthfully account for, or pay over a tax listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-302(7)(b): (1) It is prima facie evidence that a person has willfully failed to collect, truthfully account for, or pay over a tax listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-302(7)(b)(i): made a voluntary, conscious, and intentional decision to prefer other creditors over the state government or utilize the tax money for personal purposes;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-302(7)(b)(ii): recklessly disregarded obvious or known risks that resulted in the failure to collect, truthfully account for, or pay over the tax; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-302(7)(b)(iii): failed to investigate or to correct mismanagement, having notice that the tax was not or is not being collected, accounted for, or paid over as provided by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-302(7)(c): The commission or court is not required to find a bad motive or specific intent to defraud the government or deprive the government of revenue to establish willfulness under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-302(7)(d): (2); 59-1-1411 If the commission determines that a person is liable for the penalty under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-303 Authorization for commission to apply overpayment of any tax or fee against taxpayer's liability for any tax or fee.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-303(1): (1)(a)(i) For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-303(1)(a): (1)(a)(i) "Overpayment" means an amount equal to the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-303(1)(a)(i): the amount by which a tax or fee a taxpayer paid exceeds the taxpayer's liability for the tax or fee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-303(1)(a)(ii): (1)(a)(i) interest accruing to the amount described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-303(1)(b): "Tax or fee" means any tax or fee administered by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-303(2): The commission may apply an overpayment of any tax or fee against a taxpayer's liability for any tax or fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-303(3): If the commission applies an overpayment of a tax or fee against a taxpayer's liability for a tax or fee, the commission shall notify the taxpayer in writing.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304 Definition -- Limitations on maintaining a class action that relates to a tax or fee -- Requirements for a person to be included as a member of a class in a class action -- Rulemaking authority -- Limitations on recovery by members of a class -- Severability.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(1): As used in this section, "tax or fee" means a tax or fee administered by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(2): A class action that relates to a tax or fee may not be maintained in any court if a claim sought by a representative party seeking to maintain the class action arises as a result of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(2)(a): a person collecting a tax or fee from the representative party if the representative party is not required by law to pay the tax or fee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(2)(b): any of the following that requires a change in the manner in which a tax or fee is required to be collected or paid:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(2)(b)(i): an administrative rule made by the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(2)(b)(ii): a private letter ruling issued by the commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(2)(b)(iii): a decision issued by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(2)(b)(iii)(A): the commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(2)(b)(iii)(B): a court of competent jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(3): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (3)(a); (3)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(3)(a): A person may be included as a member of a class in a class action relating to a tax or fee only if the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(3)(a)(i): exhausts all administrative remedies with the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(3)(a)(ii): requests in writing to be included as a member of the class.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(3)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (3)(a); (3)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(3)(b)(i): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (3)(a) In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(3)(b)(ii): (3)(b)(i) The rules required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(3)(b)(ii)(A): expedited filing procedures and forms;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(3)(b)(ii)(B): consolidation of hearings procedures as may be reasonably needed to accommodate potential inclusion of similarly situated persons; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(3)(b)(ii)(C): the designation of test or sample cases to avoid multiple hearings.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(4): (5); 59-1-402; (5) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(4)(a): 59-1-402 the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(4)(a)(i): the amount of the refund or credit awarded to members of the class; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(4)(a)(ii): 59-1-402 interest as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(4)(b): (5) if awarded in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(4)(b)(i): reasonable costs; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(4)(b)(ii): reasonable attorney fees.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(5): (4); (5)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(5)(a): (4); (5)(b) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(5)(a)(i): reasonable costs as determined by the court; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(5)(a)(ii): (5)(b) reasonable attorney fees determined under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(5)(b): Reasonable attorney fees awarded in a class action may not exceed a reasonable hourly rate for work actually performed:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(5)(b)(i): as determined by the court; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(5)(b)(ii): taking into account all facts and circumstances that the court considers reasonable.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-304(6): If any provision of this section, or the application of any provision of this section to any person or circumstance is held unconstitutional or invalid by a court of competent jurisdiction, the remainder of the section shall be given effect without the invalid provision or application.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306 Definition -- State Tax Commission Administrative Charge Account -- Amount of administrative charge -- Deposit of revenues into the restricted account -- Interest deposited into General Fund -- Expenditure of money deposited into the restricted account.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(1): Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 3, Municipal Energy Sales and Use Tax Act; Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 4, Municipal Telecommunications License Tax Act; 19-6-714; 19-6-805; Chapter 12, Sales and Use Tax Act; Chapter 12, Part 1, Tax Collection; Chapter 12, Part 18, Additional State Sales and Use Tax Act; 59-27-105; 63H-1-205; Title 69, Chapter 2, Part 4, Prepaid Wireless Telecommunications Service Charges As used in this section, "qualifying tax, fee, or charge" means a tax, fee, or charge the commission administers under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(1)(a): Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 3, Municipal Energy Sales and Use Tax Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(1)(b): Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 4, Municipal Telecommunications License Tax Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(1)(c): 19-6-714 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(1)(d): 19-6-805 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(1)(e): Chapter 12, Sales and Use Tax Act; Chapter 12, Part 1, Tax Collection; Chapter 12, Part 18, Additional State Sales and Use Tax Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(1)(f): 59-27-105 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(1)(g): 63H-1-205 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(1)(h): Title 69, Chapter 2, Part 4, Prepaid Wireless Telecommunications Service Charges
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(2): There is created a restricted account within the General Fund known as the "State Tax Commission Administrative Charge Account."
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(3): Subject to the other provisions of this section, the restricted account shall consist of administrative charges the commission retains and deposits in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(4): For purposes of this section, the administrative charge is a percentage of revenues the commission collects from each qualifying tax, fee, or charge of not to exceed the lesser of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(4)(a): 1.5%; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(4)(b): an equal percentage of revenues the commission collects from each qualifying tax, fee, or charge sufficient to cover the cost to the commission of administering the qualifying taxes, fees, or charges.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(5): The commission shall deposit an administrative charge into the restricted account.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(6): Interest earned on the restricted account shall be deposited into the General Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(7): The commission shall expend money appropriated by the Legislature to the commission from the restricted account to administer qualifying taxes, fees, or charges.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(1): 19-6-714; 19-6-805; 59-27-105; 63H-1-205 As used in this section, "qualifying tax, fee, or charge" means a tax, fee, or charge the commission administers under:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(4)(a): 1.5%; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(4)(b): an equal percentage of revenue the commission collects from each qualifying tax, fee, or charge sufficient to cover the cost to the commission of administering the qualifying taxes, fees, or charges.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-306(7): The commission shall expend money appropriated by the Legislature to the commission from the restricted account to administer qualifying taxes, fees, or charges.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(1)(b)(v): Chapter 4, Privilege Tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(2)(a): The due date for filing a return is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(2)(a)(i): if the person filing the return is not allowed by law an extension of time for filing the return, the day on which the return is due as provided by law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(2)(a)(ii): if the person filing the return is allowed by law an extension of time for filing the return, the earlier of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(2)(a)(ii)(A): the date the person files the return; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(2)(a)(ii)(B): the last day of that extension of time as allowed by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(2)(b): A penalty in the amount described in Subsection (2)(c) is imposed if a person files a return after the due date described in Subsection (2)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(2)(c): For purposes of Subsection (2)(b), the penalty is an amount equal to the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(2)(c)(i): $20; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(2)(c)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(2)(c)(ii)(A): 2% of the unpaid tax, fee, or charge due on the return if the return is filed no later than five days after the due date described in Subsection (2)(a);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(2)(c)(ii)(B): 5% of the unpaid tax, fee, or charge due on the return if the return is filed more than five days after the due date but no later than 15 days after the due date described in Subsection (2)(a); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(2)(c)(ii)(C): 10% of the unpaid tax, fee, or charge due on the return if the return is filed more than 15 days after the due date described in Subsection (2)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(2)(d): This Subsection (2) does not apply to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(2)(d)(i): an amended return; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(2)(d)(ii): a return with no tax due.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3): 59-1-1406; 63G-4-302
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(a): 59-1-1406; 63G-4-302 Except as provided in Subsection (15), a person is subject to a penalty for failure to pay a tax, fee, or charge if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(a)(i): the person files a return on or before the due date for filing a return described in Subsection (2)(a), but fails to pay the tax, fee, or charge due on the return on or before that due date;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(a)(ii): the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(a)(ii)(A): is subject to a penalty under Subsection (2)(b); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(a)(ii)(B): fails to pay the tax, fee, or charge due on a return within a 90-day period after the due date for filing a return described in Subsection (2)(a);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(a)(iii): 59-1-1406
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(a)(iii)(A): the person is subject to a penalty under Subsection (2)(b); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(a)(iii)(B): 59-1-1406 the commission estimates an amount of tax due for that person in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(a)(iv): the person:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(a)(iv)(B): within a 30-day period after the day on which the notice of deficiency described in Subsection (3)(a)(iv)(A) is mailed:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(a)(iv)(B)(I): does not file a petition for redetermination or a request for agency action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(a)(iv)(B)(II): fails to pay the tax, fee, or charge due on a return;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(a)(v)(A)(II): 63G-4-302 is considered to have denied a request for reconsideration under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(a)(v)(B): the person fails to pay the tax, fee, or charge due on a return within a 30-day period after the date the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(a)(v)(B)(I): issues the order constituting final agency action described in Subsection (3)(a)(v)(A)(I); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(a)(v)(B)(II): is considered to have denied the request for reconsideration described in Subsection (3)(a)(v)(A)(II); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(a)(vi): the person fails to pay the tax, fee, or charge within a 30-day period after the date of a final judicial decision resulting from a timely filed petition for judicial review.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(b): For purposes of Subsection (3)(a), the penalty is an amount equal to the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(b)(i): $20; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(b)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(b)(ii)(A): 2% of the unpaid tax, fee, or charge due on the return if the activated tax, fee, or charge due on the return is paid no later than five days after the due date for filing a return described in Subsection (2)(a);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(b)(ii)(B): 5% of the unpaid tax, fee, or charge due on the return if the activated tax, fee, or charge due on the return is paid more than five days after the due date for filing a return described in Subsection (2)(a) but no later than 15 days after that due date; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(3)(b)(ii)(C): 10% of the unpaid tax, fee, or charge due on the return if the activated tax, fee, or charge due on the return is paid more than 15 days after the due date for filing a return described in Subsection (2)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(4): 59-5-107; 59-5-207; 59-7-504; 59-9-104; 59-1-402
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(4)(a): 59-5-107; 59-5-207; 59-7-504; 59-9-104; 59-1-402 In the case of any underpayment of estimated tax or quarterly installments required by Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(4)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(4)(b)(i): For purposes of Subsection (4)(a), the amount of the underpayment shall be the excess of the required installment over the amount, if any, of the installment paid on or before the due date for the installment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(4)(b)(ii): The period of the underpayment shall run from the due date for the installment to whichever of the following dates is the earlier:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(4)(b)(ii)(A): the original due date of the tax return, without extensions, for the taxable year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(4)(b)(ii)(B): with respect to any portion of the underpayment, the date on which that portion is paid.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(4)(b)(iii): For purposes of this Subsection (4), a payment of estimated tax shall be credited against unpaid required installments in the order in which the installments are required to be paid.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(5): 59-7-507; 59-10-516
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(5)(a): 59-7-507; 59-10-516 Notwithstanding Subsection (2) and except as provided in Subsection (6), a person allowed by law an extension of time for filing a corporate franchise or income tax return under Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes, or an individual income tax return under Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act, is subject to a penalty in the amount described in Subsection (5)(b) if, on or before the day on which the return is due as provided by law, not including the extension of time, the person fails to pay:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(5)(a)(i): 59-7-507 for a person filing a corporate franchise or income tax return under Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes, the payment required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(5)(a)(ii): 59-10-516 for a person filing an individual income tax return under Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act, the payment required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(5)(b): For purposes of Subsection (5)(a), the penalty per month during the period of the extension of time for filing the return is an amount equal to 2% of the tax due on the return, unpaid as of the day on which the return is due as provided by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(6): 59-7-505; 59-10-516 If a person does not file a return within an extension of time allowed by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(6)(a): is not subject to a penalty in the amount described in Subsection (5)(b); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(6)(b): is subject to a penalty in an amount equal to the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(6)(b)(i): a late file penalty in an amount equal to the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(6)(b)(i)(A): $20; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(6)(b)(i)(B): 10% of the tax due on the return, unpaid as of the day on which the return is due as provided by law, not including the extension of time; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(6)(b)(ii): a late pay penalty in an amount equal to the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(6)(b)(ii)(A): $20; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(6)(b)(ii)(B): 10% of the unpaid tax due on the return, unpaid as of the day on which the return is due as provided by law, not including the extension of time.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(7): 59-1-1404; 59-12-107; 59-12-107; 59-12-107; 59-12-103; 59-12-107; 59-12-107; 59-12-103; 59-12-107; 59-12-107; 59-12-107; 59-12-103; 59-12-107; 59-12-107; 59-12-103
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(7)(a): Additional penalties for an underpayment of a tax, fee, or charge are as provided in this Subsection (7)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(7)(a)(i): Except as provided in Subsection (7)(c), if any portion of an underpayment of a tax, fee, or charge is due to negligence, the penalty is 10% of the portion of the underpayment that is due to negligence.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(7)(a)(ii): Except as provided in Subsection (7)(d), if any portion of an underpayment of a tax, fee, or charge is due to intentional disregard of law or rule, the penalty is 15% of the entire underpayment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(7)(a)(iii): If any portion of an underpayment is due to an intent to evade a tax, fee, or charge, the penalty is the greater of $500 per period or 50% of the entire underpayment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(7)(a)(iv): If any portion of an underpayment is due to fraud with intent to evade a tax, fee, or charge, the penalty is the greater of $500 per period or 100% of the entire underpayment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(7)(b): 59-1-1404 If the commission determines that a person is liable for a penalty imposed under Subsection (7)(a)(ii), (iii), or (iv), the commission shall notify the person of the proposed penalty.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(7)(b)(i): The notice of proposed penalty shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(7)(b)(i)(A): set forth the basis of the assessment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(7)(b)(i)(B): be mailed by certified mail, postage prepaid, to the person's last-known address.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(7)(b)(ii): Upon receipt of the notice of proposed penalty, the person against whom the penalty is proposed may:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(7)(b)(ii)(A): pay the amount of the proposed penalty at the place and time stated in the notice; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(7)(b)(ii)(B): proceed in accordance with the review procedures of Subsection (7)(b)(iii).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(7)(b)(iii): A person against whom a penalty is proposed in accordance with this Subsection (7) may contest the proposed penalty by filing a petition for an adjudicative proceeding with the commission.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(a): A person is subject to the penalty provided in Subsection (11)(c) if that person:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(a)(i): commits an act described in Subsection (11)(b) with respect to one or more of the following documents:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(a)(i)(A): a return;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(a)(i)(B): an affidavit;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(a)(i)(C): a claim; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(a)(i)(D): a document similar to Subsections (11)(a)(i)(A) through (C);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(a)(ii): knows or has reason to believe that the document described in Subsection (11)(a)(i) will be used in connection with any material matter administered by the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(a)(iii): knows that the document described in Subsection (11)(a)(i), if used in connection with any material matter administered by the commission, would result in an understatement of another person's liability for a tax, fee, or charge.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(b): The following acts apply to Subsection (11)(a)(i):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(b)(i): preparing any portion of a document described in Subsection (11)(a)(i);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(b)(ii): presenting any portion of a document described in Subsection (11)(a)(i);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(b)(iii): procuring any portion of a document described in Subsection (11)(a)(i);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(b)(iv): advising in the preparation or presentation of any portion of a document described in Subsection (11)(a)(i);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(b)(v): aiding in the preparation or presentation of any portion of a document described in Subsection (11)(a)(i);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(b)(vi): assisting in the preparation or presentation of any portion of a document described in Subsection (11)(a)(i); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(b)(vii): counseling in the preparation or presentation of any portion of a document described in Subsection (11)(a)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(c): For purposes of Subsection (11)(a), the penalty:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(c)(i): shall be imposed by the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(c)(ii): is $500 for each document described in Subsection (11)(a)(i) with respect to which the person described in Subsection (11)(a) meets the requirements of Subsection (11)(a); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(c)(iii): is in addition to any other penalty provided by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(d): The commission may seek a court order to enjoin a person from engaging in conduct that is subject to a penalty under this Subsection (11).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(11)(e): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission may make rules prescribing the documents that are similar to Subsections (11)(a)(i)(A) through (C).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(12): 76-3-301; 76-3-301; 76-3-301; 76-3-301

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(12)(b)(i): A person who is required by this title or any laws the commission administers or regulates to register with or obtain a license or permit from the commission, who operates without having registered or secured a license or permit, or who operates when the registration, license, or permit is expired or not current, is guilty of a class B misdemeanor.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(12)(b)(ii)(A): be less than $500; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(12)(b)(ii)(B): exceed $1,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(12)(c): 76-3-301
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(12)(c)(i): With respect to a tax, fee, or charge, a person who knowingly and intentionally, and without a reasonable good faith basis, fails to make, render, sign, or verify a return within the time required by law or to supply information within the time required by law, or who makes, renders, signs, or verifies a false or fraudulent return or statement, or who supplies false or fraudulent information, is guilty of a third degree felony.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-401(12)(c)(ii)(A): be less than $1,000; or

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402 Definitions -- Interest.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1): (1)(c)(ii); Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 3, Municipal Energy Sales and Use Tax Act; Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 4, Municipal Telecommunications License Tax Act; 19-6-410.5; 19-6-714; 19-6-805; 34A-2-202; 40-6-14; Title 69, Chapter 2, Part 4, Prepaid Wireless Telecommunications Service Charges; Title 41, Chapter 1a, Motor Vehicle Act; 41-1a-301; Title 41, Chapter 3, Motor Vehicle Business Regulation Act; Chapter 2, Property Tax Act; 59-2-1309; Chapter 3, Tax Equivalent Property Act; Chapter 4, Privilege Tax; Chapter 13, Part 5, Interstate Agreements As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(a): "Final judicial decision" means a final ruling by a court of this state or the United States for which the time for any further review or proceeding has expired.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(b): "Retroactive application of a judicial decision" means the application of a final judicial decision that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(b)(i): invalidates a state or federal taxation statute; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(b)(ii): requires the state to provide a refund for an overpayment that was made:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(b)(ii)(A): prior to the final judicial decision; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(b)(ii)(B): during the 180-day period after the final judicial decision.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c): (1)(c)(ii); Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 3, Municipal Energy Sales and Use Tax Act; Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 4, Municipal Telecommunications License Tax Act; 19-6-410.5; 19-6-714; 19-6-805; 34A-2-202; 40-6-14; Title 69, Chapter 2, Part 4, Prepaid Wireless Telecommunications Service Charges; Title 41, Chapter 1a, Motor Vehicle Act; 41-1a-301; Title 41, Chapter 3, Motor Vehicle Business Regulation Act; Chapter 2, Property Tax Act; 59-2-1309; Chapter 3, Tax Equivalent Property Act; Chapter 4, Privilege Tax; Chapter 13, Part 5, Interstate Agreements
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(i): (1)(c)(ii); Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 3, Municipal Energy Sales and Use Tax Act; Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 4, Municipal Telecommunications License Tax Act; 19-6-410.5; 19-6-714; 19-6-805; 34A-2-202; 40-6-14; Title 69, Chapter 2, Part 4, Prepaid Wireless Telecommunications Service Charges Except as provided in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(2): Except as otherwise provided for by law, the interest rate for a calendar year for a tax, fee, or charge administered by the commission shall be calculated based on the federal short-term rate determined by the Secretary of the Treasury under Section 6621, Internal Revenue Code, in effect for the preceding fourth calendar quarter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(3): (7) The interest rate calculation shall be as follows:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(b)(ii)(A): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act with respect to a tax, fee, or charge, except for a tax under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(b)(ii)(B): if the return is not filed electronically.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c): (5)(c); Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act; (5)(c)(ii); Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act; (5)(c)(ii); (5)(c)(i)(B)(I)(Bb); (5)(c)(i)(B)(II)(Bb)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(i): (5)(c); Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act; (5)(c)(ii); Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act; (5)(c)(ii) In the case of an amended return, interest on an overpayment shall be allowed:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(i)(A): for a time period:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(i)(A)(I): that begins on the later of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(i)(A)(I)(Aa): the date the original return was filed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(i)(A)(I)(Bb): the due date for filing the original return not including any extensions for filing the original return; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(i)(A)(II): that ends on the date the commission receives the amended return; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(i)(B): (5)(c); Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act; (5)(c)(ii); Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act; (5)(c)(ii) if the commission does not make a refund of an overpayment under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(i)(B)(I): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act; (5)(c)(ii) if the amended return is with respect to a tax under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(i)(B)(I)(Aa): that begins 46 days after the commission receives the amended return; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(i)(B)(I)(Bb): (5)(c)(ii) subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(i)(B)(II): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act; (5)(c)(ii) if the amended return is with respect to a tax, fee, or charge except for a tax under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(i)(B)(II)(Aa): that begins 91 days after the commission receives the amended return; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(i)(B)(II)(Bb): (5)(c)(ii) subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(ii): (5)(c)(i)(B)(I)(Bb); (5)(c)(i)(B)(II)(Bb) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(6): Interest on any underpayment, deficiency, or delinquency of a tax, fee, or charge shall be computed from the time the original return is due, excluding any filing or payment extensions, to the date the payment is received.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(7): Interest on a refund relating to a tax, fee, or charge may not be paid on any overpayment that arises from a statute that is determined to be invalid under state or federal law or declared unconstitutional under the constitution of the United States or Utah if the basis for the refund is the retroactive application of a judicial decision upholding the claim of unconstitutionality or the invalidation of a statute.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402 Definitions -- Interest.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1): 19-6-410.5; 19-6-714; 19-6-805; 34A-2-202; 40-6-14; 41-1a-301; 59-2-1309 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(a): "Final judicial decision" means a final ruling by a court of this state or the United States for which the time for any further review or proceeding has expired.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(b): "Retroactive application of a judicial decision" means the application of a final judicial decision that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(b)(i): invalidates a state or federal taxation statute; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(b)(ii): requires the state to provide a refund for an overpayment that was made:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(b)(ii)(A): prior to the final judicial decision; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(b)(ii)(B): during the 180-day period after the final judicial decision.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c): 19-6-410.5; 19-6-714; 19-6-805; 34A-2-202; 40-6-14; 41-1a-301; 59-2-1309
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(i): 19-6-410.5; 19-6-714; 19-6-805; 34A-2-202; 40-6-14 Except as provided in Subsection (1)(c)(ii), "tax, fee, or charge" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(i)(A): 19-6-410.5; 19-6-714; 19-6-805; 34A-2-202; 40-6-14 a tax, fee, or charge the commission administers under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(i)(A)(I): this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(i)(A)(II): Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 3, Municipal Energy Sales and Use Tax Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(i)(A)(III): Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 4, Municipal Telecommunications License Tax Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(i)(A)(IV): 19-6-410.5 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(i)(A)(V): 19-6-714 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(i)(A)(VI): 19-6-805 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(i)(A)(VII): 34A-2-202 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(i)(A)(VIII): 40-6-14 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(i)(A)(IX): Title 69, Chapter 2, Part 4, Prepaid Wireless Telecommunications Service Charges; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(i)(B): another amount that by statute is subject to interest imposed under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(ii): 41-1a-301; 59-2-1309 "Tax, fee, or charge" does not include a tax, fee, or charge imposed under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(ii)(A): 41-1a-301 Title 41, Chapter 1a, Motor Vehicle Act, except for Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(ii)(B): Title 41, Chapter 3, Motor Vehicle Business Regulation Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(ii)(C): 59-2-1309 Chapter 2, Property Tax Act, except for Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(ii)(D): Chapter 3, Tax Equivalent Property Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(ii)(E): Chapter 4, Privilege Tax; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(1)(c)(ii)(F): Chapter 13, Part 5, Interstate Agreements.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(2): Except as otherwise provided for by law, the interest rate for a calendar year for a tax, fee, or charge administered by the commission shall be calculated based on the federal short-term rate determined by the Secretary of the Treasury under Section 6621, Internal Revenue Code, in effect for the preceding fourth calendar quarter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(3): The interest rate calculation shall be as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(3)(a): except as provided in Subsection (7), in the case of an overpayment or refund, simple interest shall be calculated at the rate of two percentage points above the federal short-term rate; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(3)(b): in the case of an underpayment, deficiency, or delinquency, simple interest shall be calculated at the rate of two percentage points above the federal short-term rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(4): 59-7-112 Notwithstanding Subsection (2) or (3), the interest rate applicable to certain installment sales for purposes of a tax under Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes, shall be determined in accordance with Section 453A, Internal Revenue Code, as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (5)(c), interest may not be allowed on an overpayment of a tax, fee, or charge if the overpayment of the tax, fee, or charge is refunded within:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(a)(i): 45 days after the last date prescribed for filing the return with respect to a tax under Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes, or Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act, if the return is filed electronically; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(a)(ii): 90 days after the last date prescribed for filing the return:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(a)(ii)(A): with respect to a tax, fee, or charge, except for a tax under Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes, or Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(a)(ii)(B): if the return is not filed electronically.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(b): Except as provided in Subsection (5)(c), if the return is filed after the last date prescribed for filing the return, interest may not be allowed on the overpayment if the overpayment is refunded within:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(b)(i): 45 days after the date the return is filed:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(b)(i)(A): with respect to a tax under Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes, or Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(b)(i)(B): if the return is filed electronically; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(b)(ii): 90 days after the date the return is filed:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(b)(ii)(A): with respect to a tax, fee, or charge, except for a tax under Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes, or Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(b)(ii)(B): if the return is not filed electronically.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(i): Subject to Subsection (5)(d), for an amended return, interest on an overpayment is allowed for a time period:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(i)(A): that begins on the later of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(i)(A)(I): the date the original return was filed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(i)(A)(II): the due date for filing the original return not including any extensions for filing the original return; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(i)(B): that ends on the date the commission receives the amended return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(ii): For an amended return filed electronically with respect to a tax under Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes, or Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act, interest on an overpayment is allowed if the commission does not process a refund of the overpayment within a 45-day period after the date the commission receives the amended return, for a time period:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(ii)(A): that begins 46 days after the commission receives the amended return; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(ii)(B): that ends on the date that the commission completes processing the refund of the overpayment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(iii): For an amended return not filed electronically or with respect to any tax, fee, or charge not described in Subsection (5)(c)(ii), interest on an overpayment is allowed if the commission does not process a refund of the overpayment within a 90-day period after the date the commission receives the amended return, for a time period:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(iii)(A): that begins 91 days after the commission receives the amended return; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(c)(iii)(B): that ends on the date that the commission completes processing the refund of the overpayment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(d)(i): This Subsection (5)(d) applies to interest on an overpayment under Subsection (5)(c)(i) in which:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(d)(i)(A): the amount of interest accruing on the overpayment on or after January 1, 2025, exceeds $200 in any calendar year during the time period described in Subsection (5)(c)(i); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(d)(i)(B): the amount of the overpayment exceeds 30% of the taxpayer's total tax liability as originally reported for the tax, fee, or charge to which the overpayment applies during the time period described in Subsection (5)(c)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(d)(ii): This Subsection (5)(d) does not apply to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(d)(ii)(A): an overpayment provided to a federally-recognized tribe; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(d)(ii)(B): an overpayment resulting from commission error.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(d)(iii): The annual interest rate imposed on an overpayment described in Subsection (5)(d)(i) shall be calculated at the rate of two percentage points below the federal short-term rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(d)(iv): Notwithstanding Subsection (5)(d)(iii), for an overpayment described in Subsection (5)(d)(i):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(d)(iv)(A): the interest rate imposed on the overpayment shall be a rate of no less than 0% and no more than 3%; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(5)(d)(iv)(B): the amount of interest accruing in a calendar year for an overpayment may not be less than $200, unless the amount of interest that would have accrued during the calendar year is less than $200 when calculated using the interest rate described in Subsection (3).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(6): Interest on any underpayment, deficiency, or delinquency of a tax, fee, or charge shall be computed from the time the original return is due, excluding any filing or payment extensions, to the date the payment is received.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-402(7): Interest on a refund relating to a tax, fee, or charge may not be paid on any overpayment that arises from a statute that is determined to be invalid under state or federal law or declared unconstitutional under the constitution of the United States or Utah if the basis for the refund is the retroactive application of a judicial decision upholding the claim of unconstitutionality or the invalidation of a statute.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403 Confidentiality -- Exceptions -- Penalty -- Application to property tax.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1): 19-6-805; 63H-1-205; 63H-1-201; 11-58-201 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(a): 19-6-805; 63H-1-205 "Distributed tax, fee, or charge" means a tax, fee, or charge:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(a)(i): 19-6-805; 63H-1-205 the commission administers under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(a)(i)(A): this title, other than a tax under Chapter 12, Part 2, Local Sales and Use Tax Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(a)(i)(B): Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 3, Municipal Energy Sales and Use Tax Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(a)(i)(C): Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 4, Municipal Telecommunications License Tax Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(a)(i)(D): 19-6-805 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(a)(i)(E): 63H-1-205 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(a)(i)(F): Title 69, Chapter 2, Part 4, Prepaid Wireless Telecommunications Service Charges; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(a)(ii): with respect to which the commission distributes the revenue collected from the tax, fee, or charge to a qualifying jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(b): 63H-1-201; 11-58-201 "Qualifying jurisdiction" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(b)(i): a county, city, or town;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(b)(ii): 63H-1-201 the military installation development authority created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(b)(iii): 11-58-201 the Utah Inland Port Authority created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(a): Any of the following may not divulge or make known in any manner any information gained by that person from any return filed with the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(a)(i): a tax commissioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(a)(ii): an agent, clerk, or other officer or employee of the commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(a)(iii): a representative, agent, clerk, or other officer or employee of any county, city, or town.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(b): An official charged with the custody of a return filed with the commission is not required to produce the return or evidence of anything contained in the return in any action or proceeding in any court, except:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(b)(i): in accordance with judicial order;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(b)(ii): on behalf of the commission in any action or proceeding under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(b)(ii)(A): this title; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(b)(ii)(B): other law under which persons are required to file returns with the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(b)(iii): on behalf of the commission in any action or proceeding to which the commission is a party; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(b)(iv): on behalf of any party to any action or proceeding under this title if the report or facts shown by the return are directly involved in the action or proceeding.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(c): Notwithstanding Subsection (2)(b), a court may require the production of, and may admit in evidence, any portion of a return or of the facts shown by the return, as are specifically pertinent to the action or proceeding.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(3): This section does not prohibit:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(3)(a): a person or that person's duly authorized representative from receiving a copy of any return or report filed in connection with that person's own tax;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(3)(b): the publication of statistics as long as the statistics are classified to prevent the identification of particular reports or returns; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(3)(c): the inspection by the attorney general or other legal representative of the state of the report or return of any taxpayer:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(3)(c)(i): who brings action to set aside or review a tax based on the report or return;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(3)(c)(ii): against whom an action or proceeding is contemplated or has been instituted under this title; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(3)(c)(iii): against whom the state has an unsatisfied money judgment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4): 59-12-209; 59-12-210; 19-6-402; 19-6-410.5; 59-22-202; 59-22-202; 59-14-407; 59-22-202; 59-14-401; 59-14-401; 59-14-210; 59-14-212; 59-14-211; 59-14-212; 59-14-212; 59-14-603; 59-14-606; 78B-1-106; 63N-1a-301; 63H-7a-302; 63H-7a-402; 63H-7a-502; 59-10-1313; 26B-3-106; 26B-3-903; 26B-3-106; 26B-3-903; 59-10-103.1; 59-2-103; 63H-7a-201; 59-24-103.5; 69-2-405; 69-2-405; 32B-1-203; 35A-9-604; 67-4a-102; 53F-6-402

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(c): Notwithstanding Subsection (2) and for all taxes except individual income tax and corporate franchise tax, the commission may by rule, in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, provide for the issuance of information concerning the identity and other information of taxpayers who have failed to file tax returns or to pay any tax due.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(i): Notwithstanding Subsection (2), the commission shall, at the request of a committee of the Legislature, the Office of the Legislative Fiscal Analyst, or the Governor's Office of Planning and Budget, provide to the committee or office the total amount of revenues collected by the commission under Chapter 24, Radioactive Waste Facility Tax Act, for the time period specified by the committee or office.
