Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(l): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(l)(i): Notwithstanding Subsection (2), the commission shall provide the Office of Recovery Services within the Department of Health and Human Services any relevant information obtained from a return filed under Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act, regarding a taxpayer who has become obligated to the Office of Recovery Services.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(l)(ii): The information described in Subsection (4)(l)(i) may be provided by the Office of Recovery Services to any other state's child support collection agency involved in enforcing that support obligation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(m): 78B-1-106
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(m)(i): Notwithstanding Subsection (2), upon request from the state court administrator, the commission shall provide to the state court administrator, the name, address, telephone number, county of residence, and social security number on resident returns filed under Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(m)(ii): 78B-1-106 The state court administrator may use the information described in Subsection (4)(m)(i) only as a source list for the master jury list described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n): 63N-1a-301
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(i): 63N-1a-301 As used in this Subsection (4)(n):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(i)(A): 63N-1a-301 "GOEO" means the Governor's Office of Economic Opportunity created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(i)(B): "Income tax information" means information gained by the commission that is required to be attached to or included in a return filed with the commission under Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes, or Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(i)(C): "Other tax information" means information gained by the commission that is required to be attached to or included in a return filed with the commission except for a return filed under Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes, or Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(i)(D): "Tax information" means income tax information or other tax information.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(ii)(A): Notwithstanding Subsection (2) and except as provided in Subsection (4)(n)(ii)(B) or (C), the commission shall at the request of GOEO provide to GOEO all income tax information.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(ii)(B): For purposes of a request for income tax information made under Subsection (4)(n)(ii)(A), GOEO may not request and the commission may not provide to GOEO a person's address, name, social security number, or taxpayer identification number.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(ii)(C): In providing income tax information to GOEO, the commission shall in all instances protect the privacy of a person as required by Subsection (4)(n)(ii)(B).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(iii)(A): Notwithstanding Subsection (2) and except as provided in Subsection (4)(n)(iii)(B), the commission shall at the request of GOEO provide to GOEO other tax information.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(iii)(B): Before providing other tax information to GOEO, the commission shall redact or remove any name, address, social security number, or taxpayer identification number.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(iv): GOEO may provide tax information received from the commission in accordance with this Subsection (4)(n) only:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(iv)(A): as a fiscal estimate, fiscal note information, or statistical information; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(iv)(B): if the tax information is classified to prevent the identification of a particular return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(v): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(v)(A): A person may not request tax information from GOEO under Title 63G, Chapter 2, Government Records Access and Management Act, or this section, if GOEO received the tax information from the commission in accordance with this Subsection (4)(n).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(v)(B): GOEO may not provide to a person that requests tax information in accordance with Subsection (4)(n)(v)(A) any tax information other than the tax information GOEO provides in accordance with Subsection (4)(n)(iv).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(o): Notwithstanding Subsection (2), the commission may provide to the governing board of the agreement or a taxing official of another state, the District of Columbia, the United States, or a territory of the United States:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(o)(i): the following relating to an agreement sales and use tax:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(o)(i)(A): information contained in a return filed with the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(o)(i)(B): information contained in a report filed with the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(o)(i)(C): a schedule related to Subsection (4)(o)(i)(A) or (B); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(o)(i)(D): a document filed with the commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(o)(ii): a report of an audit or investigation made with respect to an agreement sales and use tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(p): Notwithstanding Subsection (2), the commission may provide information concerning a taxpayer's state income tax return or state income tax withholding information to the Driver License Division if the Driver License Division:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(p)(i): requests the information; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(p)(ii): provides the commission with a signed release form from the taxpayer allowing the Driver License Division access to the information.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(y):

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(y)(ii): In addition to the information provided under Subsection (4)(y)(i), the commission shall provide a qualifying jurisdiction with copies of returns and other information relating to a distributed tax, fee, or charge collected within the qualifying jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(y)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(y)(iii)(A): To obtain the information described in Subsection (4)(y)(ii), the chief executive officer or the chief executive officer's designee of the qualifying jurisdiction shall submit a written request to the commission that states the specific information sought and how the qualifying jurisdiction intends to use the information.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(y)(iii)(B): The information described in Subsection (4)(y)(ii) is available only in official matters of the qualifying jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(y)(iv): Information that a qualifying jurisdiction receives in response to a request under this subsection is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(y)(iv)(A): classified as a private record under Title 63G, Chapter 2, Government Records Access and Management Act; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(y)(iv)(B): subject to the confidentiality requirements of this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(bb): 67-4a-102
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(bb)(i): 67-4a-102 As used in this Subsection (4)(bb), "unclaimed property administrator" means the administrator or the administrator's agent, as those terms are defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(bb)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(bb)(ii)(A): Notwithstanding Subsection (2), upon request from the unclaimed property administrator and to the extent allowed under federal law, the commission shall provide the unclaimed property administrator the name, address, telephone number, county of residence, and social security number or federal employer identification number on any return filed under Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes, or Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(bb)(ii)(B): The unclaimed property administrator may use the information described in Subsection (4)(bb)(ii)(A) only for the purpose of returning unclaimed property to the property's owner in accordance with Title 67, Chapter 4a, Revised Uniform Unclaimed Property Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(bb)(iii): The unclaimed property administrator is subject to the confidentiality provisions of this section with respect to any information the unclaimed property administrator receives under this Subsection (4)(bb).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(cc): 53F-6-402 Notwithstanding Subsection (2), the commission may, upon request, disclose a taxpayer's state individual income tax information to a program manager of the Utah Fits All Scholarship Program under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(cc)(i): the taxpayer consents in writing to the disclosure;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(cc)(ii): the taxpayer's written consent includes the taxpayer's name, social security number, and any other information the commission requests that is necessary to verify the identity of the taxpayer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(cc)(iii): the program manager provides the taxpayer's written consent to the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(dd): Notwithstanding Subsection (2), the commission may provide to the Division of Finance within the Department of Government Operations any information necessary to facilitate a payment from the commission to a taxpayer, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(dd)(i): the name of the taxpayer entitled to the payment or any other person legally authorized to receive the payment;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(dd)(ii): the taxpayer identification number of the taxpayer entitled to the payment;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(dd)(iii): the payment identification number and amount of the payment;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(dd)(iv): the tax year to which the payment applies and date on which the payment is due;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(dd)(v): a mailing address to which the payment may be directed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(dd)(vi): information regarding an account at a depository institution to which the payment may be directed, including the name of the depository institution, the type of account, the account number, and the routing number for the account.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(5)(a): Each report and return shall be preserved for at least three years.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(5)(b): After the three-year period provided in Subsection (5)(a) the commission may destroy a report or return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(6)(a): Any individual who violates this section is guilty of a class A misdemeanor.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(6)(b): If the individual described in Subsection (6)(a) is an officer or employee of the state, the individual shall be dismissed from office and be disqualified from holding public office in this state for a period of five years thereafter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(6)(c): Notwithstanding Subsection (6)(a) or (b), GOEO, when requesting information in accordance with Subsection (4)(n)(iii), or an individual who requests information in accordance with Subsection (4)(n)(v):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(6)(c)(i): is not guilty of a class A misdemeanor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(6)(c)(ii): is not subject to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(6)(c)(ii)(A): dismissal from office in accordance with Subsection (6)(b); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(6)(c)(ii)(B): disqualification from holding public office in accordance with Subsection (6)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(6)(d): Notwithstanding Subsection (6)(a) or (b), for a disclosure of information to the Office of the Legislative Auditor General in accordance with Title 36, Chapter 12, Legislative Organization, an individual described in Subsection (2):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(6)(d)(i): is not guilty of a class A misdemeanor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(6)(d)(ii): is not subject to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(6)(d)(ii)(A): dismissal from office in accordance with Subsection (6)(b); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(6)(d)(ii)(B): disqualification from holding public office in accordance with Subsection (6)(b).

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403 Confidentiality -- Exceptions -- Penalty -- Application to property tax.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1): 19-6-805; 63H-1-205; 63H-1-201; 11-58-201 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(a): 19-6-805; 63H-1-205 "Distributed tax, fee, or charge" means a tax, fee, or charge:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(a)(i): 19-6-805; 63H-1-205 the commission administers under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(a)(i)(A): this title, other than a tax under Chapter 12, Part 2, Local Sales and Use Tax Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(a)(i)(B): Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 3, Municipal Energy Sales and Use Tax Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(a)(i)(C): Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 4, Municipal Telecommunications License Tax Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(a)(i)(D): 19-6-805 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(a)(i)(E): 63H-1-205 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(a)(i)(F): Title 69, Chapter 2, Part 4, Prepaid Wireless Telecommunications Service Charges; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(a)(ii): with respect to which the commission distributes the revenue collected from the tax, fee, or charge to a qualifying jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(b): 63H-1-201; 11-58-201 "Qualifying jurisdiction" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(b)(i): a county, city, or town;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(b)(ii): 63H-1-201 the military installation development authority created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(1)(b)(iii): 11-58-201 the Utah Inland Port Authority created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(a): Any of the following may not divulge or make known in any manner any information gained by that person from any return filed with the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(a)(i): a tax commissioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(a)(ii): an agent, clerk, or other officer or employee of the commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(a)(iii): a representative, agent, clerk, or other officer or employee of any county, city, or town.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(b): An official charged with the custody of a return filed with the commission is not required to produce the return or evidence of anything contained in the return in any action or proceeding in any court, except:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(b)(i): in accordance with judicial order;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(b)(ii): on behalf of the commission in any action or proceeding under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(b)(ii)(A): this title; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(b)(ii)(B): other law under which persons are required to file returns with the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(b)(iii): on behalf of the commission in any action or proceeding to which the commission is a party; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(b)(iv): on behalf of any party to any action or proceeding under this title if the report or facts shown by the return are directly involved in the action or proceeding.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(2)(c): Notwithstanding Subsection (2)(b), a court may require the production of, and may admit in evidence, any portion of a return or of the facts shown by the return, as are specifically pertinent to the action or proceeding.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(3): This section does not prohibit:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(3)(a): a person or that person's duly authorized representative from receiving a copy of any return or report filed in connection with that person's own tax;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(3)(b): the publication of statistics as long as the statistics are classified to prevent the identification of particular reports or returns; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(3)(c): the inspection by the attorney general or other legal representative of the state of the report or return of any taxpayer:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(3)(c)(i): who brings action to set aside or review a tax based on the report or return;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(3)(c)(ii): against whom an action or proceeding is contemplated or has been instituted under this title; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(3)(c)(iii): against whom the state has an unsatisfied money judgment.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n): 63N-1a-301
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(i): 63N-1a-301 As used in this Subsection (4)(n):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(i)(A): 63N-1a-301 "GOEO" means the Governor's Office of Economic Opportunity created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(i)(B): "Income tax information" means information gained by the commission that is required to be attached to or included in a return filed with the commission under Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes, or Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(i)(C): "Other tax information" means information gained by the commission that is required to be attached to or included in a return filed with the commission except for a return filed under Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes, or Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(i)(D): "Tax information" means income tax information or other tax information.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(ii)(A): Notwithstanding Subsection (2) and except as provided in Subsection (4)(n)(ii)(B) or (C), the commission shall at the request of GOEO provide to GOEO all income tax information.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(ii)(B): For purposes of a request for income tax information made under Subsection (4)(n)(ii)(A), GOEO may not request and the commission may not provide toGOEO a person's address, name, social security number, or taxpayer identification number.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(ii)(C): In providing income tax information to GOEO, the commission shall in all instances protect the privacy of a person as required by Subsection (4)(n)(ii)(B).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(iii)(A): Notwithstanding Subsection (2) and except as provided in Subsection (4)(n)(iii)(B), the commission shall at the request of GOEO provide to GOEO other tax information.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(iii)(B): Before providing other tax information to GOEO, the commission shall redact or remove any name, address, social security number, or taxpayer identification number.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(iv): GOEO may provide tax information received from the commission in accordance with this Subsection (4)(n) only:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(iv)(A): as a fiscal estimate, fiscal note information, or statistical information; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(iv)(B): if the tax information is classified to prevent the identification of a particular return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(v): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(v)(A): A person may not request tax information from GOEO under Title 63G, Chapter 2, Government Records Access and Management Act, or this section, if GOEO received the tax information from the commission in accordance with this Subsection (4)(n).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(n)(v)(B): GOEO may not provide to a person that requests tax information in accordance with Subsection (4)(n)(v)(A) any tax information other than the tax information GOEO provides in accordance with Subsection (4)(n)(iv).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(o): Notwithstanding Subsection (2), the commission may provide to the governing board of the agreement or a taxing official of another state, the District of Columbia, the United States, or a territory of the United States:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(o)(i): the following relating to an agreement sales and use tax:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(o)(i)(A): information contained in a return filed with the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(o)(i)(B): information contained in a report filed with the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(o)(i)(C): a schedule related to Subsection (4)(o)(i)(A) or (B); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(o)(i)(D): a document filed with the commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(o)(ii): a report of an audit or investigation made with respect to an agreement sales and use tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(p): Notwithstanding Subsection (2), the commission may provide information concerning a taxpayer's state income tax return or state income tax withholding information to the Driver License Division if the Driver License Division:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(p)(i): requests the information; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(p)(ii): provides the commission with a signed release form from the taxpayer allowing the Driver License Division access to the information.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(q): 63H-7a-302; 63H-7a-402; 63H-7a-502 Notwithstanding Subsection (2), the commission shall provide to the Utah Communications Authority, or a division of the Utah Communications Authority, the information requested by the authority under Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(r): 59-10-1313 Notwithstanding Subsection (2), the commission shall provide to the Utah Educational Savings Plan information related to a resident or nonresident individual's contribution to a Utah Educational Savings Plan account as designated on the resident or nonresident's individual income tax return as provided under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(4)(s)(i): an eligibility worker with the Department of Health and Human Services or its designee requests the information from the commission; and

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(6)(a): Any individual who violates this section is guilty of a class A misdemeanor.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(6)(b): If the individual described in Subsection (6)(a) is an officer or employee of the state, the individual shall be dismissed from office and be disqualified from holding public office in this state for a period of five years thereafter.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(6)(c)(ii): is not subject to:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403(6)(c)(ii)(B): disqualification from holding public office in accordance with Subsection (6)(b).

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1 Disclosure of return information.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(1): 36-12-13; 36-12-12; 63J-4-201 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(1)(a): 36-12-13; 36-12-12; 63J-4-201 "Office" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(1)(a)(i): 36-12-13 the Office of the Legislative Fiscal Analyst, established in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(1)(a)(ii): 36-12-12 the Office of Legislative Research and General Counsel, established in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(1)(a)(iii): 63J-4-201 the Governor's Office of Planning and Budget, created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(1)(b)(i): "Return information" means information gained by the commission that is required to be attached to or included in a return filed with the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(1)(b)(ii): "Return information" does not include information that the commission is prohibited from disclosing by federal law, federal regulation, or federal publication.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(2): 59-1-403(2); (2)(b); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(2)(a): 59-1-403(2); (2)(b) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(2)(b): (2)(a) For purposes of a request for return information made under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(3): (3)(a); Title 63G, Chapter 2, Government Records Access and Management Act; (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(3)(a): An office may disclose return information received from the commission in accordance with this section only:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(3)(a)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(3)(a)(i)(A): as a fiscal estimate, fiscal note information, or statistical information; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(3)(a)(i)(B): in a manner that reasonably protects the identification of a particular taxpayer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(3)(a)(ii): to another office.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(3)(b): (3)(a); Title 63G, Chapter 2, Government Records Access and Management Act A person may not request return information, other than the return information that the office discloses in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(3)(c): (3)(a) An office may not disclose to a person that requests return information any return information other than the return information that the office discloses in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(4): (3)(a) Any individual who violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(4)(a): is guilty of a class A misdemeanor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(4)(b): shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(4)(b)(i): dismissed from office; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(4)(b)(ii): disqualified from holding public office in this state for a period of five years after dismissal.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(5): (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-403.1(5)(a): An office and the commission may enter into an agreement specifying the procedures for accessing, storing, and destroying return information requested in accordance with this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404 Definitions -- Confidentiality of commercial information obtained from a property taxpayer or derived from the commercial information -- Rulemaking authority -- Exceptions -- Written explanation -- Signature requirements -- Retention of signed explanation by employer -- Penalty.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1): Title 61, Chapter 2g, Real Estate Appraiser Licensing and Certification Act; 61-2g-102; (1)(c)(i); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(c)(ii)(A); 61-2g-102; Chapter 2, Part 3, County Assessment; Chapter 2, Property Tax Act; Chapter 2, Property Tax Act As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(a): Title 61, Chapter 2g, Real Estate Appraiser Licensing and Certification Act "Appraiser" means an individual who holds an appraiser's certificate or license issued by the Division of Real Estate under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(b): 61-2g-102 "Appraisal" is as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(c): (1)(c)(i); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(c)(ii)(A)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(c)(i): (1)(c)(i) "Commercial information" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(c)(i)(A): information of a commercial nature obtained from a property taxpayer regarding the property taxpayer's property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(c)(i)(B): (1)(c)(i) information derived from the information described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(c)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(c)(ii)(A)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(c)(ii)(A): "Commercial information" does not include information regarding a property taxpayer's property if the information is intended for public use.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(c)(ii)(B): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(c)(ii)(A) In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(d): 61-2g-102 "Consultation service" is as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(e): Chapter 2, Part 3, County Assessment "Locally assessed property" means property that is assessed by a county assessor in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(f): Chapter 2, Property Tax Act "Property taxpayer" means a person that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(f)(i): is a property owner; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(f)(ii): Chapter 2, Property Tax Act has in effect a contract with a property owner to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(f)(ii)(A): make filings on behalf of the property owner;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(f)(ii)(B): process appeals on behalf of the property owner; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(f)(ii)(C): Chapter 2, Property Tax Act pay a tax under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(g): Chapter 2, Property Tax Act "Property taxpayer's property" means property with respect to which a property taxpayer:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(g)(i): owns the property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(g)(ii): makes filings relating to the property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(g)(iii): processes appeals relating to the property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(g)(iv): Chapter 2, Property Tax Act pays a tax under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(h): "Protected commercial information" means commercial information that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(h)(i): identifies a specific property taxpayer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(1)(h)(ii): would reasonably lead to the identity of a specific property taxpayer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(2): 59-1-403(2)(a); 59-1-403(2)(a); Chapter 2, Property Tax Act; Chapter 2, Property Tax Act; Chapter 2, Property Tax Act; Chapter 2, Property Tax Act An individual listed under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(4)(b)(i): (8) if the commercial information is obtained from:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(4)(b)(i)(A): a real estate agent if the real estate agent is not a property taxpayer of the property that is the subject of the action or proceeding;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(4)(b)(ii): regardless of whether the commercial information is disclosed in more than one action or proceeding; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(4)(b)(iii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(4)(b)(iii)(A): if a county board of equalization conducts the action or proceeding, the county board of equalization takes action to provide that any commercial information disclosed during the action or proceeding may not be disclosed by any person conducting or participating in the action or proceeding except as specifically allowed by this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(4)(b)(iii)(B): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act if the commission conducts the action or proceeding, the commission enters a protective order or, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(4)(b)(iii)(C): if a court of competent jurisdiction conducts the action or proceeding, the court enters a protective order specifying that any commercial information disclosed during the action or proceeding may not be disclosed by any person conducting or participating in the action or proceeding except as specifically allowed by this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(5): (2); Chapter 2, Property Tax Act; 59-12-205(5) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(5)(a): Chapter 2, Property Tax Act the following from receiving a copy of any commercial information relating to the basis for assessing a tax that is charged to a property taxpayer:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(5)(a)(iii)(C): Chapter 2, Property Tax Act pay a tax under

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(5)(a)(v): a person that the property taxpayer designates in writing as being authorized to receive the commercial information;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(5)(c): the inspection by the attorney general or other legal representative of the state or a legal representative of a political subdivision of the state of the commercial information of a property taxpayer:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(5)(c)(i): that brings action to set aside or review a tax or property valuation based on the commercial information;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-404(5)(c)(ii): against which an action or proceeding is contemplated or has been instituted under this title; or

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405 Commission consideration of confidential tax matters.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(1): 59-1-403; 59-1-404 As used in this section, "confidential tax matter" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(1)(a): an offer in compromise;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(1)(b): a private letter ruling;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(1)(c): an appeal before the members of the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(1)(d): 59-1-403; 59-1-404 a tax matter if the disclosure of the tax matter is prohibited under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(1)(d)(i): federal law;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(1)(d)(ii): 59-1-403 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(1)(d)(iii): 59-1-404 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(1)(e): a voluntary disclosure agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(1)(f): a waiver request; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(1)(g): provision of guidance by the commission to an employee of the commission on the interpretation and application of a law administered by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(2): Title 52, Chapter 4, Open and Public Meetings Act; (2)(a); (1)(g)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(2)(a): Title 52, Chapter 4, Open and Public Meetings Act Notwithstanding
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(2)(b): (2)(a); (1)(g) When the commission holds a meeting described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(2)(b)(i): shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(2)(b)(i)(A): the commission's executive director; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(2)(b)(i)(B): the executive director's designee;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(2)(b)(ii): may include any other commission employee as determined by the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(2)(b)(iii): may not include guidance that constitutes an ex parte communication on a taxpayer specific matter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(3): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (4) In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-405(3)(a): to establish procedures for holding a meeting that is not open to the public to conduct a hearing on, discuss, or take action on a confidential tax matter; and

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-501 Procedure for obtaining redetermination of a deficiency -- Claim for refund.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-501(1)(b): 59-1-1402 "Tax, fee, or charge" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-501(2): A person may file a request for agency action, petitioning the commission for redetermination of a deficiency.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-501(3): 59-1-1405; 59-1-1405 Subject to Subsections (4) through (6), a person shall file the request for agency action described in Subsection (2):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-501(3)(a): 59-1-1405 within a 30-day period after the date the commission mails a notice of deficiency to the person in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-501(3)(b): 59-1-1405 within a 90-day period after the date the commission mails a notice of deficiency to the person in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-501(4): If the last day of a time period described in Subsection (3) is a Saturday, Sunday, or legal holiday, the last day for a person to file a request for agency action is the next day that is not a Saturday, Sunday, or legal holiday.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-501(5): 59-1-1404 A person that mails a request for agency action shall mail the request for agency action in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-501(6): 59-1-1404 For purposes of Subsection (3), a person is considered to have filed a request for agency action:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-501(6)(a): 59-1-1404 if the person mails the request for agency action, on the date the person is considered to have mailed the request for agency action in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-501(6)(b): if the person delivers the request for agency action to the commission by a method other than mail, on the date the commission receives the request for agency action.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-501(7): 59-1-401; 59-1-402; 59-1-1410 A person that has not previously filed a timely request for agency action in accordance with Subsection (3) may object to a final assessment issued by the commission by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-501(7)(a): 59-1-401; 59-1-402 paying the tax, fee, or charge, penalty accrued in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-501(7)(b): 59-1-1410 filing a claim for a refund as provided in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-502.5 Initial hearing -- Formal hearing to exhaust administrative remedies.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-502.5(1): At least 30 days before any formal hearing is held in response to a party's request for agency action, one or more tax commissioners or an administrative law judge designated by the commission shall hold an initial hearing at which proffers of evidence, including testimony, documents, and other exhibits may be made and oral or written argument on legal issues may be received.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-502.5(2): Any party participating in an initial hearing shall have the right to informal discovery under any rules established by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-502.5(3): A party may appear at the initial hearing in person or through an agent, an employee, or another representative, but any person appearing on behalf of another party or entity shall have full settlement authority on behalf of the party the person is representing.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-502.5(4): A record may not be kept of the initial hearing and all initial hearing proceedings are privileged and do not constitute admissions against interest of any party participating in the hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-502.5(5): At the initial hearing, or as soon thereafter as reasonably practicable, the commission may take any action the commission deems appropriate to settle, compromise, or reduce the deficiency, or adjust the assessed valuation of any property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-502.5(6): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act Nothing in this section may limit a party's right to a formal hearing under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-502.5(7): 63G-4-401 A party has not exhausted the party's administrative remedies in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-502.5(7)(a): the party requests a formal hearing within the time period provided by law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-502.5(7)(b): the commission has issued a final unappealable administrative order.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-503 Assessment and payment of deficiency.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-503(1): Following a redetermination of a deficiency by the commission, the entire amount redetermined as the deficiency by the decision of the commission, which has become final, shall be assessed and shall be paid within 30 days from the date the notice and demand is sent from the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-503(2): If the taxpayer does not file a petition with the commission within the time prescribed for filing the petition, the deficiency, notice of which has been sent to the taxpayer, shall be assessed, and shall be paid within 30 days from the date the notice and demand is sent from the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-504 Time determination final.
--------------------------------------------------------
The action of the commission on the taxpayer's petition for redetermination of deficiency shall be final 30 days after the date the commission's notice of agency action is sent.  All tax, interest, and penalties are due 30 days from the date the commission's decision or order is sent, unless the taxpayer seeks judicial review.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-601 District court jurisdiction.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-601(1): 63G-4-402 In addition to the jurisdiction granted in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-601(2): As used in this section, "trial de novo" means an original, independent proceeding, and does not mean a trial de novo on the record.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-601(3): (3); 63G-4-403
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-601(3)(a): In any appeal to the district court pursuant to this section taken after January 1, 1997, the commission shall certify a record of its proceedings to the district court.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-601(3)(b): (3); 63G-4-403 This Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-602 Right to appeal -- Venue -- County as party in interest.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-602(1): 59-1-610; 63G-4-402
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-602(1)(a): 59-1-610 Any aggrieved party appearing before the commission or county whose tax revenues are affected by the decision may at that party's option petition for judicial review in the district court pursuant to this section, or in the Supreme Court or the Court of Appeals pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-602(1)(b): Judicial review of formal or informal adjudicative proceedings in the district is in the district court located in the county of residence or principal place of business of the affected taxpayer or, in the case of a taxpayer whose taxes are assessed on a statewide basis, to the Third Judicial District Court in and for Salt Lake County.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-602(1)(c): 63G-4-402 Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-602(2): A county whose tax revenues are affected by the decision being reviewed shall be allowed to be a party in interest in the proceeding before the court.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-604 Burden of proof -- Decision of court.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
In proceedings of the district court under this part and on appeal therefrom, a preponderance of the evidence shall suffice to sustain the burden of proof.  The burden of proof shall fall upon the parties seeking affirmative relief and the burden of going forward with the evidence shall shift as in other civil litigation.  The district court shall render its decision in writing, including therein a concise statement of the facts found by the court and the conclusions of law reached by the court.  The court may affirm, reverse, modify, or remand any order of the commission, and shall grant other relief, invoke such other remedies, and issue such orders, in accordance with its decision, as appropriate.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-607 Decision of district court as final determination.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Unless stayed, the decision of the  district court shall be binding upon all parties until changed upon appeal.  If no appeal is taken, the decision of the court shall constitute a final determination of the matter.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-608 Appeal.
--------------------------------------
The exclusive remedy for review of a decision or order of the district court entered under this part shall be by appeal.  Any party to the action has the right to an appeal.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-610 Standard of review of appellate court.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-610(1): When reviewing formal adjudicative proceedings commenced before the commission, the Court of Appeals or Supreme Court shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-610(1)(a): grant the commission deference concerning its written findings of fact, applying a substantial evidence standard on review; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-610(1)(b): grant the commission no deference concerning its conclusions of law, applying a correction of error standard, unless there is an explicit grant of discretion contained in a statute at issue before the appellate court.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-610(2): 63G-4-403 This section supercedes Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-612 Formal hearing to exhaust administrative remedies.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A party has not exhausted the party's administrative remedies in accordance with SectionUtah Code Annotated § 59-1-612(1): the party requests a formal hearing within the time period provided by law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-612(2): the commission has issued a final unappealable administrative order.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-613 Judicial review -- Mandatory stay of certain commission cases.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-613(1): (1)(a) Unless all parties otherwise agree, upon request, the commission shall stay an appeal of the valuation or equalization of real or personal property, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-613(1)(a): a commission decision on the valuation or equalization of real or personal property is under judicial review; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-613(1)(b): (1)(a) the commission decision described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-613(1)(b)(i): taxpayer;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-613(1)(b)(ii): legal issue or valuation principle; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-613(1)(b)(iii): to a material degree, facts.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-613(2): (1) An appeal stayed in accordance with Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-613 Judicial review -- Mandatory stay of certain commission cases.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-613(1): Except as provided in Subsection (2) or unless all parties otherwise agree, upon request, the commission shall stay an appeal of the valuation or equalization of real or personal property, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-613(1)(a): a commission decision on the valuation or equalization of real or personal property is under judicial review; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-613(1)(b): the commission decision described in Subsection (1)(a) and the pending commission appeal involve the same:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-613(1)(b)(i): taxpayer;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-613(1)(b)(ii): legal issue or valuation principle; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-613(1)(b)(iii): to a material degree, facts.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-613(2): 59-2-1330 Subsection (1) does not apply if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-613(2)(a): the commission determines that the case under judicial review is not likely to have a material influence on the outcome of the pending commission appeal; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-613(2)(b): 59-2-1330 the property taxes subject to the pending commission appeal have not been paid in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-613(3): An appeal stayed in accordance with Subsection (1) is stayed until the court issues a final decision after judicial review of the commission decision.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-701 Grounds for termination and jeopardy assessment -- Notice -- Collection -- Reopening period -- Bond.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-701(1): If the commission finds that a taxpayer intends quickly to depart from this state or to remove his property therefrom, or to conceal himself or his property therein, or to do any other act (including in the case of a taxpayer selling or otherwise distributing all or a part of its assets in liquidation or otherwise) tending to prejudice or to render wholly or partially ineffectual proceedings to collect any tax or penalty in lieu of tax for the current or the preceding taxable period, unless such proceedings be brought without delay, the commission may declare the taxable period for such taxpayer immediately terminated whether or not the time otherwise allowed by law for filing returns and paying the liability has expired.  The commission shall immediately make a determination of tax for the current taxable period or for the preceding period, or both, and notwithstanding any other provision of law, the tax shall become immediately due and payable.  The commission shall immediately assess the amount of the tax so determined (together with all interest, penalties, additional amounts, and additions to the tax provided by law) for the current taxable period or such preceding taxable period, or both, and shall give the notice of determination and assessment to the taxpayer, together with a demand for immediate payment of the tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-701(2): (1) In the case of a current taxable period, the commission shall determine the tax for the period beginning on the first day of the current taxable period and ending on the date of the determination under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-701(3): (1); Title 59, Chapter 2, Property Tax Act; Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act; Chapter 12, Sales and Use Tax Act Notwithstanding the termination of the taxable period of the taxpayer as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-701(4): (1) Payment of taxes may not be enforced by any proceedings under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-702 Jeopardy assessment -- Notice -- Amount.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-702(1): Title 59, Chapter 2, Property Tax Act; Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act; Chapter 12, Sales and Use Tax Act If the commission believes that the assessment or collection of any tax or penalty in lieu of tax will be jeopardized by delay, it shall, notwithstanding the assessment provisions of
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-702(2): Title 59, Chapter 2, Property Tax Act; Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act; Chapter 12, Sales and Use Tax Act If the jeopardy assessment is made before any notice of the tax deficiency to which the jeopardy assessment relates has been mailed under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-702(3): The jeopardy assessment may be made of a deficiency greater or less than that set forth in the notice of deficiency, which has been mailed to the taxpayer, and whether or not the taxpayer has filed a petition with the commission.  The commission may, at any time before rendering its decision, abate such assessment, or any unpaid portion thereof, to the extent that it believes the assessment to be excessive in amount.  The commission has jurisdiction to redetermine the entire amount of the deficiency and of all amounts assessed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-702(4): If the jeopardy assessment is made after the commission has rendered a decision on a taxpayer's petition for redetermination, the assessment may be made only in respect to the amount of the deficiency determined by the commission in its decision.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-703 Collection procedure -- Review -- Bond for stay -- Sale of seized property.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-703(1): 59-1-701; 59-1-702; Part 14, Assessment, Collections, and Refunds Act; (1)(a); (1)(b)(i); (1)(b)(i); (1)(b)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-703(1)(a): 59-1-701; 59-1-702; Part 14, Assessment, Collections, and Refunds Act If an amount that is due and payable under Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-703(1)(b): (1)(a); (1)(b)(i); (1)(b)(i); (1)(b)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-703(1)(b)(i): (1)(a) For purposes of collecting an amount described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-704 Restraint of collection restricted.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-704(1): Chapter 1, Part 5, Petitions for Redetermination of Deficiencies; Part 6, Judicial Review; Part 7, Termination and Jeopardy Assessments Procedure; Chapter 2, Property Tax Act; Chapter 6, Mineral Production Tax Withholding; Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act; Chapter 12, Sales and Use Tax Act; Chapter 1, General Taxation Policies; Chapter 2, Property Tax Act; Chapter 6, Mineral Production Tax Withholding; Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act; Chapter 12, Sales and Use Tax Act Except as otherwise provided in
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-704(2): No suit may be maintained in any court for the purpose of restraining the assessment or collection of the amount of the state tax liability of a transferee or of a fiduciary of property of a taxpayer.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-801.5 Purpose of compact -- Definitions -- Elements of sales and use tax laws -- The Multistate Tax Commission -- Uniform regulations and forms -- Interstate audits -- Entry into force and withdrawal -- Effect on other laws and jurisdiction -- Construction and severability.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The "Multistate Tax Compact" is hereby enacted into law and entered into with all jurisdictions legally joining therein, in the form substantially as follows:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-808 Interaudit provisions to apply.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Article VIII of the Multistate Tax Compact relating to interaudits shall be in force in and with respect to this state.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-809 Commission authority related to the Multistate Tax Commission and governmental entities.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission may furnish to the Multistate Tax Commission, a taxing official of another state, the District of Columbia, or the United States or its territories, any information contained in:Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-809(1): a tax return or report, a related schedule, or a document filed pursuant to the tax laws of this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-809(2): (1) the report of an audit or investigation made with respect to a tax return or report, a related schedule, or a document described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1001 Statement of taxpayer rights.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1001(1): The commission shall prepare written information in clear, nontechnical language of the taxpayer's rights and obligations and of the commission's procedures for appeal, refund claims, and collections.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1001(2): When the commission contacts a taxpayer in writing about the determination or collection of any tax, the commission shall notify the taxpayer of the availability of a written statement of the taxpayer's rights and obligations and of the commission's procedures for appeal, refund claims, and collections.  If a taxpayer requests this information, the commission shall provide it to the taxpayer free of charge.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1001(3): In notices to taxpayers of taxes and penalties due, the commission shall notify the taxpayer of the procedure to follow in order to request detailed information concerning the additional taxes, tax penalties, or interest.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1002 Audit interviews.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1002(1): During any audit interview, the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1002(1)(a): require reasonable scheduling of its audit interviews;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1002(1)(b): permit recording of audit interviews;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1002(1)(c): explain its audit and collection process before the first interview; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1002(1)(d): allow a taxpayer to be represented at an interview by an attorney or other representative with power of attorney.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1002(2): The commission may not require a taxpayer to bring his attorney or other representative to interviews.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1003 Penalty waiver.
-----------------------------------------------
The commission shall waive penalties on taxpayer underpayments that are attributable to incorrect written advice obtained from the commission unless the taxpayer has given the commission inaccurate or insufficient information.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1004 Installment payments.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1004(1): The commission may enter into agreements with taxpayers on installment payments of taxes, penalties, and interest.  The commission may revise, accelerate, or cancel the installment agreement if any of the following occurs:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1004(1)(a): the commission determines that the financial condition of the taxpayer has substantially changed;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1004(1)(b): the commission determines that the taxpayer provided inaccurate information concerning his financial condition; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1004(1)(c): the taxpayer fails to make timely payments pursuant to the terms of the installment agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1004(2): The commission shall give the taxpayer reasonable notice of its intent to revise or cancel an installment agreement entered into under this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1005 Suits against commission and its employees.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1005(1): A taxpayer may bring a civil suit against the commission for recovery of actual damages and costs incurred by the taxpayer if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1005(1)(a): the commission or one of its employees intentionally or recklessly takes possession of a taxpayer's property in disregard of its published procedures, laws, or rules; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1005(1)(b): otherwise intentionally or recklessly disregards published procedures, laws, or rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1005(2): An award of actual damages and court costs in a suit under this section may not exceed $100,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1005(3): If the court finds that the civil action brought by the taxpayer is frivolous, the court may impose a penalty of up to $10,000 against the taxpayer.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1006 Application to jeopardy assessments and property tax.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The provisions of Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1101 Private collection of tax -- Fee.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1101(1): The commission is authorized to employ private collectors for the collection of accounts that are unpaid over 12 months after the assessment date.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1101(2): Up to, but no more than, 33% of the money collected may be used to offset the payment to a private collector.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1101(3): (1) The commission may authorize a private collector described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1301 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Reportable Transactions Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(1): "Gross income" is as defined in Section 61, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(2): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act "Income tax" means a tax imposed under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(2)(a): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(2)(b): Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(3): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act "Income tax return" means a return filed under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(3)(a): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(3)(b): Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(4): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Listed transaction" means a reportable transaction that is the same as, or substantially similar to, a transaction or arrangement specifically identified as a listed transaction by the:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(4)(a): United States Secretary of the Treasury in written materials interpreting the requirements of Section 6011, Internal Revenue Code; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(4)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act commission by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(5): "Material advisor" is as defined in Section 6111, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(6): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Reportable transaction" means a transaction or arrangement that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(6)(a): is carried out through or invested in by one or more entities that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(6)(a)(i): are organized in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(6)(a)(ii): do business in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(6)(a)(iii): derive gross income from sources within this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(6)(a)(iv): are subject to income tax; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(6)(a)(v): are otherwise subject to the jurisdiction of this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(6)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(6)(b)(i): a transaction or arrangement described in 26 C.F.R. Sec. 1.6011-4(b)(2) through (7); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(6)(b)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act a reportable transaction as described by the commission by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(7): "Taxpayer" means a person that is required to file an income tax return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1302(8): 59-7-101 "Unitary group" is as defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1303 Taxpayer disclosure of reportable transactions.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1303(1): A taxpayer is subject to this section for each taxable year in which:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1303(1)(a): the taxpayer participates in a reportable transaction;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1303(1)(b): the taxpayer:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1303(1)(b)(i): is included in a federal consolidated return under Sections 1501 and 1504(b), Internal Revenue Code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1303(1)(b)(ii): participates in a reportable transaction; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1303(1)(c): the taxpayer is a member of a group that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1303(1)(c)(i): is a unitary group; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1303(1)(c)(ii): participates in a reportable transaction.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1304 Penalty for taxpayer failure to disclose a reportable transaction.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1304(1): (1)(b); 59-1-1303; 59-1-1303
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1304(1)(a): (1)(b); 59-1-1303 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1304(1)(b): 59-1-1303 A taxpayer that fails to disclose a listed transaction as required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1304(2): A penalty imposed by this section is in addition to any other penalty imposed by this title.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1305 Penalty for taxpayer underpayment of tax attributable to a reportable transaction.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1305(1): If the underpayment of a tax by a taxpayer is attributable to a reportable transaction, the taxpayer is subject to a penalty that is equal to the product of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1305(1)(a): 10%; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1305(1)(b): the amount of the tax underpayment attributable to the reportable transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1305(2): If a taxpayer amends an income tax return to change the tax treatment of a reportable transaction after the day on which the commission contacts the taxpayer regarding the examination of the income tax return, that change in the tax treatment of the reportable transaction contained in the amended income tax return may not be considered in determining a tax underpayment under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1305(3): A penalty imposed by this section is in addition to any other penalty imposed by this title.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1307 Material advisor maintenance of list.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1307(1): For each reportable transaction, a material advisor shall maintain a list of the persons to which the material advisor provides material aid, assistance, or advice with respect to organizing, managing, promoting, selling, implementing, insuring, or carrying out a reportable transaction.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1307(2)(a)(iii)(B): included in a federal consolidated return under Sections 1501 and 1504(b), Internal Revenue Code;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1307(2)(c): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act any additional information required by the commission by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1307(3): (1) The list described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1307(4): (1) A material advisor required to maintain a list under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1307(4)(a): make the list available to the commission upon written request by the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1307(4)(b): retain the information that is required to be included on the list for seven years.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1308 Material advisor penalties.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1308(1): 59-1-1306 The penalty for failure of a material advisor to disclose a reportable transaction as required by Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1309 Penalty may be waived, reduced, or compromised for reasonable cause.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Upon making a record of its actions, and upon reasonable cause shown, the commission may waive, reduce, or compromise a penalty imposed by this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1401 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Assessment, Collections, and Refunds Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(1): Part 17, Depository Institution Data Match System and Levy Act; (1)(a); (c); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Administrative cost" means a fee imposed to cover:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(1)(a): the cost of filing;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(1)(b): the cost of administering a garnishment;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(1)(c): Part 17, Depository Institution Data Match System and Levy Act the amount the commission pays to a depository institution in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(1)(d): (1)(a); (c); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act a cost similar to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(2): (2)(a); (f); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Books and records" means the following made available in printed or electronic format:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(2)(a): an account;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(2)(b): a book;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(2)(c): an invoice;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(2)(d): a memorandum;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(2)(e): a paper;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(2)(f): a record; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(2)(g): (2)(a); (f); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act an item similar to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(3): "Deficiency" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(3)(a): the amount by which a tax, fee, or charge exceeds the difference between:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(3)(a)(i): the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(3)(a)(i)(A): the amount shown as the tax, fee, or charge by a person on the person's return; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(3)(a)(i)(B): any amount previously assessed, or collected without assessment, as a deficiency; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(3)(a)(ii): any amount previously abated, credited, refunded, or otherwise repaid with respect to that tax, fee, or charge; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(3)(b): if a person does not show an amount as a tax, fee, or charge on the person's return, or if a person does not make a return, the amount by which the tax, fee, or charge exceeds:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(3)(b)(i): the amount previously assessed, or collected without assessment, as a deficiency; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(3)(b)(ii): any amount previously abated, credited, refunded, or otherwise repaid with respect to that tax, fee, or charge.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(4): "Garnishment" means any legal or equitable procedure through which one or more of the following are required to be withheld for payment of an amount a person owes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(4)(a): an asset of the person held by another person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(4)(b): the earnings of the person.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(5): 59-1-402; 59-1-401 "Liability" means the following that a person is required to remit to the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(5)(a): a tax, fee, or charge;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(5)(b): an addition to a tax, fee, or charge;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(5)(c): an administrative cost;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(5)(d): 59-1-402 interest that accrues in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(5)(e): 59-1-401 a penalty that accrues in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(6): (6)(b); (6)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(6)(a): (6)(b) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(6)(b): (6)(a) The reference to Section 6213(g)(2), Internal Revenue Code, in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(6)(b)(i): the reference to Section 6213(g)(2), Internal Revenue Code, in effect for the taxable year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(6)(b)(ii): a corresponding or comparable provision of the Internal Revenue Code as amended, redesignated, or reenacted.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(7): (7)(b); Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 3, Municipal Energy Sales and Use Tax Act; Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 4, Municipal Telecommunications License Tax Act; 19-6-410.5; 19-6-714; 19-6-805; 34A-2-202; 40-6-14; Title 69, Chapter 2, Part 4, Prepaid Wireless Telecommunications Service Charges; Title 41, Chapter 1a, Motor Vehicle Act; 41-1a-301; Title 41, Chapter 3, Motor Vehicle Business Regulation Act; Chapter 2, Property Tax Act; Chapter 3, Tax Equivalent Property Act; Chapter 4, Privilege Tax; Chapter 13, Part 5, Interstate Agreements
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(7)(a): (7)(b); Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 3, Municipal Energy Sales and Use Tax Act; Title 10, Chapter 1, Part 4, Municipal Telecommunications License Tax Act; 19-6-410.5; 19-6-714; 19-6-805; 34A-2-202; 40-6-14; Title 69, Chapter 2, Part 4, Prepaid Wireless Telecommunications Service Charges Except as provided in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(7)(a)(i)(A): this title;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(7)(a)(i)(I): Title 69, Chapter 2, Part 4, Prepaid Wireless Telecommunications Service Charges
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(7)(a)(ii): another amount that by statute is administered by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(7)(b): Title 41, Chapter 1a, Motor Vehicle Act; 41-1a-301; Title 41, Chapter 3, Motor Vehicle Business Regulation Act; Chapter 2, Property Tax Act; Chapter 3, Tax Equivalent Property Act; Chapter 4, Privilege Tax; Chapter 13, Part 5, Interstate Agreements "Tax, fee, or charge" does not include a tax, fee, or charge imposed under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(7)(b)(i): Title 41, Chapter 1a, Motor Vehicle Act; 41-1a-301
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(7)(b)(ii): Title 41, Chapter 3, Motor Vehicle Business Regulation Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(7)(b)(iii): Chapter 2, Property Tax Act

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(8): (8)(a); (e); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Transferee" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(8)(a): a devisee;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402(8)(f): (8)(a); (e); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act a person similar to Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402.1 Exceptions to applicability of this part.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
This part does not apply to:Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402.1(1): Chapter 2, Property Tax Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402.1(2): Chapter 3, Tax Equivalent Property Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1402.1(3): Chapter 4, Privilege Tax


Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403 Commission to collect a tax, fee, or charge -- Receipt for tax, fee, or charge paid -- Additional remedies -- Collection agents and counsel -- Action by attorney general or county attorney -- Commission rulemaking authority.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(1): Except as otherwise provided in this title, the commission shall collect a tax, fee, or charge.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(2): The commission may designate an agent to collect a tax, fee, or charge.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(3): The commission shall, upon request, give a receipt for a tax, fee, or charge the commission collects.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(4)(a): A remedy provided in this part is in addition to other existing remedies.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(4)(b): An action taken by the commission may not be construed to be an election on the part of the state or an officer of the state to pursue a remedy under this part to the exclusion of another remedy.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(5): (2); (5)(a); (2); (5)(a) The commission may:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(5)(a): retain counsel for the purpose of collecting an amount the commission assesses against a person who is not a resident of this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(5)(b): (2); (5)(a) establish the compensation of an agent described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(5)(c): (2); (5)(a) require a bond or other security for an agent described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(6): (6)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(6)(a): The commission shall represent the state in a matter pertaining to the collection of a tax, fee, or charge.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(6)(b): The commission may institute a proceeding to enforce a judgment allowing for the collection of a liability in the district court of a county in which is located a portion of property against which collection is sought.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(6)(c): (6)(b) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(6)(c)(i): the attorney general; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(6)(c)(ii): a county attorney.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(7): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(7)(a): in addition to the methods of collecting a liability provided in this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(7)(b): that is consistent with this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(7)(c): that uses a return, warrant, or other reasonable document or method; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1403(7)(d): that is necessary in collecting a liability.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1404(1): As used in this section, "Section 7502, Internal Revenue Code" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1404(1)(a): Section 7502, Internal Revenue Code, in effect for the taxable year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1404(1)(b): a corresponding or comparable provision to Section 7502, Internal Revenue Code, as amended, redesignated, or reenacted.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1404(2): (3); (2)(a)(i); (2)(a)(ii); (3) If the commission or a person is required to mail a document under this part:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1404(2)(a): (3) the commission or the person shall mail the document using:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1404(2)(a)(i): the United States Postal Service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1404(2)(a)(ii): (3) a delivery service the commission describes or designates in accordance with any rules the commission makes as authorized by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1404(2)(b): (2)(a)(i); (2)(a)(ii); (3) the document is considered to be mailed:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1404(2)(b)(i): (2)(a)(i) for a document that is mailed using the method described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1404(2)(b)(ii): (2)(a)(ii); (3) for a document that is mailed using the method described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1404(3)(b): providing procedures or requirements for determining the date a delivery service records or marks a document as having been received by the delivery service for delivery if those rules are consistent with Section 7502, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-1-1404(4): (5) Subject to Subsection
