Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201 Assessment by commission -- Determination of value of mining property -- Determination of value of aircraft -- Notification of assessment -- Local assessment of property assessed by the unitary method -- Commission may consult with county.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1): Part 11, Exemptions; (2); (1)(a)(iii); (1)(b); (1)(b)(i)(B)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(a): Part 11, Exemptions; (2) By May 1 of each year, the following property, unless otherwise exempt under the Utah Constitution or under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(a)(i): (2) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(a)(ii): all property of public utilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(a)(iii): all operating property of an airline, air charter service, and air contract service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(a)(iv): all geothermal fluids and geothermal resources;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(a)(v): all mines and mining claims except in cases, as determined by the commission, where the mining claims are used for other than mining purposes, in which case the value of mining claims used for other than mining purposes shall be assessed by the assessor of the county in which the mining claims are located; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(a)(vi): all machinery used in mining, all property or surface improvements upon or appurtenant to mines or mining claims.  For the purposes of assessment and taxation, all processing plants, mills, reduction works, and smelters that are primarily used by the owner of a mine or mining claim for processing, reducing, or smelting minerals taken from a mine or mining claim shall be considered appurtenant to that mine or mining claim, regardless of actual location.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(b): (1)(a)(iii); (1)(b); (1)(b)(i)(B)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(b)(i): (1)(a)(iii) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(b)(i)(A): used by the air charter service for air charter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(b)(i)(B): owned by a person other than the air charter service.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(b)(ii): (1)(b); (1)(b)(i)(B) For purposes of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(b)(ii)(A): "person" means a natural person, individual, corporation, organization, or other legal entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(b)(ii)(B): (1)(b)(i)(B) a person does not qualify as a person other than the air charter service as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(b)(ii)(B)(I): a principal, owner, or member of the air charter service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(b)(ii)(B)(II): a legal entity that has a principal, owner, or member of the air charter service as a principal, owner, or member of the legal entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(2): 41-1a-222; 41-1a-228
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(2)(a): The commission may not assess property owned by a telecommunications service provider.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(2)(b): 41-1a-222; 41-1a-228 The commission shall assess and collect property tax on state-assessed commercial vehicles at the time of original registration or annual renewal.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(2)(b)(i): 41-1a-222; 41-1a-228 The commission shall assess and collect property tax annually on state-assessed commercial vehicles that are registered pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(2)(b)(ii): State-assessed commercial vehicles brought into the state that are required to be registered in Utah shall, as a condition of registration, be subject to ad valorem tax unless all property taxes or fees imposed by the state of origin have been paid for the current calendar year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(2)(b)(iii): Real property, improvements, equipment, fixtures, or other personal property in this state owned by the company shall be assessed separately by the local county assessor.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(2)(b)(iv): The commission shall adjust the value of state-assessed commercial vehicles as necessary to comply with 49 U.S.C. Sec. 14502, and the commission shall direct the county assessor to apply the same adjustment to any personal property, real property, or improvements owned by the company and used directly and exclusively in their commercial vehicle activities.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(3)(a): The method for determining the fair market value of productive mining property is the capitalized net revenue method or any other valuation method the commission believes, or the taxpayer demonstrates to the commission's satisfaction, to be reasonably determinative of the fair market value of the mining property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(3)(b): The commission shall determine the rate of capitalization applicable to mines, consistent with a fair rate of return expected by an investor in light of that industry's current market, financial, and economic conditions.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(3)(c): In no event may the fair market value of the mining property be less than the fair market value of the land, improvements, and tangible personal property upon or appurtenant to the mining property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4): (4); (4)(d); (4)(c); (4)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(a): (4) As used in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(a)(i): identified by year, make, and model; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(a)(ii): in average condition typical for the aircraft's type and vintage.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(b): (4)(d); (4)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(b)(i): (4)(d); (4)(c) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(b)(ii): The commission shall use the Airliner Price Guide as the aircraft pricing guide, except that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(b)(ii)(A): if the Airliner Price Guide is no longer published or the commission determines that another aircraft pricing guide more reasonably reflects the fair market value of aircraft, the commission, after consulting with the airlines operating in the state, shall select an alternative aircraft pricing guide;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(b)(ii)(B): if an aircraft is not listed in the Airliner Price Guide, the commission shall use the Aircraft Bluebook Price Digest as the aircraft pricing guide; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(b)(ii)(C): if the Aircraft Bluebook Price Digest is no longer published or the commission determines that another aircraft pricing guide more reasonably reflects the fair market value of aircraft, the commission, after consulting with the airlines operating in the state, shall select an alternative aircraft pricing guide.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(c): (4)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(c)(i): (4)(c) To reflect the value of an aircraft fleet that is used as part of the operating property of an airline, air charter service, or air contract service, the fair market value of the aircraft shall include a fleet adjustment as provided in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(c)(ii): If the aircraft pricing guide provides a method for making a fleet adjustment, the commission shall use the method described in the aircraft pricing guide.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(c)(iii): If the aircraft pricing guide does not provide a method for making a fleet adjustment, the commission shall make a fleet adjustment by reducing the aircraft pricing guide value of each aircraft in the fleet by .5% for each aircraft over three aircraft up to a maximum 20% reduction.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(d): The commission may use an alternative method for valuing aircraft of an airline, air charter service, or air contract service if the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(d)(i): has clear and convincing evidence that the aircraft values reflected in the aircraft pricing guide do not reasonably reflect fair market value of the aircraft; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(d)(ii): cannot identify an alternative aircraft pricing guide from which the commission may determine aircraft value.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(5): Immediately following the assessment, the commission shall send, by certified mail, notice of the assessment to the owner or operator of the assessed property and the assessor of the county in which the property is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(6): The commission may consult with a county in valuing property in accordance with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(7): The local county assessor shall separately assess property that is assessed by the unitary method if the commission determines that the property:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(7)(a): is not necessary to the conduct of the business; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(7)(b): does not contribute to the income of the business.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201 Assessment by commission -- Determination of value of mining property -- Determination of value of aircraft -- Notification of assessment -- Local assessment of property assessed by the unitary method -- Commission may consult with county.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(a): By May 1 of each year, the following property, unless otherwise exempt under the Utah Constitution or under Part 11, Exemptions, shall be assessed by the commission at 100% of fair market value, as valued on January 1, in accordance with this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(a)(i): except as provided in Subsection (2), all property that operates as a unit across county lines, if the values must be apportioned among more than one county or state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(a)(ii): all property of public utilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(a)(iii): subject to Subsection (1)(b), all mobile flight equipment of an airline, air charter service, and air contract service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(a)(iv): all geothermal fluids and geothermal resources;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(a)(v): all mines and mining claims except in cases, as determined by the commission, where the mining claims are used for other than mining purposes, in which case the value of mining claims used for other than mining purposes shall be assessed by the assessor of the county in which the mining claims are located; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(a)(vi): all machinery used in mining, all property or surface improvements upon or appurtenant to mines or mining claims.  For the purposes of assessment and taxation, all processing plants, mills, reduction works, and smelters that are primarily used by the owner of a mine or mining claim for processing, reducing, or smelting minerals taken from a mine or mining claim shall be considered appurtenant to that mine or mining claim, regardless of actual location.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(b)(i): For purposes of Subsection (1)(a)(iii), if the operating property of an airline, air charter service, or air contract service includes an aircraft, the commission shall assess the aircraft only if the aircraft operates under 14 C.F.R. Part 121, with a maximum takeoff weight exceeding 35,000 pounds.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(1)(b)(ii): Except as provided in Subsection (1)(a)(iii), property in the state owned by an airline, air charter service, or air contract service shall be assessed by the local county assessor.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(2): 41-1a-222; 41-1a-228
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(2)(a): The commission may not assess property owned by a telecommunications service provider.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(2)(b): 41-1a-222; 41-1a-228 The commission shall assess and collect property tax on state-assessed commercial vehicles at the time of original registration or annual renewal.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(2)(b)(i): 41-1a-222; 41-1a-228 The commission shall assess and collect property tax annually on state-assessed commercial vehicles that are registered pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(2)(b)(ii): State-assessed commercial vehicles brought into the state that are required to be registered in Utah shall, as a condition of registration, be subject to ad valorem tax unless all property taxes or fees imposed by the state of origin have been paid for the current calendar year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(2)(b)(iii): Real property, improvements, equipment, fixtures, or other personal property in this state owned by the company shall be assessed separately by the local county assessor.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(2)(b)(iv): The commission shall adjust the value of state-assessed commercial vehicles as necessary to comply with 49 U.S.C. Sec. 14502, and the commission shall direct the county assessor to apply the same adjustment to any personal property, real property, or improvements owned by the company and used directly and exclusively in their commercial vehicle activities.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(3)(a): The method for determining the fair market value of productive mining property is the capitalized net revenue method or any other valuation method the commission believes, or the taxpayer demonstrates to the commission's satisfaction, to be reasonably determinative of the fair market value of the mining property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(3)(b): The commission shall determine the rate of capitalization applicable to mines, consistent with a fair rate of return expected by an investor in light of that industry's current market, financial, and economic conditions.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(3)(c): In no event may the fair market value of the mining property be less than the fair market value of the land, improvements, and tangible personal property upon or appurtenant to the mining property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4): (4)(c)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(a): As used in this Subsection (4), "aircraft pricing guide" means a nationally recognized publication that assigns value estimates for individual commercial aircraft that are:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(a)(i): identified by year, make, and model; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(a)(ii): in average condition typical for the aircraft's type and vintage.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(b)(i): Except as provided in Subsection (4)(d), the commission shall use an aircraft pricing guide to determine the fair market value of aircraft assessed under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(b)(ii): The commission shall use the Airliner Price Guide as the aircraft pricing guide, except that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(b)(ii)(A): if the Airliner Price Guide is no longer published or the commission determines that another aircraft pricing guide more reasonably reflects the fair market value of aircraft, the commission, after consulting with the airlines operating in the state, shall select an alternative aircraft pricing guide;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(b)(ii)(B): if an aircraft is not listed in the Airliner Price Guide, the commission shall use the Aircraft Bluebook Price Digest as the aircraft pricing guide; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(b)(ii)(C): if the Aircraft Bluebook Price Digest is no longer published or the commission determines that another aircraft pricing guide more reasonably reflects the fair market value of aircraft, the commission, after consulting with the airlines operating in the state, shall select an alternative aircraft pricing guide.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(c): (4)(c)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(c)(i): (4)(c)(ii) The commission shall make a fleet adjustment in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(c)(ii): If the aircraft pricing guide provides for a fleet adjustment to determine the fair market value of the fleet of aircraft or the fleet of the same aircraft type, the commission shall make the fleet adjustment in the manner provided in the aircraft pricing guide.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(c)(iii): If the aircraft pricing guide does not provide for a fleet adjustment to determine the fair market value of the fleet of aircraft or the fleet of the same aircraft type, the commission shall make the adjustment the commission determines most reasonably reflects the fair market value of the fleet of aircraft or fleet of the same aircraft type.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(d): The commission may use an alternative method for valuing aircraft of an airline, air charter service, or air contract service if the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(d)(i): has clear and convincing evidence that the aircraft values reflected in the aircraft pricing guide do not reasonably reflect fair market value of the aircraft; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(4)(d)(ii): cannot identify an alternative aircraft pricing guide from which the commission may determine aircraft value.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(5): Immediately following the assessment, the commission shall send, by certified mail, notice of the assessment to the owner or operator of the assessed property and the assessor of the county in which the property is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(6): The commission may consult with a county in valuing property in accordance with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(7): The local county assessor shall separately assess property that is assessed by the unitary method if the commission determines that the property:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(7)(a): is not necessary to the conduct of the business; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-201(7)(b): does not contribute to the income of the business.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202 Statement of taxpayer -- Extension of time for filing -- Assessment without statement -- Penalty for failure to file statement or information -- Waiver, reduction, or compromise of penalty -- Appeals.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1): (1)(b); (1)(a); (1)(a); (1)(a); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(a): (1)(b) A person, or an officer or agent of that person, owning or operating property described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(a)(i): signed and sworn to by the person, officer, or agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(a)(ii): showing in detail all real property and tangible personal property located in the state that the person owns or operates;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(a)(iii): containing the number of miles of taxable tangible personal property in each county:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(a)(iii)(A): that the person owns or operates; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(a)(iii)(B): as valued on January 1 of the year for which the person, officer, or agent is furnishing the statement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(a)(iv): containing any other information the commission requires.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b): (1)(a) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(i): the following property located in the state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(i)(A): a public utility;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(i)(B): an airline;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(i)(C): an air charter service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(i)(D): an air contract service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(ii): the following property located in more than one county in the state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(ii)(A): a pipeline company;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(ii)(B): a power company;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(ii)(C): a canal company;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(ii)(D): an irrigation company; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(ii)(E): a telephone company.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(c): (1)(a); (1)(a); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(c)(i): (1)(a) The commission may allow an extension for filing the statement under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(c)(ii): (1)(a); (1)(a) The commission shall grant a person, or an officer or agent of that person, an extension for filing the statement under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(c)(ii)(A): (1)(a) a federal regulatory agency requires the taxpayer to file a statement that contains the same information as the statement under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(c)(ii)(B): the person, or an officer or agent of that person, requests the commission to grant the extension.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(2): (1)(b); (1)(a); (1)(c) The commission shall assess and list the property described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(2)(a): March 1; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(2)(b): (1)(c) if the commission allows an extension under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3): (3)(c); (3)(b); (1)(a); (1)(c); (3)(a); (3)(a); (4); (3)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(a): (3)(c); (3)(b); (1)(a); (1)(c) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(a)(i): (1)(a); (1)(c) the statement required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(a)(i)(A): March 1; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(a)(i)(B): (1)(c) if the commission allows an extension under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(a)(ii): any other information the commission determines to be necessary to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(a)(ii)(A): establish valuations for assessment purposes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(a)(ii)(B): apportion an assessment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(b): (3)(a) The penalty described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(b)(i): 10% of the person's estimated tax liability under this chapter for the current calendar year not to exceed $50,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(b)(ii): $100.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(c): (3)(a); (4); (3)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(c)(i): (3)(a); (4) Notwithstanding Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(c)(ii): (3)(c)(i) If the commission waives, reduces, or compromises a penalty under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(4): (3); 59-2-1308 The county treasurer shall collect the penalty imposed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(5): (3); Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act A person subject to a penalty under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202 Statement of taxpayer -- Extension of time for filing -- Assessment without statement -- Penalty for failure to file statement or information -- Waiver, reduction, or compromise of penalty -- Appeals.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(a): A person, or an officer or agent of that person, owning or operating property described in Subsection (1)(b) shall, on or before March 1 of each year, file with the commission a statement:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(a)(i): signed and sworn to by the person, officer, or agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(a)(ii): showing in detail all real property and tangible personal property located in the state that the person owns or operates;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(a)(iii): containing the number of miles of taxable tangible personal property in each county:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(a)(iii)(A): that the person owns or operates; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(a)(iii)(B): as valued on January 1 of the year for which the person, officer, or agent is furnishing the statement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(a)(iv): containing any other information the commission requires.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b): Subsection (1)(a) applies to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(i): the following property located in the state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(i)(A): a public utility;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(i)(B): mobile flight equipment of an airline;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(i)(C): mobile flight equipment of an air charter service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(i)(D): mobile flight equipment of an air contract service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(ii): the following property located in more than one county in the state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(ii)(A): a pipeline company;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(ii)(B): a power company;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(ii)(C): a canal company;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(ii)(D): an irrigation company; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(b)(ii)(E): a telephone company.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(c)(i): The commission may allow an extension for filing the statement under Subsection (1)(a) for a time period not exceeding 30 days, unless the commission determines that extraordinary circumstances require a longer period of extension.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(c)(ii): The commission shall grant a person, or an officer or agent of that person, an extension for filing the statement under Subsection (1)(a) for a time period not exceeding 15 days if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(c)(ii)(A): a federal regulatory agency requires the taxpayer to file a statement that contains the same information as the statement under Subsection (1)(a); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(1)(c)(ii)(B): the person, or an officer or agent of that person, requests the commission to grant the extension.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(2): The commission shall assess and list the property described in Subsection (1)(b) using the best information obtainable by the commission if a person, or an officer or agent of that person, fails to file the statement required under Subsection (1)(a) on or before the later of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(2)(a): March 1; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(2)(b): if the commission allows an extension under Subsection (1)(c) for filing the statement, the day after the last day of the extension period.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (3)(c), the commission shall assess a person a penalty as provided in Subsection (3)(b), if the person, or an officer or agent of that person, fails to file:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(a)(i): the statement required under Subsection (1)(a) on or before the later of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(a)(i)(A): March 1; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(a)(i)(B): if the commission allows an extension under Subsection (1)(c) for filing the statement, the day after the last day of the extension period; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(a)(ii): any other information the commission determines to be necessary to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(a)(ii)(A): establish valuations for assessment purposes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(a)(ii)(B): apportion an assessment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(b): The penalty described in Subsection (3)(a) is an amount equal to the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(b)(i): 10% of the person's estimated tax liability under this chapter for the current calendar year not to exceed $50,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(b)(ii): $100.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(c)(i): Notwithstanding Subsections (3)(a) and (4), the commission may waive, reduce, or compromise a penalty imposed under this section if the commission finds there are reasonable grounds for the waiver, reduction, or compromise.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(3)(c)(ii): If the commission waives, reduces, or compromises a penalty under Subsection (3)(c)(i), the commission shall make a record of the grounds for waiving, reducing, or compromising the penalty.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(4): 59-2-1308 The county treasurer shall collect the penalty imposed under Subsection (3) as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-202(5): A person subject to a penalty under Subsection (3) may appeal the penalty according to procedures and requirements of Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-203 Record of assessment of railroads and other companies -- Review by county assessor.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-203(1): Each year the commission shall prepare a record of assessment of railroads and rail car companies.  The record shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-203(1)(a): the name of the person to whom the property was assessed;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-203(1)(b): the number of miles in the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-203(1)(c): the number of miles in each county;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-203(1)(d): the total assessment of that property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-203(1)(e): the amount of the apportionment of the total assessment to each county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-203(2): At least quarterly, the commission shall prepare a record of assessment of state-assessed commercial vehicles.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-203(3): The record of the assessment and the information upon which the assessments and apportionments are made are available for review upon request by a county assessor.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204 Record of assessment of public utility and air travel companies -- Review by county assessor.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(1): Each year, the commission shall prepare a record of assessment of the following companies:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(1)(a): public utility companies;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(1)(b): airlines;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(1)(c): air charter services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(1)(d): air contract services.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(2): (1); (1); (1) The record of assessment under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(2)(a): (1) the name of each person engaged in business within the state in a company described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(2)(b): (1) for each company described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(2)(c): any other information as determined by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(3): (1) At the request of a county assessor, the commission shall provide to the county assessor:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(3)(a): (1) the record of assessment described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(3)(b): the information upon which the assessments and apportionments contained in the record of assessment are made.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204 Record of assessment of public utility and air travel companies -- Review by county assessor.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(1): Each year, the commission shall prepare a record of assessment of the following companies:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(1)(a): public utility companies;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(1)(b): airlines;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(1)(c): air charter services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(1)(d): air contract services.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(2): The record of assessment under Subsection (1) shall include:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(2)(b): for each company described in Subsection (1), the total value of all of the company's tangible properties subject to assessment by the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(2)(c): any other information as determined by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(3): At the request of a county assessor, the commission shall provide to the county assessor:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(3)(a): the record of assessment described in Subsection (1); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-204(3)(b): the information upon which the assessments and apportionments contained in the record of assessment are made.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-205 Record of assessment of mines -- Review by county assessor.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-205(1): Each year the commission shall prepare a record of assessment of mines.  The record shall include the following information for all mines subject to assessment by the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-205(1)(a): the owner of the mine;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-205(1)(b): the name and description and location of the mine;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-205(1)(c): the county in which the mine is located;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-205(1)(d): the value of the mine;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-205(1)(e): the value of the machinery;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-205(1)(f): the value of supplies and other personal property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-205(1)(g): the value of improvements; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-205(1)(h): the value of machinery, property, and surface improvements having a value separate and independent of the mines or mining claims assessed by the commission, and the names of the owners of the machinery, property, or surface improvements, together with any other information determined by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-205(2): The record of the assessment and the information upon which the assessments and apportionments are calculated are available for review upon request by a county assessor.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-208 Duties of commission and county auditors relative to mines.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The duties of the commission and county auditors relative to:Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-208(1): the assessment of mines, mining claims, and mining property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-208(2): the statements and returns to be made; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-208(3): the equalization thereof are the same as those provided for the assessment of public utilities.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-209 Assessment of improvements, machinery, or structures placed on mines.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Nothing in this chapter may be construed to exempt from taxation any supplies used in mills, reduction works, or mines, or any improvements, machinery, or other property placed upon or used in connection with a mine or mining claim, which has a value separate and independent of the mine or mining claim.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-210 Collection and enforcement of tax on mines -- Lien -- Tax liability of owners of fractional interests -- Duties of unit operators -- Penalties.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-210(1): (3) The tax mentioned in the preceding sections on mines, mining claims, and mining property shall be collected, and payment enforced, in the manner provided for the collection and enforcement of other taxes, except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-210(2): Every tax is a lien upon the mine or mining claim and related mining machinery and improvements.  The lien attaches on January 1.  Sale of property for delinquent taxes may be made as provided for the sale of real estate for delinquent taxes, except as set forth below.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-210(3): 59-2-201; 59-2-207
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-210(3)(a): If oil, gas, or other hydrocarbon wells or fields belonging to multiple owners are operated as a unit, the owner of each fractional interest in the unit is liable for the same proportion of the tax assessed against the total unit that the owner's interest bears to the total interest in the unit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-210(3)(b): 59-2-201; 59-2-207 The unit operator shall be notified of the assessment against the entire unit as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-210(3)(c): The unit operator may, in a manner provided by the commission, deduct and withhold from royalty payments, or from any other payments due to any fractional interest owner, the amount of the tax owed by the fractional interest owner.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-210(3)(d): If the unit operator fails to collect the applicable tax from the fractional interest owners and remit the tax as provided, a penalty shall be imposed against the operator by the county treasurer of the county in which the unit is located.  The penalty is equal to the amount of the tax due and owing the county for the tax period in question from that unit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-210(3)(e): Failure of the unit operator to collect and remit the tax does not preclude tax authorities from utilizing regular collection and enforcement remedies and procedures against the owner of any fractional interest to collect the tax owed by the owner.  A nonoperating owner is not subject to penalty or interest upon the tax owed unless the owner fails to remit the tax within 20 days after notification by the county treasurer of the default of the operator.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-210(3)(f): As used in this section, "unit" means any single oil, gas, or other hydrocarbon well or field which has multiple ownership, or any combination of oil, gas, or other hydrocarbon wells, fields, and properties consolidated into a single operation, whether by a formal agreement or otherwise.  "Owner" means the holder of any interest or interests in those properties or units, including royalty interests.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-211 Security for tax on uranium and vanadium mining properties.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-211(1): The commission, in order to ensure the payment and collection of an ad valorem property tax imposed against uranium and vanadium mining properties, may require the owner or the person engaged in mining the properties to deposit a security with the commission in an amount determined by the commission.  The security shall be deposited with the commission within 30 days of proper notice by the commission that the security is required.  Notice by registered mail to the last-known address as shown in the records of the commission constitutes proper notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-211(2): The security may be sold by the commission at public sale in order to recover any tax, interest, or penalty due.  Notice of the sale may be personally served upon the person who deposited the securities, or served by registered mail sent to the last-known address as shown in the records of the commission.  Following the sale, any surplus amount shall be returned to the person who deposited the security.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-211(3): If the security is not deposited on or before the due date, the commission may declare the tax for that year and any preceding year, if unpaid, in jeopardy, and may proceed to collect the tax under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-211(4): Part 13, Collection of Taxes Following recourse to the security by the commission, or to jeopardy proceedings under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-211(5): Part 13, Collection of Taxes The ad valorem tax imposed upon metalliferous mining claims and properties is a personal obligation of the owner or operator of the affected claims or properties, and the obligations are not satisfied until paid in full.  If a mining claim or property is sold at the tax sale under


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-213 Duty to furnish assessment roll to counties.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-213(1): The commission shall prepare and furnish to each county an assessment roll in which the county assessor of each county shall list all property within the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-213(2): (1) In counties using computerized listings, the county assessor shall furnish the information required under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-214 Commission to furnish forms for taxpayers' statements.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I, ____, do swear that I am a resident of the county of ____, and that my post office address is ____; that the above list contains a full and correct statement of all property subject to taxation, which I, or any firm of which I am a member, or any corporation, association, or company of which I am president, cashier, secretary, or managing agent, owned, claimed, possessed, or controlled at 12 o'clock midnight on the preceding January 1 and which is not already assessed this year.Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-214(1): 59-2-306 The commission shall furnish the assessor of each county with blank forms of statements provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-214(2): The signed statement made on behalf of a firm or corporation shall state the principal place of business of the firm or corporation, and in other respects shall conform substantially to the preceding form.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-215 Chief executive officer of state agency to furnish lists of sold lands.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
On or before January 15 of each year the chief executive officer of any agency of the state shall make and transmit to the commission certified lists of lands sold by the state for which certificates of purchase or patents have been issued during the preceding year, giving a description by divisions or subdivisions or lots and blocks, together with the names of the purchasers or patentees, and in the case of lands sold by the state upon contract the amount of the purchase price and the total amount paid or due on the preceding January 1.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-216 Commission to furnish list of patented lands to county assessors.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission shall furnish the county assessors, annually, by February 1:Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-216(1): a list of all patents of lands, except patents for mining locations, and all lands for which receivers' final receipts have been issued for which patents have not been issued, not previously reported;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-216(2): a certified list of all lands that have been sold by the state for which certificates of purchase or patents have been issued during the preceding year, with a description, together with the names of the purchasers or patentees; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-216(3): a list containing a description of the lands sold by the state during the preceding year upon contracts for purchase, together with the names and addresses of the purchasers where known, the amount of the purchase price, and the total amount paid or due on the preceding January 1.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-217 Property escaping assessment -- Duties of assessing authority -- Property willfully concealed -- Penalties.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-217(1): Part 13, Collection of Taxes Any escaped property may be assessed by the original assessing authority at any time as far back as five years prior to the time of discovery, in which case the assessing authority shall enter the assessments on the tax rolls and follow the procedures established under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-217(2): Any property found to be willfully concealed, removed, transferred, or misrepresented by its owner or agent in order to evade taxation is subject to a penalty equal to the tax on its value, and neither the penalty nor assessment may be reduced by the county board of equalization or the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301 Assessment by county assessor.
-------------------------------------------------------------
The county assessor shall assess all property located within the county which is not required by law to be assessed by the commission.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1 Assessment of property subject to a conservation easement -- Assessment of golf course or hunting club -- Assessment of common areas.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(1): In assessing the fair market value of property subject to a conservation easement under Title 57, Chapter 18, Land Conservation Easement Act, a county assessor shall consider factors relating to the property and neighboring property that affect the fair market value of the property being assessed, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(1)(a): value that transfers to neighboring property because of the presence of a conservation easement on the property being assessed;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(1)(b): practical and legal restrictions on the development potential of the property because of the presence of the conservation easement;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(1)(c): the absence of neighboring property similarly subject to a conservation easement to provide a basis for comparing values between properties; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(1)(d): any other factor that causes the fair market value of the property to be affected because of the presence of a conservation easement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(2)(a): In assessing the fair market value of a golf course or hunting club, a county assessor shall consider factors relating to the golf course or hunting club and neighboring property that affect the fair market value of the golf course or hunting club, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(2)(a)(i): value that transfers to neighboring property because of the presence of the golf course or hunting club;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(2)(a)(ii): practical and legal restrictions on the development potential of the golf course or hunting club; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(2)(a)(iii): the history of operation of the golf course or hunting club and the likelihood that the present use will continue into the future.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(2)(b): The valuation method a county assessor may use in determining the fair market value of a golf course or hunting club includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(2)(b)(i): the cost approach;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(2)(b)(ii): the income capitalization approach; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(2)(b)(iii): the sales comparison approach.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(3): 57-8-3; 57-8a-102; 10-9a-606; 17-27a-606 Except as otherwise provided by the plat or accompanying recorded document, a county assessor shall assess a common area and facility as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(4): In assessing the fair market value of property that is a common area or facility under Title 57, Chapter 8, Condominium Ownership Act, or a common area under Title 57, Chapter 8a, Community Association Act, a county assessor shall consider factors relating to the property and neighboring property that affect the fair market value of the property being assessed, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(4)(a): value that transfers to neighboring property because the property is a common area or facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(4)(b): practical and legal restrictions on the development potential of the property because the property is a common area or facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(4)(c): the absence of neighboring property similarly situated as a common area or facility to provide a basis for comparing values between properties; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.1(4)(d): any other factor that causes the fair market value of the property to be affected because the property is a common area or facility.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.2 Definitions -- Assessment of property subject to a minimum parcel size -- Other factors affecting fair market value.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.2(1): Title 17, Chapter 27a, Part 5, Land Use Regulations; Title 10, Chapter 9a, Part 5, Land Use Regulations "Minimum parcel size" means the minimum size that a parcel of property may be divided into under a zoning ordinance adopted by a:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.2(1)(a): Title 17, Chapter 27a, Part 5, Land Use Regulations county in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.2(1)(b): Title 10, Chapter 9a, Part 5, Land Use Regulations city or town in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.2(2): (2)(a) In assessing the fair market value of a parcel of property that is subject to a minimum parcel size of one acre or more, a county assessor shall include as part of the assessment:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.2(2)(a): that the parcel of property may not be subdivided into parcels of property smaller than the minimum parcel size; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.2(2)(b): (2)(a) any effects Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.2(3): This section does not prohibit a county assessor from including as part of an assessment of the fair market value of a parcel of property any other factor affecting the fair market value of the parcel of property.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3 Definitions -- Assessment of real property subject to a low-income housing covenant.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(1): (1)(b)(i)(B) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(1)(a): "Lease up period" means the period that begins the day on which residential housing located on real property subject to a low-income housing covenant is available for occupancy and ends the day on which the residential housing achieves 90% occupancy for a continuous three-month period.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(1)(b): (1)(b)(i)(B) "Low-income housing covenant" means an agreement:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(1)(b)(i): between:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(1)(b)(i)(A): the Utah Housing Corporation or a government entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(1)(b)(i)(B): an owner of real property upon which residential rental housing is located;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(1)(b)(ii): (1)(b)(i)(B) in which the owner described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(1)(b)(iii): that is filed with the county recorder in the county in which the real property is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(1)(c): "Residential rental housing" means housing that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(1)(c)(i): is used:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(1)(c)(i)(A): for residential purposes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(1)(c)(i)(B): as a primary residence; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(1)(c)(ii): is rental property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(2): (3); (2)(b)(ii); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(2)(a): (3) A county assessor shall, in determining the fair market value of real property subject to a low-income housing covenant:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(2)(a)(i): use the income capitalization approach, if the county assessor finds that the income capitalization approach is a valid indicator of the property's fair market value;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(2)(a)(ii): in using the income capitalization approach:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(2)(a)(ii)(A): calculate the property's net operating income using the reduced rent amounts that result from the low-income housing covenant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(2)(a)(ii)(B): during the lease up period, account for rent loss due to vacancy and lease up costs; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(2)(a)(iii): (3) take into account all other relevant factors that affect the fair market value of the property, including the information provided in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(2)(b): (2)(b)(ii); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(2)(b)(i): (2)(b)(ii); (2)(a) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(2)(b)(ii): For a property under construction, when determining fair market value under this section, the county assessor shall take into account the impact of the low-income housing covenant on the fair market value of the property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(3): (3)(a); (3)(a)(ii); (iii); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(3)(a): On or before April 30 of each year, an owner of real property subject to a low-income housing covenant shall provide to the county assessor the following on a form approved by the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(3)(a)(i): a signed statement from the property owner that the project continues to meet the requirements of the low-income housing covenant;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(3)(a)(ii): a certified financial operating statement for the property for the prior year;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(3)(a)(iii): rent rolls for the property for the prior year;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(3)(a)(iv): federal and commercial financing terms and agreements for the property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(3)(a)(v): for a property under construction, actual construction costs incurred as of the lien date.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(3)(b): (3)(a); (3)(a)(ii); (iii) If the April 30 described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(3)(c): (3)(a) On or before March 31 each year, the county assessor shall send a copy of the form described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(4): (3); (3); (2); (5) If an owner of real property subject to a low-income housing covenant fails to meet the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(4)(a): (3); (2) the assessor shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.3(4)(a)(i): (3) make a record of the failure to meet the requirements of Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4 Definition -- Assessment of property after a reduction in value -- Other factors affecting fair market value -- County legislative body authority to reduce value or issue a refund after a valuation reduction.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(1): As used in this section, "valuation reduction" means a reduction in the value of property on appeal if that reduction was made:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(1)(a): within the three years before the January 1 of the year in which the property is being assessed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(1)(b): by a:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(1)(b)(i): county board of equalization in a final decision;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(1)(b)(ii): the commission in a final unappealable administrative order; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(1)(b)(iii): a court of competent jurisdiction in a final unappealable judgment or order.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(2): In assessing the fair market value of property subject to a valuation reduction, a county assessor shall consider in the assessor's determination of fair market value:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(2)(a): any additional information about the property that was previously unknown or unaccounted for by the assessor that is made known on appeal; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(2)(b): whether the reasons for the valuation reduction continue to influence the fair market value of the property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(3): This section does not prohibit a county assessor from including as part of a determination of the fair market value of property any other factor affecting the fair market value of the property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(4): (4); (4)(a)(ii); (4)(a); 59-2-1004; 59-2-1006; (4)(b)(i); (4)(a); (4)(b)(i); (4)(a); (4)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(4)(a): (4); (4)(a)(ii) Subject to the other provisions of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(4)(a)(i): a county board of equalization, the commission, or a court of competent jurisdiction makes a valuation reduction with respect to the property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(4)(a)(ii): the property is assessed in the next calendar year at a value that is at least five times greater than the value established at the time of the valuation reduction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(4)(a)(iii): (4)(a)(ii) the county legislative body determines that the assessed value described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(4)(b): (4)(a); 59-2-1004; 59-2-1006; (4)(b)(i) A county legislative body may make a reduction or refund under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(4)(b)(i): applies to the county legislative body; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(4)(b)(ii): 59-2-1004; 59-2-1006; (4)(b)(i) has not filed an appeal with the county board of equalization under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(4)(c): (4)(a); (4)(b)(i) A reduction described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(4)(c)(i): (4)(b)(i) may be made if the property taxes have not been paid for the calendar year for which an owner applies to the county legislative body under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(4)(c)(ii): is in an amount to ensure that the property is assessed at fair market value.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(4)(d): (4)(a); (4)(b)(i) A refund described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(4)(d)(i): (4)(b)(i) may be made if the property taxes have been paid for the calendar year for which an owner applies to the county legislative body under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.4(4)(d)(ii): is in an amount to ensure that the property is taxed at a uniform and equal rate on the basis of its fair market value.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.5 Definitions -- Assessment of property if threatened or endangered species is present.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.5(1): 23A-1-101; 23A-1-101 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.5(1)(a): 23A-1-101 "Endangered" is as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.5(1)(b): 23A-1-101 "Threatened" is as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.5(2): In assessing the fair market value of property, a county assessor shall consider as part of the determination of fair market value whether a threatened or endangered species is present on any portion of the property, including any impacts the presence of the threatened or endangered species has on:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.5(2)(a): the functionality of the property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.5(2)(b): the ability to use the property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.5(2)(c): property rights.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.5(3): This section does not prohibit a county assessor from including as part of a determination of the fair market value of property any other factor affecting the fair market value of the property.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.6 Definition -- Assessment of property having a diminished productive value.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.6(1): Title 10, Chapter 9a, Part 5, Land Use Regulations; Title 17, Chapter 27a, Part 5, Land Use Regulations As used in this section, "diminished productive value" means that property has no, or a significantly reduced, ability to generate income as a result of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.6(1)(a): Title 10, Chapter 9a, Part 5, Land Use Regulations; Title 17, Chapter 27a, Part 5, Land Use Regulations a parcel size requirement established under a land use ordinance or zoning map adopted by a:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.6(1)(a)(i): Title 10, Chapter 9a, Part 5, Land Use Regulations city or town in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.6(1)(a)(ii): Title 17, Chapter 27a, Part 5, Land Use Regulations a county in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.6(1)(b): one or more easements burdening the property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.6(2): In assessing the fair market value of property, a county assessor shall consider as part of the determination of fair market value whether property has diminished productive value.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.6(3): This section does not prohibit a county assessor from including as part of a determination of the fair market value of property any other factor affecting the fair market value of the property.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.7(1)(b)(i): "Radioactive waste" means:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.7(1)(b)(i)(B): high-level radioactive waste as defined in 42 U.S.C. Sec. 10101.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.7(2): (3) Subject to Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8 Assessment of multi-tenant residential property.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(1): 59-2-103 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(1)(a): 59-2-103 "Multi-tenant residential property" means real and personal property where:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(1)(a)(i): 59-2-103 the real property:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(1)(a)(i)(A): is rented as 10 or more separate housing units;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(1)(a)(i)(B): meets the definition of residential property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(1)(a)(i)(C): 59-2-103 qualifies for the residential exemption described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(1)(a)(ii): the personal property is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(1)(a)(ii)(A): located within the real property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(1)(a)(ii)(B): owned by the same person as the real property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(1)(b): "Multi-tenant residential property" does not include a tourist home, a hotel, a motel, or a trailer court accommodation and service that is regularly rented for fewer than 30 consecutive days.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(2)(a): A county assessor may use an income approach to value multi-tenant residential properties within the county if the county assessor finds that the income approach is a valid indicator of fair market value for the multi-tenant residential property in the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(2)(b): A county assessor that chooses to value a multi-tenant residential property in accordance with this section shall use the same valuation method for all multi-tenant residential properties within the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(2)(c): On or before May 1, a county assessor shall notify the commission about the county's method for valuing multi-tenant residential properties if the county assessor:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(2)(c)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(2)(c)(i)(A): chooses to value multi-tenant residential properties in accordance with this section for the current tax year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(2)(c)(i)(B): did not choose to value multi-tenant residential properties in accordance with this section for the previous tax year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(2)(c)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(2)(c)(ii)(A): chose to value multi-tenant residential properties in accordance with this section for the previous tax year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(2)(c)(ii)(B): is not choosing to value multi-tenant residential properties in accordance with this section for the current tax year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(3): 59-2-306; 59-2-306; (3)(a); 59-2-306

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(3)(b): 59-2-306; (3)(a); 59-2-306 On or before May 1:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(3)(b)(i): 59-2-306; (3)(a) a county assessor that chooses to value multi-tenant residential properties in accordance with this section shall notify an owner that the owner is not required to file a signed statement if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-301.8(3)(b)(i)(A): 59-2-306 the county requests a signed statement under Section
