Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-509 Change of ownership or legal description.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-509(1): Subject to the other provisions of this section, land assessed under this part may continue to be assessed under this part if the land continues to comply with the requirements of this part, regardless of whether the land continues to have:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-509(1)(a): the same owner; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-509(1)(b): legal description.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-509(2): (1); (1); 59-2-506 Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-509(3): (1); (3)(a); 59-2-503; 59-2-508 Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-509(3)(a): there is a change in:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-509(3)(a)(i): the ownership of the land; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-509(3)(a)(ii): the legal description of the land; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-509(3)(b): (3)(a); 59-2-503; 59-2-508 after a change described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-509(3)(b)(i): 59-2-503 the land does not meet the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-509(3)(b)(ii): 59-2-508 an owner of the land fails to submit a new application for assessment as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-509(4): (3)(a) An application required by this section shall be submitted within 120 days after the day on which there is a change described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-510 Separation of land.
--------------------------------------------------
Separation of a part of the land which is being valued, assessed, and taxed under this part, either by conveyance or other action of the owner of the land, for a use other than agricultural, subjects the land which is separated to liability for the applicable rollback tax, but does not impair the continuance of agricultural use valuation, assessment, and taxation for the remaining land if it continues to meet the requirements of this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511 Acquisition of land by governmental entity -- Requirements -- Rollback tax -- One-time in lieu fee payment -- Passage of title.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(1): For purposes of this section, "governmental entity" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(1)(a): the United States;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(1)(b): the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(1)(c): a political subdivision of the state, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(1)(c)(i): a county;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(1)(c)(ii): a city;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(1)(c)(iii): a town;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(1)(c)(iv): a school district;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(1)(c)(v): a special district; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(1)(c)(vi): a special service district; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(1)(d): an entity created by the state or the United States, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(1)(d)(i): an agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(1)(d)(ii): a board;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(1)(d)(iii): a bureau;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(1)(d)(iv): a commission;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(1)(d)(ix): an instrumentality; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(1)(d)(x): an office.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(3)(b)(ii)(A): to the county treasurer of the county in which the land is located; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(3)(b)(ii)(B): 59-2-503; 59-2-506; 59-2-506
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(3)(b)(ii)(B)(I): 59-2-503; 59-2-506 if the land remaining after the acquisition by the governmental entity meets the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(3)(b)(ii)(B)(II): 59-2-506 if the land remaining after the acquisition by the governmental entity is less than five acres, in an amount equal to the rollback tax under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(3)(b)(iii): For purposes of Subsection (3)(b)(ii), "land remaining after the acquisition by the governmental entity" includes other eligible acreage that is used in conjunction with the land remaining after the acquisition by the governmental entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(3)(c): 4-46-102 A county receiving an in lieu fee payment under Subsection (3)(b) shall distribute the revenues generated by the payment as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(3)(c)(i): 4-46-102 20% to the county for use for open land and working agricultural land as those terms are defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(3)(c)(ii): 80% to the taxing entities in which the land is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(4): 59-2-506.5; 59-2-506.5 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(4)(a): the land is not subject to the rollback tax imposed by this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(4)(b): the governmental entity acquiring the land is not required to make an in lieu fee payment under Subsection (3)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(5): 59-2-506
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(5)(a): This Subsection (5) applies only to a governmental entity that is the state or a political subdivision of the state as described in Subsections (1)(b) and (c).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(5)(b): Land acquired by a governmental entity described in Subsection (5)(a) is not subject to the rollback tax imposed by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(5)(c): 59-2-506 Notwithstanding Subsection (5)(b), a governmental entity described in Subsection (5)(a) may not, within five years after the day on which the governmental entity acquires land, sell the land to a private entity unless the governmental entity makes a one-time in lieu fee payment:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(5)(c)(i): to the county treasurer of the county in which the land is located;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(5)(c)(ii): 59-2-506 in an amount equal to the rollback tax under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(5)(c)(iii): before selling the land to the private entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(6): If a governmental entity acquires land subject to assessment under this part, title to the land may not pass to the governmental entity until the following are paid to the county treasurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(6)(a): any tax due under this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(6)(b): any one-time in lieu fee payment due under this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-511(6)(c): any interest due under this part.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-512 Land located in more than one county.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-512(1): If contiguous land in agricultural use in one ownership is located in more than one county, compliance with this part:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-512(1)(a): shall be determined on the basis of the total area and production of the contiguous land; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-512(1)(b): is not determined on the basis of the area or production of land that is located in one particular county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-512(2): If land in agricultural use in one ownership is located in more than one county but the land is not contiguous across county lines, compliance with the requirements of this part shall be determined on the basis of the total area and production of the land in each county.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-513 Tax list and duplicate.
------------------------------------------------------
The factual details to be shown on the assessor's tax list and duplicate with respect to land which is being valued, assessed, and taxed under this part are the same as those set forth by the assessor with respect to other taxable property in the county.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-514 State Farmland Evaluation Advisory Committee -- Membership -- Duties.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-514(1): There is created a State Farmland Evaluation Advisory Committee consisting of five members appointed as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-514(1)(a): one member appointed by the commission who shall be chairman of the committee;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-514(1)(b): one member appointed by the president of Utah State University;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-514(1)(c): one member appointed by the state Department of Agriculture and Food;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-514(1)(d): one member appointed by the state County Assessors' Association; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-514(1)(e): one member actively engaged in farming or ranching appointed by the other members of the committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-514(2): The committee shall meet at the call of the chairman to review the several classifications of land in agricultural use in the various areas of the state and recommend a range of values for each of the classifications based upon productive capabilities of the land when devoted to agricultural uses.  The recommendations shall be submitted to the commission prior to October 2 of each year.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-515 Rules prescribed by commission.
--------------------------------------------------------------
The commission may promulgate rules and prescribe forms necessary to effectuate the purposes of this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-516 Appeal to the county board of equalization.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Notwithstanding SectionUtah Code Annotated § 59-2-516(1): the county assessor makes a determination under this part; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-516(2): the county assessor's failure to make a determination results in the owner's request being considered denied under this part.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-516 Appeal to the county board of equalization.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-516(1): 59-2-1004 Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-516(1)(a): the county assessor makes a determination under this part; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-516(1)(b): the county assessor's failure to make a determination results in the owner's request being considered denied under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-516(2): Notwithstanding Subsection (1), the commission shall, in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, make rules establishing circumstances under which an appeal may be filed with the county board of equalization no later than 60 days after the deadline for an appeal described in Subsection (1).

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-701(2): 61-2g-311(1); (2); 61-2g-312 The limitations on appraisal authority under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-701(3): The commission may prescribe additional requirements for any person performing an appraisal for purposes of establishing fair market value for the assessment roll.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-701(5): 17-17-1 In accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-702 Education and training of appraisers -- Continuing education for appraisers and county assessors.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-702(1): 59-2-701 The commission shall conduct, at its own expense, a program of education and training of appraisal personnel preparatory to the examination of applicants for appraisers' and assessors' certification or licensure required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-702(2): To ensure that the assessment of property will be performed in a professional manner by competent personnel, meeting specified professional qualifications, the commission shall conduct a continuing program of in-service education and training for county assessors and property appraisers in the principles and practices of assessment and appraisal of property.  For this purpose the commission may cooperate with educational institutions, local, regional, state, or national assessors' organizations, and with other appropriate professional organizations.  The commission may reimburse the participation expenses incurred by assessors and other employees of the state or its subdivisions whose attendance at in-service training programs is approved by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-702(3): Title 63G, Chapter 22, State Training and Certification Requirements The commission shall ensure that any training or continuing education required under this section complies with


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-702.5 Education and training for county assessors.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-702.5(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-702.5(1)(a): The commission shall conduct a program of education and training for county assessors that offers instruction on:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-702.5(1)(a)(i): a county assessor's statutory obligations; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-702.5(1)(a)(ii): the practical application of mass appraisal techniques to satisfy a county assessor's statutory obligations.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-702.5(1)(b): The commission shall confer a designation of completion upon a county assessor each time that the county assessor completes the program under Subsection (1)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-702.5(2): 59-2-303.1
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-702.5(2)(a): A county assessor shall obtain a designation of completion under Subsection (1)(b) within 12 months after the day on which the county assessor starts a term of office.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-702.5(2)(b): 59-2-303.1 If a county assessor fails to obtain a designation of completion, the commission shall take corrective action, as defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-703 Commission to assist county assessors -- Appraisers provided upon request -- Costs of services -- Contingency fee arrangements prohibited.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-703(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-703(1)(a): The commission shall, upon request and pursuant to mutual agreement, provide county assessors with technical assistance and appraisal aid.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-703(1)(b): The commission shall provide certified or licensed appraisers who, upon request of the county assessor and pursuant to mutual agreement, shall perform appraisals of property and other technical services as needed by the county assessor.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-703(1)(c): The commission shall calculate the costs of these services based on the number of days of services rendered.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-703(1)(d): Each county shall pay to the commission 50% of the cost of the services that the county receives.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-703(2): 59-2-303.1
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-703(2)(a): Both the commission and counties may contract with a private firm or an individual to conduct appraisals.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-703(2)(b): 59-2-303.1 A county assessor may request the private firm or individual conducting appraisals to assist the county assessor in meeting the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-703(2)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-703(2)(c)(i): Notwithstanding Title 63G, Chapter 2, Government Records Access and Management Act, the commission and counties may disclose the name of the taxpayer and the taxpayer's address to the contract appraiser.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-703(2)(c)(ii): A private appraiser is subject to the confidentiality requirements and penalty provisions provided in Title 63G, Chapter 2, Part 8, Remedies.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-703(2)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-703(2)(d)(i): Neither the commission nor a county may contract with a private firm or an individual under a contingency fee arrangement to assess property or prosecute or defend an appeal.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-703(2)(d)(ii): An appraisal that has been prepared on a contingency fee basis may not be allowed in any proceeding before a county board of equalization or the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-704 Assessment studies -- Sharing of data -- Factoring assessment rates -- Corrective action.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-704(1): Each year, to assist in the evaluation of appraisal performance of taxable real property, the commission shall conduct and publish studies to determine the relationship between the market value shown on the assessment roll and the market value of real property in each county. The studies shall include measurements of uniformity within counties and use statistical methods established by the commission. County assessors may provide sales information to the commission for purposes of the studies.  The commission shall make the sales and appraisal information related to the studies available to the assessors upon request.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-704(2): 59-2-103 The commission shall, each year, order each county to adjust or factor its assessment rates using the most current studies so that the assessment rate in each county is in accordance with that prescribed in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-704(3): (1) If the commission determines that sales data in any county is insufficient to perform the studies required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-704(4): (2) If a county fails to implement factoring or corrective action ordered under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-704(4)(a): implement the factoring or corrective action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-704(4)(b): charge 100% of the reasonable implementation costs to that county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-704(5): (2) If a county disputes the factoring or corrective action ordered under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-704(6): The commission may change the factor for any county which, after a hearing before the commission, establishes that the factor should properly be set at a different level for that county.  The commission shall establish the method, procedure, and timetable for the hearings authorized under this section, including access to information to ensure a fair hearing.  The commission may establish rules to implement this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-704.5 Commission to adopt rules -- Legislative review.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-704.5(1): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 59-2-704(2) In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-704.5(2): As part of its review of the standards for determining acceptable assessment levels and valuation deviations within each county, the commission shall consider any relevant standards promulgated by the International Association of Assessing Officers.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-704.5(3): By October 1, 1998, and every five years thereafter, the Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee shall review the commission's standards and determine whether the standards should be modified.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-705 Personal property audits -- Records confidential -- Cost.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-705(1): The commission shall provide the services of qualified personal property appraisers for the purpose of auditing taxable personal property accounts in each county.  The results of the audits shall be reported to the assessor of the county. The reports shall constitute the confidential records of the commission and the assessor's office but the commission or the assessor may publish statistical information based upon the audits.  The accounts to be audited shall be determined by the commission and the county assessor.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-705(2): (1) The costs of all personal property audits made pursuant to Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(a)(i)(A): State-assessed commercial vehicles that weigh 12,001 pounds or more shall be taxed at a statewide average rate which is calculated from the overall county average tax rates from the preceding year, exclusive of the property subject to the statewide uniform fee, weighted by lane miles of principal routes in each county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(a)(i)(B): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(a)(ii): 59-2-405.1 State-assessed commercial vehicles that weigh 12,000 pounds or less are subject to the uniform fee provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(b): The combined revenue from all state-assessed commercial vehicles shall be apportioned to the counties based on:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(b)(i): 40% by the percentage of lane miles of principal routes within each county as determined by the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(b)(ii): 60% by the percentage of total state-assessed vehicles having business situs in each county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(c): At least quarterly, the commission shall apportion the total taxes paid on state-assessed commercial vehicles to the counties.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(d): (3) Each county shall apportion its share of the revenues under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(d)(i): real property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(d)(ii): tangible personal property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(d)(iii): property assessed by the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801 Apportionment of property assessed by commission.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(1): 59-2-103 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(1)(a)(i): Except as provided in Subsection (1)(a)(ii), "designated tax area" means a tax area created by the overlapping boundaries of only the following taxing entities:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(1)(a)(i)(A): a county; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(1)(a)(i)(B): a school district.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(1)(a)(ii): "Designated tax area" includes a tax area created by the overlapping boundaries of the taxing entities described in Subsection (1)(a)(i) and:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(1)(a)(ii)(A): a city or town if the boundaries of the school district under Subsection (1)(a)(i) and the boundaries of the city or town are identical; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(1)(a)(ii)(B): a special service district if the boundaries of the school district under Subsection (1)(a)(i) are located entirely within the special service district.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(1)(b): 59-2-103 "Ground hours" means the total number of hours during the calendar year immediately preceding the January 1 described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(1)(b)(i): an air charter service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(1)(b)(ii): an air contract service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(1)(b)(iii): an airline.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2): Before May 25 of each year, the commission shall apportion to each tax area the total assessment of all of the property the commission assesses as provided in Subsections (2)(a) through (e).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(a)(i): The commission shall apportion the assessments of the property described in Subsection (2)(a)(ii):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(a)(i)(A): to each tax area through which the public utility or company described in Subsection (2)(a)(ii) operates; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(a)(i)(B): in proportion to the property's value in each tax area.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(a)(ii): Subsection (2)(a)(i) applies to property owned by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(a)(ii)(A): a public utility, except for the rolling stock of a public utility;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(a)(ii)(B): a pipeline company;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(a)(ii)(C): a power company;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(a)(ii)(D): a canal company; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(a)(ii)(E): an irrigation company.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(b): The commission shall apportion the assessments of the rolling stock of a railroad:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(b)(i): to the tax areas through which railroads operate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(b)(ii): in the proportion that the length of the main tracks, sidetracks, passing tracks, switches, and tramways of the railroads in each tax area bears to the total length of the main tracks, sidetracks, passing tracks, switches, and tramways in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(c): The commission shall apportion the assessments of the property of a car company to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(c)(i): each tax area in which a  railroad is operated; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(c)(ii): in the proportion that the length of the main tracks, passing tracks, sidetracks, switches, and tramways of all of the railroads in each tax area bears to the total length of the main tracks, passing tracks, sidetracks, switches, and tramways of all of the railroads in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(d)(i): The commission shall apportion the assessments of the property described in Subsection (2)(d)(ii) to each tax area in which the property is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(d)(ii): Subsection (2)(d)(i) applies to the following property:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(d)(ii)(A): mines;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(d)(ii)(B): mining claims; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(d)(ii)(C): mining property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(e)(i): The commission shall apportion the assessments of the property described in Subsection (2)(e)(ii) to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(e)(i)(A): each designated tax area; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(e)(i)(B): in the proportion that the ground hours in each designated tax area bear to the total ground hours in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(e)(ii): Subsection (2)(e)(i) applies to the mobile flight equipment owned or operated by an:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(e)(ii)(A): air charter service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(e)(ii)(B): air contract service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(2)(e)(ii)(C): airline.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3): 59-2-405.1
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(a): 59-2-405.1
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(a)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(a)(i)(A): State-assessed commercial vehicles that weigh 12,001 pounds or more shall be taxed at a statewide average rate which is calculated from the overall county average tax rates from the preceding year, exclusive of the property subject to the statewide uniform fee, weighted by lane miles of principal routes in each county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(a)(i)(B): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission shall adopt rules to define "principal routes."
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(a)(ii): 59-2-405.1 State-assessed commercial vehicles that weigh 12,000 pounds or less are subject to the uniform fee provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(b): The combined revenue from all state-assessed commercial vehicles shall be apportioned to the counties based on:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(b)(i): 40% by the percentage of lane miles of principal routes within each county as determined by the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(b)(ii): 60% by the percentage of total state-assessed vehicles having business situs in each county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(c): At least quarterly, the commission shall apportion the total taxes paid on state-assessed commercial vehicles to the counties.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(d): Each county shall apportion its share of the revenues under this Subsection (3) to the taxing entities within its  boundaries in the same proportion as the assessments of other:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(d)(i): real property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(d)(ii): tangible personal property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-801(3)(d)(iii): property assessed by the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-802 Statement of commission transmitted to county auditors -- Contents of statement -- Duties of auditors -- Change of assessment prohibited.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-802(1): 59-2-1007 The commission shall, before June 8, annually transmit to the county auditor of each county to which an apportionment has been made a statement showing:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-802(1)(a): the property assessed;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-802(1)(b): the value of the property, as fixed and apportioned to the tax areas; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-802(1)(c): 59-2-1007 the aggregate amount of taxable value placed in dispute in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-802(2): The county auditor shall enter the:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-802(2)(a): statement on the county assessment roll or book; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-802(2)(b): amount of the assessment apportioned to the county in the column of the assessment book or roll which shows for the county the total taxable value of all property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-802(3): A county board of equalization may not change any assessment fixed by the commission.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804 Interstate allocation of mobile flight equipment.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1): 59-2-103; (1)(f)(ii); 59-2-102; 59-2-102(25); 59-2-103 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(a): "Aircraft type" means a particular model of aircraft as designated by the manufacturer of the aircraft.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(b): "Airline ground hours calculation" means an amount equal to the product of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(b)(i): the total number of hours aircraft owned or operated by an airline are on the ground, calculated by aircraft type; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(b)(ii): the cost percentage.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(c): 59-2-103 "Airline revenue ton miles" means, for an airline, the total revenue ton miles during the calendar year that immediately precedes the January 1 described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(d): "Cost percentage" means a fraction, calculated by aircraft type, the numerator of which is the airline's average cost of the aircraft type and the denominator of which is the airline's average cost of the aircraft type:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(d)(i): owned or operated by the airline; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(d)(ii): that has the lowest average cost.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(e): "Ground hours factor" means the product of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(e)(i): a fraction, the numerator of which is the Utah ground hours calculation and the denominator of which is the airline ground hours calculation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(e)(ii): .50.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(f): (1)(f)(ii); 59-2-102; 59-2-102(25)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(f)(i): (1)(f)(ii); 59-2-102 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(f)(ii): 59-2-102(25) "Mobile flight equipment" does not include tangible personal property described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(f)(ii)(A): air charter service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(f)(ii)(B): air contract service.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(g): "Mobile flight equipment allocation factor" means the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(g)(i): the ground hours factor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(g)(ii): the revenue ton miles factor.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(h): "Revenue ton miles" is determined in accordance with 14 C.F.R.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(i): "Revenue ton miles factor" means the product of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(i)(i): a fraction, the numerator of which is the Utah revenue ton miles and the denominator of which is the airline revenue ton miles; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(i)(ii): .50.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(j): "Utah ground hours calculation" means an amount equal to the product of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(j)(i): the total number of hours aircraft owned or operated by an airline are on the ground in this state, calculated by aircraft type; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(j)(ii): the cost percentage.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(k): 59-2-103 "Utah revenue ton miles" means, for an airline, the total revenue ton miles within the borders of this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(k)(i): 59-2-103 during the calendar year that immediately precedes the January 1 described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(1)(k)(ii): from flight stages that originate or terminate in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(2): For purposes of the assessment of an airline's mobile flight equipment by the commission, a portion of the value of the airline's mobile flight equipment shall be allocated to the state by calculating the product of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(2)(a): the total value of the mobile flight equipment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-804(2)(b): the mobile flight equipment allocation factor.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-901 Determination of rate by commission -- Transmittal to county and state auditors.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Before June 22 of each year the commission shall determine the rate of state tax to be levied and collected upon the taxable value of all property in the state sufficient to raise the amount of revenue specified by the Legislature for general state purposes.  That rate may not exceed .00048 per dollar of taxable value of taxable property in the state.  The commission shall transmit to the county auditor of each county and to the state auditor a statement of that rate. The county auditor shall, upon receipt, give the commission written acknowledgment of receipt.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-902 Minimum basic tax levy for school districts.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-902(1): 59-2-704 If any county fails to comply with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-902(2): The commission shall then determine for each school district the amount to be raised by the minimum basic tax levy as its contribution toward the cost of the basic state-supported program, as required by the Minimum School Program Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-902(3): Each county auditor shall be notified by the commission that the minimum basic tax levy shall be imposed by the school district, to which shall be added an additional amount, if any, due to local undervaluation as provided in this section.  The auditor shall inform the county legislative body as to the amount of the levy.  The county legislative body shall at the time and in the manner provided by law make the levy upon the taxable property in the school district together with further levies for school purposes as may be required by each school district to pay the costs of programs in excess of the basic state-supported school program.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-902(4): If the levy applied under this section raises an amount in excess of the total basic state-supported school program for a school district, the excess amount shall be remitted by the school district to the State Board of Education to be credited to the Uniform School Fund for allocation to school districts to support the basic state-supported school program.  The availability of money shall be considered by the commission in fixing the state property levy as provided in the Minimum School Program Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-902(5): If the levy does not raise an amount in excess of the total basic state-supported school program for a district, then the difference between the amount which the local levy will raise within the district, and the total cost of the basic state-supported school program within the district shall be computed.  This difference, if any, shall be apportioned from the Uniform School Fund to each school district as the contribution of the state to the basic state-supported school program for the district, subject to the following conditions:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-902(5)(a): Before the apportionment is made, the commission shall determine if the local taxable valuation of any school district is undervalued according to law and if so, the dollar amount of the undervaluation.  The dollar amount of the undervaluation shall be multiplied by the district basic uniform school levy at 98%.  The resulting dollar amount shall be divided by the current year estimated yield of .0002 per dollar of taxable value at 98% based on the district's taxable valuation prior to adjusting for undervaluation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-902(5)(b): The resulting levy amount shall be added to the required district basic uniform levy to determine the combined district basic school levy adjusted for undervaluation.  The combined rate of levy shall be certified to the county auditor and employed by the auditor and the county legislative body in lieu of the required basic school local levy.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-903 Remittance to credit of Uniform School Fund of money in excess of basic state-supported school program -- Manner.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In providing for remittance to the State Board of Education of any excess collections from the tax levy applied for the basic state-supported school program as specified in SubsectionUtah Code Annotated § 59-2-903(1): by June 1, 95% of the amount by which the money then collected, pursuant to the levy, exceeds the estimated total basic state-supported school program of the district; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-903(2): as soon after the end of the school year as the school district and the State Board of Education can determine the actual cost of the district's basic state-supported school program, the district and the State Board of Education shall make a final settlement.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-904 Participation by district in state's contributions to state-supported levy program.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-904(1): 59-2-902 In addition to the basic state contribution provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-904(2): A school district that participates in the state-supported levy program shall certify to the State Board of Education the results of its determination and the amount of the board or voted local levy that the district will impose.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-905 Legislature to set minimum rate of levy for state's contribution to minimum school program -- Matters to be considered -- Commission to transmit rate to auditors -- Acknowledgment of receipt.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Legislature shall set the minimum rate of levy on each dollar of taxable value of  taxable property so that it will raise sufficient supplementary revenue to pay the state's contribution to the cost of the minimum school program for that year.  The Legislature shall take into consideration the estimated tax delinquency for the current year, and shall be conservative in its estimate of revenue to assure ample funds for the state's contribution to the cost of the minimum school program.  The commission shall immediately transmit to the county auditor of each county and to the state auditor a statement of the rate.  The county auditor shall, upon receipt, give the commission written acknowledgment of receipt.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-906 Rates fixed by commission valid.
---------------------------------------------------------------
The action of the commission in fixing the rate of taxation for state and state school purposes is a valid rate.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-908 Single aggregate limitation -- Maximum levy.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-908(1): (2); 59-2-911 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-908(1)(a): .0032 per dollar of taxable value in all counties with a total taxable value of more than $100,000,000; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-908(1)(b): .0036 per dollar of taxable value in all counties with a total taxable value of less than $100,000,000.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-908(2)(b): (2)(a); 59-2-924 A county meeting the requirements of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-909 Time for adoption of levy -- County purpose requirement.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The county legislative body of each county shall adopt a proposed or, if the tax rate is not more than the certified tax rate, a final tax rate on the taxable property of the county before June 22 to provide funds for county purposes.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-910 Amount available for each purpose.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
The county legislative body shall determine the amount which shall be available for each purpose authorized by law.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-914 Excess levies -- Commission to recalculate levy -- Notice to implement adjusted levies to county auditor -- Authority to exceed maximum levy permitted by law.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-914(1): 59-2-913 If the commission determines that a levy established for a taxing entity set under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-914(1)(a): lower the levy so that it is set at the maximum level permitted by law;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-914(1)(b): notify the taxing entity which set the excessive rate that the rate has been lowered; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-914(1)(c): notify the county auditor of the county or counties in which the taxing entity is located to implement the rate established by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-914(2): A levy set for a taxing entity by the commission under this section shall be the official levy for that taxing entity unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-914(2)(a): the taxing entity lowers the levy established by the commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-914(2)(b): the levy is subsequently modified by a court order.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-914(3): (1); (2); 59-2-924 Notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-916 Tax for development of Colorado River Water Project.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The governing body of each county, town, city, conservation district, and metropolitan district may levy a tax for participation in the development of the use of Colorado river water in Utah through the Colorado River-Great Basin Project. The tax shall be levied at the same time and collected in the same manner as other taxes.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-917 Use of funds.
--------------------------------------------
The money raised by the levy imposed by Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5 Hearings on judgment levies -- Advertisement.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(1): A taxing entity may not impose a judgment levy unless it first advertises its intention to do so and holds a public hearing in accordance with the requirements of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(2): 59-2-919; 59-2-919
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(2)(a): 59-2-919 The advertisement required by this section may be combined with the advertisement described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(2)(b): 59-2-919 The advertisement shall be at least 1/8 of a page in size and shall meet the type, placement, and frequency requirements established under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(2)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(2)(c)(i): For taxing entities operating under a July 1 through June 30 fiscal year the public hearing shall be held at the same time as the hearing at which the annual budget is adopted.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(2)(c)(ii): For taxing entities operating under a January 1 through December 31 fiscal year:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(2)(c)(ii)(A): for an eligible judgment issued on or after March 1 but on or before September 15, the public hearing shall be held at the same time as the hearing at which the annual budget is adopted; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(2)(c)(ii)(B): for an eligible judgment issued on or after September 16 but on or before the last day of February, the public hearing shall be held at the same time as the hearing at which property tax levies are set.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(3): The advertisement shall specify the date, time, and location of the public hearing at which the levy will be considered and shall set forth the total amount of the eligible judgment and the tax impact on an average residential and business property located within the taxing entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(4): If a final decision regarding the judgment levy is not made at the public hearing, the taxing entity shall announce at the public hearing the scheduled time and place for consideration and adoption of the judgment levy.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(5): (2)(c)(i); (2)(c)(ii)(B); 59-2-919.1 The date, time, and place of public hearings required by Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5 Hearings on judgment levies -- Advertisement.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(1): A taxing entity may not impose a judgment levy unless it first advertises its intention to do so and holds a public hearing in accordance with the requirements of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(2): 59-2-919; 59-2-919; 59-2-919.1; 59-2-919.1
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(2)(a): 59-2-919 The advertisement required by this section may be combined with the advertisement described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(2)(b): 59-2-919 The advertisement shall be at least 1/8 of a page in size and shall meet the type, placement, and frequency requirements established under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(2)(c): 59-2-919.1; 59-2-919.1
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(2)(c)(i): 59-2-919.1 For taxing entities operating under a July 1 through June 30 fiscal year the public hearing shall be held 10 or more days after notice is provided to property owners pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(2)(c)(ii): 59-2-919.1 For taxing entities operating under a January 1 through December 31 fiscal year:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(2)(c)(ii)(A): for an eligible judgment issued on or after March 1 but on or before September 15, the public hearing shall be held at the same time as the hearing at which the annual budget is adopted; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(2)(c)(ii)(B): 59-2-919.1 for an eligible judgment issued on or after September 16 but on or before the last day of February, the public hearing shall be held 10 or more days after notice is provided to property owners pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(3): The advertisement shall specify the date, time, and location of the public hearing at which the levy will be considered and shall set forth the total amount of the eligible judgment and the tax impact on an average residential and business property located within the taxing entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-918.5(4): If a final decision regarding the judgment levy is not made at the public hearing, the taxing entity shall announce at the public hearing the scheduled time and place for consideration and adoption of the judgment levy.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919 Notice and public hearing requirements for certain tax increases -- Exceptions.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"[Insert name of taxing entity] is proposing a tax increase for [insert applicable calendar year].  This notice contains estimates of the tax on your property and the proposed tax increase on your property as a result of this tax increase.  These estimates are calculated on the basis of [insert previous applicable calendar year] data.  The actual tax on your property and proposed tax increase on your property may vary from this estimate.";Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1): 59-2-924; 17-52a-203 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(a): "Additional ad valorem tax revenue" means ad valorem property tax revenue generated by the portion of the tax rate that exceeds the taxing entity's certified tax rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(b): 59-2-924 "Ad valorem tax revenue" means ad valorem property tax revenue not including revenue from:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(b)(i): 59-2-924 eligible new growth as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(b)(ii): personal property that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(b)(ii)(A): assessed by a county assessor in accordance with Part 3, County Assessment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(b)(ii)(B): semiconductor manufacturing equipment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(c): "Calendar year taxing entity" means a taxing entity that operates under a fiscal year that begins on January 1 and ends on December 31.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(d): 17-52a-203 "County executive calendar year taxing entity" means a calendar year taxing entity that operates under the county executive-council form of government described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(e): "Current calendar year" means the calendar year immediately preceding the calendar year for which a calendar year taxing entity seeks to levy a tax rate that exceeds the calendar year taxing entity's certified tax rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(f): "Fiscal year taxing entity" means a taxing entity that operates under a fiscal year that begins on July 1 and ends on June 30.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(g): "Last year's property tax budgeted revenue" does not include revenue received by a taxing entity from a debt service levy voted on by the public.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(2): A taxing entity may not levy a tax rate that exceeds the taxing entity's certified tax rate unless the taxing entity meets:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(2)(a): the requirements of this section that apply to the taxing entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(2)(b): all other requirements as may be required by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3): 17-36-13; 17B-1-610; 59-2-1317; 17-21-6; 17-21-6

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a)(i): 14 or more days before the date of the regular general election or municipal general election held in the current calendar year, states at a public meeting:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a)(i)(A): that the calendar year taxing entity intends to levy a tax rate that exceeds the calendar year taxing entity's certified tax rate;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a)(i)(B): the dollar amount of and purpose for additional ad valorem tax revenue that would be generated by the proposed increase in the certified tax rate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a)(i)(C): the approximate percentage increase in ad valorem tax revenue for the taxing entity based on the proposed increase described in Subsection (3)(a)(i)(B);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a)(ii): provides notice for the public meeting described in Subsection (3)(a)(i) in accordance with Title 52, Chapter 4, Open and Public Meetings Act, including providing a separate item on the meeting agenda that notifies the public that the calendar year taxing entity intends to make the statement described in Subsection (3)(a)(i);

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a)(v): 17-36-13; 17B-1-610 conducts a public hearing that is held:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a)(v)(A): in accordance with Subsections (8) and (9); and

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(b):

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(b)(i): A public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b) shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(b)(i)(A): open to the public; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(b)(i)(B): held at a meeting of the taxing entity with no items on the agenda other than discussion and action on the taxing entity's intent to levy a tax rate that exceeds the taxing entity's certified tax rate, the taxing entity's budget, a special district's or special service district's fee implementation or increase, or a combination of these items.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(b)(ii): The governing body of a taxing entity conducting a public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b) shall provide an interested party desiring to be heard an opportunity to present oral testimony:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(b)(ii)(A): within reasonable time limits; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(b)(ii)(B): without unreasonable restriction on the number of individuals allowed to make public comment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(c)(i): Except as provided in Subsection (8)(c)(ii), a taxing entity may not schedule a public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b) at the same time as the public hearing of another overlapping taxing entity in the same county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(c)(ii): The taxing entities in which the power to set tax levies is vested in the same governing board or authority may consolidate the public hearings described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b) into one public hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(d): A county legislative body shall resolve any conflict in public hearing dates and times after consultation with each affected taxing entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(e)(i): A taxing entity shall hold a public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b) beginning at or after 6 p.m.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(e)(ii): If a taxing entity holds a public meeting for the purpose of addressing general business of the taxing entity on the same date as a public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b), the public meeting addressing general business items shall conclude before the beginning of the public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(f): 17B-1-643; 10-5-107.5; 10-6-135.5
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(f)(i): Except as provided in Subsection (8)(f)(ii), a taxing entity may not hold the public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b) on the same date as another public hearing of the taxing entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(f)(ii): 17B-1-643; 10-5-107.5; 10-6-135.5 A taxing entity may hold the following hearings on the same date as a public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(f)(ii)(A): a budget hearing;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(f)(ii)(B): 17B-1-643 if the taxing entity is a special district or a special service district, a fee hearing described in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(f)(ii)(D): 10-6-135.5 if the taxing entity is a city, an enterprise fund hearing described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(9)(a): If a taxing entity does not make a final decision on budgeting additional ad valorem tax revenue at a public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b), the taxing entity shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(9)(a)(i): announce at that public hearing the scheduled time and place of the next public meeting at which the taxing entity will consider budgeting the additional ad valorem tax revenue; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(9)(a)(ii): if the taxing entity is a fiscal year taxing entity, hold the public meeting described in Subsection (9)(a)(i) before September 1.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(9)(b): A calendar year taxing entity may not adopt a final budget that budgets an amount of additional ad valorem tax revenue that exceeds the largest amount of additional ad valorem tax revenue stated at a public meeting under Subsection (3)(a)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(9)(c): A public hearing on levying a tax rate that exceeds a fiscal year taxing entity's certified tax rate may coincide with a public hearing on the fiscal year taxing entity's proposed annual budget.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919 Notice and public hearing requirements for certain tax increases -- Exceptions -- Audit.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"[Insert name of taxing entity] is proposing a tax increase for [insert applicable calendar year].  This notice contains estimates of the tax on your property and the proposed tax increase on your property as a result of this tax increase.  These estimates are calculated on the basis of [insert previous applicable calendar year] data.  The actual tax on your property and proposed tax increase on your property may vary from this estimate.";Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1): 59-2-924; 17-52a-203; 53F-2-301; 53F-2-703 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(a): "Additional ad valorem tax revenue" means ad valorem property tax revenue generated by the portion of the tax rate that exceeds the taxing entity's certified tax rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(b): 59-2-924 "Ad valorem tax revenue" means ad valorem property tax revenue not including revenue from:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(b)(i): 59-2-924 eligible new growth as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(b)(ii): personal property that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(b)(ii)(A): assessed by a county assessor in accordance with Part 3, County Assessment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(b)(ii)(B): semiconductor manufacturing equipment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(c): "Calendar year taxing entity" means a taxing entity that operates under a fiscal year that begins on January 1 and ends on December 31.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(d): 17-52a-203 "County executive calendar year taxing entity" means a calendar year taxing entity that operates under the county executive-council form of government described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(e): "Current calendar year" means the calendar year immediately preceding the calendar year for which a calendar year taxing entity seeks to levy a tax rate that exceeds the calendar year taxing entity's certified tax rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(f): "Fiscal year taxing entity" means a taxing entity that operates under a fiscal year that begins on July 1 and ends on June 30.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(g)(i): revenue received by a taxing entity from a debt service levy voted on by the public;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(g)(ii): 53F-2-301 revenue generated by the combined basic rate as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(1)(g)(iii): 53F-2-703 revenue generated by the charter school levy described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(2): A taxing entity may not levy a tax rate that exceeds the taxing entity's certified tax rate unless the taxing entity meets:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(2)(a): the requirements of this section that apply to the taxing entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(2)(b): all other requirements as may be required by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3): 17-36-13; 17B-1-610; 59-2-1317; 17-21-6(1)(m); 17-21-6(1)(m)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a): 17-36-13; 17B-1-610 Subject to Subsection (3)(b) and except as provided in Subsection (5), a calendar year taxing entity may levy a tax rate that exceeds the calendar year taxing entity's certified tax rate if the calendar year taxing entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a)(i): 14 or more days before the date of the regular general election or municipal general election held in the current calendar year, states at a public meeting:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a)(i)(A): that the calendar year taxing entity intends to levy a tax rate that exceeds the calendar year taxing entity's certified tax rate;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a)(i)(B): the dollar amount of and purpose for additional ad valorem tax revenue that would be generated by the proposed increase in the certified tax rate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a)(i)(C): the approximate percentage increase in ad valorem tax revenue for the taxing entity based on the proposed increase described in Subsection (3)(a)(i)(B);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a)(ii): provides notice for the public meeting described in Subsection (3)(a)(i) in accordance with Title 52, Chapter 4, Open and Public Meetings Act, including providing a separate item on the meeting agenda that notifies the public that the calendar year taxing entity intends to make the statement described in Subsection (3)(a)(i);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a)(iii): meets the advertisement requirements of Subsections (6) and (7) before the calendar year taxing entity conducts the public hearing required by Subsection (3)(a)(v);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a)(iv): provides notice by mail:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a)(iv)(A): seven or more days before the regular general election or municipal general election held in the current calendar year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a)(iv)(B): as provided in Subsection (3)(c); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a)(v): 17-36-13; 17B-1-610 conducts a public hearing that is held:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a)(v)(A): in accordance with Subsections (8) and (9); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(a)(v)(B): 17-36-13; 17B-1-610 in conjunction with the public hearing required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(b)(i): For a county executive calendar year taxing entity, the statement described in Subsection (3)(a)(i) shall be made by the:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(b)(i)(B): county executive; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(b)(i)(C): both the county council and county executive.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(b)(ii): If the county council makes the statement described in Subsection (3)(a)(i) or the county council states a dollar amount of additional ad valorem tax revenue that is greater than the amount of additional ad valorem tax revenue previously stated by the county executive in accordance with Subsection (3)(a)(i), the county executive calendar year taxing entity shall:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(c): 59-2-1317; 17-21-6(1)(m); 17-21-6(1)(m) The notice described in Subsection (3)(a)(iv):

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(c)(iii)(C): subject to Subsection (3)(d), for the calendar year for which the calendar year taxing entity seeks to levy a tax rate that exceeds the calendar year taxing entity's certified tax rate, the estimated tax on the property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(c)(iv): shall contain the following statement:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(c)(x)(B): 17-21-6(1)(m) instructions describing how to elect to receive a notice as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(d): For purposes of Subsection (3)(c)(iii)(C), a calendar year taxing entity shall calculate the estimated tax on property on the basis of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(d)(i): data for the current calendar year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(3)(d)(ii): the amount of additional ad valorem tax revenue stated in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(4): Except as provided in Subsection (5), a fiscal year taxing entity may levy a tax rate that exceeds the fiscal year taxing entity's certified tax rate if the fiscal year taxing entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(4)(a): provides notice by meeting the advertisement requirements of Subsections (6) and (7) before the fiscal year taxing entity conducts the public meeting at which the fiscal year taxing entity's annual budget is adopted; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(4)(b): conducts a public hearing in accordance with Subsections (8) and (9) before the fiscal year taxing entity's annual budget is adopted.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(5): 53F-8-301
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(5)(a): A taxing entity is not required to meet the notice or public hearing requirements of Subsection (3) or (4) if the taxing entity is expressly exempted by law from complying with the requirements of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(5)(b): 53F-8-301 A taxing entity is not required to meet the notice requirements of Subsection (3) or (4) if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(5)(b)(i): 53F-8-301 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(5)(b)(ii): the taxing entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(5)(b)(ii)(A): budgeted less than $20,000 in ad valorem tax revenue for the previous fiscal year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(5)(b)(ii)(B): sets a budget during the current fiscal year of less than $20,000 of ad valorem tax revenue.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6): 45-1-101; 45-1-101; 63G-30-102; 59-2-919.2
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(a): 45-1-101; 45-1-101; 63G-30-102 Subject to Subsections (6)(d) and (7)(b), the advertisement described in this section shall be published:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(a)(i): 45-1-101 subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(a)(ii): 45-1-101 electronically in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(a)(iii): 63G-30-102 for the taxing entity, as a class A notice under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(b): The advertisement described in Subsection (6)(a)(i) shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(b)(i): be no less than 1/4 page in size;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(b)(ii): use type no smaller than 18 point; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(b)(iii): be surrounded by a 1/4-inch border.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(c): The advertisement described in Subsection (6)(a)(i) may not be placed in that portion of the newspaper where legal notices and classified advertisements appear.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(d): It is the intent of the Legislature that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(d)(i): whenever possible, the advertisement described in Subsection (6)(a)(i) appear in a newspaper that is published at least one day per week; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(d)(ii): the newspaper or combination of newspapers selected:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(d)(ii)(A): be of general interest and readership in the taxing entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(d)(ii)(B): not be of limited subject matter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(e)(i): The advertisement described in Subsection (6)(a)(i) shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(e)(i)(A): except as provided in Subsection (6)(f), be run once each week for the two weeks before a taxing entity conducts a public hearing described under Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(e)(i)(B): state that the taxing entity will meet on a certain day, time, and place fixed in the advertisement, which shall be seven or more days after the day the first advertisement is published, for the purpose of hearing comments regarding any proposed increase and to explain the reasons for the proposed increase; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(e)(i)(C): state the Internet address for the taxing entity's public website.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(e)(ii): The advertisement described in Subsection (6)(a)(ii) shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(e)(ii)(A): be published two weeks before a taxing entity conducts a public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(e)(ii)(B): state that the taxing entity will meet on a certain day, time, and place fixed in the advertisement, which shall be seven or more days after the day the first advertisement is published, for the purpose of hearing comments regarding any proposed increase and to explain the reasons for the proposed increase; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(e)(ii)(C): state the Internet address for the taxing entity's public website.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(6)(g): For purposes of Subsection (3)(a)(iii) or (4)(a), the form and content of an advertisement shall be substantially as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(7): 45-1-101; 59-2-919.1 The commission:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8): 59-2-919.2; 17B-1-643; 10-5-107.5; 10-6-135.5
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(a)(i): A fiscal year taxing entity shall, on or before June 1, notify the commission and the county auditor of the date, time, and place of the public hearing described in Subsection (4)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(a)(ii): A calendar year taxing entity shall, on or before October 1 of the current calendar year, notify the commission and the county auditor of the date, time, and place of the public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(b): 59-2-919.2
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(b)(i): A public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b) shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(b)(i)(A): open to the public; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(b)(i)(B): held at a meeting of the taxing entity with no items on the agenda other than discussion and action on the taxing entity's intent to levy a tax rate that exceeds the taxing entity's certified tax rate, the taxing entity's budget, a special district's or special service district's fee implementation or increase, or a combination of these items.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(b)(ii): 59-2-919.2 The governing body of a taxing entity conducting a public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b) shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(b)(ii)(A): state the dollar amount of additional ad valorem tax revenue that would be generated each year by the proposed increase in the certified tax rate;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(b)(ii)(B): explain the reasons for the proposed tax increase, including the taxing entity's intended use of additional ad valorem tax revenue described in Subsection (8)(b)(ii)(A);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(b)(ii)(C): 59-2-919.2 if the county auditor compiles the list required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(b)(ii)(D): provide an interested party desiring to be heard an opportunity to present oral testimonywithin reasonable time limits and without unreasonable restriction on the number of individuals allowed to make public comment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(c)(i): Except as provided in Subsection (8)(c)(ii), a taxing entity may not schedule a public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b) at the same time as the public hearing of another overlapping taxing entity in the same county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(c)(ii): The taxing entities in which the power to set tax levies is vested in the same governing board or authority may consolidate the public hearings described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b) into one public hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(d): The county auditor shall resolve any conflict in public hearing dates and times after consultation with each affected taxing entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(e)(i): A taxing entity shall hold a public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b) beginning at or after 6 p.m.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(e)(ii): If a taxing entity holds a public meeting for the purpose of addressing general business of the taxing entity on the same date as a public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b), the public meeting addressing general business items shall conclude before the beginning of the public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(f): 17B-1-643; 10-5-107.5; 10-6-135.5
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(f)(i): Except as provided in Subsection (8)(f)(ii), a taxing entity may not hold the public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b) on the same date as another public hearing of the taxing entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(f)(ii): 17B-1-643; 10-5-107.5; 10-6-135.5 A taxing entity may hold the following hearings on the same date as a public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(f)(ii)(A): a budget hearing;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(f)(ii)(B): 17B-1-643 if the taxing entity is a special district or a special service district, a fee hearing described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(f)(ii)(C): 10-5-107.5 if the taxing entity is a town, an enterprise fund hearing described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(8)(f)(ii)(D): 10-6-135.5 if the taxing entity is a city, an enterprise fund hearing described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(9)(a): If a taxing entity does not make a final decision on budgeting additional ad valorem tax revenue at a public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b), the taxing entity shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(9)(a)(i): announce at that public hearing the scheduled time and place of the next public meeting at which the taxing entity will consider budgeting the additional ad valorem tax revenue; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(9)(a)(ii): if the taxing entity is a fiscal year taxing entity, hold the public meeting described in Subsection (9)(a)(i) before September 1.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(9)(b): A calendar year taxing entity may not adopt a final budget that budgets an amount of additional ad valorem tax revenue that exceeds the largest amount of additional ad valorem tax revenue stated at a public meeting under Subsection (3)(a)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(9)(c): A public hearing on levying a tax rate that exceeds a fiscal year taxing entity's certified tax rate may coincide with a public hearing on the fiscal year taxing entity's proposed annual budget.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(10): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(10)(a): A county auditor may conduct an audit to verify a taxing entity's compliance with Subsection (8).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(10)(b): If the county auditor, after completing an audit, finds that a taxing entity has failed to meet the requirements of Subsection (8), the county auditor shall prepare and submit a report of the auditor's findings to the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919(10)(c): The commission may not certify a tax rate that exceeds a taxing entity's certified tax rate if, on or before September 15 of the year in which the taxing entity is required to hold the public hearing described in Subsection (3)(a)(v) or (4)(b), the commission determines that the taxing entity has failed to meet the requirements of Subsection (8).


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1 Notice of property valuation and tax changes.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(1): 59-2-919 In addition to the notice requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2): 59-2-1004; 59-2-1007; 53F-2-703; 59-2-1602; 59-2-1602; 53F-2-301; 63H-1-501; 59-2-103; 59-2-303.1 The notice described in Subsection (1) shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(a): except as provided in Subsection (4), be sent to all owners of real property by mail 10 or more days before the day on which:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(a)(i): the county board of equalization meets; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(a)(ii): the taxing entity holds a public hearing on the proposed increase in the certified tax rate;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(b)(i): approved by the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(b)(ii): uniform in content in all counties in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(c): 59-2-1004; 59-2-1007; 53F-2-703; 59-2-1602; 59-2-1602; 53F-2-301; 63H-1-501; 59-2-103; 59-2-303.1 contain for each property:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(c)(i): the assessor's determination of the value of the property;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(c)(v)(B): the dollar amount of the taxpayer's tax liability under the current rate;
