Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(3): 59-2-919 If a taxing entity that is subject to the notice and hearing requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(3)(a): the dollar amount of the taxpayer's tax liability if the proposed increase is approved;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(3)(b): the difference between the dollar amount of the taxpayer's tax liability if the proposed increase is approved and the dollar amount of the taxpayer's tax liability under the current rate, placed in close proximity to the information described in Subsection (2)(c)(viii); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(3)(c): the percentage increase that the dollar amount of the taxpayer's tax liability under the proposed tax rate represents as compared to the dollar amount of the taxpayer's tax liability under the current tax rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4): 59-2-1004
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(a): Subject to the other provisions of this Subsection (4), a county auditor may, at the county auditor's discretion, provide the notice required by this section to a taxpayer by electronic means if a taxpayer makes an election, according to procedures determined by the county auditor, to receive the notice by electronic means.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(b)(i): If a notice required by this section is sent by electronic means, a county auditor shall attempt to verify whether a taxpayer receives the notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(b)(ii): If receipt of the notice sent by electronic means cannot be verified 14 days or more before the county board of equalization meets and the taxing entity holds a public hearing on a proposed increase in the certified tax rate, the notice required by this section shall also be sent by mail as provided in Subsection (2).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(c): A taxpayer may revoke an election to receive the notice required by this section by electronic means if the taxpayer provides written notice to the county auditor on or before April 30.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(d): 59-2-1004 An election or a revocation of an election under this Subsection (4):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(d)(i): does not relieve a taxpayer of the duty to pay a tax due under this chapter on or before the due date for paying the tax; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(d)(ii): 59-2-1004 does not alter the requirement that a taxpayer appealing the valuation or the equalization of the taxpayer's real property submit the application for appeal within the time period provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(e): A county auditor shall provide the notice required by this section as provided in Subsection (2), until a taxpayer makes a new election in accordance with this Subsection (4), if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(e)(i): the taxpayer revokes an election in accordance with Subsection (4)(c) to receive the notice required by this section by electronic means; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(e)(ii): the county auditor finds that the taxpayer's electronic contact information is invalid.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(f): A person is considered to be a taxpayer for purposes of this Subsection (4) regardless of whether the property that is the subject of the notice required by this section is exempt from taxation.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1 Notice of property valuation and tax changes.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(1): 59-2-919 In addition to the notice requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2): 59-2-1004; 59-2-1007; 53F-2-703; 59-2-1602; 59-2-1602; 10-6-133.4; 53F-2-301; 63H-1-501(4)(a); 59-2-103; 59-2-303.1 The notice described in Subsection (1) shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(a): except as provided in Subsection (4), be sent to all owners of real property by mail 10 or more days before the day on which:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(a)(i): the county board of equalization meets; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(a)(ii): the taxing entity holds a public hearing on the proposed increase in the certified tax rate;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(b): be on a form that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(b)(i): approved by the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(b)(ii): uniform in content in all counties in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(c): 59-2-1004; 59-2-1007; 53F-2-703; 59-2-1602; 59-2-1602; 10-6-133.4; 53F-2-301; 63H-1-501(4)(a); 59-2-103; 59-2-303.1 contain for each property:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(c)(i): the assessor's determination of the value of the property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(c)(ii): the taxable value of the property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(c)(iii): 59-2-1004; 59-2-1007
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(c)(iii)(A): 59-2-1004 the deadline for the taxpayer to make an application to appeal the valuation or equalization of the property under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(c)(iii)(B): 59-2-1007 for property assessed by the commission, the deadline for the taxpayer to apply to the commission for a hearing on an objection to the valuation or equalization of the property under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(c)(iv): for a property assessed by the commission, a statement that the taxpayer may not appeal the valuation or equalization of the property to the county board of equalization;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(c)(v): itemized tax information for all applicable taxing entities, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(c)(v)(A): the dollar amount of the taxpayer's tax liability for the property in the prior year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(c)(v)(B): the dollar amount of the taxpayer's tax liability under the current rate;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(c)(vi): 53F-2-703; 59-2-1602; 59-2-1602; 10-6-133.4; 53F-2-301; 63H-1-501(4)(a) the following, stated separately:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(c)(ix)(D): 59-2-103 the residential exemption described in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(c)(xi): 59-2-303.1 the last property review date of the property as described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(c)(xii)(B): the county assessor's office; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(2)(c)(xiii): other information approved by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(3): 59-2-919; 59-2-919 If a taxing entity that is subject to the notice and hearing requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(3)(a): the dollar amount of the taxpayer's tax liability if the proposed increase is approved;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(3)(b): the difference between the dollar amount of the taxpayer's tax liability if the proposed increase is approved and the dollar amount of the taxpayer's tax liability under the current rate, placed in close proximity to the information described in Subsection (2)(c)(viii);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(3)(c): the percentage increase that the dollar amount of the taxpayer's tax liability under the proposed tax rate represents as compared to the dollar amount of the taxpayer's tax liability under the current tax rate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(3)(d): 59-2-919 for each taxing entity proposing a tax increase, the dollar amount of additional ad valorem tax revenue, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4): 59-2-1004
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(a): Subject to the other provisions of this Subsection (4), a county auditor may, at the county auditor's discretion, provide the notice required by this section to a taxpayer by electronic means if a taxpayer makes an election, according to procedures determined by the county auditor, to receive the notice by electronic means.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(b)(i): If a notice required by this section is sent by electronic means, a county auditor shall attempt to verify whether a taxpayer receives the notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(b)(ii): If receipt of the notice sent by electronic means cannot be verified 14 days or more before the county board of equalization meets and the taxing entity holds a public hearing on a proposed increase in the certified tax rate, the notice required by this section shall also be sent by mail as provided in Subsection (2).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(c): A taxpayer may revoke an election to receive the notice required by this section by electronic means if the taxpayer provides written notice to the county auditor on or before April 30.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(d): 59-2-1004 An election or a revocation of an election under this Subsection (4):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(d)(i): does not relieve a taxpayer of the duty to pay a tax due under this chapter on or before the due date for paying the tax; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(d)(ii): 59-2-1004 does not alter the requirement that a taxpayer appealing the valuation or the equalization of the taxpayer's real property submit the application for appeal within the time period provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(e): A county auditor shall provide the notice required by this section as provided in Subsection (2), until a taxpayer makes a new election in accordance with this Subsection (4), if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(e)(i): the taxpayer revokes an election in accordance with Subsection (4)(c) to receive the notice required by this section by electronic means; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(e)(ii): the county auditor finds that the taxpayer's electronic contact information is invalid.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.1(4)(f): A person is considered to be a taxpayer for purposes of this Subsection (4) regardless of whether the property that is the subject of the notice required by this section is exempt from taxation.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.2(2): 59-2-919; 59-2-919 If as of July 22, two or more taxing entities notify the county auditor under Subsection (1), the county auditor shall by no later than July 22 of each year:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.2(2)(b)(iii): the average dollar increase on a residence in the taxing entity that the proposed tax increase would generate;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.2(2)(b)(iv): the average dollar increase on a business in the taxing entity that the proposed tax increase would generate;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.2(2)(b)(vii): other information approved by the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.2(2)(c): provide a copy of the list described in Subsection (2)(a) to each taxing entity that notifies the county auditor under Subsection (1); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.2(2)(d): in addition to the requirements of Subsection (3), if the county has a webpage, publish a copy of the list described in Subsection (2)(a) on the county's webpage until December 31.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.2(3)(b)(ii): except for the heading described in Subsection (3)(b)(iii), in not less than 10-point type;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.2(3)(d)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.2(3)(d)(i)(A): in a newspaper or combination of newspapers that are:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.2(3)(d)(ii)(B): 63G-30-102 for the county, as a class A notice under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.2(4): 59-2-919 A taxing entity that notifies the county auditor under Subsection (1) shall provide the list described in Subsection (2)(c) to a person:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.2(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.2(5)(a): A county auditor shall by no later than 30 days from the day on which the last publication of the information required by Subsection (3)(a) is made:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.2(5)(a)(i): determine the costs of compiling and publishing the list; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.2(5)(a)(ii): charge each taxing entity included on the list an amount calculated by dividing the amount determined under Subsection (5)(a) by the number of taxing entities on the list.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.2(5)(b): A taxing entity shall pay the county auditor the amount charged under Subsection (5)(a).

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.2(7)(a): relating to the publication of a consolidated advertisement which includes the information described in Subsection (2) for a taxing entity that overlaps two or more counties;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.2(7)(b): relating to the payment required in Subsection (5)(b); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-919.2(7)(c): to oversee the administration of this section and provide for uniform implementation.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-920 Resolution and levy to be forwarded to commission.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-920(1): 59-2-919; 59-2-912; 59-2-913 If a taxing entity, after fulfilling the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-920(2): (1) No tax rate in excess of the certified tax rate may be certified by the commission or implemented by the taxing entity until the resolution described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-921 Changes in assessment roll -- Rate adjustments -- Exemption from notice and public hearing provisions.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-921(1): On or before September 15 the county board of equalization and, in cases involving the original jurisdiction of the commission or an appeal from the county board of equalization, the commission, shall annually notify each taxing entity of the following changes resulting from actions by the commission or the county board of equalization:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-921(1)(a): a change in the taxing entity's assessment roll; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-921(1)(b): a change in the taxing entity's adopted tax rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-921(2): 59-2-919; (2)(b)(i) A taxing entity is not required to comply with the notice and public hearing provisions of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-921(2)(a): changes a taxing entity's adopted tax rate; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-921(2)(b): (2)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-921(2)(b)(i): makes a reduction in the taxing entity's assessment roll; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-921(2)(b)(ii): (2)(b)(i) the taxing entity adopts by resolution an increase in its tax rate above the certified tax rate as a result of the reduction under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-921(3): A rate adjustment under this section for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-921(3)(a): a taxing entity shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-921(3)(a)(i): made by the county auditor;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-921(3)(a)(ii): aggregated;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-921(3)(a)(iii): reported by the county auditor to the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-921(3)(a)(iv): certified by the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-921(3)(b): the state shall be made by the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-922 Replacement resolution for greater tax rate.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Except as provided in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-923 Expenditures of money prior to adoption of budget or tax rate.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A taxing entity may, before the taxing entity adopts a final annual budget or a tax rate, expend money on the basis of the taxing entity's:Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-923(1): tentative budget after adoption of the tentative budget; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-923(2): prior year's adopted final budget as amended, which shall be readopted by resolution at a meeting of the taxing entity's governing body.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1): 17C-1-102; 11-58-201; 11-58-102; 11-59-201; 11-59-207; 11-70-201; 11-70-101; 17C-1-201.5; 17C-1-102; 63H-1-201; 63H-1-102; 63N-2-502; 63N-3-602; 10-9a-1001; 17-27a-1201; 63N-3-1601; 17C-1-102; 63N-2-502; 63N-2-502; 63N-2-502; 11-58-201; 11-59-201; 11-59-207; 11-70-201; 11-70-101; 17C-1-201.5; 63H-1-201; 59-2-704; 59-2-103; 11-58-201; 11-58-102; 11-70-201; 11-70-101; 17C-1-201.5; 17C-1-102; 63H-1-201; 63H-1-102; 11-58-201; 11-59-201; 11-59-207; 11-70-201; 17C-1-201.5; 63H-1-201; 17C-1-1001; 63H-1-102; 11-58-102; 59-2-1115; 17C-1-201.5; 17C-1-102; 63N-3-602; 10-9a-1001; 17-27a-1201; 63N-3-1601 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(a):

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(c)(i)(C): the aggregate year end taxable value of all personal property a county assessor assesses in accordance with Part 3, County Assessment, contained on the prior year's tax rolls of the taxing entity.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(e): "Centrally assessed benchmark value" means an amount equal to the highest year end taxable value of real and personal property the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property, for a previous calendar year that begins on or after January 1, 2015, adjusted for taxable value attributable to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(e)(i): an annexation to a taxing entity;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(f): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(f)(i): "Centrally assessed new growth" means the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(f)(i)(A): zero; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(f)(i)(B): the amount calculated by subtracting the centrally assessed benchmark value adjusted for prior year end incremental value from the taxable value of real and personal property the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property, for the current year, adjusted for current year incremental value.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(f)(ii): "Centrally assessed new growth" does not include a change in value as a result of a change in the method of apportioning the value prescribed by the Legislature, a court, or the commission in an administrative rule or administrative order.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(g): "Certified tax rate" means a tax rate that will provide the same ad valorem property tax revenue for a taxing entity as was budgeted by that taxing entity for the prior year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(h): 17C-1-102 "Community reinvestment agency" means the same as that term is defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(2): Before June 1 of each year, the county assessor of each county shall deliver to the county auditor and the commission the following statements:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(2)(a): a statement containing the aggregate valuation of all taxable real property a county assessor assesses in accordance with Part 3, County Assessment, for each taxing entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(2)(b): a statement containing the taxable value of all personal property a county assessor assesses in accordance with Part 3, County Assessment, from the prior year end values.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(3): The county auditor shall, on or before June 8, transmit to the governing body of each taxing entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(3)(a): the statements described in Subsections (2)(a) and (b);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(3)(b): an estimate of the revenue from personal property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(3)(c): the certified tax rate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(3)(d): all forms necessary to submit a tax levy request.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(a): Except as otherwise provided in this section, the certified tax rate shall be calculated by dividing the ad valorem property tax revenue that a taxing entity budgeted for the prior year minus the qualifying exempt revenue by the amount calculated under Subsection (4)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b): For purposes of Subsection (4)(a), the legislative body of a taxing entity shall calculate an amount as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(i): calculate for the taxing entity the difference between:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(i)(A): the aggregate taxable value of all property taxed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(i)(B): any adjustments for current year incremental value;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(ii): after making the calculation required by Subsection (4)(b)(i), calculate an amount determined by increasing or decreasing the amount calculated under Subsection (4)(b)(i) by the average of the percentage net change in the value of taxable property for the equalization period for the three calendar years immediately preceding the current calendar year;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(iii): after making the calculation required by Subsection (4)(b)(ii), calculate the product of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(iii)(A): the amount calculated under Subsection (4)(b)(ii); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(iii)(B): the percentage of property taxes collected for the five calendar years immediately preceding the current calendar year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(iv): after making the calculation required by Subsection (4)(b)(iii), calculate an amount determined by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(iv)(A): multiplying the percentage of property taxes collected for the five calendar years immediately preceding the current calendar year by eligible new growth; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(iv)(B): subtracting the amount calculated under Subsection (4)(b)(iv)(A) from the amount calculated under Subsection (4)(b)(iii).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(5): 17-34-1; 17-36-9; 17-34-1; 17-36-3; 59-2-913; 53F-8-301; 53F-8-302; 53F-8-303; 59-2-1602 A certified tax rate for a taxing entity described in this Subsection (5) shall be calculated as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(5)(a): except as provided in Subsection (5)(b) or (c), for a new taxing entity, the certified tax rate is zero;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(5)(b): 17-34-1; 17-36-9; 17-34-1; 17-36-3 for a municipality incorporated on or after July 1, 1996, the certified tax rate is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(5)(b)(i): 17-34-1; 17-36-9 in a county of the first, second, or third class, the levy imposed for municipal-type services under Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(5)(b)(ii): 17-34-1; 17-36-3 in a county of the fourth, fifth, or sixth class, the levy imposed for general county purposes and such other levies imposed solely for the municipal-type services identified in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(5)(c): for a community reinvestment agency that received all or a portion of a taxing entity's project area incremental revenue in the prior year under Title 17C, Chapter 1, Part 10, Agency Taxing Authority, the certified tax rate is calculated as described in Subsection (4) except that the commission shall treat the total revenue transferred to the community reinvestment agency as ad valorem property tax revenue that the taxing entity budgeted for the prior year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(5)(d): 59-2-913; 53F-8-301; 53F-8-302; 53F-8-303; 59-2-1602 for debt service voted on by the public, the certified tax rate is the actual levy imposed by that section, except that a certified tax rate for the following levies shall be calculated in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(5)(d)(i): 53F-8-301; 53F-8-302; 53F-8-303 a school levy provided for under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(5)(d)(ii): 59-2-1602 a levy to pay for the costs of state legislative mandates or judicial or administrative orders under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(6): 59-2-1328; 59-2-1330
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(6)(a): 59-2-1328; 59-2-1330 A judgment levy imposed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(6)(b): The ad valorem property tax revenue generated by a judgment levy described in Subsection (6)(a) may not be considered in establishing a taxing entity's aggregate certified tax rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7)(a): For the purpose of calculating the certified tax rate, the county auditor shall use:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7)(a)(i): the taxable value of real property:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7)(a)(i)(A): the county assessor assesses in accordance with Part 3, County Assessment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7)(a)(i)(B): contained on the assessment roll;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7)(a)(ii): the year end taxable value of personal property:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7)(a)(ii)(A): a county assessor assesses in accordance with Part 3, County Assessment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7)(a)(ii)(B): contained on the prior year's assessment roll; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7)(a)(iii): the taxable value of real and personal property the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7)(b): For purposes of Subsection (7)(a), taxable value does not include eligible new growth.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(8): 59-2-919; 59-2-919.1
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(8)(a): On or before June 30, a taxing entity shall annually adopt a tentative budget.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(8)(b): If a taxing entity intends to exceed the certified tax rate, the taxing entity shall notify the county auditor of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(8)(b)(i): the taxing entity's intent to exceed the certified tax rate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(8)(b)(ii): the amount by which the taxing entity proposes to exceed the certified tax rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(8)(c): 59-2-919; 59-2-919.1 The county auditor shall notify property owners of any intent to levy a tax rate that exceeds the certified tax rate in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(9)(a): Subject to Subsection (9)(d), the commission shall provide notice, through electronic means on or before July 31, to a taxing entity and the Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(9)(a)(i): the amount calculated under Subsection (9)(b) is 10% or more of the year end taxable value of the real and personal property the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property, for the previous year, adjusted for prior year end incremental value; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(9)(a)(ii): the amount calculated under Subsection (9)(c) is 50% or more of the total year end taxable value of the real and personal property of a taxpayer the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property, for the previous year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(9)(b): For purposes of Subsection (9)(a)(i), the commission shall calculate an amount by subtracting the taxable value of real and personal property the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property, for the current year, adjusted for current year incremental value, from the year end taxable value of the real and personal property the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property, for the previous year, adjusted for prior year end incremental value.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(9)(c): For purposes of Subsection (9)(a)(ii), the commission shall calculate an amount by subtracting the total taxable value of real and personal property of a taxpayer the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property, for the current year, from the total year end taxable value of the real and personal property of a taxpayer the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property, for the previous year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(9)(d): The notification under Subsection (9)(a) shall include a list of taxpayers that meet the requirement under Subsection (9)(a)(ii).


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924 Definitions -- Report of valuation of property to county auditor and commission -- Transmittal by auditor to governing bodies -- Calculation of certified tax rate -- Rulemaking authority -- Adoption of tentative budget -- Notice provided by the commission.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1): 17C-1-102; 11-58-201; 11-58-102; 11-59-201; 11-59-207; 11-70-201; 11-70-101; 17C-1-201.5; 17C-1-102; 63H-1-201; 63H-1-102; 63N-2-502; 63N-3-602; 10-9a-1001; 17-27a-1201; 63N-3-1601; 17C-1-102; 63N-2-502; 63N-2-502; 63N-2-502; 11-58-201; 11-59-201; 11-59-207; 11-70-201; 11-70-101; 17C-1-201.5; 63H-1-201; 59-2-704; 59-2-103; 11-58-201; 11-58-102; 11-70-201; 11-70-101; 17C-1-201.5; 17C-1-102; 63H-1-201; 63H-1-102; 11-58-201; 11-59-201; 11-59-207; 11-70-201; 17C-1-201.5; 63H-1-201; 17C-1-1001; 63H-1-102; 11-58-102; 59-2-1115; 17C-1-201.5; 17C-1-102; 63N-3-602; 10-9a-1001; 17-27a-1201; 63N-3-1601 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(a)(i): "Ad valorem property tax revenue" means revenue collected in accordance with this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(a)(ii): "Ad valorem property tax revenue" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(a)(ii)(A): interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(a)(ii)(B): penalties;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(a)(ii)(C): collections from redemptions; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(a)(ii)(D): revenue received by a taxing entity from personal property that is semiconductor manufacturing equipment assessed by a county assessor in accordance with Part 3, County Assessment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(b): 17C-1-102 "Adjusted tax increment" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(c)(i): "Aggregate taxable value of all property taxed" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(c)(i)(A): the aggregate taxable value of all real property a county assessor assesses in accordance with Part 3, County Assessment, for the current year;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(c)(i)(B): the aggregate taxable value of all real and personal property the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property, for the current year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(c)(i)(C): the aggregate year end taxable value of all personal property a county assessor assesses in accordance with Part 3, County Assessment, contained on the prior year's tax rolls of the taxing entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(c)(ii): "Aggregate taxable value of all property taxed" does not include the aggregate year end taxable value of personal property that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(c)(ii)(A): semiconductor manufacturing equipment assessed by a county assessor in accordance with Part 3, County Assessment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(c)(ii)(B): contained on the prior year's tax rolls of the taxing entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(d): 11-58-201; 11-58-102; 11-59-201; 11-59-207; 11-70-201; 11-70-101; 17C-1-201.5; 17C-1-102; 63H-1-201; 63H-1-102; 63N-2-502; 63N-3-602; 10-9a-1001; 17-27a-1201; 63N-3-1601 "Base taxable value" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(d)(i): 11-58-201; 11-58-102 for an authority created under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(e): "Centrally assessed benchmark value" means an amount equal to the average year end taxable value of real and personal property the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property, for the previous three calendar years, adjusted for taxable value attributable to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(e)(i): an annexation to a taxing entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(e)(ii): an incorrect allocation of taxable value of real or personal property the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(e)(iii): a change in value as a result of a change in the method of apportioning the value prescribed by the Legislature, a court, or the commission in an administrative rule or administrative order.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(f): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(f)(i): "Centrally assessed new growth" means the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(f)(i)(A): zero; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(f)(i)(B): the amount calculated by subtracting the centrally assessed benchmark value adjusted for prior year end incremental value from the taxable value of real and personal property the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property, for the current year, adjusted for current year incremental value.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(f)(ii): "Centrally assessed new growth" does not include a change in value as a result of a change in the method of apportioning the value prescribed by the Legislature, a court, or the commission in an administrative rule or administrative order.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(g): "Certified tax rate" means a tax rate that will provide the same ad valorem property tax revenue for a taxing entity as was budgeted by that taxing entity for the prior year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(h): 17C-1-102 "Community reinvestment agency" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(i): "Eligible new growth" means the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(i)(i): zero; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(i)(ii): the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(i)(ii)(A): locally assessed new growth;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(i)(ii)(B): centrally assessed new growth; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(i)(ii)(C): project area new growth or hotel property new growth.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(j): 63N-2-502 "Host local government" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(k): 63N-2-502 "Hotel property" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(l): "Hotel property new growth" means an amount equal to the incremental value that is no longer provided to a host local government as incremental property tax revenue.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(m): 63N-2-502 "Incremental property tax revenue" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n): 11-58-201; 11-59-201; 11-59-207; 11-70-201; 11-70-101; 17C-1-201.5; 63H-1-201 "Incremental value" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(i): 11-58-201 for an authority created under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(i)(A): the difference between the taxable value and the base taxable value of the property that is located within a project area and on which property tax differential is collected; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(i)(B): the number that represents the percentage of the property tax differential that is paid to the authority;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(ii): 11-59-201; 11-59-207 for the Point of the Mountain State Land Authority created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(ii)(A): the difference between the current assessed value of the property and the base taxable value; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(ii)(B): 11-59-207 the number that represents the percentage of the property tax augmentation, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(iii): 11-70-201; 11-70-101 for the Utah Fairpark Area Investment and Restoration District created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(iii)(A): the difference between the taxable value for the current year and the base taxable value of the property that is located within a project area; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(iii)(B): 11-70-101 the number that represents the percentage of enhanced property tax revenue, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(iv): 17C-1-201.5 for an agency created under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(iv)(A): the difference between the taxable value and the base taxable value of the property located within a project area and on which tax increment is collected; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(iv)(B): the number that represents the adjusted tax increment from that project area that is paid to the agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(v): 63H-1-201 for an authority created under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(v)(A): the difference between the taxable value and the base taxable value of the property located within a project area and on which property tax allocation is collected; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(v)(B): the number that represents the percentage of the property tax allocation from that project area that is paid to the authority;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(vi): for a housing and transit reinvestment zone created pursuant to Title 63N, Chapter 3, Part 6, Housing and Transit Reinvestment Zone Act, an amount calculated by multiplying:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(vi)(A): the difference between the taxable value and the base taxable value of the property that is located within a housing and transit reinvestment zone and on which tax increment is collected; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(vi)(B): the number that represents the percentage of the tax increment that is paid to the housing and transit reinvestment zone;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(vii): for a host local government, an amount calculated by multiplying:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(vii)(A): the difference between the taxable value and the base taxable value of the hotel property on which incremental property tax revenue is collected; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(vii)(B): the number that represents the percentage of the incremental property tax revenue from that hotel property that is paid to the host local government;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(viii): for a home ownership promotion zone created under Title 10, Chapter 9a, Part 10, Home Ownership Promotion Zone for Municipalities, or Title 17, Chapter 27a, Part 12, Home Ownership Promotion Zone for Counties, an amount calculated by multiplying:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(viii)(A): the difference between the taxable value and the base taxable value of the property that is located within a home ownership promotion zone and on which tax increment is collected; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(viii)(B): the number that represents the percentage of the tax increment that is paid to the home ownership promotion zone; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(ix): for a first home investment zone created pursuant to Title 63N, Chapter 3, Part 16, First Home Investment Zone Act, an amount calculated by multiplying:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(ix)(A): the difference between the taxable value and the base taxable value of the property that is located within a first home investment zone and on which tax increment is collected; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(n)(ix)(B): the number that represents the percentage of the tax increment that is paid to the first home investment zone.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(1)(u)(iv): on the aggregate 2021 year end taxable value of the tangible personal property that exceeds $15,300.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(2): Before June 1 of each year, the county assessor of each county shall deliver to the county auditor and the commission the following statements:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(2)(a): a statement containing the aggregate valuation of all taxable real property a county assessor assesses in accordance with Part 3, County Assessment, for each taxing entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(2)(b): a statement containing the taxable value of all personal property a county assessor assesses in accordance with Part 3, County Assessment, from the prior year end values.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(3): The county auditor shall, on or before June 8, transmit to the governing body of each taxing entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(3)(a): the statements described in Subsections (2)(a) and (b);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(3)(b): an estimate of the revenue from personal property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(3)(c): the certified tax rate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(3)(d): all forms necessary to submit a tax levy request.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(a): Except as otherwise provided in this section, the certified tax rate shall be calculated by dividing the ad valorem property tax revenue that a taxing entity budgeted for the prior year minus the qualifying exempt revenue by the amount calculated under Subsection (4)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b): For purposes of Subsection (4)(a), the legislative body of a taxing entity shall calculate an amount as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(i): calculate for the taxing entity the difference between:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(i)(A): the aggregate taxable value of all property taxed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(i)(B): any adjustments for current year incremental value;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(ii): after making the calculation required by Subsection (4)(b)(i), calculate an amount determined by increasing or decreasing the amount calculated under Subsection (4)(b)(i) by the average of the percentage net change in the value of taxable property for the equalization period for the three calendar years immediately preceding the current calendar year;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(iii): after making the calculation required by Subsection (4)(b)(ii), calculate the product of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(iii)(A): the amount calculated under Subsection (4)(b)(ii); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(iii)(B): the percentage of property taxes collected for the five calendar years immediately preceding the current calendar year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(iv): after making the calculation required by Subsection (4)(b)(iii), calculate an amount determined by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(iv)(A): multiplying the percentage of property taxes collected for the five calendar years immediately preceding the current calendar year by eligible new growth; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(4)(b)(iv)(B): subtracting the amount calculated under Subsection (4)(b)(iv)(A) from the amount calculated under Subsection (4)(b)(iii).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(5): 17-34-1; 17-36-9; 17-34-1; 17-36-3; 59-2-913; 53F-8-301; 53F-8-302; 53F-8-303; 59-2-1602 A certified tax rate for a taxing entity described in this Subsection (5) shall be calculated as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(5)(a): except as provided in Subsection (5)(b) or (c), for a new taxing entity, the certified tax rate is zero;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(5)(b): 17-34-1; 17-36-9; 17-34-1; 17-36-3 for a municipality incorporated on or after July 1, 1996, the certified tax rate is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(5)(b)(i): 17-34-1; 17-36-9 in a county of the first, second, or third class, the levy imposed for municipal-type services under Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(5)(b)(ii): 17-34-1; 17-36-3 in a county of the fourth, fifth, or sixth class, the levy imposed for general county purposes and such other levies imposed solely for the municipal-type services identified in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(5)(c): for a community reinvestment agency that received all or a portion of a taxing entity's project area incremental revenue in the prior year under Title 17C, Chapter 1, Part 10, Agency Taxing Authority, the certified tax rate is calculated as described in Subsection (4) except that the commission shall treat the total revenue transferred to the community reinvestment agency as ad valorem property tax revenue that the taxing entity budgeted for the prior year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(5)(d): 59-2-913; 53F-8-301; 53F-8-302; 53F-8-303; 59-2-1602 for debt service voted on by the public, the certified tax rate is the actual levy imposed by that section, except that a certified tax rate for the following levies shall be calculated in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(5)(d)(i): 53F-8-301; 53F-8-302; 53F-8-303 a school levy provided for under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(5)(d)(ii): 59-2-1602 a levy to pay for the costs of state legislative mandates or judicial or administrative orders under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(6): 59-2-1328; 59-2-1330
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(6)(a): 59-2-1328; 59-2-1330 A judgment levy imposed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(6)(b): The ad valorem property tax revenue generated by a judgment levy described in Subsection (6)(a) may not be considered in establishing a taxing entity's aggregate certified tax rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7)(a): For the purpose of calculating the certified tax rate, the county auditor shall use:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7)(a)(i): the taxable value of real property:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7)(a)(i)(A): the county assessor assesses in accordance with Part 3, County Assessment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7)(a)(i)(B): contained on the assessment roll;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7)(a)(ii): the year end taxable value of personal property:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7)(a)(ii)(A): a county assessor assesses in accordance with Part 3, County Assessment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7)(a)(ii)(B): contained on the prior year's assessment roll; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7)(a)(iii): the taxable value of real and personal property the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(7)(b): For purposes of Subsection (7)(a), taxable value does not include eligible new growth.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(8): 59-2-919; 59-2-919.1
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(8)(a): On or before June 30, a taxing entity shall annually adopt a tentative budget.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(8)(b): If a taxing entity intends to exceed the certified tax rate, the taxing entity shall notify the county auditor of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(8)(b)(i): the taxing entity's intent to exceed the certified tax rate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(8)(b)(ii): the amount by which the taxing entity proposes to exceed the certified tax rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(8)(c): 59-2-919; 59-2-919.1 The county auditor shall notify property owners of any intent to levy a tax rate that exceeds the certified tax rate in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(9)(a): Subject to Subsection (9)(d), the commission shall provide notice, through electronic means on or before July 31, to a taxing entity and the Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(9)(a)(i): the amount calculated under Subsection (9)(b) is 10% or more of the year end taxable value of the real and personal property the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property, for the previous year, adjusted for prior year end incremental value; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(9)(a)(ii): the amount calculated under Subsection (9)(c) is 50% or more of the total year end taxable value of the real and personal property of a taxpayer the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property, for the previous year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(9)(b): For purposes of Subsection (9)(a)(i), the commission shall calculate an amount by subtracting the taxable value of real and personal property the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property, for the current year, adjusted for current year incremental value, from the year end taxable value of the real and personal property the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property, for the previous year, adjusted for prior year end incremental value.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(9)(c): For purposes of Subsection (9)(a)(ii), the commission shall calculate an amount by subtracting the total taxable value of real and personal property of a taxpayer the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property, for the current year, from the total year end taxable value of the real and personal property of a taxpayer the commission assesses in accordance with Part 2, Assessment of Property, for the previous year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924(9)(d): The notification under Subsection (9)(a) shall include a list of taxpayers that meet the requirement under Subsection (9)(a)(ii).


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.1 Definitions -- Commission authorized to adjust taxing entity's certified rate for clerical error -- Requirements -- Amount of adjustment.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.1(1): For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.1(1)(a): "Clerical error" means the following in an assessment roll:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.1(1)(a)(i): an omission;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.1(1)(a)(ii): an error; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.1(1)(a)(iii): a defect in form.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.1(1)(b): "Year" means the period beginning on January 1 and ending on December 31 during which there is a clerical error on the taxing entity's assessment roll.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.1(2): (3); 59-2-1317; 59-2-1365 The commission shall adjust a taxing entity's certified tax rate as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.1(2)(a): the taxing entity's assessment roll contained a clerical error;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.1(2)(b): the county adjusted the clerical error on the assessment roll;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.1(2)(c): the taxing entity's actual collections for the year were different than the taxing entity's budgeted collections for the year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.1(2)(d): 59-2-1317; 59-2-1365 the taxing entity notified the county legislative body of the clerical error after the county treasurer provided the tax notices under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.1(3): (2); (2); 59-2-1365
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.1(3)(a): (2) The adjustment under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.1(3)(a)(i): the difference between the taxing entity's budgeted collections for the year and the taxing entity's actual collections for the year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.1(3)(a)(ii): the amount of the clerical error.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.1(3)(b): (2); 59-2-1365 The commission shall make an adjustment under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(a)(iii)(A): calculating, for each participating county and each participating municipality, the property tax revenue necessary:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(a)(iii)(A)(I): in the case of a fire district, to cover all of the costs associated with providing fire protection, paramedic, and emergency services:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(a)(iii)(A)(I)(Aa): for a participating county, in the unincorporated area of the county; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(a)(iii)(A)(I)(Bb): for a participating municipality, in the municipality; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(a)(iii)(A)(II): in the case of a police district, to cover all the costs:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(a)(iii)(A)(II)(Aa): associated with providing law enforcement service:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(a)(iii)(A)(II)(Aa)(Ii): for a participating county, in the unincorporated area of the county; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(a)(iii)(A)(II)(Aa)(IIii): for a participating municipality, in the municipality; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(a)(iii)(A)(II)(Bb): that the police district board designates as the costs to be funded by a property tax; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(a)(iii)(B): 59-2-913 adding all the amounts calculated under Subsection (6)(a)(iii)(A) for all participating counties and all participating municipalities and then dividing that sum by the aggregate taxable value of the property, as adjusted in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(a)(iii)(B)(I): for participating counties, in the unincorporated area of all participating counties; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(a)(iii)(B)(II): for participating municipalities, in all the participating municipalities.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(a)(iv): 17B-1-214 "Fire district" means a service area under Title 17B, Chapter 2a, Part 9, Service Area Act:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(a)(iv)(A): created to provide fire protection, paramedic, and emergency services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(a)(iv)(B): 17B-1-214 in the creation of which an election was not required under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(a)(vi): "Participating municipality" means a municipality whose area is included within a public safety district at the time of the creation of the public safety district.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(a)(ix)(A): in the case of a public safety district that is a fire district, fire protection, paramedic, and emergency services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(a)(ix)(B): in the case of a public safety district that is a police district, law enforcement service.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(b): In the first year following creation of a public safety district, the certified tax rate of each participating county and each participating municipality shall be decreased by the amount of the equalized public safety tax rate.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(c)(i): for public safety service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(c)(ii): in:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-924.2(6)(c)(ii)(B): for a taxing entity operating under a July 1 through June 30 fiscal year, the prior fiscal year.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-926 Proposed tax increase by state -- Notice -- Contents -- Dates.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If the state authorizes a tax rate that exceeds the combined basic rate described in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 59-2-926(1): 59-2-924; 45-1-101; (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-926(1)(a): 59-2-924; 45-1-101 The Office of the Legislative Fiscal Analyst shall advertise that the state authorized a levy that generates revenue in excess of the previous year's ad valorem tax revenue, plus eligible new growth as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-926(1)(a)(i): in a newspaper of general circulation in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-926(1)(a)(ii): 45-1-101 as required in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-926(1)(b): (1)(a) Except an advertisement published on a website, the advertisement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-926(1)(b)(i): shall be no less than 1/4 page in size and the type used shall be no smaller than 18 point, and surrounded by a 1/4-inch border;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-926(1)(b)(ii): may not be placed in that portion of the newspaper where legal notices and classified advertisements appear; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-926(1)(b)(iii): shall be run once.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-926(2): The form and content of the notice shall be substantially as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-926(2)(a): $__________ of the increase will come from (provide an explanation of the cause of adjustment or increased revenues, such as reappraisals or factoring orders);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-926(2)(b): $__________ of the increase will come from natural increases in the value of the tax base due to (explain cause of eligible new growth, such as new building activity, annexation, etc.); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-926(2)(c): a home valued at $100,000 in the state of Utah which based on last year's (levy for the basic state-supported school program, applicable tax rate for the Property Tax Valuation Fund, or both) paid $____________ in property taxes would pay the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-926(2)(c)(i): $__________ if the state of Utah did not budget an increase in property tax revenue exclusive of eligible new growth; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-926(2)(c)(ii): $__________ under the increased property tax revenues exclusive of eligible new growth budgeted by the state of Utah."


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001 County board of equalization -- Public hearings -- Hearing officers -- Notice of decision -- Rulemaking.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(1): The county legislative body is the county board of equalization and the county auditor is the clerk of the county board of equalization.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(2): The county board of equalization shall adjust and equalize the valuation and assessment of the real and personal property within the county, subject to regulation and control by the commission, as prescribed by law.  The county board of equalization shall meet and hold public hearings each year to examine the assessment roll and equalize the assessment of property in the county, including the assessment for general taxes of all taxing entities located in the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(3): (3)(d); Title 61, Chapter 2g, Real Estate Appraiser Licensing and Certification Act; Title 61, Chapter 2g, Real Estate Appraiser Licensing and Certification Act; (3)(d); (3)(c)(i); (3)(c)(ii); (3)(c)(i); (3)(c); Title 63G, Chapter 22, State Training and Certification Requirements
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(3)(a): (3)(d); Title 61, Chapter 2g, Real Estate Appraiser Licensing and Certification Act; Title 61, Chapter 2g, Real Estate Appraiser Licensing and Certification Act Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(3)(a)(i): Title 61, Chapter 2g, Real Estate Appraiser Licensing and Certification Act appoint an appraiser licensed in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(3)(a)(ii): Title 61, Chapter 2g, Real Estate Appraiser Licensing and Certification Act appoint an individual who is not licensed in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(3)(a)(ii)(A): real estate;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(3)(a)(ii)(B): finance;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(3)(a)(ii)(C): economics;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(3)(a)(ii)(D): public administration; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(3)(a)(ii)(E): law.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(3)(b): (3)(d); (3)(c)(i); (3)(c)(ii) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(3)(b)(i): (3)(c)(i) develops in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(3)(b)(ii): (3)(c)(ii) approves in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(3)(c): (3)(c)(i); (3)(c); Title 63G, Chapter 22, State Training and Certification Requirements
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(3)(c)(i): On or before January 1, 2014, the commission shall develop a hearing officer training course that includes training in property valuation and administrative law.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(3)(c)(ii): (3)(c)(i) In addition to the course the commission develops in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(3)(c)(iii): (3)(c); Title 63G, Chapter 22, State Training and Certification Requirements The commission shall ensure that any training described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(3)(d): A county board of equalization may not appoint a person employed by an assessor's office as a hearing officer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(3)(e): A hearing officer shall transmit the hearing officer's findings to the board, where a quorum shall be required for final action upon any application for exemption, deferral, reduction, or abatement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(4): The clerk of the board of equalization shall notify the taxpayer, in writing, of any decision of the board.  The decision shall include any adjustment in the amount of taxes due on the property resulting from a change in the taxable value and shall be considered the corrected tax notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(5): During the session of the board, the assessor or any deputy whose testimony is needed shall be present and may make any statement or introduce and examine witnesses on questions before the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1001(6): The county board of equalization may make and enforce any rule which is consistent with statute or commission rule and necessary for the government of the board, the preservation of order, and the transaction of business.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1002 Change in assessment -- Force and effect -- Additional assessments -- Notice.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1002(1): The county board of equalization shall use all information it may gain from the records of the county or elsewhere in equalizing the assessment of the property in the county or in determining any exemptions.  The board may require the assessor to enter upon the assessment roll any taxable property which has not been assessed and any assessment made has the same force and effect as if made by the assessor before the delivery of the assessment roll to the county treasurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1002(2): During its sessions, the county board of equalization may direct the assessor to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1002(2)(a): assess any taxable property which has escaped assessment;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1002(2)(b): add to the amount, number, or quantity of property when a false or incomplete list has been rendered; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1002(2)(c): make and enter new assessments, at the same time cancelling previous entries, when any assessment made by the assessor is considered by the board to be incomplete or incorrect.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1002(3): 59-2-301.4(2) The clerk of the board of equalization shall give written notice:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1002(3)(a): to all interested persons of the day fixed for the investigation of any assessment under consideration by the board at least 30 days before action is taken; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1002(3)(b): 59-2-301.4(2) to the assessor of a valuation adjustment made in accordance with Subsection

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
