Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1201 Purpose of part.
------------------------------------------------
The purpose of this part is to provide general property tax relief for certain persons who own or rent their places of residence through a system of tax credits, refunds, and appropriations from the General Fund.  The relief is to offset in part the general tax burden, a significant portion of which, directly or indirectly, is represented by property tax.  Accordingly, the tax relief provided by this part is determined in part by reference to the property tax assessment and collection mechanisms, but, however, is not limited to property tax relief nor is it formulated upon the Legislature's power to relieve those taxes.  It is for the general relief of all taxes.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(1)(a): "Claimant" means a homeowner or renter who:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(1)(a)(i): files a claim under this part for a residence;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(1)(a)(ii): is domiciled in this state for the entire calendar year for which a claim for relief is filed under this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(1)(a)(iii): on or before December 31 of the year for which a claim for relief is filed under this part, is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(1)(a)(iii)(A): 66 years old or older if the individual was born on or before December 31, 1959; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(1)(a)(iii)(B): 67 years old or older if the individual was born on or after January 1, 1960.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(1)(b): Notwithstanding Subsection (1)(a), "claimant" includes a surviving spouse:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(1)(b)(i): regardless of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(1)(b)(i)(A): the age of the surviving spouse; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(1)(b)(i)(B): the age of the deceased spouse at the time of death;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(1)(b)(ii): if the surviving spouse meets the requirements of this part except for the age requirement;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(1)(b)(iii): if the surviving spouse is part of the same household of the deceased spouse at the time of death of the deceased spouse; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(1)(b)(iv): if the surviving spouse is unmarried at the time the surviving spouse files the claim.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(1)(c): If two or more individuals of a household are able to meet the qualifications for a claimant, they may determine among them as to who the claimant shall be, but if they are unable to agree, the matter shall be referred to the county legislative body for a determination of the claimant of an owned residence and to the commission for a determination of the claimant of a rented residence.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(2): "Consumer price index housing" means the Consumer Price Index - All Urban Consumers, Housing United States Cities Average, published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics of the United States Department of Labor.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(3)(a): "Gross rent" means rent actually paid in cash or its equivalent solely for the right of occupancy, at arm's-length, of a residence, exclusive of charges for any utilities, services, furniture, furnishings, or personal appliances furnished by the landlord as a part of the rental agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(3)(b): If a claimant occupies two or more residences in the year, "gross rent" means the total rent paid for the residences during the one-year period for which the renter files a claim under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(4)(a): "Homeowner" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(4)(a)(i): an individual whose name is listed on the deed of a residence; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(4)(a)(ii): if a residence is owned in a qualifying trust, an individual who is a grantor, trustor, or settlor or holds another similar role in the trust.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(4)(b): "Homeowner" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(4)(b)(i): if a residence is owned by any type of entity other than a qualifying trust, an individual who holds an ownership interest in that entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(4)(b)(ii): an individual who is listed on a deed of a residence along with an entity other than a qualifying trust.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(5): "Homeowner's credit" means a credit against a claimant's property tax liability.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(6): "Household" means the association of individuals who live in the same dwelling, sharing the dwelling's furnishings, facilities, accommodations, and expenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(7)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (7)(b), "household income" means all income received by all members of a claimant's household in:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(7)(a)(i): for a claimant who owns a residence, the calendar year preceding the calendar year in which property taxes are due; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(7)(a)(ii): for a claimant who rents a residence, the year for which a claim is filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(7)(b): "Household income" does not include income received by a member of a claimant's household who is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(7)(b)(i): under the age of 18; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(7)(b)(ii): a parent or a grandparent, through blood, marriage, or adoption, of the claimant or the claimant's spouse.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(8): "Income" means the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(8)(a): federal adjusted gross income as defined in Section 62, Internal Revenue Code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(8)(b): nontaxable income.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(a): "Nontaxable income" means amounts excluded from adjusted gross income under the Internal Revenue Code, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(a)(i): capital gains;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(a)(ii): loss carry forwards claimed during the taxable year in which a claimant files for relief under this part or Part 18, Tax Deferral and Tax Abatement;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(a)(iii): depreciation claimed pursuant to the Internal Revenue Code by a claimant on the residence for which the claimant files for relief under this part or Part 18, Tax Deferral and Tax Abatement;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(a)(iv): support money received;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(a)(v): nontaxable strike benefits;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(a)(vi): the gross amount of a pension or annuity, including benefits under the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974, 45 U.S.C. Sec. 231 et seq., and veterans disability pensions;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(a)(vii): except for payments described in Subsection (9)(b)(vi), payments received under the Social Security Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(a)(viii): state unemployment insurance amounts;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(a)(ix): nontaxable interest received from any source;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(a)(x): workers' compensation;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(a)(xi): the gross amount of "loss of time" insurance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(a)(xii): voluntary contributions to a tax-deferred retirement plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(b): "Nontaxable income" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(b)(i): public assistance;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(b)(ii): aid, assistance, or contributions from a tax-exempt nongovernmental source;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(b)(iii): surplus foods;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(b)(iv): relief in kind supplied by a public or private agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(b)(v): relief provided under this part or Part 18, Tax Deferral and Tax Abatement;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(b)(vi): Social Security Disability Income payments received under the Social Security Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(b)(vii): federal tax refunds;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(b)(viii): federal child tax credits received under 26 U.S.C. Sec. 24;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(b)(ix): federal earned income tax credits received under 26 U.S.C. Sec. 32;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(b)(x): payments received under a reverse mortgage;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(b)(xi): payments or reimbursements to senior program volunteers under 42 U.S.C. Sec. 5058; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(9)(b)(xii): gifts or bequests.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(10): 59-2-103
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(10)(a): "Property taxes accrued" means property taxes, exclusive of special assessments, delinquent interest, and charges for service, levied on 35% of the fair market value, as reflected on the assessment roll, of a claimant's residence in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(10)(b): For a mobile home, "property taxes accrued" includes taxes imposed on both the land upon which the home is situated and on the structure of the home itself, whether classified as real property or personal property taxes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(10)(c): 59-2-103 The relief described in Subsection (10)(a) constitutes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(10)(c)(i): a tax abatement for the poor in accordance with Utah Constitution, Article XIII,
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(10)(c)(ii): 59-2-103 the residential exemption provided for in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(10)(d): For purposes of this Subsection (10), property taxes accrued are levied on the lien date.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(10)(e): When a household owns and occupies two or more different residences in this state in the same calendar year, and neither residence is acquired or sold during the calendar year for which relief is claimed under this part, property taxes accrued shall relate only to the residence occupied on the lien date by the household as the household's principal place of residence.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(10)(f): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(10)(f)(i): If a residence is an integral part of a large unit such as a farm or a multipurpose or multidwelling building, property taxes accrued shall be calculated on the percentage that the value of the residence is of the total value of the unit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(10)(f)(ii): For purposes of this Subsection (10)(f), "unit" refers to the parcel of property covered by a single tax statement of which the residence is a part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(11): 35A-1-102 "Public assistance" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(11)(a): medical assistance provided under Title 26B, Chapter 3, Health Care - Administration and Assistance;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(11)(b): 35A-1-102 SNAP benefits as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(11)(c): services or benefits provided under Title 35A, Chapter 3, Employment Support Act; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(11)(d): foster care maintenance payments provided from the General Fund or under Title IV-E of the Social Security Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(12): "Qualifying trust" means a trust holding title to real or tangible personal property for which an individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(12)(a): makes a claim under this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(12)(b): proves to the satisfaction of the county that title to the portion of the trust will revest in the individual upon the exercise of a power:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(12)(b)(i): by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(12)(b)(i)(A): the individual as grantor, trustor, settlor, or in another similar role of the trust;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(12)(b)(i)(B): a nonadverse party; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(12)(b)(i)(C): both the individual and a nonadverse party; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(12)(b)(ii): regardless of whether the power is a power:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(12)(b)(ii)(A): to revoke;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(12)(b)(ii)(B): to terminate;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(12)(b)(ii)(C): to alter;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(12)(b)(ii)(D): to amend; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(12)(b)(ii)(E): to appoint; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(12)(c): is obligated to pay the taxes on that portion of the trust property beginning January 1 of the year the individual makes the claim.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(13): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(13)(a): "Rental assistance payment" means any payment that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(13)(a)(i): is made by a:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(13)(a)(i)(A): governmental entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(13)(a)(i)(B): charitable organization; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(13)(a)(i)(C): religious organization; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(13)(a)(ii): is specifically designated for the payment of rent of a claimant:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(13)(a)(ii)(A): for the calendar year for which the claimant seeks a renter's credit under this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(13)(a)(ii)(B): regardless of whether the payment is made to the claimant or the landlord.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(13)(b): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission may make rules defining the terms:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(13)(b)(i): "governmental entity";
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(13)(b)(ii): "charitable organization"; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(13)(b)(iii): "religious organization."
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(14): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(14)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(14)(a)(i): "Residence" means the dwelling in this state, whether owned or rented, and so much of the land surrounding the dwelling, not exceeding one acre, as is reasonably necessary for use of the dwelling as a home.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(14)(a)(ii): "Residence" includes a dwelling that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(14)(a)(ii)(A): a part of a multidwelling or multipurpose building and a part of the land upon which the multidwelling or multipurpose building is built; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(14)(a)(ii)(B): a mobile home or houseboat.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(14)(b): "Residence" does not include personal property such as furniture, furnishings, or appliances.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1202(14)(c): For purposes of this Subsection (14), "owned" includes a vendee in possession under a land contract or one or more joint tenants or tenants in common.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1203 Right to file claim -- Death of claimant.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1203(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1203(1)(a): The right to file a claim under this part is personal to the claimant.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1203(1)(b): The right to file a claim does not survive the claimant's death.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1203(1)(c): The right to file a claim may be exercised on behalf of a claimant by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1203(1)(c)(i): a legal guardian of the claimant; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1203(1)(c)(ii): an attorney-in-fact of the claimant.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1203(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1203(2)(a): If a claimant dies after having filed a timely claim, the amount of the claim shall be disbursed to another member of the household as determined by the commission by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1203(2)(b): (2)(a) If the claimant described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1203(3): If the claimant is the grantor, trustor, or settlor of or holds another similar role in a qualifying trust and the claimant meets the requirements of this part, the claimant may claim the portion of the credit and be treated as the owner of that portion of the property held in trust.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1203(4): 59-2-1202(10)(a); 59-2-1206 The relief described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1204 Renter's and homeowner's credits authorized -- No interest allowed.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1204(3): Interest is not allowed on any payment made to a renter's or homeowner's credit claimant under this part.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1205 Time for filing claim for renter's credit.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
No claim with respect to a renter's credit may be paid or allowed unless the claim is actually filed with, and in the possession of, the commission on or before December 31 of each calendar year.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1206 Application for homeowner's credit -- Time for filing -- Payment from General Fund.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1207 Claim applied against tax liability -- One claimant per household per year.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1207(2): Only one claimant per household per year is entitled to payment under this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1209 Amount of renter's credit -- Cost-of-living adjustment -- Renter's credit may be claimed only for gross rent that does not constitute a rental assistance payment -- Calculation of credit when rent includes utilities -- Limitation -- General Fund as source of credit -- Maximum credit.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1209(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1209(1)(a): Subject to Subsections (2) and (3), for a calendar year beginning on or after January 1, 2021, a claimant may claim a renter's credit for the previous calendar year that does not exceed the following amounts:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1209(1)(b): For a calendar year beginning on or after January 1, 2022, the commission shall increase or decrease the household income eligibility amounts under Subsection (1)(a) by a percentage equal to the percentage difference between the Consumer Price Index housing for the preceding calendar year and the Consumer Price Index housing for calendar year 2020.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1209(2): A claimant may claim a renter's credit under this part only for gross rent that does not constitute a rental assistance payment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1209(3): 59-2-1213 For purposes of calculating gross rent when a claimant's rent includes electricity or natural gas and the utility amount is not itemized in the statement provided in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1209(3)(a): 7% of rent if the rent includes electricity or natural gas but not both; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1209(3)(b): 13% of rent if the rent includes both electricity and natural gas.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1209(4): An individual may not receive the renter's credit under this section if the individual is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1209(4)(a): claimed as a personal exemption on another individual's federal income tax return during any portion of a calendar year for which the individual seeks to claim the renter's credit under this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1209(4)(b): a dependent with respect to whom another individual claims a tax credit under Section 24(h)(4), Internal Revenue Code, during any portion of a calendar year for which the individual seeks to claim the renter's credit under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1209(5): 59-2-1204 A payment for a renter's credit allowed by this section, and provided for in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1209(6): 59-2-1208 A credit under this section may not exceed the maximum amount allowed as a homeowner's credit for each income bracket under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1211 Commission to provide forms and instructions -- County may prepare forms and instructions -- County legislative body authority to adopt rules or ordinances.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1211(1): The commission shall prescribe and make available suitable forms and instructions for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1211(1)(a): claimants; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1211(1)(b): counties.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1211(2): (1) A county is not required to use the forms and instructions prescribed by the commission under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1211(2)(a): this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1211(2)(b): rules adopted by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1211(3): The county legislative body may adopt rules or ordinances to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1211(3)(a): effectuate the property tax relief under this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1211(3)(b): designate one or more persons to perform the functions given the county under this part.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1213 Statement required of renter claimant.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Every renter claimant under this part shall supply to the commission, in support of the claim, a statement showing reasonable proof of rent paid, the name and address of the owner or managing agent of the property rented, and any changes of residence.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1214 Redetermination of claim by commission or county.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1214(1): If, on the audit of any claim filed under this part, the commission or the county determines the amount has been incorrectly determined, the commission or the county shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1214(1)(a): redetermine the claim; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1214(1)(b): notify the claimant of the redetermination and its reason for the redetermination.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1214(2): (1)(a); (1)(b) The redetermination provided in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1215 Fraudulent or negligently prepared claim -- Penalties and interest -- Procedure.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1215(1): (1)(a)(iii)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1215(1)(a): (1)(a)(iii) If the commission or the county determines that a claim is excessive and was filed with fraudulent intent:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1215(1)(a)(i): the claim shall be disallowed in full;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1215(1)(a)(ii): the credit shall be cancelled;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1215(1)(a)(iii): the amount paid or claimed shall be recovered by assessment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1215(1)(a)(iv): (1)(a)(iii) the assessment provided for in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1215(1)(a)(iv)(A): from the date of the claim;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1215(1)(a)(iv)(B): until refunded or paid; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1215(1)(a)(iv)(C): at the rate of 1% per month.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1215(1)(b): The claimant, and any person who assists in the preparation or filing of an excessive claim or supplies information upon which an excessive claim was prepared, with fraudulent intent, is guilty of a class A misdemeanor.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1215(2): (2)(b) If the commission or the county determines that a claim is excessive and negligently prepared:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1215(2)(a): 10% of the corrected claim shall be disallowed;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1215(2)(b): the proper portion of any amount paid shall be similarly recovered by assessment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1215(2)(c): (2)(b) the assessment provided for in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1216 Rented homestead -- Rent constituting property taxes.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If a homestead is rented by a person from another person under circumstances deemed by the commission to be not at arm's-length, the commission may determine rent as at arm's-length, and the determination shall be final unless appealed within 30 days.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1217 Denial of relief -- Appeal.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Any person aggrieved by the denial in whole or in part of relief claimed under this part, except when the denial is based upon late filing of claim for relief, may appeal the denial to the commission by filing a petition within 30 days after the denial.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1219 Claim disallowed if residence obtained for purpose of receiving benefits.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A claim shall be disallowed if the commission or county finds that the claimant received title to a residence primarily for the purpose of receiving benefits under this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1220 Extension of time for filing application -- Rulemaking authority -- County authority to make refunds.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1220(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1220(1)(a): The commission or a county may extend the time for filing an application until December 31 of the year the application is required to be filed if, subject to any rules made by the commission under Subsection (1)(b), the commission or county finds that good cause exists to extend the deadline.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1220(1)(b): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission may make rules to establish the circumstances under which the commission or a county may, for good cause, extend the deadline for filing an application under Subsection (1)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1220(2): 59-2-1202
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1220(2)(a): 59-2-1202 For purposes of this Subsection (2):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1220(2)(a)(i): 59-2-1202 "Abatement" means the amount of property taxes accrued that constitutes a tax abatement for the poor in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1220(2)(a)(ii): "Credit" means a homeowner's credit or renter's credit authorized by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1220(2)(a)(iii): "Property taxes due" means the taxes due on a claimant's property:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1220(2)(a)(iii)(A): for which the county or the commission grants an abatement or a credit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1220(2)(a)(iii)(B): for the calendar year for which the abatement or credit is granted.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1220(2)(a)(iv): "Property taxes paid" is an amount equal to the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1220(2)(a)(iv)(A): the amount of the property taxes paid for the taxable year for which the claimant is applying for the abatement or credit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1220(2)(a)(iv)(B): the amount of the abatement or credit the county or the commission grants.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1220(2)(b): A county or the commission granting an abatement or a credit to a claimant shall refund to that claimant an amount equal to the amount by which the claimant's property taxes paid exceed the claimant's property taxes due, if that amount is $1 or more.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1301 Tax has effect of judgment -- Lien has effect of execution.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Every tax has the effect of a judgment against the person, and every lien created by this title has the force and effect of an execution duly levied against all personal property of the delinquent.  The judgment is not satisfied nor the lien removed until the taxes are paid or the property sold for the payment of the judgment or lien.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1301.5 Definitions.
----------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1301.5(1): 59-2-1317 "Tax notice charge" means an amount that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1301.5(1)(a): a property owner owes to a tax notice charge entity in relation to real property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1301.5(1)(b): 59-2-1317 the county treasurer lists on the property tax notice in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1301.5(2): "Tax notice charge entity" means the entity that certifies to the county treasurer an outstanding amount that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1301.5(2)(a): a property owner owes to the entity in relation to the property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1301.5(2)(b): the county treasurer lists on the property tax notice as a tax notice charge.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1302 Assessor or treasurer's duties -- Collection of uniform fees and taxes on personal property -- Unpaid tax or unpaid uniform fee is a lien -- Delinquency interest -- Rate.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1302(1): 17-16-5.5; (3) After the assessor assesses taxes or uniform fees on personal property, the assessor or, if this duty has been reassigned in an ordinance under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1302(5)(a): the state treasurer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1302(5)(b): a qualified depository for the credit of the county.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303 Seizure and sale -- Method and procedure.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Unless taxes or uniform fees on personal property assessed by the county assessor are paid or secured as provided under SectionUtah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(1): (1)(b); 45-1-101; 59-2-1302; 45-1-101; (1)(b)(iv)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(1)(a): (1)(b); 45-1-101 For all personal property, except manufactured homes and mobile homes as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(1)(a)(i): at public auction;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(1)(a)(ii): of a sufficient amount of property to pay the taxes, or uniform fees and interest, penalties, and costs;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(1)(a)(iii): when practicable, in the city, town, or precinct where the property was seized; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(1)(a)(iv): 45-1-101 after one week's notice of the time and place of the sale, given by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(1)(a)(iv)(A): 45-1-101
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(1)(a)(iv)(A)(I): publication in a newspaper having general circulation in the county; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(1)(a)(iv)(A)(II): 45-1-101 publication in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(1)(a)(iv)(B): posting in three public places in the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(1)(b): 59-2-1302; 45-1-101; (1)(b)(iv) For manufactured homes and mobile homes that are used as a residence and that are listed on the personal property roll of the county, the sale shall be made:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(1)(b)(i): at public auction;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(1)(b)(ii): when practicable, in the city, town, or precinct where the property was seized;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(1)(b)(iii): 59-2-1302 no sooner than one year after the taxes on the property became delinquent as determined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(1)(b)(iv): 45-1-101 after publication of the date, time, and place of sale:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(1)(b)(iv)(A): in a newspaper having general circulation in the county, once in each of two successive weeks immediately preceding the date of the sale; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(1)(b)(iv)(B): 45-1-101 in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(1)(b)(v): (1)(b)(iv) after notification, sent by certified mail at least 10 days prior to the first date of publication under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(2): For seizing or selling personal property the assessor or treasurer, as the case may be, may charge in each case the actual and necessary expenses for travel and seizing, handling, keeping, selling, or caring for that property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(3): Upon payment of the price bid for any personal property sold under this section, the delivery of the property, with a bill of sale, vests title in the purchaser.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(4): All sale proceeds in excess of taxes, or uniform fees and interest, penalties, and costs shall be returned to the owner of the personal property, and until claimed shall be deposited in the county treasury and made subject to the order of the owner, the owner's heirs, or assigns.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(5): The unsold portion of any property may be left at the place of sale at the risk of the owner.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1303(6): If there is no acceptable purchaser of the property, the property shall be declared the property of the county.  The county  executive may sell or rent any property held in the name of the county at any time after the sale upon terms determined by the county legislative body.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1304 Rate of previous year governs -- Proration among taxing units -- Effective date of boundary changes for assessment.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1304(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1304(1)(a): The amount of taxes to be collected in the current year on personal property assessed by the county assessor shall be based on the tax rates levied by all taxing entities for the previous year, and the tax so billed shall be the full tax on the property for the current year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1304(1)(b): (1)(a) The money collected in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1304(1)(b)(i): into the county treasury; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1304(1)(b)(ii): by the treasurer to the various taxing entities pro rata in accordance with the tax rates levied and approved for the current year, including new entities levying for the first time.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1304(2): 17-2-209(4) An assessment shall be collected in accordance with the effective date and boundary adjustment provisions in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1305 Entries of payments made -- Payments to county treasurer.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1305(1): 17-16-5.5 The assessor or, if this duty has been reassigned in an ordinance under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1305(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1305(2)(a): The assessor or treasurer, as the case may be, shall require all checks to be made payable to the office of the county assessor or treasurer, respectively.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1305(2)(b): If the assessor or treasurer receives checks made payable to a payee other than the office of the county assessor or treasurer, respectively, the assessor or treasurer, as the case may be, shall immediately endorse the check with a restrictive endorsement that makes the check payable to the office of the county treasurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1305(3): The assessor shall deposit all money the assessor collects into an account controlled by the county treasurer.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1306 Collection after taxpayer moves from county -- Evidence of tax due -- Costs of collection.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1306(1): If any person moves from one county to another after being assessed on personal property, the county in which the person was assessed may sue for and collect the tax in the name of the county where the assessment was made.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1306(2): At the trial, a certified copy of the assessment from the county where the assessment was made, with a signed statement attached that the tax has not been paid, describing it as on the assessment book or delinquent list, is prima facie evidence that the tax and the interest are due, and entitles the county to judgment, unless the defendant proves that the tax was paid.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1306(3): The county treasurer shall be credited and the county auditor shall allow the expenses of collecting the tax and permit a deduction from the amount collected, not to exceed 1/3 of the amount of the tax collected.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1307 Entries of tax payments made on rail cars or state-assessed commercial vehicles.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1307(1): The commission, upon apportionment of the property of rail car companies and state-assessed commercial vehicles, shall proceed to collect the taxes from the owners of the property, and shall send to each owner notice of the amount of the tax assessed against it, when and where payable, when delinquent, and the penalty provided by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1307(1)(a): The commission shall remit taxes collected from owners of state-assessed commercial vehicles to each county treasurer at least quarterly.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1307(1)(b): On or before the first Monday in January following in each year, the commission shall remit to the state treasurer all other taxes collected and due the state, and to each county the taxes collected and due to it and to the various taxing entities included in the county.  The state treasurer and the treasurers of the several taxing entities shall make proper entries in their records of the receipt of the taxes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1307(2): All railroads doing business in this state shall furnish the commission with any information required by the commission, within the knowledge of the railroad companies, which will aid the commission in the collection of taxes from rail car companies.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308 Property assessed by commission -- Collection procedures -- Exceptions.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308(1): Property taxes assessed by the commission shall be collected, billed, and paid in the manner provided for the collection, billing, and enforcement of other general property taxes under this chapter, except:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308(1)(a): the rolling stock of rail car companies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308(1)(b): state-assessed commercial vehicles.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308(2): (1)(a); (b); 59-2-201; 59-2-1302; 59-2-1303; 59-2-1302; 59-2-1331; 59-2-1302; 59-2-1303; (1)(a); (b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308(2)(a): (1)(a); (b); 59-2-201 A county treasurer may require a taxpayer, other than a taxpayer described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308(2)(a)(i): 59-2-201 the taxpayer's property taxes are assessed by the commission under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308(2)(a)(ii): the taxpayer gives any indication of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308(2)(a)(ii)(A): departing from the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308(2)(a)(ii)(B): removing the taxpayer's property from the state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308(2)(a)(ii)(C): doing any other act which may prejudice or hinder the collection process for any assessment period.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308(2)(b): 59-2-1302; 59-2-1303; 59-2-1302; 59-2-1331 If a tax is not paid as provided in this chapter, the county treasurer shall collect the tax:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308(2)(b)(i): 59-2-1302; 59-2-1303 for personal property and uniform fees, in the same manner as is provided for the collection of delinquent taxes or uniform fees under Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308(2)(b)(ii): 59-2-1302; 59-2-1331 for all other property, including personal property and uniform fees listed with real property under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308(2)(c): 59-2-1302; 59-2-1303; (1)(a); (b) The provisions of Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5 Equal payment agreements.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(1)(a): The commission may enter into an agreement with a commercial or industrial taxpayer to provide for equal, or approximately equal, property tax payments over a reasonable period of years, not to exceed 20 years, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(1)(a)(i): the payment schedule is based on an accepted valuation methodology that reasonably estimates the property's anticipated fair market value over the period of the proposed equal payments;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(1)(a)(ii): the agreement includes a provision making the initial equal payment schedule subject to an annual adjustment, as necessary, to account for differences between the property's fair market value as of the annual lien date and the property's fair market value that formed the basis of the initial equal payment schedule;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(1)(a)(iii): the commission, the taxpayer, and each affected taxing entity approve the agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(1)(a)(iv): the total amount the taxpayer pays under the agreement is no less than the amount the taxpayer would have paid in the absence of the agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(1)(b): A taxing entity may not approve an agreement under this section on behalf of another taxing entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(2): (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(2)(a): (2)(b) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(2)(b): For purposes of enforcing a tax lien under this chapter, a taxpayer's failure to pay the full amount of taxes that the taxpayer would have been required to pay in the absence of an agreement under this section does not constitute a failure to pay the full amount of taxes owing:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(2)(b)(i): if the taxpayer pays the full amount of the payment owing under the agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(2)(b)(ii): unless the taxpayer:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(2)(b)(ii)(A): files for bankruptcy;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(2)(b)(ii)(B): transfers ownership of the property that is the subject of the property taxes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(2)(b)(ii)(C): has a change in ownership and the new owner does not assume all responsibility and liability under the agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(3): 59-1-1004
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(3)(a): 59-1-1004 The commission may revise, accelerate, or cancel an equal payment agreement under this section to the same extent and for the same reasons that the commission may revise, accelerate, or cancel an installment agreement under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(3)(b): The commission shall give the taxpayer reasonable notice of its intent to revise or cancel an equal payment agreement under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(4): 59-2-924 The commission shall promulgate rules to ensure that tax revenue derived from payments pursuant to an agreement under this section do not affect the calculation of the certified tax rate under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(5): If the commission or a taxing entity enters into an equal payment agreement under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(5)(a): the commission shall annually provide an electronic report to the Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee on the effects of equal payment agreements under this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1308.5(5)(b): the Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee shall annually review and assess the effects of equal payment agreements under this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1309 Publication of delinquency -- Seizure and sale -- Redemption -- Distribution of proceeds.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1309(1): 45-1-101; 59-1-402; 45-1-101
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1309(1)(a): 45-1-101 On or before December 15 of each year, the commission shall publish a list of the delinquent rail car companies and state-assessed commercial vehicles:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1309(1)(a)(i): in a newspaper having general circulation in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1309(1)(a)(ii): 45-1-101 as required in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1309(1)(b): The list shall contain the names of the owners, when known, and a general description of the property assessed as to which the taxes are delinquent, and the amount of the delinquent taxes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1309(1)(c): 59-1-402 The commission shall publish with the list a notice that unless the delinquent taxes, together with the penalty, are paid before December 21, the property of the delinquent or so much of it as may be necessary to pay the amount of the taxes, penalty, and interest at the rate prescribed in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1309(1)(d): 45-1-101 The provisions of law governing the seizure and sale by county treasurers of personal property for delinquent taxes shall apply to sales made by the commission under this section, except that notice of the time and place of the sale shall be given by publication:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1309(1)(d)(i): in a newspaper of general circulation in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1309(1)(d)(ii): 45-1-101 as required in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1309(2): Property seized by the commission pursuant to this section may be redeemed, at any time prior to the sale, by payment of the full amount of taxes due from the delinquent together with all penalties, interest, and the costs then accrued.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1309(3): All sums collected by the commission upon the sale or redemption of property pursuant to this section shall be immediately distributed as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1309(3)(a): all interest, penalties, and costs to the appropriate county treasurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1309(3)(b): any excess over the taxes, penalties, interest, and cost shall be deposited with the state treasurer subject to the order of the owner of the property sold, or the owner's heirs or assigns.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1310 Collection by seizure and sale -- Procedure -- Costs.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1310(1): The treasurer shall collect the taxes delinquent on personal property assessed by the commission as determined by the assessor, except when sufficient real estate is liable for the tax, by seizure and sale of any personal property owned by the delinquent taxpayer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1310(2): The sale shall be at public auction, and of a sufficient amount of property to pay the taxes and costs, and when practicable shall be made in the city, town, or precinct where seized.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1310(3): 45-1-101 The sale shall be made after one week's notice of the time and place of the sale, given by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1310(3)(a): 45-1-101
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1310(3)(a)(i): publication in a newspaper having general circulation in the county; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1310(3)(a)(ii): 45-1-101 publication in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1310(3)(b): posting in three public places in the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1310(4): For seizing or selling personal property the treasurer may charge in each case the actual and necessary expenses for travel and seizing, handling, keeping, selling, or caring for property so seized or sold.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1310(5): On payment of the price bid for any personal property sold, its delivery, with a bill of sale, vests title in the purchaser.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1310(6): Title 67, Chapter 4a, Revised Uniform Unclaimed Property Act All excess of the proceeds of any sale over the taxes and costs shall be returned to the owner of the property sold, and until claimed shall be deposited in the county treasury and disposed of under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1310(7): If there is no acceptable purchaser of the property, the property shall be declared the property of the county.  The county executive may sell or rent any property held in the name of the county at any time after the sale upon terms determined by the county legislative body.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1310(8): The unsold portion of any property may be left at the place of sale at the risk of the owner.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1311 Treasurer to advise commission of taxes unpaid on its assessments -- Notice to property owners.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Each county treasurer shall, during the first week in February of each year, report to the commission the name of each person who has failed to pay the taxes assessed and levied against the person during the preceding year upon property assessed by the commission.  The commission shall note that the prior year's taxes are delinquent on the next tax notice sent to property owners under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1312 Examination of books of county officers by state officers.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The state auditor, any member of the commission, or any person designated by the commission may examine the books of any county officer charged with the collection and receipt of state taxes.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1313 Attorney general to prosecute delinquent officers.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If, on examination, it is found that any officer has been guilty of defrauding the state of revenue or has neglected or refused to perform any duty relating to revenue, the attorney general shall prosecute the delinquent officer.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1314 Informalities and time prescribed for action -- Effect on validity of tax.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
No assessment or act relating to assessment or collection of taxes is illegal on account of informality or because the assessment or act was not completed within the time required by law.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1315 Disposition of fines and forfeitures.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
The fines and forfeitures incurred by violation of any of the provisions of this chapter shall be paid into the treasury for the use of the county where the property is located.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1316 Annual settlements between county assessor, county treasurer, and county auditor.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Every county assessor and county treasurer shall annually, on the first Monday in January, make a settlement with the county auditor of all transactions connected with the revenue for the previous year, and every county treasurer, on the expiration of the treasurer's term of office, shall make the settlement.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317 Tax notice -- Contents of notice -- Procedures and requirements for providing notice.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(1): 11-60-102 As used in this section, "political subdivision lien" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(2): 59-2-303.1; 10-7-30; 10-8-17; 10-8-19; 10-11-4; 17B-1-902; 17B-2a-506; 17B-2a-1007; 17D-4-304; 63H-1-501; 63H-1-501(4)(a); 17-21-6; 17-21-6 Subject to the other provisions of this section, the county treasurer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(2)(a): collect the taxes and tax notice charges; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(2)(b): 59-2-303.1; 10-7-30; 10-8-17; 10-8-19; 10-11-4; 17B-1-902; 17B-2a-506; 17B-2a-1007; 17D-4-304; 63H-1-501; 63H-1-501(4)(a); 17-21-6; 17-21-6 provide a notice to each taxpayer that contains the following:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(2)(b)(iii): 59-2-303.1 that the property may be subject to a detailed review in the next year under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(2)(b)(vii)(I): 63H-1-501 if applicable, an annual payment to the Military Installation Development Authority or an entity designated by the authority in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(2)(b)(viii): if a county's tax notice includes an assessment area charge, a statement that, due to potentially ongoing assessment area charges, costs, penalties, and interest, payment of a tax notice charge may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(2)(b)(viii)(A): pay off the full amount the property owner owes to the tax notice entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(2)(b)(viii)(B): cause a release of the lien underlying the tax notice charge;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(2)(b)(ix): 63H-1-501(4)(a) if applicable, the annual payment described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(2)(b)(x): the date the taxes and tax notice charges are due;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(2)(b)(xi): the street address at which the taxes and tax notice charges may be paid;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(2)(b)(xiii): the penalty imposed on delinquent taxes and tax notice charges;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(2)(b)(xiv): a statement that explains the taxpayer's right to direct allocation of a partial payment in accordance with Subsection (9);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(2)(b)(xv): other information specifically authorized to be included on the notice under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(2)(b)(xvi): other property tax information approved by the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(2)(b)(xvii): 17-21-6; 17-21-6 if sent in calendar year 2024, 2025, or 2026:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(2)(b)(xvii)(A): 17-21-6 notice that the taxpayer may request electronic notice as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(2)(b)(xvii)(B): 17-21-6 instructions describing how to elect to receive a notice as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(3): 59-2-1343
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(3)(a): Unless expressly allowed under this section or another statutory provision, the treasurer may not add an amount to be collected to the property tax notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(3)(b): 59-2-1343 If the county treasurer adds an amount to be collected to the property tax notice under this section or another statutory provision that expressly authorizes the item's inclusion on the property tax notice:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(3)(b)(i): the amount constitutes a tax notice charge; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(3)(b)(ii): 59-2-1343
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(3)(b)(ii)(A): the tax notice charge has the same priority as property tax; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(3)(b)(ii)(B): 59-2-1343 a delinquency of the tax notice charge triggers a tax sale, in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(4): For any property for which property taxes or tax notice charges are delinquent, the notice described in Subsection (2) shall state, "Prior taxes or tax notice charges are delinquent on this parcel."
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(5): Except as provided in Subsection (6), the county treasurer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(5)(a): mail the notice required by this section, postage prepaid; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(5)(b): leave the notice required by this section at the taxpayer's residence or usual place of business, if known.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(6)(a): Subject to the other provisions of this Subsection (6), a county treasurer may, at the county treasurer's discretion, provide the notice required by this section by electronic mail if a taxpayer makes an election, according to procedures determined by the county treasurer, to receive the notice by electronic mail.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(6)(b): A taxpayer may revoke an election to receive the notice required by this section by electronic mail if the taxpayer provides written notice to the treasurer on or before October 1.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(6)(c): A revocation of an election under this section does not relieve a taxpayer of the duty to pay a tax or tax notice charge due under this chapter on or before the due date for paying the tax or tax notice charge.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(6)(d): A county treasurer shall provide the notice required by this section using a method described in Subsection (5), until a taxpayer makes a new election in accordance with this Subsection (6), if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(6)(d)(i): the taxpayer revokes an election in accordance with Subsection (6)(b) to receive the notice required by this section by electronic mail; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(6)(d)(ii): the county treasurer finds that the taxpayer's electronic mail address is invalid.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(6)(e): A person is considered to be a taxpayer for purposes of this Subsection (6) regardless of whether the property that is the subject of the notice required by this section is exempt from taxation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(7)(a): The county treasurer shall provide the notice required by this section to a taxpayer on or before November 1.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(7)(b): The county treasurer shall keep on file in the county treasurer's office the information set forth in the notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(7)(c): The county treasurer is not required to mail a tax receipt acknowledging payment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(8): 59-2-1302; 59-2-1307 This section does not apply to property taxed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(9)(a): A taxpayer who pays less than the full amount due on the taxpayer's property tax notice may, on a form provided by the county treasurer, direct how the county treasurer allocates the partial payment between:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(9)(a)(i): the total amount due for property tax;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(9)(a)(ii): the amount due for assessments, past due special district fees, and other tax notice charges; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(9)(a)(iii): any other amounts due on the property tax notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(9)(b): The county treasurer shall comply with a direction submitted to the county treasurer in accordance with Subsection (9)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(9)(c): The provisions of this Subsection (9) do not:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(9)(c)(i): affect the right or ability of a local entity to pursue any available remedy for non-payment of any item listed on a taxpayer's property tax notice; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1317(9)(c)(ii): toll or otherwise change any time period related to a remedy described in Subsection (9)(c)(i).


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1318 Date of payment of property tax -- Notation on assessment roll.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The county treasurer shall mark the date of the payment of any tax on the assessment roll opposite the property identification number.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1319 Receipts for payments -- Payment by warrant -- Cash payments required -- Exceptions.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1319(1): If a person pays taxes in person at the county treasurer's office, the county treasurer shall, upon request, give a receipt to the person paying the taxes, specifying the amount of the taxes due, the property identification number, and the aggregate amount of taxes paid.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1319(2): County warrants shall be taken in payment of county taxes, city warrants in payment of city taxes, and school district warrants in payment of school district taxes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1319(3): All taxes shall be paid in cash, unless the county treasurer adopts rules otherwise.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1320 Settlements with county legislative bodies.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
On the first Monday of March and June, and the second Monday of September and December, the county treasurer shall settle with the county legislative body for all money collected by the treasurer, and on those days shall deliver to and file in the office of the county auditor a statement under oath showing:Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1320(1): an account of all transactions and receipts since the last settlement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1320(2): that all money collected is in the county treasury.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1321 Erroneous or illegal assessments -- Deductions and refunds.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The county legislative body, upon sufficient evidence being produced that property has been either erroneously or illegally assessed, may order the county treasurer to allow the taxes on that part of the property erroneously or illegally assessed to be deducted before payment of taxes. Any taxes, interest, and costs paid more than once, or erroneously or illegally collected, may, by order of the county legislative body, be refunded by the county treasurer, and the portion of taxes, interest, and costs paid to the state or any taxing entity shall be refunded to the county, and the appropriate officer shall draw a warrant for that amount in favor of the county.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1322 Property assessed more than once.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
If the county treasurer determines that any property has been assessed more than once for the same year, the treasurer shall collect only the tax justly due and report the facts, under affidavit, to the county auditor.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1323 Undivided interests in real estate -- Interest of delinquent co-owner only to be sold.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1323(1): The county treasurer shall issue a receipt showing the interest on which taxes or tax notice charges are paid to any person paying taxes on an undivided interest in real estate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1323(2): If any portion of the taxes or tax notice charges on the real estate remain unpaid, it is the duty of the treasurer to sell only the undivided interest in the real estate which belongs to the co-owners who have not paid their portion of the tax.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1324 Taxes and tax notice charges to be paid before distribution of estate of a deceased person.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1324(1): The district court shall require every administrator or executor to pay out of the funds of the estate all taxes and tax notice charges due from the estate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1324(2): No order or decree for the distribution of any property of any decedent among the heirs or devisees may be made until all taxes and tax notice charges against the estate are paid.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1325 Nature and extent of lien -- Time of attachment -- Effective date of boundary changes for assessment.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1325(1): (1)(a); (b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1325(1)(a): A tax upon real property is a lien against the property assessed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1325(1)(b): A tax due upon improvements upon real property assessed to a person other than the owner of the real property is a lien upon the property and improvements.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1325(1)(c): (1)(a); (b) A lien described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1325(2): 17-2-209(4) An assessment shall be collected in accordance with the effective date and boundary adjustment provisions in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1326 Illegal tax and tax notice charges -- Injunction to restrain collection.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1326(1): No injunction may be granted by any court to restrain the collection of any tax, any part of the tax, or any tax notice charge, nor to restrain the sale of any property for the nonpayment of the tax or tax notice charge, unless the tax or tax notice charge, or some part of the tax or tax notice charge sought to be enjoined:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1326(1)(a): is not authorized by law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1326(1)(b): is on property which is exempt from taxation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1326(2): If the payment of a part of a tax or tax notice charge is sought to be enjoined, the other part shall be paid or tendered before any action may be commenced.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1327 Payment of tax or tax notice charge under protest -- Circumstances where authorized -- Action to recover tax or tax notice charge paid.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1327(1): Where a taxing entity demands or enforces a tax or where an entity responsible for a tax notice charge demands or enforces the tax notice charge, and the person whose property is taxed or charged claims the tax or tax notice charge is unlawful, that person may pay the tax or tax notice charge under protest to the county treasurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1327(2): The person may then bring an action in the district court against the officer or taxing entity to recover the tax or tax notice charge or any portion of the tax or tax notice charge paid under protest.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1328 Judgment or order against state or taxing entity -- Payment to taxpayer -- County recovery of portion of payment to taxpayer from the state or a taxing entity other than the county -- Apportionment of expenses incurred by county in objection to assessment by commission.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1328(1): 59-2-1330; 59-2-1330 If a taxpayer obtains a final and unappealable judgment or order in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1328(1)(a): audit and allow the final and unappealable judgment  or order;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1328(1)(b): cause a warrant to be drawn for the amount recovered by the final and unappealable judgment or order; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1328(1)(c): 59-2-1330 pay the taxpayer as required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1328(2): 59-2-1330 At the request of a county, the state or a taxing entity shall cause a warrant to be drawn upon the treasurer of the state or the taxing entity in favor of the county:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1328(2)(a): if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1328(2)(a)(i): the final and unappealable judgment or order described in Subsection (1) is obtained against a county; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1328(2)(a)(ii): any portion of the taxes included in the final and unappealable judgment or order described in Subsection (1):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1328(2)(a)(ii)(A): is levied by the state or a taxing entity other than the county; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1328(2)(a)(ii)(B): has been paid over to the state or the taxing entity described in Subsection (2)(a)(ii)(A) by the county; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1328(2)(b): 59-2-1330 for the state's or the taxing entity's proportionate share of a payment to a taxpayer required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1328(3): 59-2-1330 For purposes of Subsection (2), the state's or a taxing entity's proportionate share of a payment to a taxpayer required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1328(3)(a): the percentage by which the amount of any tax levied against any property for which the taxpayer paid a tax under this chapter for a calendar year was reduced in accordance with the final and unappealable judgment or order described in Subsection (1); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1328(3)(b): the total amount of the taxes for the property described in Subsection (1) paid over to the state or the taxing entity by the county for the calendar year described in Subsection (3)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1328(4): 59-2-1007 If the final and unappealable judgment or order described in Subsection (1) results from an objection to the commission's assessment of property to which the county is a party under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1329 Right to injunction limited.
------------------------------------------------------------
This remedy supersedes the remedy of injunction and all other remedies which might be invoked to prevent the collection of taxes alleged to be unlawfully levied or demanded, unless the court finds that the remedy provided is inadequate, in which case the injunctive proceedings under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330 Payment of property taxes -- Payments to taxpayer by state or taxing entity -- Refund of penalties paid by taxpayer -- Refund of interest paid by taxpayer -- Payment of interest to taxpayer -- Judgment levy -- Objections to assessments by the commission -- Time periods for making payments to taxpayer.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(1): Unless otherwise specifically provided by statute, property taxes shall be paid directly to the county treasurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(1)(a): on the date that the property taxes are due; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(1)(b): as provided in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(2)(a): The county treasurer shall apply a payment that is insufficient to cover both a tax or tax notice charge that is deferred in accordance with Part 18, Tax Deferral and Tax Abatement, and a current year property tax or tax notice charge to the current tax year property tax or tax notice charge first.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(2)(b): The county treasurer shall send notice to the property owner:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(2)(b)(i): that the payment was insufficient;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(2)(b)(ii): that the county applied the payment to the tax or tax notice charges for the current tax year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(2)(b)(iii): of the amount of tax and tax notice charge that is outstanding.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(3): A taxpayer shall receive payment as provided in this section if a reduction in the amount of any tax levied against any property for which the taxpayer paid a tax or any portion of a tax under this chapter for a calendar year is required by a final and unappealable judgment or order described in Subsection (4) issued by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(3)(a): a county board of equalization;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(3)(b): the commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(3)(c): a court of competent jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a): For purposes of Subsection (3), the state or any taxing entity that has received property taxes or any portion of property taxes from a taxpayer described in Subsection (2) shall pay the taxpayer if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a)(i): the taxes the taxpayer paid in accordance with Subsection (3) are collected by an authorized officer of the:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a)(i)(A): county; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a)(i)(B): state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a)(ii): the taxpayer obtains a final and unappealable judgment or order:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a)(ii)(A): from a county board of equalization, the commission, or a court of competent jurisdiction;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a)(ii)(B): against:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a)(ii)(B)(I): the taxing entity or an authorized officer of the taxing entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a)(ii)(B)(II): the state or an authorized officer of the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a)(ii)(C): ordering a reduction in the amount of any tax levied against any property for which a taxpayer paid a tax or any portion of a tax under this chapter for the calendar year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(b): The amount that the state or a taxing entity shall pay a taxpayer shall be determined in accordance with Subsections (5) through (8).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(5): 59-2-1331; 59-2-1331; 59-2-1331 For purposes of Subsections (3) and (4), the amount the state shall pay to a taxpayer is equal to the sum of:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(11):

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330 Payment of property taxes -- Payments to taxpayer by state or taxing entity -- Refund of penalties paid by taxpayer -- Refund of interest paid by taxpayer -- Payment of interest to taxpayer -- Judgment levy -- Objections to assessments by the commission -- Time periods for making payments to taxpayer.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(1): Unless otherwise specifically provided by statute, property taxes shall be paid directly to the county treasurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(1)(a): on the date that the property taxes are due; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(1)(b): as provided in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(2)(a): The county treasurer shall apply a payment that is insufficient to cover both a tax or tax notice charge that is deferred in accordance with Part 18, Tax Deferral and Tax Abatement, and a current year property tax or tax notice charge to the current tax year property tax or tax notice charge first.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(2)(b): The county treasurer shall send notice to the property owner:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(2)(b)(i): that the payment was insufficient;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(2)(b)(ii): that the county applied the payment to the tax or tax notice charges for the current tax year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(2)(b)(iii): of the amount of tax and tax notice charge that is outstanding.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(3): A taxpayer shall receive payment as provided in this section if a reduction in the amount of any tax levied against any property for which the taxpayer paid a tax or any portion of a tax under this chapter for a calendar year is required by a final and unappealable judgment or order described in Subsection (4) issued by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(3)(a): a county board of equalization;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(3)(b): the commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(3)(c): a court of competent jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a): For purposes of Subsection (3), the state or any taxing entity that has received property taxes or any portion of property taxes from a taxpayer described in Subsection (2) shall pay the taxpayer if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a)(i): the taxes the taxpayer paid in accordance with Subsection (3) are collected by an authorized officer of the:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a)(i)(A): county; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a)(i)(B): state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a)(ii): the taxpayer obtains a final and unappealable judgment or order:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a)(ii)(A): from a county board of equalization, the commission, or a court of competent jurisdiction;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a)(ii)(B): against:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a)(ii)(B)(I): the taxing entity or an authorized officer of the taxing entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a)(ii)(B)(II): the state or an authorized officer of the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(a)(ii)(C): ordering a reduction in the amount of any tax levied against any property for which a taxpayer paid a tax or any portion of a tax under this chapter for the calendar year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(4)(b): The amount that the state or a taxing entity shall pay a taxpayer shall be determined in accordance with Subsections (5) through (8).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(5): 59-2-1331; 59-2-1331; 59-2-1331; (5)(a) For purposes of Subsections (3) and (4), the amount the state shall pay to a taxpayer is equal to the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(5)(a): if the difference described in this Subsection (5)(a) is greater than $0, the difference between:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(11): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(11)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (11)(b), a payment that is required by this section shall be paid to a taxpayer:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1330(11)(a)(i): within 120 days after the day on which the final and unappealable judgment or order is issued in accordance with Subsection (4); or
