Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1905 Refund.
---------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1905(1): 59-2-405; 59-2-405 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1905(1)(a): 59-2-405 "Property taxes and fees due" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1905(1)(a)(i): the taxes due on an active duty claimant or veteran claimant's property:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1905(1)(a)(i)(A): with respect to which a county grants an exemption under this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1905(1)(a)(i)(B): for the calendar year for which the county grants an exemption under this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1905(1)(a)(ii): 59-2-405 for a veteran claimant, a uniform fee on tangible personal property described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1905(1)(b): 59-2-405 "Property taxes and fees paid" is an amount equal to the sum of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1905(1)(b)(i): the amount of property taxes that qualifies for an exemption under this part that the active duty claimant or the veteran claimant paid for the calendar year for which the active duty claimant or veteran claimant is applying for an exemption under this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1905(1)(b)(ii): the amount of the exemption the county grants for the calendar year for which the active duty claimant or veteran claimant is applying for an exemption under this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1905(1)(b)(iii): 59-2-405 for a veteran claimant, the amount of a uniform fee on tangible personal property, described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1905(2): A county shall refund to an active duty claimant or a veteran claimant an amount equal to the amount by which the active duty claimant's or veteran claimant's property taxes and fees paid exceed the active duty claimant's or veteran claimant's property taxes and fees due, if that amount is $1 or more.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1906 County legislative body authority to adopt rules or ordinances.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A county legislative body may adopt rules or ordinances to:Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1906(1): effectuate an exemption under this part; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-2-1906(2): designate one or more persons to perform the functions given to the county under this part.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Chapter 3 - Tax Equivalent Property Act
************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 59-3-101 Short title.
-------------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Tax Equivalent Property Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-3-102 Definitions.
-------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 59-3-102(1): "Tax equivalent payment" means a payment required or authorized by statute to be made in lieu of ad valorem taxes on tax exempt property pursuant to a contract entered into under statutory authority and filed with the county assessor of the county in which the property is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-3-102(2): "Tax equivalent property" means property on which any tax equivalent payment is made.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-3-103 Value of tax equivalent property included as part of value of taxable property.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In determining the value of taxable property within any tax area for purposes of computing the limitation on indebtedness under Article XIV, Sec. 4, Utah Constitution, the value of all tax equivalent property shall be included as a part of the total value of taxable property.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-3-104 Tax equivalent property list -- Assessment of tax equivalent property.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The county assessor shall keep a separate list of the tax equivalent property in each tax area in the county, showing the value of all tax equivalent property in each area.  The value of tax equivalent property established on the tax equivalent property list is subject to the same process of review and equalization as the value of taxable property shown in the assessment roll.  The assessment roll delivered to the county treasurer under Section

Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Chapter 4 - Privilege Tax
**********************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101 Tax basis -- Exceptions -- Assessment and collection -- Designation of person to receive notice.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(1): 59-2-1103; 59-2-1114
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(1)(a): Except as provided in Subsections (1)(b), (1)(c), and (3), a tax is imposed on the possession or other beneficial use enjoyed by any person of any real or personal property that is exempt for any reason from taxation, if that property is used in connection with a business conducted for profit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(1)(b): 59-2-1103 Any interest remaining in the state in state lands after subtracting amounts paid or due in part payment of the purchase price as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(1)(c): 59-2-1114 The tax imposed under Subsection (1)(a) does not apply to property exempt from taxation under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(2)(a): The tax imposed under this chapter is the same amount that the ad valorem property tax would be if the possessor or user were the owner of the property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(2)(b): The amount of any payments that are made in lieu of taxes is credited against the tax imposed on the beneficial use of property owned by the federal government.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(3): 11-13-103; 11-13-302; 72-6-202 A tax is not imposed under this chapter on the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(3)(a): the use of property that is a concession in, or relative to, the use of a public airport, park, fairground, or similar property that is available as a matter of right to the use of the general public;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(3)(b): the use or possession of property by a religious, educational, or charitable organization;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(3)(c): the use or possession of property if the revenue generated by the possessor or user of the property through its possession or use of the property inures only to the benefit of a religious, educational, or charitable organization and not to the benefit of any other person;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(3)(d): the possession or other beneficial use of public land occupied under the terms of an agricultural lease or permit issued by the United States or this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(3)(e): the use or possession of any lease, permit, or easement unless the lease, permit, or easement entitles the lessee or permittee to exclusive possession of the premises to which the lease, permit, or easement relates;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(3)(f): 11-13-103; 11-13-302 the use or possession of property by a public agency, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(3)(g): 72-6-202 the possession or beneficial use of public property as a tollway by a private entity through a tollway development agreement as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(4): For purposes of Subsection (3)(e):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(4)(a): every lessee, permittee, or other holder of a right to remove or extract the mineral covered by the holder's lease, right permit, or easement, except from brines of the Great Salt Lake, is considered to be in possession of the premises, regardless of whether another party has a similar right to remove or extract another mineral from the same property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(4)(b): a lessee, permittee, or holder of an easement still has exclusive possession of the premises if the owner has the right to enter the premises, approve leasehold improvements, or inspect the premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(5): 11-70-203 A tax imposed under this chapter is assessed to the possessors or users of the property on the same forms, and collected and, subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(6): 59-2-919.1; 59-2-1317
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(6)(a): 59-2-919.1; 59-2-1317
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(6)(a)(i): Except as provided in Subsection (6)(a)(ii), if a governmental entity is required under this chapter to send information or notice to a person, the governmental entity shall send the information or notice to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(6)(a)(i)(A): the person required under the applicable provision of this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(6)(a)(i)(B): each person designated in accordance with Subsection (6)(b) by the person described in Subsection (6)(a)(i)(A).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(6)(a)(ii): 59-2-919.1; 59-2-1317 If a governmental entity is required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(6)(a)(ii)(A): the person required under the applicable section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(6)(a)(ii)(B): one person designated in accordance with Subsection (6)(b) by the person described in Subsection (6)(a)(ii)(A).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(6)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(6)(b)(i): A person to whom a governmental entity is required under this chapter to send information or notice may designate a person to receive the information or notice in accordance with Subsection (6)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(6)(b)(ii): To make a designation described in Subsection (6)(b)(i), the person shall submit a written request to the governmental entity on a form prescribed by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(6)(c): A person who makes a designation described in Subsection (6)(b) may revoke the designation by submitting a written request to the governmental entity on a form prescribed by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-101(7): 59-2-301.1; 59-2-301.7 Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 59-4-102 Failure to pay tax -- Remedies of county.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
A tax due and unpaid under this chapter constitutes a debt due the county for and on behalf of the various taxing units concerned with the tax.  If the tax imposed by this chapter or any portion of the tax is not paid at the time the tax becomes delinquent, the county auditor shall issue a warrant in the name of the county directed to the clerk of the district court for that county.  The clerk shall enter in the judgment docket, in the column for judgment debtors, the name of the delinquent taxpayer mentioned in the warrant and, in the appropriate columns, the amount of tax, penalties, interest, and other costs for which the warrant is issued and the date when the warrant is filed.  The warrant so docketed has the force and effect of a judgment duly rendered by a district court and docketed in the office of the clerk, and the county has the same remedies against the possessor or user as any other judgment creditor.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Chapter 5 - Severance Tax on Oil, Gas, and Mining
**********************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101 Definitions.
-------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(1): 40-6-4 "Board" means the Board of Oil, Gas, and Mining created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(2): "Coal-to-liquid" means the process of converting coal into a liquid synthetic fuel.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(3): "Condensate" means those hydrocarbons, regardless of gravity, that occur naturally in the gaseous phase in the reservoir that are separated from the natural gas as liquids through the process of condensation either in the reservoir, in the wellbore, or at the surface in field separators.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(4): "Crude oil" means those hydrocarbons, regardless of gravity, that occur naturally in the liquid phase in the reservoir and are produced and recovered at the wellhead in liquid form.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(5): "Development well" means any oil and gas producing well other than a wildcat well.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(6): Title 40, Chapter 6, Board and Division of Oil, Gas, and Mining "Division" means the Division of Oil, Gas, and Mining established under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(7): "Enhanced recovery project" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(7)(a): the injection of liquids or hydrocarbon or nonhydrocarbon gases directly into a reservoir for the purpose of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(7)(a)(i): augmenting reservoir energy;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(7)(a)(ii): modifying the properties of the fluids or gases in a reservoir; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(7)(a)(iii): changing the reservoir conditions to increase the recoverable oil, gas, or oil and gas through the joint use of two or more well bores; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(7)(b): a project initially approved by the board as a new or expanded enhanced recovery project on or after January 1, 1996.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(8)(a): "Gas" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(8)(a)(i): natural gas;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(8)(a)(ii): natural gas liquids; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(8)(a)(iii): any mixture of natural gas and natural gas liquids.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(8)(b): "Gas" does not include solid hydrocarbons.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(9): "Incremental production" means that part of production, certified by the Division of Oil, Gas, and Mining, which is achieved from an enhanced recovery project that would not have economically occurred under the reservoir conditions existing before the project and that has been approved by the division as incremental production.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(10): "Natural gas" means those hydrocarbons, other than oil and other than natural gas liquids separated from natural gas, that occur naturally in the gaseous phase in the reservoir and are produced and recovered at the wellhead in gaseous form.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(11): "Natural gas liquids" means those hydrocarbons initially in reservoir natural gas, regardless of gravity, that are separated in gas processing plants from the natural gas as liquids at the surface through the process of condensation, absorption, adsorption, or other methods.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(12): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(12)(a): "Oil" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(12)(a)(i): crude oil;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(12)(a)(ii): condensate; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(12)(a)(iii): any mixture of crude oil and condensate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(12)(b): "Oil" does not include solid hydrocarbons.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(13): Title 40, Chapter 6, Board and Division of Oil, Gas, and Mining "Oil or gas field" means a geographical area overlying oil or gas structures.  The boundaries of oil or gas fields shall conform with the boundaries as fixed by the Board and Division of Oil, Gas, and Mining under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(14): "Oil shale" means a group of fine black to dark brown shales containing bituminous material that yields petroleum upon distillation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(15): (15)(a); (b); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Operator" means any person engaged in the business of operating an oil or gas well, regardless of whether the person is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(15)(a): a working interest owner;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(15)(b): an independent contractor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(15)(c): (15)(a); (b); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act acting in a capacity similar to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(16): "Owner" means any person having a working interest, royalty interest, payment out of production, or any other interest in the oil or gas produced or extracted from an oil or gas well in the state, or in the proceeds of this production.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(17): (17)(b); (c); (17)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(17)(a): (17)(b); (c) Subject to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(17)(a)(i): natural gas liquids; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(17)(a)(ii): contaminants.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(17)(b): If processing costs are determined on the basis of an arm's-length contract, processing costs are the actual costs.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(17)(c): (17)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(17)(c)(i): If processing costs are determined on a basis other than an arm's-length contract, processing costs are those reasonable costs associated with:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(17)(c)(i)(A): actual operating and maintenance expenses, including oil or gas used or consumed in processing;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(17)(c)(i)(B): overhead directly attributable and allocable to the operation and maintenance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(17)(c)(i)(C): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(17)(c)(i)(C)(I): depreciation and a return on undepreciated capital investment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(17)(c)(i)(C)(II): a cost equal to a return on the investment in the processing facilities as determined by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(17)(c)(ii): (17)(c)(i) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(18): "Producer" means any working interest owner in any lands in any oil or gas field from which gas or oil is produced.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(19): "Recompletion" means any downhole operation that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(19)(a): conducted to reestablish the producibility or serviceability of a well in any geologic interval; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(19)(b): approved by the division as a recompletion.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(20): "Research and development" means the process of inquiry or experimentation aimed at the discovery of facts, devices, technologies, or applications and the process of preparing those devices, technologies, or applications for marketing.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(21): "Royalty interest owner" means the owner of an interest in oil or gas, or in the proceeds of production from the oil or gas who does not have the obligation to share in the expenses of developing and operating the property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(22): "Solid hydrocarbons" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(22)(a): coal;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(22)(b): gilsonite;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(22)(c): ozocerite;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(22)(d): elaterite;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(22)(e): oil shale;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(22)(f): tar sands; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(22)(g): all other hydrocarbon substances that occur naturally in solid form.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(23): "Stripper well" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(23)(a): an oil well whose average daily production for the days the well has produced has been 20 barrels or less of crude oil a day during any consecutive 12-month period; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(23)(b): a gas well whose average daily production for the days the well has produced has been 60 MCF or less of natural gas a day during any consecutive 90-day period.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(24): "Tar sands" means impregnated sands that yield mixtures of liquid hydrocarbon and require further processing other than mechanical blending before becoming finished petroleum products.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(25): (25)(b); (c); (25)(c)(i); (25)(d)(i); (vi); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(25)(a): (25)(b); (c) Subject to Subsections

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(25)(c)(i)(A): actual operating and maintenance expenses, including fuel used or consumed in transporting the oil or gas;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(25)(c)(i)(B): overhead costs directly attributable and allocable to the operation and maintenance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(25)(c)(i)(C): depreciation and a return on undepreciated capital investment.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(25)(d)(v): separating;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(25)(d)(vi): treating; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(25)(d)(vii): (25)(d)(i); (vi); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act a process similar to Subsections

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(27): "Well or wells" means any extractive means from which oil or gas is produced or extracted, located within an oil or gas field, and operated by one person.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(28): 40-6-2 "Wildcat well" means an oil and gas producing well which is drilled and completed in a pool, as defined under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(29): "Working interest owner" means the owner of an interest in oil or gas burdened with a share of the expenses of developing and operating the property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(30): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(30)(a): "Workover" means any downhole operation that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(30)(a)(i): conducted to sustain, restore, or increase the producibility or serviceability of a well in the geologic intervals in which the well is currently completed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(30)(a)(ii): approved by the division as a workover.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-101(30)(b): "Workover" does not include operations that are conducted primarily as routine maintenance or to replace worn or damaged equipment.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(3)(b)(i): dividing the taxable value by the taxable volume;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(3)(b)(ii): (4)(b)(i); (3)(b)(i); (4)(b)(i); (4)(b)(ii); (3)(b)(i); (4)(b)(ii)

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(3)(c): (4)(c) The severance tax on natural gas liquids shall be calculated by multiplying the taxable value of the natural gas liquids by the severance tax rate in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(4): (9) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(4)(a): the severance tax rate for oil is as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(4)(a)(i): 3% of the taxable value of the oil up to and including the first $13 per barrel for oil; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(4)(a)(ii): 5% of the taxable value of the oil from $13.01 and above per barrel for oil;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(4)(b): the severance tax rate for natural gas is as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(4)(b)(i): 3% of the taxable value of the natural gas up to and including the first $1.50 per MCF for gas; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(4)(b)(ii): 5% of the taxable value of the natural gas from $1.51 and above per MCF for gas; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(4)(c): the severance tax rate for natural gas liquids is 4% of the taxable value of the natural gas liquids.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(5): If oil or gas is shipped outside the state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(5)(a): the shipment constitutes a sale; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(5)(b): the oil or gas is subject to the tax imposed by this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(6)(b): If oil or gas is stockpiled for more than two years, the oil or gas is subject to the tax imposed by this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(7)(d)(iii): An independent certified public accountant shall:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(7)(d)(iii)(B): provide a report on the accuracy and validity of the amount of expenses of a well recompletion or workover that the taxpayer included in the summary, in accordance with the agreed upon procedures.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(7)(d)(iv): The taxpayer shall submit the taxpayer's summary and the independent certified public accountant's report to the division to verify that the expenses certified by the independent certified public accountant are well recompletion or workover expenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(7)(d)(v): The division shall return to the taxpayer:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(7)(d)(v)(A): the taxpayer's summary;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(7)(d)(v)(B): the report by the independent certified public accountant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(7)(d)(v)(C): a report by the division that includes the amount of approved well recompletion or workover expenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(7)(d)(vi): The taxpayer shall apply to the office for a tax credit certificate to receive a written certification, on a form approved by the commission, that includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(7)(d)(vi)(A): the amount of the taxpayer's payments of expenses of a well recompletion or workover during the calendar year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(7)(d)(vi)(B): the amount of the taxpayer's tax credit.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(9): A 50% reduction in the tax rate is imposed upon the incremental production achieved from an enhanced recovery project.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(10): The taxes imposed by this section are:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(10)(a): in addition to all other taxes provided by law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(10)(b): delinquent, unless otherwise deferred, on June 1 following the calendar year when the oil or gas is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(10)(b)(i): produced; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(10)(b)(ii):

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(10)(b)(ii)(B): sold; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(10)(b)(ii)(C): transported from the field.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(11): With respect to the tax imposed by this section on each owner of an interest in the production of oil or gas or in the proceeds of the production of oil or gas in the state, each owner is liable for the tax in proportion to the owner's interest in the production or in the proceeds of the production.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(12): The tax imposed by this section shall be reported and paid by each producer that takes oil or gas in kind pursuant to an agreement on behalf of the producer and on behalf of each owner entitled to participate in the oil or gas sold by the producer or transported by the producer from the field where the oil or gas is produced.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-102(13): Each producer shall deduct the tax imposed by this section from the amounts due to other owners for the production or the proceeds of the production.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-108 Tax as lien on property or oil and gas production interests.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-108(1): The severance tax imposed by this chapter, together with penalties and interest, is and shall remain a lien upon the owner's interest in the oil or gas well or rights in the well from which the oil or gas is extracted, until the tax is paid.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-108(2): In the case of an owner who has no interest in the oil or gas well, but only in the proceeds of production from it, the lien is upon the oil or gas production rights or royalty interests in the well.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-109 Adjudicative proceedings for correction of amount of tax.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If any person feels aggrieved because of the amount of the severance tax determined by the commission, the person may file a request for agency action with the commission within 30 days after notice is mailed to the person, requesting an adjudicative proceeding and the correction of the assessed tax.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-110 Decisions of commission.
-------------------------------------------------------
Every decision of the commission shall be in writing and notice of the decision shall be mailed to the taxpayer within 10 days. All decisions become final upon the expiration of 30 days after notice has been mailed to the taxpayer, unless proceedings are taken within such time for a review in accordance with

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-111 Condition precedent to judicial review.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-111(1): Before seeking judicial review, the taxpayer shall deposit with the commission the full amount of taxes, interest, and other charges audited and stated in the decision of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-111(2): (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-111(2)(a): (2)(b) If the party appealing executes an undertaking meeting the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-111(2)(b): The taxpayer shall file an undertaking with the commission in the amount and with the surety approved by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-111(2)(c): The undertaking shall provide that, if the appeal is dismissed or the decision of the commission is affirmed, the party appealing will pay all costs and charges that may accrue against the party in the prosecution of the case.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-111(2)(d): At the option of the party appealing, the undertaking may be in a sum sufficient to cover the taxes, interest, and other charges, audited or stated in the decision, plus the costs or charges that may accrue against the party appealing in the prosecution of the case.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-119 Disposition of certain taxes collected on Navajo Nation land located in Utah.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-119(1)(b): 80% of the taxes collected on oil, gas, or other hydrocarbon substances produced from a well:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-119(1)(b)(i): for which production began on or after July 1, 1996; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-119(1)(b)(ii): attributable to interests in Utah held in trust by the United States for the Navajo Nation and its members.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-119(2): (2)(a); 51-9-305; 51-9-306; 51-9-307; 59-5-115
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-119(2)(a): The maximum amount deposited in the Navajo Revitalization Fund may not exceed:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-119(2)(a)(i): $2,000,000 in fiscal year 2006-07; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-119(2)(a)(ii): $3,000,000 for fiscal years beginning with fiscal year 2007-08.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-119(2)(b): (2)(a); 51-9-305; 51-9-306; 51-9-307; 59-5-115 Any amounts in excess of the maximum described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-120 Exemption.
-----------------------------------------
Beginning on January 1, 2006, and ending on June 30, 2026, no severance tax required by this chapter is imposed on oil and gas produced, saved, sold, or transported if the oil or gas produced, saved, sold, or transported is derived from:Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-120(1): coal-to-liquids technology;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-120(2): oil shale; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-120(3): oil sands.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-121 Severance tax revenue for aviation fuel incentive account.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-121(1): (3); 11-58-208; 59-5-102; 51-9-305; 51-9-306; 59-5-116; 59-5-119; 11-58-201 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-121(1)(a): (3) "Base revenue year" means the fiscal year designated by the port authority under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-121(1)(b): 11-58-208 "Incentive account" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-121(1)(c): "Incremental revenue" means the amount that is calculated by subtracting the net severance revenue for the base revenue year from the net severance revenue for the applicable incremental revenue year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-121(1)(d): "Incremental revenue year" means any of the first 10 consecutive fiscal years immediately following the base revenue year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-121(1)(e): 59-5-102; 51-9-305; 51-9-306; 59-5-116; 59-5-119 "Net severance revenue" means the amount of severance tax revenue collected during a fiscal year under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-121(1)(f): 11-58-201 "Port authority" means the Utah Inland Port Authority created in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-121(3): 11-58-208; 59-5-102

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-121(3)(a)(i): begins on or after July 1, 2023; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-121(3)(a)(ii): 11-58-208; 59-5-102 the port authority determines will precede the first fiscal year during which the effects of the aviation fuel incentive program under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-121(4)(b): The maximum cumulative amount of incremental revenue that the Division of Finance may deposit into the incentive account is $10,000,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-121(4)(c): If the amount of incremental revenue for any incentive year is less than $1,000,000, the Division of Finance shall deposit into the incentive account the amount of incremental revenue available.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201 Definitions.
-------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a): "Metalliferous minerals" includes any ore, metal, or other substance containing the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(i): aluminum;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(ii): antimony;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(iii): arsenic;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(iv): barium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(v): beryllium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(vi): bismuth;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(vii): boron;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(viii): cadmium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(ix): calcium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(x): cerium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xi): cesium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xii): chromium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xiii): cobalt;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xiv): columbium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xv): copper;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xvi): gallium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xvii): germanium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xviii): gold;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xix): hafnium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xx): indium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xxi): iridium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xxii): iron;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xxiii): lanthanum;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xxiv): lead;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xxv): lithium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xxvi): manganese;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xxvii): mercury;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xxviii): molybdenum;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xxix): nickel;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xxx): osmium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xxxi): palladium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xxxii): platinum;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xxxiii): praseodymium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xxxiv): rare earth metals;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xxxv): rhenium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xxxvi): rhodium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xxxvii): rubidium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xxxviii): ruthenium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xxxix): samarium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xl): scandium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xli): selenium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xlii): silicon;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xliii): silver;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xliv): sodium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xlv): strontium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xlvi): tantalum;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xlvii): tellurium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xlviii): thallium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(xlix): thorium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(l): tin;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(li): titanium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(lii): tungsten;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(liii): uranium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(liv): vanadium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(lv): yttrium;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(lvi): zinc; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(a)(lvii): zirconium.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(b): "Metalliferous minerals" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(b)(i): chloride compounds or salts;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(b)(ii): potash;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(b)(iii): rock, sand, gravel, and stone products;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(b)(iv): gypsum;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(b)(v): sulfur or sulfuric acid;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(b)(vi): gem stones;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(b)(vii): ammonium nitrate;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(b)(viii): carbon dioxide;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(b)(ix): oil, gas, coal, and all carboniferous materials; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(1)(b)(x): phosphate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(2): "Mine" means an operation for extracting minerals and includes any deposit of valuable metalliferous minerals that are being extracted from a natural deposit, or a secondary source including tails, slag, waste dumps, or other similar secondary source, whether in solution or otherwise.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(3): "Mining" means the act, process, or work of extracting minerals from their natural occurring environment or from a mine, and transporting or moving those minerals to the point of processing, use, or sale.  "Mining" includes the process of leaching minerals from their naturally occurring deposit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-201(4): "Ore" means raw materials in their natural state or condition prior to beneficiation or processing, and includes mined raw materials extracted prior to further processing.  "Ore" includes any metalliferous material whose metal content is less than 15% and does not include any material whose metal content is 15% or greater.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202 Severance tax -- Rate -- Computation -- Annual exemption.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(1): A person engaged in the business of mining or extracting metalliferous minerals in this state shall pay to the state a severance tax equal to 2.6% of the taxable value of all metals or metalliferous minerals sold or otherwise disposed of.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(2): If the metals or metalliferous minerals are shipped outside the state, this constitutes a sale, and the finished metals or the recoverable units of finished metals from the metalliferous minerals shipped are subject to the severance tax.  If the metals or metalliferous minerals are stockpiled, the tax is not applicable until they are sold or shipped out of state.  For purposes of the tax imposed by this chapter, uranium concentrates shall be considered to be finished metals.  The owner of the metals or metalliferous minerals that are stockpiled shall report to the commission annually, in a form acceptable to the commission, the amount of metalliferous minerals so stockpiled.  Metals or metalliferous minerals that are stockpiled for more than two years, however, are subject to the severance tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(3): An annual exemption from the payment of the tax imposed by this chapter upon the first $50,000 in gross value of the metalliferous mineral is allowed to each mine.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(4): These taxes are in addition to all other taxes provided by law and are delinquent, unless otherwise deferred, on June 1 next succeeding the calendar year when the metalliferous mineral is produced and sold or delivered.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(5): (5); 59-5-201; (5); 65A-6-4
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(5)(a): (5) As used in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(5)(a)(i): "Great Salt Lake extraction operator" means a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(5)(a)(i)(A): is engaged in the business of mining or extracting metalliferous minerals from the brine of the Great Salt Lake; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(5)(a)(i)(B): enters into a mineral lease with the Division of Forestry, Fire, and State Lands on or after May 3, 2023, or as of July 1, 2020, had a mineral lease with the Division of Forestry, Fire, and State Lands, but not a royalty agreement for a metalliferous mineral, chloride compound, or salt.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(5)(a)(ii): "Metalliferous compound" means a metalliferous mineral or a chloride compound or salt containing a metalliferous mineral.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(5)(b): 59-5-201 Notwithstanding the exclusion for chloride compounds or salts from the definition of metalliferous minerals under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(5)(c): (5) This Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(5)(c)(i): excuse a person from paying a severance tax in accordance with the other provisions of this part; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(5)(c)(ii): void a mineral lease or royalty agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(5)(d): 65A-6-4 A person extracting metalliferous minerals, including a metalliferous compound, from the brine of the Great Salt Lake is subject to the payment of a royalty agreement under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202 Severance tax -- Rate -- Computation -- Annual exemption.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(1): A person engaged in the business of mining or extracting metalliferous minerals in this state shall pay to the state a severance tax equal to 2.6% of the taxable value of all metals or metalliferous minerals sold or otherwise disposed of.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(2): If the metals or metalliferous minerals are shipped outside the state, this constitutes a sale, and the finished metals or the recoverable units of finished metals from the metalliferous minerals shipped are subject to the severance tax.  If the metals or metalliferous minerals are stockpiled, the tax is not applicable until they are sold or shipped out of state.  For purposes of the tax imposed by this chapter, uranium concentrates shall be considered to be finished metals.  The owner of the metals or metalliferous minerals that are stockpiled shall report to the commission annually, in a form acceptable to the commission, the amount of metalliferous minerals so stockpiled.  Metals or metalliferous minerals that are stockpiled for more than two years, however, are subject to the severance tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(3): An annual exemption from the payment of the tax imposed by this chapter upon the first $50,000 in gross value of the metalliferous mineral is allowed to each mine.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(4): These taxes are in addition to all other taxes provided by law and are delinquent, unless otherwise deferred, on June 1 next succeeding the calendar year when the metalliferous mineral is produced and sold or delivered.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(5): 65A-17-101; 59-5-201; 73-3-30; 73-3-30; 73-3-30; 65A-17-306; 65A-17-306; 73-3-30; 65A-6-4; 51-9-305; 65A-5-1; 65A-6-4

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(5)(a)(i): "Great Salt Lake element or mineral" means a metalliferous mineral, metal, ore, chloride compound, potash, or salt mined or extracted from the brines of the Great Salt Lake.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(5)(a)(ii): 65A-17-101 "Great Salt Lake elevation" means the same as that term is defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(5)(a)(iv): For purposes of each tax imposed under Subsection (5)(b), "incremental revenue" means the difference between the sum of the revenue collected for the fiscal year from each of the tax rates imposed under Subsection (5)(b) and the revenue collected for the fiscal year from the tax rate imposed under Subsection (1).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-202(5)(a)(v): "Metalliferous compound" means a metalliferous mineral or a chloride compound or salt containing a metalliferous mineral.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203 Determining taxable value.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(1): (3); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(a); (b); (c); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(1)(a): If the metals or metalliferous mineral products are actually sold, the value of those metals or metalliferous mineral products shall be the gross amount the producer receives from that sale, provided that the metals or metalliferous mineral products are sold under a bona fide contract of sale between unaffiliated parties.  In the case of a sale of uranium concentrates, gross proceeds shall be the gross amount the producer receives from the sale of processed uranium concentrate or "yellowcake," provided that the uranium concentrate is sold under a bona fide contract of sale between unaffiliated parties.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(1)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act If the metals or metalliferous mineral products are not actually sold but are shipped, transported, or delivered out of state, the gross proceeds shall be the multiple of the recoverable units of finished metals, or of the finished metals contained in the metalliferous minerals shipped, and the average daily price per unit of contained metals as quoted by an established authority for market prices of metals for the period during which the tax imposed by this chapter is due.  The established authority or authorities shall be designated by the commission by rule adopted in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(1)(c): In the case of metals or metalliferous minerals not sold, but otherwise disposed of, for which there is no established authority for market prices of metals for the period during which the tax imposed by this chapter is due, gross proceeds is determined by allocating to the state the same proportion of the producer's total sales of metals or metalliferous minerals sold or otherwise disposed of as the producer's total Utah costs bear to the total costs associated with sale or disposal of the metal or metalliferous mineral.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(1)(d): (1)(a); (b); (c); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act In the event of a sale of metals or metalliferous minerals between affiliated companies which is not a bona fide sale because the value received is not proportionate to the fair market value of the metals or metalliferous minerals or in the event that Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(2): For all metals except beryllium, the taxable value of the metalliferous mineral sold or otherwise disposed of is 30% of the gross proceeds received for the metals sold or otherwise disposed of by the producer of the metal.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(3): (1); (4) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(4): (3) Except as provided in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203 Determining taxable value.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(1): 59-5-202; 59-5-202 Except as provided in Subsection (3), the basis for computing the gross proceeds, prior to those deductions or adjustments specified in this chapter, in determining the taxable value of the metals, metalliferous minerals, or metalliferous compounds, as defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(1)(a): If the metals, metalliferous mineral products, or metalliferous compounds are actually sold, the value of those metals, metalliferous mineral products, or metalliferous compounds shall be the gross amount the producer receives from that sale, provided that the metals, metalliferous mineral products, or metalliferous compounds are sold under a bona fide contract of sale between unaffiliated parties.  In the case of a sale of uranium concentrates, gross proceeds shall be the gross amount the producer receives from the sale of processed uranium concentrate or "yellowcake," provided that the uranium concentrate is sold under a bona fide contract of sale between unaffiliated parties.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(1)(b): 59-5-202
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(1)(b)(i): 59-5-202 For purposes of a Great Salt Lake extraction operator, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(1)(b)(ii): The established authority or authorities under this Subsection (1)(b) shall be designated by the commission by rule adopted in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(1)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(1)(c)(i): If the metals, metalliferous mineral products, or metalliferous compounds are not actually sold but are shipped, transported, or delivered out of state, the gross proceeds shall be the multiple of the recoverable units of finished metals, or of the finished metals contained in the metalliferous minerals or metalliferous compounds shipped, and the average daily price per unit of contained metals as quoted by an established authority for market prices of metals for the period during which the tax imposed by this chapter is due.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(1)(c)(ii): The established authority or authorities shall be designated by the commission by rule adopted in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(1)(d): In the case of metals, metalliferous minerals, or metalliferous compounds not sold, but otherwise disposed of, for which there is no established authority for market prices of metals for the period during which the tax imposed by this chapter is due, gross proceeds is determined by allocating to the state the same proportion of the producer's total sales of metals, metalliferous minerals, or metalliferous compounds sold or otherwise disposed of as the producer's total Utah costs bear to the total costs associated with sale or disposal of the metal or metalliferous mineral.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(1)(e): In the event of a sale of metals, metalliferous minerals, or metalliferous compounds between affiliated companies which is not a bona fide sale because the value received is not proportionate to the fair market value of the metals, metalliferous minerals, metalliferous compounds or in the event that Subsection (1)(a), (b), (c), or (d) are not applicable, the commission shall determine the value of such metals, metalliferous minerals, or metalliferous compounds in an equitable manner by reference to an objective standard as specified in a rule adopted in accordance with the provisions of Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(2): For all metals except beryllium, the taxable value of the metalliferous mineral sold or otherwise disposed of is 30% of the gross proceeds received for the metals sold or otherwise disposed of by the producer of the metal.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(3): Notwithstanding Subsection (1) or (4), the taxable value of beryllium sold or otherwise disposed of by the producer of the beryllium is equal to 125% of the direct mining costs incurred in mining the beryllium.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-203(4): Except as provided in Subsection (3), if the metalliferous mineral sold or otherwise disposed of is sold or shipped out of state in the form of ore, then the taxable value is 80% of the gross proceeds.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-204 Statements filed -- Contents -- Verification -- Falsification as perjury.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-204(1): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act Every person engaged in the business of mining or extracting metalliferous minerals shall make and file with the commission, on or before June 1 of each year on forms furnished by the commission, a statement containing:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-204(1)(a): the name, description, and location of the mine owned and operated by the person during the preceding calendar year;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-204(1)(b): the number of tons of mineral mined during the preceding calendar year and the disposition of the mineral;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-204(1)(c): the total amount received during the preceding calendar year from the sale of minerals; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-204(1)(d): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act such other reasonable and necessary information as the commission may require for the proper enforcement of this chapter as specified in a rule adopted under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-204(2): The owner of the mine shall be responsible for the statement or report required by this section, but the principal lessee, contractor, or operator may, with the consent of the commission, report and pay the tax as agent for the owner.  The owner shall be entitled to deduct and remit to the commission any tax chargeable upon the operations conducted by the lessees or other parties.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-204(3): Title 76, Utah Criminal Code The statements or reports required to be filed with the commission shall be signed and sworn to by the person required to file the statements or reports, by a partner if a partnership, or by the president, secretary, or managing officer, if a corporation.  Any willful false swearing as to the purported material facts set out in this report constitutes the crime of perjury and shall be punished as such under


Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-206 Interest and penalty -- Overpayments.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-206(1): 59-1-401; 59-1-402 In case of any failure to make or file a return required by this chapter, the penalty provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-206(2): 59-1-402 An overpayment of a tax imposed by this chapter shall accrue interest at the rate and in the manner prescribed in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207 Date tax due -- Extensions -- Installment payments -- Penalty on delinquencies -- Audit.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(1): The tax imposed by this chapter is due and payable on or before June 1 of the year next succeeding the calendar year when the mineral is produced and sold or delivered.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(2): 59-1-402 The commission may, for good cause shown upon a written application by the taxpayer, extend the time of payment of the whole or any part of the tax for a period not to exceed six months.  If an extension is granted, interest at the rate and in the manner prescribed in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(3): Every taxpayer subject to this chapter whose total tax obligation for the preceding calendar year was $3,000 or more shall pay the taxes assessed under this chapter in quarterly installments.  Each installment shall be based on the estimated gross value received by the taxpayer during the quarter preceding the date on which the installment is due.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(4): The quarterly installments are due as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(4)(a): for January 1 through March 31, on or before June 1;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(4)(b): for April 1 through June 30, on or before September 1;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(4)(c): for July 1 through September 30, on or before December 1; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(4)(d): for October 1 through December 31, on or before March 1 of the next year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(5): 59-1-401; (6)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(5)(a): 59-1-401; (6) If the taxpayer fails to report and pay any tax when due, the taxpayer is subject to the penalties provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(5)(b): An underpayment exists if less than 80% of the tax due for a quarter is paid.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(6): The penalty for failure to pay the tax due or underpayment of tax may not be assessed if the taxpayer's quarterly tax installment payment equals 25% of the tax reported and paid by the taxpayer for the preceding taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(7): There shall be no interest added to any estimated tax payments subject to a penalty under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(8): The commission may conduct audits to determine whether any tax is owed under this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207 Date tax due -- Extensions -- Installment payments -- Penalty on delinquencies -- Audit.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(1): The tax imposed by this chapter is due and payable on or before June 1 of the year next succeeding the calendar year when the mineral is produced and sold or delivered.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(2): 59-1-402 The commission may, for good cause shown upon a written application by the taxpayer, extend the time of payment of the whole or any part of the tax for a period not to exceed six months.  If an extension is granted, interest at the rate and in the manner prescribed in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(3): Every taxpayer subject to this chapter whose total tax obligation for the preceding calendar year was $3,000 or more shall pay the taxes assessed under this chapter in quarterly installments.  Each installment shall be based on the estimated gross value received by the taxpayer during the quarter preceding the date on which the installment is due.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(4): The quarterly installments are due as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(4)(a): for January 1 through March 31, on or before June 1;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(4)(b): for April 1 through June 30, on or before September 1;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(4)(c): for July 1 through September 30, on or before December 1; and

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(6): The penalty for failure to pay the tax due or underpayment of tax may not be assessed if the taxpayer's quarterly tax installment payment equals 25% of the tax reported and paid by the taxpayer for the preceding taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(7): There shall be no interest added to any estimated tax payments subject to a penalty under this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-207(9): 59-5-202; 65A-17-306 For purposes of a Great Salt Lake extraction operator under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-208 Tax as lien.
-------------------------------------------
The tax imposed by this chapter, together with penalties and interest, is and shall remain a lien upon the mine or mining claim from which the mineral is extracted, until the tax is paid.  In the case of unpatented claims or leases on unpatented ground, the lien shall be upon the mining rights.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-209 Adjudicative proceedings for correction of amount of tax.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If any person feels aggrieved because of the amount of the tax determined by the commission, the person may file a request for agency action with the commission within 30 days after notice is mailed to the person, requesting an adjudicative proceeding and the correction of the assessed tax.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-210 Decisions of commission.
-------------------------------------------------------
Every decision of the commission shall be in writing and notice of the decision shall be mailed to the taxpayer within 10 days.  All decisions become final upon the expiration of 30 days after notice has been mailed to the taxpayer, unless proceedings are taken within such time for a review in accordance with

Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-211 Condition precedent to judicial review.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-211(1): Before seeking judicial review, the taxpayer shall deposit with the commission the full amount of taxes, interest, and other charges audited and stated in the decision of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-211(2): (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-211(2)(a): (2)(b) If the party appealing executes an undertaking meeting the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-211(2)(b): The undertaking shall be filed with the commission in the amount and with the surety approved by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-211(2)(c): The undertaking shall provide that, if the appeal is dismissed or the decision of the commission is affirmed, the party appealing will pay all costs and charges that may accrue against the party in the prosecution of the case.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-5-211(2)(d): At the option of the party appealing, the undertaking may be in a sum sufficient to cover the taxes, interest, and other charges, audited or stated in the decision, plus the costs or charges that may accrue against the party appealing in the prosecution of the case.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Chapter 7 - Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101 Definitions.
-------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(1): 59-7-105; 59-7-106 "Adjusted income" means unadjusted income as modified by Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(2): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(2)(a): "Affiliated group" means one or more chains of corporations that are connected through stock ownership with a common parent corporation that meet the following requirements:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(2)(a)(i): at least 80% of the stock of each of the corporations in the group, excluding the common parent corporation, is owned by one or more of the other corporations in the group; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(2)(a)(ii): the common parent directly owns at least 80% of the stock of at least one of the corporations in the group.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(2)(b): "Affiliated group" does not include corporations that are qualified to do business but are not otherwise doing business in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(2)(c): (2) For purposes of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(3): "Apportionable income" means adjusted income less nonbusiness income net of related expenses, to the extent included in adjusted income.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(4): 59-7-311 "Apportioned income" means apportionable income multiplied by the apportionment fraction as determined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(5): 59-7-302 "Business income" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(6): 31A-1-301 "Captive insurance company" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(7): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(7)(a): "Captive real estate investment trust" means a real estate investment trust if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(7)(a)(i): the shares or beneficial interests of the real estate investment trust are not regularly traded on an established securities market; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(7)(a)(ii): more than 50% of the voting power or value of the shares or beneficial interests of the real estate investment trust are directly, indirectly, or constructively:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(7)(a)(ii)(A): owned by a controlling entity of the real estate investment trust; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(7)(a)(ii)(B): controlled by a controlling entity of the real estate investment trust.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(7)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(8): (2)(a)(i); (ii); (2)(a)(i); (2)(a)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(8)(a): (2)(a)(i); (ii); (2)(a)(i); (2)(a)(ii) "Common ownership" means the direct or indirect control or ownership of more than 50% of the outstanding voting stock of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(8)(a)(i): a parent-subsidiary controlled group as defined in Section 1563, Internal Revenue Code, except that 50% shall be substituted for 80%;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(8)(a)(ii): a brother-sister controlled group as defined in Section 1563, Internal Revenue Code; or

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(9): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(9)(a): "Controlling entity of a captive real estate investment trust" means an entity that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(9)(a)(i): is treated as an association taxable as a corporation under the Internal Revenue Code;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(9)(a)(ii): is not exempt from federal income taxation under Section 501(a), Internal Revenue Code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(9)(a)(iii): directly, indirectly, or constructively holds more than 50% of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(9)(a)(iii)(A): the voting power of a captive real estate investment trust; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(9)(a)(iii)(B): the value of the shares or beneficial interests of a captive real estate investment trust.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(9)(b): "Controlling entity of a captive real estate investment trust" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(9)(b)(i): a real estate investment trust, except for a captive real estate investment trust;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(9)(b)(ii): a qualified real estate investment subsidiary described in Section 856(i), Internal Revenue Code, except for a qualified real estate investment trust subsidiary of a captive real estate investment trust; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(9)(b)(iii): a foreign real estate investment trust.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(9)(c): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(10): "Corporate return" or "return" includes a combined report.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(11): "Corporation" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(11)(a): entities defined as corporations under Sections 7701(a) and 7704, Internal Revenue Code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(11)(b): other organizations that are taxed as corporations for federal income tax purposes under the Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(12): "COVID-19" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(12)(a): the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(12)(b): the disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(13): "Dividend" means any distribution, including money or other type of property, made by a corporation to its shareholders out of its earnings or profits accumulated after December 31, 1930.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(14): (14)(c); 59-7-102(3)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(14)(a): "Doing business" includes any transaction in the course of business by a domestic corporation or by a foreign corporation qualified to do or doing business in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(14)(b): (14)(c); 59-7-102(3) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(14)(b)(i): the right to do business through incorporation or qualification;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(14)(b)(ii): owning, renting, or leasing of real or personal property within this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(14)(b)(iii): the participation in joint ventures, working and operating agreements, the performance of which takes place in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(14)(b)(iv): selling or performing a service in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(14)(b)(v): earning income from the use of intangible property in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(14)(c): "Doing business" does not include the business activity of a corporation if the corporation's only business activity within the state is the solicitation of orders for sales of tangible personal property that are protected under 15 U.S.C. Secs. 381 through 384.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(15): "Domestic corporation" means a corporation that is incorporated or organized under the laws of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(16): "Exercising a corporate franchise" does not include the business activity of a corporation if the corporation's only business activity within the state is the solicitation of orders for sales of tangible personal property that are protected under 15 U.S.C. Secs. 381 through 384.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(18): "Foreign corporation" means a corporation that is not incorporated or organized under the laws of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(19): 59-7-401; Part 3, Allocation and Apportionment of Income - Utah UDITPA Provisions
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(19)(a): 59-7-401; Part 3, Allocation and Apportionment of Income - Utah UDITPA Provisions "Foreign operating company" means a corporation that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(19)(a)(i): is incorporated in the United States;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(19)(a)(ii): 59-7-401 conducts at least 80% of the corporation's business activity, as determined under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(19)(a)(iii)(A): at least $1,000,000 of payroll located outside the United States; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(19)(a)(iii)(B): at least $2,000,000 of property located outside the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(19)(b): "Foreign operating company" does not include a corporation that qualifies for the Puerto Rico and possession tax credit as provided in Section 936, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20)(a): "Foreign real estate investment trust" means:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20)(a)(i)(A)(II): cash or cash equivalents; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20)(a)(i)(A)(III): one or more securities issued or guaranteed by the United States;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20)(a)(i)(B): the business entity is:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20)(a)(i)(B)(I)(Aa): on amounts distributed to the business entity's beneficial owners; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20)(a)(i)(B)(I)(Bb): in the jurisdiction in which the business entity is organized; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20)(a)(i)(B)(II): exempt from income taxation on an entity level in the jurisdiction in which the business entity is organized;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20)(a)(i)(C): the business entity distributes at least 85% of the business entity's taxable income, as computed in the jurisdiction in which the business entity is organized, to the holders of the business entity's:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20)(a)(i)(C)(I): shares or beneficial interests; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20)(a)(i)(C)(II): on an annual basis;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20)(a)(i)(D):

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20)(a)(i)(D)(I)(Aa): the voting power of the business entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20)(a)(i)(D)(I)(Bb): the value of the shares or beneficial interests of the business entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20)(a)(i)(D)(II): the shares of the business entity are regularly traded on an established securities market; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20)(a)(i)(E): the business entity is organized in a country that has a tax treaty with the United States; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20)(a)(ii): a listed Australian property trust.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20)(b)(i): "cash or cash equivalents";
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20)(b)(ii): "established securities market"; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(20)(b)(iii): "listed Australian property trust."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(22): "Internal Revenue Code" means Title 26 of the United States Code as effective during the year in which Utah taxable income is determined.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(24): "Real estate investment trust" means the same as that term is defined in Section 856, Internal Revenue Code.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(25)(a): expenses directly attributable to nonbusiness income; and

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(27): "Safe harbor lease" means a lease that qualified as a safe harbor lease under Section 168, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(28): "Special deduction" includes a deduction under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(28)(a): Section 250, Internal Revenue Code; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(28)(b): Section 965(c), Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(29): "State of the United States" includes any of the 50 states or the District of Columbia.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(30): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(30)(a): "Taxable year" means the calendar year or the fiscal year ending during such calendar year upon the basis of which the adjusted income is computed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(30)(b): In the case of a return made for a fractional part of a year under this chapter or under rules prescribed by the commission, "taxable year" includes the period for which such return is made.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(31): "Taxpayer" means any corporation subject to the tax imposed by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(32): 59-7-401 "Threshold level of business activity" means business activity in the United States equal to or greater than 20% of the corporation's total business activity as determined under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(33): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(33)(a): "Unadjusted income" means federal taxable income as determined on a separate return basis before intercompany eliminations as determined by the Internal Revenue Code, before the net operating loss deduction and special deductions.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(33)(b): "Unadjusted income" includes deferred foreign income described in Section 965(a), Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(33)(c): "Unadjusted income" does not include income received from:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(33)(c)(i): a loan forgiven in accordance with 15 U.S.C. Sec. 636(a)(36), to the extent that a deduction for the expenditures paid with the loan is disallowed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(33)(c)(ii): a similar paycheck protection loan that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(33)(c)(ii)(A): authorized by the federal government;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(33)(c)(ii)(B): provided in response to COVID-19;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(33)(c)(ii)(C): forgiven if the borrower meets the expenditure requirements; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(33)(c)(ii)(D): exempt from federal income tax, to the extent that a deduction for the expenditures paid with the loan is disallowed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(34): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(34)(a): "Unitary group" means a group of corporations that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(34)(a)(i): are related through common ownership; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(34)(a)(ii): by a preponderance of the evidence as determined by a court of competent jurisdiction or the commission, are economically interdependent with one another as demonstrated by the following factors:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(34)(a)(ii)(A): centralized management;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(34)(a)(ii)(B): functional integration; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(34)(a)(ii)(C): economies of scale.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(34)(b): "Unitary group" includes a captive real estate investment trust.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(34)(c): "Unitary group" does not include an S corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(35): "United States" includes the 50 states and the District of Columbia.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(36): "Utah net loss" means the current year Utah taxable income before Utah net loss deduction, if determined to be less than zero.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(37): 59-7-110 "Utah net loss deduction" means the amount of Utah net losses from other taxable years that a taxpayer may carry forward to the current taxable year in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(38): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(38)(a): "Utah taxable income" means Utah taxable income before net loss deduction less Utah net loss deduction.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(38)(b): "Utah taxable income" includes income from tangible or intangible property located or having situs in this state, regardless of whether carried on in intrastate, interstate, or foreign commerce.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(39): "Utah taxable income before net loss deduction" means apportioned income plus nonbusiness income allocable to Utah net of related expenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(40): (40); 59-7-402(2)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(40)(a): (40); 59-7-402(2) "Water's edge combined report" means a report combining the income and activities of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(40)(a)(i): (40) all members of a unitary group that are:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(40)(a)(i)(A): (40) corporations organized or incorporated in the United States, including those corporations qualifying for the Puerto Rico and Possession Tax Credit as provided in Section 936, Internal Revenue Code, in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(40)(a)(i)(B): corporations organized or incorporated outside of the United States meeting the threshold level of business activity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(40)(a)(ii): 59-7-402(2) an affiliated group electing to file a water's edge combined report under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(40)(b): There is a rebuttable presumption that a corporation which qualifies for the Puerto Rico and possession tax credit provided in Section 936, Internal Revenue Code, is part of a unitary group.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-101(41): "Worldwide combined report" means the combination of the income and activities of all members of a unitary group irrespective of the country in which the corporations are incorporated or conduct business activity.
