Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-103 Chapter applicable to receivers, trustees in bankruptcy and assignees.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Unless otherwise provided in this chapter, receivers, trustees in bankruptcy, and assignees for creditors required to make returns under this chapter shall be subject to the provisions of this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-104 Tax -- Minimum tax.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-104(1): 59-7-102 Each domestic and foreign corporation, except a corporation that is exempt under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-104(2): The tax shall be 4.55% of a corporation's Utah taxable income.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-104(3): The minimum tax a corporation shall pay under this chapter is $100.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-105 Additions to unadjusted income.
--------------------------------------------------------------
In computing adjusted income the following amounts shall be added to unadjusted income:Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-105(1): interest from bonds, notes, and other evidences of indebtedness issued by any state of the United States, including any agency and instrumentality of a state of the United States;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-105(2): the amount of any deduction taken on a corporation's federal return for taxes paid by a corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-105(2)(a): to Utah for taxes imposed by this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-105(2)(b): to another state of the United States, a foreign country, a United States possession, or the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico for taxes imposed for the privilege of doing business, or exercising its corporate franchise, including income, franchise, corporate stock and business and occupation taxes;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-105(3): 59-7-111(1)(a); (2)(a) the safe harbor lease adjustment required under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-105(4): capital losses that have been deducted on a Utah corporate return in previous years;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-105(5): any deduction on the federal return that has been previously deducted on the Utah return;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-105(6): charitable contributions, to the extent deducted on the federal return when determining federal taxable income;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-105(7): 59-7-114 the amount of gain or loss determined under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-105(8): 59-7-115 the amount of gain or loss determined under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-105(9): 59-7-107 adjustments to gains, losses, depreciation expense, amortization expense, and similar items due to a difference between basis for federal purposes and basis as computed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-105(10): Title 53B, Chapter 8a, Utah Educational Savings Plan; 53B-8a-102; 53B-8a-102.5; 59-7-106(1)(r) the amount withdrawn under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-105(10)(a): 53B-8a-102.5 is not expended for:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-105(10)(b)(i): that is the account owner; and

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-107 Basis.
-------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-107(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-107(1)(a): For property acquired after December 31, 1993, basis shall be determined pursuant to the Internal Revenue Code without reference to Section 1502, Internal Revenue Code, or regulations promulgated under that section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-107(1)(b): (1)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-107(2): For property acquired after December 31, 1930, but before January 1, 1994, basis shall be determined under Utah law in effect at the time the property was acquired.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-107(3): (3)(c); 59-7-402; 59-7-403
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-107(3)(a): (3)(c) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-107(3)(a)(i): the cost of such property or in the case of property acquired by gift or transfer in trust, the fair market value of such property at the time of such acquisition; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-107(3)(a)(ii): the fair market value of such property as of January 1, 1931, whichever is greater.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-107(3)(b): In determining the fair market value of stock in a corporation as of January 1, 1931, due regard shall be given to the fair market value of the assets of the corporation as of that date.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-107(3)(c): 59-7-402; 59-7-403
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-107(3)(c)(i): In determining the basis for inventory acquired before January 1, 1931, if the property should have been included in the last inventory, the basis shall be the value of that property at the last inventory.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-107(3)(c)(ii): In determining the basis for bequests and devises acquired before January 1, 1931, if personal property was acquired by specific bequest, or if real property was acquired by general or specific devise, the basis shall be the fair market value of the property at the time of the death of the decedent. In all other cases if the property was acquired by will, the basis shall be the fair market value of the property at the time of the distribution to the taxpayer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-107(3)(c)(iii): 59-7-402; 59-7-403 In determining the basis for property acquired before January 1, 1931, during affiliation in which a combined report is filed under either Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-107(4): If any property subject to taxation under this chapter was acquired before January 1, 1931, the basis of such property, if other than the fair market value as of January 1, 1931, shall be diminished in the amount of exhaustion, wear and tear, obsolescence, and depletion actually sustained before such date.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-110 Utah net loss -- Carry forward -- Deduction.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-110(1): A taxpayer shall determine the amount of Utah net loss that the taxpayer may carry forward to offset income of another taxable year as provided in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-110(2): Subject to the other provisions of this section, a taxpayer:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-110(2)(a): may carry forward a Utah net loss from a taxable year beginning on or after January 1, 2008, to a future taxable year until the Utah net loss is exhausted; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-110(2)(b): may not carry back a Utah net loss from a taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-110(3): A taxpayer that carries forward a Utah net loss shall carry forward the Utah net loss to the earliest eligible year for which the Utah taxable income before net loss deduction, minus Utah net losses from previous years that a taxpayer applied or was required to apply to offset income, is not less than zero.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-110(4): (4)(b); (3); (3); (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-110(4)(a): (4)(b); (3); (3); (3) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-110(4)(a)(i): the remaining Utah net loss after deduction of any amounts of the Utah net loss that a taxpayer carried to previous years; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-110(4)(a)(ii): (3); (3) the remaining Utah taxable income before net loss deduction of the year identified in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-110(4)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-110(4)(b)(i): For a Utah net loss carried forward to a taxable year beginning on or after January 1, 2023, the amount of Utah net loss that a taxpayer may carry forward to a taxable year may not exceed 80% of Utah taxable income calculated before deducting any Utah net loss from Utah taxable income.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-110(4)(b)(ii): A taxpayer may carry a remaining Utah net loss to one or more taxable years in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-110(5): (5)(a)(ii); (5)(a)(i); (6); (7)

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-111 Safe harbor lease provisions.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-111(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-111(1)(a): For purchasers or lessors of safe harbor leases, the following additions shall be made to unadjusted income:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-111(1)(a)(i): interest expense; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-111(1)(a)(ii): depreciation claimed on safe harbor lease property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-111(1)(b): For purchasers or lessors of safe harbor leases, the following subtractions shall be made from unadjusted income:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-111(1)(b)(i): rental income; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-111(1)(b)(ii): amortization of the purchase price of tax benefits.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-111(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-111(2)(a): For sellers or lessees of safe harbor leases the following additions shall be made from unadjusted income:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-111(2)(a)(i): the amount of gain on the sale of federal tax benefits; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-111(2)(a)(ii): rental expense on safe harbor lease property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-111(2)(b): For sellers or lessees of safe harbor leases the following subtractions shall be made to unadjusted income:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-111(2)(b)(i): interest income; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-111(2)(b)(ii): depreciation on safe harbor lease property.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-112 Installment sales.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-112(1): (2); (3) Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-112(2): Installment sales entered into prior to January 1, 1994, shall be recognized as originally reported.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-112(3): If a corporation is no longer required to file a Utah corporate return, any taxes owed by that corporation on installment sales entered into by that corporation shall accelerate and be due on the corporation's last return filed in Utah.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-113 Allocation of income and deductions between several corporations controlled by same interests.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If two or more corporations (whether or not organized or doing business in this state, and whether or not affiliated) are owned or controlled directly or indirectly by the same interests, the commission is authorized to distribute, apportion, or allocate gross income or deductions between or among such corporations, if it determines that such distribution, apportionment, or allocation is necessary in order to prevent evasion of taxes or clearly to reflect the income of any of such corporations.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-114 Section 338, Internal Revenue Code -- Elections.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-114(1): Transactions for which an election has been made or considered to be made for federal purposes under Section 338, Internal Revenue Code, shall be treated as provided in this section.  An election is not available for state purposes unless an election is made or considered to be made for federal purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-114(2): If an election is made or considered to be made for federal purposes under Section 338, Internal Revenue Code, other than under Subsection 338(h)(10):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-114(2)(a): the target corporation shall file a separate entity one-day tax return for state purposes, as is required for federal purposes, and shall include in such return the gain or loss on the deemed sale of assets in its adjusted income;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-114(2)(b): the gain or loss on the deemed sale of assets shall be apportioned to this state using the apportionment fraction of the target corporation calculated on a separate entity basis for the most recent preceding taxable year consisting of 180 days or more; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-114(2)(c): the due date of the one-day return shall be the same as the due date of the return which includes the taxable period of the target corporation which immediately precedes the one-day return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-114(3): If an election is made for federal purposes under Subsection 338(h)(10), Internal Revenue Code, the following shall apply:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-114(3)(a): if the target corporation is a member of a unitary group immediately preceding the acquisition date, the target corporation shall be included in a combined return to the extent of its income through the acquisition date, and the gain or loss on the deemed sale of assets shall be included in the combined income of the unitary group;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-114(3)(b): if the target corporation is not a member of a unitary group immediately preceding the acquisition date, the target corporation shall file a short period return for the period ending on the acquisition date and shall include in such return the gain or loss on the deemed sale of assets in its adjusted income; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-114(3)(c): any gain or loss which is not recognized for federal purposes on stock sold or exchanged by a member of a selling consolidated group as defined in Section 338, Internal Revenue Code, may not be included in the adjusted income of the selling corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-114(4): There is a rebuttable presumption that the gain or loss on the deemed sale of assets constitutes business income.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-114(5): The new basis of the target corporation's assets shall be determined under Section 338, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-114(6): The target corporation shall be treated as a new corporation as of the day after the acquisition date.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-114(7): The commission may prescribe such rules as necessary to provide for the equitable treatment of any transaction subject to Section 338, Internal Revenue Code.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-115 Section 336(e), Internal Revenue Code -- Elections.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-115(1): Transactions for which an election has been made for federal purposes under Section 336(e), Internal Revenue Code, shall be treated as provided in this section.  An election is not available for state purposes unless an election is made for federal purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-115(2): If an election is made under Section 336(e), Internal Revenue Code, the following shall apply:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-115(2)(a): if the corporation is treated for federal purposes as having disposed of all of its assets and is a member of a unitary group immediately preceding the date of sale, the corporation shall be included in a combined return to the extent of its income through the date of sale, and the gain or loss on the deemed disposal of assets shall be included in the combined income of the unitary group;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-115(2)(b): if the corporation is treated for federal purposes as having disposed of all of its assets and is not a member of a unitary group immediately preceding the date of sale, the corporation shall file a short period return for the period ending on the date of sale and shall include in such return the gain or loss on the deemed disposal of assets in its adjusted income; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-115(2)(c): any gain or loss which is not recognized for federal purposes on stock sold, exchanged, or distributed by a corporation pursuant to Section 336(e), Internal Revenue Code, may not be included in adjusted income.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-115(3): There is a rebuttable presumption that the gain or loss on the deemed disposition of assets constitutes business income.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-115(4): The new basis of assets of the corporation which is treated as having disposed of its assets shall be the same as determined for federal purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-115(5): The corporation which is treated as having disposed of its assets shall be treated as a new corporation as of the day after the date of sale.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-115(6): The commission may prescribe such rules as necessary to provide for the equitable treatment of any transaction subject to Section 336(e), Internal Revenue Code.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-116 Taxation of regulated investment companies.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-116(1): A regulated investment company or a fund of such a company, as defined in Sections 851(a) or 851(g), Internal Revenue Code, which is organized under the laws of Utah, shall determine Utah taxable income as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-116(1)(a): calculate investment company taxable income, as determined in Section 852(b)(2), Internal Revenue Code;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-116(1)(b): add any municipal interest and the exclusion of net capital gain provided in Section 852(b)(2)(A), Internal Revenue Code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-116(1)(c): subtract the deduction for the capital gain dividends and exempt interest dividends as defined in Sections 852(b)(3)(C) and 852(b)(5), Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-116(2): A regulated investment company which is organized under the laws of Utah or a fund of such a company, shall be taxed at the same rate and in the same manner as a corporation as provided in this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-116.5 Real estate investment trusts.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-116.5(1): A real estate investment trust that is not a captive real estate investment trust shall be taxed on the same income taxed for federal purposes under the Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-116.5(2): Any income taxable under this section shall be taxed at the same rate and in the same manner provided for in this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-117 Equitable adjustments.
-----------------------------------------------------
The commission shall by rule prescribe for adjustments to Utah taxable income when, solely by reason of the enactment of this chapter, a taxpayer would otherwise receive or have received a double tax benefit or suffer or have suffered a double tax detriment.  However, the commission may not make any adjustment pursuant to this section which will result in an increase or decrease of tax liability that is less than $25.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-118 Section 965, Internal Revenue Code -- Installment payments.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-118(1): Subject to the other provisions of this section, a corporation may pay in installments the tax owed under this chapter on deferred foreign income described in Section 965, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-118(2): (1) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-118(2)(a): to a corporation that:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-118(2)(a)(ii): apportions deferred foreign income described in Section 965, Internal Revenue Code, to this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-118(2)(b): for a tax year in which a corporation makes an election under Section 965(h), Internal Revenue Code, for purposes of the corporation's federal income tax.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-118(3)(b)(ii): a subsequent installment on or before the due date of the tax return filed under this chapter in each of the following seven years.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-159(1): As used in this section, "committee" means the Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-159(2)(b)(iii):

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-159(2)(b)(v): undertake other review efforts as determined by the committee chairs or as otherwise required by law.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-201 Tax -- Minimum tax.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-201(1): 59-7-102; 59-7-104 There is imposed upon each corporation, except a corporation that is exempt under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-201(2): The tax imposed by Subsection (1) shall be 4.55% of a corporation's Utah taxable income.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-201(3): In no case shall the tax be less than $100.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-203 Computation of Utah taxable income.
------------------------------------------------------------------
For purposes of the tax imposed by this part, Utah taxable income shall be determined in accordance with

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-204 Income attributed to sources within the state.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
For the purposes of the tax imposed by this part, the portion of Utah taxable income derived from or attributable to sources within this state shall be determined in accordance with

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-205 Applicability of Parts 5 and 6 of chapter.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
For purposes of the tax imposed by this part,

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-206 Offsets against tax.
---------------------------------------------------
There shall be offset against the tax imposed by  this part for any period the amount of any tax imposed on the taxpayer under Section

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302 Definitions -- Determination of taxpayer status.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1): 59-2-102; (1)(h)(ii); 59-2-102; 59-2-102(25); (3); 59-7-311(4); 59-7-306; 59-7-310; (2) As used in this part, unless the context otherwise requires:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(a): "Aircraft type" means a particular model of aircraft as designated by the manufacturer of the aircraft.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(b): 59-2-102 "Airline" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(c): "Airline revenue ton miles" means, for an airline, the total revenue ton miles during the airline's tax period.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(d): "Business income" means income that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(d)(i): is apportionable under the United States Constitution and is not allocated under the laws of this state, including income arising from:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(d)(i)(A): a transaction or activity in the regular course of the taxpayer's trade or business; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(d)(i)(B): tangible and intangible property, if the acquisition, management, employment, development, or disposition of the property is or was related to the operation of the taxpayer's trade or business; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(d)(ii): would be allocable to this state under the United States Constitution, but is apportioned rather than allocated in accordance with the laws of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(e): "Commercial domicile" means the principal place from which the trade or business of the taxpayer is directed or managed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(f): "Compensation" means wages, salaries, commissions, and any other form of remuneration paid to employees for personal services.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(g): "Excluded NAICS code" means a NAICS code of the 2017 North American Industry Classification System of the federal Executive Office of the President, Office of Management and Budget, within:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(g)(i): NAICS Code 211120, Crude Petroleum Extraction;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(g)(ii): NAICS Industry Group 2121, Coal Mining;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(g)(iii): NAICS Industry Group 2212, Natural Gas Distribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(g)(iv): NAICS Subsector 311, Food Manufacturing;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(g)(v): NAICS Industry Group 3121, Beverage Manufacturing;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(g)(vi): NAICS Code 327310, Cement Manufacturing;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(g)(vii): NAICS Subsector 482, Rail Transportation;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(g)(viii): NAICS Code 512110, Motion Picture and Video Production;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(g)(ix): NAICS Subsection 515, Broadcasting (except Internet); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(g)(x): NAICS Code 522110, Commercial Banking.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(h): (1)(h)(ii); 59-2-102; 59-2-102(25)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(h)(i): (1)(h)(ii); 59-2-102 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(h)(ii): 59-2-102(25) "Mobile flight equipment" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(h)(ii)(A): a spare engine; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(h)(ii)(B): 59-2-102(25) tangible personal property described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(i): "Nonbusiness income" means all income other than business income.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(j): (3) "Optional apportionment taxpayer" means a taxpayer described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(n): (2) "Sales factor weighted taxpayer" means a taxpayer described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(o): "State" means any state of the United States, the District of Columbia, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, any territory or possession of the United States, and any foreign country or political subdivision thereof.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(p): "Transportation revenue" means revenue an airline earns from:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(p)(i): transporting a passenger or cargo; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(p)(ii): from miscellaneous sales of merchandise as part of providing transportation services.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(q): "Utah revenue ton miles" means, for an airline, the total revenue ton miles within the borders of this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(q)(i): during the airline's tax period; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(1)(q)(ii): from flight stages that originate or terminate in this state.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(4): A taxpayer that files a return as a unitary group for a taxable year is considered to be a unitary group for that taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-302(5): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act In accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-303 Apportionable income.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-303(1): Any taxpayer having income from business activity which is taxable both within and without this state shall allocate and apportion the taxpayer's adjusted income as provided in this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-303(2): Any taxpayer having income solely from business activity taxable within this state shall allocate or apportion the taxpayer's entire adjusted income to this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-303(3): (1); (2); (3)(a); 59-7-505; (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-303(3)(a): (1); (2) Notwithstanding Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-303(3)(b): (3)(a); 59-7-505 A taxpayer shall make the election described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-303(3)(c): (3) An election under this Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-305 When taxable in another state.
-------------------------------------------------------------
For purposes of allocation and apportionment of income under this part, a taxpayer is taxable in another state if:Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-305(1): in that state the taxpayer is subject to a net income tax, a franchise tax measured by net income, a franchise tax for the privilege of doing business, or a corporate stock tax; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-305(2): that state has jurisdiction to subject the taxpayer to a net income tax regardless of whether, in fact, the state does or does not.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-306 Allocation of certain nonbusiness income.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Rents and royalties from real or tangible personal property, capital gains, interest, dividends, or patent or copyright royalties, to the extent that they constitute nonbusiness income, shall be allocated as provided in Sections

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-307 Allocation of rents and royalties.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-307(1): To the extent that the following constitute nonbusiness income:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-307(1)(a): net rents and royalties from real property located in this state are allocable to this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-307(1)(b): net rents and royalties from tangible personal property are allocable to this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-307(1)(b)(i): if and to the extent that the property is utilized in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-307(1)(b)(ii): in their entirety if the taxpayer's commercial domicile is in this state and the taxpayer is not organized under the laws of or taxable in the state in which the property is utilized.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-307(2): The extent of utilization of tangible personal property in a state is determined by multiplying the rents and royalties by a fraction, the numerator of which is the number of days of physical location of the property in the state during the rental or royalty period in the taxable year and the denominator of which is the number of days of physical location of the property everywhere during all rental or royalty periods in the taxable year.  If the physical location of the property during the rental or royalty period is unknown or unascertainable by the taxpayer, tangible personal property is utilized in the state in which the property was located at the time the rental or royalty payer obtained possession.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-308 Allocation of capital gains and losses.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
To the extent that the following constitute nonbusiness income:Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-308(1): capital gains and losses from sales of real property located in this state are allocable to this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-308(2): capital gains and losses from sales of tangible personal property are allocable to this state if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-308(2)(a): the property had a situs in this state at the time of the sale; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-308(2)(b): the taxpayer's commercial domicile is in this state and the taxpayer is not taxable in the state in which the property had a situs; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-308(3): capital gains and losses from sales of intangible personal property are allocable to this state if the taxpayer's commercial domicile is in this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-309 Allocation of interest and dividends.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
To the extent they constitute nonbusiness income, interest and dividends are allocable to this state if the taxpayer's commercial domicile is in this state.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-310 Allocation of patent and copyright royalties.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-310(1): To the extent they constitute nonbusiness income, patent and copyright royalties are allocable to this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-310(1)(a): if and to the extent that the patent or copyright is utilized by the payer in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-310(1)(b): if and to the extent that the patent or copyright is utilized by the payer in a state in which the taxpayer is not taxable and the taxpayer's commercial domicile is in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-310(2): A patent is utilized in a state to the extent that it is employed in production, fabrication, manufacturing, or other processing in the state or to the extent that a patented product is produced in the state. If the basis of receipts from patent royalties does not permit allocation to states or if the accounting procedures do not reflect states of utilization, the patent is utilized in the state in which the taxpayer's commercial domicile is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-310(3): A copyright is utilized in a state to the extent that printing or other publication originates in the state.  If the basis of receipts from copyright royalties does not permit allocation to states or if the accounting procedures do not reflect states of utilization, the copyright is utilized in the state in which the taxpayer's commercial domicile is located.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311 Method of apportionment of business income.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(1): For a taxable year, a taxpayer shall apportion all business income to this state by multiplying the business income by a fraction calculated as provided in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(2): 59-7-317 Subject to the other provisions of this part, a sales factor weighted taxpayer shall calculate the fraction for apportioning business income to this state using a fraction where:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(2)(a): 59-7-317 the numerator of the fraction is the sales factor as calculated under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(2)(b): the denominator of the fraction is one.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(3): (4); 59-7-312; 59-7-315; 59-7-317 Subject to the other provisions of this part, an optional apportionment taxpayer that is not a phased-in sales factor weighted taxpayer shall calculate the fraction for apportioning business income to this state using one of the following fractions:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(3)(a): (4) the fraction described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(3)(b): 59-7-312; 59-7-315; 59-7-317 the fraction where:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(3)(b)(i): 59-7-312; 59-7-315; 59-7-317 the numerator of the fraction is the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(3)(b)(i)(A): 59-7-312 the property factor as calculated under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(3)(b)(i)(B): 59-7-315 the payroll factor as calculated under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(3)(b)(i)(C): 59-7-317 the sales factor as calculated under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(3)(b)(ii): the denominator of the fraction is three.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(4): (4)(b); (d); 59-7-312; 59-7-315; (4)(e)(i); 59-7-312; 59-7-315; (4)(e)(ii); (2); 59-7-317; 59-7-317
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(4)(a): (4)(b); (d) Subject to other provisions of this part, a phased-in sales factor weighted taxpayer shall calculate the fraction for apportioning business income to this state as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(4)(b): 59-7-312; 59-7-315; (4)(e)(i) For the taxable year that begins on or after January 1, 2019, but begins on or before December 31, 2019:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(4)(b)(i): 59-7-312; 59-7-315; (4)(e)(i) the numerator of the fraction is the sum of:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(4)(c): 59-7-312; 59-7-315; (4)(e)(ii) For the taxable year that begins on or after January 1, 2020, but begins on or before December 31, 2020:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(4)(d): (2) For a taxable year that begins on or after January 1, 2021, a phased-in sales factor weighted taxpayer shall calculate the fraction as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(4)(e): 59-7-317; 59-7-317
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(4)(e)(i): 59-7-317 For the taxable year that begins on or after January 1, 2019, but begins on or before December 31, 2019, the sales factor shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(4)(e)(i)(A): 59-7-317 calculated as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(4)(e)(i)(B): multiplied by four.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(4)(e)(ii): 59-7-317 For the taxable year that begins on or after January 1, 2020, but begins on or before December 31, 2020, the sales factor shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-311(4)(e)(ii)(A): 59-7-317 calculated as described in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-312 Property factor for apportionment of business income -- Mobile flight equipment of an airline.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-312(1)(b): the denominator of which is the average value of all the taxpayer's real and tangible personal property owned or rented and used during the tax period.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-313 Valuation of property for inclusion in property factor.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-313(1): Property owned by the taxpayer is valued at its original cost.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-313(2): Property rented by the taxpayer is valued at eight times the net annual rental rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-313(3): Net annual rental rate is the annual rental rate paid by the taxpayer less any annual rental rate received by the taxpayer from subrentals.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-313(4): 59-7-312(2) Property owned or rented by an airline is valued as provided in this section, subject to the calculation required by Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-314 Averaging property values for inclusion in property factors.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-314(1): The average value of property shall be determined by averaging the values at the beginning and ending of the tax period or averaging of monthly values during the tax period if monthly averaging more clearly reflects the average value of the taxpayer's property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-314(2): 59-7-312(2) The average value of property of an airline is valued as provided in this section, subject to the calculation required by Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-315 Payroll factor for apportionment of business income -- Compensation of flight personnel by an airline.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-315(1): (2); (3) Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-315(1)(a): the numerator of which is the total amount paid in this state during the tax period by the taxpayer for compensation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-315(1)(b): the denominator of which is the total compensation paid everywhere during the tax period.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-315(2): (1) The total amount paid in this state during the tax period by an airline for compensation attributable to the compensation of flight personnel for purposes of the numerator of the fraction described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-315(2)(a): the total amount paid during the tax period by the airline to flight personnel for compensation for the aircraft type; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-315(2)(b): a fraction:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-315(2)(b)(i): the numerator of which is the Utah revenue ton miles for the aircraft type; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-315(2)(b)(ii): the denominator of which is the airline revenue ton miles for the aircraft type.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-315(3): 59-7-302(3)(b)(i)(B); (3)(b); (3)(a)

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-315(3)(a)(ii): the denominator of which is the total amount of the payroll in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-315(3)(b): (3)(a) A taxpayer engaged in economic activities that are classified in an excluded NAICS code shall exclude an individual's payroll from the calculation of the payroll factor fraction described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-315(3)(b)(i): to economic activities in both excluded NAICS codes and NAICS codes that are not excluded NAICS codes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-315(3)(b)(ii): to providing management, information technology, finance, accounting, legal, or human resource services.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-316 Determination of compensation for inclusion in payroll factor.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-316(1): Compensation is paid in this state if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-316(1)(a): the individual's service is performed entirely within the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-316(1)(b): the individual's service is performed both within and without the state, but the service performed without the state is incidental to the individual's service within the state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-316(1)(c): some of the service is performed in the state and:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-316(1)(c)(i): the base of operations or, if there is no base of operations, the place from which the service is directed or controlled is in the state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-316(1)(c)(ii): the base of operations or the place from which the service is directed or controlled is not in any state in which some part of the service is performed, but the individual's residence is in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-316(2): 59-7-315(2) Whether compensation paid by an airline is paid in this state is determined as provided in this section, subject to the calculation required by Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-317 Sales factor for apportionment of business income -- Transportation revenues of an airline.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-317(1): (2) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-317(2): (1) The total sales of an airline in this state during the tax period attributable to transportation revenues in this state during the tax period for purposes of the numerator of the fraction described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-317(2)(a): the total transportation revenues during the tax period of the airline; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-317(2)(b): a fraction, the numerator of which is the Utah revenue ton miles and the denominator of which is the airline revenue ton miles.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-318 Sales of tangible personal property.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-318(1): Sales of tangible personal property are in this state if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-318(1)(a): the property is delivered or shipped to a purchaser, other than the United States Government, within this state regardless of the f.o.b. point or other conditions of the sale; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-318(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-318(1)(b)(i): the property is shipped from an office, store, warehouse, factory, or other place of storage in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-318(1)(b)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-318(1)(b)(ii)(A): the purchaser is the United States Government; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-318(1)(b)(ii)(B): the taxpayer is not taxable in the state of the purchaser.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-318(2): 59-7-317(2) Whether sales of tangible personal property by an airline are in this state is determined as provided in this section, subject to the calculation required by Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-320 Equitable adjustment of standard allocation or apportionment.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Notwithstanding any other provision of this part, if the allocation and apportionment provisions of this part do not fairly represent the extent of the taxpayer's business activity in this state, the taxpayer may petition for or the commission may require, in respect to all or any part of the taxpayer's business activity, if reasonable:Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-320(1): separate accounting;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-320(2): the exclusion of any one or more of the factors;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-320(3): the inclusion of one or more additional factors which will fairly represent the taxpayer's business activity in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-320(4): the employment of any other method to effectuate an equitable allocation and apportionment of the taxpayer's income.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-321 Construction.
--------------------------------------------
This part shall be so construed as to effectuate its general purpose to make uniform the law of those states which enact it.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-401 Determining threshold level of business activity for corporations organized or incorporated outside of the United States.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-401(1): (2); 59-7-312; 59-7-319 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-401(2): Part 3, Allocation and Apportionment of Income - Utah UDITPA Provisions
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-401(2)(a): Part 3, Allocation and Apportionment of Income - Utah UDITPA Provisions Any taxpayer who would ordinarily be required to apportion business income in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-401(2)(b): The results of the property and payroll factor computation shall be divided by two, or by one if either the property or payroll factor has a denominator of zero.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-402 Water's edge combined report.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-402(1): 59-7-403; 59-7-101(40)(a) Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-402(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-402(2)(a): A group of corporations that are not otherwise a unitary group may elect to file a water's edge combined report if each member of the group is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-402(2)(a)(i): doing business in Utah;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-402(2)(a)(ii): part of the same affiliated group; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-402(2)(a)(iii): qualified, under Section 1501, Internal Revenue Code, to file a federal consolidated return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-402(2)(b): Each corporation within the affiliated group that is doing business in Utah must consent to filing a combined report.  If an affiliated group elects to file a combined report, each corporation within the affiliated group that is doing business in Utah must file a combined report.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-402(2)(c): Corporations that elect to file a water's edge combined report under this section may not thereafter elect to file a separate return without the consent of the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-403 Worldwide combined report.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-403(1): A unitary group may elect to file a worldwide combined report.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-403(2): Corporations electing to file a worldwide combined report may not thereafter elect to file a return on a basis other than a worldwide combined report without the consent of the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-404 Calculation of unadjusted income for combined reporting.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-404(1): 59-7-402; 59-7-403 A group filing a combined report under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-404(1)(a): computing unadjusted income on a separate return basis;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-404(1)(b): combining income or loss of the members included in the combined report; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-404(1)(c): making appropriate eliminations and adjustments between members included in the combined report.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-404(2): For purposes of this section, if an entity does not calculate federal taxable income, then unadjusted income shall be calculated based on the applicable federal tax laws.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-404.5 Adjustment to apportionment factors for corporations in a combined report -- Sales factor -- Property factor.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
For purposes of apportionment underUtah Code Annotated § 59-7-404.5(1): 59-7-402; 59-7-403 corporations filing a combined report under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-404.5(2): 59-7-402; 59-7-403 corporations filing a combined report under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-404.5(3): 53-2a-1202; 53-2a-1202; 53-2a-1202 the amounts of the numerators in this state of the property, payroll, and sales factors of an out-of-state business, as defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-405 Commission empowered to make rules.
------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission shall prescribe such rules as necessary to reflect a corporation's tax liability and to prevent avoidance of corporate tax liability in accordance with the provisions of this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-501 Accounting periods -- Methods of accounting.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-501(1): Utah taxable income shall be computed upon the basis of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-501(1)(a): the same taxable period used for federal income tax purposes;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-501(1)(b): the corporation's annual accounting period if the corporation did not file a federal income tax return; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-501(1)(c): the calendar year if the corporation has an annual accounting period other than a fiscal year, has no annual accounting period, or does not keep books, and does not file a federal income tax return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-501(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-501(2)(a): Utah taxable income shall be computed under the method of accounting on the basis of which the corporation computes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-501(2)(a)(i): its income for federal income tax purposes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-501(2)(a)(ii): its income in keeping its books if the corporation did not file a federal income tax return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-501(2)(b): If no method of accounting has been regularly used by the corporation or if the method employed does not clearly reflect Utah taxable income computed and apportioned to this state for the taxable year,  Utah taxable income shall be computed in accordance with a method which in the opinion of the commission clearly reflects Utah taxable income.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-501(3): If a corporation is required under Public Law 99-514, or successor statute, to change its method of accounting from the cash receipts and disbursements method to an accrual method or other permissible method, the transition period provision of Public Law 99-514, or successor statute, for taking into account the adjustments required by reasons of such change shall be followed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-501(4): The amount of all items of gross income shall be included in the gross income for the taxable year in which received by the taxpayer, unless, under the methods of accounting permitted under this section, any such amounts are to be properly accounted for as of a different period.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-501(5): The subtractions provided for in this chapter shall be taken for the taxable year in which "paid or accrued" or "paid or incurred," dependent upon the method of accounting upon the basis of which Utah taxable income is computed, unless in order to clearly reflect the income the subtractions ought to be taken as of a different period.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-501(6): (4); (5) For purposes of Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-502 Change of taxable year or accounting period.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-502(1): If a corporation changes its taxable year for federal income tax purposes, the new taxable year shall become the corporation's taxable year for Utah corporate franchise or income tax purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-502(2): If a corporation which does not file a federal tax return changes its accounting period, the new accounting period shall become the corporation's taxable year for Utah corporate franchise or income tax purposes if the change is approved by the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-503 Return where period changed.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-503(1): 59-7-502 If a corporation changes its taxable year in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-503(2): (1); 59-7-104 Where a short period return is made under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-504 Estimated tax payments -- Penalty -- Waiver.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-504(1): (2) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-504(2): (1); (1); 59-7-104; 59-7-201 The provisions of Section 6655, Internal Revenue Code, shall govern the payment described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-504(2)(a): (1); 59-7-104; 59-7-201 for the first year a corporation is required to file a return in Utah, that corporation is not subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-504(2)(b): the applicable percentage of the required annual payment, as defined in Section 6655, Internal Revenue Code, for annualized income installments, adjusted seasonal installments, and those estimated tax payments based on the current year tax liability shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-504(2)(c): a large corporation shall be treated as any other corporation for purposes of this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-504(2)(d): if a taxpayer elects a different annualization period than the one used for federal purposes, the taxpayer shall make an election with the commission at the same time as provided under Section 6655, Internal Revenue Code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-504(2)(e): the due date shall be superseded by the due date for federal estimated payments if modified by other federal action.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-504(3): 59-1-401 A penalty shall be added as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-504(4): There shall be no interest added to any estimated tax payments subject to a penalty under this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505 Returns required -- When due -- Extension of time -- Exemption from filing.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(1): Each corporation subject to taxation under this chapter shall make a return, except that a group of corporations filing a combined report under Part 4, Combined Reporting, shall file one combined report.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(1)(a): The return shall be signed by a responsible officer of the corporation, the signature of whom need not be notarized but when signed shall be considered as made under oath.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(1)(b)(i): In cases where receivers, trustees in bankruptcy, or assignees are operating the property or business of corporations, those receivers, trustees, or assignees shall make returns for such corporations in the same manner and form as corporations are required to make returns.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(1)(b)(ii): Any tax due on the basis of such returns made by receivers, trustees, or assignees shall be collected in the same manner as if collected from the corporations of whose business or property they have custody and control.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(2)(a): A corporation required to make a return under this chapter shall make a return on or before the later of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(2)(a)(i): the 15th day of the fourth month following the close of the taxable year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(2)(a)(ii): the day on which the corporation is required to file a federal income tax return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(2)(b): Interest accrues from the day on which a return is due under this Subsection (2).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(3)(a): The commission shall allow a taxpayer an extension of time for filing a return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(3)(b): Except as provided in Subsection (3)(c), the extension described in Subsection (3)(a) may be for up to six months.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(3)(c): For a taxable year beginning on or after January 1, 2019, but beginning on or before December 31, 2019, a taxpayer may receive an extension described in Subsection (3)(a) for the time period that ends on the last day of the extension to file the taxpayer's federal income tax return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(4): Each return shall be made to the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(5): A corporation incorporated or qualified to do business in this state before January 1, 1973, is not liable for filing a return or paying tax measured by income for the taxable year in which the corporation legally terminates the corporation's existence.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(6): A corporation incorporated or qualified to do business or that had the corporation's authority to do business reinstated on or after January 1, 1973, shall file a return and pay the tax measured by income for each period during which the corporation had the right to do business in this state, and the return shall be filed and the tax paid within three months and 15 days after the close of this period.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(7): 16-10a-1401 If a corporation terminates the corporation's existence under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(8)(a): A corporation commencing to do business in Utah after qualification or incorporation with the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code is not required to file a return for the period commencing with the date of incorporation or qualification and ending on the last day of the same month, if that corporation was not doing business in and received no income from sources in the state during such period.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(8)(b): In determining whether a corporation comes within the provisions of this chapter, affidavits on behalf of the corporation that it did no business in and received no income from sources in Utah during such period shall be filed with the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(9): An entity required to file a return under this section shall report on the entity's return:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(9)(a): whether the entity has filed a current annual report with the Division of Corporations; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-505(9)(b): the entity's commerce entity number.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-507 Payment of tax.
----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-507(1): 59-7-504; 59-7-505(2); 59-7-505; 59-7-803; 59-7-505(2); 59-7-104; (1)(b); 59-1-401
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-507(1)(a): 59-7-504; 59-7-505(2) If an estimated payment is not made as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-507(1)(b): 59-7-505; 59-7-803; 59-7-505(2); 59-7-104 If a taxpayer needs an extension of time to file a return, as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-507(1)(b)(i): 59-7-104 the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-507(1)(b)(i)(A): 90% of the total tax reported on the return for the current taxable year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-507(1)(b)(i)(B): 59-7-104 100% of the minimum tax described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-507(1)(b)(ii): 100% of the total tax liability for the taxable year immediately preceding the current taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-507(1)(c): (1)(b); 59-1-401 If payment is not made as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-507(2): (2)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-507(2)(a): For a taxable year beginning on or after January 1, 2019, but beginning on or before December 31, 2019, a taxpayer shall receive an extension of time for the payment of the amount determined as the tax of the taxpayer, or any part of that amount, for the time period that ends on the last day of the extension to pay the taxpayer's federal income tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-507(2)(b): (2)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-507(2)(b)(i): For a taxable year beginning on or after January 1, 2020, at the request of the taxpayer, the commission may extend the time for payment of the amount determined as the tax by the taxpayer, or any part of that amount, for a period not to exceed six months from the date prescribed for the payment of the tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-507(2)(b)(ii): (2)(b)(i) For purposes of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-508 Audit of returns.
------------------------------------------------
As soon as practicable after the return is filed the commission shall examine it and shall determine the correct amount of the tax.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-509 Failure to file return -- Penalty.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
In case of any failure to make and file a return required by this chapter within the time prescribed by law or prescribed by the commission in pursuance of law, there shall be added to the amount required to be shown as tax on the return a penalty as provided in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-510 Deficiency -- Interest.
------------------------------------------------------
Interest upon the amount determined as a deficiency shall be assessed at the same time as the deficiency, shall be paid upon notice and demand from the commission, and shall be collected as a part of the tax at the rate and in the manner prescribed in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-511 Penalty added to underpayments.
--------------------------------------------------------------
A penalty shall be added to underpayments of tax as provided in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-512 Addition to tax in case of nonpayment.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Where the entire amount determined by the taxpayer as the tax imposed by this chapter is not paid on or before the date prescribed for its payment, there shall be collected as a part of the tax interest upon such unpaid amount at the rate and in the manner prescribed in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-513 Interest when time for payment extended.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
If the time for payment of the amount determined as the tax by the taxpayer is extended under the authority of Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-514 Extension of time to pay deficiency.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-514(1): Where it is shown to the satisfaction of the commission that the payment of a deficiency upon the date prescribed for the payment thereof will result in undue hardship to the taxpayer, the commission (except where the deficiency is due to negligence, to intentional disregard of rules, or to fraud with intent to evade tax) may grant an extension for the payment of such deficiency or any part thereof for a period not in excess of six months.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-514(2): If an extension is granted, the commission may require the taxpayer to furnish a bond in such amount, not exceeding double the amount of the deficiency, and with such sureties as the commission deems necessary, conditioned upon the payment of the deficiency in accordance with the terms of the extension.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-515 Interest when deficiency extended.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-515(1): 59-1-402 If the time for the payment of any part of a deficiency is extended, the commission shall collect as a part of the tax interest on the part of the deficiency (the time for payment of which is so extended) at the rate prescribed in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-515(2): 59-1-402 If the part of the deficiency (the time for payment of which is so extended) is not paid in accordance with the terms of the extension, the commission shall collect as a part of the tax interest on such unpaid amount at the rate prescribed in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-519 Period of limitation for making assessments -- Change, correction, or amendment of federal income tax -- Duty of corporation to notify state -- Extensions.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-519(1): (1)(a); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-519(1)(a): Subject to the other provisions of this section, the amount of taxes imposed by this chapter shall be assessed within three years after a return is filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-519(1)(b): (1)(a); (1)(a) After the expiration of the time period described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-519(2): In the case of a deficiency attributable to the application of a net loss carryback, the deficiency may be assessed at any time before the expiration of the period within which a deficiency for the taxable year of the net loss that results in the carryback may be assessed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-519(3): If the amount of federal taxable income for any year of any corporation as returned to the United States treasury department is changed or corrected by the commissioner of internal revenue or other officer of the United States or other competent authority, or where a renegotiation of a contract or subcontract with the United States results in a change of federal taxable income, a taxpayer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-519(3)(a): report the change or corrected net income within 90 days after the final determination of the change or correction as required to the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-519(3)(b): concede the accuracy of the determination or state where the determination is erroneous.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-519(4): Any corporation filing an amended return with the United States treasury department shall also file, within 90 days after the corporation files the amended return with the United States treasury department, an amended return with the commission that contains the information the commission requires.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-519(5): If a corporation fails to report a change or correction by the commissioner of internal revenue, other officer of the United States, or other competent authority or fails to file an amended return, any deficiency resulting from the change or correction may be assessed and collected within three years after the change, correction, or amended return is reported to or filed with the federal government.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-519(6): If any corporation agrees with the commissioner of internal revenue for an extension, or a renewal of an extension, of the period for proposing and assessing deficiencies in federal income tax for any year, the period for sending a notice of proposed Utah tax deficiencies for that year is the later of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-519(6)(a): three years after the return is filed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-519(6)(b): six months after the date of the expiration of the agreed period for assessing deficiencies in federal income tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-519(7): 59-1-1418 The extensions described in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-522 Overpayments.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-522(1): 59-1-1409 As used in this section, "overpayment" means the same as that term is defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-522(2)(a): (2)(b) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-522(2)(b): (2)(a); (2)(a) The three-year period described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-522(3): 59-7-519 The commission shall make a credit against or refund of any overpayment of a tax under this chapter for a taxable year if, in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-522(3)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-522(3)(a)(i): a corporation agrees with the commissioner of internal revenue for an extension, or a renewal of an extension, of the period for proposing and assessing a deficiency in federal income tax for that taxable year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-522(3)(a)(ii): there is a change in or correction of federal taxable income for that taxable year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-522(3)(b): the corporation files a claim for the credit or refund before the expiration of the time period within which the commission may assess a deficiency.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-522(4): The commission shall make a credit or refund within a 30-day period after the day on which a court's decision to require the commission to credit or refund the amount of an overpayment to a taxpayer is final.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-528 Failure to make return or supply information -- Penalty.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Each officer or employee of any corporation, who, without fraudulent intent, fails to make, render, sign, or verify any return, or to supply any information within the time required by or under the provisions of this chapter, shall be liable for a penalty as provided in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-529 General violations and penalties.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-529(1): 59-1-401 Each person who, without fraudulent intent, fails to make, render, sign, or verify any return, or to supply any information within the time required by or under the provisions of this chapter, is liable for a civil penalty as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-529(2): 59-1-401 It is unlawful for any person, with intent to evade any tax, to fail to timely remit the full amount of tax required by the provisions of this chapter.  A violation of this section is punishable as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-529(3): 59-1-401 Each person who knowingly or intentionally makes, renders, signs, or verifies any false or fraudulent return or statement or supplies any false or fraudulent information is guilty of a criminal violation as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-529(4): 59-1-401 Each person who, with intent to evade any tax or any requirement of this chapter, fails to make, render, sign, or verify any return, or supply any information within the time required under the provisions of this chapter, is guilty of a criminal violation as provided in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-530 Power to waive penalties or interest.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission may waive penalties or interest as provided in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-531 Venue of offenses -- Evidence.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-531(1): The failure to do any act required by the provisions of this chapter shall be considered an act committed in part at the office of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-7-531(2): The certificate of the commission that a tax has not been paid, that a return has not been filed, or that information has not been supplied, as required by or under the provisions of this chapter, shall be prima facie evidence that such tax has not been paid, that such return has not been filed, or that such information has not been supplied.
