Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-101(3): An admitted insurer writing title insurance in this state shall pay to the commission, on or before March 31 in each year, a tax of .45% of the total premium received by either the insurer or by its agents during the preceding calendar year from title insurance concerning property located in this state.  In calculating this tax, "premium" includes the charges made to an insured under or to an applicant for a policy or contract of title insurance for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-101(3)(a): the assumption by the title insurer of the risks assumed by the issuance of the policy or contract of title insurance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-101(3)(b): abstracting title, title searching, examining title, or determining the insurability of title, and every other activity, exclusive of escrow, settlement, or closing charges, whether denominated premium or otherwise, made by a title insurer, an agent of a title insurer, a title insurance producer, or any of them.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-101(4): Beginning July 1, 1986, a former county mutual and a former mutual benefit association shall pay the premium tax or assessment due under this chapter.  Premiums received after July 1, 1986, shall be considered in determining the tax or assessment.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-102 Offsets.
---------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-102(1): If any authorized insurer doing business in this state during the tax year pays a property tax in this state, the insurer may deduct from the tax provided under this chapter that portion of the property tax paid for general state purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-102(2): 31A-2-205; 31A-2-203(2)(e) Any domestic insurance company paying a fee for examination under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-102(4): 59-9-102.5; 59-9-101(2) There is an offset provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-102(5): The state has no liability to insurers for any amount by which offsets allowed under this section exceed the insurer's premium tax liability.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-103 Taxation of insurers otherwise untaxed.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-103(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-103(1)(a): "Administrative and claims expense" includes all claims paid, agency expenses, third party administrator expenses, taxes, licenses, fees, loss adjustment expenses, legal expenses, reinsurance premiums, and all other expenses incurred directly in connection with the insurance of Utah risks by the insurer, less any recoveries or reimbursements collected or collectible because of reinsurance or any other source, but only with respect to Utah risks.  The administrative and claims expense also includes the pro rata portion attributable to Utah risks of the salaries and fringe benefits, including taxes on salaries, of all personnel responsible for the administration of the insurer, the printing and stationery, and all other expenses attributable to the administration of the insurer.  When personnel are engaged in the administration of the insurer as only part of their employment, for purposes of this section their salaries and fringe benefits shall be prorated based on the portion of their time devoted to the administration of the insurer.  Appropriate overhead charges shall be included with all the expenses listed in this subsection.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-103(1)(b): "Utah risks" means insurance coverage on the lives, health, or against the liability of persons residing in Utah, or on property located in Utah, other than property temporarily in transit through Utah.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-103(2): (3); (4) Except for workers' compensation coverage, which is provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-103(3): (4); 59-9-101(2) Except as provided under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-103(4): (2); (3); 31A-3-301; 31A-1-103 The taxes imposed under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-103(4)(a): admitted insurers;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-103(4)(b): 31A-3-301 insurers taxed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-103(4)(c): self insurers;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-103(4)(d): annuity considerations or ocean marine insurance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-103(4)(e): 31A-1-103 a public agency insurance mutual as defined in Section

---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-104(1): 59-9-103 A person whose total tax obligation under this chapter for the preceding taxable year was $10,000 or more shall pay the taxes levied under this chapter in quarterly installments.  Each installment shall be based on the estimated insurance premiums received, or for the taxes imposed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-104(2): (3); 59-1-401 If an installment is not paid or is underpaid, except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-104(3): (2) No penalty, interest, or audit charge may be assessed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-104(4): There shall be no interest added to any estimated tax payments subject to a penalty under this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-9-105(1): An insurer that provides coverage for motor vehicle liability, uninsured motorist, and personal injury protection shall pay to the State Tax Commission on or before March 31 of each year, a tax of .01% on the total premiums received for these coverages during the preceding calendar year from policies covering motor vehicle risks in this state.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Chapter 10 - Individual Income Tax Act
***********************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-101 Short title.
--------------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Individual Income Tax Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1): 59-10-401; 59-10-401; (1)(p)(i); 59-10-1402; 59-10-1402; 75-7-103; 59-10-202; 59-10-207; 59-10-209.1; 59-10-210; 59-10-1405; 59-10-114; 59-10-115; (1)(x)(i); 59-10-1404.5; 59-10-114; 59-10-115; 59-10-114; 59-10-115; (1)(y)(i)(B)(I); 59-10-117; 59-10-114; 59-10-115; 59-10-1404.5; 59-10-114; 59-10-115; 59-10-114; 59-10-115; (1)(z)(ii)(A); 59-10-117; 59-10-201.1; 59-10-204; (1)(bb)(i); 59-10-401 As used in this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(a)(i): "Adjusted gross income":
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(a)(i)(A): for a resident or nonresident individual, means the same as that term is defined in Section 62, Internal Revenue Code; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(a)(i)(B): for a resident or nonresident estate or trust, is as calculated in Section 67(e), Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(a)(ii): "Adjusted gross income" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(a)(ii)(A): income received from a loan forgiven in accordance with 15 U.S.C. Sec. 636(a) (36), to the extent that a deduction for the expenditures paid with the loan is disallowed, or a similar paycheck protection loan that is authorized by the federal government, provided in response to COVID-19, forgiven if the borrower meets the expenditure requirements, and exempt from federal income tax, to the extent that a deduction for the expenditures paid with the loan is disallowed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(a)(ii)(B): an amount that an individual receives in accordance with Section 6428, Internal Revenue Code, or an amount that an individual receives that is authorized by the federal government as a tax credit for the 2020 tax year, provided in response to COVID-19, paid in advance of the filing of the individual's 2020 federal income tax return, and exempt from federal income tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(b): "Corporation" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(b)(i): an association;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(b)(ii): a joint stock company; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(b)(iii): an insurance company.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(c): "COVID-19" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(c)(i): the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(c)(ii): the disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(d): "Distributable net income" means the same as that term is defined in Section 643, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(e): 59-10-401 "Employee" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(f): 59-10-401 "Employer" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(g): "Federal taxable income":
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(g)(i): for a resident or nonresident individual, means taxable income as defined by Section 63, Internal Revenue Code; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(g)(ii): for a resident or nonresident estate or trust, is as calculated in Section 641(a) and (b), Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(h): "Fiduciary" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(h)(i): a guardian;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(h)(ii): a trustee;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(h)(iii): an executor;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(h)(iv): an administrator;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(h)(v): a receiver;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(h)(vi): a conservator; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(h)(vii): any person acting in any fiduciary capacity for any individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(i): "Guaranteed annuity interest" means the same as that term is defined in 26 C.F.R. Sec. 1.170A-6(c)(2).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(j): "Homesteaded land diminished from the Uintah and Ouray Reservation" means the homesteaded land that was held to have been diminished from the Uintah and Ouray Reservation in Hagen v. Utah, 510 U.S. 399 (1994).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(k): "Individual" means a natural person and includes aliens and minors.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(l): "Irrevocable trust" means a trust in which the settlor may not revoke or terminate all or part of the trust without the consent of a person who has a substantial beneficial interest in the trust and the interest would be adversely affected by the exercise of the settlor's power to revoke or terminate all or part of the trust.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(m): "Military service" means the same as that term is defined in Pub. L. No. 108-189, Sec. 101.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(n): "Nonresident individual" means an individual who is not a resident of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(o): "Nonresident trust" or "nonresident estate" means a trust or estate which is not a resident estate or trust.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(p): (1)(p)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(p)(i): "Partnership" includes a syndicate, group, pool, joint venture, or other unincorporated organization:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(p)(i)(A): through or by means of which any business, financial operation, or venture is carried on; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(p)(i)(B): that is not, within the meaning of this chapter, a trust, an estate, or a corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(p)(ii): "Partnership" does not include any organization not included under the definition of "partnership" in Section 761, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(p)(iii): (1)(p)(i) "Partner" includes a member in a syndicate, group, pool, joint venture, or organization described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(aa): "Taxpayer" means any of the following that has income subject in whole or part to the tax imposed by this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(aa)(i): an individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(aa)(ii): an estate, a trust, or a beneficiary of an estate or a trust that is not a pass-through entity or a pass-through entity taxpayer;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(aa)(iii): a pass-through entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(aa)(iv): a pass-through entity taxpayer.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(cc): "Uintah and Ouray Reservation" means the lands recognized as being included within the Uintah and Ouray Reservation in:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(cc)(i): Hagen v. Utah, 510 U.S. 399 (1994); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(cc)(ii): Ute Indian Tribe v. Utah, 114 F.3d 1513 (10th Cir. 1997).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(dd): "Unadjusted income" means an amount equal to the difference between:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(dd)(i): the total income required to be reported by a resident or nonresident estate or trust on the resident or nonresident estate's or trust's federal income tax return for estates and trusts for the taxable year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(dd)(ii): the sum of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(dd)(ii)(A): fees paid or incurred to the fiduciary of a resident or nonresident estate or trust:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(dd)(ii)(A)(I): for administering the resident or nonresident estate or trust; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(dd)(ii)(A)(II): that the resident or nonresident estate or trust deducts as allowed on the resident or nonresident estate's or trust's federal income tax return for estates and trusts for the taxable year;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(dd)(ii)(B): the income distribution deduction that a resident or nonresident estate or trust deducts under Section 651 or 661, Internal Revenue Code, as allowed on the resident or nonresident estate's or trust's federal income tax return for estates and trusts for the taxable year;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(dd)(ii)(C): the amount that a resident or nonresident estate or trust deducts as a deduction for estate tax or generation skipping transfer tax under Section 691(c), Internal Revenue Code, as allowed on the resident or nonresident estate's or trust's federal income tax return for estates and trusts for the taxable year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(dd)(ii)(D): the amount that a resident or nonresident estate or trust deducts as a personal exemption under Section 642(b), Internal Revenue Code, as allowed on the resident or nonresident estate's or trust's federal income tax return for estates and trusts for the taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(ee): "Unitrust interest" means the same as that term is defined in 26 C.F.R. Sec. 1.170A-6(c)(2).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(ff): "Ute tribal member" means an individual who is enrolled as a member of the Ute Indian Tribe of the Uintah and Ouray Reservation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(gg): "Ute tribe" means the Ute Indian Tribe of the Uintah and Ouray Reservation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(1)(hh): 59-10-401 "Wages" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(2)(a): Any term used in this chapter has the same meaning as when used in comparable context in the laws of the United States relating to federal income taxes unless a different meaning is clearly required.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(2)(b): Any reference to the Internal Revenue Code or to the laws of the United States shall mean the Internal Revenue Code or other provisions of the laws of the United States relating to federal income taxes that are in effect for the taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-103(2)(c): Any reference to a specific section of the Internal Revenue Code or other provision of the laws of the United States relating to federal income taxes shall include any corresponding or comparable provisions of the Internal Revenue Code as amended, redesignated, or reenacted.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104 Tax basis -- Tax rate -- Exemption.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104(1): A tax is imposed on the state taxable income of a resident individual as provided in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104(2): For purposes of Subsection (1), for a taxable year, the tax is an amount equal to the product of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104(2)(a): the resident individual's state taxable income for that taxable year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104(2)(b): 4.55%.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104(3): 59-10-104.1 This section does not apply to a resident individual exempt from taxation under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104.1 Exemption from taxation.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104.1(1): (1)(b)(i) For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104.1(1)(a): "Personal exemptions" means the total exemption amount an individual is allowed to claim for the taxable year under Section 151, Internal Revenue Code, for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104.1(1)(a)(i): the individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104.1(1)(a)(ii): the individual's spouse; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104.1(1)(a)(iii): the individual's dependents.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104.1(1)(b): (1)(b)(i) "Standard deduction":
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104.1(1)(b)(i): means the standard deduction an individual is allowed to claim for the taxable year under Section 63, Internal Revenue Code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104.1(1)(b)(ii): (1)(b)(i) notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104.1(1)(b)(ii)(A): blind; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104.1(1)(b)(ii)(B): 65 years of age or older.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104.1(2): 59-10-104; 59-10-116 For taxable years beginning on or after January 1, 2002, an individual is exempt from a tax imposed by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104.1(2)(a): personal exemptions for that taxable year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-104.1(2)(b): standard deduction for that taxable year.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-110 Disallowance of federal tax credits.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
A credit applied directly to the income tax calculated for federal income tax purposes in accordance with the Internal Revenue Code may not be applied in calculating the tax due under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-114(5): (1)(e); (1)(e)(i)(A); (D); (1)(e)(i)(A); (B); (1)(e)(i)(C); (D) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-114(5)(a): (1)(e)(i)(A); (B) for an entity described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-114(5)(b): (1)(e)(i)(C); (D) for an entity described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-114(5)(b)(i): the entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-114(5)(b)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-114(5)(b)(ii)(A): the state in which the entity is located; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-114(5)(b)(ii)(B): the District of Columbia, if the entity is located within the District of Columbia.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117 State taxable income derived from Utah sources.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(1): 59-10-116; 59-10-114(1)(c); (d); (h); 59-10-114(2)(c); 59-10-114(2)(c); 59-10-115; (1)(a); (d) For purposes of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(1)(a): the ownership in this state of any interest in real or tangible personal property, including real property or property rights from which gross income from mining as described by Section 613(c), Internal Revenue Code, is derived;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(1)(b): the carrying on of a business, trade, profession, or occupation in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(1)(c): 59-10-114(1)(c); (d); (h) an addition to adjusted gross income required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(1)(d): 59-10-114(2)(c); 59-10-114(2)(c) a subtraction from adjusted gross income required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(1)(e): 59-10-115; (1)(a); (d) an adjustment to adjusted gross income required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(2): (1); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 59-10-117.5; 59-10-1402; 59-10-118; 59-10-118; 59-10-207; 59-7-101; (2)(a) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(2)(a): income from intangible personal property, including annuities, dividends, interest, and gains from the disposition of intangible personal property, shall constitute income derived from Utah sources only to the extent that the income is from property employed in a trade, business, profession, or occupation carried on in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(2)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act a deduction with respect to a capital loss, net long-term capital gain, or net operating loss shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(2)(b)(i): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act based solely on income, gain, loss, and deduction connected with Utah sources, under rules prescribed by the commission in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(2)(b)(ii): otherwise determined in the same manner as the corresponding federal deductions;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(2)(c): 59-10-117.5 a salary, wage, commission, or compensation for personal services rendered:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(2)(c)(i): 59-10-117.5 subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(2)(c)(ii): outside this state may not be considered to be income derived from Utah sources;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(2)(d): 59-10-1402; 59-10-118 a share of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit of a nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(2)(e): a nonresident, other than a dealer holding property primarily for sale to customers in the ordinary course of the dealer's trade or business, may not be considered to carry on a trade, business, profession, or occupation in this state solely by reason of the purchase or sale of property for the nonresident's own account;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(2)(f): 59-10-118 if a trade, business, profession, or occupation is carried on partly within and partly without this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(2)(f)(i): 59-10-118 an item of income, gain, loss, or a deduction derived from or connected with Utah sources shall be determined in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(2)(f)(ii): a salary, a wage, a commission, or compensation for personal services rendered is not considered to be an item of income from the carrying on of a business, trade, profession, or occupation;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(2)(g): 59-10-207 the share of a nonresident estate or trust or a nonresident beneficiary of any estate or trust in income, gain, loss, or deduction derived from or connected with Utah sources shall be determined under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(2)(h): 59-7-101; (2)(a) any dividend, interest, or distributive share of income, gain, or loss from a real estate investment trust, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(2)(h)(i): (2)(a) be income from intangible personal property under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117(2)(h)(ii): constitute income derived from Utah sources only to the extent the nonresident investor is employing its beneficial interest in the trust in a trade, business, profession, or occupation carried on by the investor in this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5 Nonresident individual wage exemption.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(1): 59-10-402; 59-10-402(5)(a) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(1)(a): "Day" means any period of time during a calendar day that an individual is present in the state, unless the presence is solely for transportation through the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(1)(b): 59-10-402; 59-10-402(5)(a) "Wages" means income that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(1)(b)(i): is received by an individual for employment duties performed inside this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(1)(b)(ii): 59-10-402; 59-10-402(5)(a) would be subject to withholding in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(2): A nonresident individual's wages may not be considered income derived from Utah sources if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(2)(a): the nonresident individual has no other income from sources within this state for the taxable year in which the nonresident individual receives the wages;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(2)(b): the nonresident individual is present in this state to perform employment duties for 20 or fewer days during the tax year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(2)(c): the nonresident individual's state of residence:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(2)(c)(i): provides a substantially similar exclusion; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(2)(c)(ii): does not impose a state individual income tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(3): This section does not apply to wages received by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(3)(a): an individual who is a professional athlete or a member of a professional athletic team;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(3)(b): an individual who is a professional entertainer and who performs services in the professional performing arts;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(3)(c): an individual of prominence who performs services for wages on a per-event basis;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(3)(d): an individual who performs construction services to improve real property, predominantly on a construction site, as a laborer;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(3)(e): an individual who is a key employee, without regard to ownership or the existence of a benefit plan, for the year immediately preceding the current tax year pursuant to Subsection 416(i), Internal Revenue Code; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(3)(f): an individual who is an employee of a non-corporate employer, and who would be a key employee without regard to ownership or the existence of a benefit plan, for the year immediately preceding the current tax year pursuant to Subsection 416(i), Internal Revenue Code, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(3)(f)(i): the term "employee" were substituted for the term "officer"; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-117.5(3)(f)(ii): the individual is one of the non-corporate employer's 50 highest paid employees without regard to whether the individual is an officer.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118 Division of income for tax purposes.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(1): (1)(a)(ii); (3); (7) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(1)(a): (1)(a)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(1)(a)(i): (1)(a)(ii) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(1)(a)(ii): "Business income" does not include a salary, a wage, a commission, or compensation for personal services rendered.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(1)(b): "Commercial domicile" means the principal place from which the trade or business of a taxpayer is directed or managed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(1)(c): "Nonbusiness income" means all income other than business income.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(1)(d): (3); (7) "Sales" means all gross receipts of a taxpayer not allocated under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(1)(e): "State" means any state of the United States, the District of Columbia, the commonwealth of Puerto Rico, or any possession of the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(2): A taxpayer having business income that is taxable both within and without this state shall allocate and apportion the taxpayer's net income as provided in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(3): (4); (7) Rents and royalties from real or tangible personal property, capital gains, interest, dividends, or patent or copyright royalties, to the extent that rents and royalties constitute nonbusiness income, shall be allocated as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(4)(a): Net rents and royalties from real property located in this state are allocable to this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(4)(b): Net rents and royalties from tangible personal property are allocable to this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(4)(b)(i): if and to the extent that the property is utilized in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(4)(b)(ii): in their entirety if the taxpayer's commercial domicile is in this state and the taxpayer is not organized under the laws of or taxable in the state in which the property is utilized.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(4)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(4)(c)(i): The extent of utilization of tangible personal property in a state is determined by multiplying the rents and royalties by a fraction, the numerator of which is the number of days of physical location of the property in the state during the rental or royalty period in the taxable year and the denominator of which is the number of days of physical location of the property everywhere during all rental or royalty periods in the taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(4)(c)(ii): If the physical location of the property during the rental or royalty period is unknown or unascertainable by the taxpayer, tangible personal property is utilized in the state in which the property was located at the time the rental or royalty payer obtained possession.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(5)(a): Capital gains and losses from sales of real property located in this state are allocable to this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(5)(b): Capital gains and losses from sales of tangible personal property are allocable to this state if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(5)(b)(i): the property has a situs in this state at the time of the sale; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(5)(b)(ii): the taxpayer's commercial domicile is in this state and the taxpayer is not taxable in the state in which the property had a situs.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(5)(c): Capital gains and losses from sales of intangible personal property are allocable to this state if the taxpayer's commercial domicile is in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(6): Interest and dividends are allocable to this state if the taxpayer's commercial domicile is in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(7)(a): Patent and copyright royalties are allocable to this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(7)(a)(i): if and to the extent that the patent or copyright is utilized by the payer in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(7)(a)(ii): if and to the extent that the patent or copyright is utilized by the payer in a state in which the taxpayer is not taxable and the taxpayer's commercial domicile is in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(7)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(7)(b)(i): A patent is utilized in a state to the extent that the patent is employed in production, fabrication, manufacturing, or other processing in the state or to the extent that a patented product is produced in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(7)(b)(ii): If the basis of receipts from patent royalties does not permit allocation to states or if the accounting procedures do not reflect states of utilization, the patent is utilized in the state in which the taxpayer's commercial domicile is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-118(8): 59-7-311; 59-7-320 All business income shall be apportioned to this state using the same methods, procedures, and requirements of Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-119 Returns by husband and wife if husband or wife is a nonresident.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-119(1): If the adjusted gross income of a husband and wife who are both nonresidents of this state is reported or determined on separate federal individual income tax returns, the husband's and wife's state taxable incomes in this state shall be separately determined.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-119(2): If the adjusted gross income of a husband and wife who are both nonresidents of this state is reported or determined on a joint federal individual income tax return, the husband's and wife's tax shall be reported or determined in this state on a joint return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-119(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-119(3)(a): If one spouse is a nonresident of this state and the other spouse is a resident of this state, separate taxes shall be determined on each spouse's separate state taxable incomes on forms prescribed by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-119(3)(b): (3)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-119(3)(c): If one spouse who is a nonresident of this state and the other spouse who is a resident of this state file a joint federal income tax return, but determine state taxable income separately, the spouses shall compute their taxable incomes in this state as if their adjusted gross incomes had been determined separately.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-120 Change of status as resident or nonresident.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-120(1): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act If an individual changes the individual's status during the taxable year from resident to nonresident or from nonresident to resident, the commission may by rule, made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-120(2): (1) The taxable income of the individual described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-121 Proration when two returns required.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
If an individual is required to file two returns for a taxable year under SectionUtah Code Annotated § 59-10-121(1): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act personal exemptions and the standard deduction as used on the federal individual income tax return shall be prorated between the two returns, under rules prescribed by the commission in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-121(2): the total amount of the taxes due on the two returns may not be less than the total amount of the taxes that would be due if the total of the taxable incomes reported on the two returns had been included in one return.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-122 Taxable year.
---------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-122(1): For purposes of a tax imposed by this chapter, the taxable year of a resident or nonresident individual or resident or nonresident estate or trust shall be the same as the taxable year of the resident or nonresident individual or resident or nonresident estate or trust for federal income tax purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-122(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-122(2)(a): If the taxable year of a resident or nonresident individual or resident or nonresident estate or trust is changed for federal income tax purposes, that taxable year for purposes of a tax imposed by this chapter shall be changed in the same manner as the change for federal income tax purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-122(2)(b): If a change in a taxable year results in a taxable period of less than 12 months for federal income tax purposes, that same taxable period shall be used in computing a tax imposed by this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-123 Accounting method.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-123(1): For purposes of a tax imposed by this chapter, a resident or nonresident individual's or resident or nonresident estate's or trust's method of accounting shall be the same as the method of accounting the resident or nonresident individual or resident or nonresident estate or trust uses for federal income tax purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-123(2): If a resident or nonresident individual's or resident or nonresident estate's or trust's method of accounting is changed for federal income tax purposes, the resident or nonresident individual's or resident or nonresident estate's or trust's method of accounting shall be changed in the same manner:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-123(2)(a): for purposes of a tax imposed by this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-123(2)(b): for any taxable year for which the change in the method of accounting is made for federal income tax purposes.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-124 Adjustments between taxable years after change in accounting method.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-124(1): In computing a resident or nonresident individual's or resident or nonresident estate's or trust's state taxable income for a taxable year under a method of accounting different from the method under which the resident or nonresident individual's or resident or nonresident estate's or trust's state taxable income was computed for the previous taxable year, state taxable income shall be increased or decreased:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-124(1)(a): to prevent double inclusion or exclusion of an item of gross income as a result of the change in the method of accounting; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-124(1)(b): to prevent double allowance or disallowance of a subtraction from or addition to gross income as a result of the change in the method of accounting.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-124(2): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1) In accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-125 Adjustment after change of accounting method.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-125(1): If a taxpayer's method of accounting is changed, other than from an accrual to an installment method, any additional tax that results from adjustments determined to be necessary solely by reason of the change may not be greater than if those adjustments were ratably allocated and included for the taxable year of the change and the preceding taxable years, not in excess of two, during which the taxpayer used the method of accounting from which the change is made.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-125(2): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act If a taxpayer's method of accounting is changed from an accrual to an installment method, any additional tax for the taxable year of the change in the method of accounting and for any subsequent taxable year that is attributable to the receipt of installment payments properly accrued in a prior taxable year, shall be reduced by the portion of tax for any prior taxable year attributable to the accrual of such installment payments, under rules prescribed by the commission in accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-126 Business entities not subject to tax -- Exceptions.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-126(1): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes A business entity that is taxable as a corporation for federal income tax purposes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-126(1)(a): may not be subject to the tax imposed by this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-126(1)(b): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes is subject to
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-126(2): A business entity that is exempt from federal income taxation is exempt from the tax imposed by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-126(3): (2); Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes Notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136 Domicile.
-----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(1): 53B-8-102; 53B-2-101
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(1)(a): 53B-8-102; 53B-2-101 An individual is considered to have domicile in this state if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(1)(a)(i): except as provided in Subsection (1)(b), a dependent with respect to whom the individual or the individual's spouse claims a personal exemption  or a tax credit under Section 24, Internal Revenue Code,  on the individual's or individual's spouse's federal individual income tax return is enrolled in a public kindergarten, public elementary school, or public secondary school in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(1)(a)(ii): 53B-8-102; 53B-2-101 the individual or the individual's spouse is a resident student in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(1)(a)(iii): the individual or the individual's spouse, in that taxable year:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(1)(a)(iii)(A): votes in this state in a regular general election, municipal general election, primary election, or special election;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(1)(a)(iii)(B): has not registered to vote in another state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(1)(a)(iii)(C): has not voted in another state that does not require voter registration.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(1)(b): The determination of whether an individual is considered to have domicile in this state may not be determined in accordance with Subsection (1)(a)(i) if the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(1)(b)(i): is the noncustodial parent of a dependent:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(1)(b)(i)(A): with respect to whom the individual claims a personal exemption  or a tax credit under Section 24, Internal Revenue Code,  on the individual's federal individual income tax return; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(1)(b)(i)(B): who is enrolled in a public kindergarten, public elementary school, or public secondary school in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(1)(b)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(1)(b)(ii)(A): is divorced from the custodial parent of the dependent described in Subsection (1)(b)(i); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(1)(b)(ii)(B): was never married to the custodial parent of the dependent described in Subsection (1)(b)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2): 53B-8-102; 53B-2-101; 59-12-102
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(a): Subject to Subsection (2)(b), if the requirements of Subsection (1) are not met for an individual to be considered to have domicile in this state, the individual is considered to have domicile in this state if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(a)(i): the individual or the individual's spouse has a permanent home in this state to which the individual or the individual's spouse intends to return after being absent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(a)(ii): the individual or the individual's spouse has voluntarily fixed the individual's or the individual's spouse's habitation in this state, not for a special or temporary purpose, but with the intent of making a permanent home.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b): 53B-8-102; 53B-2-101; 59-12-102 The determination of whether an individual is considered to have domicile in this state under this Subsection (2) shall be based on the preponderance of the evidence, taking into consideration the totality of only the following facts and circumstances:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(i): whether the individual or the individual's spouse has a driver license in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(ii): whether the individual or the individual's spouse receives a residential exemption in accordance with Chapter 2, Property Tax Act, for that individual's or individual's spouse's primary residence;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(iii): 53B-8-102; 53B-2-101 whether a dependent with respect to whom the individual or the individual's spouse claims a personal exemption  or a tax credit under Section 24, Internal Revenue Code,  on the individual's or individual's spouse's federal individual income tax return is a resident student in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(iv): the nature and quality of the living accommodations that the individual or the individual's spouse has in this state as compared to another state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(v): the presence in this state of a spouse or dependent with respect to whom the individual or the individual's spouse claims a personal exemption  or a tax credit under Section 24, Internal Revenue Code,  on the individual's or individual's spouse's federal individual income tax return;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(vi): the physical location in which earned income as defined in Section 32(c)(2), Internal Revenue Code, is earned by the individual or the individual's spouse;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(vii): 59-12-102 the state of registration of a vehicle as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(viii): whether the individual or the individual's spouse is a member of a church, a club, or another similar organization in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(ix): whether the individual or the individual's spouse lists an address in this state on mail, a telephone listing, a listing in an official government publication, other correspondence, or another similar item;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(x): whether the individual or the individual's spouse lists an address in this state on a state or federal tax return;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(xi): whether the individual or the individual's spouse asserts residency in this state for purposes of filing an individual income tax return under this chapter, including asserting that the individual or the individual's spouse is a part-year resident of this state for the portion of the taxable year for which the individual or the individual's spouse is a resident of this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(xii): whether the individual or the individual's spouse asserts residency in this state on a document, other than an individual income tax return filed under this chapter, filed with or provided to a court or other governmental entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(xiii): the failure of an individual or the individual's spouse to obtain a permit or license normally required of a resident of the state for which the individual or the individual's spouse asserts to have domicile;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(xiv): whether the individual is an individual described in Subsection (1)(b);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(xv): whether the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(xv)(A): maintains a place of abode in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(xv)(B): spends in the aggregate 183 or more days of the taxable year in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(xvi): whether the individual or the individual's spouse:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(xvi)(A): did not vote in this state in a regular general election, municipal general election, primary election, or special election during the taxable year, but voted in the state in a general election, municipal general election, primary election, or special election during any of the three taxable years prior to that taxable year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(2)(b)(xvi)(B): has not registered to vote in another state during a taxable year described in Subsection (2)(b)(xvi)(A).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(3): Notwithstanding Subsection (2), for individuals who are spouses for purposes of this section and one of the spouses has domicile under this section, the other spouse is not considered to have domicile in this state under Subsection (2) if one of the spouses establishes by a preponderance of the evidence that, during the taxable year and for three taxable years prior to that taxable year, that other spouse:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(3)(a): is not an owner of property in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(3)(b): has not spent in the aggregate more than 30 days of the taxable year in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(3)(c): has not received earned income as defined in Section 32(c)(2), Internal Revenue Code, in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(3)(d): has not voted in this state in a regular general election, municipal general election, primary election, or special election; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(3)(e): does not have a driver license in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(4)(a): For purposes of this section, an individual is not considered to have a spouse if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(4)(a)(i): the individual is legally separated or divorced from the spouse; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(4)(a)(ii): the individual and the individual's spouse claim married filing separately filing status for purposes of filing a federal individual income tax return for the taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(4)(b): Except as provided in Subsection (4)(a)(ii), for purposes of this section, an individual's filing status on a federal individual income tax return or a return filed under this chapter may not be considered in determining whether the individual has a spouse.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-136(5): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, and for purposes of Subsections (2)(b)(xv) and (3)(b), the commission may by rule define what constitutes spending a day of the taxable year in this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-137 Review of credits allowed under this chapter.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-137(1): As used in this section, "committee" means the Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-137(2): (3); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-137(2)(a): (3) The committee shall review the tax credits described in this chapter as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-137(2)(b): (2)(a) In conducting the review required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-137(2)(b)(i): schedule time on at least one committee agenda to conduct the review;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-137(2)(b)(ii): invite state agencies, individuals, and organizations concerned with the tax credit under review to provide testimony;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-137(2)(b)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-137(2)(b)(iii)(A): invite the Governor's Office of Economic Opportunity to present a summary and analysis of the information for each tax credit regarding which the Governor's Office of Economic Opportunity is required to make a report under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-137(2)(b)(iii)(B): invite the Office of the Legislative Fiscal Analyst to present a summary and analysis of the information for each tax credit regarding which the Office of the Legislative Fiscal Analyst is required to make a report under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-137(2)(b)(iv): ensure that the committee's recommendations described in this section include an evaluation of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-137(2)(b)(iv)(A): the cost of the tax credit to the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-137(2)(b)(iv)(B): the purpose and effectiveness of the tax credit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-137(2)(b)(iv)(C): the extent to which the state benefits from the tax credit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-137(2)(b)(v): undertake other review efforts as determined by the committee chairs or as otherwise required by law.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-201.1 State taxable income of a resident estate or trust defined.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
For a taxable year, the state taxable income of a resident estate or trust means the unadjusted income of the resident estate or trust for that taxable year, as adjusted by Sections

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-209.1 Adjustments to unadjusted income.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-209.1(1): The commission shall allow an adjustment to unadjusted income of a resident or nonresident estate or trust if the resident or nonresident estate or trust would otherwise:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-209.1(1)(a): receive a double tax benefit under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-209.1(1)(b): suffer a double tax detriment under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-401 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
For purposes of this part:Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-401(1): "Employee" means and includes every individual performing services for an employer, either within or without, or both within or without the state of Utah, or any individual performing services within the state of Utah, the performance of which services constitutes, establishes, and determines the relationship between the parties as that of employer and employee, and includes offices of corporations, individuals, including elected officials, performing services for the United States Government or any agency or instrumentality thereof, or the state of Utah or any county, city, municipality, or political subdivision thereof.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-401(2): "Employer" means a person or organization transacting business in or deriving any income from sources within the state of Utah for whom an individual performs or performed any services, of whatever nature, and who has control of the payment of wages for such services, or is the officer, agent, or employee of the person or organization having control of the payment of wages.  It includes any officer or department of state or federal government, or any political subdivision or agency of the federal or state government, or any city organized under a charter, or any political body not a subdivision or agency of the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-401(3): "Wages" means wages as defined in Section 3401 of the Internal Revenue Code.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402 Requirement of withholding -- Exceptions.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(1): (1)(c)(i); (ii); (iii) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(1)(a): "Day" means any period of time during a calendar day that an individual is present in the state, unless the presence is solely for transportation through the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(1)(b): "Related entity" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(1)(b)(i): a stockholder who is an individual, or a member of the stockholder's family as described in Section 318, Internal Revenue Code, if the stockholder and the members of the stockholder's family own, in the aggregate, at least 50% of the value of the nonresident individual's outstanding stock;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(1)(b)(ii): a stockholder, or a stockholder's partnership, limited liability company, estate, trust, or corporation, if the stockholder and the stockholder's partnerships, limited liability companies, estates, trusts, or corporations own, in the aggregate, at least 50% of the value of the nonresident individual's outstanding stock; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(1)(b)(iii): a corporation, or a party related to the corporation in a manner that would require an attribution of stock from the corporation to the party or from the party to the corporation under the attribution rules of the Internal Revenue Code if the taxpayer owns, directly, indirectly, beneficially, or constructively, at least 50% of the value of the corporation's outstanding stock.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(1)(c): (1)(c)(i); (ii); (iii) "Related person" means a person that, with respect to the nonresident individual during all or any portion of the taxable year, is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(1)(c)(i): a related entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(1)(c)(ii): a component member as defined in Subsection 1563(b), Internal Revenue Code;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(1)(c)(iii): a person to or from whom there is attribution of stock ownership in accordance with Subsection 1563(e), Internal Revenue Code; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(1)(c)(iv): (1)(c)(i); (ii); (iii) a person that, notwithstanding the form of organization, bears the same relationship to the nonresident individual as a person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(2): For purposes of determining whether the ownership requirements of a related entity are satisfied, a person shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(2)(a): use the attribution rules of the Internal Revenue Code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(2)(b): include direct, indirect, beneficial, or constructive ownership.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(3): Each employer making payment of wages shall deduct and withhold from wages an amount to be determined by a commission rule that will, as closely as possible, pay the income tax imposed by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(4): (3); (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(4)(a): (3) Any employer described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(4)(b): (4)(a) If an employer described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(4)(c): Upon a showing of good cause by the employer, the commission may extend for a period of not to exceed 30 days the time during which the employer is not required to deduct and withhold the tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(5): (3); 59-10-117.5; 59-10-117.5(2)(a); (5)(a)(i); 59-10-117.5(2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(5)(a): (3); 59-10-117.5; 59-10-117.5(2)(a); (5)(a)(i); 59-10-117.5(2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(5)(a)(i): (3); 59-10-117.5; 59-10-117.5(2)(a) An employer described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(5)(a)(ii): (5)(a)(i); 59-10-117.5(2)(b) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(5)(b): If a nonresident individual is present in this state to perform employment duties for the employer, a related person, or a combination of the employer and a related person for more than 20 days during a calendar year, the employer shall be liable for all the tax that the employer would have been required to deduct and withhold.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(6): (4)(a); (5)(a); (3); Part 1, Determination and Reporting of Tax Liability and Information The exceptions described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(7): (7)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(7)(a): The amount withheld under this section shall be allowed to the recipient of the income as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(7)(b): (7) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-402(7)(c): If more than one taxable year begins in a calendar year, the withheld amount shall be allowed as a credit for the last taxable year that begins in the calendar year in which the amount is withheld.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-403 Circumstances under which an employer is not required to deduct and withhold a tax.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-403(1): 53-2a-1202; 53-2a-1202 Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, an employer is not required to deduct and withhold any tax under this chapter upon a payment of wages to an employee:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-403(1)(a): if there is in effect with respect to the payment a withholding exemption certificate  furnished to the employer by the employee, certifying that the employee:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-403(1)(a)(i): incurred no liability for a tax imposed under this chapter for the employee's immediately preceding taxable year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-403(1)(a)(ii): expects that the employee will not incur liability for a tax imposed under this chapter for the employee's current taxable year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-403(1)(b): 53-2a-1202; 53-2a-1202 if the employer:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-403(1)(b)(i): 53-2a-1202 is an out-of-state business as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-403(1)(b)(ii): 53-2a-1202 pays the wages as compensation for services performed in response to a declared state disaster or emergency as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-403(2): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 59-10-402 In accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-404 Extension of withholding to payments other than wages.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-404(1): For purposes of this part, any supplemental unemployment compensation benefit paid to an individual, and any payment of an annuity to an individual, if at the time the payment is made a request that such annuity be subject to withholding under this part is in effect, shall be treated as if it were a payment of wages by an employer to an employee for a payroll period.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-404(2): (1) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-404(3): Title 35A, Chapter 4, Employment Security Act; 35A-4-407 For purposes of this part, any unemployment compensation benefit paid to an individual pursuant to
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-404(4): For purposes of this section, "annuity" means any amount paid to an individual as a pension or annuity, but only to the extent that the amount is includable in the gross income of such individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-404(5): 59-10-403 A request that an annuity be subject to withholding under this part shall be made by the payee in writing to the person making the annuity payments.  The request may be terminated by furnishing to the person making the payments a written statement of termination which shall be treated as a withholding exemption certificate for purposes of Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-405 Voluntary withholding agreements.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-405(1): The commission may by rule provide for withholding:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-405(1)(a): from remuneration for services performed by an employee for the employee's employer that, without regard to this section, does not constitute wages; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-405(1)(b): from any other type of payment with respect to which the commission finds that withholding would be appropriate under this part if the employer and the employee, or in the case of any other type of payment the person making and the person receiving the payment, agree to the withholding.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-405.5(6)(c)(ii)(B)(III): a person for which the licensee or the fiduciary of the licensee is required to collect, truthfully account for, and pay over an amount under this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406 Collection and payment of tax -- Forms filed electronically.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(1)(a): Each employer shall, on or before the last day of April, July, October, and January, pay to the commission the amount required to be deducted and withheld from wages paid to any employee during the preceding calendar quarter under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(1)(b): The commission may change the time or period for making reports and payments if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(1)(b)(i): in its opinion, the tax is in jeopardy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(1)(b)(ii): a different time or period will facilitate the collection and payment of the tax by the employer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(2)(a): Each employer shall file a return, in a form the commission prescribes, with each payment  of the amount deducted and withheld under this part showing:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(2)(a)(i): the total amount of wages paid to his employees;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(2)(a)(ii): the amount of federal income tax deducted and withheld;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(2)(a)(iii): the amount of tax under this part deducted and withheld; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(2)(a)(iv): any other information the commission may require.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(2)(b): (2)(a) The employer shall file the return described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(3)(a): Each employer shall file an annual return, in a form the commission prescribes, summarizing:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(3)(a)(i): the total compensation paid;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(3)(a)(ii): the federal income tax deducted and withheld; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(3)(a)(iii): the state tax deducted and withheld for each employee during the calendar year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(3)(b): (3)(a) The return required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(3)(b)(i): in an electronic format approved by the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(3)(b)(ii): on or before January 31 of the year following that for which the report is made.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(4): (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(4)(a): Each employer shall also, in accordance with rules prescribed by the commission, provide each employee from whom state income tax has been withheld with a statement of the amounts of total compensation paid and the amounts deducted and withheld for that employee during the preceding calendar year in accordance with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(4)(b): (4)(a) The statement shall be made available to each employee described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(5): (5)(a); (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(5)(a): The employer is liable to the commission for the payment of the tax required to be deducted and withheld under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(5)(b): (5)(a); (5)(a) If an employer pays the tax required to be deducted and withheld under this part:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(5)(b)(i): (5)(a) an employee of the employer is not liable for the amount of any payment described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(5)(b)(ii): (5)(a) the employer is not liable to any person or to any employee for the amount of any such payment described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(5)(c): For the purpose of making penal provisions of this title applicable, any amount deducted or required to be deducted and remitted to the commission under this part is considered to be the tax of the employer and with respect to such amounts the employer is considered to be the taxpayer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(6): (6)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(6)(a): Each employer that deducts and withholds any amount under this part shall hold the amount in trust for the state for the payment of the amount to the commission in the manner and at the time provided for in this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(6)(b): So long as any delinquency continues, the state shall have a lien to secure the payment of any amounts withheld, and not remitted as provided under this section, upon all of the assets of the employer and all property owned or used by the employer in the conduct of the employer's business, including stock-in-trade, business fixtures, and equipment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(6)(c): (6)(b) The lien described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(7): To the extent consistent with this section, the commission may use all the provisions of this chapter relating to records, penalties, interest, deficiencies, redetermination of deficiencies, overpayments, refunds, assessments, and venue to enforce this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(8): (8)(b); (c); 59-10-404; (8)(a)(i); (ii); (8)(d); (8)(a); (8)(a); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (8)(a); (8)(a)(i); (ii); (8)(a)(i); (ii); (8)(a)(i); (ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(8)(a): (8)(b); (c); 59-10-404; (8)(a)(i); (ii); (8)(d) Subject to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(8)(a)(i): a federal Form W-2;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(8)(a)(ii): 59-10-404 a federal Form 1099 filed for purposes of withholding under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(8)(a)(iii): (8)(a)(i); (ii); (8)(d) a federal form substantially similar to a form described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-406(8)(b): (8)(a) An employer that is required to file a form with the commission in accordance with Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-407 Withholding tax prepayments.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-407(1): This section does not apply to an employer filing a withholding tax return for a period under this part other than a quarterly period.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-407(2): 59-10-402; 59-10-406; (2); (2)(c)(i); (2)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-407(2)(a): 59-10-402; 59-10-406 Any employer whose withholding tax liability under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-407(2)(b): (2) An employer that makes a monthly prepayment described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-407(2)(c): (2)(c)(i); (2)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-407(2)(c)(i): An employer shall file a form with a monthly prepayment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-407(2)(c)(ii): (2)(c)(i) The commission shall prescribe and furnish the form described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-407(2)(c)(iii): (2)(c)(i) An employer shall make a monthly prepayment and file the form described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-407(3): 59-10-406 In determining whether an employer's estimated withholding tax liability will average an amount that requires a monthly prepayment, the commission may consider:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-407(3)(a): 59-10-406 a return filed pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-407(3)(b): information in the commission's possession or that may come into the commission's possession.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-407(4): (2)(c)(i); (2)(c)(iii); 59-1-401; 59-1-402 The penalties and interest for failure to make a monthly prepayment and file the form described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-408 Withholding rules -- Agreements with federal government.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission may prescribe and enforce reasonable rules necessary to carry out the provisions of Sections

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-501 Rulemaking authority -- Federal income tax return information.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In accordance with

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-502 Persons required to file returns.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
An income tax return with respect to the tax imposed by this chapter shall be filed by:Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-502(1): every resident individual, estate, or trust required to file a federal income tax return for the taxable year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-502(2): every nonresident individual, estate, or trust having federal gross income derived from sources within the state for the taxable year and required to file a federal income tax return for such taxable year.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-503 Returns by husband and wife.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-503(1): (1)(b) A husband and wife may make a single return jointly with respect to the tax imposed by this chapter even though one of the spouses has neither gross income nor deductions, except as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-503(1)(a): No joint return shall be made if the husband and wife are not permitted to file a joint return for federal income tax purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-503(1)(b): If the federal income tax liability of husband or wife is determined on a separate return for federal income tax purposes, the income tax liability of each spouse shall be determined on a separate return under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-503(1)(c): (1)(b) If the federal income tax liabilities of husband and wife, other than a husband and wife described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-503(1)(d): If neither spouse is required to file a federal income tax return and either or both are required to file an income tax return under this chapter, they may elect to file separate or joint returns and their tax liability shall be several or joint and several, in accordance with the election made.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-503(2): If either husband or wife is a resident and the other is a nonresident, they shall file separate income tax returns in this state on such forms as may be required by the commission, in which event their tax liability shall be several.  They may elect to determine their joint taxable income as if both were residents, in which event their tax liability shall be joint and several.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-504 Returns made by fiduciaries and receivers.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Any fiduciary or receiver required to make a return for federal income tax purposes under the provisions of Section 6012(b) of the Internal Revenue Code shall make and file the corresponding state return for state income tax purposes.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-505 Return by minor.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-505(1): As used in this section, "parent" includes an individual who is entitled to the services of an individual who is a minor by reason of having parental rights and duties with respect to the individual who is a minor.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-505(2): If an individual who is a minor is required to make a return under this chapter, the return shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-505(2)(a): all income attributable to the individual's personal services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-505(2)(b): all other items of the individual's income.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-505(3): The income of an individual who is a minor may not be included on the return of the individual's parent.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-505(4): An expenditure attributable to the income of an individual who is a minor that is made by the individual or the individual's parent is considered to have been paid or incurred by the individual who is a minor.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-505(5): A tax assessed against an individual who is a minor, to the extent attributable to income from personal services, if not paid by the individual, for all purposes is considered as being properly assessable against the individual's parent.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-507 Return by a pass-through entity.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-507(1): As used in this section, "taxable year" means a year or other time period that would be a taxable year of a pass-through entity if the pass-through entity were subject to taxation under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-507(2): 59-10-514 A pass-through entity having any income derived from or connected with Utah sources shall make a return for the taxable year in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-508 Returns with respect to common trust funds.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Every bank or trust company maintaining a common trust fund shall make a return to the commission for each tax year in substantially the same form as it is required to make to the federal government.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-509 Notice of qualification as fiduciary.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Every receiver, trustee in bankruptcy, assignee for benefit of creditors, or other like fiduciary shall give the commission such notice of qualification in such capacity as the commission may by rule require.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-510 Return of electing small business corporation.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
An electing small business corporation, as defined in Section 1371(a)(2), Internal Revenue Code, shall make a return for each taxable year, stating specifically:Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-510(1): the items of the electing small business corporation's gross income and the deductions allowable by Subtitle A, Internal Revenue Code;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-510(2): the names and addresses of all persons owning stock in the electing small business corporation at any time during the taxable year;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-510(3): the number of shares of stock owned by each shareholder at all times during the taxable year to each shareholder;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-510(4): the date of each distribution to a shareholder; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-510(5): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act other information as the commission may prescribe by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-510(5)(a): form; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-510(5)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act administrative rule made in accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-511 Statement of tax withheld.
----------------------------------------------------------
For requirement that an employer furnish an employee a statement of tax withheld, see Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-512 Signing of returns and other documents.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-512(1): (2) Except as otherwise provided by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-512(2): 59-10-507 The return of a partnership made under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-512(3): The fact that an individual's name is signed on a return, statement, or other document shall be prima facie evidence for all purposes that the return, statement, or other document was actually signed by him.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-513 Verifications of returns.
---------------------------------------------------------
Except as the commission shall otherwise provide by rule, any return, declaration, statement, or other document required to be made under any provision of this chapter, or under rules promulgated hereunder, shall contain or be verified by a written declaration that it is made under the penalties of perjury.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-514 Return filing requirements -- Rulemaking authority.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-514(1): (3); 59-10-518; Part 1, Determination and Reporting of Tax Liability and Information; Part 2, Trusts and Estates; 59-10-507; (1)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-514.1(1)(b)(ii): (1)(b)(ii)(A)(I); (II); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Income tax return preparer" does not include an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-514.1(1)(b)(ii)(A): (1)(b)(ii)(A)(I); (II); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act performs only one or more of the following relating to a return required to be filed by this chapter:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-514.1(1)(b)(ii)(B)(II): of any person if that individual is a fiduciary for that person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-514.1(1)(b)(ii)(B)(III): for a taxpayer in response to a tax order issued to that taxpayer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-514.1(1)(c): "Prepare" means to prepare a substantial portion or more of a return required to be filed by this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-515 Place and time for filing other documents.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission by rule shall fix the place and time for filing other documents.
