Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-516(4): If a federal income tax return filing is lawfully delayed pending a determination of qualification for a federal tax exemption due to residency outside of the United States, a taxpayer shall file a return within 30 days after that determination is made.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517 Timely mailing treated as timely filing and paying.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517(1): (1)(a); (1)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517(1)(a): If any return, claim, statement, or other document required to be filed, or any payment required to be made, within a prescribed period or on or before a prescribed date under authority of any provision of this chapter is, after such period or such date, delivered by United States mail to the agency, officer, or office with which such return, claim, statement, or other document is required to be filed, or to which such payment is required to be made, the date of the United States postmark stamped on the cover in which such return, claim, statement, or other document, or payment, is mailed shall be deemed to be the date of delivery or the date of payment, as the case may be.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517(1)(b): (1)(a); (1)(b)(i) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517(1)(b)(i): the postmark date falls within the prescribed period or on or before the prescribed date:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517(1)(b)(i)(A): for the filing (including any extension granted for such filing) of the return, claim, statement, or other document; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517(1)(b)(i)(B): for making the payment (including any extension granted for making such payment); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517(1)(b)(ii): (1)(b)(i) the return, claim, statement, or other document, or payment, was, within the time prescribed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517(2): This section shall apply in the case of postmarks not made by the United States post office only if and to the extent provided by rules prescribed by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517(3)(a): For purposes of this section, if any such return, claim, statement, or other document, or payment, is sent by United States registered mail:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517(3)(a)(i): such registration shall be prima facie evidence that the return, claim, statement, or other document was delivered to the agency, officer, or office to which addressed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517(3)(a)(ii): the date of registration shall be deemed the postmark date.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517(3)(b): (3)(a) The commission may provide by rule the extent to which the provisions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517(4): This section does not apply with respect to currency or other medium of payment unless actually received and accounted for.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517(5): (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517(5)(a): If any deposit required to be made on or before a prescribed date is, after such date, delivered by the United States mail to the commission, such deposit shall be deemed received by the commission on the date the deposit was mailed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517(5)(b): (5)(a) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517(5)(b)(i): the date of mailing falls on or before the second day before the prescribed date for making the deposit (including any extension of time granted for making the deposit); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-517(5)(b)(ii): the deposit was, on or before such second day, mailed in the United States in an envelope or other appropriate wrapper, postage prepaid, properly addressed to the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-518 Time for performance of acts when last day falls on Saturday, Sunday, or legal holiday.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-518(1): As used in this section, "legal holiday" means a legal holiday in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-518(2): If the last day prescribed under authority of this chapter for performing any act falls on Saturday, Sunday, or a legal holiday, the performance of the act shall be considered to be timely if it is performed on the next succeeding day which is not a Saturday, Sunday, or a legal holiday.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-518(3): For purposes of this section, the last day for the performance of any act shall be determined by including any authorized extension of time.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-519 Place for filing returns or other documents.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
When not otherwise provided for by this chapter, the commission shall by rule prescribe the place for the filing of any return, statement, or other documents, or copies thereof, required by this chapter or rules.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-520 Time and place for paying tax shown on returns.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-520(1): When a return of tax is required under this chapter or rules, the person required to make such return shall, without assessment or notice and demand from the commission, pay such tax to the commission office with which the return is filed, and shall pay such tax at the time and place fixed for filing the return (determined without regard to any extension of time).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-520(2): In any case where a tax is required to be paid on or before a certain date, or within a certain period, any reference in this chapter to the date fixed for payment of such tax shall be deemed a reference to the last day fixed for such payment (determined without regard to any extension of time for paying the tax).


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-522 Extension of time for paying tax.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-522(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-522(1)(a): For a taxable year beginning on or after January 1, 2019, but beginning on or before December 31, 2019, a taxpayer shall receive an extension of time for the payment of the amount determined as the tax of the taxpayer, or any part of that amount, for the time period that ends on the last day of the extension to pay the taxpayer's federal income tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-522(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-522(1)(b)(i): For a taxable year beginning on or after January 1, 2020, the commission, except as otherwise provided by this chapter, may extend the time for payment of the amount shown, or required to be shown, on any return required under authority of this chapter (or any installment thereof), for a reasonable period not to exceed six months from the date fixed for payment thereof.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-522(1)(b)(ii): The extension may exceed six months in the cases of taxpayers who are outside the states of the union and the District of Columbia.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-522(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-522(2)(a): Under rules prescribed by the commission, the time for payment of the amount determined as a deficiency may be extended for a period not to exceed 18 months from the date fixed for payment of the deficiency, and, in exceptional cases, for a further period not to exceed 12 months.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-522(2)(b): An extension under this subsection may be granted only where it is shown to the satisfaction of the commission that the payment of a deficiency upon the date fixed for the payment thereof will result in undue hardship to the taxpayer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-522(2)(c): No extension may be granted if the deficiency is due to negligence, to intentional disregard of rules, or to fraud with intent to evade tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-522(3): (2) An extension of time for payment of any portion of a claim for an unpaid tax under this chapter, allowed in bankruptcy or receivership proceedings, may be had in the same manner and subject to the same provisions and limitations as provided in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-527 Assessment authority.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-527(1): The commission shall make the inquiries, determinations, and assessments of all taxes (including interest, additional amounts, additions to the tax, and assessable penalties) imposed by this chapter or former chapters imposing income taxes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-527(2): The assessment shall be made by recording the liability of the taxpayer in the office of the commission in accordance with rules prescribed by the commission.  The commission may, at any time within the period prescribed for assessment, make a supplemental assessment if it is ascertained that any assessment is imperfect or incomplete in any material respect.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-536(7)(b)(i)(A): in the return; or

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-536(7)(b)(ii): in a manner adequate to apprise the commission of the nature and amount of the item.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-541 Violations -- Civil and criminal penalties.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-541(1): 59-1-401 Every person who, without fraudulent intent, fails to make, render, sign, or verify any return, or to supply any information within the time required by or under the provisions of this chapter, is liable for a penalty as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-541(2): 59-1-401 It is unlawful for any person, with intent to evade any tax, to fail to timely remit the full amount of tax required by this chapter.  A violation of this section is punishable as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-541(3): 59-1-401 Any person who knowingly or intentionally makes, renders, signs, or verifies any false or fraudulent return or statement or supplies any false or fraudulent information is guilty of a criminal violation as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-541(4): 59-1-401; 59-1-401 Any person who, with intent to evade any tax or any requirement of this chapter, or any lawful requirement of the commission, fails to pay the tax, or to make, render, sign, or verify any return, or to supply any information, within the time required by or under this chapter, or who, with like intent, makes, renders, signs, or verifies any false or fraudulent return or statement, or supplies any false or fraudulent information, is liable for a civil penalty as provided in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-544 General powers and duties of the commission -- Deposit, distribution, or credit of revenues -- Refund reverts to state under certain circumstances.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-544(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-544(1)(a): The commission shall administer and enforce a tax imposed under this chapter for which purpose it may divide the state into districts in each of which a branch office of the commission may be maintained.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-544(1)(b): A county may not be divided in forming a district.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-544(2): 59-10-529; 59-10-531; (2)(a); 53F-9-201.1; (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-544(2)(a): The commission shall deposit at least quarterly all revenue collected or received by the commission under this chapter with the state treasurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-544(2)(b): 59-10-529; 59-10-531; (2)(a); 53F-9-201.1 Subject to Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-544(2)(b)(i): the Income Tax Fund; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-544(2)(b)(ii): 53F-9-201.1 the Uniform School Fund in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-544(2)(c): (2)(b) The commission may credit to or draw from the Income Tax Fund and the Uniform School Fund:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-544(2)(c)(i): annually to adjust for differences between estimates and actual amounts; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-544(2)(c)(ii): (2)(b) in the proportion described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-544(2)(d): If a refund the commission makes is not claimed within two years from the date the commission issues the refund:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-544(2)(d)(i): the refund reverts to the state to be credited to the Income Tax Fund; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-544(2)(d)(ii): no further claim may be made on the commission for the amount of the refund.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-546 Application of former law.
----------------------------------------------------------
Nothing in this chapter applies to or affects any tax, interest, or additions to tax or penalties, imposed by or due under former

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-552 Carry forward of expired or repealed tax credit.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-552(1): Except as provided in Subsection (2), when a nonrefundable individual income tax credit, under Part 10, Nonrefundable Tax Credit Act, expires or is repealed, the commission shall allow a claimant, estate, or trust to carry forward any amount of the tax credit that remains for the period of time described in the tax credit for the taxable year in which the claimant, estate, or trust first claimed the tax credit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-552(2): 59-10-1010 Subsection (1) does not apply to a tax credit described in Subsection

This part is known as the "Nonrefundable Tax Credit Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1002.2 Apportionment of tax credits.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1002.2(1): 59-10-1017; 59-10-1018; 59-10-1019; 59-10-1022; 59-10-1023; 59-10-1024; 59-10-1028; 59-10-1042; 59-10-1043; 59-10-1044; 59-10-1046; 59-10-1047 A nonresident individual or a part-year resident individual that claims a tax credit in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1002.2(1)(a): for a nonresident individual, the product of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1002.2(1)(a)(i): the state income tax percentage for the nonresident individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1002.2(1)(a)(ii): the amount of the tax credit that the nonresident individual would have been allowed to claim but for the apportionment requirements of this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1002.2(1)(b): for a part-year resident individual, the product of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1002.2(1)(b)(i): the state income tax percentage for the part-year resident individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1002.2(1)(b)(ii): the amount of the tax credit that the part-year resident individual would have been allowed to claim but for the apportionment requirements of this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1002.2(2)(b): the amount of the tax credit that the nonresident estate or trust would have been allowed to claim but for the apportionment requirements of this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1003 Tax credit for tax paid by individual to another state.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1003(1): (2) Except as provided in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1003(1)(b): by another state of the United States, the District of Columbia, or a possession of the United States; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1003(1)(c): on income:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1003(1)(c)(ii): if that income is also subject to tax under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1003(2)(a): resident claimant;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1003(2)(c): resident trust.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1003(3): The application of the tax credit provided under this section may not operate to reduce the tax payable under this chapter to an amount less than would have been payable were the income from the other state disregarded.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1003(4): The tax credit provided by this section shall be computed and claimed in accordance with rules prescribed by the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1004 Tax credit for cash contributions to sheltered workshops.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1004(1): 59-10-104 For tax years beginning January 1, 1983, and thereafter, in computing the tax due the state under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1004(2): The allowable tax credit is an amount equal to 50% of the aggregate amount of the cash contributions to the qualifying rehabilitation facilities, but the allowed tax credit may not exceed $200.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1004(3): The amount of contribution claimed as a tax credit under this section may not also be claimed as a charitable deduction in determining net taxable income.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005 Tax credit for at-home parent.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(1): 26B-2-101 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(1)(a): "At-home parent" means a parent:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(1)(a)(i): who provides full-time care at the parent's residence for one or more of the parent's own qualifying children;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(1)(a)(ii): who claims the qualifying child as a dependent on the parent's individual income tax return for the taxable year for which the parent claims the credit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(1)(a)(iii): if the sum of the following amounts are $3,000 or less for the taxable year for which the parent claims the credit:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(1)(a)(iii)(A): the total wages, tips, and other compensation listed on all of the parent's federal Forms W-2; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(1)(a)(iii)(B): the gross income listed on the parent's federal Form 1040 Schedule C, Profit or Loss From Business.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(1)(b): 26B-2-101 "Parent" means an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(1)(b)(i): is the biological mother or father of a qualifying child;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(1)(b)(ii): is the stepfather or stepmother of a qualifying child;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(1)(b)(iii): 26B-2-101
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(1)(b)(iii)(A): legally adopts a qualifying child; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(1)(b)(iii)(B): 26B-2-101 has a qualifying child placed in the individual's home:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(1)(b)(iii)(B)(I): 26B-2-101 by a child-placing agency, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(1)(b)(iii)(B)(II): for the purpose of legally adopting the child;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(1)(b)(iv): is a foster parent of a qualifying child; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(1)(b)(v): is a legal guardian of a qualifying child.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(1)(c): "Qualifying child" means a child who is no more than 12 months of age on the last day of the taxable year for which the tax credit is claimed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(2): For a taxable year beginning on or after January 1, 2000, a claimant may claim on the claimant's individual income tax return a nonrefundable tax credit of $100 for each qualifying child if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(2)(a): the claimant or another claimant filing a joint individual income tax return with the claimant is an at-home parent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(2)(b): the adjusted gross income of all of the claimants filing the individual income tax return is less than or equal to $50,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(3): A claimant may not carry forward or carry back a tax credit authorized by this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(4): (4)(b); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(4)(a): (4)(b) In accordance with any rules prescribed by the commission under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1005(4)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (4)(a) In accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1006 Historic preservation tax credit.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1006(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1006(1)(a): For tax years beginning January 1, 1993, and thereafter, there is allowed to a claimant, estate, or trust, as a nonrefundable tax credit against the income tax due, an amount equal to 20% of qualified rehabilitation expenditures, costing more than $10,000, incurred in connection with any residential certified historic building.  When qualifying expenditures of more than $10,000 are incurred, the tax credit allowed by this section shall apply to the full amount of expenditures.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1006(1)(b): All rehabilitation work to which the tax credit may be applied shall be approved  by the State Historic Preservation Office prior to completion of the rehabilitation project as meeting the Secretary of the Interior's Standards for Rehabilitation so that the office can provide corrective comments to the claimant, estate, or trust in order to preserve the historical qualities of the building.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1006(1)(c): Any amount of tax credit remaining may be carried forward to each of the five taxable years following the qualified expenditures.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1006(1)(d): The commission, in consultation with the State Historic Preservation Office, shall promulgate rules to implement this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1006(2): (1)(b) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1006(2)(a): "Certified historic building" means a building that is listed on the National Register of Historic Places within three years of taking the credit under this section or that is located in a National Register Historic District and the building has been designated by the State Historic Preservation Office as being of significance to the district.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1006(2)(b): (1)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1006(2)(b)(i): "Qualified rehabilitation expenditures" means any amount properly chargeable to the rehabilitation and restoration of the physical elements of the building, including the historic decorative elements, and the upgrading of the structural, mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems to applicable codes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1006(2)(b)(ii): (1)(b) "Qualified rehabilitation expenditures" does not include expenditures related to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1006(2)(b)(ii)(A): a claimant's, estate's, or trust's personal labor;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1006(2)(b)(ii)(B): cost of acquisition of the property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1006(2)(b)(ii)(C): any expenditure attributable to the enlargement of an existing building;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1006(2)(b)(ii)(D): (1)(b) rehabilitation of a certified historic building without the approval required in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1006(2)(b)(ii)(E): any expenditure attributable to landscaping and other site features, outbuildings, garages, and related features.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1006(2)(c): "Residential" means a building used for residential use, either owner occupied or income producing.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007 Recycling market development zones tax credits.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(1): 19-13-102; 59-10-104(2) Subject to other provisions of this section, a claimant, estate, or trust in a recycling market development zone as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(1)(a): 59-10-104(2) a tax credit equal to the product of the percentage listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(1)(a)(i): commercial composting; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(1)(a)(ii): manufacturing facilities or plant units that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(1)(a)(ii)(A): manufacture, process, compound, or produce recycled items of tangible personal property for sale; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(1)(a)(ii)(B): reduce or reuse postconsumer waste material; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(1)(b): a tax credit equal to the lesser of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(1)(b)(i): 20% of net expenditures to third parties for rent, wages, supplies, tools, test inventory, and utilities made by the claimant, estate, or trust for establishing and operating recycling or composting technology in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(1)(b)(ii): $2,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2): (1); (1)(a); (1)(b); (1); 59-1-1406
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(a): (1); (1)(a); (1)(b) To claim a tax credit described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(a)(i): a statement that the claimant, estate, or trust is operating within the boundaries of a recycling market development zone;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(a)(ii): (1)(a) for a claim of the tax credit described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(a)(ii)(A): the type of the machinery and equipment that the claimant, estate, or trust purchased;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(a)(ii)(B): the date that the claimant, estate, or trust purchased the machinery and equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(a)(ii)(C): the purchase price for the machinery and equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(a)(ii)(D): the total purchase price for all machinery and equipment for which the claimant, estate, or trust is claiming a tax credit;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(a)(ii)(E): the amount of the claimant's, estate's, or trust's tax credit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(a)(ii)(F): a statement that the machinery and equipment are integral to the composting or recycling process; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(a)(iii): (1)(b) for a claim of the tax credit described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(a)(iii)(A): the type of net expenditure that the claimant, estate, or trust made to a third party;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(a)(iii)(B): the date that the claimant, estate, or trust made the payment to a third party;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(a)(iii)(C): the amount that the claimant, estate, or trust paid to each third party;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(a)(iii)(D): the total amount that the claimant, estate, or trust paid to all third parties;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(a)(iii)(E): a statement that the net expenditures support the establishment and operation of recycling or composting technology in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(a)(iii)(F): the amount of the claimant's, estate's, or trust's tax credit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(b): (1); 59-1-1406

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(b)(ii): 59-1-1406 The claimant, estate, or trust shall retain a copy of the written certification for the same period of time that a person is required to keep books and records under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(c): The Department of Environmental Quality shall submit to the commission an electronic list that includes:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1007(2)(c)(ii): for each claimant, estate, or trust, the amount of each tax credit listed on the written certification.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010 Utah low-income housing tax credit.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1): 63H-8-201; 59-10-1402; 59-10-1402 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(a): "Allocation certificate" means a certificate in a form prescribed by the commission and issued by the corporation to a housing sponsor that specifies the aggregate amount of the tax credit awarded under this section to a qualified development and includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(a)(i): the aggregate annual amount of the tax credit awarded that may be claimed by one or more qualified taxpayers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(a)(ii): the credit period over which the tax credit may be claimed by one or more qualified taxpayers.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(b): "Building" means a qualified low-income building as defined in Section 42(c), Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(c): 63H-8-201 "Corporation" means the Utah Housing Corporation created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(d): Except as provided in Subsection (5)(c), "credit period" means the same as that term is defined in Section 42(f)(1), Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(e): "Designated reporter" means, as selected by a housing sponsor, the housing sponsor or one of the housing sponsor's direct or indirect partners, members, or shareholders that will provide information to the commission regarding the allocation of tax credits under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(f): "Federal low-income housing credit" means the federal low-income housing credit described in Section 42, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(g): "Housing sponsor" means an entity that owns a qualified development.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(h): 59-10-1402 "Pass-through entity" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(i): 59-10-1402
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(i)(i): 59-10-1402 Subject to Subsection (1)(i)(ii), "pass-through entity taxpayer" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(i)(ii): The determination of whether a pass-through entity taxpayer is considered a partner, member, or shareholder of a pass-through entity shall be made in accordance with applicable state law governing the pass-through entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(j): "Qualified allocation plan" means a qualified allocation plan adopted by the corporation in accordance with Section 42(m), Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(k): "Qualified development" means a "qualified low-income housing project":
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(k)(i): as defined in Section 42(g)(1), Internal Revenue Code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(k)(ii): that is located in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(l): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(l)(i): "Qualified taxpayer" means a claimant, estate, or trust that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(l)(i)(A): owns a direct or indirect interest, through one or more pass-through entities, in a qualified development; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(l)(i)(B): meets the requirements to claim a tax credit under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(1)(l)(ii): "Qualified taxpayer" includes a pass-through entity taxpayer to which a tax credit under this section is passed through by a pass-through entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2): 59-7-607; 59-7-607; 59-7-607; 59-7-607
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(a): A qualified taxpayer may claim a nonrefundable tax credit under this section against taxes otherwise due under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(b): The tax credit shall be in an amount equal to the tax credit amount specified on the allocation certificate that the corporation issues to a housing sponsor under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(c): 59-7-607; 59-7-607; 59-7-607; 59-7-607
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(c)(i): 59-7-607 For a calendar year beginning on or before December 31, 2016, the aggregate annual tax credit that the corporation may allocate for each year of the credit period pursuant to this section and Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(c)(i)(A): 12.5 cents; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(c)(i)(B): the population of Utah.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(c)(ii): 59-7-607 For a calendar year beginning on or after January 1, 2017, but beginning on or before December 31, 2022, the aggregate annual tax credit that the corporation may allocate for each year of the credit period pursuant to this section and Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(c)(ii)(A): 34.5 cents; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(c)(ii)(B): the population of Utah.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(c)(iii): 59-7-607 For a calendar year beginning on or after January 1, 2023, but beginning on or before December 31, 2028, the aggregate annual tax credit that the corporation may allocate for each year of the credit period pursuant to this section and Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(c)(iv): For a calendar year beginning on or after January 1, 2024, in addition to the amount of annual tax credits available for allocation as described in Subsections (2)(c)(i) through (2)(c)(iii), the corporation shall have the following tax credit amounts available for allocation:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(c)(iv)(A): any tax credits allocated in a calendar year that are subsequently returned to the corporation or recaptured by the corporation may be allocated in the following calendar year, except no tax credits under this Subsection (2)(c)(iv) shall be allocated after December 31, 2028; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(c)(iv)(B): if the actual amount of tax credits allocated in a calendar year to qualified developments is less than the total amount of credits available to be allocated to qualified developments, the balance of the credits but no more than 15% of the total amount of credits available for allocation to qualified developments may be allocated by the corporation to qualified developments in the following calendar year, except no tax credits under this Subsection (2)(c)(iv) shall be allocated after December 31, 2028.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(c)(v): 59-7-607 For a calendar year beginning on or after January 1, 2029, the aggregate annual tax credit that the corporation may allocate for each year of the credit period pursuant to this section and Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(c)(vi): For purposes of this Subsection (2)(c), the population of Utah shall be determined in accordance with Section 146(j), Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(d)(i): Subject to Subsection (2)(d)(ii), a qualified taxpayer that is a pass-through entity may allocate a tax credit under this section to one or more of the pass-through entity's pass-through entity taxpayers in any manner agreed upon, regardless of whether:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(d)(i)(A): the pass-through entity taxpayer is eligible to claim any portion of a federal low-income housing tax credit for the qualified development;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(d)(i)(B): the allocation of the tax credit has substantial economic effect within the meaning of Section 704(b), Internal Revenue Code; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(d)(i)(C): the pass-through entity taxpayer is considered a partner for federal income tax purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(d)(ii): With respect to a tax year, a qualified taxpayer that is a pass-through entity taxpayer may claim a tax credit allocated to the qualified taxpayer by a pass-through entity under Subsection (2)(d)(i) so long as the qualified taxpayer's ownership interest in the pass-through entity is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(d)(ii)(A): acquired on or before December 31 of the tax year to which the tax credit relates; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(d)(ii)(B): reflected in the report required in Subsection (6)(b) for the tax year to which the tax credit relates.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(e): If a qualified taxpayer that is a pass-through entity taxpayer assigns to another taxpayer the pass-through entity taxpayer's ownership interest in a pass-through entity, including the pass-through entity taxpayer's interest in the tax credit associated with the ownership interest, the assignee shall be considered a qualified taxpayer and may claim the tax credit so long as the assignee's ownership interest in the pass-through entity is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(e)(i): acquired on or before December 31 of the tax year to which the tax credit relates; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(2)(e)(ii): reflected in the report required in Subsection (6)(b) for the tax year to which the tax credit relates.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(3): 59-7-607
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(3)(a): 59-7-607 The corporation shall determine criteria and procedures for allocating the tax credit under this section and Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(3)(b): The corporation shall create the criteria under Subsection (3)(a) based on:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(3)(b)(i): the number of affordable housing units to be created in Utah for low and moderate income persons in a qualified development;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(3)(b)(ii): the level of area median income being served by a qualified development;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(3)(b)(iii): the need for the tax credit for the economic feasibility of a qualified development; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(3)(b)(iv): the extended period for which a qualified development commits to remain as affordable housing.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(4): Any housing sponsor may apply to the corporation for a tax credit allocation under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(5)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(5)(a)(i): The corporation shall determine the amount of the tax credit to allocate to a qualified development in accordance with the qualified allocation plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(5)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(5)(a)(ii)(A): Before the allocation certificate is issued to the housing sponsor, the corporation shall send to the housing sponsor written notice of the corporation's preliminary determination of the tax credit amount to be allocated to the qualified development.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(5)(a)(ii)(B): The notice described in Subsection (5)(a)(ii)(A) shall specify the corporation's preliminary determination of the tax credit amount to be allocated to the qualified development for each year of the credit period and state that allocation of the tax credit is contingent upon the issuance of an allocation certificate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(5)(a)(iii): Upon approving a final cost certification in accordance with the qualified allocation plan, the corporation shall issue an allocation certificate to the housing sponsor as evidence of the allocation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(5)(a)(iv): The amount of the tax credit specified in an allocation certificate may not exceed 100% of the federal low-income housing credit awarded to a qualified development.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(5)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(5)(b)(i): Notwithstanding Subsection (5)(a), if a housing sponsor applies to the corporation for a tax credit under this section and an allocation certificate is not yet issued, a qualified taxpayer may claim a tax credit based upon the corporation's preliminary determination of the tax credit amount as stated in the notice under Subsection (5)(a)(ii).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(5)(b)(ii): Upon issuance of the allocation certificate to the housing sponsor, a qualified taxpayer that claims a tax credit under this Subsection (5)(b) shall file an amended tax return to adjust the tax credit amount if the amount previously claimed by the qualified taxpayer is different than the amount specified in the allocation certificate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(5)(c): The amount of tax credit that may be claimed in the first year of the credit period may not be reduced as a result of the calculation in Section 42(f)(2), Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(5)(d): On or before January 31 of each year, the corporation shall provide to the commission in a form prescribed by the commission a report that describes each allocation certificate that the corporation issued during the previous calendar year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(6)(a): A housing sponsor shall provide to the commission identification of the housing sponsor's designated reporter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(6)(b): For each tax year in which a tax credit is claimed under this section, the designated reporter shall provide to the commission in a form prescribed by the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(6)(b)(i): a list of each qualified taxpayer that has been allocated a portion of the tax credit awarded in the allocation certificate for that tax year;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(6)(b)(ii): the amount of tax credit that has been allocated to each qualified taxpayer described in Subsection (6)(b)(i) for that tax year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(6)(b)(iii): any other information, as prescribed by the commission, to demonstrate that the aggregate annual amount of tax credits allocated to all qualified taxpayers for that tax year does not exceed the aggregate annual tax credit amount specified in the allocation certificate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(7)(a): All elections made by a housing sponsor pursuant to Section 42, Internal Revenue Code, shall apply to this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(7)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(7)(b)(i): If a qualified taxpayer is required to recapture a portion of any federal low-income housing credit, the qualified taxpayer that has been allocated a portion of a tax credit under this section shall also be required to recapture a portion of the tax credit under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(7)(b)(ii): The state recapture amount shall be equal to the percentage of the state tax credit that equals the proportion the federal recapture amount bears to the original federal low-income housing credit amount subject to recapture.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(7)(b)(iii): The designated reporter shall identify each qualified taxpayer that is required to recapture a portion of any state tax credits as described in this Subsection (7)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(8)(a): Any tax credits returned to the corporation in any year may be reallocated within the same time period as provided in Section 42, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(8)(b): Tax credits that are unallocated by the corporation in any year may be carried over for allocation in subsequent years.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(9)(a): If a tax credit is not claimed by a qualified taxpayer in the year in which it is earned because the tax credit is more than the tax owed by the qualified taxpayer, the tax credit may be carried back three years or may be carried forward five years as a credit against the tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(9)(b): Carryover tax credits under Subsection (9)(a) shall be applied against the tax:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(9)(b)(i): before the application of the tax credits earned in the current year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(9)(b)(ii): on a first-earned first-used basis.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(10): Any tax credit taken in this section may be subject to an annual audit by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(11): The corporation shall annually provide an electronic report to the Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee that includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(11)(a): the purpose and effectiveness of the tax credits;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(11)(b): any recommendations for legislative changes to the aggregate tax credit amount that the corporation is authorized to allocate each year under Subsection (2)(c); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(11)(c): the benefits of the tax credits to the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(12): The commission may, in consultation with the corporation, promulgate rules to implement this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(13): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(13)(a): Beginning in 2026, and every three years thereafter, the Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee shall conduct a review of the aggregate tax credit amount that the corporation is authorized to allocate and has allocated each year under Subsection (2)(c).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(13)(b): In a review under this Subsection (13), the Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(13)(b)(i): study any recommendations provided by the corporation under Subsection (11)(b); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1010(13)(b)(ii): if the Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee decides to recommend legislative action to the Legislature, prepare legislation for consideration by the Legislature in the next general session.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014 Nonrefundable clean energy systems tax credits -- Definitions -- Certification -- Rulemaking authority.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1): 59-12-102; 79-6-401; 59-2-405; 59-2-405.1; 59-2-405.2; 59-2-405.3; 72-10-110.5 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(a)(i): "Active solar system" means a system of equipment that is capable of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(a)(i)(A): collecting and converting incident solar radiation into thermal, mechanical, or electrical energy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(a)(i)(B): transferring a form of energy described in Subsection (1)(a)(i)(A) by a separate apparatus to storage or to the point of use.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(a)(ii): "Active solar system" includes water heating, space heating or cooling, and electrical or mechanical energy generation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(b): 59-12-102 "Biomass system" means a system of apparatus and equipment for use in:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(b)(i): 59-12-102 converting material into biomass energy, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(b)(ii): transporting the biomass energy by separate apparatus to the point of use or storage.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(c): "Direct use geothermal system" means a system of apparatus and equipment that enables the direct use of geothermal energy to meet energy needs, including heating a building, an industrial process, and aquaculture.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(d): "Geothermal electricity" means energy that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(d)(i): contained in heat that continuously flows outward from the earth; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(d)(ii): used as a sole source of energy to produce electricity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(e): "Geothermal energy" means energy generated by heat that is contained in the earth.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(f): "Geothermal heat pump system" means a system of apparatus and equipment that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(f)(i): enables the use of thermal properties contained in the earth at temperatures well below 100 degrees Fahrenheit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(f)(ii): helps meet heating and cooling needs of a structure.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(g): "Hydroenergy system" means a system of apparatus and equipment that is capable of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(g)(i): intercepting and converting kinetic water energy into electrical or mechanical energy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(g)(ii): transferring this form of energy by separate apparatus to the point of use or storage.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(h): 79-6-401 "Office" means the Office of Energy Development created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(i)(i): "Passive solar system" means a direct thermal system that utilizes the structure of a building and its operable components to provide for collection, storage, and distribution of heating or cooling during the appropriate times of the year by utilizing the climate resources available at the site.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(i)(ii): "Passive solar system" includes those portions and components of a building that are expressly designed and required for the collection, storage, and distribution of solar energy.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(j): "Photovoltaic system" means an active solar system that generates electricity from sunlight.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(k): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(k)(i): "Principal recovery portion" means the portion of a lease payment that constitutes the cost a person incurs in acquiring a residential energy system.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(k)(ii): "Principal recovery portion" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(k)(ii)(A): an interest charge; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(k)(ii)(B): a maintenance expense.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(l): "Residential energy system" means the following used to supply energy to or for a residential unit:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(l)(i): an active solar system;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(l)(ii): a biomass system;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(l)(iii): a direct use geothermal system;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(l)(iv): a geothermal heat pump system;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(l)(v): a hydroenergy system;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(l)(vi): a passive solar system; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(l)(vii): a wind system.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(m): 59-2-405; 59-2-405.1; 59-2-405.2; 59-2-405.3; 72-10-110.5
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(m)(i): "Residential unit" means a house, condominium, apartment, or similar dwelling unit that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(m)(i)(A): is located in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(m)(i)(B): serves as a dwelling for a person, group of persons, or a family.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(m)(ii): 59-2-405; 59-2-405.1; 59-2-405.2; 59-2-405.3; 72-10-110.5 "Residential unit" does not include property subject to a fee under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(m)(ii)(A): 59-2-405 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(m)(ii)(B): 59-2-405.1 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(m)(ii)(C): 59-2-405.2 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(m)(ii)(D): 59-2-405.3 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(m)(ii)(E): 72-10-110.5 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(n): "Wind system" means a system of apparatus and equipment that is capable of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(n)(i): intercepting and converting wind energy into mechanical or electrical energy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(1)(n)(ii): transferring these forms of energy by a separate apparatus to the point of use or storage.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(2): A claimant, estate, or trust may claim an energy system tax credit as provided in this section against a tax due under this chapter for a taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(3): For a taxable year beginning on or after January 1, 2007, a claimant, estate, or trust may claim a nonrefundable tax credit under this section with respect to a residential unit the claimant, estate, or trust owns or uses if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(3)(a): the claimant, estate, or trust:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(3)(a)(i): purchases and completes a residential energy system to supply all or part of the energy required for the residential unit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(3)(a)(ii): participates in the financing of a residential energy system to supply all or part of the energy required for the residential unit;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(3)(b): the residential energy system is installed on or after January 1, 2007; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(3)(c): the claimant, estate, or trust obtains a written certification from the office in accordance with Subsection (5).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4): 59-7-614
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(a): For a residential energy system, other than a photovoltaic system, the tax credit described in this section is equal to the lesser of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(a)(i): 25% of the reasonable costs, including installation costs, of each residential energy system installed with respect to each residential unit the claimant, estate, or trust owns or uses; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(a)(ii): $2,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(b): Subject to Subsection (5)(d), for a residential energy system that is a photovoltaic system, the tax credit described in this section is equal to the lesser of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(b)(i): 25% of the reasonable costs, including installation costs, of each system installed with respect to each residential unit the claimant, estate, or trust owns or uses; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(b)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(b)(ii)(A): for a system installed on or after January 1, 2007, but on or before December 31, 2017, $2,000;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(b)(ii)(B): for a system installed on or after January 1, 2018, but on or before December 31, 2020, $1,600;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(b)(ii)(C): for a system installed on or after January 1, 2021, but on or before December 31, 2021, $1,200;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(b)(ii)(D): for a system installed on or after January 1, 2022, but on or before December 31, 2022, $800;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(b)(ii)(E): for a system installed on or after January 1, 2023, but on or before December 31, 2023, $400; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(b)(ii)(F): for a system installed on or after January 1, 2024, $0.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(c)(i): The office shall determine the amount of the tax credit that a claimant, estate, or trust may claim and list that amount on the written certification that the office issues under Subsection (5).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(c)(ii): The claimant, estate, or trust may claim the tax credit in the amount listed on the written certification that the office issues under Subsection (5).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(d): A claimant, estate, or trust may claim a tax credit under Subsection (3) for the taxable year in which the residential energy system is installed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(e): If the amount of a tax credit listed on the written certification exceeds a claimant's, estate's, or trust's tax liability under this chapter for a taxable year, the claimant, estate, or trust may carry forward the amount of the tax credit exceeding the liability for a period that does not exceed the next four taxable years.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(f): A claimant, estate, or trust may claim a tax credit with respect to additional residential energy systems or parts of residential energy systems for a subsequent taxable year if the total amount of tax credit the claimant, estate, or trust claims does not exceed $2,000 per residential unit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(g): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(g)(i): Subject to Subsections (4)(g)(ii) and (iii), a claimant, estate, or trust that leases a residential energy system installed on a residential unit may claim a tax credit under Subsection (3) if the claimant, estate, or trust confirms that the lessor irrevocably elects not to claim the tax credit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(g)(ii): A claimant, estate, or trust described in Subsection (4)(g)(i) that leases a residential energy system may claim as a tax credit under Subsection (3) only the principal recovery portion of the lease payments.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(g)(iii): A claimant, estate, or trust described in Subsection (4)(g)(i) that leases a residential energy system may claim a tax credit under Subsection (3) for a period that does not exceed seven taxable years after the date the lease begins, as stated in the lease agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(h): 59-7-614 If a claimant, estate, or trust sells a residential unit to another person before the claimant, estate, or trust claims the tax credit under Subsection (3):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(h)(i): the claimant, estate, or trust may assign the tax credit to the other person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(h)(ii): 59-7-614
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(h)(ii)(A): 59-7-614 if the other person files a return under Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes, the other person may claim the tax credit as if the other person had met the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(4)(h)(ii)(B): if the other person files a return under this chapter, the other person may claim the tax credit under this section as if the other person had met the requirements of this section to claim the tax credit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(5): 59-1-1406
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(5)(a): Before a claimant, estate, or trust may claim a tax credit under this section, the claimant, estate, or trust shall obtain a written certification from the office.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(5)(b): The office shall issue a claimant, estate, or trust a written certification if the office determines that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(5)(b)(i): the claimant, estate, or trust meets the requirements of this section to receive a tax credit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(5)(b)(ii): the office determines that the residential energy system with respect to which the claimant, estate, or trust seeks to claim a tax credit:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(5)(b)(ii)(A): has been completely installed;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(5)(b)(ii)(B): is a viable system for saving or producing energy from clean resources; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(5)(b)(ii)(C): is safe, reliable, efficient, and technically feasible to ensure that the residential energy system uses the state's renewable and nonrenewable energy resources in an appropriate and economic manner.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(5)(c): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the office may make rules:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(5)(c)(i): for determining whether a residential energy system meets the requirements of Subsection (5)(b)(ii); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(5)(c)(ii): for purposes of determining the amount of a tax credit that a claimant, estate, or trust may receive under Subsection (4), establishing the reasonable costs of a residential energy system, as an amount per unit of energy production.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(5)(d): 59-1-1406 A claimant, estate, or trust that obtains a written certification from the office shall retain the certification for the same time period a person is required to keep books and records under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(5)(e): The office shall submit to the commission an electronic list that includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(5)(e)(i): the name and identifying information of each claimant, estate, or trust to which the office issues a written certification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(5)(e)(ii): for each claimant, estate, or trust:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(5)(e)(ii)(A): the amount of the tax credit listed on the written certification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(5)(e)(ii)(B): the date the clean energy system was installed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(6): A tax credit under this section is in addition to any tax credits provided under the laws or rules and regulations of the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1014(7): 59-10-1024 A purchaser of one or more solar units that claims a tax credit under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015 Definitions -- Tax credit for live organ donation expenses -- Rulemaking authority.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(a): "human organ" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(a)(i): human bone marrow; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(a)(ii): any part of a human:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(a)(ii)(A): intestine;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(a)(ii)(B): kidney;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(a)(ii)(C): liver;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(a)(ii)(D): lung; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(a)(ii)(E): pancreas;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(b): "live organ donation" means that an individual who is living donates one or more of that individual's human organs:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(b)(i): to another human; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(b)(ii): to be transplanted:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(b)(ii)(A): using a medical procedure; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(b)(ii)(B): to the body of the other human; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(c): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(c)(i): "live organ donation expenses" means the total amount of expenses:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(c)(i)(A): incurred by a claimant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(c)(i)(B): that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(c)(i)(B)(I): are not reimbursed to that claimant by any person;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(c)(i)(B)(II): are directly related to a live organ donation by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(c)(i)(B)(II)(Aa): the claimant; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(c)(i)(B)(II)(Bb): another individual that the claimant is allowed to claim as a dependent in accordance with Section 151, Internal Revenue Code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(c)(i)(B)(III): are for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(c)(i)(B)(III)(Aa): travel;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(c)(i)(B)(III)(Bb): lodging; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(c)(i)(B)(III)(Cc): a lost wage; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(1)(c)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(2): For taxable years beginning on or after January 1, 2005, a claimant may claim a nonrefundable tax credit:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(2)(a): as provided in this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(2)(b): against taxes otherwise due under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(2)(c): for live organ donation expenses incurred during the taxable year for which the live organ donation occurs; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(2)(d): in an amount equal to the lesser of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(2)(d)(i): the actual amount of the live organ donation expenses; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(2)(d)(ii): $10,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1015(3): If the amount of a tax credit under this section exceeds a claimant's tax liability under this chapter for a taxable year, the amount of the tax credit that exceeds the claimant's tax liability may be carried forward for a period that does not exceed the next five taxable years.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018 Definitions -- Nonrefundable taxpayer tax credits.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1): (6) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1)(a): "Head of household filing status" means a head of household, as defined in Section 2(b), Internal Revenue Code, who files a single federal individual income tax return for the taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1)(b): "Joint filing status" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1)(b)(i): spouses who file a single return jointly under this chapter for a taxable year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1)(b)(ii): a surviving spouse, as defined in Section 2(a), Internal Revenue Code, who files a single federal individual income tax return for the taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1)(c): "Qualifying dependent" means an individual with respect to whom the claimant is allowed to claim a tax credit under Section 24, Internal Revenue Code, on the claimant's federal individual income tax return for the taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1)(d): "Single filing status" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1)(d)(i): a single individual who files a single federal individual income tax return for the taxable year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1)(d)(ii): a married individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1)(d)(ii)(A): does not file a single federal individual income tax return jointly with that married individual's spouse for the taxable year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1)(d)(ii)(B): files a single federal individual income tax return for the taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1)(e): "State or local income tax" means the lesser of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1)(e)(i): the amount of state or local income tax that the claimant:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1)(e)(i)(A): pays for the taxable year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1)(e)(i)(B): reports on the claimant's federal individual income tax return for the taxable year, regardless of whether the claimant is allowed an itemized deduction on the claimant's federal individual income tax return for the taxable year for the full amount of state or local income tax paid; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1)(e)(ii): $10,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1)(f): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1)(f)(i): "Utah itemized deduction" means the amount the claimant deducts as allowed as an itemized deduction on the claimant's federal individual income tax return for that taxable year minus any amount of state or local income tax for the taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1)(f)(ii): "Utah itemized deduction" does not include any amount of qualified business income that the claimant subtracts as allowed by Section 199A, Internal Revenue Code, on the claimant's federal income tax return for that taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(1)(g): (6) "Utah personal exemption" means, subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(2): 59-10-1002.2; (3); (5) Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(2)(a)(i): for a claimant that deducts the standard deduction on the claimant's federal individual income tax return for the taxable year, 6% of the amount the claimant deducts as allowed as the standard deduction on the claimant's federal individual income tax return for that taxable year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(2)(a)(ii): for a claimant that itemizes deductions on the claimant's federal individual income tax return for the taxable year, 6% of the amount of the claimant's Utah itemized deduction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(2)(b): 6% of the claimant's Utah personal exemption.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(3): A claimant may not carry forward or carry back a tax credit under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(4): (2) The tax credit allowed by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1018(4)(a): for a claimant who has a single filing status, $15,095;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1019(1)(d)(ii): files a single federal individual income tax return for the taxable year.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1019(1)(e)(iii): 59-10-114; (1)(e)(i) any addition to adjusted gross income required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1019(1)(f): "Single filing status" means a single individual who files a single federal individual income tax return for the taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1019(2): 59-10-1002.2; (3); (4) Except as provided in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1022(1)(a)(i)(B): long-term capital gain.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1022(1)(d)(iii)(C)(II): other property, except for stock or securities.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024 Nonrefundable tax credit for qualifying solar projects.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1): 59-10-1014; 79-6-401; Title 11, Chapter 13, Interlocal Cooperation Act; Title 17D, Chapter 1, Special Service District Act; 59-10-1014 As used in this section:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(b): 79-6-401 "Office" means the Office of Energy Development created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(c): "Purchaser" means a claimant, estate, or trust that purchases one or more solar units from a qualifying political subdivision.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(d): Title 11, Chapter 13, Interlocal Cooperation Act; Title 17D, Chapter 1, Special Service District Act "Qualifying political subdivision" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(d)(i): a city or town in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(d)(ii): Title 11, Chapter 13, Interlocal Cooperation Act an interlocal entity created under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(d)(iii): Title 17D, Chapter 1, Special Service District Act a special service district created under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(e): "Qualifying solar project" means the portion of an active solar system:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(e)(i): that a qualifying political subdivision:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(e)(i)(A): constructs;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(e)(i)(B): controls; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(e)(i)(C): owns;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(e)(ii): with respect to which the qualifying political subdivision sells one or more solar units; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(e)(iii): that generates electrical output that is furnished:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(e)(iii)(A): to one or more residential units; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(e)(iii)(B): for the benefit of one or more residential units.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(f): 59-10-1014 "Residential unit" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(g): "Solar unit" means a portion of the electrical output:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(g)(i): of a qualifying solar project;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(g)(ii): that a qualifying political subdivision sells to a purchaser; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(g)(iii): the purchase of which requires that the purchaser agree to bear a proportionate share of the expense of the qualifying solar project:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(g)(iii)(A): in accordance with a written agreement between the purchaser and the qualifying political subdivision;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(g)(iii)(B): in exchange for a credit on the purchaser's electrical bill; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(1)(g)(iii)(C): as determined by a formula established by the qualifying political subdivision.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(2): (2)(b); (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(2)(a): (2)(b); (3) Subject to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(2)(b): The maximum tax credit per taxpayer per taxable year is the lesser of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(2)(b)(i): 25% of the amount that the purchaser pays to purchase one or more solar units during the taxable year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(2)(b)(ii): $2,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(3): 59-10-1014; 59-10-1014; 59-1-1406
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(3)(a): To claim a tax credit under this section, a purchaser shall receive a tax credit certificate from the office.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(3)(c): If the office determines that the purchaser purchased one or more solar units during the taxable year, the office shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(3)(c)(i): determine the amount of the purchaser's tax credit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(3)(c)(ii): issue, on a form approved by the commission, a tax credit certificate to the purchaser that states the amount of the purchaser's tax credit.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1024(3)(f)(i): the name and identifying information of each purchaser to whom the office issued a certificate; and

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1025 Nonrefundable tax credit for investment in certain life science establishments.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1025(1): 63N-2-802; 59-10-1402; 59-10-1402; (1)(h)(ii); 59-10-1022 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1025(1)(a): "Commercial domicile" means the principal place from which the trade or business of a Utah small business corporation is directed or managed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1025(1)(b): 63N-2-802 "Eligible claimant, estate, or trust" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1025(1)(c): "Life science establishment" means an establishment primarily engaged in the development or manufacture of products in one or more of the following categories:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1025(1)(c)(i): biotechnologies;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1025(1)(c)(ii): medical devices;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1025(1)(c)(iii): medical diagnostics; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1025(1)(c)(iv): pharmaceuticals.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1027 Nonrefundable tax credit for combat related death.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1027(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1027(1)(a): "Active component of the United States Armed Forces" means active duty service in the United States Army, United States Navy, United States Air Force, United States Marine Corps, United States Space Force, or United States Coast Guard.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1027(1)(b): "Combat related death" means an individual who dies:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1027(1)(b)(i): on or after January 1, 2010; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1027(1)(b)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1027(1)(b)(ii)(A): while in military service in a combat zone; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1027(1)(b)(ii)(B): as a result of a wound, disease, or injury the individual incurs while in military service in a combat zone.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1027(1)(c): "Combat zone" means an area that the President of the United States designates by Executive Order as an area in which an active component of the United States Armed Forces or a reserve component of the United States Armed Forces are or have engaged in combat.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1027(1)(d): "Military service in a combat zone" means service:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1027(1)(d)(i): in an active component of the United States Armed Forces or reserve component of the United States Armed Forces; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1027(1)(d)(ii): performed:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1027(1)(d)(ii)(A): on or after the date the President of the United States designates by Executive Order as the date combatant activities begin in a combat zone; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1027(1)(d)(ii)(B): on or before the date the President of the United States designates by Executive Order as the date combatant activities terminate in a combat zone.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1027(1)(e): "Reserve component of the United States Armed Forces" means service in a reserve component of the armed forces listed in 10 U.S.C. Sec. 101(c) or 10 U.S.C. Sec. 10101.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1027(2): A claimant, estate, or trust that files a return on behalf of an individual who dies a combat related death may claim a nonrefundable tax credit against that individual's tax liability under this chapter as provided in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1027(3): (2) For purposes of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1028 Nonrefundable tax credit for capital gain transactions on the exchange of one form of legal tender for another form of legal tender.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1028(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1028(1)(a): "Capital gain transaction" means a transaction that results in a:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1028(1)(a)(i): short-term capital gain; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1028(1)(a)(ii): long-term capital gain.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1028(1)(b): "Long-term capital gain" is as defined in Section 1222, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1028(1)(c): "Long-term capital loss" is as defined in Section 1222, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1028(1)(d): "Net capital gain" means the amount by which the sum of long-term capital gains and short-term capital gains on a claimant's, estate's, or trust's transactions from exchanges made for a taxable year of one form of legal tender for another form of legal tender exceeds the sum of long-term capital losses and short-term capital losses on those transactions for that taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1028(1)(e): "Short-term capital loss" is as defined in Section 1222, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1028(1)(f): "Short-term capital gain" is as defined in Section 1222, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1028(2): 59-10-1002.2; 59-10-104(2) Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1028(2)(a): to the extent a net capital gain is included in taxable income, the amount of the claimant's, estate's, or trust's net capital gain on capital gain transactions from exchanges made on or after January 1, 2012, for a taxable year, of one form of legal tender for another form of legal tender; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1028(2)(b): 59-10-104(2) the percentage listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1028(3): A claimant, estate, or trust may not carry forward or carry back a tax credit under this section.
