Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1 Tax credit related to alternative fuel heavy duty vehicles.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(1): Title 19, Chapter 2, Air Conservation Act; 19-2-107 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(1)(a): Title 19, Chapter 2, Air Conservation Act "Board" means the Air Quality Board created under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(1)(b): 19-2-107 "Director" means the director of the Division of Air Quality appointed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(1)(c): "Heavy duty vehicle" means a commercial category 7 or 8 vehicle, according to vehicle classifications established by the Federal Highway Administration.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(1)(d): "Natural gas" includes compressed natural gas and liquified natural gas.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(1)(e): "Qualified heavy duty vehicle" means a heavy duty vehicle that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(1)(e)(i): has never been titled or registered and has been driven less than 7,500 miles; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(1)(e)(ii): is fueled by natural gas, has a 100% electric drivetrain, or has a hydrogen-electric drivetrain.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(1)(f): "Qualified purchase" means the purchase of a qualified heavy duty vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(1)(g): "Qualified taxpayer" means a claimant, estate, or trust that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(1)(g)(i): purchases a qualified heavy duty vehicle; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(1)(g)(ii): receives a tax credit certificate from the director.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(1)(h): "Small fleet" means 40 or fewer heavy duty vehicles registered in the state and owned by a single claimant, estate, or trust.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(1)(i): "Tax credit certificate" means a certificate issued by the director certifying that a claimant, estate, or trust is entitled to a tax credit as provided in this section and stating the amount of the tax credit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(2): A qualified taxpayer may claim a nonrefundable tax credit against tax otherwise due under this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(2)(a): in an amount equal to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(2)(a)(i): $15,000, if the qualified purchase occurs during calendar year 2021;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(2)(a)(ii): $13,500, if the qualified purchase occurs during calendar year 2022;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(2)(a)(iii): $12,000, if the qualified purchase occurs during calendar year 2023;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(2)(a)(iv): $10,500, if the qualified purchase occurs during calendar year 2024;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(2)(a)(v): $9,000, if the qualified purchase occurs during calendar year 2025;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(2)(a)(vi): $7,500, if the qualified purchase occurs during calendar year 2026;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(2)(a)(vii): $6,000, if the qualified purchase occurs during calendar year 2027;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(2)(a)(viii): $4,500, if the qualified purchase occurs during calendar year 2028;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(2)(a)(ix): $3,000, if the qualified purchase occurs during calendar year 2029; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(2)(a)(x): $1,500, if the qualified purchase occurs during calendar year 2030; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(2)(b): if the qualified taxpayer certifies under oath that over 50% of the miles that the heavy duty vehicle that is the subject of the qualified purchase will travel annually will be within the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(3): (3)(b); (5); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(3)(a): (3)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(3)(b): (5); (3)(a) If, by May 1 of any year, more than 30% of the aggregate annual total amount of tax credits under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(4): (4)(b); (4)(a); (5)(b); (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(4)(a): (4)(b) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(4)(b): (4)(a); (5)(b); (4)(a) Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(6)(b)(ii): provide the claimant, estate, or trust with a written tax credit certificate:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(6)(b)(ii)(B): showing the amount of tax credit for which the claimant, estate, or trust has qualified under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(6)(c): A qualified taxpayer shall retain the tax credit certificate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(6)(d): The director shall at least annually submit to the commission a list of all qualified taxpayers to which the director has issued a tax credit certificate and the amount of each tax credit represented by the tax credit certificates.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(7): The tax credit under this section is allowed only:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(7)(a): against a tax owed under this chapter in the taxable year by the qualified taxpayer;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(7)(b): for the taxable year in which the qualified purchase occurs; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(7)(c): once per vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(8): A qualified taxpayer may not assign a tax credit or a tax credit certificate under this section to another person.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1033.1(9): If the qualified taxpayer receives a tax credit certificate under this section that allows a tax credit in an amount that exceeds the qualified taxpayer's tax liability under this chapter for a taxable year, the qualified taxpayer may carry forward the amount of the tax credit that exceeds the tax liability for a period that does not exceed the next five taxable years.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1044 Nonrefundable earned income tax credit.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1044(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1044(1)(a): "Federal earned income tax credit" means the federal earned income tax credit described in Section 32, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1044(1)(b): "Qualifying claimant" means a resident or nonresident individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1044(1)(b)(i): qualifies for and claims the federal earned income tax credit for the current taxable year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1044(1)(b)(ii): earns income in Utah that is reported on a W-2 form.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1044(2): 59-10-1002.2 Subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1044(2)(a): 20% of the amount of the federal earned income tax credit that the qualifying claimant was entitled to claim on a federal income tax return for the current taxable year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1044(2)(b): the total Utah wages reported on the qualifying claimant's W-2 form for the current taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1044(3): A qualifying claimant may not carry forward or carry back the amount of the earned income tax credit that exceeds the qualifying claimant's tax liability.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1045 Nonrefundable tax credit for taxes paid by pass-through entity.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1045(1): (1)(a); 59-10-1403.2(2); (1)(a); 59-10-114(1)(i) As used in this section, "taxed pass-through entity taxpayer" means a resident or nonresident individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1045(1)(a): has income attributed to the individual by a pass-through entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1045(1)(b): (1)(a); 59-10-1403.2(2) receives the income described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1045(1)(c): (1)(a); 59-10-114(1)(i) adds the amount of tax paid on the income described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1045(2): 59-10-1403.2(2); 59-10-1403.2(2)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1045(2)(a): 59-10-1403.2(2) A taxed pass-through entity taxpayer may claim a nonrefundable tax credit for the taxes imposed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1045(2)(b): 59-10-1403.2(2) The tax credit is equal to the amount of the tax paid under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1045(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1045(3)(a): A taxed pass-through entity taxpayer may carry forward the amount of the tax credit that exceeds the taxed pass-through entity taxpayer's tax liability for a period that does not exceed the next five taxable years.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1045(3)(b): A taxed pass-through entity taxpayer may not carry back the amount of the tax credit that exceeds the taxed pass-through entity taxpayer's tax liability for the taxable year.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046 Nonrefundable adoption expense tax credit.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1): 35A-1-111; 26B-3-101; Title 35A, Chapter 3, Employment Support Act; Title 26B, Chapter 3, Part 9, Utah Children's Health Insurance Program As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(a): "Adoption expense" means a reasonable and necessary adoption fee, court cost, attorney fee, or other expense that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(a)(i): directly related to, and for the primary purpose of, adoption of a qualifying child through a domestic adoption;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(a)(ii): not incurred in violation of federal or state law or in carrying out any surrogate parenting arrangement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(a)(iii): not paid or reimbursed by any employer or state assistance program.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(b): "Domestic adoption" means an adoption of a child who is a United States citizen or a resident of the United States or its possessions before the adoption effort begins.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(c)(i): "Qualifying child" means an individual who is under 18 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(c)(ii): "Qualifying child" does not include an individual who is a child of the claimant's spouse.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(d): 35A-1-111 "Qualifying claimant" means a claimant:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(d)(i): whose adjusted gross income on a federal tax return is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(d)(i)(A): for a claimant who files the federal tax return jointly with the claimant's spouse, $55,000 or more but less than $110,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(d)(i)(B): for a claimant who files the federal tax return other than jointly, $27,500 or more but less than $55,000;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(d)(ii): who did not, and if the claimant is married, whose spouse did not, receive state or federal assistance during the taxable year in which the adoption is finalized; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(d)(iii): 35A-1-111 who applies for and receives a certification described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(e): 26B-3-101; Title 35A, Chapter 3, Employment Support Act; Title 26B, Chapter 3, Part 9, Utah Children's Health Insurance Program
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(e)(i): "State or federal assistance" means public funds that are:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(e)(i)(A): expended for the benefit of an individual in need of financial, medical, food, housing, or related assistance;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(e)(i)(B): means tested; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(e)(i)(C): provided by a state or the federal government.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(e)(ii): 26B-3-101; Title 35A, Chapter 3, Employment Support Act; Title 26B, Chapter 3, Part 9, Utah Children's Health Insurance Program "State or federal assistance" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(e)(ii)(A): 26B-3-101 the Medicaid program, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(e)(ii)(B): Title 35A, Chapter 3, Employment Support Act the Employment Support Act described in
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(e)(ii)(C): Title 26B, Chapter 3, Part 9, Utah Children's Health Insurance Program the Children's Health Insurance Program created in
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(e)(ii)(D): the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program established in 7 U.S.C.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(e)(ii)(E): the Women, Infants, and Children Program established in 42 U.S.C. Sec. 1786;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(e)(ii)(F): the federal Social Security Act; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(e)(ii)(G): housing assistance.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(1)(e)(iii): "State or federal assistance" does not include an income tax credit, subtraction, or deduction.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(2): 59-10-1002.2 Subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(2)(a): $3,500; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(2)(b): the amount of the qualifying claimant's adoption expenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(3): A qualifying claimant may carry forward, to the next three taxable years, the amount of any tax credit that exceeds the qualifying claimant's tax liability for the taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(4): A qualifying claimant may not claim a credit under this section to the extent that the qualifying claimant claims a federal tax credit under 26 U.S.C. Sec. 23 for the same adoption expense.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1046(5): A qualifying claimant who is married may claim a tax credit under this section only if the qualifying claimant and the qualifying claimant's spouse file a joint federal income tax return.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047 Nonrefundable child tax credit.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1): 59-10-1018; 59-10-1018; (1)(d)(i); 59-10-114; (1)(d)(i) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(a): 59-10-1018 "Joint filing status" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(b): 59-10-1018 "Head of household filing status" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(c): "Married filing separately status" means a married individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(c)(i): does not file a single federal individual income tax return jointly with that married individual's spouse for the taxable year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(c)(ii): files a single federal individual income tax return for the taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(d): (1)(d)(i); 59-10-114; (1)(d)(i) "Modified adjusted gross income" means the sum of the following for a claimant or, if the claimant's federal individual income tax return is allowed a joint filing status, the claimant and the claimant's spouse:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(d)(i): adjusted gross income for the taxable year for which a tax credit is claimed under this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(d)(ii): (1)(d)(i) any interest income that is not included in adjusted gross income for the taxable year described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(d)(iii): 59-10-114; (1)(d)(i) any addition to adjusted gross income required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(e): "Qualifying child" means an individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(e)(i): with respect to whom the claimant is allowed to claim a tax credit under Section 24, Internal Revenue Code, on the claimant's federal individual income tax return for the taxable year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(e)(ii): who is at least one year old and younger than four years old on the last day of the claimant's taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(f): "Single filing status" means a single individual who files a single federal individual income tax return for the taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(2): 59-10-1002.2 Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(3): A claimant may not carry forward or carry back the amount of the tax credit that exceeds the claimant's tax liability.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(4): (2) The tax credit allowed by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(4)(a): for a federal individual income tax return that is allowed a married filing separately status, $27,000;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(4)(b): for a federal individual income tax return that is allowed a single filing status or head of household filing status, $43,000; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(4)(c): for a federal individual income tax return under this chapter that is allowed a joint filing status, $54,000.

----------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(b): 59-10-1018 "Head of household filing status" means the same as that term is defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(d): 59-10-114 "Modified adjusted gross income" means the sum of the following for a claimant or, if the claimant's federal individual income tax return is allowed a joint filing status, the claimant and the claimant's spouse:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(d)(i): adjusted gross income for the taxable year for which a tax credit is claimed under this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(d)(ii): any interest income that is not included in adjusted gross income for the taxable year described in Subsection (1)(d)(i); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(d)(iii): 59-10-114 any addition to adjusted gross income required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(e): "Qualifying child" means an individual:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(e)(ii): who is at least one year old and younger than five years old on the last day of the claimant's taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(1)(f): "Single filing status" means a single individual who files a single federal individual income tax return for the taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(2): 59-10-1002.2 Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(3): A claimant may not carry forward or carry back the amount of the tax credit that exceeds the claimant's tax liability.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(4): The tax credit allowed by Subsection (2) claimed on a return filed under this part shall be reduced by $.10 for each dollar by which modified adjusted gross income for purposes of the return exceeds:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(4)(a): for a federal individual income tax return that is allowed a married filing separately status, $27,000;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(4)(b): for a federal individual income tax return that is allowed a single filing status or head of household filing status, $43,000; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1047(4)(c): for a federal individual income tax return that is allowed a joint filing status, $54,000.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Refundable Tax Credit Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1102(1): (1)(b); 59-10-1103(1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1102(1)(a): (1)(b); 59-10-1103(1)(a) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1102(1)(b): "Claimant" does not include an estate or trust.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1102(2): 59-10-1103(1)(a) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1102(3): "Refundable tax credit" or "tax credit" means a tax credit that a claimant, estate, or trust may claim:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1102(3)(a): as provided by statute; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1102(3)(b): regardless of whether the claimant, estate, or trust has a tax liability under this chapter for a taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1102(4): 59-10-1103(1)(a) Except as provided in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1102.1 Apportionment of tax credit.
---------------------------------------------------------------
A nonresident individual or a part-year resident individual who claims a tax credit in accordance with SectionUtah Code Annotated § 59-10-1102.1(1): the state income tax percentage for the nonresident individual or the state income tax percentage for the part-year resident individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1102.1(2): the amount of the tax credit that the nonresident individual or the part-year resident individual would have been allowed to claim but for the apportionment requirement of this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1105 Tax credit for hand tools used in farming operations -- Procedures for refund -- Transfers from General Fund to Income Tax Fund -- Rulemaking authority.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1105(1): Chapter 12, Sales and Use Tax Act; (1)(c)(i) For a taxable year beginning on or after January 1, 2004, a claimant, estate, or trust may claim a refundable tax credit:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1105(1)(a): as provided in this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1105(1)(b): against taxes otherwise due under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1105(1)(c): Chapter 12, Sales and Use Tax Act; (1)(c)(i) in an amount equal to the amount of tax the claimant, estate, or trust pays:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1105(1)(c)(i): on a purchase of a hand tool:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1105(1)(c)(i)(A): if the purchase is made on or after July 1, 2004;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1105(1)(c)(i)(B): if the hand tool is used or consumed primarily and directly in a farming operation in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1105(1)(c)(i)(C): if the unit purchase price of the hand tool is more than $250; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1105(1)(c)(ii): Chapter 12, Sales and Use Tax Act; (1)(c)(i) under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1105(2): Chapter 12, Sales and Use Tax Act; (1)(c)(i); (2)(a)(i); (ii) A claimant, estate, or trust:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1105(2)(a): Chapter 12, Sales and Use Tax Act; (1)(c)(i); (2)(a)(i); (ii) shall retain the following to establish the amount of tax the claimant, estate, or trust paid under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1105(2)(a)(i): a receipt;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1105(2)(a)(ii): an invoice; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1105(2)(a)(iii): (2)(a)(i); (ii) a document similar to a document described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1105(2)(b): may not carry forward or carry back a tax credit under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1105(3): (3)(b); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (3)(a)(i); (3)(a)(ii)

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1105(3)(a)(ii): the Division of Finance shall transfer at least annually from the General Fund into the Income Tax Fund an amount equal to the aggregate amount of all tax credits claimed under this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106 Refundable clean energy systems tax credits -- Definitions -- Certification -- Rulemaking authority.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(1): 59-10-1014; 59-10-1014; 59-7-614; 59-7-614; 59-7-614; 59-10-1014; 59-10-1014; 59-10-1014; 59-10-1014; 59-10-1014; 59-7-614; 79-6-401; 59-10-1014; 59-10-1014; 59-10-1014 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(1)(a): 59-10-1014 "Active solar system" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(1)(b): 59-10-1014 "Biomass system" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(1)(c): 59-7-614 "Commercial energy system" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(1)(d): 59-7-614 "Commercial enterprise" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(1)(e): 59-7-614 "Commercial unit" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(1)(f): 59-10-1014 "Direct use geothermal system" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(1)(g): 59-10-1014 "Geothermal electricity" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(1)(h): 59-10-1014 "Geothermal energy" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(1)(i): 59-10-1014 "Geothermal heat pump system" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(1)(j): 59-10-1014 "Hydroenergy system" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(1)(k): 59-7-614 "Hydrogen production system" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(1)(l): 79-6-401 "Office" means the Office of Energy Development created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(1)(m): 59-10-1014 "Passive solar system" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(1)(n): 59-10-1014 "Principal recovery portion" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(1)(o): 59-10-1014 "Wind system" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(2): A claimant, estate, or trust may claim an energy system tax credit as provided in this section against a tax due under this chapter for a taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3)(a): Subject to the other provisions of this Subsection (3), a claimant, estate, or trust may claim a refundable tax credit under this Subsection (3) with respect to a commercial energy system if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3)(a)(i): the commercial energy system does not use:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3)(a)(i)(A): wind, geothermal electricity, solar, or biomass equipment capable of producing a total of 660 or more kilowatts of electricity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3)(a)(i)(B): solar equipment capable of producing 2,000 or more kilowatts of electricity;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3)(a)(ii): the claimant, estate, or trust purchases or participates in the financing of the commercial energy system;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3)(a)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3)(a)(iii)(A): the commercial energy system supplies all or part of the energy required by commercial units owned or used by the claimant, estate, or trust; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3)(a)(iii)(B): the claimant, estate, or trust sells all or part of the energy produced by the commercial energy system as a commercial enterprise;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3)(a)(iv): the claimant, estate, or trust has not claimed and will not claim a tax credit under Subsection (6) for hydrogen production using electricity for which the claimant, estate, or trust claims a tax credit under this Subsection (3); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3)(a)(v): the claimant, estate, or trust obtains a written certification from the office in accordance with Subsection (7).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3)(b)(i): Subject to Subsections (3)(b)(ii) through (iv), the tax credit is equal to 10% of the reasonable costs of the commercial energy system.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3)(b)(ii): A tax credit under this Subsection (3) may include installation costs.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3)(b)(iii): A claimant, estate, or trust is eligible to claim a tax credit under this Subsection (3) for the taxable year in which the commercial energy system is completed and placed in service.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3)(b)(iv): The total amount of tax credit a claimant, estate, or trust may claim under this Subsection (3) may not exceed $50,000 per commercial unit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3)(c)(i): Subject to Subsections (3)(c)(ii) and (iii), a claimant, estate, or trust that is a lessee of a commercial energy system installed on a commercial unit may claim a tax credit under this Subsection (3) if the claimant, estate, or trust confirms that the lessor irrevocably elects not to claim the tax credit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3)(c)(ii): A claimant, estate, or trust described in Subsection (3)(c)(i) may claim as a tax credit under this Subsection (3) only the principal recovery portion of the lease payments.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(3)(c)(iii): A claimant, estate, or trust described in Subsection (3)(c)(i) may claim a tax credit under this Subsection (3) for a period that does not exceed seven taxable years after the day on which the lease begins, as stated in the lease agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(4)(a): Subject to the other provisions of this Subsection (4), a claimant, estate, or trust may claim a refundable tax credit under this Subsection (4) with respect to a commercial energy system if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(4)(a)(i): the commercial energy system uses wind, geothermal electricity, or biomass equipment capable of producing a total of 660 or more kilowatts of electricity;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(4)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(4)(a)(ii)(A): the commercial energy system supplies all or part of the energy required by commercial units owned or used by the claimant, estate, or trust; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(4)(a)(ii)(B): the claimant, estate, or trust sells all or part of the energy produced by the commercial energy system as a commercial enterprise;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(4)(a)(iii): the claimant, estate, or trust has not claimed and will not claim a tax credit under Subsection (6) for hydrogen production using electricity for which the claimant, estate, or trust claims a tax credit under this Subsection (4); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(4)(a)(iv): the claimant, estate, or trust obtains a written certification from the office in accordance with Subsection (7).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(4)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(4)(b)(i): Subject to Subsection (4)(b)(ii), a tax credit under this Subsection (4) is equal to the product of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(4)(b)(i)(A): 0.35 cents; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(4)(b)(i)(B): the kilowatt hours of electricity produced and used or sold during the taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(4)(b)(ii): A claimant, estate, or trust is eligible to claim a tax credit under this Subsection (4) for production occurring during a period of 48 months beginning with the month in which the commercial energy system is placed in commercial service.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(4)(c): A claimant, estate, or trust that is a lessee of a commercial energy system installed on a commercial unit may claim a tax credit under this Subsection (4) if the claimant, estate, or trust confirms that the lessor irrevocably elects not to claim the tax credit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(5)(a): Subject to the other provisions of this Subsection (5), a claimant, estate, or trust may claim a refundable tax credit as provided in this Subsection (5) if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(5)(a)(i): the claimant, estate, or trust owns a commercial energy system that uses solar equipment capable of producing a total of 660 or more kilowatts of electricity;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(5)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(5)(a)(ii)(A): the commercial energy system supplies all or part of the energy required by commercial units owned or used by the claimant, estate, or trust; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(5)(a)(ii)(B): the claimant, estate, or trust sells all or part of the energy produced by the commercial energy system as a commercial enterprise;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(5)(a)(iii): the claimant, estate, or trust does not claim a tax credit under Subsection (3);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(5)(a)(iv): the claimant, estate, or trust has not claimed and will not claim a tax credit under Subsection (6) for hydrogen production using electricity for which a taxpayer claims a tax credit under this Subsection (5); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(5)(a)(v): the claimant, estate, or trust obtains a written certification from the office in accordance with Subsection (7).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(5)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(5)(b)(i): Subject to Subsection (5)(b)(ii), a tax credit under this Subsection (5) is equal to the product of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(5)(b)(i)(A): 0.35 cents; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(5)(b)(i)(B): the kilowatt hours of electricity produced and used or sold during the taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(5)(b)(ii): A claimant, estate, or trust is eligible to claim a tax credit under this Subsection (5) for production occurring during a period of 48 months beginning with the month in which the commercial energy system is placed in commercial service.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(5)(c): A claimant, estate, or trust that is a lessee of a commercial energy system installed on a commercial unit may claim a tax credit under this Subsection (5) if the claimant, estate, or trust confirms that the lessor irrevocably elects not to claim the tax credit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(6)(a): A claimant, estate, or trust may claim a refundable tax credit as provided in this Subsection (6) if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(6)(a)(i): the claimant, estate, or trust owns a hydrogen production system;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(6)(a)(ii): the hydrogen production system is completed and placed in service on or after January 1, 2022;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(6)(a)(iii): the claimant, estate, or trust sells as a commercial enterprise, or supplies for the claimant's, estate's, or trust's own use in commercial units, the hydrogen produced from the hydrogen production system;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(6)(a)(iv): the claimant, estate, or trust has not claimed and will not claim a tax credit under Subsection (3), (4), or (5) for electricity used to meet the requirements of this Subsection (6); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(6)(a)(v): the claimant, estate, or trust obtains a written certification from the office in accordance with Subsection (7).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(6)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(6)(b)(i): Subject to Subsections (6)(b)(ii) and (iii), a tax credit under this Subsection (6) is equal to the product of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(6)(b)(i)(A): $0.12; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(6)(b)(i)(B): the number of kilograms of hydrogen produced during the taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(6)(b)(ii): A claimant, estate, or trust may not receive a tax credit under this Subsection (6) for more than 5,600 metric tons of hydrogen per taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(6)(b)(iii): A claimant, estate, or trust is eligible to claim a tax credit under this Subsection (6) for production occurring during a period of 48 months beginning with the month in which the hydrogen production system is placed in commercial service.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(7): 59-1-1406
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(7)(a): Before a claimant, estate, or trust may claim a tax credit under this section, the claimant, estate, or trust shall obtain a written certification from the office.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(7)(b): The office shall issue a claimant, estate, or trust a written certification if the office determines that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(7)(b)(i): the claimant, estate, or trust meets the requirements of this section to receive a tax credit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(7)(b)(ii): the commercial energy system or the hydrogen production system with respect to which the claimant, estate, or trust seeks to claim a tax credit:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(7)(b)(ii)(A): has been completely installed;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(7)(b)(ii)(B): is a viable system for saving or producing energy from clean resources; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(7)(b)(ii)(C): is safe, reliable, efficient, and technically feasible to ensure that the commercial energy system or the hydrogen production system uses the state's clean and nonrenewable resources in an appropriate and economic manner.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(7)(c): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the office may make rules:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(7)(c)(i): for determining whether a commercial energy system or a hydrogen production system meets the requirements of Subsection (7)(b)(ii); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(7)(c)(ii): for purposes of a tax credit under Subsection (3), establishing the reasonable costs of a commercial energy system, as an amount per unit of energy production.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(7)(d): 59-1-1406 A claimant, estate, or trust that obtains a written certification from the office shall retain the certification for the same time period a person is required to keep books and records under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(7)(e): The office shall submit to the commission an electronic list that includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(7)(e)(i): the name and identifying information of each claimant, estate, or trust to which the office issues a written certification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(7)(e)(ii): for each claimant, estate, or trust:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(7)(e)(ii)(A): the amount of the tax credit listed on the written certification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(7)(e)(ii)(B): the date the commercial energy system or the hydrogen production system was installed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(8): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission may make rules to address the certification of a tax credit under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(9): A tax credit under this section is in addition to any tax credits provided under the laws or rules and regulations of the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1106(10): 59-10-1024 A purchaser of one or more solar units that claims a tax credit under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1114(1)(d)(i): whose adjusted gross income is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1114(1)(d)(i)(A): for a claimant who files a federal income tax return jointly with the claimant's spouse, less than $55,000; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1114(1)(d)(i)(B): for a claimant who files a federal income tax return other than jointly, less than $27,500;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1114(1)(d)(ii): who did not, and if the claimant is married, whose spouse did not, receive state or federal assistance during the taxable year in which the adoption is finalized; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1114(1)(d)(iii): 35A-1-111 who applies for and receives a certification described in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1114(2)(a): 59-10-1102.1; (2) Subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1114(2)(a)(i): $3,500; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1114(2)(a)(ii): the amount of the qualifying claimant's adoption expenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1114(2)(b): (2)(a) A qualifying claimant who claims the tax credit described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1114(3): A qualifying claimant may not claim a credit under this section to the extent that the qualifying claimant claims a federal tax credit under 26 U.S.C. Sec. 23 for the same adoption expense.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1114(4): A qualifying claimant who is married may claim a tax credit under this section only if the qualifying claimant and the qualifying claimant's spouse file a joint federal income tax return.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1301 Title.
---------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Individual Income Tax Contribution Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1302 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this part, "contribution" means a contribution a resident or nonresident individual makes on an individual income tax return as allowed by this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1303 Contributions -- Amount -- Procedure for designating a contribution -- Joint return -- Contribution irrevocable.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1303(2)(a): is owed an individual income tax refund for the taxable year, the amount of the contribution under this part shall be deducted from the resident or nonresident individual's individual income tax refund; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1303(2)(b): 59-10-1313 is not owed an individual income tax refund for the taxable year, the resident or nonresident individual may remit a contribution under this part with the resident or nonresident individual's individual income tax return, except as provided in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1304(3)(b)(ii)(A): is required to remove the contribution from the individual income tax return; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1304(3)(b)(ii)(B): may not collect the contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1304(3)(b)(iii): (3)(a) state the taxable year for which the removal described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1304(3)(b)(iv): (3) remain available for viewing and searching until the commission publishes a new list in accordance with this Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1311(1)(a)(i): has a liability under this chapter for a taxable year of $2 or more; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1311(1)(a)(ii): files a return under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1311(2)(a): (1) A contribution under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313 Contribution to a Utah Educational Savings Plan account.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313(1): Title 53B, Chapter 8a, Utah Educational Savings Plan
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313(1)(a): Title 53B, Chapter 8a, Utah Educational Savings Plan If a resident or nonresident individual is owed an individual income tax refund for the taxable year, the individual may designate on the resident or nonresident individual's income tax return a contribution to a Utah Educational Savings Plan account established under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313(1)(b): If a resident or nonresident individual is not owed an individual income tax refund for the taxable year, the individual may not designate on the resident or nonresident's individual income tax return a contribution to a Utah Educational Savings Plan account.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313(2): (2)(a); (b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313(2)(a): The commission shall send the contribution to the Utah Educational Savings Plan along with the following information:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313(2)(a)(i): the amount of the individual income tax refund; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313(2)(a)(ii): the taxpayer's:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313(2)(a)(ii)(A): name;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313(2)(a)(ii)(B): Social Security number or taxpayer identification number; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313(2)(a)(ii)(C): address.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313(2)(b): The commission shall provide the taxpayer's telephone number and number of dependents claimed, as requested, to the Utah Educational Savings Plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313(2)(c): (2)(a); (b) If a contribution to a Utah Educational Savings Plan account is designated in a single individual income tax return filed jointly by a husband and wife, the commission shall send the information described under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313(3)(a): If the taxpayer owns a Utah Educational Savings Plan account, the Utah Educational Savings Plan shall deposit the contribution into the account.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313(3)(b): If the taxpayer owns more than one Utah Educational Savings Plan account, the Utah Educational Savings Plan shall allocate the contribution among the accounts in equal amounts.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313(3)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313(3)(c)(i): If the taxpayer does not own a Utah Educational Savings Plan account, the Utah Educational Savings Plan shall send the taxpayer an account agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313(3)(c)(ii): If the taxpayer does not sign and return the account agreement by the date specified by the Utah Educational Savings Plan, the Utah Educational Savings Plan shall return the contribution to the taxpayer without any interest or earnings.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1313(4): 59-1-402 For the purpose of determining interest on an overpayment or refund under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1319 Contribution to Clean Air Fund.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1319(1): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1319(1)(a): There is created an expendable special revenue fund known as the "Clean Air Fund."
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1319(1)(b): (2) The fund shall consist of all amounts deposited into the fund in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1319(2): 59-10-1304; (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1319(2)(a): 59-10-1304; (3) Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1319(2)(a)(i): deposited into the Clean Air Fund; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1319(2)(a)(ii): (3) expended as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1319(2)(b): The fund shall also consist of amounts deposited into the fund through:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1319(2)(b)(i): private contributions; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1319(2)(b)(ii): donations or grants from public or private entities.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1319(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1319(3)(a): At least once each year, the commission shall disburse from the Clean Air Fund all money deposited into the fund since the last disbursement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1319(3)(b): (3)(a) The commission shall disburse money under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1319(3)(b)(i): providing money for grants to individuals or organizations in the state to fund activities intended to improve air quality in the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1319(3)(b)(ii): enhancing programs designed to educate the public about the importance of air quality to the health, well-being, and livelihood of individuals in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1319(3)(b)(iii): pay the costs of issuing or reordering Clean Air Support special group license plate decals.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1401 Title.
---------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Pass-Through Entities and Pass-Through Entity Taxpayers Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(1): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; 59-7-105; 59-7-106; 59-10-114; 59-10-115; 59-10-202; 59-10-209.1 "Addition, subtraction, or adjustment" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(1)(a): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; 59-7-105; 59-7-106 for a pass-through entity taxpayer that is classified as a C corporation for federal income tax purposes, under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(1)(a)(i): 59-7-105 an addition to unadjusted income described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(1)(a)(ii): 59-7-106 a subtraction from unadjusted income described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(1)(b): 59-10-114; 59-10-115 for a pass-through entity taxpayer that is classified as an individual, partnership, or S corporation for federal income tax purposes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(1)(b)(i): 59-10-114 an addition to or subtraction from adjusted gross income described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(1)(b)(ii): 59-10-115 an adjustment to adjusted gross income described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(1)(c): 59-10-202; 59-10-209.1 for a pass-through entity taxpayer that is classified as an estate or a trust for federal income tax purposes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(1)(c)(i): 59-10-202 an addition to or subtraction from unadjusted income described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(1)(c)(ii): 59-10-209.1 an adjustment to unadjusted income described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(2): "Business income" means income arising from transactions and activity in the regular course of a pass-through entity's trade or business and includes income from tangible and intangible property if the acquisition, management, and disposition of the property constitutes integral parts of the pass-through entity's regular trade or business operations.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(3): "C corporation" means the same as that term is defined in Section 1361, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(4): "Commercial domicile" means the principal place from which the trade or business of a business entity is directed or managed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(5): "Dependent beneficiary" means an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(5)(a): is claimed as a dependent under Section 151, Internal Revenue Code, on another person's federal income tax return; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(5)(b): is a beneficiary of a trust that is a pass-through entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(6): Chapter 7, Part 3, Allocation and Apportionment of Income - Utah UDITPA Provisions; 59-10-117; 59-10-118 "Derived from or connected with Utah sources" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(6)(a): Chapter 7, Part 3, Allocation and Apportionment of Income - Utah UDITPA Provisions if a pass-through entity taxpayer is classified as a C corporation for federal income tax purposes, derived from or connected with Utah sources in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(6)(b): 59-10-117; 59-10-118 if a pass-through entity or pass-through entity taxpayer is classified as an estate, individual, partnership, S corporation, or a trust for federal income tax purposes, derived from or connected with Utah sources in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(7)(a): "Final pass-through entity taxpayer" means a pass-through entity taxpayer who is a resident or nonresident individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(7)(b): "Final pass-through entity taxpayer" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(7)(b)(i): a resident or nonresident business entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(7)(b)(ii): a resident or nonresident estate or trust.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(8): "Nonbusiness income" means all income of a pass-through entity other than business income.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(9): "Nonresident business entity" means a business entity that does not have its commercial domicile in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(10): "Nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer" means a pass-through entity taxpayer that is a:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(10)(a): nonresident individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(10)(b): nonresident business entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(11): (11)(a); (c); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Pass-through entity" means a business entity that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(11)(a): the following if classified as a partnership for federal income tax purposes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(11)(a)(i): a general partnership;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(11)(a)(ii): a limited liability company;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(11)(a)(iii): a limited liability partnership; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(11)(a)(iv): a limited partnership;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(11)(b): an S corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(11)(c): an estate or trust with respect to which the estate's or trust's income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit is divided among and passed through to one or more pass-through entity taxpayers; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(11)(d): (11)(a); (c); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act a business entity similar to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(11)(d)(i): with respect to which the business entity's income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit is divided among and passed through to one or more pass-through entity taxpayers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(11)(d)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act as defined by the commission by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(12): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Pass-through entity taxpayer" means a resident or nonresident individual, a resident or nonresident business entity, or a resident or nonresident estate or trust:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(12)(a): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(12)(a)(i): for a general partnership, a partner;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(12)(a)(ii): for a limited liability company, a member;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(12)(a)(iii): for a limited liability partnership, a partner;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(12)(a)(iv): for a limited partnership, a partner;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(12)(a)(v): for an S corporation, a shareholder;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(12)(a)(vi): for an estate or trust described in Subsection(11)(c), a beneficiary; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(12)(a)(vii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act for a business entity described in Subsection(11)(d), a member, partner, shareholder, or other title designated by the commission by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(12)(b): to which the income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit of a pass-through entity is passed through.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(13): "Resident business entity" means a business entity that is not a nonresident business entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(14): "Resident pass-through entity taxpayer" means a pass-through entity taxpayer that is a:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(14)(a): resident individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(14)(b): resident business entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(15): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes "Return" means a return that a pass-through entity taxpayer files:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(15)(a): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes for a pass-through entity taxpayer that is classified as a C corporation for federal income tax purposes, under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(15)(b): for a pass-through entity taxpayer that is classified as an estate, individual, partnership, S corporation, or a trust for federal income tax purposes, under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(16): "S corporation" means the same as that term is defined in Section 1361, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(17): "Share of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit of a pass-through entity" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(17)(a): for a pass-through entity except for a pass-through entity that is an S corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(17)(a)(i): for a resident pass-through entity taxpayer, the resident pass-through entity taxpayer's distributive share of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit of the pass-through entity as determined under Section 704 et seq., Internal Revenue Code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(17)(a)(ii): for a nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer, the nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer's distributive share of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit of the pass-through entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(17)(a)(ii)(A): as determined under Section 704 et seq., Internal Revenue Code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(17)(a)(ii)(B): derived from or connected with Utah sources; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(17)(b): for an S corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(17)(b)(i): for a resident pass-through entity taxpayer, the resident pass-through entity taxpayer's pro rata share of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit of the S corporation, as determined under Sec. 1366 et seq., Internal Revenue Code; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(17)(b)(ii): for a nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer, the nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer's pro rata share of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit of the S corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(17)(b)(ii)(A): as determined under Section 1366 et seq., Internal Revenue Code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(17)(b)(ii)(B): derived from or connected with Utah sources.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(18): "Statement of dependent beneficiary income" means a statement:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(18)(a): signed by the person who claims a dependent beneficiary as a dependent under Section 151, Internal Revenue Code, on the person's federal income tax return for the taxable year;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(18)(b): attesting that the dependent is a dependent beneficiary; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(18)(c): indicating that the person expects that the dependent beneficiary's adjusted gross income for the taxable year will not exceed the basic standard deduction for the dependent beneficiary, as calculated under Section 63, Internal Revenue Code, for that taxable year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(19): "Voluntary taxable income" means the sum of a pass-through entity's income that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(19)(a): attributed to a final pass-through entity taxpayer who is a resident individual unless the income is taxed by another state of the United States, the District of Columbia, or possession of the United States; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(19)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(19)(b)(i): business income and nonbusiness income that is derived from or connected with Utah sources; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1402(19)(b)(ii): attributed to a final pass-through entity taxpayer who is a nonresident individual.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403 Income tax treatment of a pass-through entity -- Returns -- Classification same as under Internal Revenue Code.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403(1): 59-10-1403.2 Subject to Subsection (3) and except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403(2): 59-10-1403.3 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403(3): 59-10-507; 59-10-514; 59-10-516 A pass-through entity is subject to the return filing requirements of Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403(4): For purposes of taxation under this title, a pass-through entity that transacts business in the state shall be classified in the same manner as the pass-through entity is classified for federal income tax purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403(5)(a): If a change is made in a pass-through entity's net income or loss on the pass-through entity's federal income tax return because of an action of the federal government, the pass-through entity shall file with the commission within 90 days after the date of a final determination of the action:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403(5)(a)(i): a copy of the pass-through entity's amended federal income tax return or federal adjustment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403(5)(a)(ii): an amended state income tax return that conforms with the changes made in the pass-through entity's amended federal income tax return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403(5)(b): If a change is made in a pass-through entity's net income on the pass-through entity's federal income tax return because the pass-through entity files an amended federal income tax return, the pass-through entity shall file with the commission, within 90 days after the date the taxpayer files the amended federal income tax return:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403(5)(b)(i): a copy of the pass-through entity's amended federal income tax return; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403(5)(b)(ii): an amended state income tax return that conforms with the changes made in the pass-through entity's amended federal income tax return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403(6)(a): A pass-through entity subject to the return filing requirements under Subsection (3), shall report on the pass-through entity's return:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403(6)(a)(i): whether the entity has filed a current annual report with the Division of Corporations; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403(6)(a)(ii): the entity's commerce entity number.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403(6)(b): Subsection (6)(a) does not apply to an individual, estate, or trust.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.1 Income tax treatment of a pass-through entity taxpayer -- Return filing requirements.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.1(1): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes Subject to the other provisions of this part, a pass-through entity taxpayer is subject to taxation:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.1(1)(a): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes for a pass-through entity taxpayer that is classified as a C corporation for federal income tax purposes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.1(1)(a)(i): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes if that pass-through entity taxpayer is a resident pass-through entity taxpayer, as a domestic corporation is taxed under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.1(1)(a)(ii): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes if that pass-through entity taxpayer is a nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer, as a foreign corporation is taxed under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.1(1)(b): for a pass-through entity taxpayer that is classified as an estate, individual, partnership, S corporation, or a trust for federal income tax purposes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.1(1)(b)(i): if that pass-through entity taxpayer is a resident pass-through entity taxpayer, as a resident estate, resident individual, resident partnership, resident S corporation, or resident trust is taxed under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.1(1)(b)(ii): if that pass-through entity taxpayer is a nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer, as a nonresident estate, nonresident individual, nonresident partnership, nonresident S corporation, or nonresident trust is taxed under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.1(2): A pass-through entity taxpayer is subject to taxation on the pass-through entity taxpayer's share of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit of the pass-through entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.1(3): (3)(b)(iii); Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; (3)(b)(ii); (3)(b)(iii); (iv); Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; 59-7-101; 59-10-103; Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; 59-10-1403.2; 59-7-104; 59-7-101; (3); Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 59-10-1403.2
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.1(3)(a): (3)(b)(iii); Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.1(3)(a)(i): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes if the resident pass-through entity taxpayer is classified as a C corporation for federal income tax purposes, as a domestic corporation under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.1(3)(a)(ii): if the resident pass-through entity taxpayer is classified as an estate, individual, partnership, S corporation, or a trust for federal income tax purposes, as a resident estate, resident individual, resident partnership, resident S corporation, or resident trust under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3 Refund of amounts paid or withheld for a pass-through entity.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(1): 59-10-104(2); 59-10-1403.2(1)(a)(i) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(1)(a): "Committee" means the Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(1)(b): 59-10-104(2); 59-10-1403.2(1)(a)(i) "Qualifying excess withholding" means an amount that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(1)(b)(i): is paid or withheld:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(1)(b)(i)(A): by a pass-through entity that has a different taxable year than the pass-through entity that requests a refund under this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(1)(b)(i)(B): on behalf of the pass-through entity that requests the refund, if the pass-through entity that requests the refund also is a pass-through entity taxpayer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(1)(b)(ii): 59-10-104(2); 59-10-1403.2(1)(a)(i) is equal to the difference between:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(1)(b)(ii)(A): the amount paid or withheld for the taxable year on behalf of the pass-through entity that requests the refund; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(1)(b)(ii)(B): 59-10-104(2); 59-10-1403.2(1)(a)(i) the product of the percentage listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(2): For a taxable year ending on or after July 1, 2017, a pass-through entity may claim a refund of qualifying excess withholding, if the amount of the qualifying excess withholding is equal to or greater than $250,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(3): (4) A pass-through entity that requests a refund of qualifying excess withholding under this section shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(3)(a): (4) apply to the commission for a refund on or, subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(3)(b): provide any information that the commission may require to determine that the pass-through entity is eligible to receive the refund.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(4): A pass-through entity shall claim a refund of qualifying excess withholding under this section within 30 days after the earlier of the day on which:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(4)(a): the pass-through entity files an income tax return; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(4)(b): the pass-through entity's income tax return is due, including any extension of due date authorized in statute.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(5): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(6): (2); (6)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(6)(a): (2) On or before November 30, 2018, the committee shall review the $250,000 threshold described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(6)(b): (6)(a) To assist the committee in conducting the review described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(6)(b)(i): the total number of refund requests made under this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(6)(b)(ii): the total costs of any refunds issued under this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(6)(b)(iii): the costs of any audits conducted on refund requests made under this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(6)(b)(iv): an estimation of:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1403.3(6)(b)(iv)(C): the costs of any audits the commission would conduct if the Legislature increases or decreases the threshold.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404 Character of an item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Regardless of whether or how an item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit is characterized for federal income tax purposes, that item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit is from the same source and incurred in the same manner for a pass-through entity taxpayer as if the item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit is:Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404(1): realized directly from the source from which the item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit is realized by the pass-through entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404(2): incurred in the same manner as incurred by the pass-through entity.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404.5 Resident pass-through entity taxpayer's share of an addition, subtraction, or adjustment that relates to an item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit of a pass-through entity.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404.5(1): In determining the taxable income of a resident pass-through entity taxpayer, an addition, subtraction, or adjustment that relates to an item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit of a pass-through entity shall be made in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404.5(2): For a resident pass-through entity taxpayer of a pass-through entity except for a pass-through entity that is an S corporation, the resident pass-through entity taxpayer's share of an addition, subtraction, or adjustment that relates to an item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404.5(2)(a): if the item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit is required to be taken into account separately for federal income tax purposes, the resident pass-through entity taxpayer's distributive share of the item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404.5(2)(a)(i): for federal income tax purposes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404.5(2)(a)(ii): determined under Section 704 et seq., Internal Revenue Code; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404.5(2)(b): if the item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit is not required to be taken into account separately for federal income tax purposes, determined in accordance with the resident pass-through entity taxpayer's distributive share of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404.5(2)(b)(i): relating to the pass-through entity generally;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404.5(2)(b)(ii): for federal income tax purposes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404.5(2)(b)(iii): under Section 704 et seq., Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404.5(3): For a resident pass-through entity taxpayer of a pass-through entity that is an S corporation, the resident pass-through entity taxpayer's share of an addition, subtraction, or adjustment that relates to an item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404.5(3)(a): if the item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit is required to be taken into account separately for federal income tax purposes, the resident pass-through entity taxpayer's pro rata share of the item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404.5(3)(a)(i): for federal income tax purposes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404.5(3)(a)(ii): determined under Section 1366 et seq., Internal Revenue Code; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404.5(3)(b): if the item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit is not required to be taken into account separately for federal income tax purposes, determined in accordance with the resident pass-through entity taxpayer's pro rata share of the item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404.5(3)(b)(i): relating to the pass-through entity generally;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404.5(3)(b)(ii): for federal income tax purposes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1404.5(3)(b)(iii): under Section 1366 et seq., Internal Revenue Code.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405 Nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer's share of an addition, subtraction, or adjustment that relates to an item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit of a pass-through entity -- In determining source of nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer's income certain provisions of pass-through entity agreement may not be considered -- Rulemaking authority.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(1)(b)(i): if the item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit is required to be taken into account separately for federal income tax purposes, the nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer's distributive share of the item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(1)(b)(i)(A): for federal income tax purposes;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(1)(b)(i)(C): derived from or connected with Utah sources; or
