Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(1)(b)(ii)(A): relating to the pass-through entity generally;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(1)(b)(ii)(B): for federal income tax purposes;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(1)(b)(ii)(C): under Section 704 et seq., Internal Revenue Code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(1)(b)(ii)(D): derived from or connected with Utah sources.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(1)(c): For a nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer of a pass-through entity that is an S corporation, the nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer's share of an addition, subtraction, or adjustment that relates to an item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(1)(c)(i): if the item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit is required to be taken into account separately for federal income tax purposes, the nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer's pro rata share of the item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(1)(c)(i)(A): for federal income tax purposes;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(1)(c)(i)(B): determined under Section 1366 et seq., Internal Revenue Code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(1)(c)(i)(C): derived from or connected with Utah sources; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(1)(c)(ii): if the item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit is not required to be taken into account separately for federal income tax purposes, determined in accordance with the nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer's pro rata share of the item of income, gain, loss, deduction, or credit:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(1)(c)(ii)(A): relating to the pass-through entity generally;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(1)(c)(ii)(B): for federal income tax purposes;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(1)(c)(ii)(C): under Section 1366 et seq., Internal Revenue Code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(1)(c)(ii)(D): derived from or connected with Utah sources.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(2): In determining the source of a nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer's income, the following provisions in a pass-through entity agreement may not be considered:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(2)(a): a provision that allocates to the nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer, as income, gain, or credit from a source outside this state, a greater proportion of the nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer's share of income, gain, or credit of the pass-through entity than the ratio of income, gain, or credit of the pass-through entity from sources outside this state to income, gain, or credit of the pass-through entity from all sources; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(2)(b): a provision that allocates to the nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer a greater proportion of an item of loss or deduction of the pass-through entity derived from or connected with Utah sources than the taxpayer's share of loss or deduction generally:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(2)(b)(i): relating to the pass-through entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(2)(b)(ii): for federal income tax purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(3): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1) The commission may by rule, made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(3)(a): the nonresident pass-through entity taxpayer applies to the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-10-1405(3)(b): the commission finds that the use of the calculation is appropriate and equitable.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Chapter 11 - Inheritance Tax Act
*****************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-101 Short title.
--------------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Inheritance Tax Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-102(1): "Decedent" means a deceased natural person.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-102(2): "Federal credit" means the maximum amount of the credit for state death taxes allowed by Section 2011 in respect to a decedent's taxable estate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-102(3): "Gross estate" means "gross estate" as defined in Section 2031, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-102(4): "Nonresident" means a decedent who was domiciled outside of this state at the time of death.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-102(5): "Other state" means any state in the United States other than this state, the District of Columbia, or any possession or territory of the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-102(6): "Person" includes any natural person, corporation, association, partnership, joint venture, syndicate, estate, trust, or other entity under which business or other activities may be conducted.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-102(7): "Personal representative" means the executor, administrator, or trustee of a decedent's estate, or, if there is no executor, administrator, or trustee appointed, qualified, and acting within this state, then any person in actual or constructive possession of any property of the decedent.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-102(8): "Resident" means a decedent who was domiciled in this state at the time of death.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-102(9): "Section 2011" means "Section 2011," Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-102(10): "Taxable estate" means "taxable estate" as defined in Section 2051, Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-102(11): "Transfer" means "transfer" as described in Section 2001, Internal Revenue Code.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-103 Tax on transfer of taxable estate of residents -- Amount -- Credit -- Property of a resident defined.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-103(1): (2) A tax in the amount of the federal credit is imposed on the transfer of the taxable estate of every resident, subject to the credit provided for in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-103(2): If any property of a resident is subject to a death tax imposed by another state for which a credit is allowed under Section 2011, and if the tax imposed by the other state is not qualified by a reciprocal provision allowing the property to be taxed in this state, the amount of tax due under this section shall be credited with the lesser of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-103(2)(a): the amount of the death tax paid the other state and credited against the federal estate tax; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-103(2)(b): an amount computed by multiplying the federal credit by a fraction, the numerator of which is the value of the property subject to the death tax imposed by the other state and the denominator of which is the value of the decedent's gross estate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-103(3): Property of a resident includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-103(3)(a): real property located in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-103(3)(b): tangible personal property having actual situs in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-103(3)(c): intangible personal property owned by the resident regardless of where it is located.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-104 Tax on transfer of taxable estate of nonresidents -- Amount -- Property of a nonresident defined -- Exemptions.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-104(1): A tax is imposed on the transfer of the taxable estate located in this state of every nonresident.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-104(2): The tax is the amount computed by multiplying the federal credit by a fraction, the numerator of which is the value of the property located in this state and the denominator of which is the value of the decedent's gross estate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-104(3): The property located in this state of a nonresident includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-104(3)(a): real property and real property interests located in this state including mineral interests, royalties, production payments, leasehold interests, or working interests in oil, gas, or any other minerals;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-104(3)(b): tangible personal property having actual situs in this state, including money;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-104(3)(c): intangible personal property having a trade or business situs in this state, including deposits in banks, negotiable instruments, debts, receivables, shares of stock, bonds, notes, evidences of an interest in property, evidences of debt, and choses in action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-104(3)(d): the securities of any corporation or other entity organized under the laws of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-104(4): (3)(c); (3)(d) The transfer of the property described in Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-105 Tax returns -- Date to be filed -- Extensions -- Maximum time allowed.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-105(1): The personal representative of every estate subject to the tax imposed by this chapter who is required by the laws of the United States to file a federal estate tax return shall file with the commission on or before the date the federal estate tax return is required to be filed:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-105(1)(a): a return for the tax due under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-105(1)(b): a copy of the federal estate tax return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-105(2): (1) If the personal representative has obtained an extension of time for filing the federal estate tax return, the filing required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-105(3): (2); (1) In addition to the extension of time for filing the return for the tax due under this chapter provided for under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-106 Payment date -- Extensions.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-106(1): 59-11-105 The tax due under this chapter shall be paid by the personal representative to the commission not later than the date when the return covering this tax is required to be filed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-106(2): When an estate has obtained an extension for payment of federal estate taxes, the commission shall extend the time for payment of the tax due under this chapter for the same period of time.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-109 Deposit of money collected -- Refund of overpayments -- Limitation.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-109(1): 51-4-1 All money collected by the commission under this chapter shall be deposited as provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-109(2): 59-1-402; (1) If the commission determines that a personal representative has overpaid the tax due under this chapter, the commission is authorized to refund the amount of the overpayment together with interest at the rate and in the manner prescribed under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-110 Tax as lien -- Instruments issued upon payment -- Certificate of transfer.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-110(1): 59-1-401; 59-1-402 The tax provided for in this chapter, together with applicable interest and penalties as provided in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-110(2): Upon payment of the tax, together with applicable interest and penalties, the commission shall issue to the personal representative a receipt reflecting this payment, a certificate of transfer, and any other appropriate instruments reflecting this payment.  If the property is not of sufficient value for a tax under this chapter to be imposed, the commission upon adequate showing to that effect shall issue a certificate of transfer and any other appropriate instruments indicating that no tax is due.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-111 Personal representative -- Payment of tax -- Sale of property -- Liability.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-111(1): The personal representative has the duty to pay the tax, together with applicable interest and penalties, imposed on property under this chapter.  The personal representative may sell so much of the property regardless of whether any portion of the property is included in a specific bequest or devise, as is necessary to pay the proportionate amount of the tax due under this chapter, together with applicable interest and penalties, and the fees and expenses of the sale, unless the legatee or devisee pays the personal representative the proportionate part of the tax due.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-111(2): Any personal representative who distributes any portion of the property without first paying the tax imposed by this chapter on that property, including applicable interest and penalties, or having another make the payment, is personally liable for the tax, including applicable interest and penalties, to the extent of the value of that portion of the property that is, or has come into, the possession of that personal representative.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-11-112 Personal representative -- Final account -- Approval by commission.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
No final account of a personal representative in any probate proceeding who is required to file a federal estate tax return may be allowed and approved by the court before whom the proceeding is pending unless it is shown by evidence satisfactory to the commission, and the court finds, that the tax imposed on the property by this chapter, including applicable interest and penalties, has been paid in full or that no tax is due.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Chapter 12 - Sales and Use Tax Act
*******************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-101 Short title.
--------------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Sales and Use Tax Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(1): "800 service" means a telecommunications service that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(1)(a): allows a caller to dial a toll-free number without incurring a charge for the call; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(1)(b): is typically marketed:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(1)(b)(i): under the name 800 toll-free calling;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(1)(b)(ii): under the name 855 toll-free calling;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(1)(b)(iii): under the name 866 toll-free calling;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(1)(b)(iv): under the name 877 toll-free calling;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(1)(b)(v): under the name 888 toll-free calling; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(1)(b)(vi): under a name similar to Subsections (1)(b)(i) through (v) as designated by the Federal Communications Commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(2)(a): "900 service" means an inbound toll telecommunications service that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(2)(a)(i): a subscriber purchases;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(2)(a)(ii): allows a customer of the subscriber described in Subsection (2)(a)(i) to call in to the subscriber's:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(2)(a)(ii)(A): prerecorded announcement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(2)(a)(ii)(B): live service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(2)(a)(iii): is typically marketed:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(2)(a)(iii)(A): under the name 900 service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(2)(a)(iii)(B): under a name similar to Subsection (2)(a)(iii)(A) as designated by the Federal Communications Commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(2)(b): "900 service" does not include a charge for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(2)(b)(i): a collection service a seller of a telecommunications service provides to a subscriber; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(2)(b)(ii): the following a subscriber sells to the subscriber's customer:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(2)(b)(ii)(A): a product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(2)(b)(ii)(B): a service.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(3): 59-12-103
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(3)(a): "Admission or user fees" includes season passes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(3)(b): 59-12-103 "Admission or user fees" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(3)(b)(i): annual membership dues to private organizations; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(3)(b)(ii): 59-12-103 a lesson, including a lesson that involves as part of the lesson equipment or a facility listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(4): "Affiliate" or "affiliated person" means a person that, with respect to another person:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(4)(a): has an ownership interest of more than 5%, whether direct or indirect, in that other person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(4)(b): is related to the other person because a third person, or a group of third persons who are affiliated persons with respect to each other, holds an ownership interest of more than 5%, whether direct or indirect, in the related persons.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(5): "Agreement" means the Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement adopted on November 12, 2002, including amendments made to the Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement after November 12, 2002.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(6): "Agreement combined tax rate" means the sum of the tax rates:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(6)(a): listed under Subsection (7); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(6)(b): that are imposed within a local taxing jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(7): 59-12-103; 59-12-103; 59-12-103; 59-12-103; 59-12-103; 59-12-204; 59-12-401; 59-12-402; 59-12-402.1; 59-12-703; 59-12-802; 59-12-804; 59-12-1102; 59-12-1302; 59-12-1402; 59-12-1802; 59-12-2003; 59-12-2103; 59-12-2213; 59-12-2214; 59-12-2215; 59-12-2216; 59-12-2217; 59-12-2218; 59-12-2219; 59-12-2220 "Agreement sales and use tax" means a tax imposed under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(7)(a): 59-12-103 Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(7)(b): 59-12-103 Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(9): 59-2-102; 59-7-101 "Aircraft maintenance, repair, and overhaul provider" means a business entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(9)(a): 59-2-102; 59-7-101 except for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(9)(a)(i): 59-2-102 an airline as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(9)(a)(ii): 59-7-101 an affiliated group, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(9)(b): that has the workers, expertise, and facilities to perform the following, regardless of whether the business entity performs the following in this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(9)(b)(i): check, diagnose, overhaul, and repair:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(9)(b)(i)(A): an onboard system of a fixed wing turbine powered aircraft; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(9)(b)(i)(B): the parts that comprise an onboard system of a fixed wing turbine powered aircraft;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(9)(b)(ii): assemble, change, dismantle, inspect, and test a fixed wing turbine powered aircraft engine;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(9)(b)(iii): perform at least the following maintenance on a fixed wing turbine powered aircraft:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(9)(b)(iii)(A): an inspection;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(9)(b)(iii)(B): a repair, including a structural repair or modification;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(9)(b)(iii)(C): changing landing gear; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(9)(b)(iii)(D): addressing issues related to an aging fixed wing turbine powered aircraft;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(9)(b)(iv): completely remove the existing paint of a fixed wing turbine powered aircraft and completely apply new paint to the fixed wing turbine powered aircraft; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(9)(b)(v): refurbish the interior of a fixed wing turbine powered aircraft in a manner that results in a change in the fixed wing turbine powered aircraft's certification requirements by the authority that certifies the fixed wing turbine powered aircraft.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(10): "Alcoholic beverage" means a beverage that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(10)(a): is suitable for human consumption; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(10)(b): contains .5% or more alcohol by volume.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(11): "Alternative energy" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(11)(a): biomass energy;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(11)(b): geothermal energy;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(11)(c): hydroelectric energy;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(11)(d): solar energy;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(11)(e): wind energy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(11)(f): energy that is derived from:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(11)(f)(i): coal-to-liquids;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(11)(f)(ii): nuclear fuel;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(11)(f)(iii): oil-impregnated diatomaceous earth;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(11)(f)(iv): oil sands;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(11)(f)(v): oil shale;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(11)(f)(vi): petroleum coke; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(11)(f)(vii): waste heat from:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(11)(f)(vii)(A): an industrial facility; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(11)(f)(vii)(B): a power station in which an electric generator is driven through a process in which water is heated, turns into steam, and spins a steam turbine.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(12): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(12)(a): Subject to Subsection (12)(b), "alternative energy electricity production facility" means a facility that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(12)(a)(i): uses alternative energy to produce electricity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(12)(a)(ii): has a production capacity of two megawatts or greater.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(12)(b): A facility is an alternative energy electricity production facility regardless of whether the facility is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(12)(b)(i): connected to an electric grid; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(12)(b)(ii): located on the premises of an electricity consumer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(13): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(13)(a): "Ancillary service" means a service associated with, or incidental to, the provision of telecommunications service.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(13)(b): "Ancillary service" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(13)(b)(i): a conference bridging service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(13)(b)(ii): a detailed communications billing service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(13)(b)(iii): directory assistance;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(13)(b)(iv): a vertical service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(13)(b)(v): a voice mail service.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(14): 26B-6-101 "Area agency on aging" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(15): "Assisted amusement device" means an amusement device, skill device, or ride device that is started and stopped by an individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(15)(a): who is not the purchaser or renter of the right to use or operate the amusement device, skill device, or ride device; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(15)(b): at the direction of the seller of the right to use the amusement device, skill device, or ride device.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(16): "Assisted cleaning or washing of tangible personal property" means cleaning or washing of tangible personal property if the cleaning or washing labor is primarily performed by an individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(16)(a): who is not the purchaser of the cleaning or washing of the tangible personal property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(16)(b): at the direction of the seller of the cleaning or washing of the tangible personal property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(17): "Authorized carrier" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(17)(a): in the case of vehicles operated over public highways, the holder of credentials indicating that the vehicle is or will be operated pursuant to both the International Registration Plan and the International Fuel Tax Agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(17)(b): in the case of aircraft, the holder of a Federal Aviation Administration operating certificate or air carrier's operating certificate; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(17)(c): in the case of locomotives, freight cars, railroad work equipment, or other rolling stock, a person who uses locomotives, freight cars, railroad work equipment, or other rolling stock in more than one state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(18): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(18)(a): "Biomass energy" means any of the following that is used as the primary source of energy to produce fuel or electricity:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(18)(a)(i): material from a plant or tree; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(18)(a)(ii): other organic matter that is available on a renewable basis, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(18)(a)(ii)(A): slash and brush from forests and woodlands;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(18)(a)(ii)(B): animal waste;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(18)(a)(ii)(C): waste vegetable oil;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(18)(a)(ii)(D): methane or synthetic gas produced at a landfill, as a byproduct of the treatment of wastewater residuals, or through the conversion of a waste material through a nonincineration, thermal conversion process;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(18)(a)(ii)(E): aquatic plants; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(18)(a)(ii)(F): agricultural products.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(18)(b): "Biomass energy" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(18)(b)(i): black liquor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(18)(b)(ii): treated woods.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(a): "Bundled transaction" means the sale of two or more items of tangible personal property, products, or services if the tangible personal property, products, or services are:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(a)(i): distinct and identifiable; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(a)(ii): sold for one nonitemized price.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b): "Bundled transaction" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(i): the sale of tangible personal property if the sales price varies, or is negotiable, on the basis of the selection by the purchaser of the items of tangible personal property included in the transaction;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(ii): the sale of real property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(iii): the sale of services to real property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(iv): the retail sale of tangible personal property and a service if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(iv)(A): the tangible personal property:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(iv)(A)(I): is essential to the use of the service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(iv)(A)(II): is provided exclusively in connection with the service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(iv)(B): the service is the true object of the transaction;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(v): the retail sale of two services if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(v)(A): one service is provided that is essential to the use or receipt of a second service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(v)(B): the first service is provided exclusively in connection with the second service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(v)(C): the second service is the true object of the transaction;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(vi): a transaction that includes tangible personal property or a product subject to taxation under this chapter and tangible personal property or a product that is not subject to taxation under this chapter if the:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(vi)(A): seller's purchase price of the tangible personal property or product subject to taxation under this chapter is de minimis; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(vi)(B): seller's sales price of the tangible personal property or product subject to taxation under this chapter is de minimis; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(vii): the retail sale of tangible personal property that is not subject to taxation under this chapter and tangible personal property that is subject to taxation under this chapter if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(vii)(A): that retail sale includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(vii)(A)(I): food and food ingredients;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(vii)(A)(II): a drug;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(vii)(A)(III): durable medical equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(vii)(A)(IV): mobility enhancing equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(vii)(A)(V): an over-the-counter drug;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(vii)(A)(VI): a prosthetic device; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(vii)(A)(VII): a medical supply; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(vii)(B): subject to Subsection (19)(f):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(vii)(B)(I): the seller's purchase price of the tangible personal property subject to taxation under this chapter is 50% or less of the seller's total purchase price of that retail sale; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(b)(vii)(B)(II): the seller's sales price of the tangible personal property subject to taxation under this chapter is 50% or less of the seller's total sales price of that retail sale.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(c)(i): For purposes of Subsection (19)(a)(i), tangible personal property, a product, or a service that is distinct and identifiable does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(c)(i)(A): packaging that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(c)(i)(A)(I): accompanies the sale of the tangible personal property, product, or service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(c)(i)(A)(II): is incidental or immaterial to the sale of the tangible personal property, product, or service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(c)(i)(B): tangible personal property, a product, or a service provided free of charge with the purchase of another item of tangible personal property, a product, or a service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(c)(i)(C): an item of tangible personal property, a product, or a service included in the definition of "purchase price."
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(c)(ii): For purposes of Subsection (19)(c)(i)(B), an item of tangible personal property, a product, or a service is provided free of charge with the purchase of another item of tangible personal property, a product, or a service if the sales price of the purchased item of tangible personal property, product, or service does not vary depending on the inclusion of the tangible personal property, product, or service provided free of charge.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(d)(i): For purposes of Subsection (19)(a)(ii), property sold for one nonitemized price does not include a price that is separately identified by tangible personal property, product, or service on the following, regardless of whether the following is in paper format or electronic format:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(d)(i)(A): a binding sales document; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(d)(i)(B): another supporting sales-related document that is available to a purchaser.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(d)(ii): For purposes of Subsection (19)(d)(i), a binding sales document or another supporting sales-related document that is available to a purchaser includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(d)(ii)(A): a bill of sale;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(d)(ii)(B): a contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(d)(ii)(C): an invoice;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(d)(ii)(D): a lease agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(d)(ii)(E): a periodic notice of rates and services;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(d)(ii)(F): a price list;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(d)(ii)(G): a rate card;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(d)(ii)(H): a receipt; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(d)(ii)(I): a service agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(e)(i): For purposes of Subsection (19)(b)(vi), the sales price of tangible personal property or a product subject to taxation under this chapter is de minimis if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(e)(i)(A): the seller's purchase price of the tangible personal property or product is 10% or less of the seller's total purchase price of the bundled transaction; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(e)(i)(B): the seller's sales price of the tangible personal property or product is 10% or less of the seller's total sales price of the bundled transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(e)(ii): For purposes of Subsection (19)(b)(vi), a seller:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(e)(ii)(A): shall use the seller's purchase price or the seller's sales price to determine if the purchase price or sales price of the tangible personal property or product subject to taxation under this chapter is de minimis; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(e)(ii)(B): may not use a combination of the seller's purchase price and the seller's sales price to determine if the purchase price or sales price of the tangible personal property or product subject to taxation under this chapter is de minimis.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(e)(iii): For purposes of Subsection (19)(b)(vi), a seller shall use the full term of a service contract to determine if the sales price of tangible personal property or a product is de minimis.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(19)(f): For purposes of Subsection (19)(b)(vii)(B), a seller may not use a combination of the seller's purchase price and the seller's sales price to determine if tangible personal property subject to taxation under this chapter is 50% or less of the seller's total purchase price or sales price of that retail sale.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(22)(a)(i): on a transaction; and

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(24): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(24)(a): Subject to Subsection (24)(b), "clothing" means all human wearing apparel suitable for general use.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(24)(b): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission shall make rules:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(24)(b)(i): listing the items that constitute "clothing"; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(24)(b)(ii): that are consistent with the list of items that constitute "clothing" under the agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(25): "Coal-to-liquid" means the process of converting coal into a liquid synthetic fuel.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(26): "Commercial use" means the use of gas, electricity, heat, coal, fuel oil, or other fuels that does not constitute industrial use under Subsection (60) or residential use under Subsection (115).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(27): 13-51-102
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(27)(a): "Common carrier" means a person engaged in or transacting the business of transporting passengers, freight, merchandise, or other property for hire within this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(27)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(27)(b)(i): "Common carrier" does not include a person that, at the time the person is traveling to or from that person's place of employment, transports a passenger to or from the passenger's place of employment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(27)(b)(ii): For purposes of Subsection (27)(b)(i), in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission may make rules defining what constitutes a person's place of employment.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(28)(d): feed, seeds, and seedlings.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(29): "Computer" means an electronic device that accepts information:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(29)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(29)(a)(i): in digital form; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(29)(a)(ii): in a form similar to digital form; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(29)(b): manipulates that information for a result based on a sequence of instructions.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(30): "Computer software" means a set of coded instructions designed to cause:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(30)(a): a computer to perform a task; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(30)(b): automatic data processing equipment to perform a task.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(31): "Computer software maintenance contract" means a contract that obligates a seller of computer software to provide a customer with:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(31)(a): future updates or upgrades to computer software;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(31)(b): support services with respect to computer software; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(31)(c): a combination of Subsections (31)(a) and (b).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(32): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(32)(a): "Conference bridging service" means an ancillary service that links two or more participants of an audio conference call or video conference call.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(32)(b): "Conference bridging service" may include providing a telephone number as part of the ancillary service described in Subsection (32)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(32)(c): "Conference bridging service" does not include a telecommunications service used to reach the ancillary service described in Subsection (32)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(33): "Construction materials" means any tangible personal property that will be converted into real property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(34): "Delivered electronically" means delivered to a purchaser by means other than tangible storage media.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(35): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(35)(a): "Delivery charge" means a charge:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(35)(a)(i): by a seller of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(35)(a)(i)(A): tangible personal property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(35)(a)(i)(B): a product transferred electronically; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(35)(a)(i)(C): a service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(35)(a)(ii): for preparation and delivery of the tangible personal property, product transferred electronically, or services described in Subsection (35)(a)(i) to a location designated by the purchaser.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(35)(b): "Delivery charge" includes a charge for the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(35)(b)(i): transportation;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(35)(b)(ii): shipping;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(35)(b)(iii): postage;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(35)(b)(iv): handling;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(35)(b)(v): crating; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(35)(b)(vi): packing.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(36): "Detailed telecommunications billing service" means an ancillary service of separately stating information pertaining to individual calls on a customer's billing statement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37): "Dietary supplement" means a product, other than tobacco, that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(a): is intended to supplement the diet;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(b): contains one or more of the following dietary ingredients:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(b)(i): a vitamin;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(b)(ii): a mineral;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(b)(iii): an herb or other botanical;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(b)(iv): an amino acid;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(b)(v): a dietary substance for use by humans to supplement the diet by increasing the total dietary intake; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(b)(vi): a concentrate, metabolite, constituent, extract, or combination of any ingredient described in Subsections (37)(b)(i) through (v);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(c)(i): except as provided in Subsection (37)(c)(ii), is intended for ingestion in:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(c)(i)(A): tablet form;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(c)(i)(B): capsule form;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(c)(i)(C): powder form;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(c)(i)(D): softgel form;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(c)(i)(E): gelcap form; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(c)(i)(F): liquid form; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(c)(ii): if the product is not intended for ingestion in a form described in Subsections (37)(c)(i)(A) through (F), is not represented:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(c)(ii)(A): as conventional food; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(c)(ii)(B): for use as a sole item of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(c)(ii)(B)(I): a meal; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(c)(ii)(B)(II): the diet; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(d): is required to be labeled as a dietary supplement:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(d)(i): identifiable by the "Supplemental Facts" box found on the label; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(37)(d)(ii): as required by 21 C.F.R. Sec. 101.36.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(38): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(38)(a): "Digital audio work" means a work that results from the fixation of a series of musical, spoken, or other sounds.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(38)(b): "Digital audio work" includes a ringtone.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(39): "Digital audio-visual work" means a series of related images which, when shown in succession, imparts an impression of motion, together with accompanying sounds, if any.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(40): "Digital book" means a work that is generally recognized in the ordinary and usual sense as a book.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(41): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(41)(a): "Direct mail" means printed material delivered or distributed by United States mail or other delivery service:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(41)(a)(i): to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(41)(a)(i)(A): a mass audience; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(41)(a)(i)(B): addressees on a mailing list provided:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(41)(a)(i)(B)(I): by a purchaser of the mailing list; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(41)(a)(i)(B)(II): at the discretion of the purchaser of the mailing list; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(41)(a)(ii): if the cost of the printed material is not billed directly to the recipients.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(41)(b): "Direct mail" includes tangible personal property supplied directly or indirectly by a purchaser to a seller of direct mail for inclusion in a package containing the printed material.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(41)(c): "Direct mail" does not include multiple items of printed material delivered to a single address.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(42): "Directory assistance" means an ancillary service of providing:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(42)(a): address information; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(42)(b): telephone number information.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(43): 26B-2-201; 78B-3-403

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(43)(a)(ii)(A): 26B-2-201 a health care facility as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(43)(a)(ii)(B): 78B-3-403 a health care provider as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(43)(a)(ii)(C): an office of a health care provider described in Subsection (43)(a)(ii)(B); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(43)(a)(ii)(D): a person similar to a person described in Subsections (43)(a)(ii)(A) through (C).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(43)(b): "Disposable home medical equipment or supplies" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(43)(b)(i): a drug;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(43)(b)(ii): durable medical equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(43)(b)(iii): a hearing aid;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(43)(b)(iv): a hearing aid accessory;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(43)(b)(v): mobility enhancing equipment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(43)(b)(vi): tangible personal property used to correct impaired vision, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(43)(b)(vi)(A): eyeglasses; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(43)(b)(vi)(B): contact lenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(43)(c): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission may by rule define what constitutes medical equipment or supplies.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(44): "Drilling equipment manufacturer" means a facility:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(44)(a): located in the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(44)(b): with respect to which 51% or more of the manufacturing activities of the facility consist of manufacturing component parts of drilling equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(44)(c): that uses pressure of 800,000 or more pounds per square inch as part of the manufacturing process; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(44)(d): that uses a temperature of 2,000 or more degrees Fahrenheit as part of the manufacturing process.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(45): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(45)(a): "Drug" means a compound, substance, or preparation, or a component of a compound, substance, or preparation that is:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(45)(a)(i)(A): the official United States Pharmacopoeia;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(45)(a)(i)(D): a supplement to a publication listed in Subsections (45)(a)(i)(A) through (C);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(45)(a)(ii): intended for use in the:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(45)(a)(ii)(A): diagnosis of disease;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(45)(a)(ii)(B): cure of disease;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(45)(a)(ii)(C): mitigation of disease;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(45)(a)(ii)(D): treatment of disease; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(45)(a)(ii)(E): prevention of disease; or

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(45)(a)(iii)(A): the structure of the body; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(45)(a)(iii)(B): any function of the body.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(46): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(46)(a): "Durable medical equipment" means equipment that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(46)(a)(i): can withstand repeated use;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(46)(a)(ii): is primarily and customarily used to serve a medical purpose;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(46)(a)(iii): generally is not useful to a person in the absence of illness or injury; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(46)(a)(iv): is not worn in or on the body.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(46)(b): "Durable medical equipment" includes parts used in the repair or replacement of the equipment described in Subsection (46)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(46)(c): "Durable medical equipment" does not include mobility enhancing equipment.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(63):

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(63)(a)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(63)(a)(i)(A): a fixed term; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(63)(a)(i)(B): an indeterminate term; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(63)(a)(ii): consideration.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(63)(b)(i): an agreement covering a motor vehicle and trailer if the amount of consideration may be increased or decreased by reference to the amount realized upon sale or disposition of the property as defined in Section 7701(h)(1), Internal Revenue Code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(63)(b)(ii): car sharing.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(63)(c): "Lease" or "rental" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(63)(c)(i): a transfer of possession or control of property under a security agreement or deferred payment plan that requires the transfer of title upon completion of the required payments;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(63)(c)(ii): a transfer of possession or control of property under an agreement that requires the transfer of title:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(63)(c)(ii)(A): upon completion of required payments; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(63)(c)(ii)(B): if the payment of an option price does not exceed the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(63)(c)(ii)(B)(I): $100; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(63)(c)(ii)(B)(II): 1% of the total required payments; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(63)(c)(iii): providing tangible personal property along with an operator for a fixed period of time or an indeterminate period of time if the operator is necessary for equipment to perform as designed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(63)(d): For purposes of Subsection (63)(c)(iii), an operator is necessary for equipment to perform as designed if the operator's duties exceed the:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(63)(d)(i): set-up of tangible personal property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(63)(d)(ii): maintenance of tangible personal property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(63)(d)(iii): inspection of tangible personal property.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(64)(a): is present with a student in person or by video; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(64)(b): actively instructs the student, including by providing observation or feedback.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(71): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(71)(a): "Marketplace" means a physical or electronic place, platform, or forum where tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service is offered for sale.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(71)(b): "Marketplace" includes a store, a booth, an Internet website, a catalog, or a dedicated sales software application.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72): 59-12-602
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(a): "Marketplace facilitator" means a person, including an affiliate of the person, that enters into a contract, an agreement, or otherwise with sellers, for consideration, to facilitate the sale of a seller's product through a marketplace that the person owns, operates, or controls and that directly or indirectly:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(a)(i): does any of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(a)(i)(A): lists, makes available, or advertises tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service for sale by a marketplace seller on a marketplace that the person owns, operates, or controls;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(a)(i)(B): facilitates the sale of a marketplace seller's tangible personal property, product transferred electronically, or service by transmitting or otherwise communicating an offer or acceptance of a retail sale between the marketplace seller and a purchaser using the marketplace;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(a)(i)(C): owns, rents, licenses, makes available, or operates any electronic or physical infrastructure or any property, process, method, copyright, trademark, or patent that connects a marketplace seller to a purchaser for the purpose of making a retail sale of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(a)(i)(D): provides a marketplace for making, or otherwise facilitates, a retail sale of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service, regardless of ownership or control of the tangible personal property, the product transferred electronically, or the service that is the subject of the retail sale;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(a)(i)(E): provides software development or research and development activities related to any activity described in this Subsection (72)(a)(i), if the software development or research and development activity is directly related to the person's marketplace;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(a)(i)(F): provides or offers fulfillment or storage services for a marketplace seller;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(a)(i)(G): sets prices for the sale of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service by a marketplace seller;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(a)(i)(H): provides or offers customer service to a marketplace seller or a marketplace seller's purchaser or accepts or assists with taking orders, returns, or exchanges of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service sold by a marketplace seller on the person's marketplace; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(a)(i)(I): brands or otherwise identifies sales as those of the person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(a)(ii): does any of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(a)(ii)(A): collects the sales price or purchase price of a retail sale of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(a)(ii)(B): provides payment processing services for a retail sale of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(a)(ii)(C): charges, collects, or otherwise receives a selling fee, listing fee, referral fee, closing fee, a fee for inserting or making available tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service on the person's marketplace, or other consideration for the facilitation of a retail sale of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service, regardless of ownership or control of the tangible personal property, the product transferred electronically, or the service that is the subject of the retail sale;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(a)(ii)(D): through terms and conditions, an agreement, or another arrangement with a third person, collects payment from a purchase for a retail sale of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service and transmits that payment to the marketplace seller, regardless of whether the third person receives compensation or other consideration in exchange for the service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(a)(ii)(E): provides a virtual currency for a purchaser to use to purchase tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or service offered for sale.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(b): 59-12-602 "Marketplace facilitator" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(b)(i): a person that only provides payment processing services; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(72)(b)(ii): 59-12-602 a person described in Subsection (72)(a) to the extent the person is facilitating a sale for a seller that is a restaurant as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(73): "Marketplace seller" means a seller that makes one or more retail sales through a marketplace that a marketplace facilitator owns, operates, or controls, regardless of whether the seller is required to be registered to collect and remit the tax under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(74): 59-12-104 "Member of the immediate family of the producer" means a person who is related to a producer described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(74)(a): child or stepchild, regardless of whether the child or stepchild is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(74)(a)(i): an adopted child or adopted stepchild; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(74)(a)(ii): a foster child or foster stepchild;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(74)(b): grandchild or stepgrandchild;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(74)(c): grandparent or stepgrandparent;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(74)(d): nephew or stepnephew;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(74)(e): niece or stepniece;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(74)(f): parent or stepparent;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(74)(g): sibling or stepsibling;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(74)(h): spouse;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(74)(i): person who is the spouse of a person described in Subsections (74)(a) through (g); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(74)(j): person similar to a person described in Subsections (74)(a) through (i) as determined by the commission by rule made in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(75): 15A-1-302 "Mobile home" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(76): "Mobile telecommunications service" means the same as that term is defined in the Mobile Telecommunications Sourcing Act, 4 U.S.C. Sec. 124.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(77): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(77)(a): "Mobile wireless service" means a telecommunications service, regardless of the technology used, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(77)(a)(i): the origination point of the conveyance, routing, or transmission is not fixed;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(77)(a)(ii): the termination point of the conveyance, routing, or transmission is not fixed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(77)(a)(iii): the origination point described in Subsection (77)(a)(i) and the termination point described in Subsection (77)(a)(ii) are not fixed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(77)(b): "Mobile wireless service" includes a telecommunications service that is provided by a commercial mobile radio service provider.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(77)(c): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission may by rule define "commercial mobile radio service provider."
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(78): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(78)(a): "Mobility enhancing equipment" means equipment that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(78)(a)(i): primarily and customarily used to provide or increase the ability to move from one place to another;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(78)(a)(ii): appropriate for use in a:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(78)(a)(ii)(A): home; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(78)(a)(ii)(B): motor vehicle; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(78)(a)(iii): not generally used by persons with normal mobility.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(78)(b): "Mobility enhancing equipment" includes parts used in the repair or replacement of the equipment described in Subsection (78)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(78)(c): "Mobility enhancing equipment" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(78)(c)(i): a motor vehicle;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(78)(c)(ii): equipment on a motor vehicle if that equipment is normally provided by the motor vehicle manufacturer;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(78)(c)(iii): durable medical equipment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(78)(c)(iv): a prosthetic device.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(79): 59-12-124 "Model 1 seller" means a seller registered under the agreement that has selected a certified service provider as the seller's agent to perform the seller's sales and use tax functions for agreement sales and use taxes, as outlined in the contract between the governing board of the agreement and the certified service provider, other than the seller's obligation under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(80): "Model 2 seller" means a seller registered under the agreement that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(80)(a): except as provided in Subsection (80)(b), has selected a certified automated system to perform the seller's sales tax functions for agreement sales and use taxes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(80)(b): retains responsibility for remitting all of the sales tax:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(80)(b)(i): collected by the seller; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(80)(b)(ii): to the appropriate local taxing jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(81): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(81)(a): Subject to Subsection (81)(b), "model 3 seller" means a seller registered under the agreement that has:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(81)(a)(i): sales in at least five states that are members of the agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(81)(a)(ii): total annual sales revenue of at least $500,000,000;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(81)(a)(iii): a proprietary system that calculates the amount of tax:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(81)(a)(iii)(A): for an agreement sales and use tax; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(81)(a)(iii)(B): due to each local taxing jurisdiction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(81)(a)(iv): entered into a performance agreement with the governing board of the agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(81)(b): For purposes of Subsection (81)(a), "model 3 seller" includes an affiliated group of sellers using the same proprietary system.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(82): "Model 4 seller" means a seller that is registered under the agreement and is not a model 1 seller, model 2 seller, or model 3 seller.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(85): "Oil sands" means impregnated bituminous sands that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(85)(a): contain a heavy, thick form of petroleum that is released when heated, mixed with other hydrocarbons, or otherwise treated;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(85)(b): yield mixtures of liquid hydrocarbon; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(85)(c): require further processing other than mechanical blending before becoming finished petroleum products.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(86): "Oil shale" means a group of fine black to dark brown shales containing kerogen material that yields petroleum upon heating and distillation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(87): "Optional computer software maintenance contract" means a computer software maintenance contract that a customer is not obligated to purchase as a condition to the retail sale of computer software.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(88): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(88)(a): "Other fuels" means products that burn independently to produce heat or energy.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(88)(b): "Other fuels" includes oxygen when it is used in the manufacturing of tangible personal property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(89): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(89)(a): "Paging service" means a telecommunications service that provides transmission of a coded radio signal for the purpose of activating a specific pager.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(89)(b): For purposes of Subsection (89)(a), the transmission of a coded radio signal includes a transmission by message or sound.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(91): 13-32a-102 "Pawnbroker" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(a): "Permanently attached to real property" means that for tangible personal property attached to real property:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(a)(i): the attachment of the tangible personal property to the real property:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(a)(i)(A): is essential to the use of the tangible personal property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(a)(i)(B): suggests that the tangible personal property will remain attached to the real property in the same place over the useful life of the tangible personal property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(a)(ii): if the tangible personal property is detached from the real property, the detachment would:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(a)(ii)(A): cause substantial damage to the tangible personal property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(a)(ii)(B): require substantial alteration or repair of the real property to which the tangible personal property is attached.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(b): "Permanently attached to real property" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(b)(i): the attachment of an accessory to the tangible personal property if the accessory is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(b)(i)(A): essential to the operation of the tangible personal property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(b)(i)(B): attached only to facilitate the operation of the tangible personal property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(b)(ii): a temporary detachment of tangible personal property from real property for a repair or renovation if the repair or renovation is performed where the tangible personal property and real property are located; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(b)(iii): property attached to oil, gas, or water pipelines, except for the property listed in Subsection (92)(c)(iii) or (iv).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(c): "Permanently attached to real property" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(c)(i): the attachment of portable or movable tangible personal property to real property if that portable or movable tangible personal property is attached to real property only for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(c)(i)(A): convenience;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(c)(i)(B): stability; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(c)(i)(C): for an obvious temporary purpose;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(c)(ii): the detachment of tangible personal property from real property except for the detachment described in Subsection (92)(b)(ii);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(c)(iii): an attachment of the following tangible personal property to real property if the attachment to real property is only through a line that supplies water, electricity, gas, telecommunications, cable, or supplies a similar item as determined by the commission by rule made in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(c)(iii)(A): a computer;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(c)(iii)(B): a telephone;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(c)(iii)(C): a television; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(c)(iii)(D): tangible personal property similar to Subsections (92)(c)(iii)(A) through (C) as determined by the commission by rule made in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(92)(c)(iv): an item listed in Subsection (137)(c).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(93): "Person" includes any individual, firm, partnership, joint venture, association, corporation, estate, trust, business trust, receiver, syndicate, this state, any county, city, municipality, district, or other local governmental entity of the state, or any group or combination acting as a unit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(94): "Place of primary use":
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(94)(a): for telecommunications service other than mobile telecommunications service, means the street address representative of where the customer's use of the telecommunications service primarily occurs, which shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(94)(a)(i): the residential street address of the customer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(94)(a)(ii): the primary business street address of the customer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(94)(b): for mobile telecommunications service, means the same as that term is defined in the Mobile Telecommunications Sourcing Act, 4 U.S.C. Sec. 124.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101): 59-12-103
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(a): "Prewritten computer software" means computer software that is not designed and developed:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(a)(i): by the author or other creator of the computer software; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(a)(ii): to the specifications of a specific purchaser.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(b): "Prewritten computer software" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(b)(i): a prewritten upgrade to computer software if the prewritten upgrade to the computer software is not designed and developed:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(b)(i)(A): by the author or other creator of the computer software; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(b)(i)(B): to the specifications of a specific purchaser;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(b)(ii): computer software designed and developed by the author or other creator of the computer software to the specifications of a specific purchaser if the computer software is sold to a person other than the purchaser; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(b)(iii): except as provided in Subsection (101)(c), prewritten computer software or a prewritten portion of prewritten computer software:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(b)(iii)(A): that is modified or enhanced to any degree; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(b)(iii)(B): if the modification or enhancement described in Subsection (101)(b)(iii)(A) is designed and developed to the specifications of a specific purchaser.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(c): 59-12-103 "Prewritten computer software" does not include a modification or enhancement described in Subsection (101)(b)(iii) if the charges for the modification or enhancement are:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(c)(i): reasonable; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(c)(ii): 59-12-103 subject to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(c)(ii)(A): the books and records the seller keeps at the time of the transaction in the regular course of business, including books and records the seller keeps at the time of the transaction in the regular course of business for nontax purposes;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(c)(ii)(B): a preponderance of the facts and circumstances at the time of the transaction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(c)(ii)(C): the understanding of all of the parties to the transaction.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(102)(a)(ii): regardless of the manner in which the one or more communications channels are connected.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(102)(b)(i): an extension line;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(103): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(103)(a): "Product transferred electronically" means a product transferred electronically that would be subject to a tax under this chapter if that product was transferred in a manner other than electronically.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(103)(b)(ii): computer software; or

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(104): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(104)(a): "Prosthetic device" means a device that is worn on or in the body to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(104)(a)(i): artificially replace a missing portion of the body;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(104)(a)(ii): prevent or correct a physical deformity or physical malfunction; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(104)(a)(iii): support a weak or deformed portion of the body.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(104)(b)(i): parts used in the repairs or renovation of a prosthetic device;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(104)(b)(ii): replacement parts for a prosthetic device;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(104)(b)(iii): a dental prosthesis; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(104)(b)(iv): a hearing aid.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(104)(c): "Prosthetic device" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(104)(c)(i): corrective eyeglasses; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(104)(c)(ii): contact lenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(105): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(105)(a): "Protective equipment" means an item:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(105)(a)(i): for human wear; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(105)(a)(ii): that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(105)(a)(ii)(A): designed as protection:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(105)(a)(ii)(A)(I): to the wearer against injury or disease; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(105)(a)(ii)(A)(II): against damage or injury of other persons or property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(105)(a)(ii)(B): not suitable for general use.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(105)(b): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission shall make rules:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(105)(b)(i): listing the items that constitute "protective equipment"; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(105)(b)(ii): that are consistent with the list of items that constitute "protective equipment" under the agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(106): 59-12-104
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(106)(a): 59-12-104 For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(106)(a)(i): regardless of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(106)(a)(i)(A): characteristics;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(106)(a)(i)(B): copyright;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(106)(a)(i)(C): form;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(106)(a)(i)(D): format;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(106)(a)(i)(E): method of reproduction; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(106)(a)(i)(F): source; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(106)(a)(ii): made available in printed or electronic format.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(106)(b): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission may by rule define the term "photocopy."
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107): 59-12-103
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(a): "Purchase price" and "sales price" mean the total amount of consideration:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(a)(i): valued in money; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(a)(ii): for which tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or services are:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(a)(ii)(A): sold;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(a)(ii)(B): leased; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(a)(ii)(C): rented.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b): "Purchase price" and "sales price" include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(i): the seller's cost of the tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or services sold;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(ii): expenses of the seller, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(ii)(A): the cost of materials used;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(ii)(B): a labor cost;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(ii)(C): a service cost;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(ii)(D): interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(ii)(E): a loss;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(ii)(F): the cost of transportation to the seller; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(ii)(G): a tax imposed on the seller;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iii): a charge by the seller for any service necessary to complete the sale; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv): consideration a seller receives from a person other than the purchaser if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(A): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(A)(I): the seller actually receives consideration from a person other than the purchaser; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(A)(II): the consideration described in Subsection (107)(b)(iv)(A)(I) is directly related to a price reduction or discount on the sale;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(B): the seller has an obligation to pass the price reduction or discount through to the purchaser;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(C): the amount of the consideration attributable to the sale is fixed and determinable by the seller at the time of the sale to the purchaser; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(D): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(D)(I): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(D)(I)(Aa): the purchaser presents a certificate, coupon, or other documentation to the seller to claim a price reduction or discount; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(D)(I)(Bb): a person other than the seller authorizes, distributes, or grants the certificate, coupon, or other documentation with the understanding that the person other than the seller will reimburse any seller to whom the certificate, coupon, or other documentation is presented;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(D)(II): the purchaser identifies that purchaser to the seller as a member of a group or organization allowed a price reduction or discount, except that a preferred customer card that is available to any patron of a seller does not constitute membership in a group or organization allowed a price reduction or discount; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(D)(III): the price reduction or discount is identified as a third party price reduction or discount on the:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(D)(III)(Aa): invoice the purchaser receives; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(D)(III)(Bb): certificate, coupon, or other documentation the purchaser presents.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c): 59-12-103 "Purchase price" and "sales price" do not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(i): a discount:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(i)(A): in a form including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(i)(A)(I): cash;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(i)(A)(II): term; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(i)(A)(III): coupon;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(i)(B): that is allowed by a seller;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(i)(C): taken by a purchaser on a sale; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(i)(D): that is not reimbursed by a third party; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(ii): 59-12-103 subject to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(ii)(A): the following from credit extended on the sale of tangible personal property or services:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(ii)(A)(I): a carrying charge;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(ii)(A)(II): a financing charge; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(ii)(A)(III): an interest charge;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(ii)(B): a delivery charge;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(ii)(C): an installation charge;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(ii)(D): a manufacturer rebate on a motor vehicle; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(ii)(E): a tax or fee legally imposed directly on the consumer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(108): "Purchaser" means a person to whom:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(108)(a): a sale of tangible personal property is made;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(108)(b): a product is transferred electronically; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(108)(c): a service is furnished.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(109)(a): houses a group of networked server computers in one physical location in order to disseminate, manage, and store data and information;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(109)(b): is located in the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(109)(c): is a new operation constructed on or after July 1, 2016;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(109)(d): consists of one or more buildings that total 150,000 or more square feet;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(109)(e): 59-7-101 is owned or leased by:
