Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(99)(b)(iii)(C)(XIII): a pie;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(99)(b)(iii)(C)(XIV): a roll;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(99)(b)(iii)(C)(XV): a tart;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(99)(b)(iii)(C)(XVI): a torte; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(99)(b)(iii)(C)(XVII): a tortilla.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(99)(c): An eating utensil provided by the seller does not include the following used to transport the food:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(99)(c)(i): a container; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(99)(c)(ii): packaging.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(100): "Prescription" means an order, formula, or recipe that is issued:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(100)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(100)(a)(i): orally;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(100)(a)(ii): in writing;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(100)(a)(iii): electronically; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(100)(a)(iv): by any other manner of transmission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(100)(b): by a licensed practitioner authorized by the laws of a state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101): 59-12-103
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(a): "Prewritten computer software" means computer software that is not designed and developed:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(a)(i): by the author or other creator of the computer software; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(a)(ii): to the specifications of a specific purchaser.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(b): "Prewritten computer software" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(b)(i): a prewritten upgrade to computer software if the prewritten upgrade to the computer software is not designed and developed:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(b)(i)(A): by the author or other creator of the computer software; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(b)(i)(B): to the specifications of a specific purchaser;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(b)(ii): computer software designed and developed by the author or other creator of the computer software to the specifications of a specific purchaser if the computer software is sold to a person other than the purchaser; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(b)(iii): except as provided in Subsection (101)(c), prewritten computer software or a prewritten portion of prewritten computer software:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(b)(iii)(A): that is modified or enhanced to any degree; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(b)(iii)(B): if the modification or enhancement described in Subsection (101)(b)(iii)(A) is designed and developed to the specifications of a specific purchaser.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(c): 59-12-103 "Prewritten computer software" does not include a modification or enhancement described in Subsection (101)(b)(iii) if the charges for the modification or enhancement are:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(c)(i): reasonable; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(c)(ii): 59-12-103 subject to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(c)(ii)(A): the books and records the seller keeps at the time of the transaction in the regular course of business, including books and records the seller keeps at the time of the transaction in the regular course of business for nontax purposes;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(c)(ii)(B): a preponderance of the facts and circumstances at the time of the transaction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(101)(c)(ii)(C): the understanding of all of the parties to the transaction.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107): 59-12-103
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(a): "Purchase price" and "sales price" mean the total amount of consideration:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(a)(i): valued in money; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(a)(ii): for which tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or services are:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(a)(ii)(A): sold;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(a)(ii)(B): leased; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(a)(ii)(C): rented.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b): "Purchase price" and "sales price" include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(i): the seller's cost of the tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or services sold;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(ii): expenses of the seller, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(ii)(A): the cost of materials used;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(ii)(B): a labor cost;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(ii)(C): a service cost;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(ii)(D): interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(ii)(E): a loss;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(ii)(F): the cost of transportation to the seller; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(ii)(G): a tax imposed on the seller;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iii): a charge by the seller for any service necessary to complete the sale; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv): consideration a seller receives from a person other than the purchaser if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(A): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(A)(I): the seller actually receives consideration from a person other than the purchaser; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(A)(II): the consideration described in Subsection (107)(b)(iv)(A)(I) is directly related to a price reduction or discount on the sale;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(B): the seller has an obligation to pass the price reduction or discount through to the purchaser;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(C): the amount of the consideration attributable to the sale is fixed and determinable by the seller at the time of the sale to the purchaser; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(D): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(D)(I): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(D)(I)(Aa): the purchaser presents a certificate, coupon, or other documentation to the seller to claim a price reduction or discount; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(D)(I)(Bb): a person other than the seller authorizes, distributes, or grants the certificate, coupon, or other documentation with the understanding that the person other than the seller will reimburse any seller to whom the certificate, coupon, or other documentation is presented;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(D)(II): the purchaser identifies that purchaser to the seller as a member of a group or organization allowed a price reduction or discount, except that a preferred customer card that is available to any patron of a seller does not constitute membership in a group or organization allowed a price reduction or discount; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(D)(III): the price reduction or discount is identified as a third party price reduction or discount on the:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(D)(III)(Aa): invoice the purchaser receives; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(b)(iv)(D)(III)(Bb): certificate, coupon, or other documentation the purchaser presents.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c): 59-12-103 "Purchase price" and "sales price" do not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(i): a discount:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(i)(A): in a form including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(i)(A)(I): cash;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(i)(A)(II): term; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(i)(A)(III): coupon;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(i)(B): that is allowed by a seller;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(i)(C): taken by a purchaser on a sale; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(i)(D): that is not reimbursed by a third party; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(ii): 59-12-103 subject to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(ii)(A): the following from credit extended on the sale of tangible personal property or services:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(ii)(A)(I): a carrying charge;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(ii)(A)(II): a financing charge; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(ii)(A)(III): an interest charge;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(ii)(B): a delivery charge;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(ii)(C): an installation charge;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(ii)(D): a manufacturer rebate on a motor vehicle; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(107)(c)(ii)(E): a tax or fee legally imposed directly on the consumer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(108): "Purchaser" means a person to whom:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(108)(a): a sale of tangible personal property is made;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(108)(b): a product is transferred electronically; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(108)(c): a service is furnished.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(110): "Regularly rented" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(110)(a): rented to a guest for value three or more times during a calendar year; or

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(111): "Rental" means the same as that term is defined in Subsection (63).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(112): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(112)(a): "Repairs or renovations of tangible personal property" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(112)(a)(i): a repair or renovation of tangible personal property that is not permanently attached to real property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(112)(a)(ii): attaching tangible personal property or a product transferred electronically to other tangible personal property or detaching tangible personal property or a product transferred electronically from other tangible personal property if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(112)(a)(ii)(A): the other tangible personal property to which the tangible personal property or product transferred electronically is attached or from which the tangible personal property or product transferred electronically is detached is not permanently attached to real property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(112)(a)(ii)(B): the attachment of tangible personal property or a product transferred electronically to other tangible personal property or detachment of tangible personal property or a product transferred electronically from other tangible personal property is made in conjunction with a repair or replacement of tangible personal property or a product transferred electronically.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(112)(b): "Repairs or renovations of tangible personal property" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(112)(b)(i): attaching prewritten computer software to other tangible personal property if the other tangible personal property to which the prewritten computer software is attached is not permanently attached to real property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(112)(b)(ii): detaching prewritten computer software from other tangible personal property if the other tangible personal property from which the prewritten computer software is detached is not permanently attached to real property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(113): "Research and development" means the process of inquiry or experimentation aimed at the discovery of facts, devices, technologies, or applications and the process of preparing those devices, technologies, or applications for marketing.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(114): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(114)(a): "Residential telecommunications services" means a telecommunications service or an ancillary service that is provided to an individual for personal use:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(114)(a)(i): at a residential address; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(114)(a)(ii): at an institution, including a nursing home or a school, if the telecommunications service or ancillary service is provided to and paid for by the individual residing at the institution rather than the institution.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(114)(b): For purposes of Subsection (114)(a)(i), a residential address includes an:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(114)(b)(i): apartment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(114)(b)(ii): other individual dwelling unit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(115): "Residential use" means the use in or around a home, apartment building, sleeping quarters, and similar facilities or accommodations.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(116): "Retail sale" or "sale at retail" means a sale, lease, or rental for a purpose other than:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(116)(a): resale;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(116)(b): sublease; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(116)(c): subrent.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(117)(a): 59-12-103 "Retailer" means any person, unless prohibited by the Constitution of the United States or federal law, that is engaged in a regularly organized business in tangible personal property or any other taxable transaction under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(117)(b): "Retailer" includes commission merchants, auctioneers, and any person regularly engaged in the business of selling to users or consumers within the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(118): 59-12-103
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(118)(a): 59-12-103 "Sale" means any transfer of title, exchange, or barter, conditional or otherwise, in any manner, of tangible personal property or any other taxable transaction under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(118)(b): "Sale" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(118)(b)(i): installment and credit sales;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(118)(b)(ii): any closed transaction constituting a sale;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(118)(b)(iii): any sale of electrical energy, gas, services, or entertainment taxable under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(118)(b)(iv): any transaction if the possession of property is transferred but the seller retains the title as security for the payment of the price; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(118)(b)(v): any transaction under which right to possession, operation, or use of any article of tangible personal property is granted under a lease or contract and the transfer of possession would be taxable if an outright sale were made.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(119): "Sale at retail" means the same as that term is defined in Subsection (116).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(120): "Sale-leaseback transaction" means a transaction by which title to tangible personal property or a product transferred electronically that is subject to a tax under this chapter is transferred:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(120)(a): by a purchaser-lessee;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(120)(b): to a lessor;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(120)(c): for consideration; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(120)(d): if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(120)(d)(i): the purchaser-lessee paid sales and use tax on the purchaser-lessee's initial purchase of the tangible personal property or product transferred electronically;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(120)(d)(ii): the sale of the tangible personal property or product transferred electronically to the lessor is intended as a form of financing:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(120)(d)(ii)(A): for the tangible personal property or product transferred electronically; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(120)(d)(ii)(B): to the purchaser-lessee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(120)(d)(iii): in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, the purchaser-lessee is required to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(120)(d)(iii)(A): capitalize the tangible personal property or product transferred electronically for financial reporting purposes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(120)(d)(iii)(B): account for the lease payments as payments made under a financing arrangement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(121): "Sales price" means the same as that term is defined in Subsection (107).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(a): "Sales relating to schools" means the following sales by, amounts paid to, or amounts charged by a school:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(a)(i): sales that are directly related to the school's educational functions or activities including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(a)(i)(A): the sale of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(a)(i)(A)(I): textbooks;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(a)(i)(A)(II): textbook fees;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(a)(i)(A)(III): laboratory fees;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(a)(i)(A)(IV): laboratory supplies; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(a)(i)(A)(V): safety equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(a)(i)(B): the sale of a uniform, protective equipment, or sports or recreational equipment that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(a)(i)(B)(I): a student is specifically required to wear as a condition of participation in a school-related event or school-related activity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(a)(i)(B)(II): is not readily adaptable to general or continued usage to the extent that it takes the place of ordinary clothing;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(a)(i)(C): sales of the following if the net or gross revenue generated by the sales is deposited into a school district fund or school fund dedicated to school meals:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(a)(i)(C)(I): food and food ingredients; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(a)(i)(C)(II): prepared food; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(a)(i)(D): transportation charges for official school activities; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(a)(ii): amounts paid to or amounts charged by a school for admission to a school-related event or school-related activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(b): "Sales relating to schools" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(b)(i): bookstore sales of items that are not educational materials or supplies;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(b)(ii): except as provided in Subsection (122)(a)(i)(B):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(b)(ii)(A): clothing;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(b)(ii)(B): clothing accessories or equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(b)(ii)(C): protective equipment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(b)(ii)(D): sports or recreational equipment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(b)(iii): amounts paid to or amounts charged by a school for admission to a school-related event or school-related activity if the amounts paid or charged are passed through to a person:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(b)(iii)(A): other than a:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(b)(iii)(A)(I): school;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(b)(iii)(A)(II): nonprofit organization authorized by a school board or a governing body of a private school to organize and direct a competitive secondary school activity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(b)(iii)(A)(III): nonprofit association authorized by a school board or a governing body of a private school to organize and direct a competitive secondary school activity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(b)(iii)(B): that is required to collect sales and use taxes under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(122)(c): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission may make rules defining the term "passed through."
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(123): 59-12-104 For purposes of this section and Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(123)(a): an elementary school or a secondary school that:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(123)(b): a public school district.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(124): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(124)(a): "Seller" means a person that makes a sale, lease, or rental of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(124)(a)(i): tangible personal property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(124)(a)(ii): a product transferred electronically; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(124)(a)(iii): a service.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(124)(b): "Seller" includes a marketplace facilitator.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(a): "Semiconductor fabricating, processing, research, or development materials" means tangible personal property or a product transferred electronically if the tangible personal property or product transferred electronically is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(a)(i): used primarily in the process of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(a)(i)(A): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(a)(i)(A)(I): manufacturing a semiconductor;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(a)(i)(A)(II): fabricating a semiconductor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(a)(i)(A)(III): research or development of a:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(a)(i)(A)(III)(Aa): semiconductor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(a)(i)(A)(III)(Bb): semiconductor manufacturing process; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(a)(i)(B): maintaining an environment suitable for a semiconductor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(a)(ii): consumed primarily in the process of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(a)(ii)(A): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(a)(ii)(A)(I): manufacturing a semiconductor;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(a)(ii)(A)(II): fabricating a semiconductor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(a)(ii)(A)(III): research or development of a:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(a)(ii)(A)(III)(Aa): semiconductor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(a)(ii)(A)(III)(Bb): semiconductor manufacturing process; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(a)(ii)(B): maintaining an environment suitable for a semiconductor.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(b): "Semiconductor fabricating, processing, research, or development materials" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(b)(i): parts used in the repairs or renovations of tangible personal property or a product transferred electronically described in Subsection (125)(a); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(b)(ii): a chemical, catalyst, or other material used to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(b)(ii)(A): produce or induce in a semiconductor a:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(b)(ii)(A)(I): chemical change; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(b)(ii)(A)(II): physical change;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(b)(ii)(B): remove impurities from a semiconductor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(125)(b)(ii)(C): improve the marketable condition of a semiconductor.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(137):

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(137)(a)(i)(E): touched; or

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(139): "Telecommunications equipment, machinery, or software required for 911 service" means equipment, machinery, or software that is required to comply with 47 C.F.R. Sec. 20.18.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(140): "Telecommunications maintenance or repair equipment, machinery, or software" means equipment, machinery, or software purchased or leased primarily to maintain or repair one or more of the following, regardless of whether the equipment, machinery, or software is purchased or leased as a spare part or as an upgrade or modification to one or more of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(140)(a): telecommunications enabling or facilitating equipment, machinery, or software;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(140)(b): telecommunications switching or routing equipment, machinery, or software; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(140)(c): telecommunications transmission equipment, machinery, or software.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(a): "Telecommunications service" means the electronic conveyance, routing, or transmission of audio, data, video, voice, or any other information or signal to a point, or among or between points.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(b): "Telecommunications service" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(b)(i): an electronic conveyance, routing, or transmission with respect to which a computer processing application is used to act:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(b)(i)(A): on the code, form, or protocol of the content;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(b)(i)(B): for the purpose of electronic conveyance, routing, or transmission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(b)(i)(C): regardless of whether the service:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(b)(i)(C)(I): is referred to as voice over Internet protocol service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(b)(i)(C)(II): is classified by the Federal Communications Commission as enhanced or value added;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(b)(ii): an 800 service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(b)(iii): a 900 service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(b)(iv): a fixed wireless service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(b)(v): a mobile wireless service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(b)(vi): a postpaid calling service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(b)(vii): a prepaid calling service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(b)(viii): a prepaid wireless calling service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(b)(ix): a private communications service.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c): "Telecommunications service" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(i): advertising, including directory advertising;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(ii): an ancillary service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(iii): a billing and collection service provided to a third party;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(iv): a data processing and information service if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(iv)(A): the data processing and information service allows data to be:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(iv)(A)(I): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(iv)(A)(I)(Aa): acquired;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(iv)(A)(I)(Bb): generated;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(iv)(A)(I)(Cc): processed;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(iv)(A)(I)(Dd): retrieved; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(iv)(A)(I)(Ee): stored; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(iv)(A)(II): delivered by an electronic transmission to a purchaser; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(iv)(B): the purchaser's primary purpose for the underlying transaction is the processed data or information;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(v): installation or maintenance of the following on a customer's premises:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(v)(A): equipment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(v)(B): wiring;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(vi): Internet access service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(vii): a paging service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(viii): a product transferred electronically, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(viii)(A): music;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(viii)(B): reading material;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(viii)(C): a ring tone;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(viii)(D): software; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(viii)(E): video;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(ix): a radio and television audio and video programming service:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(ix)(A): regardless of the medium; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(ix)(B): including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(ix)(B)(I): furnishing conveyance, routing, or transmission of a television audio and video programming service by a programming service provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(ix)(B)(II): cable service as defined in 47 U.S.C. Sec. 522(6); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(ix)(B)(III): audio and video programming services delivered by a commercial mobile radio service provider as defined in 47 C.F.R. Sec. 20.3;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(x): a value-added nonvoice data service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(141)(c)(xi): tangible personal property.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(142): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(142)(a): "Telecommunications service provider" means a person that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(142)(a)(i): owns, controls, operates, or manages a telecommunications service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(142)(a)(ii): engages in an activity described in Subsection (142)(a)(i) for the shared use with or resale to any person of the telecommunications service.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(142)(b): A person described in Subsection (142)(a) is a telecommunications service provider whether or not the Public Service Commission of Utah regulates:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(142)(b)(i): that person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(142)(b)(ii): the telecommunications service that the person owns, controls, operates, or manages.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(143):

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(145): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(145)(a): "Textbook for a higher education course" means a textbook or other printed material that is required for a course:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(145)(a)(i): offered by an institution of higher education; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(145)(a)(ii): that the purchaser of the textbook or other printed material attends or will attend.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(145)(b): "Textbook for a higher education course" includes a textbook in electronic format.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(146): "Tobacco" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(146)(a): a cigarette;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(146)(b): a cigar;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(146)(c): chewing tobacco;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(146)(d): pipe tobacco; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(146)(e): any other item that contains tobacco.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(147): "Unassisted amusement device" means an amusement device, skill device, or ride device that is started and stopped by the purchaser or renter of the right to use or operate the amusement device, skill device, or ride device.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(148): 59-12-103
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(148)(a): 59-12-103 "Use" means the exercise of any right or power over tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(148)(b): "Use" does not include the sale, display, demonstration, or trial of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service in the regular course of business and held for resale.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(149): "Value-added nonvoice data service" means a service:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(149)(a): that otherwise meets the definition of a telecommunications service except that a computer processing application is used to act primarily for a purpose other than conveyance, routing, or transmission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(149)(b): with respect to which a computer processing application is used to act on data or information:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(149)(b)(i): code;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(149)(b)(ii): content;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(149)(b)(iii): form; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(149)(b)(iv): protocol.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(150): 72-10-102; 41-1a-102; 41-22-2; 41-1a-102; 59-12-104
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(150)(a): 72-10-102; 41-1a-102; 41-22-2; 41-1a-102 Subject to Subsection (150)(b), "vehicle" means the following that are required to be titled, registered, or titled and registered:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(150)(a)(i): 72-10-102 an aircraft as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(150)(a)(ii): 41-1a-102 a vehicle as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(150)(a)(iii): 41-22-2 an off-highway vehicle as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(150)(a)(iv): 41-1a-102 a vessel as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(150)(b): 59-12-104 For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(150)(b)(i): a vehicle described in Subsection (150)(a); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(150)(b)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(150)(b)(ii)(A): a locomotive;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(150)(b)(ii)(B): a freight car;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(150)(b)(ii)(C): railroad work equipment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(150)(b)(ii)(D): other railroad rolling stock.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(151): "Vehicle dealer" means a person engaged in the business of buying, selling, or exchanging a vehicle as defined in Subsection (150).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(152): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(152)(a): "Vertical service" means an ancillary service that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(152)(a)(i): is offered in connection with one or more telecommunications services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(152)(a)(ii): offers an advanced calling feature that allows a customer to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(152)(a)(ii)(A): identify a caller; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(152)(a)(ii)(B): manage multiple calls and call connections.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(152)(b): "Vertical service" includes an ancillary service that allows a customer to manage a conference bridging service.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(153): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(153)(a): "Voice mail service" means an ancillary service that enables a customer to receive, send, or store a recorded message.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(153)(b): "Voice mail service" does not include a vertical service that a customer is required to have in order to utilize a voice mail service.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(154): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(154)(a): "Waste energy facility" means a facility that generates electricity:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(154)(a)(i): using as the primary source of energy waste materials that would be placed in a landfill or refuse pit if it were not used to generate electricity, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(154)(a)(i)(A): tires;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(154)(a)(i)(B): waste coal;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(154)(a)(i)(C): oil shale; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(154)(a)(i)(D): municipal solid waste; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(154)(a)(ii): in amounts greater than actually required for the operation of the facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(154)(b): "Waste energy facility" does not include a facility that incinerates:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(154)(b)(i): hospital waste as defined in 40 C.F.R. 60.51c; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(154)(b)(ii): medical/infectious waste as defined in 40 C.F.R. 60.51c.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(155): 73-18-2 "Watercraft" means a vessel as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(156): "Wind energy" means wind used as the sole source of energy to produce electricity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102(157): "ZIP Code" means a Zoning Improvement Plan Code assigned to a geographic location by the United States Postal Service.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102.3 Authority to enter into agreement -- Delegates.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102.3(1): The commission may apply to the governing board for the state to become a party to the agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102.3(2): (2)(c)(i); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act If the state becomes a party to the agreement, the commission may:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102.3(2)(a): establish standards for certification of a:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102.3(2)(a)(i): certified automated system; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102.3(2)(a)(ii): certified service provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102.3(2)(b): act jointly with other states that are parties to the agreement to establish performance standards for multistate sellers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102.3(2)(c): (2)(c)(i); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act take other actions reasonably required to implement provisions of the agreement:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102.3(2)(c)(i): if those actions are not in conflict with statute; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102.3(2)(c)(ii): (2)(c)(i); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102.3(2)(c)(ii)(A): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102.3(2)(c)(ii)(B): in furtherance of the agreement, jointly procuring goods or services with other states that are parties to the agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102.3(3): (4) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102.3(3)(a): assist in implementing the provisions of the agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102.3(3)(b): address other matters as determined by the governing board.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102.3(4): Delegates shall be appointed as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102.3(4)(a): two delegates shall be legislators appointed by mutual consent of the speaker of the House of Representatives and the president of the Senate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-102.3(4)(b): two delegates shall be appointed by the governor, at least one of whom shall be from the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103 Sales and use tax base -- Rates -- Effective dates -- Use of sales and use tax revenue.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1): 59-12-104; 59-12-104; 59-12-104 A tax is imposed on the purchaser as provided in this part on the purchase price or sales price for amounts paid or charged for the following transactions:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(a): retail sales of tangible personal property made within the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(b): amounts paid for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(b)(i): telecommunications service, other than mobile telecommunications service, that originates and terminates within the boundaries of this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(b)(ii): mobile telecommunications service that originates and terminates within the boundaries of one state only to the extent permitted by the Mobile Telecommunications Sourcing Act, 4 U.S.C. Sec. 116 et seq.; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(b)(iii): an ancillary service associated with a:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(b)(iii)(A): telecommunications service described in Subsection (1)(b)(i); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(b)(iii)(B): mobile telecommunications service described in Subsection (1)(b)(ii);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(c): sales of the following for commercial use:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(c)(i): gas;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(c)(ii): electricity;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(c)(iii): heat;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(c)(iv): coal;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(c)(v): fuel oil; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(c)(vi): other fuels;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(d): sales of the following for residential use:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(d)(i): gas;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(d)(ii): electricity;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(d)(iii): heat;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(d)(iv): coal;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(d)(v): fuel oil; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(d)(vi): other fuels;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(e): sales of prepared food;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(f): 59-12-104 except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(g): 59-12-104 amounts paid or charged for services for repairs or renovations of tangible personal property, unless Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(g)(i): the tangible personal property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(g)(ii): parts used in the repairs or renovations of the tangible personal property described in Subsection (1)(g)(i), regardless of whether:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(g)(ii)(A): any parts are actually used in the repairs or renovations of that tangible personal property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(g)(ii)(B): the particular parts used in the repairs or renovations of that tangible personal property are exempt from a tax under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(h): 59-12-104 except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(i): amounts paid or charged for short-term rentals of tourist home, hotel, motel, or trailer court accommodations and services;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(j): amounts paid or charged for laundry or dry cleaning services;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(k): amounts paid or charged for leases or rentals of tangible personal property if within this state the tangible personal property is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(k)(i): stored;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(k)(ii): used; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(k)(iii): otherwise consumed;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(l): amounts paid or charged for tangible personal property if within this state the tangible personal property is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(l)(i): stored;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(l)(ii): used; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(l)(iii): consumed;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(m): amounts paid or charged for a sale:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(m)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(m)(i)(A): of a product transferred electronically; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(m)(i)(B): of a repair or renovation of a product transferred electronically; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(m)(ii): regardless of whether the sale provides:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(m)(ii)(A): a right of permanent use of the product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(m)(ii)(B): a right to use the product that is less than a permanent use, including a right:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(m)(ii)(B)(I): for a definite or specified length of time; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(m)(ii)(B)(II): that terminates upon the occurrence of a condition; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(n): sales of leased tangible personal property from the lessor to the lessee made in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2): 59-12-211; 59-12-215; 59-12-211; 59-12-215; 59-12-211; 59-12-215; 59-12-211; 59-12-215
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(a): 59-12-211; 59-12-215; 59-12-211; 59-12-215 Except as provided in Subsections (2)(b) through (f), a state tax and a local tax are imposed on a transaction described in Subsection (1) equal to the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(a)(i): 59-12-211; 59-12-215; 59-12-211; 59-12-215 a state tax imposed on the transaction at a tax rate equal to the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(a)(i)(A): 4.70% plus the rate specified in Subsection (11)(a); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(a)(i)(B): 59-12-211; 59-12-215; 59-12-211; 59-12-215
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(a)(i)(B)(I): 59-12-211; 59-12-215 the tax rate the state imposes in accordance with Part 18, Additional State Sales and Use Tax Act, if the location of the transaction as determined under Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(a)(i)(B)(II): 59-12-211; 59-12-215 the tax rate the state imposes in accordance with Part 20, Supplemental State Sales and Use Tax Act, if the location of the transaction as determined under Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(a)(ii): a local tax equal to the sum of the tax rates a county, city, or town imposes on the transaction under this chapter other than this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(b): Except as provided in Subsection (2)(f) or (g) and subject to Subsection (2)(l), a state tax and a local tax are imposed on a transaction described in Subsection (1)(d) equal to the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(b)(i): a state tax imposed on the transaction at a tax rate of 2%; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(b)(ii): a local tax equal to the sum of the tax rates a county, city, or town imposes on the transaction under this chapter other than this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(c): Except as provided in Subsection (2)(f) or (g), a state tax and a local tax are imposed on amounts paid or charged for food and food ingredients equal to the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(c)(i): a state tax imposed on the amounts paid or charged for food and food ingredients at a tax rate of 1.75%; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(c)(ii): a local tax equal to the sum of the tax rates a county, city, or town imposes on the amounts paid or charged for food and food ingredients under this chapter other than this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(d): Except as provided in Subsection (2)(f) or (g), a state tax is imposed on amounts paid or charged for fuel to a common carrier that is a railroad for use in a locomotive engine at a rate of 4.85%.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(i)(A): If a shared vehicle owner certifies to the commission, on a form prescribed by the commission, that the shared vehicle is an individual-owned shared vehicle, a tax imposed under Subsection (2)(a)(i)(A) does not apply to car sharing, a car-sharing program, a shared vehicle driver, or a shared vehicle owner.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(i)(B): A shared vehicle owner's certification described in Subsection (2)(e)(i)(A) is required once during the time that the shared vehicle owner owns the shared vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(i)(C): The commission shall verify that a shared vehicle is an individual-owned shared vehicle by verifying that the applicable Utah taxes imposed under this chapter were paid on the purchase of the shared vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(i)(D): The exception under Subsection (2)(e)(i)(A) applies to a certified individual-owned shared vehicle shared through a car-sharing program even if non-certified shared vehicles are also available to be shared through the same car-sharing program.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(ii): A tax imposed under Subsection (2)(a)(i)(B) or (2)(a)(ii) applies to car sharing.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(iii)(A): A car-sharing program may rely in good faith on a shared vehicle owner's representation that the shared vehicle is an individual-owned shared vehicle certified with the commission as described in Subsection (2)(e)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(iii)(B): If a car-sharing program relies in good faith on a shared vehicle owner's representation that the shared vehicle is an individual-owned shared vehicle certified with the commission as described in Subsection (2)(e)(i), the car-sharing program is not liable for any tax, penalty, fee, or other sanction imposed on the shared vehicle owner.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(iv): If all shared vehicles shared through a car-sharing program are certified as described in Subsection (2)(e)(i)(A) for a tax period, the car-sharing program has no obligation to collect and remit the tax under Subsection (2)(a)(i)(A) for that tax period.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(v): A car-sharing program is not required to list or otherwise identify an individual-owned shared vehicle on a return or an attachment to a return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(vi): A car-sharing program shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(vi)(A): retain tax information for each car-sharing program transaction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(vi)(B): provide the information described in Subsection (2)(e)(vi)(A) to the commission at the commission's request.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f): 59-12-211; 59-12-215; 59-12-211; 59-12-215
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(i): 59-12-211; 59-12-215; 59-12-211; 59-12-215 For a bundled transaction that is attributable to food and food ingredients and tangible personal property other than food and food ingredients, a state tax and a local tax is imposed on the entire bundled transaction equal to the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(i)(A): 59-12-211; 59-12-215; 59-12-211; 59-12-215 a state tax imposed on the entire bundled transaction equal to the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(i)(A)(I): the tax rate described in Subsection (2)(a)(i)(A); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(i)(A)(II): 59-12-211; 59-12-215; 59-12-211; 59-12-215
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(i)(A)(II)(Aa): 59-12-211; 59-12-215 the tax rate the state imposes in accordance with Part 18, Additional State Sales and Use Tax Act, if the location of the transaction as determined under Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(i)(A)(II)(Bb): 59-12-211; 59-12-215 the tax rate the state imposes in accordance with Part 20, Supplemental State Sales and Use Tax Act, if the location of the transaction as determined under Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(i)(B): a local tax imposed on the entire bundled transaction at the sum of the tax rates described in Subsection (2)(a)(ii).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(ii): If an optional computer software maintenance contract is a bundled transaction that consists of taxable and nontaxable products that are not separately itemized on an invoice or similar billing document, the purchase of the optional computer software maintenance contract is 40% taxable under this chapter and 60% nontaxable under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(iii): Subject to Subsection (2)(f)(iv), for a bundled transaction other than a bundled transaction described in Subsection (2)(f)(i) or (ii):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(iii)(A): if the sales price of the bundled transaction is attributable to tangible personal property, a product, or a service that is subject to taxation under this chapter and tangible personal property, a product, or service that is not subject to taxation under this chapter, the entire bundled transaction is subject to taxation under this chapter unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(iii)(A)(I): the seller is able to identify by reasonable and verifiable standards the tangible personal property, product, or service that is not subject to taxation under this chapter from the books and records the seller keeps in the seller's regular course of business; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(iii)(A)(II): state or federal law provides otherwise; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(iii)(B): if the sales price of a bundled transaction is attributable to two or more items of tangible personal property, products, or services that are subject to taxation under this chapter at different rates, the entire bundled transaction is subject to taxation under this chapter at the higher tax rate unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(iii)(B)(I): the seller is able to identify by reasonable and verifiable standards the tangible personal property, product, or service that is subject to taxation under this chapter at the lower tax rate from the books and records the seller keeps in the seller's regular course of business; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(iii)(B)(II): state or federal law provides otherwise.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(iv): For purposes of Subsection (2)(f)(iii), books and records that a seller keeps in the seller's regular course of business includes books and records the seller keeps in the regular course of business for nontax purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(g): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(g)(i): Except as otherwise provided in this chapter and subject to Subsections (2)(g)(ii) and (iii), if a transaction consists of the sale, lease, or rental of tangible personal property, a product, or a service that is subject to taxation under this chapter, and the sale, lease, or rental of tangible personal property, other property, a product, or a service that is not subject to taxation under this chapter, the entire transaction is subject to taxation under this chapter unless the seller, at the time of the transaction:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(g)(i)(A): separately states the portion of the transaction that is not subject to taxation under this chapter on an invoice, bill of sale, or similar document provided to the purchaser; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(g)(i)(B): is able to identify by reasonable and verifiable standards, from the books and records the seller keeps in the seller's regular course of business, the portion of the transaction that is not subject to taxation under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(g)(ii): A purchaser and a seller may correct the taxability of a transaction if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(g)(ii)(A): after the transaction occurs, the purchaser and the seller discover that the portion of the transaction that is not subject to taxation under this chapter was not separately stated on an invoice, bill of sale, or similar document provided to the purchaser because of an error or ignorance of the law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(g)(ii)(B): the seller is able to identify by reasonable and verifiable standards, from the books and records the seller keeps in the seller's regular course of business, the portion of the transaction that is not subject to taxation under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(g)(iii): For purposes of Subsections (2)(g)(i) and (ii), books and records that a seller keeps in the seller's regular course of business includes books and records the seller keeps in the regular course of business for nontax purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(h): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(h)(i): If the sales price of a transaction is attributable to two or more items of tangible personal property, products, or services that are subject to taxation under this chapter at different rates, the entire purchase is subject to taxation under this chapter at the higher tax rate unless the seller, at the time of the transaction:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(h)(i)(A): separately states the items subject to taxation under this chapter at each of the different rates on an invoice, bill of sale, or similar document provided to the purchaser; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(h)(i)(B): is able to identify by reasonable and verifiable standards the tangible personal property, product, or service that is subject to taxation under this chapter at the lower tax rate from the books and records the seller keeps in the seller's regular course of business.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(h)(ii): For purposes of Subsection (2)(h)(i), books and records that a seller keeps in the seller's regular course of business includes books and records the seller keeps in the regular course of business for nontax purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(i): Subject to Subsections (2)(j) and (k), a tax rate repeal or tax rate change for a tax rate imposed under the following shall take effect on the first day of a calendar quarter:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(i)(i): Subsection (2)(a)(i)(A);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(i)(ii): Subsection (2)(b)(i);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(i)(iii): Subsection (2)(c)(i); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(i)(iv): Subsection (2)(f)(i)(A)(I).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(j): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(j)(i): A tax rate increase takes effect on the first day of the first billing period that begins on or after the effective date of the tax rate increase if the billing period for the transaction begins before the effective date of a tax rate increase imposed under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(j)(i)(A): Subsection (2)(a)(i)(A);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(j)(i)(B): Subsection (2)(b)(i);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(j)(i)(C): Subsection (2)(c)(i); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(j)(i)(D): Subsection (2)(f)(i)(A)(I).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(j)(ii): The repeal of a tax or a tax rate decrease applies to a billing period if the billing statement for the billing period is rendered on or after the effective date of the repeal of the tax or the tax rate decrease imposed under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(j)(ii)(A): Subsection (2)(a)(i)(A);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(j)(ii)(B): Subsection (2)(b)(i);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(j)(ii)(C): Subsection (2)(c)(i); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(j)(ii)(D): Subsection (2)(f)(i)(A)(I).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(k): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(k)(i): For a tax rate described in Subsection (2)(k)(ii), if a tax due on a catalogue sale is computed on the basis of sales and use tax rates published in the catalogue, a tax rate repeal or change in a tax rate takes effect:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(k)(i)(A): on the first day of a calendar quarter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(k)(i)(B): beginning 60 days after the effective date of the tax rate repeal or tax rate change.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(k)(ii): Subsection (2)(k)(i) applies to the tax rates described in the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(k)(ii)(A): Subsection (2)(a)(i)(A);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(k)(ii)(B): Subsection (2)(b)(i);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(k)(ii)(C): Subsection (2)(c)(i); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(k)(ii)(D): Subsection (2)(f)(i)(A)(I).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(k)(iii): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission may by rule define the term "catalogue sale."
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(l): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(l)(i): For a location described in Subsection (2)(l)(ii), the commission shall determine the taxable status of a sale of gas, electricity, heat, coal, fuel oil, or other fuel based on the predominant use of the gas, electricity, heat, coal, fuel oil, or other fuel at the location.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(l)(ii): Subsection (2)(l)(i) applies to a location where gas, electricity, heat, coal, fuel oil, or other fuel is furnished through a single meter for two or more of the following uses:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(l)(ii)(A): a commercial use;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(l)(ii)(B): an industrial use; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(l)(ii)(C): a residential use.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(3)(b)(i): the tax imposed by Subsection (2)(a)(ii);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(3)(b)(ii): the tax imposed by Subsection (2)(b)(ii);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(3)(b)(iii): the tax imposed by Subsection (2)(c)(ii); and

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(3)(c): The state tax imposed by Subsection (2)(d) shall be deposited into the General Fund.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(17)(e)(ii): The commission shall discontinue distributions of sales and use tax revenue under Subsection (17)(b) at the beginning of the calendar quarter that begins at least 90 days after the date that the commission receives the written notice under Subsection (17)(e)(i).


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103 Sales and use tax base -- Rates -- Effective dates -- Use of sales and use tax revenues.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1): 59-12-104; 59-12-104; 59-12-104 A tax is imposed on the purchaser as provided in this part on the purchase price or sales price for amounts paid or charged for the following transactions:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(a): retail sales of tangible personal property made within the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(b): amounts paid for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(b)(i): telecommunications service, other than mobile telecommunications service, that originates and terminates within the boundaries of this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(b)(ii): mobile telecommunications service that originates and terminates within the boundaries of one state only to the extent permitted by the Mobile Telecommunications Sourcing Act, 4 U.S.C. Sec. 116 et seq.; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(b)(iii): an ancillary service associated with a:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(b)(iii)(A): telecommunications service described in Subsection (1)(b)(i); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(b)(iii)(B): mobile telecommunications service described in Subsection (1)(b)(ii);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(c): sales of the following for commercial use:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(c)(i): gas;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(c)(ii): electricity;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(c)(iii): heat;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(c)(iv): coal;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(c)(v): fuel oil; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(c)(vi): other fuels;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(d): sales of the following for residential use:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(d)(i): gas;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(d)(ii): electricity;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(d)(iii): heat;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(d)(iv): coal;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(d)(v): fuel oil; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(d)(vi): other fuels;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(e): sales of prepared food;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(f): 59-12-104 except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(g): 59-12-104 amounts paid or charged for services for repairs or renovations of tangible personal property, unless Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(g)(i): the tangible personal property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(g)(ii): parts used in the repairs or renovations of the tangible personal property described in Subsection (1)(g)(i), regardless of whether:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(g)(ii)(A): any parts are actually used in the repairs or renovations of that tangible personal property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(g)(ii)(B): the particular parts used in the repairs or renovations of that tangible personal property are exempt from a tax under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(h): 59-12-104 except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(1)(i): amounts paid or charged for short-term rentals of tourist home, hotel, motel, or trailer court accommodations and services;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2): 59-12-211; 59-12-215; 59-12-211; 59-12-215; 59-12-211; 59-12-215; 59-12-211; 59-12-215

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(c)(i): Except as provided in Subsection (2)(f) or (g), a local tax is imposed on amounts paid or charged for food and food ingredients equal to the sum of the tax rates a county, city, or town imposes under this chapter on the amounts paid or charged for food or food ingredients.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(c)(ii): There is no state tax imposed on amounts paid or charged for food and food ingredients.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(d): Except as provided in Subsection (2)(f) or (g), a state tax is imposed on amounts paid or charged for fuel to a common carrier that is a railroad for use in a locomotive engine at a rate of 4.85%.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(i)(A): If a shared vehicle owner certifies to the commission, on a form prescribed by the commission, that the shared vehicle is an individual-owned shared vehicle, a tax imposed under Subsection (2)(a)(i)(A) does not apply to car sharing, a car-sharing program, a shared vehicle driver, or a shared vehicle owner.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(i)(B): A shared vehicle owner's certification described in Subsection (2)(e)(i)(A) is required once during the time that the shared vehicle owner owns the shared vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(i)(C): The commission shall verify that a shared vehicle is an individual-owned shared vehicle by verifying that the applicable Utah taxes imposed under this chapter were paid on the purchase of the shared vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(i)(D): The exception under Subsection (2)(e)(i)(A) applies to a certified individual-owned shared vehicle shared through a car-sharing program even if non-certified shared vehicles are also available to be shared through the same car-sharing program.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(ii): A tax imposed under Subsection (2)(a)(i)(B) or (2)(a)(ii) applies to car sharing.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(iii)(A): A car-sharing program may rely in good faith on a shared vehicle owner's representation that the shared vehicle is an individual-owned shared vehicle certified with the commission as described in Subsection (2)(e)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(iii)(B): If a car-sharing program relies in good faith on a shared vehicle owner's representation that the shared vehicle is an individual-owned shared vehicle certified with the commission as described in Subsection (2)(e)(i), the car-sharing program is not liable for any tax, penalty, fee, or other sanction imposed on the shared vehicle owner.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(iv): If all shared vehicles shared through a car-sharing program are certified as described in Subsection (2)(e)(i)(A) for a tax period, the car-sharing program has no obligation to collect and remit the tax under Subsection (2)(a)(i)(A) for that tax period.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(v): A car-sharing program is not required to list or otherwise identify an individual-owned shared vehicle on a return or an attachment to a return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(vi): A car-sharing program shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(vi)(A): retain tax information for each car-sharing program transaction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(e)(vi)(B): provide the information described in Subsection (2)(e)(vi)(A) to the commission at the commission's request.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(i)(B): a local tax imposed on the entire bundled transaction at the sum of the tax rates described in Subsection (2)(a)(ii).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(ii): If an optional computer software maintenance contract is a bundled transaction that consists of taxable and nontaxable products that are not separately itemized on an invoice or similar billing document, the purchase of the optional computer software maintenance contract is 40% taxable under this chapter and 60% nontaxable under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(iii): Subject to Subsection (2)(f)(iv), for a bundled transaction other than a bundled transaction described in Subsection (2)(f)(i) or (ii):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(iii)(A): if the sales price of the bundled transaction is attributable to tangible personal property, a product, or a service that is subject to taxation under this chapter and tangible personal property, a product, or service that is not subject to taxation under this chapter, the entire bundled transaction is subject to taxation under this chapter unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(iii)(A)(I): the seller is able to identify by reasonable and verifiable standards the tangible personal property, product, or service that is not subject to taxation under this chapter from the books and records the seller keeps in the seller's regular course of business; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(iii)(A)(II): state or federal law provides otherwise; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(iii)(B): if the sales price of a bundled transaction is attributable to two or more items of tangible personal property, products, or services that are subject to taxation under this chapter at different rates, the entire bundled transaction is subject to taxation under this chapter at the higher tax rate unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(iii)(B)(I): the seller is able to identify by reasonable and verifiable standards the tangible personal property, product, or service that is subject to taxation under this chapter at the lower tax rate from the books and records the seller keeps in the seller's regular course of business; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(iii)(B)(II): state or federal law provides otherwise.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(f)(iv): For purposes of Subsection (2)(f)(iii), books and records that a seller keeps in the seller's regular course of business includes books and records the seller keeps in the regular course of business for nontax purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(g): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(g)(i): Except as otherwise provided in this chapter and subject to Subsections (2)(g)(ii) and (iii), if a transaction consists of the sale, lease, or rental of tangible personal property, a product, or a service that is subject to taxation under this chapter, and the sale, lease, or rental of tangible personal property, other property, a product, or a service that is not subject to taxation under this chapter, the entire transaction is subject to taxation under this chapter unless the seller, at the time of the transaction:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(g)(i)(A): separately states the portion of the transaction that is not subject to taxation under this chapter on an invoice, bill of sale, or similar document provided to the purchaser; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(g)(i)(B): is able to identify by reasonable and verifiable standards, from the books and records the seller keeps in the seller's regular course of business, the portion of the transaction that is not subject to taxation under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(g)(ii): A purchaser and a seller may correct the taxability of a transaction if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(g)(ii)(A): after the transaction occurs, the purchaser and the seller discover that the portion of the transaction that is not subject to taxation under this chapter was not separately stated on an invoice, bill of sale, or similar document provided to the purchaser because of an error or ignorance of the law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(g)(ii)(B): the seller is able to identify by reasonable and verifiable standards, from the books and records the seller keeps in the seller's regular course of business, the portion of the transaction that is not subject to taxation under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(g)(iii): For purposes of Subsections (2)(g)(i) and (ii), books and records that a seller keeps in the seller's regular course of business includes books and records the seller keeps in the regular course of business for nontax purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(h): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(h)(i): If the sales price of a transaction is attributable to two or more items of tangible personal property, products, or services that are subject to taxation under this chapter at different rates, the entire purchase is subject to taxation under this chapter at the higher tax rate unless the seller, at the time of the transaction:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(h)(i)(A): separately states the items subject to taxation under this chapter at each of the different rates on an invoice, bill of sale, or similar document provided to the purchaser; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(h)(i)(B): is able to identify by reasonable and verifiable standards the tangible personal property, product, or service that is subject to taxation under this chapter at the lower tax rate from the books and records the seller keeps in the seller's regular course of business.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(h)(ii): For purposes of Subsection (2)(h)(i), books and records that a seller keeps in the seller's regular course of business includes books and records the seller keeps in the regular course of business for nontax purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(i): Subject to Subsections (2)(j) and (k), a tax rate repeal or tax rate change for a tax rate imposed under the following shall take effect on the first day of a calendar quarter:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(i)(i): Subsection (2)(a)(i)(A);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(i)(ii): Subsection (2)(b)(i); or

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(k): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(k)(i): For a tax rate described in Subsection (2)(k)(ii), if a tax due on a catalogue sale is computed on the basis of sales and use tax rates published in the catalogue, a tax rate repeal or change in a tax rate takes effect:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(l): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(l)(i): For a location described in Subsection (2)(l)(ii), the commission shall determine the taxable status of a sale of gas, electricity, heat, coal, fuel oil, or other fuel based on the predominant use of the gas, electricity, heat, coal, fuel oil, or other fuel at the location.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(l)(ii): Subsection (2)(l)(i) applies to a location where gas, electricity, heat, coal, fuel oil, or other fuel is furnished through a single meter for two or more of the following uses:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(l)(ii)(A): a commercial use;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(l)(ii)(B): an industrial use; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(2)(l)(ii)(C): a residential use.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(17)(b): Notwithstanding Subsection (3)(a), the commission shall distribute to the point of the mountain authority 50% of the revenue from the sales and use tax imposed by Subsection (2)(a)(i)(A) at a 4.7% rate, on transactions occurring on the point of the mountain state land.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(17)(c)(i): accurately describes the point of the mountain state land; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(17)(c)(ii): the point of the mountain authority certifies as accurate.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(17)(d)(ii): the point of the mountain authority certifies as accurate.
