Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-103(17)(e)(ii): The commission shall discontinue distributions of sales and use tax revenue under Subsection (17)(b) at the beginning of the calendar quarter that begins at least 90 days after the date that the commission receives the written notice under Subsection (17)(e)(i).


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104 Exemptions.
-------------------------------------------
Exemptions from the taxes imposed by this chapter are as follows:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(1): sales of aviation fuel, motor fuel, and special fuel subject to a Utah state excise tax under Chapter 13, Motor and Special Fuel Tax Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(2): 59-12-104.6; 11-13-103; 11-13-103 subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(2)(a): construction materials except:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(2)(a)(i): construction materials purchased by or on behalf of institutions of the public education system as defined in Utah Constitution, Article X, Section 2, provided the construction materials are clearly identified and segregated and installed or converted to real property which is owned by institutions of the public education system; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(2)(a)(ii): construction materials purchased by the state, its institutions, or its political subdivisions which are installed or converted to real property by employees of the state, its institutions, or its political subdivisions; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(2)(b): 11-13-103; 11-13-103 tangible personal property in connection with the construction, operation, maintenance, repair, or replacement of a project, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(3)(a): sales of an item described in Subsection (3)(b) from a vending machine if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(3)(a)(i): the proceeds of each sale do not exceed $1; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(3)(a)(ii): the seller or operator of the vending machine reports an amount equal to 150% of the cost of the item described in Subsection (3)(b) as goods consumed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(3)(b): Subsection (3)(a) applies to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(3)(b)(i): food and food ingredients; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(3)(b)(ii): prepared food;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(4)(a): sales of the following to a commercial airline carrier for in-flight consumption:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(4)(a)(i): alcoholic beverages;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(4)(a)(ii): food and food ingredients; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(4)(a)(iii): prepared food;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(4)(b): sales of tangible personal property or a product transferred electronically:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(4)(b)(i): to a passenger;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(4)(b)(ii): by a commercial airline carrier; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(4)(b)(iii): during a flight for in-flight consumption or in-flight use by the passenger; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(4)(c): services related to Subsection (4)(a) or (b);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(5): sales of parts and equipment for installation in an aircraft operated by a common carrier in interstate or foreign commerce;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(6): sales of commercials, motion picture films, prerecorded audio program tapes or records, and prerecorded video tapes by a producer, distributor, or studio to a motion picture exhibitor, distributor, or commercial television or radio broadcaster;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(7)(a): except as provided in Subsection (85) and subject to Subsection (7)(b), sales of cleaning or washing of tangible personal property if the cleaning or washing of the tangible personal property is not assisted cleaning or washing of tangible personal property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(7)(b): if a seller that sells at the same business location assisted cleaning or washing of tangible personal property and cleaning or washing of tangible personal property that is not assisted cleaning or washing of tangible personal property, the exemption described in Subsection (7)(a) applies if the seller separately accounts for the sales of the assisted cleaning or washing of the tangible personal property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(7)(c): for purposes of Subsection (7)(b) and in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission may make rules:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(7)(c)(i): governing the circumstances under which sales are at the same business location; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(7)(c)(ii): establishing the procedures and requirements for a seller to separately account for sales of assisted cleaning or washing of tangible personal property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(8): 59-12-104.1 sales made to or by religious or charitable institutions in the conduct of their regular religious or charitable functions and activities, if the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(9): sales of a vehicle of a type required to be registered under the motor vehicle laws of this state if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(9)(a): the sale is not from the vehicle's lessor to the vehicle's lessee;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(9)(b): the vehicle is not registered in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(9)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(9)(c)(i): the vehicle is not used in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(9)(c)(ii): the vehicle is used in this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(9)(c)(ii)(A): if the vehicle is not used to conduct business, for a time period that does not exceed the longer of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(9)(c)(ii)(A)(I): 30 days in any calendar year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(9)(c)(ii)(A)(II): the time period necessary to transport the vehicle to the borders of this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(9)(c)(ii)(B): if the vehicle is used to conduct business, for the time period necessary to transport the vehicle to the borders of this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(10): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(10)(a): amounts paid for an item described in Subsection (10)(b) if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(10)(a)(i): the item is intended for human use; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(10)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(10)(a)(ii)(A): a prescription was issued for the item; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(10)(a)(ii)(B): the item was purchased by a hospital or other medical facility; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(10)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(10)(b)(i): Subsection (10)(a) applies to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(10)(b)(i)(A): a drug;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(10)(b)(i)(B): a syringe; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(10)(b)(i)(C): a stoma supply; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(10)(b)(ii): in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission may by rule define the terms:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(10)(b)(ii)(A): "syringe"; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(10)(b)(ii)(B): "stoma supply";
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(11): 19-12-201 purchases or leases exempt under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(12): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(12)(a): sales of an item described in Subsection (12)(c) served by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(12)(a)(i): the following if the item described in Subsection (12)(c) is not available to the general public:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(12)(a)(i)(A): a church; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(12)(a)(i)(B): a charitable institution; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(12)(a)(ii): an institution of higher education if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(12)(a)(ii)(A): the item described in Subsection (12)(c) is not available to the general public; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(12)(a)(ii)(B): the item described in Subsection (12)(c) is prepaid as part of a student meal plan offered by the institution of higher education; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(12)(b): sales of an item described in Subsection (12)(c) provided for a patient by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(12)(b)(i): a medical facility; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(12)(b)(ii): a nursing facility; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(12)(c): Subsections (12)(a) and (b) apply to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(12)(c)(i): food and food ingredients;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(12)(c)(ii): prepared food; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(12)(c)(iii): alcoholic beverages;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(13): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(13)(a): except as provided in Subsection (13)(b), the sale of tangible personal property or a product transferred electronically by a person:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(13)(a)(i): regardless of the number of transactions involving the sale of that tangible personal property or product transferred electronically by that person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(13)(a)(ii): not regularly engaged in the business of selling that type of tangible personal property or product transferred electronically;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(13)(b): this Subsection (13) does not apply if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(13)(b)(i): the sale is one of a series of sales of a character to indicate that the person is regularly engaged in the business of selling that type of tangible personal property or product transferred electronically;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(13)(b)(ii): the person holds that person out as regularly engaged in the business of selling that type of tangible personal property or product transferred electronically;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(13)(b)(iii): the person sells an item of tangible personal property or product transferred electronically that the person purchased as a sale that is exempt under Subsection (25); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(13)(b)(iv): the sale is of a vehicle or vessel required to be titled or registered under the laws of this state in which case the tax is based upon:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(13)(b)(iv)(A): the bill of sale, lease agreement, or other written evidence of value of the vehicle or vessel being sold; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(13)(b)(iv)(B): in the absence of a bill of sale, lease agreement, or other written evidence of value, the fair market value of the vehicle or vessel being sold at the time of the sale as determined by the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(13)(c): in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission shall make rules establishing the circumstances under which:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(13)(c)(i): a person is regularly engaged in the business of selling a type of tangible personal property or product transferred electronically;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(13)(c)(ii): a sale of tangible personal property or a product transferred electronically is one of a series of sales of a character to indicate that a person is regularly engaged in the business of selling that type of tangible personal property or product transferred electronically; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(13)(c)(iii): a person holds that person out as regularly engaged in the business of selling a type of tangible personal property or product transferred electronically;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(14): amounts paid or charged for a purchase or lease of machinery, equipment, normal operating repair or replacement parts, or materials, except for office equipment or office supplies, by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(14)(a): a manufacturing facility that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(14)(a)(i): is located in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(14)(a)(ii): uses or consumes the machinery, equipment, normal operating repair or replacement parts, or materials:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(14)(a)(ii)(A): in the manufacturing process to manufacture an item sold as tangible personal property, as the commission may define that phrase in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(14)(a)(ii)(B): for a scrap recycler, to process an item sold as tangible personal property, as the commission may define that phrase in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(14)(b): an establishment, as the commission defines that term in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(14)(b)(i): is described in NAICS Subsector 212, Mining (except Oil and Gas), or NAICS Code 213113, Support Activities for Coal Mining, 213114, Support Activities for Metal Mining, or 213115, Support Activities for Nonmetallic Minerals (except Fuels) Mining, of the 2002 North American Industry Classification System of the federal Executive Office of the President, Office of Management and Budget;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(14)(b)(ii): is located in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(14)(b)(iii): uses or consumes the machinery, equipment, normal operating repair or replacement parts, or materials in:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(14)(b)(iii)(A): the production process to produce an item sold as tangible personal property, as the commission may define that phrase in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(14)(b)(iii)(B): research and development, as the commission may define that phrase in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(14)(b)(iii)(C): transporting, storing, or managing tailings, overburden, or similar waste materials produced from mining;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(14)(b)(iii)(D): developing or maintaining a road, tunnel, excavation, or similar feature used in mining; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(14)(b)(iii)(E): preventing, controlling, or reducing dust or other pollutants from mining; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(14)(c): an establishment, as the commission defines that term in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(14)(c)(i): is described in NAICS Code 518112, Web Search Portals, of the 2002 North American Industry Classification System of the federal Executive Office of the President, Office of Management and Budget;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(14)(c)(ii): is located in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(14)(c)(iii): uses or consumes the machinery, equipment, normal operating repair or replacement parts, or materials in the operation of the web search portal;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(15): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(15)(a): sales of the following if the requirements of Subsection (15)(b) are met:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(15)(a)(i): tooling;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(15)(a)(ii): special tooling;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(15)(a)(iii): support equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(15)(a)(iv): special test equipment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(15)(a)(v): parts used in the repairs or renovations of tooling or equipment described in Subsections (15)(a)(i) through (iv); and

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(56)(b)(iii): unless the tangible personal property is used or acquired for an increase in capacity described in Subsection (56)(a)(i)(C)(II), tangible personal property used or acquired after:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(56)(b)(iii)(A): the waste energy facility described in Subsection (56)(a)(i) is operational as described in Subsection (56)(a)(iii); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(56)(b)(iii)(B): the increased capacity described in Subsection (56)(a)(i) is operational as described in Subsection (56)(a)(iii);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(57):

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(58):

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104 Exemptions.
-------------------------------------------
Exemptions from the taxes imposed by this chapter are as follows:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(1): sales of aviation fuel, motor fuel, and special fuel subject to a Utah state excise tax under Chapter 13, Motor and Special Fuel Tax Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(2): 59-12-104.6; 11-13-103; 11-13-103 subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(2)(a): construction materials except:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104(2)(a)(i): construction materials purchased by or on behalf of institutions of the public education system as defined in Utah Constitution, Article X, Section 2, provided the construction materials are clearly identified and segregated and installed or converted to real property which is owned by institutions of the public education system; and

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.2(1): As used in this section "tribal taxing area" means the geographical area that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.2(1)(a): is subject to the taxing authority of the Navajo Nation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.2(1)(b): consists of:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.2(1)(b)(i)(A): within the limits of an Indian reservation under the jurisdiction of the federal government; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.2(1)(b)(i)(B): including any rights-of-way running through the reservation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.2(1)(b)(ii): all Indian allotments the Indian titles to which have not been extinguished, including any rights-of-way running through an Indian allotment.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3 Credit for certain repossessions of a motor vehicle.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(1): (2); (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(1)(a): (2); (3) Subject to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(1)(a)(i): has been repossessed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(1)(a)(ii): that the seller resells.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(1)(b): A seller of a motor vehicle other than the seller that collects a tax under this chapter on the sale of that motor vehicle may claim a credit for a tax under this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(1)(b)(i): for a motor vehicle that the seller:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(1)(b)(i)(A): repossessed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(1)(b)(i)(B): resells; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(1)(b)(ii): if the seller that collected the tax under this chapter on that motor vehicle:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(1)(b)(ii)(A): is no longer doing business in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(1)(b)(ii)(B): does not owe a tax under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(2): (1) The amount of the credit allowed by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(2)(a): the portion of the motor vehicle's purchase price that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(2)(a)(i): was subject to a tax under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(2)(a)(ii): remains unpaid after the motor vehicle is resold; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(2)(b): the sum of the tax rates imposed:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(2)(b)(i): under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(2)(b)(ii): on the motor vehicle's purchase price; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(2)(b)(iii): on the date the motor vehicle was purchased by the person that owns the motor vehicle at the time of the repossession.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(3): (4); (1)(b); (1)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(3)(a): (1)(b) on the portion of the motor vehicle's unpaid purchase price that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(3)(a)(i): the seller recovers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(3)(a)(ii): (1)(b) is used to calculate the credit allowed by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(3)(b): on a return filed for the time period for which the portion of the motor vehicle's unpaid purchase price is recovered.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.3(4): A credit under this section may not be reduced by any amount of a motor vehicle's unpaid purchase price that a seller recovers as a result of reselling the vehicle, regardless of whether that amount is included in calculating a credit under this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.6 Procedure for claiming a sales and use tax exemption for certain lodging related purchases -- Rulemaking authority -- Applicability of section.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.6(1): 59-12-103(1)(i); (1)(c)(i); (1)(c)(i) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.6(1)(a): "Designated establishment within the lodging industry" means an establishment described in NAICS Code 721110 or 721191 of the 2007 North American Industry Classification System of the federal Executive Office of the President, Office of Management and Budget.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.6(1)(b): "Exempt purchaser" means a person that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.6(1)(b)(i): makes a lodging related purchase; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.6(1)(b)(ii): may claim an exemption from a tax under this chapter for the purchase.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.6(1)(c): 59-12-103(1)(i); (1)(c)(i); (1)(c)(i) "Lodging related purchase" means the purchase of the following from a seller that is a designated establishment within the lodging industry:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.6(1)(c)(i): 59-12-103(1)(i) accommodations and services described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.6(1)(c)(ii): (1)(c)(i); (1)(c)(i) any other tangible personal property, product, or service that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.6(1)(c)(ii)(A): (1)(c)(i) purchased as part of a transaction that includes the purchase of accommodations and services described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.6(1)(c)(ii)(B): (1)(c)(i) included on the invoice, bill of sale, or similar document provided to the purchaser of the accommodations and services described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.6(2): (3); (2)(a) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.6(2)(a): shall pay a tax that would otherwise be imposed under this chapter on the lodging related purchase but for the purchaser being allowed to claim an exemption from a tax under this chapter for the purchase; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.6(2)(b): (2)(a) may apply to the commission for a refund of the tax described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.6(3): 59-12-104.1 An exempt purchaser that makes a lodging related purchase may claim an exemption from a tax under this chapter at the point of sale if the exempt purchaser:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.6(3)(a): is an agency or instrumentality of the United States;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.6(3)(b): is exempt from a tax under this chapter on a lodging related purchase as authorized by a diplomatic tax exemption card issued by the United States; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.6(3)(c): 59-12-104.1 may claim the exemption at the point of sale in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.6(4): An exempt purchaser that applies to the commission for a refund may not make an application to the commission for a refund more frequently than monthly.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.10 Exemption from sales tax for cannabis.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.10(1): 26B-4-201; 26B-4-201; 26B-4-201; 26B-4-201; 26B-4-201 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.10(1)(a): 26B-4-201 "Cannabis" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.10(1)(b): 26B-4-201 "Cannabis product" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.10(1)(c): 26B-4-201 "Medical cannabis device" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.10(1)(d): 26B-4-201 "Medical cannabis pharmacy" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.10(1)(e): 26B-4-201 "Medicinal dosage form" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.10(2): 59-12-104 In addition to the exemptions described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.10(2)(a): cannabis in a medicinal dosage form; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.10(2)(b): a cannabis product in a medicinal dosage form.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-104.10(3): The sale of a medical cannabis device by a medical cannabis pharmacy is subject to the taxes this chapter imposes.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107 Definitions -- Collection, remittance, and payment of tax by sellers or other persons -- Returns -- Reports -- Direct payment by purchaser of vehicle -- Other liability for collection -- Rulemaking authority -- Credits -- Treatment of bad debt -- Penalties and interest.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(1): (2)(a)(i); (2)(a)(i) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(1)(a): "Ownership" means direct ownership or indirect ownership through a parent, subsidiary, or affiliate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(1)(b): (2)(a)(i); (2)(a)(i) "Related seller" means a seller that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(1)(b)(i): (2)(a)(i) meets one or more of the criteria described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(1)(b)(ii): (2)(a)(i) delivers tangible personal property, a service, or a product transferred electronically that is sold:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(1)(b)(ii)(A): (2)(a)(i) by a seller that does not meet one or more of the criteria described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(1)(b)(ii)(B): to a purchaser in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(1)(c): "Substantial ownership interest" means an ownership interest in a business entity if that ownership interest is greater than the degree of ownership of equity interest specified in 15 U.S.C. Sec. 78p, with respect to a person other than a director or an officer.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(3)(a): 59-12-107.1 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(3)(b): A seller may not collect as tax an amount, without regard to fractional parts of one cent, in excess of the tax computed at the rates prescribed by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(3)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(3)(c)(i): Each seller shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(3)(c)(i)(A): give the purchaser a receipt for the tax collected; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(3)(c)(i)(B): bill the tax as a separate item and declare the name of this state and the seller's sales and use tax license number on the invoice for the sale.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(3)(c)(ii): The receipt or invoice is prima facie evidence that the seller has collected the tax and relieves the purchaser of the liability for reporting the tax to the commission as a consumer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(3)(d): A seller is not required to maintain a separate account for the tax collected, but is considered to be a person charged with receipt, safekeeping, and transfer of public money.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(3)(e): Taxes collected by a seller pursuant to this chapter shall be held in trust for the benefit of the state and for payment to the commission in the manner and at the time provided for in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(3)(f): If any seller, during any reporting period, collects as a tax an amount in excess of the lawful state and local percentage of total taxable sales allowed under this chapter, the seller shall remit to the commission the full amount of the tax imposed under this chapter, plus any excess.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(3)(g): If the accounting methods regularly employed by the seller in the transaction of the seller's business are such that reports of sales made during a calendar month or quarterly period will impose unnecessary hardships, the commission may accept reports at intervals that, in the commission's opinion, will better suit the convenience of the taxpayer or seller and will not jeopardize collection of the tax.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(10)(g): (10)(f) For purposes of reporting a recovery of a portion of bad debt under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(10)(g)(i): in a proportional amount:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(10)(g)(i)(A): to the purchase price of the tangible personal property, product transferred electronically, or service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(10)(g)(i)(B): to the tax due under this chapter on the tangible personal property, product transferred electronically, or service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(10)(g)(ii): to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(10)(g)(ii)(A): interest charges;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(10)(g)(ii)(B): service charges; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(10)(g)(ii)(C): other charges.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(10)(h): (10) A seller's certified service provider may make a deduction or claim a refund for bad debt on behalf of the seller:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(10)(h)(i): (10) in accordance with this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(10)(h)(ii): if the certified service provider credits or refunds the entire amount of the bad debt deduction or refund to the seller.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(10)(i): A seller may allocate bad debt among the states that are members of the agreement if the seller's books and records support that allocation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(11): 59-1-401; Chapter 1, Part 14, Assessment, Collections, and Refunds Act; 59-12-111; 59-1-401; 59-1-402
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(11)(a): A seller may not, with intent to evade any tax, fail to timely remit the full amount of tax required by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(11)(b): 59-1-401 A violation of this section is punishable as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(11)(c): Chapter 1, Part 14, Assessment, Collections, and Refunds Act; 59-12-111; 59-1-401; 59-1-402 Each person that fails to pay any tax to the state or any amount of tax required to be paid to the state, except amounts determined to be due by the commission under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107(11)(d): For purposes of prosecution under this section, each quarterly tax period in which a seller, with intent to evade any tax, collects a tax and fails to timely remit the full amount of the tax required to be remitted constitutes a separate offense.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.1 Direct payment permit.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.1(1): 59-12-106; 59-12-211; 59-12-212; 59-12-213 The commission may issue a direct payment permit to a seller that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.1(1)(a): 59-12-106 obtains a license under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.1(1)(b): makes aggregate purchases of at least $1,500,000 for each of the three years prior to the year in which the commission issues the direct payment permit to the seller;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.1(1)(c): has a record of timely payment of taxes under this chapter as determined by the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.1(1)(d): 59-12-211; 59-12-212; 59-12-213 demonstrates to the commission that the seller has the ability to determine the appropriate location of a transaction:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.1(1)(d)(i): 59-12-211; 59-12-212; 59-12-213 under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.1(1)(d)(i)(A): 59-12-211 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.1(1)(d)(i)(B): 59-12-212 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.1(1)(d)(i)(C): 59-12-213 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.1(1)(d)(ii): for each transaction for which the seller makes a purchase using the direct payment permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.1(2): The commission shall within 120 days after the date a seller applies for a direct payment permit notify the seller of the commission's decision to issue or deny the issuance of the direct payment permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.1(3): 59-12-103(1)(i); 59-12-103(1)(f); 59-12-103(1)(b); 59-12-103(1)(c) A direct payment permit may not be used in connection with the following transactions:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.1(3)(a)(ii): food and food ingredients;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6 Marketplace facilitator collection, remittance, and payment of sales tax obligation -- Marketplace seller collection, remittance, and payment of sales tax obligation -- Liability for collection.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(1): 59-12-107; 59-12-107(2)(a); (b) A marketplace facilitator shall pay or collect and remit taxes imposed by this chapter in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(1)(a): 59-12-107(2)(a); (b) if the marketplace facilitator meets one or more of the criteria provided for in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(1)(b): on the sales the marketplace facilitator made on the marketplace facilitator's own behalf.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(2): (3); (2); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(2)(a): (3) A marketplace facilitator shall pay or collect and remit taxes imposed by this chapter in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(2)(a)(i): that exceed $100,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(2)(a)(ii): in 200 or more separate transactions.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(2)(b): (2) For purposes of determining if a marketplace facilitator meets or exceeds one or both thresholds described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(2)(b)(i): the marketplace facilitator's sales; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(2)(b)(ii): any sales the marketplace facilitator makes or facilitates for a marketplace seller.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(2)(c): (2)(a) A marketplace facilitator without a physical presence in this state shall begin collecting and remitting the taxes imposed by this chapter no later than the first day of the calendar quarter that is at least 60 days after the day on which the marketplace facilitator meets or exceeds either threshold described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(3): (2); 59-12-107; 59-12-107 A marketplace facilitator described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(3)(a): makes on the marketplace facilitator's own behalf; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(3)(b): 59-12-107; 59-12-107 makes or facilitates on behalf of a marketplace seller, regardless of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(3)(b)(i): 59-12-107 whether the marketplace seller has an obligation to pay or collect and remit taxes under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(3)(b)(ii): 59-12-107 whether the marketplace seller would have been required to pay or collect and remit taxes under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(3)(b)(iii): the amount of the sales price or the purchase price that accrues to or benefits the marketplace facilitator, the marketplace seller, or any other person.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(4): Chapter 1, General Taxation Policies A marketplace facilitator shall comply with the procedures and requirements in this chapter and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(4)(a): the sales that the marketplace facilitator makes on the marketplace facilitator's own behalf; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(4)(b): the sales that the marketplace facilitator makes or facilitates on behalf of one or more marketplace sellers.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(5)(a): The commission may audit the marketplace facilitator for sales made or facilitated through the marketplace facilitator's marketplace on behalf of one or more marketplace sellers.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(5)(b): The commission may not audit the marketplace seller for sales made or facilitated through the marketplace facilitator's marketplace on the marketplace seller's behalf.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(6): Nothing in this section prohibits a marketplace facilitator from providing in a marketplace facilitator's agreement with a marketplace seller for the recovery of taxes, and any related interest or penalties to the extent that a tax, interest, or penalty is assessed by the state in an audit of the marketplace facilitator on a retail sale:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(6)(a): that a marketplace facilitator makes or facilitates on behalf of a marketplace seller; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(6)(b): for which the marketplace facilitator relied on incorrect or incomplete information provided by the marketplace seller.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(7): (7)(b); (c); (7)(a); (7)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(7)(a): (7)(b); (c) Subject to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(7)(a)(i): the marketplace facilitator made or facilitated the sale through the marketplace facilitator's marketplace on or before December 31, 2022;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(7)(a)(ii): the marketplace facilitator made or facilitated the sale on behalf of a marketplace seller and not on behalf of the marketplace facilitator;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(7)(a)(iii): the marketplace facilitator and the marketplace seller are not affiliates; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(7)(a)(iv): the failure to collect taxes was due to a good faith error other than an error in sourcing.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(7)(b): (7)(a) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(7)(b)(i): for sales made or facilitated during the 2019 or 2020 calendar year, the marketplace facilitator is not liable for the amount the marketplace facilitator fails to collect due to error that is equal to the error rate, but not to exceed a 7% error rate;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(7)(b)(ii): for sales made or facilitated during the 2021 calendar year, the marketplace facilitator is not liable for the amount the marketplace facilitator fails to collect due to error that is equal to the error rate, but not to exceed a 5% error rate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(7)(b)(iii): for sales made or facilitated during the 2022 calendar year, the marketplace facilitator is not liable for the amount the marketplace facilitator fails to collect due to error that is equal to the error rate, but not to exceed a 3% error rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(7)(c): (7)(b) The commission shall calculate the percentages described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(7)(c)(i): using the total taxes due on sales that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(7)(c)(i)(A): a marketplace facilitator made or facilitated in this state on behalf of one or more marketplace sellers during the calendar year that the sale for which the marketplace facilitator seeks relief was made or facilitated; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(7)(c)(i)(B): are sourced to the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(7)(c)(ii): not including sales that the marketplace facilitator or the marketplace facilitator's affiliates directly made during the same calendar year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(8): A marketplace seller shall pay or collect and remit taxes imposed by this chapter for a sale of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service that the marketplace seller makes other than through a marketplace facilitator if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(8)(a): the sale is sourced to this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(8)(b): the marketplace seller's sales in this state, other than through a marketplace facilitator, in the previous calendar year or the current calendar year:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(8)(b)(i): exceed $100,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(8)(b)(ii): occur in 200 or more separate transactions.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(9)(a): A marketplace seller may not pay or collect and remit taxes imposed by this chapter for any sale for which a marketplace facilitator is required to pay or collect and remit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(9)(b): A marketplace seller is not liable for a marketplace facilitator's failure to pay or collect and remit, or the marketplace facilitator's underpayment of, taxes imposed by this chapter for any sale for which a marketplace facilitator is required to pay or collect and remit the taxes imposed by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(10): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(10)(a): A purchaser of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service may file a claim for a refund with the marketplace facilitator if the purchaser overpaid taxes imposed under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-107.6(10)(b): No person may bring a class action against a marketplace facilitator in any court of the state on behalf of purchasers arising from or in any way related to an overpayment of taxes collected and remitted on sales made or facilitated by the marketplace facilitator on behalf of a marketplace seller, regardless of whether such claim is characterized as a tax refund claim.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-110.1 Refund or credit for taxes overpaid by a purchaser -- Seller reasonable business practice.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-110.1(1): Subject to the other provisions of this section, a purchaser may request from a seller a refund or credit of any amount that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-110.1(1)(a): the purchaser overpaid in taxes under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-110.1(1)(b): was collected by the seller.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-110.1(2): (2)(b); (1); 59-1-1410; (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-110.1(2)(a): (2)(b); (1); 59-1-1410 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-110.1(2)(b): (2)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-110.1(2)(b)(i): the commission is not required to make a refund or credit of an amount for which as of the date the refund or credit is to be given the purchaser has requested or received a refund or credit from the seller; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-110.1(2)(b)(ii): a seller is not required to refund or credit an amount for which as of the date the refund is to be given the purchaser has requested or received a refund or credit from the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-110.1(3): (1); (1); (3)(a) A purchaser may not bring a cause of action against a seller for a refund or credit described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-110.1(3)(a): (1) unless the purchaser provided the seller written notice that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-110.1(3)(a)(i): (1) the purchaser requests the refund or credit described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-110.1(3)(a)(ii): contains the information necessary for the seller to determine the validity of the request; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-110.1(3)(b): (3)(a) sooner than 60 days after the day on which the seller receives the written notice described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-110.1(4): A seller that collects a tax under this chapter that exceeds the amount the seller is required to collect under this chapter is presumed to have a reasonable business practice if the seller:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-110.1(4)(a): collects the tax under this chapter that exceeds the amount the seller is required to collect under this chapter through the use of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-110.1(4)(a)(i): a certified service provider; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-110.1(4)(a)(ii): a system certified by the state, including a proprietary system certified by the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-110.1(4)(b): remits to the commission all taxes the seller is required to remit to the commission under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-112 Tax a lien when selling business -- Liability of purchaser.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The tax imposed by this chapter shall be a lien upon the property of any person who sells out his business or stock of goods or quits business.  Such person shall complete the return provided for under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-116 License and tax in addition to other licenses and taxes.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The license and tax imposed by this chapter shall be in addition to all other licenses and taxes provided by law.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-117 Refusal to make or falsifying returns -- Evasion of payment of a tax -- Aiding or abetting an attempt to evade the payment of a tax -- Penalties -- Criminal violations.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-117(1): It is unlawful for any seller to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-117(1)(a): refuse to make any return required to be made under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-117(1)(b): make any false or fraudulent return or false statement on any return;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-117(1)(c): evade the payment of a tax, or any part of a tax imposed by this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-117(1)(d): aid or abet another in any attempt to evade the payment of the tax or any part imposed by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-117(2): 59-12-107; 59-1-401 Any person violating any of the provisions of this chapter, except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-117(3): (2) In addition to the penalties described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-117(4): 59-1-401 Any company making a false return or a return containing a false statement is guilty of a criminal violation as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-117(5): 59-1-401 Any person failing or refusing to furnish any return required to be made, failing or refusing to furnish a supplemental return or other data required by the commission, or rendering a false or fraudulent return is guilty of a criminal violation as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-117(6): 59-1-401 Any person required to make, render, sign, or verify any report under this chapter, who makes any false or fraudulent return with intent to defeat or evade the assessment or determination of amount due required by law to be made is guilty of a criminal violation as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-117(7): 59-1-401 Any violation of the provisions of this chapter, except as otherwise provided, shall be a criminal violation as provided in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-118 Commission's authority to administer sales and use tax.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Except as provided in SectionsUtah Code Annotated § 59-12-118(1): determining, assessing, and collecting any sales and use tax imposed pursuant to this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-118(2): representing each designated political subdivision's interest in any administrative proceeding involving the state or local option sales and use tax;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-118(3): adjudicating any administrative proceedings involving the state or local option sales and use tax;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-118(4): waiving, reducing, or compromising any penalty and interest imposed in connection with any determination of state or local option sales or use tax; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-118(5): prescribing forms and rules to conform with this chapter for the making of returns and for the ascertainment, assessment, and collection of the taxes imposed under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-123(1): 59-12-102; (1)(a) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-123(1)(a): 59-12-102 "Advertising and promotional direct mail" means printed material:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-123(1)(a)(ii): if the primary purpose of the printed material is to:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-123(1)(a)(ii)(B): attempt to popularize, secure, or sell financial support for a business, organization, person, or product.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-123(1)(b)(ii): a product transferred electronically; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-123(1)(b)(iii): a service.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-125 Seller or certified service provider reliance on commission information.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A seller or certified service provider is not liable for failing to collect a tax at a tax rate imposed under this part if the seller's or certified service provider's failure to collect the tax is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data provided by the commission in a database created by the commission:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-125(1): containing tax rates, boundaries, or local taxing jurisdiction assignments; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-125(2): indicating the taxability of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-129 Monetary allowance under the agreement.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-201 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Local Sales and Use Tax Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-202 Purpose and intent.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-202(1): It is the purpose of this part to provide the counties, cities, and towns of the state with an added source of revenue and to thereby assist them to meet their growing financial needs.  It is the legislative intent that this added revenue be used to the greatest possible extent by the counties, cities, and towns to finance their capital outlay requirements and to service their bonded indebtedness.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-202(2): It is the purpose of this part to provide an orderly and efficient system of administering, operating, and enforcing the state and local option sales and use tax.  The Legislature finds that intervention by counties, cities, and towns into the administration, operation, and enforcement of the local sales and use tax, particularly in the hearing and appeal process, increases the cost of administering both the local option sales and use tax and the state sales and use tax proceedings, and substantially delays the receipt of revenues for counties, cities, towns, and the state.  The Legislature finds that the interests and concerns of counties, cities, and towns can be adequately protected through the commission's enforcement efforts.  It is therefore the Legislature's intent to grant the commission exclusive authority to administer, operate, and enforce the local option sales and use tax, without interference from counties, cities, and towns and to allow intervention by any county, city, or town only in the limited circumstances where a particular hearing or appeal may result in a significant lessening of the revenues of any single county, city, or town.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-203 County, city, or town may levy tax -- Contracts pursuant to Interlocal Cooperation Act.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-203(1): 10-1-201.5 As used in this section, "converted municipality" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-203(2): A county, city, or town may impose a sales and use tax under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-203(3): 59-12-205
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-203(3)(a): 59-12-205 Except as provided in Subsection (3)(b), if a converted municipality imposes a tax under this part, the State Tax Commission shall distribute the amount that the State Tax Commission calculates under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-203(3)(b): The State Tax Commission shall transfer the amount that would otherwise be distributed to a converted municipality under this part to a municipal services district created under Title 17B, Chapter 2a, Part 11, Municipal Services District Act, if the converted municipality:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-203(3)(b)(i): provides written notice to the State Tax Commission requesting the transfer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-203(3)(b)(ii): designates the municipal services district to which the converted municipality requests the State Tax Commission to transfer the revenues.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-203(4): A county, city, or town that imposes a sales and use tax under this part may:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-203(4)(a): enter into agreements authorized by Title 11, Chapter 13, Interlocal Cooperation Act; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-203(4)(b): use any or all of the revenue collected from the tax for the mutual benefit of local governments that elect to contract with one another pursuant to Title 11, Chapter 13, Interlocal Cooperation Act.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(3)(a)(i)(A): for fiscal year 2012-13, received a tax revenue distribution under Subsection (3)(b) equal to the amount described in Subsection (3)(b)(ii); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(3)(a)(i)(B): 59-12-2103 does not impose a sales and use tax under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(3)(a)(ii): "Minimum tax revenue distribution" means the total amount of tax revenue distributions an eligible county, city, or town received from a tax imposed in accordance with this part for fiscal year 2004-05.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(3)(b): An eligible county, city, or town shall receive a tax revenue distribution for a tax imposed in accordance with this part equal to the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(3)(b)(i): the payment required by Subsection (2); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(3)(b)(ii): the minimum tax revenue distribution.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(4): 10-1-104; 35A-16-404; 35A-16-405; 35A-16-402
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(4)(a): 10-1-104; 35A-16-404 For purposes of this Subsection (4):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(4)(a)(i): "Annual local contribution" means the lesser of $275,000 or an amount equal to 2.55% of the participating local government's tax revenue distribution amount under Subsection (2)(a)(i) for the previous fiscal year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(4)(a)(ii): 10-1-104; 35A-16-404 "Participating local government" means a county or municipality, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(4)(b): 35A-16-405; 35A-16-402 For revenue collected from the tax authorized by this part that is distributed on or after January 1, 2019, the commission, before making a tax revenue distribution under Subsection (2)(a)(i) to a participating local government, shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(4)(b)(i): 35A-16-405 adjust a participating local government's tax revenue distribution under Subsection (2)(a)(i) by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(4)(b)(i)(A): subtracting an amount equal to one-twelfth of the annual local contribution for each participating local government from the participating local government's tax revenue distribution; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(4)(b)(i)(B): 35A-16-405 if applicable, reducing the amount described in Subsection (4)(b)(i)(A) by an amount equal to one-twelfth of $250 for each bed that is available at all homeless shelters located within the boundaries of the participating local government, as reported to the commission by the Office of Homeless Services in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(4)(b)(ii): 35A-16-402 deposit the resulting amount described in Subsection (4)(b)(i) into the Homeless Shelter Cities Mitigation Restricted Account created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(4)(c): For a participating local government that qualifies to receive a distribution described in Subsection (3), the commission shall apply the provisions of this Subsection (4) after the commission applies the provisions of Subsection (3).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(5): 59-2-201
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(5)(a): 59-2-201 As used in this Subsection (5):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(5)(a)(i): "Annual dedicated sand and gravel sales tax revenue" means an amount equal to the total revenue an establishment described in NAICS Code 327320, Ready-Mix Concrete Manufacturing, of the 2022 North American Industry Classification System of the federal Executive Office of the President, Office of Management and Budget, collects and remits under this part for a calendar year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(5)(a)(ii): "Sand and gravel" means sand, gravel, or a combination of sand and gravel.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(5)(a)(iii): 59-2-201 "Sand and gravel extraction site" means a pit, quarry, or deposit that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(5)(a)(iii)(A): contains sand and gravel; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(5)(a)(iii)(B): 59-2-201 is assessed by the commission in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(5)(a)(iv): "Ton" means a short ton of 2,000 pounds.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(5)(a)(v): "Tonnage ratio" means the ratio of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(5)(a)(v)(A): the total amount of sand and gravel, measured in tons, sold during a calendar year from all sand and gravel extraction sites located within a county, city, or town; to
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(5)(a)(v)(B): the total amount of sand and gravel, measured in tons, sold during the same calendar year from sand and gravel extraction sites statewide.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(5)(b): For purposes of calculating the ratio described in Subsection (5)(a)(v), the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(5)(b)(i): use the gross sales data provided to the commission as part of the commission's property tax valuation process; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(5)(b)(ii): if a sand and gravel extraction site operates as a unit across municipal or county lines, apportion the reported tonnage among the counties, cities, or towns based on the percentage of the sand and gravel extraction site located in each county, city, or town, as approximated by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(5)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(5)(c)(i): Beginning July 2023, and each July thereafter, the commission shall distribute from total collections under this part an amount equal to the annual dedicated sand and gravel sales tax revenue for the preceding calendar year to each county, city, or town in the same proportion as the county's, city's, or town's tonnage ratio for the preceding calendar year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(5)(c)(ii): The commission shall ensure that the revenue distributed under this Subsection (5)(c) is drawn from each jurisdiction's collections in proportion to the jurisdiction's share of total collections for the preceding 12-month period.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(5)(d): A county, city, or town shall use revenue described in Subsection (5)(c) for class B or class C roads.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(6)(a): Population figures for purposes of this section shall be based on the most recent official census or census estimate of the United States Bureau of the Census.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(6)(b): If a needed population estimate is not available from the United States Bureau of the Census, population figures shall be derived from the estimate from the Utah Population Committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-205(6)(c): The population of a county for purposes of this section shall be determined only from the unincorporated area of the county.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1 Commission redistribution of certain sales and use tax revenues.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1): Part 1, Tax Collection; Part 3, Transient Room Tax; Part 12, Motor Vehicle Rental Tax; Part 18, Additional State Sales and Use Tax Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(e)(ii)(A) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(a): "Eligible portion of qualifying sales and use tax revenues" means the portion of qualifying sales and use tax revenues that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(a)(i): were part of an original distribution; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(a)(ii): the commission determines should have been transmitted:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(a)(ii)(A): to a secondary recipient political subdivision; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(a)(ii)(B): during the redistribution period.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(b): "Original distribution" means that the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(b)(i): collects an amount of qualifying sales and use tax revenues; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(b)(ii): transmits the amount of qualifying sales and use tax revenues to an original recipient political subdivision.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(c): "Original recipient political subdivision" means a county, city, or town to which the commission makes an original distribution.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(d): Part 1, Tax Collection; Part 3, Transient Room Tax; Part 12, Motor Vehicle Rental Tax; Part 18, Additional State Sales and Use Tax Act "Qualifying sales and use tax revenues" means revenues the commission collects from a tax under this chapter except for a tax imposed under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(d)(i): Part 1, Tax Collection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(d)(ii): Part 3, Transient Room Tax
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(d)(ii)(A): collects the tax; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(d)(ii)(B): does not contract with the commission to collect the tax;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(d)(iii): Part 12, Motor Vehicle Rental Tax
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(d)(iv): Part 18, Additional State Sales and Use Tax Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(e): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(e)(ii)(A) "Redistribution" means that the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(e)(i): makes an original distribution of qualifying sales and use tax revenues to an original recipient political subdivision;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(e)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(e)(ii)(A) after the commission makes the original distribution of qualifying sales and use tax revenues to the original recipient political subdivision, determines that an eligible portion of qualifying sales and use tax revenues should have been transmitted to a secondary recipient political subdivision as a result of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(e)(ii)(A): a county, city, or town providing written notice to the commission that qualifying sales and use tax revenues that the commission distributed to an original recipient political subdivision should have been transmitted to a secondary recipient political subdivision; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(e)(ii)(B): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(e)(ii)(A) the commission finding that an extraordinary circumstance, as defined by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(e)(iii): in accordance with this section, transmits to the secondary recipient political subdivision the eligible portion of qualifying sales and use tax revenues for the redistribution period.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(f): "Redistribution determination date" means the date the commission determines that a secondary recipient political subdivision should have received a redistribution, regardless of the date the commission actually transmits the redistribution to the secondary recipient political subdivision.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(g): "Redistribution period" means the time period:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(g)(i): if the commission determines that an eligible portion of qualifying sales and use tax revenues should have been transmitted to a secondary recipient political subdivision beginning on a date that is 90 or more days before the redistribution determination date:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(g)(i)(A): beginning 90 days before the redistribution determination date; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(g)(i)(B): ending on the redistribution determination date; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(g)(ii): if the commission determines that an eligible portion of qualifying sales and use tax revenues should have been transmitted to a secondary recipient political subdivision beginning on a date that is less than 90 days before the redistribution determination date:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(g)(ii)(A): beginning on the date the eligible portion of qualifying sales and use tax revenues should have been transmitted to the secondary recipient political subdivision; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(g)(ii)(B): ending on the redistribution determination date.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(1)(h): "Secondary recipient political subdivision" means a county, city, or town that the commission determines should receive a redistribution.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(2): (3); (2)(b)(i) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(2)(a): the commission provides written notice to the following within 15 days after the commission determines to make the redistribution:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(2)(a)(i): the original recipient political subdivision; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(2)(a)(ii): the secondary recipient political subdivision; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(2)(b): (2)(b)(i) the commission obtains:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(2)(b)(i): an amended return from each seller that reports a transaction that will be subject to the redistribution; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(2)(b)(ii): (2)(b)(i) if the commission determines that an amended return described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(2)(b)(ii)(A): supporting the redistribution; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(2)(b)(ii)(B): supplied by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(2)(b)(ii)(B)(I): a seller;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(2)(b)(ii)(B)(II): a county, city, or town; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(2)(b)(ii)(B)(III): the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(3): (2) The commission shall make a redistribution within 60 days after the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-210.1(4): This section does not limit the commission's authority to make a distribution of revenues under this chapter for a time period other than the redistribution period.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-211 Definitions -- Location of certain transactions -- Reports to commission -- Direct payment provision for a seller making certain purchases -- Exceptions.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-211(1): 41-1a-301; 41-1a-301; (1)(b)(i); (iv) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-211(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-211(1)(a)(i): "Receipt" and "receive" mean:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-211(1)(a)(i)(A): taking possession of tangible personal property;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-211(1)(a)(i)(B): making first use of a service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-211(1)(a)(i)(C): for a product transferred electronically, the earlier of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-211(1)(a)(i)(C)(I): taking possession of the product transferred electronically; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-211(1)(a)(i)(C)(II): making first use of the product transferred electronically.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-211(1)(a)(ii): "Receipt" and "receive" do not include possession by a shipping company on behalf of a purchaser.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-211(1)(b): 41-1a-301; 41-1a-301; (1)(b)(i); (iv) "Transportation equipment" means:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212 Location of certain transactions if receipt of order and receipt of tangible personal property or product take place in this state -- Location of sale, lease, or rental of a service -- Exception from tax, penalty, or interest.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(1): (3); (6) The location of the sale of tangible personal property or a product transferred electronically is the location where the seller receives the order if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(1)(a): the seller receives the order for the tangible personal property or product transferred electronically in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(1)(b): receipt of the tangible personal property or product transferred electronically by the purchaser or the purchaser's donee occurs in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(1)(c): (3); (6) the location where receipt of the tangible personal property or product transferred electronically by the purchaser occurs is determined in accordance with Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(1)(d): at the time the seller receives the order, the record keeping system that the seller uses to calculate the proper amount of tax imposed under this chapter captures the location where the order is received.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(2): (2)(b); (d); (2); (2)(d)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(2)(a): (2)(b); (d) Subject to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(2)(a)(i): a physical location of the seller or a third party; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(2)(a)(ii): where an order is initially received by or on behalf of the seller.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(2)(b): A physical location of a seller or third party includes the following if operated by or on behalf of the seller:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(2)(b)(i): an automated order receipt system;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(2)(b)(ii): an office; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(2)(b)(iii): an outlet.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(2)(c): The location where a seller receives an order does not include the location:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(2)(c)(ii): from which tangible personal property or a product transferred electronically is shipped.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(3)(a): A purchaser is not liable for a tax, penalty, or interest on a sale for which the purchaser remits a tax under this chapter to the seller in the amount the seller invoices if the amount is calculated at the total tax rate applicable to the location where:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(3)(a)(i): receipt by the purchaser occurs; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(3)(a)(ii): the seller receives the order.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(3)(b): A purchaser may rely on a written representation by the seller as to the location where the seller receives the order for the sale.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(3)(c): If a purchaser does not have a written representation by the seller as to the location where the seller receives the order for the sale, the purchaser may determine the total tax rate applicable to the location where the order is received by using a location indicated by a business address for the seller that is available from the business records:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(3)(c)(i): of the purchaser; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-212(3)(c)(ii): that are maintained in the ordinary course of the purchaser's business.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215 Location of transaction involving telecommunications service or other related service.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1): (1)(d)(ii); (1)(d)(i)(A); (1)(h)(i); (1)(h)(i); (ii) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(a): "Air-to-ground radiotelephone service" means a radio service:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(a)(i): as defined in 47 C.F.R. Sec. 22.99; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(a)(ii): for which a common carrier is authorized to offer and provide radio telecommunications service:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(a)(ii)(A): for hire; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(a)(ii)(B): to a subscriber in an aircraft.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(b): "Call-by-call basis" means a method of charging for telecommunications service that is measured by individual calls.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(c): "Communications channel" means a physical or virtual path of communications over which a signal is transmitted between or among customer channel termination points.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(d): (1)(d)(ii); (1)(d)(i)(A)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(d)(i): (1)(d)(ii); (1)(d)(i)(A) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(d)(i)(A): a person that is obligated under a contract with a telecommunications service provider to pay for telecommunications service received under the contract; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(d)(i)(B): (1)(d)(i)(A) if the end user is not the person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(d)(ii): "Customer" does not include a reseller:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(d)(ii)(A): of telecommunications service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(d)(ii)(B): for mobile telecommunications service, of a serving carrier under an agreement to serve a customer outside the home service provider's licensed service area.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(e): "Customer channel termination point" means the location where a customer:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(e)(i): inputs communications; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(e)(ii): receives communications.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(f): "End user" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(f)(i): an individual who uses a telecommunications service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(f)(ii): for a telecommunications service provided to a person who is not an individual, an individual who uses a telecommunications service on behalf of the person who is provided the telecommunications service.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(g): "Home service provider" is as defined in the Mobile Telecommunications Sourcing Act, 4 U.S.C. Sec. 124.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(h): (1)(h)(i); (1)(h)(i); (ii) "Service address" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(h)(i): regardless of where a call is billed or paid, the location of the telecommunications equipment:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(h)(i)(A): to which a customer's call is charged; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(h)(i)(B): from which the call:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(h)(i)(B)(I): originates; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(h)(i)(B)(II): terminates;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(h)(ii): (1)(h)(i) if the location described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(h)(ii)(A): the telecommunications system of the telecommunications service provider; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(h)(ii)(B): if the system used to transport the signal of the telecommunications service is not a system of the telecommunications service provider, information received by the telecommunications service provider from the telecommunications service provider's telecommunications service provider; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(1)(h)(iii): (1)(h)(i); (ii) if the locations described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(2): (4) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(2)(a): the location at which the call originates and terminates; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(2)(b): the location at which:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(2)(b)(i): the call:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(2)(b)(i)(A): originates; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(2)(b)(i)(B): terminates; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(2)(b)(ii): the service address is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(3): (4) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(4): (2); (3); 59-12-211; (4)(d)(ii); 59-12-211; (4)(d)(i); 59-12-211(6) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(4)(a): the location of a sale of a mobile telecommunications service, other than an air-to-ground radiotelephone service or a prepaid calling service, is the location required by the Mobile Telecommunications Sourcing Act, 4 U.S.C. Sec. 116 et seq.;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(4)(b): the location of a sale of a postpaid calling service is the origination point of the telecommunications signal as first identified by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(4)(b)(i): the seller's telecommunications system; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(4)(b)(ii): if the system used to transport the telecommunications signal is not that of the seller, information received by the seller from the seller's telephone service provider;
