Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(5): The location of a sale of a private communication service is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(5)(a): if all of the customer channel termination points are located entirely within one county, city, or town, the location of the sale is the county, city, or town in which all of the customer channel termination points are located;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(5)(b): if a charge for a service related to a customer channel termination point is separately stated, the location of the sale is the location in which the customer channel termination point is located;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(5)(c): if a charge for service for a segment of a channel between two customer channel termination points located in different counties, cities, or towns is separately stated, the location of the sale is each county, city, or town:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(5)(c)(i): in which the customer channel termination points are located; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(5)(c)(ii): in equal proportions; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(5)(d): if a charge for service for a segment of a channel located in more than one county, city, or town is not separately stated, the location of the sale is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(5)(d)(i): each county, city, or town in which a segment of the channel is located; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(5)(d)(ii): in proportion to the percentage of customer channel termination points in each county, city, or town compared to the total customer channel termination points in all counties, cities, and towns.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(6): The location of a sale of Internet access service is the customer's place of primary use.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-215(7): The location of a sale of an ancillary service is the customer's place of primary use.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-216 Seller or certified service provider reliance on commission information.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A seller or certified service provider is not liable for failing to collect a tax at a tax rate imposed under this part if the seller's or certified service provider's failure to collect the tax is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data provided by the commission in a database created by the commission:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-216(1): containing tax rates, boundaries, or local taxing jurisdiction assignments; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-216(2): indicating the taxability of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-304 Seller or certified service provider reliance on commission information.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A seller or certified service provider is not liable for failing to collect a tax at a tax rate imposed under this part if the seller's or certified service provider's failure to collect the tax is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data provided by the commission in a database created by the commission:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-304(1): containing tax rates, boundaries, or local taxing jurisdiction assignments; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-304(2): indicating the taxability of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-357 Seller or certified service provider reliance on commission information.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A seller or certified service provider is not liable for failing to collect a tax at a tax rate imposed under this part if the seller's or certified service provider's failure to collect the tax is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data provided by the commission in a database created by the commission:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-357(1): containing tax rates, boundaries, or local taxing jurisdiction assignments; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-357(2): indicating the taxability of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-358(1)(a): the certified service provider or model 2 seller relies on software the commission certifies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-358(1)(b): the certified service provider's or model 2 seller's failure to collect a tax required under this part is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-358(1)(b)(i): provided by the commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-358(1)(b)(ii): in the software the commission certifies.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-358(2): (1) The relief from liability described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-358(3): (3)(a) If the taxability of a product category is incorrectly classified in software the commission certifies, the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-358(3)(a): notify a certified service provider or model 2 seller of the incorrect classification of the taxability of a product category in software the commission certifies; and

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402(2):

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402(2)(b): Amounts paid under Subsection (2)(a) shall be allocated proportionally among those cities and towns according to the amount of revenue the respective cities and towns generate in that year through imposition of that tax.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1 State correctional facility sales and use tax -- Base -- Rate -- Collection fees -- Imposition -- Prohibition of military installation development authority imposition of tax.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(1): As used in this section, "new state correctional facility" means a new prison in the state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(1)(a): that is operated by the Department of Corrections;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(1)(b): the construction of which begins on or after May 12, 2015; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(1)(c): that provides a capacity of 2,500 or more inmate beds.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(2): Subject to the other provisions of this part, a city or town legislative body may impose a tax under this section if the construction of a new state correctional facility has begun within the boundaries of the city or town.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(3): For purposes of this section, the tax rate may not exceed .5%.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(4): (5); 59-12-103(1) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(5): 59-12-104; 59-12-104; (7) A city or town may not impose a tax under this section on:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(5)(a)(i): a motor vehicle;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(5)(a)(ii): an aircraft;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(5)(a)(iii): a watercraft;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(5)(a)(iv): a modular home;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(5)(a)(v): a manufactured home; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(5)(a)(vi): a mobile home;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(5)(b): 59-12-104; 59-12-104 the sales and uses described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(5)(c): (7) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(6): 59-12-211; 59-12-215 For purposes of this section, the location of a transaction shall be determined in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(7): A city or town that imposes a tax under this section shall impose the tax on the purchase price or sales price for amounts paid or charged for food and food ingredients if the food and food ingredients are sold as part of a bundled transaction attributable to food and food ingredients and tangible personal property other than food and food ingredients.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(8): A city or town may impose a tax under this section by majority vote of the members of the city or town legislative body.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(9): 59-12-405 A city or town that imposes a tax under this section is not subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-402.1(10): A military installation development authority may not impose a tax under this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-405(1)(a)(ii): a unit similar to a hostel as determined by the commission by rule.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-405(5)(a): 59-12-401; (3); (4) For a municipality that does not impose a tax under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-405(5)(b): 59-12-403; (4); (4) For a municipality that is not required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-405(5)(b)(i): (4) beginning on July 1 of the year after the year during which the commission provided written notice described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-405(5)(b)(i)(A): to the municipality; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-405(5)(b)(i)(B): for the third consecutive calendar year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-405(5)(b)(ii): until the municipality meets the requirements of this part to enact the tax.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-406 Seller or certified service provider reliance on commission information.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A seller or certified service provider is not liable for failing to collect a tax at a tax rate imposed under this part if the seller's or certified service provider's failure to collect the tax is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data provided by the commission in a database created by the commission:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-406(1): containing tax rates, boundaries, or local taxing jurisdiction assignments; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-406(2): indicating the taxability of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-407 Certified service provider or model 2 seller reliance on commission certified software.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-407(1): (2); (4) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-407(1)(a): the certified service provider or model 2 seller relies on software the commission certifies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-407(1)(b): the certified service provider's or model 2 seller's failure to collect a tax required under this part is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-407(1)(b)(i): provided by the commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-407(1)(b)(ii): in the software the commission certifies.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-407(2): (1) The relief from liability described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-407(3): (3)(a) If the taxability of a product category is incorrectly classified in software the commission certifies, the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-407(3)(a): notify a certified service provider or model 2 seller of the incorrect classification of the taxability of a product category in software the commission certifies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-407(3)(b): (3)(a) state in the notice required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-407(4): (3) If a certified service provider or model 2 seller fails to correct the taxability of an item or transaction within 10 days after the day on which the certified service provider or model 2 seller receives the notice described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-408(2)(b)(ii)(B)(II)(Cc): included in or excluded from a definition.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-601.1 Title.
----------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Tourism, Recreation, Cultural, Convention, and Airport Facilities Tax Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(1)(a): "Airport facility" means an airport of regional significance, as defined by the Transportation Commission by rule made in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(1)(b): "Airport facility" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(1)(b)(i): an appurtenance to an airport, including a fixed guideway that provides transportation service to or from the airport;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(1)(b)(ii): a control tower, including a radar system;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(1)(b)(iii): a public area of an airport; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(1)(b)(iv): a terminal facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(2): 41-22-2 "All-terrain type I vehicle" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(3): 41-22-2 "All-terrain type II vehicle" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(4): 41-22-2 "All-terrain type III vehicle" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(5): "Convention facility" means any publicly owned or operated convention center, sports arena, or other facility at which conventions, conferences, and other gatherings are held and whose primary business or function is to host such conventions, conferences, and other gatherings.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(6): "Cultural facility" means any publicly owned or operated museum, theater, art center, music hall, or other cultural or arts facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(7): 41-1a-102
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(7)(a): "Off-highway vehicle" means any snowmobile, all-terrain type I vehicle, all-terrain type II vehicle, all-terrain type III vehicle, or motorcycle.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(7)(b): 41-1a-102 "Off-highway vehicle" does not include a vehicle that is a motor vehicle under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(8): 41-22-2 "Motorcycle" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(9): "Recreation facility" or "tourist facility" means any publicly owned or operated park, campground, marina, dock, golf course, water park, historic park, monument, planetarium, zoo, bicycle trails, and other recreation or tourism-related facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(10): 41-1a-102
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(10)(a): "Recreational vehicle" means a vehicular unit other than a mobile home, primarily designed as a temporary dwelling for travel, recreational, or vacation use, that is pulled by another vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(10)(b): "Recreational vehicle" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(10)(b)(i): a travel trailer;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(10)(b)(ii): a camping trailer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(10)(b)(iii): a fifth wheel trailer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(10)(c): 41-1a-102 "Recreational vehicle" does not include a vehicle that is a motor vehicle under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(11): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(11)(a): "Restaurant" includes any coffee shop, cafeteria, luncheonette, soda fountain, or fast-food service where food is prepared for immediate consumption.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(11)(b): "Restaurant" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(11)(b)(i): any retail establishment whose primary business or function is the sale of fuel or food items for off-premise, but not immediate, consumption; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(11)(b)(ii): a theater that sells food items, but not a dinner theater.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(12): 41-22-2 "Snowmobile" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(13): "Travel trailer," "camping trailer," or "fifth wheel trailer" means a portable vehicle without motive power, designed as a temporary dwelling for travel, recreational, or vacation use that does not require a special highway movement permit when drawn by a self-propelled motor vehicle.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(1): "Airport facility" means an airport of regional significance, and includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(1)(a): an appurtenance to an airport, including a fixed guideway that provides transportation service to or from the airport;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(1)(b): a control tower, including a radar system;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(1)(c): a public area of an airport; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(1)(d): a terminal facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(2): 59-12-2202 "Airport of regional significance" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(3): 41-22-2 "All-terrain type I vehicle" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(4): 41-22-2 "All-terrain type II vehicle" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(5): 41-22-2 "All-terrain type III vehicle" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(6): "Convention facility" means any publicly owned or operated convention center, sports arena, or other facility at which conventions, conferences, and other gatherings are held and whose primary business or function is to host such conventions, conferences, and other gatherings.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(7): "Cultural facility" means any publicly owned or operated museum, theater, art center, music hall, or other cultural or arts facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(8): 41-1a-102
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(8)(a): "Off-highway vehicle" means any snowmobile, all-terrain type I vehicle, all-terrain type II vehicle, all-terrain type III vehicle, or motorcycle.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(8)(b): 41-1a-102 "Off-highway vehicle" does not include a vehicle that is a motor vehicle under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(9): 41-22-2 "Motorcycle" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(10): "Recreation facility" or "tourist facility" means any publicly owned or operated park, campground, marina, dock, golf course, water park, historic park, monument, planetarium, zoo, bicycle trails, and other recreation or tourism-related facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(11): 41-1a-102
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(11)(a): "Recreational vehicle" means a vehicular unit other than a mobile home, primarily designed as a temporary dwelling for travel, recreational, or vacation use, that is pulled by another vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(11)(b): "Recreational vehicle" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(11)(b)(i): a travel trailer;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(11)(b)(ii): a camping trailer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(11)(b)(iii): a fifth wheel trailer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(11)(c): 41-1a-102 "Recreational vehicle" does not include a vehicle that is a motor vehicle under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(12): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(12)(a): "Restaurant" includes any coffee shop, cafeteria, luncheonette, soda fountain, or fast-food service where food is prepared for immediate consumption.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(12)(b): "Restaurant" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(12)(b)(i): any retail establishment whose primary business or function is the sale of fuel or food items for off-premise, but not immediate, consumption; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(12)(b)(ii): a theater that sells food items, but not a dinner theater.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(13): 41-22-2 "Snowmobile" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-602(14): "Travel trailer," "camping trailer," or "fifth wheel trailer" means a portable vehicle without motive power, designed as a temporary dwelling for travel, recreational, or vacation use that does not require a special highway movement permit when drawn by a self-propelled motor vehicle.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603 County tax -- Bases -- Rates -- Use of revenue -- Adoption of ordinance required -- Advisory board -- Administration -- Collection -- Administrative charge -- Distribution -- Enactment or repeal of tax or tax rate change -- Effective date -- Notice requirements.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(1): 59-12-103; 17-31-5.5
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(1)(a): 59-12-103 In addition to any other taxes, a county legislative body may, as provided in this part, impose a tax as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(1)(a)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(1)(a)(i)(A): a county legislative body of any county may impose a tax of not to exceed 3% on all short-term rentals of motor vehicles, except for short-term rentals of motor vehicles made for the purpose of temporarily replacing a person's motor vehicle that is being repaired pursuant to a repair or an insurance agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(1)(a)(i)(B): a county legislative body of any county imposing a tax under Subsection (1)(a)(i)(A) may, in addition to imposing the tax under Subsection (1)(a)(i)(A), impose a tax of not to exceed 4% on all short-term rentals of motor vehicles, except for short-term rentals of motor vehicles made for the purpose of temporarily replacing a person's motor vehicle that is being repaired pursuant to a repair or an insurance agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(1)(a)(ii): a county legislative body of any county may impose a tax of not to exceed 7% on all short-term rentals of off-highway vehicles and recreational vehicles;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(1)(a)(iii): a county legislative body of any county may impose a tax of not to exceed 1% of all sales of the following that are sold by a restaurant:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(1)(a)(iii)(A): alcoholic beverages;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(1)(a)(iii)(B): food and food ingredients; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(1)(a)(iii)(C): prepared food;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(1)(a)(iv): 59-12-103 a county legislative body of a county of the first class may impose a tax of not to exceed .5% on charges for the accommodations and services described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(1)(a)(v): if a county legislative body of any county imposes a tax under Subsection (1)(a)(i), a tax at the same rate applies to car sharing of less than 30 days, except forcar sharing for the purpose of temporarily replacing a person's motor vehicle that is being repaired pursuant to a repair or an insurance agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(1)(b): 17-31-5.5 A tax imposed under Subsection (1)(a) is subject to the audit provisions of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2): 17-31-8; 59-12-103
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(a): Subject to Subsection (2)(c), a county may use revenue from the imposition of a tax under Subsection (1) for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(a)(i): financing tourism promotion; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(a)(ii): the development, operation, and maintenance of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(a)(ii)(A): an airport facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(a)(ii)(B): a convention facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(a)(ii)(C): a cultural facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(a)(ii)(D): a recreation facility; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(a)(ii)(E): a tourist facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(b): 17-31-8
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(b)(i): In addition to the uses described in Subsection (2)(a) and subject to Subsection (2)(b)(ii), a county of the fourth, fifth, or sixth class or a county with a population density of fewer than 15 people per square mile may expend the revenue from the imposition of a tax under Subsections (1)(a)(i) and (ii) on the following activities to mitigate the impacts of tourism:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(b)(i)(A): solid waste disposal;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(b)(i)(B): search and rescue activities;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(b)(i)(C): law enforcement activities;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(b)(i)(D): emergency medical services; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(b)(i)(E): fire protection services.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(b)(ii): 17-31-8 A county may only expend the revenue as outlined in Subsection (2)(b)(i) if the county's tourism tax advisory board created under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(c): 59-12-103 A county of the first class shall expend at least $450,000 each year of the revenue from the imposition of a tax authorized by Subsection (1)(a)(iv) within the county to fund a marketing and ticketing system designed to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(c)(i): promote tourism in ski areas within the county by persons that do not reside within the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(c)(ii): 59-12-103 combine the sale of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(c)(ii)(A): ski lift tickets; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(2)(c)(ii)(B): 59-12-103 accommodations and services described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(3): A tax imposed under this part may be pledged as security for bonds, notes, or other evidences of indebtedness incurred by a county, city, or town under Title 11, Chapter 14, Local Government Bonding Act, or a community reinvestment agency under Title 17C, Chapter 1, Part 5, Agency Bonds, to finance:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(3)(a): an airport facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(3)(b): a convention facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(3)(c): a cultural facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(3)(d): a recreation facility; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(3)(e): a tourist facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(4): 59-12-106
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(4)(a): To impose a tax under Subsection (1), the county legislative body shall adopt an ordinance imposing the tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(4)(b): The ordinance under Subsection (4)(a) shall include provisions substantially the same as those contained in Part 1, Tax Collection, except that the tax shall be imposed only on those items and sales described in Subsection (1).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(4)(c): 59-12-106 The name of the county as the taxing agency shall be substituted for that of the state where necessary, and an additional license is not required if one has been or is issued under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(5): To maintain in effect a tax ordinance adopted under this part, each county legislative body shall, within 30 days of any amendment of any applicable provisions of Part 1, Tax Collection, adopt amendments to the county's tax ordinance to conform with the applicable amendments to Part 1, Tax Collection.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(6): 17-31-8
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(6)(a): 17-31-8 Regardless of whether a county of the first class creates a tourism tax advisory board in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(6)(b): The tax advisory board shall be composed of nine members appointed as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(6)(b)(i): four members shall be residents of a county of the first class appointed by the county legislative body of the county of the first class; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(6)(b)(ii): subject to Subsections (6)(c) and (d), five members shall be mayors of cities or towns within the county of the first class appointed by an organization representing all mayors of cities and towns within the county of the first class.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(6)(c): Five members of the tax advisory board constitute a quorum.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(6)(d): The county legislative body of the county of the first class shall determine:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(6)(d)(i): terms of the members of the tax advisory board;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(6)(d)(ii): procedures and requirements for removing a member of the tax advisory board;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(6)(d)(iii): voting requirements, except that action of the tax advisory board shall be by at least a majority vote of a quorum of the tax advisory board;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(6)(d)(iv): chairs or other officers of the tax advisory board;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(6)(d)(v): how meetings are to be called and the frequency of meetings; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(6)(d)(vi): the compensation, if any, of members of the tax advisory board.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(6)(e): The tax advisory board under this Subsection (6) shall advise the county legislative body of the county of the first class on the expenditure of revenue collected within the county of the first class from the taxes described in Subsection (1)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(7): 59-12-107.1; 59-12-123; 59-12-205; 59-1-306
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(7)(a): 59-12-107.1; 59-12-123; 59-12-205
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(7)(a)(i): Except as provided in Subsection (7)(a)(ii), a tax authorized under this part shall be administered, collected, and enforced in accordance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(7)(a)(i)(A): the same procedures used to administer, collect, and enforce the tax under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(7)(a)(i)(A)(I): Part 1, Tax Collection; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(7)(a)(i)(A)(II): Part 2, Local Sales and Use Tax Act; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(7)(a)(i)(B): Chapter 1, General Taxation Policies.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(7)(a)(ii): 59-12-107.1; 59-12-123; 59-12-205 A tax under this part is not subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(7)(b): Except as provided in Subsection (7)(c):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(7)(b)(i): for a tax under this part other than the tax under Subsection (1)(a)(i)(B), the commission shall distribute the revenue to the county imposing the tax; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(7)(b)(ii): for a tax under Subsection (1)(a)(i)(B), the commission shall distribute the revenue according to the distribution formula provided in Subsection (8).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(7)(c): 59-1-306 The commission shall retain and deposit an administrative charge in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(8): The commission shall distribute the revenue generated by the tax under Subsection (1)(a)(i)(B) to each county collecting a tax under Subsection (1)(a)(i)(B) according to the following formula:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(8)(a): the commission shall distribute 70% of the revenue based on the percentages generated by dividing the revenue collected by each county under Subsection (1)(a)(i)(B) by the total revenue collected by all counties under Subsection (1)(a)(i)(B); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(8)(b): the commission shall distribute 30% of the revenue based on the percentages generated by dividing the population of each county collecting a tax under Subsection (1)(a)(i)(B) by the total population of all counties collecting a tax under Subsection (1)(a)(i)(B).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(a): For purposes of this Subsection (9):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(a)(i): "Annexation" means an annexation to a county under Title 17, Chapter 2, Part 2, County Annexation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(a)(ii): "Annexing area" means an area that is annexed into a county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(b)(i): Except as provided in Subsection (9)(c), if a county enacts or repeals a tax or changes the rate of a tax under this part, the enactment, repeal, or change shall take effect:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(b)(i)(A): on the first day of a calendar quarter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(b)(i)(B): after a 90-day period beginning on the day on which the commission receives notice meeting the requirements of Subsection (9)(b)(ii) from the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(b)(ii): The notice described in Subsection (9)(b)(i)(B) shall state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(b)(ii)(A): that the county will enact or repeal a tax or change the rate of a tax under this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(b)(ii)(B): the statutory authority for the tax described in Subsection (9)(b)(ii)(A);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(b)(ii)(C): the effective date of the tax described in Subsection (9)(b)(ii)(A); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(b)(ii)(D): if the county enacts the tax or changes the rate of the tax described in Subsection (9)(b)(ii)(A), the rate of the tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(c)(i): If the billing period for a transaction begins before the effective date of the enactment of the tax or the tax rate increase imposed under Subsection (1), the enactment of the tax or the tax rate increase shall take effect on the first day of the first billing period that begins after the effective date of the enactment of the tax or the tax rate increase.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(c)(ii): If the billing period for a transaction begins before the effective date of the repeal of the tax or the tax rate decrease imposed under Subsection (1), the repeal of the tax or the tax rate decrease shall take effect on the first day of the last billing period that began before the effective date of the repeal of the tax or the tax rate decrease.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(d)(i): Except as provided in Subsection (9)(e), if the annexation will result in the enactment, repeal, or change in the rate of a tax under this part for an annexing area, the enactment, repeal, or change shall take effect:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(d)(i)(A): on the first day of a calendar quarter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(d)(i)(B): after a 90-day period beginning on the day on which the commission receives notice meeting the requirements of Subsection (9)(d)(ii) from the county that annexes the annexing area.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(d)(ii): The notice described in Subsection (9)(d)(i)(B) shall state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(d)(ii)(A): that the annexation described in Subsection (9)(d)(i) will result in an enactment, repeal, or change in the rate of a tax under this part for the annexing area;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(d)(ii)(B): the statutory authority for the tax described in Subsection (9)(d)(ii)(A);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(d)(ii)(C): the effective date of the tax described in Subsection (9)(d)(ii)(A); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(d)(ii)(D): if the county enacts the tax or changes the rate of the tax described in Subsection (9)(d)(ii)(A), the rate of the tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(e)(i): If the billing period for a transaction begins before the effective date of the enactment of the tax or the tax rate increase imposed under Subsection (1), the enactment of the tax or the tax rate increase shall take effect on the first day of the first billing period that begins after the effective date of the enactment of the tax or the tax rate increase.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-603(9)(e)(ii): If the billing period for a transaction begins before the effective date of the repeal of the tax or the tax rate decrease imposed under Subsection (1), the repeal of the tax or the tax rate decrease shall take effect on the first day of the last billing period that began before the effective date of the repeal of the tax or the tax rate decrease.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-605 Seller or certified service provider reliance on commission information.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A seller or certified service provider is not liable for failing to collect a tax at a tax rate imposed under this part if the seller's or certified service provider's failure to collect the tax is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data provided by the commission in a database created by the commission:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-605(1): containing tax rates, boundaries, or local taxing jurisdiction assignments; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-605(2): indicating the taxability of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-606(1)(b)(i): provided by the commission; or

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-701 Purpose statement.
--------------------------------------------------
The Utah Legislature finds and declares that:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-701(1): Recreational and zoological facilities and the botanical, cultural, and zoological organizations of the state of Utah enhance the quality of life of Utah's citizens, as well as the continuing growth of Utah's tourist, convention, and recreational industries.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-701(2): Utah was the first state in this nation to create and financially support a state arts agency and remains committed to the nurturing and growth of cultural pursuits.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-701(3): Utah has provided, and intends to continue, the financial support of recreational and zoological facilities and the botanical, cultural, and zoological organizations of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-701(4): The state's support of its recreational and zoological facilities and its botanical, cultural, and zoological organizations has not been sufficient to assure the continuing existence and growth of these facilities and organizations, and the Legislature believes that local government may wish to play a greater role in the support of these organizations.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-701(5): Without jeopardizing the state's ongoing support of its recreational and zoological facilities and its botanical, cultural, and zoological organizations, the Legislature intends to permit the counties of the state of Utah to enhance public financial support of Utah's publicly owned or operated recreational and zoological facilities, and botanical, cultural, and zoological organizations owned or operated by institutions or private nonprofit organizations, through the imposition of a county sales and use tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-701(6): In a county of the first class, it is necessary and appropriate to allocate a tax imposed under this part in a manner that provides adequate predictable support to a fixed number of botanical and cultural organizations and that gives the county legislative body discretion to allocate the tax revenues to other botanical and cultural organizations.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(1): "Administrative unit" means a division of a private nonprofit organization or institution that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(1)(a): would, if it were a separate entity, be a botanical organization or cultural organization; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(1)(b): consistently maintains books and records separate from those of its parent organization.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(2): "Aquarium" means a park or building where a collection of water animals and plants is kept for study, conservation, and public exhibition.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(3): "Aviary" means a park or building where a collection of birds is kept for study, conservation, and public exhibition.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(4): "Botanical organization" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(4)(a): a private nonprofit organization or institution having as its primary purpose the advancement and preservation of plant science through horticultural display, botanical research, and community education; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(4)(b): an administrative unit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(5): 59-12-602 "Cultural facility" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6): 59-12-704(1)(d); (6); (6)(a)(ii)(B)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a): 59-12-704(1)(d); (6) "Cultural organization":
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(i): means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(i)(A): a private nonprofit organization or institution having as its primary purpose the advancement and preservation of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(i)(A)(I): natural history;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(i)(A)(II): art;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(i)(A)(III): music;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(i)(A)(IV): theater;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(i)(A)(V): dance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(i)(A)(VI): cultural arts, including literature, a motion picture, or storytelling;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(i)(B): an administrative unit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(ii): 59-12-704(1)(d); (6) includes, for purposes of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(ii)(A): a private nonprofit organization or institution having as its primary purpose the advancement and preservation of history; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(ii)(B): a municipal or county cultural council having as its primary purpose the advancement and preservation of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(ii)(B)(I): history;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(ii)(B)(II): natural history;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(ii)(B)(III): art;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(ii)(B)(IV): music;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(ii)(B)(V): theater; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(ii)(B)(VI): dance.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(b): (6)(a)(ii)(B) "Cultural organization" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(b)(i): an agency of the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(b)(ii): (6)(a)(ii)(B) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(b)(iii): an educational institution whose annual revenues are directly derived more than 50% from state funds; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(b)(iv): in a county of the first or second class, a radio or television broadcasting network or station, cable communications system, newspaper, or magazine.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(7): 53B-1-102(1)(a) "Institution" means an institution of higher education listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(8): "Recreational facility" means a publicly owned or operated park, campground, marina, dock, golf course, playground, athletic field, gymnasium, swimming pool, trail system, or other facility used for recreational purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(9): "Rural radio station" means a nonprofit radio station based in a county of the third, fourth, fifth, or sixth class.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(10): In a county of the first class, "zoological facility" means a public, public-private partnership, or private nonprofit building, exhibit, utility and infrastructure, walkway, pathway, roadway, office, administration facility, public service facility, educational facility, enclosure, public viewing area, animal barrier, animal housing, animal care facility, and veterinary and hospital facility related to the advancement, exhibition, or preservation of a mammal, bird, reptile, fish, or an amphibian.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(11): (11)(a)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(11)(a): (11)(a)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(11)(a)(i): (11)(a)(ii) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(11)(a)(ii): In a county of the first class, "zoological organization" means a nonprofit organization having as its primary purpose the advancement and exhibition of a mammal, bird, reptile, fish, or an amphibian to an audience of 75,000 or more persons annually.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(11)(b): "Zoological organization" does not include an agency of the state, educational institution, radio or television broadcasting network or station, cable communications system, newspaper, or magazine.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(12): "Zoological park" means a park or garden where a collection of wild animals is kept for study, conservation, and public exhibition.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(1): "Administrative unit" means a division of a private nonprofit organization or institution that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(1)(a): would, if it were a separate entity, be a botanical organization or cultural organization; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(1)(b): consistently maintains books and records separate from those of the administrative unit's parent organization.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(2): "Aquarium" means a park or building where a collection of water animals and plants is kept for study, conservation, and public exhibition.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(3): "Aviary" means a park or building where a collection of birds is kept for study, conservation, and public exhibition.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(4): "Botanical organization" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(4)(a): a private nonprofit organization or institution having as the private nonprofit organization's or institution's primary purpose the advancement and preservation of plant science through horticultural display, botanical research, and community education; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(4)(b): an administrative unit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(5): 59-12-602 "Cultural facility" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6): 59-12-704
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a): "Cultural organization" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(i): a private nonprofit organization or institution having as the private nonprofit organization's or institution's primary purpose the advancement and preservation of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(i)(A): natural history;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(i)(B): art;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(i)(C): music;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(i)(D): theater;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(i)(E): dance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(i)(F): cultural arts, including literature, a motion picture, or storytelling; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(a)(ii): an administrative unit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(b): 59-12-704 "Cultural organization" includes, for purposes of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(b)(i): a private nonprofit organization or institution having as the private nonprofit organization's or institution's primary purpose the advancement and preservation of history; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(b)(ii): a municipal or county cultural council having as the municipal or county cultural council's primary purpose the advancement and preservation of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(b)(ii)(A): history;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(b)(ii)(B): natural history;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(b)(ii)(C): art;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(b)(ii)(D): music;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(b)(ii)(E): theater; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(b)(ii)(F): dance.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(c): "Cultural organization" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(c)(i): an agency of the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(c)(ii): except as provided in Subsection (6)(b)(ii), a political subdivision of the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(c)(iii): an educational institution for which annual revenue is directly derived more than 50% from state funds; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(6)(c)(iv): in a county of the first or second class, a radio or television broadcasting network or station, cable communications system, newspaper, or magazine.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(7): 53B-1-102 "Institution" means an institution of higher education listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(8): "Recreational facility" means a publicly owned or operated park, campground, marina, dock, golf course, playground, athletic field, gymnasium, swimming pool, trail system, or other facility used for recreational purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(9): "Rural radio station" means a nonprofit radio station based in a county of the third, fourth, fifth, or sixth class.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(10): In a county of the first class, "zoological facility" means a public, public-private partnership, or private nonprofit building, exhibit, utility and infrastructure, walkway, pathway, roadway, office, administration facility, public service facility, educational facility, enclosure, public viewing area, animal barrier, animal housing, animal care facility, and veterinary and hospital facility related to the advancement, exhibition, or preservation of a mammal, bird, reptile, fish, or an amphibian.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(11): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(11)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(11)(a)(i): Except as provided in Subsection (11)(a)(ii), "zoological organization" means a public, public-private partnership, or private nonprofit organization having as its primary purpose the advancement and preservation of zoology.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(11)(a)(ii): In a county of the first class, "zoological organization" means a nonprofit organization having as nonprofit organization's primary purpose the advancement and exhibition of a mammal, bird, reptile, fish, or an amphibian to an audience of 75,000 or more persons annually.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(11)(b): "Zoological organization" does not include an agency of the state, educational institution, radio or television broadcasting network or station, cable communications system, newspaper, or magazine.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-702(12): "Zoological park" means a park or garden where a collection of wild animals is kept for study, conservation, and public exhibition.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-703 Opinion question election -- Base -- Rate -- Imposition of tax -- Expenditure of revenues -- Administration -- Enactment or repeal of tax -- Effective date -- Notice requirements.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"Shall (insert the name of the county), Utah, be authorized to impose a .1% sales and use tax for (list the purposes for which the revenue collected from the sales and use tax shall be expended)?"Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-703(1): Part 14, City or Town Option Funding for Botanical, Cultural, Recreational, and Zoological Organizations or Facilities; 59-12-103(1); 59-12-104; 59-12-104; Part 14, City or Town Option Funding for Botanical, Cultural, Recreational, and Zoological Organizations or Facilities; (1)(e); (1); 59-12-211; 59-12-215; Title 11, Chapter 14, Local Government Bonding Act

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-703(1)(a)(i): fund cultural facilities, recreational facilities, and zoological facilities, botanical organizations, cultural organizations, and zoological organizations, and rural radio stations, in that county; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-703(1)(a)(ii): provide funding for a botanical organization, cultural organization, or zoological organization to pay for use of a bus or facility rental if that use of the bus or facility rental is in furtherance of the botanical organization's, cultural organization's, or zoological organization's primary purpose.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704 Distribution of revenue -- Advisory board creation -- Determining operating expenses -- Administrative charge.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(1): Except as provided in Subsections (7)(b) and (9), and subject to the requirements of this section, the county legislative body of a county of the first class shall distribute annually any revenue collected under this part to support cultural facilities, recreational facilities, and zoological facilities and botanical organizations, cultural organizations, and zoological organizations within that first class county as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(1)(a): 30% of the revenue to support cultural facilities and recreational facilities located within the county;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(1)(b): 16% of the revenue to support zoological facilities and zoological organizations located within the county as provided in Subsection (2);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(1)(c): as provided in Subsection (5), 45% of the revenue to support no more than 22 botanical organizations and cultural organizations:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(1)(c)(i): each of which has average annual operating expenses of more than $250,000 as determined under Subsection (7); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(1)(c)(ii): whose activities impact all or a significant region of the county or state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(1)(d): 9% of the revenue to botanical organizations and cultural organizations that do not receive revenue under Subsection (1)(c) in communities throughout the county as determined by the county legislative body.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(2)(a): The distribution described in Subsection (1)(b) shall support no more than three zoological facilities and zoological organizations located within the county and having average annual operating expenses of $1,500,000 or more as determined under Subsection (7).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(2)(b): For the calendar years that begin on or after January 1, 2025, and on or before January 1, 2029, the county shall distribute the 16% of the revenue as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(2)(b)(i): 8.25% of the revenue to support a zoological organization having as the zoological organization's primary purpose the operation of an aviary, or a zoological facility that is part of or integrated with an aviary;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(2)(b)(ii): an amount equal to the amount distributed during the previous calendar year to support a zoological organization having as the zoological organization's primary purpose the operation of a zoological park, or a zoological facility that is part of or integrated with a zoological park; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(2)(b)(iii): the remaining amount to a zoological organization having as the zoological organization's primary purpose the operation of an aquarium, or a zoological facility that is part of or integrated with an aquarium.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(2)(c): For a calendar year that begins on or after January 1, 2030, the county shall provide by ordinance for the distribution of the 16% of revenue to no more than three zoological facilities and zoological organizations located within the county and having average annual operating expenses of $1,500,000 or more as determined under Subsection (7).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(3): If more than one zoological organization or zoological facility qualifies to receive the money described in Subsection (2), the county legislative body shall distribute the money described in the subsection for which more than one zoological organization or zoological facility qualifies to whichever zoological organization or zoological facility the county legislative body determines is most appropriate, except that a zoological organization or zoological facility may not receive money under more than one subsection under Subsection (2).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(4): If no zoological organization or zoological facility qualifies to receive money described in Subsection (2), the county legislative body shall distribute the money described in the subsection for which no zoological organization or zoological facility qualifies among the zoological organizations or zoological facilities qualifying for and receiving money under the other subsections in proportion to the zoological organizations' or zoological facilities' average annual operating expenses as determined under Subsection (7).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(5)(a): Subject to Subsection (5)(b), the county legislative body shall distribute the money described in Subsection (1)(c) among the botanical organizations and cultural organizations in proportion to the botanical organizations' and cultural organizations' average annual operating expenses as determined under Subsection (7).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(5)(b): The county may not distribute to any botanical organization or cultural organization described in Subsection (1)(c) an amount that exceeds 35% of the botanical organization's or cultural organization's operating budget.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-704(6): 9-6-201

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-705 Free or reduced admission day available to all state residents.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Each botanical organization, cultural organization, or zoological organization that receives money from a tax imposed under this part and that periodically offers a waived or discounted admission fee shall make the waived or discounted admission fee available to all residents of the state.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-707 Seller or certified service provider reliance on commission information.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A seller or certified service provider is not liable for failing to collect a tax at a tax rate imposed under this part if the seller's or certified service provider's failure to collect the tax is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data provided by the commission in a database created by the commission:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-707(1): containing tax rates, boundaries, or local taxing jurisdiction assignments; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-707(2): indicating the taxability of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-708 Certified service provider or model 2 seller reliance on commission certified software.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-708(1): (2); (4) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-708(1)(a): the certified service provider or model 2 seller relies on software the commission certifies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-708(1)(b): the certified service provider's or model 2 seller's failure to collect a tax required under this part is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-708(1)(b)(i): provided by the commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-708(1)(b)(ii): in the software the commission certifies.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-708(2): (1) The relief from liability described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-708(3): (3)(a) If the taxability of a product category is incorrectly classified in software the commission certifies, the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-708(3)(a): notify a certified service provider or model 2 seller of the incorrect classification of the taxability of a product category in software the commission certifies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-708(3)(b): (3)(a) state in the notice required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-708(4): (3) If a certified service provider or model 2 seller fails to correct the taxability of an item or transaction within 10 days after the day on which the certified service provider or model 2 seller receives the notice described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-709 Purchaser relief from liability.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-709(1): (1)(b); 59-1-401; 59-12-107.1; (1)(a); 59-1-401
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-709(1)(a): (1)(b); 59-1-401; 59-12-107.1 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-709(1)(a)(i): the purchaser's seller or certified service provider relies on incorrect data provided by the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-709(1)(a)(i)(A): on a tax rate;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-709(1)(a)(i)(B): on a boundary;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-709(1)(a)(i)(C): on a taxing jurisdiction; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-709(1)(a)(i)(D): in the taxability matrix the commission provides in accordance with the agreement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-709(1)(a)(ii): 59-12-107.1 the purchaser, regardless of whether the purchaser holds a direct payment permit in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(1): 59-12-802(4) "Affected area" means the portion of a county in which a tax is imposed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(2): 53-2d-101 "Emergency medical services" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(3): "Federally qualified health center" means the same as that term is defined in 42 U.S.C. Sec. 1395x.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(4): "Freestanding urgent care center" means a facility that provides outpatient health care service:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(4)(a): on an as-needed basis, without an appointment;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(4)(b): to the public;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(4)(c): for the diagnosis and treatment of a medical condition if that medical condition does not require hospitalization or emergency intervention for a life threatening or potentially permanently disabling condition; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(4)(d): including one or more of the following services:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(4)(d)(i): a medical history physical examination;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(4)(d)(ii): an assessment of health status; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(4)(d)(iii): treatment:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(4)(d)(iii)(A): for a variety of medical conditions; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(4)(d)(iii)(B): that is commonly offered in a physician's office.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(5): "Municipality" means a city or town.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(6): 26B-2-201 "Nursing care facility" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(7): "Political subdivision" means a county, municipality, local district, or special service district.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(8): "Rural city hospital" means a hospital owned by a city that is located within a third, fourth, fifth, or sixth class county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(9): "Rural county health care facility" means a:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(9)(a): rural county hospital; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(9)(b): rural county nursing care facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(10): 17-50-501 "Rural county hospital" means a hospital owned by a county that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(10)(a): 17-50-501 a third, fourth, fifth, or sixth class county, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(10)(b): located outside of a standard metropolitan statistical area, as designated by the United States Bureau of the Census.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(11): 17-50-501; 17-50-501 "Rural county nursing care facility" means a nursing care facility owned by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(11)(a): 17-50-501 a county that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(11)(a)(i): 17-50-501 a third, fourth, fifth, or sixth class county, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(11)(a)(ii): located outside of a standard metropolitan statistical area, as designated by the United States Census Bureau; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(11)(b): 17-50-501 a special service district if the special service district is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(11)(b)(i): created for the purpose of operating the nursing care facility; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(11)(b)(ii): 17-50-501 within a county that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(11)(b)(ii)(A): 17-50-501 a third, fourth, fifth, or sixth class county, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(11)(b)(ii)(B): located outside of a standard metropolitan statistical area, as designated by the United States Census Bureau.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(12): 17-50-501 "Rural emergency medical services" means emergency medical services that are provided by a county that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(12)(a): 17-50-501 a third, fourth, fifth, or sixth class county, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(12)(b): located outside of a standard metropolitan statistical area, as designated by the United States Census Bureau.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-801(13): "Rural health clinic" means the same as that term is defined in 42 U.S.C. Sec. 1395x.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802 Imposition of rural county health care tax -- Expenditure of tax revenue -- Base -- Rate -- Administration, collection, and enforcement of tax -- Administrative charge.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(1): 59-12-103; 59-12-104; 59-12-104; 59-12-804; 59-12-211; 59-12-215
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(1)(a): 59-12-103 A county legislative body of the following counties may impose a sales and use tax of up to 1% on the transactions described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(1)(a)(i): a county of the third, fourth, fifth, or sixth class; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(1)(a)(ii): a county of the second class that has:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(1)(a)(ii)(A): a national park within or partially within the county's boundaries; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(1)(a)(ii)(B): two or more state parks within or partially within the county's boundaries.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(1)(b): 59-12-104; 59-12-104; 59-12-804 Notwithstanding Subsection (1)(a), a county legislative body may not impose a tax under this section on:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(1)(b)(i): 59-12-104; 59-12-104 the sales and uses described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(1)(b)(ii): 59-12-804 a transaction to the extent a rural city hospital tax is imposed on that transaction in a city that imposes a tax under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(1)(b)(iii): except as provided in Subsection (1)(d), amounts paid or charged for food and food ingredients.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(1)(c): 59-12-211; 59-12-215 For purposes of this Subsection (1), the location of a transaction is determined in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(1)(d): A county legislative body imposing a tax under this section shall impose the tax on the purchase price or sales price for amounts paid or charged for food and food ingredients if the food and food ingredients are sold as part of a bundled transaction attributable to food and food ingredients and tangible personal property other than food and food ingredients.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(2)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (5)(b), before imposing a tax under Subsection (1), a county legislative body shall obtain approval to impose the tax from a majority of the:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(2)(a)(i): members of the county's legislative body; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(2)(a)(ii): county's registered voters voting on the imposition of the tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(2)(b): The county legislative body shall conduct the election according to the procedures and requirements of Title 11, Chapter 14, Local Government Bonding Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(3): Subject to Subsection (4), a county legislative body may use money collected from a tax imposed under Subsection (1) to fund:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(3)(a): for a county described in Subsection (1)(a)(i):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(3)(a)(i): the following costs associated with a federally qualified health center within the county, a freestanding urgent care center within the county, a rural county health care facility within the county, or a rural health clinic within the county:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(3)(a)(i)(A): ongoing operating expenses of the center, clinic, or facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(3)(a)(i)(B): the acquisition of land for the center, clinic, or facility; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(3)(a)(i)(C): the design, construction, equipping, or furnishing of the center, clinic, or facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(3)(a)(ii): rural emergency medical services within the county; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(3)(a)(iii): a combination of the activities described in this Subsection (3)(a); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(3)(b): for a county described in Subsection (1)(a)(ii), emergency medical services that are provided by a political subdivision within that county, subject to Subsection (5)(c).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(4)(a): For a tax enacted on or after July 1, 2024, by a county described in Subsection (1)(a)(i), a county legislative body may use money collected from a tax imposed under Subsection (1) to fund:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(4)(a)(i): the costs described in Subsection (3)(a)(i);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(4)(a)(ii): the following activities to mitigate the impacts of visitors within the county:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(4)(a)(ii)(A): emergency medical services;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(4)(a)(ii)(B): solid waste disposal;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(4)(a)(ii)(C): search and rescue activities;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(4)(a)(ii)(D): law enforcement activities; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(4)(a)(ii)(E): fire protection services;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(4)(a)(iii): avalanche forecasting within the county; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(4)(a)(iv): a combination of the activities described in this Subsection (4)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(4)(b): For a tax increased on or after July 1, 2024, by a county described in Subsection (1)(a)(i), a county legislative body may use the money collected from the increased tax rate to fund the activities described in Subsections (4)(a)(i) through (iv).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(5)(a): A county described in Subsection (1)(a)(ii) may impose a tax under this section within a portion of the county if the affected area includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(5)(a)(i): the entire unincorporated area of the county; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(5)(a)(ii): the entire boundaries of any municipality located within the affected area.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(5)(b): Before a county described in Subsection (1)(a)(ii) may impose a tax under this section within a portion of the county, the county legislative body shall obtain approval to impose the tax from a majority of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(5)(b)(i): the members of the county's legislative body;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(5)(b)(ii): the county's registered voters within the affected area voting on the imposition of the tax, in an election conducted according to the procedures and requirements of Title 11, Chapter 14, Local Government Bonding Act; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(5)(b)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(5)(b)(iii)(A): the members of the legislative body of each municipality located within the affected area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(5)(b)(iii)(B): the members of the governing body of a special service district established under Title 17D, Chapter 1, Special Service District Act, to provide emergency medical services within the affected area.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(5)(c): A county described in Subsection (1)(a)(ii) that imposes a tax under this section within a portion of the county in accordance with this Subsection (5) may use the money collected from the tax to fund emergency medical services that are provided by a political subdivision within the affected area.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(6): 59-12-205
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(6)(a): A tax under this section shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(6)(a)(i): except as provided in Subsection (6)(b), administered, collected, and enforced in accordance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(6)(a)(i)(A): the same procedures used to administer, collect, and enforce the tax under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(6)(a)(i)(A)(I): Part 1, Tax Collection; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(6)(a)(i)(A)(II): Part 2, Local Sales and Use Tax Act; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(6)(a)(i)(B): Chapter 1, General Taxation Policies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(6)(a)(ii): levied for a period of 10 years and may be reauthorized at the end of the 10-year period by the county legislative body as provided in Subsection (1).

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-802(6)(c): A county legislative body shall distribute money collected from a tax under this section quarterly.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-808 Seller or certified service provider reliance on commission information.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A seller or certified service provider is not liable for failing to collect a tax at a tax rate imposed under this part if the seller's or certified service provider's failure to collect the tax is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data provided by the commission in a database created by the commission:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-808(1): containing tax rates, boundaries, or local taxing jurisdiction assignments; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-808(2): indicating the taxability of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-809(1)(a): the certified service provider or model 2 seller relies on software the commission certifies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-809(1)(b): the certified service provider's or model 2 seller's failure to collect a tax required under this part is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-809(1)(b)(i): provided by the commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-809(1)(b)(ii): in the software the commission certifies.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-809(2): (1) The relief from liability described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1101 Statewide purpose.
---------------------------------------------------
The Legislature finds that a statewide purpose is served by this part in that it enables counties to carry out more effectively the counties' statutorily defined roles as political and legal subdivisions of the state by improving the counties' revenue raising capacities.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1104 Seller or certified service provider reliance on commission information.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A seller or certified service provider is not liable for failing to collect a tax at a tax rate imposed under this part if the seller's or certified service provider's failure to collect the tax is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data provided by the commission in a database created by the commission:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1104(1): containing tax rates, boundaries, or local taxing jurisdiction assignments; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1104(2): indicating the taxability of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1105 Certified service provider or model 2 seller reliance on commission certified software.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1105(1): (2); (4) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1105(1)(a): the certified service provider or model 2 seller relies on software the commission certifies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1105(1)(b): the certified service provider's or model 2 seller's failure to collect a tax required under this part is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1105(1)(b)(i): provided by the commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1105(1)(b)(ii): in the software the commission certifies.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1201(5)(c): the lease or rental of the motor vehicle is made for the purpose of temporarily replacing a person's motor vehicle that is being repaired pursuant to a repair agreement or an insurance agreement.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1202 Seller or certified service provider reliance on commission information.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A seller or certified service provider is not liable for failing to collect a tax at a tax rate imposed under this part if the seller's or certified service provider's failure to collect the tax is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data provided by the commission in a database created by the commission:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1202(1): containing tax rates, boundaries, or local taxing jurisdiction assignments; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1202(2): indicating the taxability of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1304 Seller or certified service provider reliance on commission information.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A seller or certified service provider is not liable for failing to collect a tax at a tax rate imposed under this part if the seller's or certified service provider's failure to collect the tax is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data provided by the commission in a database created by the commission:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1304(1): containing tax rates, boundaries, or local taxing jurisdiction assignments; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1304(2): indicating the taxability of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1305 Certified service provider or model 2 seller reliance on commission certified software.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
