Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1305(1)(b)(i): provided by the commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1305(1)(b)(ii): in the software the commission certifies.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1402(6)(b)(iii)(B): the city or town legislative body may submit the opinion question to the residents of the city or town in accordance with this part because although a majority of the county's registered voters voted against the county imposing the tax, the majority of the registered voters who are residents of the city or town voted for the imposition of the county tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1402(6)(c): (6)(b); (6)(a); Part 7, County Option Funding for Botanical, Cultural, Recreational, and Zoological Organizations or Facilities; (1) Notwithstanding Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1405 Seller or certified service provider reliance on commission information.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A seller or certified service provider is not liable for failing to collect a tax at a tax rate imposed under this part if the seller's or certified service provider's failure to collect the tax is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data provided by the commission in a database created by the commission:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1405(1): containing tax rates, boundaries, or local taxing jurisdiction assignments; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-1405(2): indicating the taxability of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2005 Seller or certified service provider reliance on commission information.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A seller or certified service provider is not liable for failing to collect a tax at a tax rate imposed under this part if the seller's or certified service provider's failure to collect the tax is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data provided by the commission in a database created by the commission:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2005(1): containing tax rates, boundaries, or local taxing jurisdiction assignments; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2005(2): indicating the taxability of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2006 Certified service provider or model 2 seller reliance on commission certified software.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2006(1): (2); (4) Except as provided in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This part is known as the "City or Town Option Sales and Use Tax Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2102(1): Title 10, Chapter 2, Part 4, Annexation "Annexation" means an annexation to a city or town under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2102(2): "Annexing area" means an area that is annexed into a city or town.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2104 Seller or certified service provider reliance on commission information.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A seller or certified service provider is not liable for failing to collect a tax at a tax rate imposed under this part if the seller's or certified service provider's failure to collect the tax is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data provided by the commission in a database created by the commission:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2104(1): containing tax rates, boundaries, or local taxing jurisdiction assignments; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2104(2): indicating the taxability of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2105(1)(b)(ii): in the software the commission certifies.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2201 Title.
---------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Local Option Sales and Use Taxes for Transportation Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(1): 59-2-102 "Airline" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(2): 59-12-602 "Airport facility" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(3): "Airport of regional significance" means an airport identified by the Federal Aviation Administration in the most current National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems or an update to the National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(4): "Annexation" means an annexation to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(4)(a): a county under Title 17, Chapter 2, County Consolidations and Annexations; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(4)(b): a city or town under Title 10, Chapter 2, Part 4, Annexation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(5): "Annexing area" means an area that is annexed into a county, city, or town.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(6): 72-3-102 "Class A road" means the same as that term is described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(7): 72-3-103 "Class B road" means the same as that term is described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(8): 72-3-104 "Class C road" means the same as that term is described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(9): 72-3-105 "Class D road" means the same as that term is described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(10): 72-2-117.5 "Council of governments" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(11): "Eligible political subdivision" means a political subdivision that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(11)(a): provides public transit services;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(11)(b): is not a public transit district; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(11)(c): is not annexed into a public transit district.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(12): 59-12-102 "Fixed guideway" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(13): 17B-2a-802 "Large public transit district" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(14): 72-4-102.5 "Major collector highway" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(15): 72-1-208.5 "Metropolitan planning organization" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(16): 72-4-102.5 "Minor arterial highway" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(17): 72-4-102.5 "Minor collector road" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(18): 72-4-102.5 "Principal arterial highway" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(19): 17B-2a-802 "Public transit" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(20): 17B-2a-802 "Public transit district" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(21): 72-2-401 "Public transit innovation grant" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(22): "Public transit provider" means a public transit district or an eligible political subdivision.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(23): "Public transit service" means a service provided as part of public transit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(24): "Regionally significant transportation facility" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(24)(a): in a county of the first or second class:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(24)(a)(i): a principal arterial highway;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(24)(a)(ii): a minor arterial highway;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(24)(a)(iii): a fixed guideway that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(24)(a)(iii)(A): extends across two or more cities or unincorporated areas; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(24)(a)(iii)(B): is an extension to an existing fixed guideway; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(24)(a)(iv): an airport of regional significance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(24)(b): in a county of the second class that is not part of a large public transit district, or in a county of the third, fourth, fifth, or sixth class:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(24)(b)(i): a principal arterial highway;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(24)(b)(ii): a minor arterial highway;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(24)(b)(iii): a major collector highway;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(24)(b)(iv): a minor collector road; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(24)(b)(v): an airport of regional significance.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(25): "State highway" means a highway designated as a state highway under Title 72, Chapter 4, Designation of State Highways Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(26): 17B-2a-802
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(26)(a): 17B-2a-802 Subject to Subsection (26)(b), "system for public transit" means the same as the term "public transit" is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(26)(b): "System for public transit" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(26)(b)(i): the following costs related to public transit:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(26)(b)(i)(A): maintenance costs; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(26)(b)(i)(B): operating costs;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(26)(b)(ii): a fixed guideway;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(26)(b)(iii): a park and ride facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(26)(b)(iv): a passenger station or passenger terminal;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(26)(b)(v): a right-of-way for public transit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(26)(b)(vi): the following that serve a public transit facility:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2202(26)(b)(vi)(G): a facility or item similar to those described in Subsections (26)(b)(vi)(A) through (F).

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2210 Seller or certified service provider reliance on commission information.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A seller or certified service provider is not liable for failing to collect a sales and use tax at a tax rate imposed under this part if the seller's or certified service provider's failure to collect the sales and use tax is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data provided by the commission in a database created by the commission:Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2210(1): containing tax rates, boundaries, or local taxing jurisdiction assignments; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2210(2): indicating the taxability of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2211(1)(b)(i): provided by the commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2211(1)(b)(ii): in the software the commission certifies.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2 Allowable uses of local option sales and use tax revenue.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1): Except as otherwise provided in this part, a county, city, or town that imposes a local option sales and use tax under this part may expend the revenue generated from the local option sales and use tax for the following purposes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(a): the development, construction, maintenance, or operation of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(a)(i): a class A road;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(a)(ii): a class B road;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(a)(iii): a class C road;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(a)(iv): a class D road;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(a)(v): traffic and pedestrian safety infrastructure, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(a)(v)(A): a sidewalk;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(a)(v)(B): curb and gutter;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(a)(v)(C): a safety feature;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(a)(v)(D): a traffic sign;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(a)(v)(E): a traffic signal; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(a)(v)(F): street lighting;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(a)(vi): streets, alleys, roads, highways, and thoroughfares of any kind, including connected structures;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(a)(vii): an airport facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(a)(viii): an active transportation facility that is for nonmotorized vehicles and multimodal transportation and connects an origin with a destination; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(a)(ix): an intelligent transportation system;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(b): a system for public transit;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(c): all other modes and forms of conveyance used by the public;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(d): debt service or bond issuance costs related to a project or facility described in Subsections (1)(a) through (c); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(1)(e): corridor preservation related to a project or facility described in Subsections (1)(a) through (c).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(2): Any revenue subject to rights or obligations under a contract between a county, city, or town and a public transit district entered into before January 1, 2019, remains subject to existing contractual rights and obligations.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2212.2(3): 59-12-2219; 59-12-2219 In addition to the uses described in Subsection (1), for any revenue generated by a sales and use tax imposed under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2218(8)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2218(8)(a)(i): Notwithstanding any other provision in this section, if the entire boundary of a county, city, or town is annexed into a large public transit district, if the county, city, or town legislative body wishes to impose a sales and use tax under this section, the county, city, or town legislative body shall pass the ordinance to impose a sales and use tax under this section on or before June 30, 2022.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2218(8)(a)(ii): If the entire boundary of a county, city, or town is annexed into a large public transit district, the county, city, or town legislative body may not pass the ordinance to impose a sales and use tax under this section on or after July 1, 2022.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2218(8)(b): (8)(a) Notwithstanding the deadline described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219 County option sales and use tax for highways and public transit -- Base -- Rate -- Distribution and expenditure of revenue -- Revenue may not supplant existing budgeted transportation revenue.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(1): 59-12-103 Subject to the other provisions of this part, and subject to Subsection (13), a county legislative body may impose a sales and use tax of .25% on the transactions described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(2): Subject to Subsection (9), the commission shall distribute sales and use tax revenue collected under this section as provided in Subsections (3) through (8).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(3): 59-12-2206 If the entire boundary of a county that imposes a sales and use tax under this section is annexed into a single public transit district, the commission shall distribute the sales and use tax revenue collected within the county as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(3)(a): 59-12-2206 .10% shall be transferred to the public transit district in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(3)(b): .10% shall be distributed as provided in Subsection (6); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(3)(c): .05% shall be distributed to the county legislative body.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(4): 59-12-2206; 59-12-2206 If the entire boundary of a county that imposes a sales and use tax under this section is not annexed into a single public transit district, but a city or town within the county is annexed into a single large public transit district, the commission shall distribute the sales and use tax revenue collected within the county as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(4)(a): 59-12-2206 for a city or town within the county that is annexed into a single public transit district, the commission shall distribute the sales and use tax revenue collected within that city or town as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(4)(a)(i): 59-12-2206 .10% shall be transferred to the public transit district in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(4)(a)(ii): .10% shall be distributed as provided in Subsection (6); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(4)(a)(iii): .05% shall be distributed to the county legislative body;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(4)(b): 59-12-2206 for an eligible political subdivision within the county, the commission shall distribute the sales and use tax revenue collected within that eligible political subdivision as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(4)(b)(i): 59-12-2206 .10% shall be transferred to the eligible political subdivision in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(4)(b)(ii): .10% shall be distributed as provided in Subsection (6); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(4)(b)(iii): .05% shall be distributed to the county legislative body; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(4)(c): the commission shall distribute the sales and use tax revenue, except for the sales and use tax revenue described in Subsections (4)(a) and (b), as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(4)(c)(i): .10% shall be distributed as provided in Subsection (6); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(4)(c)(ii): .15% shall be distributed to the county legislative body.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(5): For a county not described in Subsection (3) or (4), if a county of the second, third, fourth, fifth, or sixth class imposes a sales and use tax under this section, the commission shall distribute the sales and use tax revenue collected within the county as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(5)(a): for a city or town within the county that is annexed into a single public transit district, the commission shall distribute the sales and use tax revenue collected within that city or town as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(5)(a)(i): .10% shall be distributed as provided in Subsection (6);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(5)(a)(ii): .10% shall be distributed as provided in Subsection (7); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(5)(a)(iii): .05% shall be distributed to the county legislative body;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(5)(b): for an eligible political subdivision within the county, the commission shall distribute the sales and use tax revenue collected within that eligible political subdivision as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(5)(b)(i): .10% shall be distributed as provided in Subsection (6);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(5)(b)(ii): .10% shall be distributed as provided in Subsection (7); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(5)(b)(iii): .05% shall be distributed to the county legislative body; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(5)(c): the commission shall distribute the sales and use tax revenue, except for the sales and use tax revenue described in Subsections (5)(a) and (b), as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(5)(c)(i): .10% shall be distributed as provided in Subsection (6); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(5)(c)(ii): .15% shall be distributed to the county legislative body.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(6): 59-12-211; 59-12-215
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(6)(a): 59-12-211; 59-12-215 Subject to Subsection (6)(b), the commission shall make the distributions required by Subsections (3)(b), (4)(a)(ii), (4)(b)(ii), (4)(c)(i), (5)(a)(i), (5)(b)(i), (5)(c)(i), and (7)(d)(ii)(A) as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(6)(a)(i): 50% of the total revenue collected under Subsections (3)(b), (4)(a)(ii), (4)(b)(ii), (4)(c)(i), (5)(a)(i), (5)(b)(i), (5)(c)(i), and (7)(d)(ii)(A) within the counties and cities that impose a tax under this section shall be distributed to the unincorporated areas, cities, and towns within those counties and cities on the basis of the percentage that the population of each unincorporated area, city, or town bears to the total population of all of the counties and cities that impose a tax under this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(6)(a)(ii): 59-12-211; 59-12-215 50% of the total revenue collected under Subsections (3)(b), (4)(a)(ii), (4)(b)(ii), (4)(c)(i), (5)(a)(i), (5)(b)(i), (5)(c)(i), and (7)(d)(ii)(A) within the counties and cities that impose a tax under this section shall be distributed to the unincorporated areas, cities, and towns within those counties and cities on the basis of the location of the transaction as determined under Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(6)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(6)(b)(i): Population for purposes of this Subsection (6) shall be determined on the basis of the most recent official census or census estimate of the United States Bureau of the Census.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(6)(b)(ii): If a needed population estimate is not available from the United States Bureau of the Census, population figures shall be derived from an estimate from the Utah Population Committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7): 59-12-2208; 59-12-2208; 59-12-2208; 59-12-2208; 59-12-2208
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(a)(i): Subject to the requirements in Subsections (7)(b) and (c), a county legislative body:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(a)(i)(A): for a county that obtained approval from a majority of the county's registered voters voting on the imposition of a sales and use tax under this section prior to May 10, 2016, may, in consultation with any cities, towns, or eligible political subdivisions within the county, and in compliance with the requirements for changing an allocation under Subsection (7)(e), allocate the revenue under Subsection (5)(a)(ii) or (5)(b)(ii) by adopting a resolution specifying the percentage of revenue under Subsection (5)(a)(ii) or (5)(b)(ii) that will be allocated to a public transit district or an eligible political subdivision; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(a)(i)(B): for a county that imposes a sales and use tax under this section on or after May 10, 2016, shall, in consultation with any cities, towns, or eligible political subdivisions within the county, allocate the revenue under Subsection (5)(a)(ii) or (5)(b)(ii) by adopting a resolution specifying the percentage of revenue under Subsection (5)(a)(ii) or (5)(b)(ii) that will be allocated to a public transit district or an eligible political subdivision.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(a)(ii): If a county described in Subsection (7)(a)(i)(A) does not allocate the revenue under Subsection (5)(a)(ii) or (5)(b)(ii) in accordance with Subsection (7)(a)(i)(A), the commission shall distribute 100% of the revenue under Subsection (5)(a)(ii) or (5)(b)(ii) to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(a)(ii)(A): a public transit district for a city or town within the county that is annexed into a single public transit district; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(a)(ii)(B): an eligible political subdivision within the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(b): If a county legislative body allocates the revenue as described in Subsection (7)(a)(i), the county legislative body shall allocate not less than 25% of the revenue under Subsection (5)(a)(ii) or (5)(b)(ii) to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(b)(i): a public transit district for a city or town within the county that is annexed into a single public transit district; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(b)(ii): an eligible political subdivision within the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(c): 59-12-2208; 59-12-2208 Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(d): The commission shall make the distributions required by Subsection (5)(a)(ii) or (5)(b)(ii) as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(d)(i): the percentage specified by a county legislative body shall be distributed in accordance with a resolution adopted by a county legislative body under Subsection (7)(a) to an eligible political subdivision or a public transit district within the county; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(d)(ii): except as provided in Subsection (7)(a)(ii), if a county legislative body allocates less than 100% of the revenue under Subsection (5)(a)(ii) or (5)(b)(ii) to a public transit district or an eligible political subdivision, the remainder of the revenue under Subsection (5)(a)(ii) or (5)(b)(ii) not allocated by a county legislative body through a resolution under Subsection (7)(a) shall be distributed as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(d)(ii)(A): 50% of the revenue as provided in Subsection (6); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(d)(ii)(B): 50% of the revenue to the county legislative body.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(e): 59-12-2208; 59-12-2208 If a county legislative body seeks to change an allocation specified in a resolution under Subsection (7)(a), the county legislative body may change the allocation by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(e)(i): adopting a resolution in accordance with Subsection (7)(a) specifying the percentage of revenue under Subsection (5)(a)(ii) or (5)(b)(ii) that will be allocated to a public transit district or an eligible political subdivision;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(e)(ii): obtaining approval to change the allocation of the sales and use tax by a majority of all the members of the county legislative body; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(e)(iii): 59-12-2208; 59-12-2208 subject to Subsection (7)(f):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(e)(iii)(A): 59-12-2208 in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(e)(iii)(B): 59-12-2208 in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(f): 59-12-2208 Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(g): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(g)(i): If a county makes an allocation by adopting a resolution under Subsection (7)(a) or changes an allocation by adopting a resolution under Subsection (7)(e), the allocation shall take effect on the first distribution the commission makes under this section after a 90-day period that begins on the date the commission receives written notice meeting the requirements of Subsection (7)(g)(ii) from the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(g)(ii): The notice described in Subsection (7)(g)(i) shall state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(g)(ii)(A): that the county will make or change the percentage of an allocation under Subsection (7)(a) or (e); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(7)(g)(ii)(B): the percentage of revenue under Subsection (5)(a)(ii) or (5)(b)(ii) that will be allocated to a public transit district or an eligible political subdivision.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(8)(a): If a public transit district is organized after the date a county legislative body first imposes a tax under this section, a change in a distribution required by this section may not take effect until the first distribution the commission makes under this section after a 90-day period that begins on the date the commission receives written notice from the public transit district of the organization of the public transit district.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(8)(b): If an eligible political subdivision intends to provide public transit service within a county after the date a county legislative body first imposes a tax under this section, a change in a distribution required by this section may not take effect until the first distribution the commission makes under this section after a 90-day period that begins on the date the commission receives written notice from the eligible political subdivision stating that the eligible political subdivision intends to provide public transit service within the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(9)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(9)(a)(i): Notwithstanding Subsections (3) through (8), for a county that has not imposed a sales and use tax under this section before May 8, 2018, and if the county imposes a sales and use tax under this section before June 30, 2019, the commission shall distribute all of the sales and use tax revenue collected by the county before June 30, 2019, to the county for the purposes described in Subsection (9)(a)(ii).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(9)(a)(ii): For any revenue collected by a county pursuant to Subsection (9)(a)(i) before June 30, 2019, the county may expend that revenue for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(9)(a)(ii)(A): reducing transportation related debt;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(9)(a)(ii)(B): a regionally significant transportation facility; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(9)(a)(ii)(C): a public transit project of regional significance.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(9)(b): For a county that has not imposed a sales and use tax under this section before May 8, 2018, and if the county imposes a sales and use tax under this section before June 30, 2019, the commission shall distribute the sales and use tax revenue collected by the county on or after July 1, 2019, as described in Subsections (3) through (8).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(9)(c): For a county that has not imposed a sales and use tax under this section before June 30, 2019, if the entire boundary of that county is annexed into a large public transit district, and if the county imposes a sales and use tax under this section on or after July 1, 2019, the commission shall distribute the sales and use tax revenue collected by the county as described in Subsections (3) through (8).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(10): 59-12-2212.2 A county, city, or town may expend revenue collected from a tax under this section, except for revenue the commission distributes in accordance with Subsection (3)(a), (4)(a)(i), (4)(b)(i), or (7)(d)(i), for a purpose described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(11): 59-12-2212.2
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(11)(a): A public transit district or an eligible political subdivision may expend revenue the commission distributes in accordance with Subsection (3)(a), (4)(a)(i), (4)(b)(i), or (7)(d)(i) for capital expenses and service delivery expenses of the public transit district or eligible political subdivision.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(11)(b): 59-12-2212.2 As provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(12): 59-12-2208; 59-12-2208 Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(13): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(13)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(13)(a)(i): Notwithstanding any other provision in this section, if the entire boundary of a county is annexed into a large public transit district, if the county legislative body wishes to impose a sales and use tax under this section, the county legislative body shall pass the ordinance to impose a sales and use tax under this section on or before June 30, 2022.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(13)(a)(ii): If the entire boundary of a county is annexed into a large public transit district, the county legislative body may not pass an ordinance to impose a sales and use tax under this section on or after July 1, 2022.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(13)(b): Notwithstanding the deadline described in Subsection (13)(a), any sales and use tax imposed under this section by passage of a county ordinance on or before June 30, 2022, may remain in effect.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(14): 59-12-103
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(14)(a): 59-12-103 Beginning on July 1, 2020, and subject to Subsection (15), if a county has not imposed a sales and use tax under this section, subject to the provisions of this part, the legislative body of a city or town described in Subsection (14)(b) may impose a .25% sales and use tax on the transactions described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(14)(b): The following cities or towns may impose a sales and use tax described in Subsection (14)(a):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(14)(b)(i): a city or town that has been annexed into a public transit district; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(14)(b)(ii): an eligible political subdivision.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(14)(c): If a city or town imposes a sales and use tax as provided in this section, the commission shall distribute the sales and use tax revenue collected by the city or town as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(14)(c)(i): .125% to the city or town that imposed the sales and use tax, to be distributed as provided in Subsection (6); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(14)(c)(ii): .125%, as applicable, to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(14)(c)(ii)(A): the public transit district in which the city or town is annexed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(14)(c)(ii)(B): the eligible political subdivision for public transit services.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(14)(d): If a city or town imposes a sales and use tax under this section and the county subsequently imposes a sales and use tax under this section, the commission shall distribute the sales and use tax revenue collected within the city or town as described in Subsection (14)(c).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(15): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(15)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(15)(a)(i): Notwithstanding any other provision in this section, if a city or town legislative body wishes to impose a sales and use tax under this section, the city or town legislative body shall pass the ordinance to impose a sales and use tax under this section on or before June 30, 2022.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(15)(a)(ii): A city or town legislative body may not pass an ordinance to impose a sales and use tax under this section on or after July 1, 2022.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2219(15)(b): Notwithstanding the deadline described in Subsection (15)(a), any sales and use tax imposed under this section by passage of an ordinance by a city or town legislative body on or before June 30, 2022, may remain in effect.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(1): 59-12-103; 59-12-2203; 59-12-2213; 59-12-2214; 59-12-2215; 59-12-2216; 59-12-2217; 59-12-2218; 59-12-2219; 59-12-103; 59-12-103 Subject to the other provisions of this part and subject to the requirements of this section, the following counties may impose a sales and use tax under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(1)(a): 59-12-103; 59-12-2203; 59-12-2213; 59-12-2214; 59-12-2215; 59-12-2216; 59-12-2217; 59-12-2218; 59-12-2219 a county legislative body may impose the sales and use tax on the transactions described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(1)(a)(i): the entire boundary of a county is annexed into a large public transit district; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(1)(a)(ii): 59-12-2203; 59-12-2213; 59-12-2214; 59-12-2215; 59-12-2216; 59-12-2217; 59-12-2218; 59-12-2219 the maximum amount of sales and use tax authorizations allowed pursuant to Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(1)(b)(i): the county is an eligible political subdivision; or

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(2): For purposes of Subsection (1) and subject to the other provisions of this section, a county legislative body that imposes a sales and use tax under this section may impose the tax at a rate of .2%.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(3)(a): The commission shall distribute sales and use tax revenue collected under this section as determined by a county legislative body as described in Subsection (3)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(3)(b): If a county legislative body imposes a sales and use tax as described in this section, the county legislative body may elect to impose a sales and use tax revenue distribution as described in Subsection (4), (5), (6), or (7), depending on the class of county, and presence and type of a public transit provider in the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(4): If a county legislative body imposes a sales and use tax as described in this section, and the entire boundary of the county is annexed into a large public transit district, and the county is a county of the first class, the commission shall distribute the sales and use tax revenue as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(4)(a): .10% to a public transit district as described in Subsection (11);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(4)(b): .05% to the cities and towns as provided in Subsection (8); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(4)(c): .05% to the county legislative body.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(5): If a county legislative body imposes a sales and use tax as described in this section and the entire boundary of the county is annexed into a large public transit district, and the county is a county not described in Subsection (4), the commission shall distribute the sales and use tax revenue as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(5)(a): .10% to a public transit district as described in Subsection (11);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(5)(b): .05% to the cities and towns as provided in Subsection (8); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(5)(c): .05% to the county legislative body.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(6)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (12)(c), if the entire boundary of a county that imposes a sales and use tax as described in this section is not annexed into a single public transit district, but a city or town within the county is annexed into a single public transit district, or if the city or town is an eligible political subdivision, the commission shall distribute the sales and use tax revenue collected within the county as provided in Subsection (6)(b) or (c).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(6)(b): For a city, town, or portion of the county described in Subsection (6)(a) that is annexed into the single public transit district, or an eligible political subdivision, the commission shall distribute the sales and use tax revenue collected within the portion of the county that is within a public transit district or eligible political subdivision as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(6)(b)(i): .05% to a public transit provider as described in Subsection (11);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(6)(b)(ii): .075% to the cities and towns as provided in Subsection (8); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(6)(b)(iii): .075% to the county legislative body.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(6)(c): Except as provided in Subsection (12)(c), for a city, town, or portion of the county described in Subsection (6)(a) that is not annexed into a single public transit district or eligible political subdivision in the county, the commission shall distribute the sales and use tax revenue collected within that portion of the county as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(6)(c)(i): .08% to the cities and towns as provided in Subsection (8); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(6)(c)(ii): .12% to the county legislative body.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(7): For a county without a public transit service that imposes a sales and use tax as described in this section, the commission shall distribute the sales and use tax revenue collected within the county as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(7)(a): .08% to the cities and towns as provided in Subsection (8); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(7)(b): .12% to the county legislative body.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(8): 59-12-211; 59-12-215; 10-9a-408; 10-9a-408; 17-27a-408; 17-27a-408
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(8)(a): 59-12-211; 59-12-215 Subject to Subsections (8)(b) and (c), the commission shall make the distributions required by Subsections (4)(b), (5)(b), (6)(b)(ii), (6)(c)(i), and (7)(a) as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(8)(a)(i): 50% of the total revenue collected under Subsections (4)(b), (5)(b), (6)(b)(ii), (6)(c)(i), and (7)(a) within the counties that impose a tax under Subsections (4) through (7) shall be distributed to the unincorporated areas, cities, and towns within those counties on the basis of the percentage that the population of each unincorporated area, city, or town bears to the total population of all of the counties that impose a tax under this section; and

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(8)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(8)(b)(i): Population for purposes of this Subsection (8) shall be determined on the basis of the most recent official census or census estimate of the United States Census Bureau.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(8)(b)(ii): If a needed population estimate is not available from the United States Census Bureau, population figures shall be derived from an estimate from the Utah Population Estimates Committee created by executive order of the governor.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(9): If a public transit service is organized after the date a county legislative body first imposes a tax under this section, a change in a distribution required by this section may not take effect until the first distribution the commission makes under this section after a 90-day period that begins on the date the commission receives written notice from the public transit provider that the public transit service has been organized.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(10)(b): If a county described in Subsection (1)(a) that is a county of the first class imposes the sales and use tax authorized in this section, the county may also use funds distributed in accordance with Subsection (4)(c) for public safety purposes.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(12)(a): 59-12-2208; 59-12-2208 Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(12)(b): If a county passes an ordinance to impose a sales and use tax as described in this section, the sales and use tax shall take effect on the first day of the calendar quarter after a 90-day period that begins on the date the commission receives written notice from the county of the passage of the ordinance.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(12)(c): A county that imposed the local option sales and use tax described in this section before January 1, 2023, may maintain that county's distribution allocation in place as of January 1, 2023.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(13): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(13)(a): Revenue collected from a sales and use tax under this section may not be used to supplant existing General Fund appropriations that a county, city, or town budgeted for transportation or public transit as of the date the tax becomes effective for a county, city, or town.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-12-2220(13)(b): The limitation under Subsection (13)(a) does not apply to a designated transportation or public transit capital or reserve account a county, city, or town established before the date the tax becomes effective.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Chapter 13 - Motor and Special Fuel Tax Act
****************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-101 Short title.
--------------------------------------------
This act is known as the "Motor and Special Fuel Tax Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(1): "Aviation fuel" means fuel that is sold at airports and used exclusively for the operation of aircraft.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(2): "Clean fuel" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(2)(a): the following special fuels:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(2)(a)(i): propane;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(2)(a)(ii): compressed natural gas;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(2)(a)(iii): liquified natural gas;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(2)(a)(iv): electricity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(2)(a)(v): hydrogen; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(2)(b): any motor or special fuel that meets the clean fuel vehicle standards in the federal Clean Air Act Amendments of 1990, Title II.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(3): "Commission" means the State Tax Commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(4): "Consumer Price Index" means the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers as published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics of the United States Department of Labor.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(5): Part 2, Motor Fuel; Part 4, Aviation Fuel
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(5)(a): "Diesel fuel" means any liquid that is commonly or commercially known, offered for sale, or used as a fuel in diesel engines.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(5)(b): Part 2, Motor Fuel; Part 4, Aviation Fuel "Diesel fuel" includes any combustible liquid, by whatever name the liquid may be known or sold, when the liquid is used in an internal combustion engine for the generation of power to operate a motor vehicle licensed to operate on the highway, except fuel that is subject to the tax imposed in
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(6): "Diesel gallon equivalent" means 6.06 pounds of liquified natural gas.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(7): Part 4, Aviation Fuel "Distributor" means any person in this state who:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(7)(a): imports or causes to be imported motor fuel for use, distribution, or sale, whether at retail or wholesale;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(7)(b): produces, refines, manufactures, or compounds motor fuel in this state for use, distribution, or sale in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(7)(c): is engaged in the business of purchasing motor fuel for resale in wholesale quantities to retail dealers of motor fuel and who accounts for his own motor fuel tax liability; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(7)(d): Part 4, Aviation Fuel for purposes of
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(7)(d)(i): federally certificated air carriers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(7)(d)(ii): other persons.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(8): "Dyed diesel fuel" means diesel fuel that is dyed in accordance with 26 U.S.C. Sec. 4082 or United States Environmental Protection Agency or Internal Revenue Service regulations and that is considered destined for nontaxable off-highway use.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(9): "Exchange agreement" means an agreement between licensed suppliers where one is a position holder in a terminal who agrees to deliver taxable special fuel to the other supplier or the other supplier's customer at the loading rack of the terminal where the delivering supplier holds an inventory position.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(10): "Federally certificated air carrier" means a person who holds a certificate issued by the Federal Aviation Administration authorizing the person to conduct an all-cargo operation or scheduled operation, as defined in 14 C.F.R. Sec. 110.2.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(11): "Fuels" means any gas, liquid, solid, mixture, or other energy source which is generally used in an engine or motor for the generation of power, including aviation fuel, clean fuel, diesel fuel, motor fuel, and special fuel.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(12): "Gasoline gallon equivalent" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(12)(a): 5.660 pounds of compressed natural gas; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(12)(b): 2.198 pounds of hydrogen.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(13): "Highway" means every way or place, of whatever nature, generally open to the use of the public for the purpose of vehicular travel notwithstanding that the way or place may be temporarily closed for the purpose of construction, maintenance, or repair.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(14): "Motor fuel" means fuel that is commonly or commercially known or sold as gasoline or gasohol and is used for any purpose, but does not include aviation fuel.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(15): "Motor fuels received" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(15)(a): motor fuels that have been loaded at the refinery or other place into tank cars, placed in any tank at the refinery from which any withdrawals are made directly into tank trucks, tank wagons, or other types of transportation equipment, containers, or facilities other than tank cars, or placed in any tank at the refinery from which any sales, uses, or deliveries not involving transportation are made directly; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(15)(b): motor fuels that have been imported by any person into the state from any other state or territory by tank car, tank truck, pipeline, or any other conveyance at the time when, and the place where, the interstate transportation of the motor fuel is completed within the state by the person who at the time of the delivery is the owner of the motor fuel.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(16): "Oil pricing service" means an organization that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(16)(a): publishes wholesale petroleum prices within the United States;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(16)(b): publishes at least 25,000 rack prices on a daily basis; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(16)(c): receives daily gasoline and diesel prices from at least 100,000 retail outlets in the United States and Canada.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(17): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(17)(a): "Qualified motor vehicle" means a special fuel-powered motor vehicle used, designed, or maintained for transportation of persons or property which:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(17)(a)(i): has a gross vehicle weight or registered gross vehicle weight exceeding 26,000 pounds;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(17)(a)(ii): has three or more axles regardless of weight; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(17)(a)(iii): is used in a combination of vehicles when the weight of the combination of vehicles exceeds 26,000 pounds gross vehicle weight.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(17)(b): "Qualified motor vehicle" does not include a recreational vehicle not used in connection with any business activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(18): Part 3, Special Fuel "Rack," as used in
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(19): Part 3, Special Fuel "Removal," as used in
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(19)(a): loss by evaporation or destruction; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(19)(b): transfers between refineries, racks, or terminals.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(20): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(20)(a): "Special fuel" means any fuel regardless of name or character that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(20)(a)(i): is usable as fuel to operate or propel a motor vehicle upon the public highways of the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(20)(a)(ii): is not taxed under the category of aviation or motor fuel.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(20)(b): Special fuel includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(20)(b)(i): fuels that are not conveniently measurable on a gallonage basis; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(20)(b)(ii): diesel fuel.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(21): Part 3, Special Fuel "Supplier," as used in
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(21)(a): imports or acquires immediately upon importation into this state diesel fuel from within or without a state, territory, or possession of the United States or the District of Columbia;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(21)(b): produces, manufactures, refines, or blends diesel fuel in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(21)(c): otherwise acquires for distribution or sale in this state, diesel fuel with respect to which there has been no previous taxable sale or use; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(21)(d): is in a two party exchange where the receiving party is deemed to be the supplier.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(22): Part 3, Special Fuel "Terminal," as used in
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(23): "Two party exchange" means a transaction in which special fuel is transferred between licensed suppliers pursuant to an exchange agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(24): "Undyed diesel fuel" means diesel fuel that is not subject to the dyeing requirements in accordance with 26 U.S.C. Sec. 4082 or United States Environmental Protection Agency or Internal Revenue Service regulations.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(25): Part 3, Special Fuel "Use," as used in
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(26): Part 3, Special Fuel "User," as used in
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(27): "Ute tribal member" means an enrolled member of the Ute tribe.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(28): "Ute tribe" means the Ute Indian Tribe of the Uintah and Ouray Reservation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(29): 59-13-201.5(3); 59-13-301.5(3) "Ute trust land" means the lands:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(29)(a): of the Uintah and Ouray Reservation that are held in trust by the United States for the benefit of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(29)(a)(i): the Ute tribe;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(29)(a)(ii): an individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(29)(a)(iii): a group of individuals; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-102(29)(b): 59-13-201.5(3); 59-13-301.5(3) specified as trust land by agreement between the governor and the Ute tribe meeting the requirements of Subsections

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201(2): Any increase or decrease in tax rate applies to motor fuel that is imported to the state or sold at refineries in the state on or after the effective date of the rate change.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201(3): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (3)(a)(iv)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201(3)(a): No motor fuel tax is imposed upon:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201(3)(a)(i): motor fuel that is brought into and sold in this state in original packages as purely interstate commerce sales;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201(3)(a)(ii): motor fuel that is exported from this state if proof of actual exportation on forms prescribed by the commission is made within 180 days after exportation;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201(3)(a)(iii): motor fuel or components of motor fuel that is sold and used in this state and distilled from coal, oil shale, rock asphalt, bituminous sand, or solid hydrocarbons located in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201(3)(a)(iv): motor fuel that is sold to the United States government, this state, or the political subdivisions of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201(3)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (3)(a)(iv) In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201(4): The commission may either collect no tax on motor fuel exported from the state or, upon application, refund the tax paid.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201(5)(a): All revenue received by the commission under this part shall be deposited daily with the state treasurer and credited to the Transportation Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201(5)(b): An appropriation from the Transportation Fund shall be made to the commission to cover expenses incurred in the administration and enforcement of this part and the collection of the motor fuel tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201(6): Title 73, Chapter 18, State Boating Act; Title 73, Chapter 18, State Boating Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201(6)(a): Title 73, Chapter 18, State Boating Act The commission shall determine what amount of motor fuel tax revenue is received from the sale or use of motor fuel used in motorboats registered under

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201(7): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (7)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201(7)(a): The United States government or any of its instrumentalities, this state, or a political subdivision of this state that has purchased motor fuel from a licensed distributor or from a retail dealer of motor fuel and has paid the tax on the motor fuel as provided in this section is entitled to a refund of the tax and may file with the commission for a quarterly refund.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201(9)(a)(i): a tax imposed on the basis of the sale, use, or receipt for sale or use of the motor fuel is paid to the Navajo Nation;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201(9)(a)(ii): (9)(a)(i) the tax described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201.5 Refund of taxes impacting Ute tribe and Ute tribal members.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201.5(1): 59-13-204; 59-13-204; (3) In accordance with this section, the Ute tribe may receive a refund from the state of amounts paid to a distributor for taxes imposed on the distributor in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201.5(1)(a): the motor fuel is purchased from a licensed distributor;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201.5(1)(b): 59-13-204 the Ute tribe pays the distributor as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201.5(1)(c): the motor fuel is purchased for use by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201.5(1)(c)(i): the Ute tribe; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201.5(1)(c)(ii): a Ute tribal member from a retail station:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201.5(1)(c)(ii)(B): that is located on Ute trust land; and

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201.5(2)(b): provides a process by which:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-201.5(2)(b)(ii): reports and remits motor fuel tax to the state for sales made to persons who are not Ute tribal members.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202 Refund of tax for agricultural uses on individual income and corporate franchise and income tax returns -- Application for permit for refund -- Division of Finance to pay claims -- Rules permitted to enforce part -- Penalties -- Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee study.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(1): (1)(a)(ii); Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(1)(a): (1)(a)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(1)(a)(i): (1)(a)(ii) Except at provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(1)(a)(ii): "Claimant" does not include an estate or trust.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(1)(b): "Estate" means a nonresident estate or a resident estate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(1)(c): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act "Refundable tax credit" or "tax credit" means a tax credit that a claimant, estate, or trust may claim:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(1)(c)(i): as provided by statute; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(1)(c)(ii): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act regardless of whether, for the taxable year for which the claimant, estate, or trust claims the tax credit, the claimant, estate, or trust has a tax liability under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(1)(c)(ii)(A): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(1)(c)(ii)(B): Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(1)(d): "Trust" means a nonresident trust or a resident trust.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(2): Any claimant, estate, or trust that purchases and uses any motor fuel within the state for the purpose of operating or propelling stationary farm engines and self-propelled farm machinery used for nonhighway agricultural uses, and that has paid the tax on the motor fuel as provided by this part, is entitled to a refund of the tax subject to the conditions and limitations provided under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(3): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act; (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(3)(a): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes; Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act A claimant, estate, or trust desiring a nonhighway agricultural use refund under this part shall claim the refund as a refundable tax credit on the tax return the claimant, estate, or trust files under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(3)(a)(i): Chapter 7, Corporate Franchise and Income Taxes
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(3)(a)(ii): Chapter 10, Individual Income Tax Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(3)(b): (3)(a) A claimant, estate, or trust not subject to filing a tax return described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(3)(c): Any claimant, estate, or trust claiming a refundable tax credit under this section is required to furnish any or all of the information outlined in this section upon request of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(3)(d): A refundable tax credit under this section is allowed only on purchases on which tax is paid during the taxable year covered by the tax return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(4): In order to obtain a permit for a refund of motor fuel tax paid, an application shall be filed containing:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(4)(a): the name of the claimant, estate, or trust;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(4)(b): the claimant's, estate's, or trust's address;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(4)(c): location and number of acres owned and operated, location and number of acres rented and operated, the latter of which shall be verified by a signed statement from the legal owner;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(4)(d): number of acres planted to each crop, type of soil, and whether irrigated or dry; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(4)(e): make, size, and type of fuel used and power rating of each piece of equipment using fuel.  If the claimant, estate, or trust is an operator of self-propelled or tractor-pulled farm machinery with which the claimant, estate, or trust works for hire doing custom jobs for other farmers, the application shall include information the commission requires and shall all be contained in, and be considered part of, the original application.  The claimant, estate, or trust shall also file with the application a certificate from the county assessor showing each piece of equipment using fuel.  This original application and all information contained in it constitutes a permanent file with the commission in the name of the claimant, estate, or trust.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(5): A claimant, estate, or trust claiming the right to a refund of motor fuel tax paid shall file a claim with the commission by April 15 of each year for the refund for the previous calendar year.  The claim shall state the name and address of the claimant, estate, or trust, the number of gallons of motor fuel purchased for nonhighway agricultural uses, and the amount paid for the motor fuel.  The claimant, estate, or trust shall retain the original invoice to support the claim.  No more than one claim for a tax refund may be filed annually by each user of motor fuel purchased for nonhighway agricultural uses.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(6): Upon commission approval of the claim for a refund, the Division of Finance shall pay the amount found due to the claimant, estate, or trust.  The total amount of claims for refunds shall be paid from motor fuel taxes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(7): The commission may refuse to accept as evidence of purchase or payment any instruments that show alteration or that fail to indicate the quantity of the purchase, the price of the motor fuel, a statement that the motor fuel is purchased for purposes other than transportation, and the date of purchase and delivery.  If the commission is not satisfied with the evidence submitted in connection with the claim, the commission may reject the claim or require additional evidence.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(8): A claimant, estate, or trust aggrieved by the decision of the commission with respect to a refundable tax credit or refund may file a request for agency action, requesting a hearing before the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(9): 59-1-401 A claimant, estate, or trust that makes any false claim, report, or statement, as claimant, estate, trust, agent, or creditor, with intent to defraud or secure a refund to which the claimant, estate, or trust is not entitled, is subject to the criminal penalties provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(10): (10)(b); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (3)(a)(i); (10)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(10)(a): (10)(b) In accordance with any rules prescribed by the commission under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(10)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (3)(a)(i); (10)(a) In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(10)(b)(i): (3)(a)(i) making a refund to a claimant, estate, or trust as required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(10)(b)(ii): (10)(a) making a transfer from the Transportation Fund into the Income Tax Fund as required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(10)(b)(iii): enforcing this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(11): (11)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(11)(a): On or before November 30, 2017, and every three years after 2017, the Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee shall review the tax credit provided by this section and make recommendations concerning whether the tax credit should be continued, modified, or repealed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(11)(b): (11)(a) In conducting the review required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(11)(b)(i): schedule time on at least one committee agenda to conduct the review;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(11)(b)(ii): invite state agencies, individuals, and organizations concerned with the credit under review to provide testimony;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(11)(b)(iii): ensure that the recommendations described in this section include an evaluation of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(11)(b)(iii)(A): the cost of the tax credit to the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(11)(b)(iii)(B): the purpose and effectiveness of the tax credit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(11)(b)(iii)(C): the extent to which the state benefits from the tax credit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202(11)(b)(iv): undertake other review efforts as determined by the chairs of the Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5 Refunds of tax due to fire, flood, storm, accident, crime, discharge in bankruptcy, or mixing of fuels -- Filing claims and affidavits -- Commission approval -- Rulemaking -- Appeals -- Penalties.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(1)(a): A retailer, wholesaler, or licensed distributor, who without fault, sustains a loss or destruction of 8,000 or more gallons of motor fuel in a single incident due to fire, flood, storm, accident, or the commission of a crime and who has paid or is required to pay the tax on the motor fuel as provided by this part, is entitled to a refund or credit of the tax subject to the conditions and limitations provided under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(1)(b): The claimant shall file a claim for a refund or credit with the commission within 90 days of the incident.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(1)(c): Any part of a loss or destruction eligible for indemnification under an insurance policy for the taxes paid or required on the loss or destruction of motor fuel is not eligible for a refund or credit under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(1)(d): Any claimant filing a claim for a refund or credit shall furnish any or all of the information outlined in this section upon request of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(1)(e): The burden of proof of loss or destruction is on the claimant who shall provide evidence of loss or destruction to the satisfaction of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(1)(f): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(1)(f)(i): The claim shall include an affidavit containing the:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(1)(f)(i)(A): name of claimant;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(1)(f)(i)(B): claimant's address;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(1)(f)(i)(C): date, time, and location of the incident;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(1)(f)(i)(D): cause of the incident;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(1)(f)(i)(E): name of the investigating agencies at the scene;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(1)(f)(i)(F): number of gallons actually lost from sale; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(1)(f)(i)(G): information on any insurance coverages related to the incident.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(1)(f)(ii): The claimant shall support the claim by submitting the original invoices or copy of the original invoices.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(1)(f)(iii): This original claim and all information contained in it constitutes a permanent file with the commission in the name of the claimant.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(2): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(2)(a): A retailer, wholesaler, or licensed distributor who has paid the tax on motor fuel as provided by this part is entitled to a refund for taxes paid on that portion of an account that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(2)(a)(i): relates to 4,500 or more gallons of motor fuel purchased in a single transaction for which no payment has been received; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(2)(a)(ii): has been discharged in a bankruptcy proceeding.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(2)(b): The claimant shall file a claim for refund with the commission within 90 days from the date of the discharge.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(2)(c): Any claimant filing a claim for a refund shall furnish any or all of the information outlined in this section upon request of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(2)(d): The burden of proof of discharge is on the claimant who shall provide evidence of discharge to the satisfaction of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(2)(e): The claim shall include an affidavit containing the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(2)(e)(i): the name of the claimant;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(2)(e)(ii): the claimant's address;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(2)(e)(iii): the name of the debtor that received a discharge in bankruptcy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(2)(e)(iv): the portion of the account that is subject to an order granting a discharge.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(2)(f): The claimant shall support the claim by submitting:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(2)(f)(i): the original invoices or a copy of the original invoices; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(2)(f)(ii): a certified copy of the notice of discharge.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(2)(g): This original claim and all information contained in it constitutes a permanent file with the commission in the name of the claimant.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(2)(h): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (2) In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3): (3)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3)(a): Subject to the conditions and limitations of this section, a retailer, wholesaler, or licensed distributor is entitled to a refund or credit of motor fuel tax if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3)(a)(i): dyed diesel fuel or special fuel is mixed with motor fuel; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3)(a)(ii): the retailer, wholesaler, or licensed distributor:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3)(a)(ii)(A): returns the mixed motor fuel to the refinery for re-refining; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3)(a)(ii)(B): has paid the tax on the motor fuel as provided by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3)(b): The claimant shall file a claim for a refund or credit with the commission within 90 days of the date the motor fuel was returned to the refinery for re-refinement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3)(c): Any claimant filing a claim for a refund or credit shall furnish any or all of the information outlined in this section upon request of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3)(d): The burden of proof that the motor fuel was returned to the refinery for re-refinement is on the claimant who shall provide evidence to the satisfaction of the commission that the motor fuel was returned to the refinery for re-refinement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3)(e): (3)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3)(e)(i): The claim shall include an affidavit containing the:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3)(e)(i)(A): name of claimant;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3)(e)(i)(B): claimant's address;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3)(e)(i)(C): date, time, and location of the incident;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3)(e)(i)(D): nature of the incident; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3)(e)(i)(E): number of gallons actually required to be re-refined.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3)(e)(ii): The claimant shall support the claim by submitting written verification from a refinery that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3)(e)(ii)(A): the motor fuel mixed with the dyed diesel fuel or special fuel was returned to the refinery for re-refinement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3)(e)(ii)(B): motor fuel tax was paid on the returned motor fuel.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(3)(e)(iii): (3)(b) The claim filed pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(4)(a): Upon commission approval of the claim for a refund, the commission shall pay the amount found due to the claimant.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(4)(b): The total amount of claims for refunds shall be paid from the Transportation Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(5): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(5)(a): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(5)(a)(i): promulgate rules to enforce this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(5)(a)(ii): refuse to accept unsubstantiated evidence for the claim.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(5)(b): If the commission is not satisfied with the evidence submitted in connection with the claim, it may:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(5)(b)(i): reject the claim; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(5)(b)(ii): require additional evidence.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(6): Any person aggrieved by the decision of the commission with respect to a refund or credit may file a request for agency action, requesting a hearing before the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(7): 59-1-401; (7)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(7)(a): 59-1-401 Any person who makes any false claim, report, or statement, either as claimant, agent, or creditor, with intent to defraud or secure a refund or credit to which the claimant is not entitled, is subject to the criminal penalties provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(7)(b): (7)(a) In addition to the penalties under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-202.5(8): 59-13-207 Any refund or credit made under this section does not affect any deduction allowed under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-203.1 Definitions -- License requirements -- Penalty -- Application process and requirements -- Fee not required -- Bonds.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-203.1(1): (1)(c)(i); (1)(c)(i); (1)(c)(i); (1)(c)(i); (1)(c)(i); (1)(c)(i); (1)(c)(ii)(A); (E); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(d)(i); (1)(d)(i); (1)(d)(i); (1)(d)(i); (1)(d)(i); (1)(d)(i); (1)(d)(ii)(A); (E); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-203.1(1)(a): "applicant" means a person that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-203.1(1)(a)(i): is required by this section to obtain a license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-203.1(1)(a)(ii): submits an application:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-203.1(1)(a)(ii)(A): to the commission; and
