Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-204 Distributors liable for tax -- Computations -- Exceptions -- Assumption of liability statements -- Motor fuel received -- Tax to be added to price of motor fuel.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-204(1): Distributors licensed under this part who receive motor fuel are liable for the tax as provided by this part, and shall report the receipt of the motor fuel to the commission and pay the tax as prescribed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-204(2): 59-13-206
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-204(2)(a): Distributors shall compute the tax on the total taxable amount of motor fuel produced, purchased, received, imported, or refined in this state, and all distributors shipping motor fuels into this state shall compute the tax on the total taxable amount of motor fuels received for sale or use in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-204(2)(b): All motor fuel distributed by any distributor to the distributor's branches within this state is considered to be sold at the time of this distribution and is subject to this part as if actually sold.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-204(2)(c): 59-13-206 Distributors licensed under this part may sell motor fuel to other licensed distributors without the payment or collection of the tax, if the purchasing distributor furnishes the seller with an assumption of liability statement indicating the purchasing distributor is a licensed and bonded Utah motor fuel distributor and will assume the Utah motor fuel tax responsibility on all motor fuel purchased from the seller.  The seller shall report each sale to the commission in a monthly report of sales as provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-204(3): If motor fuels have been purchased outside of this state and brought into this state in original packages from a distributor for the use of the consumer, then the tax shall be imposed when the motor fuel is received.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-204(4): (4); (4)(a); 59-13-201.5; (4)(a); 59-13-201(9)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-204(4)(a): Every distributor and retail dealer of motor fuels shall add the amount of the taxes levied and assessed by this part to the price of the motor fuels.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-204(4)(b): (4) This Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-204(4)(c): (4)(a); 59-13-201.5 Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-204(4)(c)(i): by a Ute tribal member; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-204(4)(c)(ii): at a retail station:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-204(4)(c)(ii)(A): wholly owned by the Ute tribe; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-204(4)(c)(ii)(B): located on Ute trust land.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-204(4)(d): (4)(a); 59-13-201(9) For purposes of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-205 License certificate -- Display at place of business -- Failure to secure license -- Penalties.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-205(1): Each distributor of motor fuel shall, at all times, conspicuously display at the distributor's place of business or agency a license certificate issued by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-205(2): 59-1-401 If any person becomes a distributor, without first securing the license required by this part, the motor fuel tax shall be immediately due and payable on account of all motor fuel received.  The commission shall proceed immediately to determine the amount of distributions and shall assess immediately the motor fuel tax on account of the distributions, adding to the motor fuel tax a penalty for failure to secure the license as provided in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-206 Distributor requirements -- Reports and statements to be furnished to the commission -- Contents of statements -- Statement to be signed -- Penalties.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-206(1): Every distributor of motor fuel shall render to the commission, on or before the last day of each month, the following statements on forms prescribed by the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-206(1)(a): the number of gallons of motor fuel sold, used, or received for sale or use by the distributor during the preceding calendar month;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-206(1)(b): an itemized account of the date and quantities of motor fuel sold, used, or received for sale or use, stating separately the sales made in interstate commerce and those made in broken packages; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-206(1)(c): any other information incidental to the enforcing of this part which the commission may require.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-206(2): The statement shall be signed by a responsible representative of the distributor.  This signature need not be notarized, but when signed is considered to have been made under oath.  Bills shall be rendered to all purchasers of motor fuel by distributors.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-206(3): (1); 59-1-401 A penalty for failure to file the statement required by Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-207 Deductions allowed -- Prorating of deduction to retail dealers.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-207(1): There is deducted 2% from the gross amount of motor fuel taxable under this part to allow for all evaporation, loss in handling, and expenses of collection.  All distributors shall report the gross amount of taxable motor fuel which is produced, received, refined, or sold in this state from which this deduction shall be made.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-207(2): At the time of submitting the report and payment of the tax, the producers and refiners shall further submit evidence to the satisfaction of the commission that from the amount of the 2% deduction made by them, one half of the deduction has been paid to the registered retail dealers on quantities sold to them during the period covered by the report.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-208 Motor fuel shipments from out of state -- Reports required.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-208(1): Every person delivering within this state any motor fuel which has been shipped from outside the state shall, on or before the last day of each month, report in writing all deliveries during the preceding month to the commission on forms prescribed by it.  The report shall show:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-208(1)(a): the date of delivery;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-208(1)(b): the person who received the delivery;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-208(1)(c): the quantity as shown by the bill of lading; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-208(1)(d): any other information the commission may require.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-208(2): The commission may require from carriers necessary information regarding the shipment of other petroleum products.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-209 Due date -- Delinquency -- Penalties -- Interest -- Collection procedure.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-209(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-209(1)(a): The motor fuel tax is due and payable by the distributor on or before the last day of each month to the commission for the number of gallons of motor fuel sold, used, or received for sale or use by the distributor during the preceding calendar month.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-209(1)(b): The commission shall receipt the distributor for taxes paid and shall promptly deposit all revenue with the state treasurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-209(2): 59-1-401; 59-1-402
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-209(2)(a): If any distributor fails or refuses to pay any tax when it becomes due and payable, the tax is delinquent.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-209(2)(b): 59-1-401 If a distributor is delinquent in tax payments, the commission shall impose a penalty as provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-209(2)(c): 59-1-402 The amount of the tax shall bear interest at the rate and in the manner prescribed in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-209(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-209(3)(a): A report or payment of tax is not considered delinquent if the envelope in which the report or remittance is enclosed bears a post office cancellation mark dated on or before the date on which the report or payment is due.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-209(3)(b): (3)(a) The commission, upon receipt of a report or remittance described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-209(4): 59-1-401 If any part of a tax due is deficient or delinquent because of negligence or disregard of this part, or in the case of false or fraudulent monthly reports, or intent to evade the tax, a penalty shall be added to the tax due as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-209(5): (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-209(5)(a): A tax due and unpaid under this part constitutes a debt due the state and may be collected, together with interest, penalty, and costs, by appropriate judicial proceeding.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-209(5)(b): (5)(a) The remedy described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-209(6): Chapter 1, Part 14, Assessment, Collections, and Refunds Act If the tax imposed by this part is not paid when it is due, collection may be made in accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-210 Commission rulemaking authority.
----------------------------------------------------------------
In accordance with

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-211 Distributor's records -- Audit requirements -- Deposit of revenues with treasurer -- Dedicated credits.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-211(1): A distributor who does not maintain adequate motor fuel records at one location in this state so that an audit of the records may be made, may be required to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-211(1)(a): forward the necessary records to Salt Lake City; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-211(1)(b): pay the necessary expenses of an auditor to make the examination at the proper division office.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-211(2): Funds collected under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-211(2)(a): shall be deposited with the state treasurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-211(2)(b): are dedicated credits for the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-212 Penalties for failure to make reports or returns -- Criminal penalties.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Any person who violates this part or who fails or neglects to make any statement, report, or return required by this part, where the penalty is not otherwise specifically prescribed, is guilty of a criminal violation as provided in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301 Tax basis -- Rate -- Exemptions -- Revenue deposited with treasurer and credited to Transportation Fund -- Reduction of tax in limited circumstances.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(1): (2); (3); (11); (12); 59-13-304; 59-13-201(1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(1)(a): (2); (3); (11); (12); 59-13-304; 59-13-201(1)(a) Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(1)(a)(i): removal of undyed diesel fuel from any refinery;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(1)(a)(ii): removal of undyed diesel fuel from any terminal;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(1)(a)(iii): entry into the state of any undyed diesel fuel for consumption, use, sale, or warehousing;

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(1)(a)(vi): use of untaxed special fuel other than propane or electricity.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(1)(b): The tax imposed under this section shall only be imposed once upon any special fuel.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(2)(a): No special fuel tax is imposed or collected upon dyed diesel fuel which:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(2)(a)(i): is sold or used for any purpose other than to operate or propel a motor vehicle upon the public highways of the state, but this exemption applies only in those cases where the purchasers or the users of special fuel establish to the satisfaction of the commission that the special fuel was used for purposes other than to operate a motor vehicle upon the public highways of the state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(2)(a)(ii): is sold to this state or any of its political subdivisions.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(2)(b): No special fuel tax is imposed on undyed diesel fuel or clean fuel that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(2)(b)(i): sold to the United States government or any of its instrumentalities or to this state or any of its political subdivisions;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(2)(b)(ii): exported from this state if proof of actual exportation on forms prescribed by the commission is made within 180 days after exportation;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(2)(b)(iii): used in a vehicle off-highway;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(2)(b)(iv): used to operate a power take-off unit of a vehicle;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(2)(b)(v): used for off-highway agricultural uses;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(2)(b)(vi): used in a separately fueled engine on a vehicle that does not propel the vehicle upon the highways of the state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(2)(b)(vii): used in machinery and equipment not registered and not required to be registered for highway use.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(3): Title 19, Chapter 2, Air Conservation Act No tax is imposed or collected on special fuel if it is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(3)(a): Title 19, Chapter 2, Air Conservation Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(3)(a)(i): purchased for business use in machinery and equipment not registered and not required to be registered for highway use; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(3)(a)(ii): Title 19, Chapter 2, Air Conservation Act used pursuant to the conditions of a state implementation plan approved under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301(3)(b): propane or electricity.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5 Refund of taxes impacting Ute tribe and Ute tribal members.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(1): 59-13-301; (3) In accordance with this section, the Ute tribe may receive a refund from the state of amounts paid in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(1)(a): the amounts paid by the Ute tribe when it purchases the special fuel includes the amount paid in taxes on the special fuel;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(1)(b): the special fuel is purchased for use by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(1)(b)(i): the Ute tribe; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(1)(b)(ii): a Ute tribal member from a retail station that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(1)(b)(ii)(A): wholly owned by the Ute tribe; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(1)(b)(ii)(B): located on Ute trust land; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(1)(c): (3) the governor and the Ute tribe execute and maintain an agreement meeting the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(2): (1) In addition to the agreement required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(2)(a): provides an allocation formula or procedure for determining:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(2)(a)(i): the amount of special fuel sold by the Ute tribe to a Ute tribal member; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(2)(a)(ii): the amount of special fuel sold by the Ute tribe to a person who is not a Ute tribal member; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(2)(b): provides a process by which:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(2)(b)(i): the Ute tribe obtains a refund permitted by this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(2)(b)(ii): reports and remits special fuel tax to the state for sales made to persons who are not Ute tribal members.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(3): (1) The agreement required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(3)(a): may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(3)(a)(i): authorize the state to impose a tax in addition to a tax imposed under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(3)(a)(ii): provide a refund, credit, or similar tax relief that is greater or different than the refund permitted under this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(3)(a)(iii): affect the power of the state to establish rates of taxation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(3)(b): shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(3)(b)(i): provide that the state agrees to allow the refund described in this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(3)(b)(ii): be in writing;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(3)(b)(iii): be signed by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(3)(b)(iii)(A): the governor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(3)(b)(iii)(B): the chair of the Business Committee of the Ute tribe;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(3)(b)(iv): be conditioned on obtaining any approval required by federal law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(3)(b)(v): state the effective date of the agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(4): (4); (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(4)(a): (4) The governor shall report to the commission by no later than February 1 of each year as to whether or not an agreement meeting the requirements of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(4)(b): (4) If an agreement meeting the requirements of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-301.5(5): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (2) In accordance with

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-302(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-302(7)(a): If any person ceases to be a supplier within the state by reason of the discontinuance, sale, or transfer of the person's business, the supplier shall notify the commission in writing at the time the discontinuance, sale, or transfer takes effect.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-302(7)(b): The notice shall give the date of discontinuance and, in the event of a sale, the date of the sale and the name and address of the purchaser or transferee.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-302(7)(c): Taxes on all special fuel delivery or removal made prior to the discontinuance, sale, or transfer, shall become due and payable on the date of discontinuance, sale, or transfer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-302(7)(d): The supplier shall make a report and pay all taxes, interest, and penalties and surrender to the commission the license certificate that was issued to the supplier by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-302(8): 59-1-401; 59-1-402
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-302(8)(a): The tax imposed by this part shall be a lien upon the property of any supplier liable for an amount of tax that is required to be collected, if the supplier sells the business, stock of goods, or quits business, and if the supplier fails to make a final return and payment within 15 days after the date of selling or quitting business.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-302(8)(b): 59-1-401; 59-1-402 The successor or assigns, if any, shall be required to withhold a sufficient amount of the purchase money to cover the amount of the taxes that are required to be collected and interest or penalties due and paid under Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-303 Special fuel user permits -- Application -- Revocation of permits under certain circumstances.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-303(1): (1)(b); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-303(1)(a): (1)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-303(1)(b): (1)(a) In place of the special fuel user permit issued under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-303(1)(c): The fee for the special fuel user trip permit is $25.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-303(2): A special fuel user permit number shall be assigned to each licensed user and is nontransferable and valid until surrendered by the user for nonuse or until revoked by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-303(3): The special fuel user permit expires December 31 of each year. Special fuel user permits for the calendar year shall be honored until February 28 of the following year.  An application shall be filed with the commission each year for a new special fuel user permit for vehicles operated by a licensed user.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-303(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-303(4)(a): The special fuel user permit shall be kept in the passenger compartment of each vehicle, or as otherwise authorized by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-303(4)(b): A user that does not comply with the requirements of this section may be required to purchase a special fuel user trip permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-303(5): The commission may revoke the special fuel user permit issued under this section from any person refusing or neglecting to comply with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-303(6): Part 5, Interstate Agreements Any user reporting Utah special fuel tax liability under


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-304 Inspection of clean fuel vehicles.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-304(1): The commission may require each clean fuel vehicle to be inspected for safe operation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-304(2): Each clean fuel vehicle shall be equipped with an approved and properly installed carburetion system if it is powered by a fuel that is gaseous at standard atmospheric conditions.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-305 User report required -- Contents of report -- Signature -- Penalties -- Exemptions from requirements -- Change of exemption status -- Duty to notify commission.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-305(1): (5) Unless exempted by Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-305(1)(b): any other information the commission may require to carry out the purposes of this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-305(2): The report shall be signed by the user or a responsible representative.  This signature need not be notarized, but when signed is considered to have been made under oath.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-306 Due date of special fuel tax.
-------------------------------------------------------------
The special fuel tax is due and payable at the offices of the commission on or before the last day of the month following each reporting period.  If not paid at the offices of the commission or if the envelope enclosing the report or remittance does not bear a post office cancellation mark dated on or before the due date, the special fuel tax is delinquent.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-307 Supplier reports -- Signature required -- Penalties.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-307(1): Each supplier shall file with the commission, on or before the last day of each month, a report on forms prescribed by the commission showing the amount of fuel delivered or removed during the preceding calendar month and any other information the commission may require to carry out the purposes of this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-307(2): The report shall be signed by the supplier or a responsible representative.  This signature need not be notarized, but when signed is considered to have been made under oath.  The report shall be accompanied by a remittance payable to the commission for the amount of special fuel tax due.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-307(3): 59-1-401 A penalty is imposed under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-308 Delinquency -- Penalties -- Interest.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
If any user becomes delinquent in tax payments under this part, all licenses or permits issued under this part are automatically revoked.  In addition, the commission shall impose a penalty determined under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-310 Special fuel from out of state -- Reports required -- Contents of reports.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-310(1): Every person who delivers special fuel from outside the state to any consignee within the state shall file with the commission on or before the last day of each month a report on forms prescribed by the commission showing:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-310(1)(a): all deliveries of special fuel within the state during the preceding month; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-310(1)(b): the points of origin and original destination.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-310(2): Where any consignment of special fuel was diverted in transit and delivered within this state, the carrier making delivery of this consignment shall report to the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-310(2)(a): the place of the delivery of the consignment;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-310(2)(b): to whom the consignment was delivered;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-310(2)(c): the number of gallons of special fuel transported or delivered;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-310(2)(d): the date of delivery and the name of the consignor and of the consignee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-310(2)(e): any other information the commission may require.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-311 Tax is a lien against vehicle -- Removable only when tax is paid.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The special fuel tax constitutes a lien upon, and has the effect of an execution duly levied against, any vehicle in which special fuel is used.  The lien may not be removed until the special fuel tax is paid or the vehicle subject to the lien is sold in payment of the tax.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-312 Special fuel user records -- Auditing requirements -- Deposit of funds with treasurer as dedicated credits.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-312(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-312(1)(a): A user claiming a refund for taxes paid to a supplier shall retain on file a receipt or invoice, or a microfilm or microfiche of the receipt or invoice, evidencing the purchase of special fuel and the payment of the tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-312(1)(b): The commission may require the user to furnish summaries or copies of original documentation substantiating the amount of refund claimed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-312(2): If the payer of this tax or the person dealing in special fuel does not maintain records in this state so that an audit of the records may be made by the commission or its representative, that person may be required to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-312(2)(a): forward the necessary records to the commission for examination; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-312(2)(b): pay the necessary expenses for an auditor of the commission to travel to the location of the records outside of this state to make an examination.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-312(3): Funds collected under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-312(3)(a): shall be deposited with the state treasurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-312(3)(b): are dedicated credits for the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-313 Commission to enforce the laws -- Estimations of tax -- Penalties -- Notice of determinations -- Information sharing with other states.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-313(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-313(1)(a): The commission is charged with the enforcement of this part and may prescribe rules relating to administration and enforcement of this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-313(1)(b): The commission may coordinate with state and federal agencies in the enforcement of this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-313(1)(c): Enforcement procedures may include checking diesel fuel dye compliance of storage facilities and tanks of vehicles, in a manner consistent with state and federal law.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-313(2): 59-1-401; 59-1-402; (2)(c)(i); (2)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-313(2)(a): If the commission has reason to question the report filed or the amount of special fuel tax paid to the state by a user or supplier, the commission may compute and determine the amount to be paid based upon the best information available to the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-313(2)(b): 59-1-401; 59-1-402 Any added amount of special fuel tax determined to be due under this section shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-313(2)(b)(i): 59-1-401 have added to it a penalty as provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-313(2)(b)(ii): 59-1-402 bear interest at the rate and in the manner prescribed in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-313(2)(c): (2)(c)(i); (2)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-313(2)(c)(i): The commission shall give to the user or supplier written notice of the commission's determination.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-313(2)(c)(ii): (2)(c)(i); (2)(c)(i) The commission may:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-313(2)(c)(ii)(A): (2)(c)(i) serve the notice described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-313(2)(c)(ii)(B): (2)(c)(i) send the notice described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-313(3): The commission may, upon the duly received request of the officials to whom the enforcement of the special fuel laws of any other state are entrusted, forward to those officials any information which the commission may have in its possession relative to the delivery, removal, production, manufacture, refining, compounding, receipt, sale, use, transportation, or shipment of special fuel by any person.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-314 Special fuel user permit required before registration of vehicle.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Before registering any motor vehicle which is operated by special fuels, the registered owner or lessee of the vehicle shall obtain a valid special fuel user permit for the current year if required under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-315 Transfer of ownership of vehicle -- Lien to be removed -- Tax clearance by commission.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The transfer of registered ownership of any motor vehicle subject to a lien of the tax imposed by this part may be effected only after a certificate of clearance of the tax has been issued by the commission.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-318 Refunds.
----------------------------------------
A refund that a taxpayer is allowed under this chapter shall be paid from the Transportation Fund.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320 Penalties for violations of the special fuel tax provisions.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320(1): The following offenses, unless otherwise provided, are class B misdemeanors:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320(1)(a): failing or refusing to pay the tax imposed by this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320(1)(b): engaging in business in this state as a supplier without being the holder of an uncancelled license to engage in this business;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320(1)(c): operating a motor vehicle, which requires special fuel, upon the highways of this state without a valid special fuel user permit;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320(1)(d): failing to make any of the reports required by this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320(1)(e): making any false statement in any application, report, or statement required by this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320(1)(f): refusing to permit the commission or any employee to examine records as provided by this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320(1)(g): failing to keep proper records of quantities of fuel received, produced, refined, manufactured, compounded, used, or delivered in this state as required by this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320(1)(h): making any false statement in connection with an application for the refund of any money or taxes provided in this part; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320(1)(i): violating any of the provisions of this part for which no penalty is provided.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320(2): 59-1-401 Any person required to make, render, sign, or verify any report and who makes any false or fraudulent report with intent to defeat or evade the assessment required by law to be made, is subject to a criminal violation under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320(3): The remedies of the state are cumulative and no action taken by the commission or any of its officers to pursue any remedy may be construed to be an election on the part of the state to exclude any other allowed by law.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320.5 Use of dyed diesel on highways prohibited -- Penalty.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320.5(1): 41-1a-102 A person may not operate a motor vehicle on a highway if a fuel supply tank of the motor vehicle contains dyed diesel fuel, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320.5(1)(a): permitted under federal law;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320.5(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320.5(1)(b)(i): the motor vehicle is used on the highway only to travel from one parcel of land owned or operated by the owner to another parcel of land owned or operated by the owner; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320.5(1)(b)(ii): the motor vehicle's travel on the highway is necessary for furtherance of agricultural purposes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320.5(1)(c): 41-1a-102 the motor vehicle is special mobile equipment, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320.5(2): (1) A person who violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320.5(2)(a): the greater of $500 or $5 per gallon of dyed diesel fuel within each fuel supply tank of the motor vehicle, based on the maximum storage capacity of each fuel supply tank; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320.5(2)(b): for a second and subsequent offense, the greater of $1,000 or $10 per gallon of dyed diesel fuel within each fuel supply tank of the motor vehicle, based on the maximum storage capacity of each fuel supply tank.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320.5(3): The penalty imposed under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320.5(3)(a): is in addition to any other taxes, interest, or penalties imposed under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320.5(3)(b): shall be deposited in the Transportation Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-320.5(4): Upon making a record of its actions, and upon reasonable cause shown, the commission may waive, reduce, or compromise the penalty imposed under this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-321 Wholesaler option for rack distributions tax payments -- Notification -- Security.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-321(1): As used in this section "wholesaler" means a person who receives a rack distribution of diesel fuel from a supplier for purposes of resale.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-321(2): (2)(a); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-321(2)(a): Upon agreement of wholesaler and supplier, the payment of the taxes to the supplier under this part may be made on or before one business day prior to the time that the supplier is required to remit those taxes to the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-321(2)(b): (2)(a) The wholesaler shall provide written notification to the supplier of the wholesaler's intent to exercise the payment option under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-321(2)(c): (2)(a) The wholesaler's payment of the taxes under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-321(3): (2) Upon the wholesaler's exercise of the payment option provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-321(4): (2); (3) At the option of the supplier, the wholesaler's exercise of the payment option provided under this section may be terminated if the wholesaler fails to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-321(4)(a): (2) remit timely payment of the taxes as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-321(4)(b): (3) provide security as provided in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322 Refunds of tax due to fire, flood, storm, accident, crime, discharge in bankruptcy, or mixing of fuels -- Filing claims and affidavits -- Commission approval -- Rulemaking -- Appeals -- Penalties.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(1)(a): A retailer, wholesaler, licensed distributor, or licensed supplier, who without fault, sustains a loss or destruction of 7,000 or more gallons of diesel fuel in a single incident due to fire, flood, storm, accident, or the commission of a crime and who has paid or is required to pay the tax on the special fuel as provided by this part, is entitled to a refund or credit of the tax subject to the conditions and limitations provided under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(1)(b): The claimant shall file a claim for a refund or credit with the commission within 90 days of the incident.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(1)(c): Any part of a loss or destruction eligible for indemnification under an insurance policy for the taxes paid or required on the loss or destruction of special fuel is not eligible for a refund or credit under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(1)(d): Any claimant filing a claim for a refund or credit shall furnish any or all of the information outlined in this section upon request of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(1)(e): The burden of proof of loss or destruction is on the claimant who shall provide evidence of loss or destruction to the satisfaction of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(1)(f): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(1)(f)(i): The claim shall include an affidavit containing the:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(1)(f)(i)(A): name of claimant;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(1)(f)(i)(B): claimant's address;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(1)(f)(i)(C): date, time, and location of the incident;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(1)(f)(i)(D): cause of the incident;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(1)(f)(i)(E): name of the investigating agencies at the scene;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(1)(f)(i)(F): number of gallons actually lost from sale; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(1)(f)(i)(G): information on any insurance coverages related to the incident.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(1)(f)(ii): The claimant shall support the claim by submitting the original invoices or copy of the original invoices.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(1)(f)(iii): This original claim and all information contained in it constitutes a permanent file with the commission in the name of the claimant.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(2): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(2)(a): A retailer, wholesaler, licensed distributor, or licensed supplier who has paid the tax on special fuel as provided by this part is entitled to a refund for taxes paid on that portion of an account that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(2)(a)(i): relates to 4,500 or more gallons of special fuel purchased in a single transaction for which no payment has been received; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(2)(a)(ii): has been discharged in a bankruptcy proceeding.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(2)(b): The claimant shall file a claim for refund with the commission within 90 days from the date of the discharge.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(2)(c): Any claimant filing a claim for a refund shall furnish any or all of the information outlined in this section upon request of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(2)(d): The burden of proof of discharge is on the claimant who shall provide evidence of discharge to the satisfaction of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(2)(e): The claim shall include an affidavit containing the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(2)(e)(i): the name of the claimant;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(2)(e)(ii): the claimant's address;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(2)(e)(iii): the name of the debtor that received a discharge in bankruptcy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(2)(e)(iv): the portion of the account that is subject to an order granting a discharge.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(2)(f): The claimant shall support the claim by submitting:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(2)(f)(i): the original invoices or a copy of the original invoices; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(2)(f)(ii): a certified copy of the notice of discharge.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(2)(g): This original claim and all information contained in it constitutes a permanent file with the commission in the name of the claimant.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(2)(h): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (2) In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3): (3)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3)(a): Subject to the conditions and limitations of this section, a retailer, wholesaler, licensed distributor, or licensed supplier is entitled to a refund or credit of special fuel tax if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3)(a)(i): dyed diesel fuel or special fuel is mixed with special fuel; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3)(a)(ii): the retailer, wholesaler, licensed distributor, or licensed supplier:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3)(a)(ii)(A): returns the mixed special fuel to the refinery for re-refining; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3)(a)(ii)(B): has paid the tax on the special fuel as provided by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3)(b): The claimant shall file a claim for a refund or credit with the commission within 90 days of the date the special fuel was returned to the refinery for re-refinement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3)(c): Any claimant filing a claim for a refund or credit shall furnish any or all of the information outlined in this section upon request of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3)(d): The burden of proof that the special fuel was returned to the refinery for re-refinement is on the claimant who shall provide evidence to the satisfaction of the commission that the special fuel was returned to the refinery for re-refinement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3)(e): (3)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3)(e)(i): The claim shall include an affidavit containing the:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3)(e)(i)(A): name of claimant;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3)(e)(i)(B): claimant's address;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3)(e)(i)(C): date, time, and location of the incident;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3)(e)(i)(D): nature of the incident; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3)(e)(i)(E): number of gallons of special fuel actually required to be re-refined.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3)(e)(ii): The claimant shall support the claim by submitting written verification from a refinery that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3)(e)(ii)(A): the special fuel mixed with the dyed diesel fuel or special fuel was returned to the refinery for re-refinement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3)(e)(ii)(B): special fuel tax was paid on the returned special fuel.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(3)(e)(iii): (3)(b) The claim filed pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(4)(a): Upon commission approval of the claim for a refund, the commission shall pay the amount found due to the claimant.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(4)(b): The total amount of claims for refunds shall be paid from the Transportation Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(5): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(5)(a): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(5)(a)(i): promulgate rules to enforce this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(5)(a)(ii): refuse to accept unsubstantiated evidence for the claim.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(5)(b): If the commission is not satisfied with the evidence submitted in connection with the claim, it may:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(5)(b)(i): reject the claim; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(5)(b)(ii): require additional evidence.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(6): Any person aggrieved by the decision of the commission with respect to a refund or credit may file a request for agency action, requesting a hearing before the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(7): 59-1-401; (7)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(7)(a): 59-1-401 Any person who makes any false claim, report, or statement, either as claimant, agent, or creditor, with intent to defraud or secure a refund or credit to which the claimant is not entitled, is subject to the criminal penalties provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-322(7)(b): (7)(a) In addition to the penalties under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-401 Aviation fuel tax -- Rate.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-401(1): A tax is imposed upon aviation fuel at the rates provided in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-401(2): (3) Except as provided by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-401(3): Aviation fuel purchased for use by a federally certificated air carrier is subject to a tax of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-401(3)(a): 4 cents per gallon on aviation fuel purchased other than at an international airport:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-401(3)(a)(i): located within a county of the first class; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-401(3)(a)(ii): that has a United States customs office on its premises; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-401(3)(b): 2.5 cents per gallon on aviation fuel purchased at an international airport:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-401(3)(b)(i): located within a county of the first class; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-401(3)(b)(ii): that has a United States customs office on its premises.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-402(1)(b): An appropriation from the Transportation Fund shall be made to the commission to cover expenses incurred in the administration and enforcement of this part and the collection of the aviation fuel tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-402(1)(c): Refunds to which taxpayers are entitled under this part shall be paid from the Transportation Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-402(2): 72-2-126 The state treasurer shall place an amount equal to the total amount received from the sale or use of aviation fuel in the Aeronautics Restricted Account created by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-402(3): 59-13-401; (3)(e)(i); 72-2-126 The tax imposed on each gallon of aviation fuel under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-402(3)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-402(3)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-402(3)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-402(3)(d):

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-402(3)(e)(i): construction, improvements, operation, and maintenance of publicly used airports in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-402(3)(e)(ii): (3)(e)(i) payment of principal and interest on indebtedness incurred for the purposes described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-402(3)(f): 72-2-126 Upon appropriation by the Legislature, the allocation to aeronautical operations of the Department of Transportation shall be used as provided in the Aeronautics Restricted Account created by Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-403 Administration and penalties -- Bond requirements.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-403(1): Part 2, Motor Fuel; Part 4, Aviation Fuel All administrative and penalty provisions of
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-403(2): (1); 59-13-102(7)(d) Notwithstanding Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-501 Interstate fuel tax agreements by commission -- Contents of agreement -- Rulemaking power -- Legal remedies -- Conflicts.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-501(1): The commission may enter into cooperative agreements with other states for the exchange of information and auditing of users of motor fuel and special fuels used in fleets of motor vehicles operated or intended to operate interstate.  Any agreement, arrangement, declaration, or amendment is not effective until stated in writing and filed with the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-501(2): Any agreement may provide for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-501(2)(a): determining the base state for users;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-501(2)(b): users' records requirements;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-501(2)(c): audit procedures;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-501(2)(d): exchange of information;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-501(2)(e): persons eligible for tax licensing;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-501(2)(f): defining qualified motor vehicles;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-501(2)(g): determining if bonding is required;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-501(2)(h): specifying reporting requirements and periods including defining uniform penalty and interest rates for late reporting;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-501(2)(i): determining methods for collecting and forwarding of motor fuel and special fuel taxes and penalties to another jurisdiction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-501(2)(j): any other provisions designed to facilitate the administration of the agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-501(3): The commission may, as required by the terms of an agreement, forward to officers of another state any information in the commission's possession relative to the manufacture, receipts, sale, use, transportation, or shipment of motor fuel or special fuel by any person. The commission may disclose the location of officers, motor vehicles, and other real and personal property of users of motor fuel or special fuel to officers of another state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-501(4): Any agreement may provide for each state to audit the records of persons based in the state, to determine if the motor fuel or special fuel taxes due each state are properly reported and paid.  Each state shall forward the findings of the audits performed on persons based in the state to each state in which the person has taxable use of motor fuels and special fuels.  For persons not based in this state and who have taxable use of motor fuels or special fuels in this state, the commission may serve the audit findings received from another state, in the form of an assessment, on the person as if the audit were conducted by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-501(5): Any agreement entered into pursuant to this section does not preclude the commission from auditing the records of any person covered by the provisions of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-501(6): The legal remedies for any person served with an order or assessment under this section are as prescribed in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-501(7): If the commission enters into any agreement under the authority of this section, and the provisions established in the agreement are in conflict with any rules promulgated by the commission, the agreement provisions prevail.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-502 Interstate fuel tax agreements -- Compliance procedures.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-502(1): 59-13-501; Part 3, Special Fuel After the commission's membership in an agreement provided for under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-502(2): 59-13-102; Part 2, Motor Fuel; Part 2, Motor Fuel Any taxpayer who has vehicles, qualifying under an agreement entered into under this part, which operate on motor fuel as defined under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-13-502(3): 59-1-401; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act The statutory notice procedures of this chapter, penalty provisions of Section


Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Chapter 14 - Cigarette and Tobacco Tax and Licensing Act
*****************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-101 Short title.
--------------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Cigarette and Tobacco Tax and Licensing Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(1): 76-10-101 "Alternative nicotine product" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(2): "Cigarette" means a roll made wholly or in part of tobacco:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(2)(a): regardless of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(2)(a)(i): the size of the roll;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(2)(a)(ii): the shape of the roll;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(2)(a)(iii): whether the tobacco is flavored, adulterated, or mixed with any other ingredient; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(2)(a)(iv): whether the tobacco is heated or burned; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(2)(b): if the roll has a wrapper or cover that is made of paper or any other substance or material except tobacco.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(3): "Cigarette rolling machine" means a device or machine that has the capability to produce at least 150 cigarettes in less than 30 minutes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(4): "Cigarette rolling machine operator" means a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(4)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(4)(a)(i): controls, leases, owns, possesses, or otherwise has available for use a cigarette rolling machine; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(4)(a)(ii): makes the cigarette rolling machine available for use by another person to produce a cigarette; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(4)(b): offers for sale, at retail, a cigarette produced from the cigarette rolling machine.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(5): 59-14-201; 59-14-202; 59-14-301; 59-14-202; 59-14-803 "Consumer" means a person that is not required:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(5)(a): 59-14-201; 59-14-202 under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(5)(b): 59-14-301; 59-14-202 under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(5)(c): 59-14-803 to obtain a license under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(6): "Counterfeit cigarette" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(6)(a): a cigarette that has a false manufacturing label; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(6)(b): a package of cigarettes bearing a counterfeit tax stamp.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(7): 76-10-101
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(7)(a): 76-10-101 "Electronic cigarette" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(7)(b): "Electronic cigarette" does not include a cigarette or a tobacco product.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(8): 76-10-101 "Electronic cigarette product" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(9): 76-10-101 "Electronic cigarette substance" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(10): "Importer" means a person that imports into the United States, either directly or indirectly, a finished cigarette for sale or distribution.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(11): "Indian tribal entity" means a federally recognized Indian tribe, tribal entity, or any other person doing business as a distributor or retailer of cigarettes on tribal lands located in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(12): "Little cigar" means a roll for smoking that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(12)(a): is made wholly or in part of tobacco;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(12)(b): uses an integrated cellulose acetate filter or other similar filter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(12)(c): is wrapped in a substance:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(12)(c)(i): containing tobacco; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(12)(c)(ii): that is not exclusively natural leaf tobacco.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(13): (13)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(13)(a): (13)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(13)(a)(i): manufactures, fabricates, assembles, processes, or labels a finished cigarette; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(13)(a)(ii): makes, modifies, mixes, manufactures, fabricates, assembles, processes, labels, repackages, relabels, or imports an electronic cigarette product or a nicotine product.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(13)(b): "Manufacturer" does not include a cigarette rolling machine operator.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(14): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Moist snuff" means tobacco that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(14)(a): is finely cut, ground, or powdered;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(14)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act has at least 45% moisture content, as determined by the commission by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(14)(c): is not intended to be:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(14)(c)(i): smoked; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(14)(c)(ii): placed in the nasal cavity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(14)(d): except for single-use pouches of loose tobacco, is not packaged, produced, sold, or distributed in single-use units, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(14)(d)(i): tablets;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(14)(d)(ii): lozenges;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(14)(d)(iii): strips;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(14)(d)(iv): sticks; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(14)(d)(v): packages containing multiple single-use units.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(15): 76-10-101 "Nicotine" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(16): 76-10-101 "Nicotine product" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(17): 76-10-101 "Nontherapeutic nicotine device" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(18): 76-10-101 "Nontherapeutic nicotine device substance" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(19): 76-10-101 "Nontherapeutic nicotine product" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(20): 76-10-101 "Prefilled electronic cigarette" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(21): 76-10-101 "Prefilled nontherapeutic nicotine device" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(22): "Retailer" means a person that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(22)(a): sells or distributes a cigarette, an electronic cigarette product, or a nicotine product to a consumer in the state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(22)(b): intends to sell or distribute a cigarette, an electronic cigarette product, or a nicotine product to a consumer in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(23): 59-14-205 "Stamp" means the indicia required to be placed on a cigarette package that evidences payment of the tax on cigarettes required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(24): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(24)(a): "Tobacco product" means a product made of, or containing, tobacco.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(24)(b): "Tobacco product" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(24)(b)(i): a cigarette produced from a cigarette rolling machine;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(24)(b)(ii): a little cigar; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(24)(b)(iii): moist snuff.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(24)(c): "Tobacco product" does not include a cigarette.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-102(25): "Tribal lands" means land held by the United States in trust for a federally recognized Indian tribe.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-103 Waiver or reduction of penalty.
---------------------------------------------------------------
The commission may, upon making a record of its actions, and upon reasonable cause shown, waive, reduce, or compromise any of the penalties or interest imposed under:Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-103(1): 59-14-212(4)(b)(ii) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-103(2): 59-14-214(5)(b)(ii) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-103(3): 59-14-407(5)(b)(ii) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-103(4): 59-14-606(7)(b)(ii) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-103(5): 59-14-608(1)(d) Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-104 Rate reduction for modified risk tobacco products.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-104(1): (2) Beginning July 1, 2021, the tax imposed under this chapter is reduced in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-104(1)(a): on the first day of a calendar quarter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-104(1)(b): after a 90-day period beginning on the day on which the commission receives a notice from the manufacturer of a product that has received a modified risk tobacco product order from the United States Food and Drug Administration.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-104(2): The tax imposed under this chapter is reduced by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-104(2)(a): 50% for any product that is issued a modified risk tobacco product order under 21 U.S.C. Sec. 387k(g)(1); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-104(2)(b): 25% for any product that is issued a modified risk tobacco product order under 21 U.S.C. Sec. 387k(g)(2).


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-105 Electronic reporting of report on product transferred into the state.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A person that is required to file a report with the commission in accordance with 15 U.S.C. Sec. 376 shall file the report electronically in a format approved by the commission.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-201 License -- Application of part -- Fee -- Bond -- Exceptions.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-201(1): 59-14-202 It is unlawful for any person in this state to manufacture, import, distribute, barter, sell, exchange, or offer cigarettes for sale without first having obtained a license issued by the commission under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-201(2): 59-14-204(2) Except for the tax rates described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-201(3): (3)(a); (b); 59-14-102
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-201(3)(a): A license may not be issued for the sale of cigarettes until the applicant has paid a license fee of $30 or a license renewal fee of $20, as appropriate.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-201(3)(b): The fee for reinstatement of a license that has been revoked, suspended, or allowed to expire is $30.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-201(3)(c): (3)(a); (b); 59-14-102 Notwithstanding Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-201(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-201(4)(a): A license may not be issued until the applicant files a bond with the commission.  The commission shall determine the form and the amount of the bond, the minimum amount of which shall be $500.  The bond shall be executed by the applicant as principal, with a corporate surety, payable to the state and conditioned upon the faithful performance of all the requirements of this chapter, including the payment of all taxes, penalties, and other obligations.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-201(4)(b): An applicant is not required to post a bond if the applicant:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-201(4)(b)(i): purchases during the license year only products that have the proper state stamp affixed as required by this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-201(4)(b)(ii): files an affidavit with the applicant's application attesting to this fact.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202 Issuance of licenses -- Common carrier licenses -- Contents -- Valid for three years -- Revocation -- Distribution requirements.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(1): Cigarette licenses may be issued only to a person owning or operating the place or cigarette vending machine from which the cigarette sales are made.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(2)(a): A license is required for each separate place of business.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(2)(b): A licensee shall notify the commission within 30 days in the event that it changes the location of the business.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(3): Applications for a license under this chapter shall be submitted on a form authorized by the commission.  Each application shall state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(3)(a): the name and address of the applicant;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(3)(b): the address of each place of business where the applicant's business will be conducted within this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(3)(c): any other information the commission may require relevant to license qualification.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(4): A common carrier is not required to obtain more than one license for sales on conveyances operated by that carrier within the state.  All conveyances owned by a common carrier are considered as one place of business for the purpose of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(5): No license may be granted, maintained, or renewed:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(5)(a): if any combination of people owning directly or indirectly, in the aggregate, more than 10% of the ownership interests in the applicant:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(5)(a)(i): has been convicted of knowingly:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(5)(a)(i)(A): selling stolen or counterfeit cigarettes;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(5)(a)(i)(B): receiving stolen or counterfeit cigarettes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(5)(a)(i)(C): being involved in the smuggling or counterfeiting of cigarettes;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(5)(a)(ii): is a cigarette manufacturer or importer that is not a:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(5)(a)(ii)(A): participating manufacturer as defined in subsection II(jj) of the "Master Settlement Agreement"; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(5)(a)(ii)(B): in full compliance with the provisions of this chapter dealing with nonparticipating manufacturers;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(5)(a)(iii): has imported, or caused to be imported, into the United States any cigarette in violation of 19 U.S.C. 1681a; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(5)(a)(iv): has imported, or caused to be imported into the United States, or manufactured for sale or distribution in the United States any cigarette that does not fully comply with the Federal Cigarette Labeling and Advertising Act, 15 U.S.C. 1331, et. seq.; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(5)(b): until the applicant:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(5)(b)(i): has paid any delinquent cigarette taxes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(5)(b)(ii): has served the period of suspension resulting from any prior revoked license.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(6): Each license shall be numbered, show the residence and place of business of the licensee, and is nontransferable.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(7)(a): Each license is in effect for three years from the date of issuance, unless the license is earlier revoked by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(7)(b): The license expires on the expiration date shown on the license, unless the licensee renews it in accordance with commission rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(7)(c): The commission shall by rule establish procedures for the renewal and reinstatement of licenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(8): (5); (8)(a)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(8)(a): (5) In addition to any civil or criminal penalty provided by law, the commission shall, after providing notice and a hearing, revoke the license of any person:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(8)(a)(i): found to have violated this title; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(8)(a)(ii): (5) who no longer qualifies for licensure under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(8)(b): (8)(a)(i) In the case of a revocation under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(9): A licensee may not barter, sell, exchange, or offer for sale:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(9)(a): cigarettes in an individual package or container that contains less than 20 cigarettes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(9)(b): roll-your-own cigarettes in an individual package or container that contains less than 0.6 ounces of tobacco.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(10): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(10)(a): The commission shall maintain a list that includes the identity of all people licensed under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(10)(b): The list shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(10)(b)(i): include the type of license possessed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-202(10)(b)(ii): be updated by the commission at least once per quarter.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-203 Failure to obtain a license -- Penalty.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Any person engaging in the business of manufacturing, importing, distributing, or selling or offering to sell cigarettes without holding a valid license that is currently not suspended or revoked is guilty of a class B misdemeanor for each offense.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-204 Tax basis -- Rate -- Future increase -- Cigarette Tax Restricted Account -- Appropriation and expenditure of revenues.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-204(1): 59-14-210(3) Except for cigarettes described under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-204(2): (1) The rates of the tax levied under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-204(2)(a): 8.5 cents on each cigarette, for all cigarettes weighing not more than three pounds per thousand cigarettes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-204(2)(b): 9.963 cents on each cigarette, for all cigarettes weighing in excess of three pounds per thousand cigarettes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-204(3): (1) Except as otherwise provided under this chapter, the tax levied under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-204(4): The tax rates specified in this section shall be increased by the commission by the same amount as any future reduction in the federal excise tax on cigarettes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-204(5): (5)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-204(5)(a): There is created within the General Fund a restricted account known as the "Cigarette Tax Restricted Account."
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-204(5)(b): The Cigarette Tax Restricted Account consists of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-204(5)(b)(i): the first $7,950,000 of the revenues collected from a tax under this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-204(5)(b)(ii): any other appropriations the Legislature makes to the Cigarette Tax Restricted Account.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-204(5)(c): For each fiscal year beginning with fiscal year 2011-12 and subject to appropriation by the Legislature, the Division of Finance shall distribute money from the Cigarette Tax Restricted Account as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-204(5)(c)(i): $250,000 to the Department of Health to be expended for a tobacco prevention and control media campaign targeted towards children;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-204(5)(c)(ii): $2,900,000 to the Department of Health to be expended for tobacco prevention, reduction, cessation, and control programs;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-204(5)(c)(iii): $2,000,000 to the University of Utah Health Sciences Center for the Huntsman Cancer Institute to be expended for cancer research; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-204(5)(c)(iv): $2,800,000 to the University of Utah Health Sciences Center to be expended for medical education at the University of Utah School of Medicine.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-204(5)(d): (5)(c) In determining how to appropriate revenue deposited into the Cigarette Tax Restricted Account that is not otherwise appropriated under Subsection
