Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-205 Stamping procedure -- Rules -- Exceptions -- Penalty -- Collection procedure.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-205(1): In the case of manufacturers, jobbers, importers, distributors, wholesalers, and retailers, the taxes imposed on cigarettes by this chapter shall be paid by affixing stamps in the manner and at the time prescribed in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-205(2): All manufacturers, importers, distributors, wholesalers, and retailers shall securely affix the stamps to each individual package or container of cigarettes sold in the state, and may not sell or provide cigarette stamps to any other person.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-205(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-205(3)(a): Stamps shall be securely affixed to each individual package of cigarettes within 72 hours after the cigarettes are received within the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-205(3)(b): All cigarettes shall be stamped before sale within the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-205(3)(c): Cigarettes manufactured within the state shall be stamped by the manufacturer when and as sold.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-205(4): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The commission may, if it is practical and reasonable for the enforcement of the collection of taxes, make rules in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-205(5): The commission may permit a person to sell and export cigarettes to a regular dealer in cigarettes outside the state without affixing stamps.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-205(6): (4); (5); (6)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-205(6)(a): (4); (5) If cigarettes are allowed to remain unstamped under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-205(6)(b): (6)(a) The surety bond described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-205(7): 59-14-210(1)(a)(i) A manufacturer, jobber, importer, distributor, wholesaler, or retailer may not remove, conceal, or obscure a cigarette package:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-205(7)(a): 59-14-210(1)(a)(i) notice described under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-205(7)(b): warning label that is placed on the package in compliance with the Federal Cigarette Labeling and Advertising Act, 15 U.S.C. Sec. 1333.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-205(8): Chapter 1, Part 14, Assessment, Collections, and Refunds Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-205(8)(a): Chapter 1, Part 14, Assessment, Collections, and Refunds Act Any person failing to properly affix and cancel stamps to the cigarettes, under this section and rules promulgated by the commission, may be required by the commission to pay as part of the tax, and in addition to any other penalty provided in this chapter, a penalty of $25 for each offense, to be assessed and collected by the commission in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-205(8)(b): Each article, package, or container found not having proper stamps affixed to the article, package, or container is a separate offense.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-205(8)(c): The presence of any package or container in a place of business conducting retail sales shall be prima facie evidence that it is intended for sale and subject to taxes under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-206 Sales of stamps -- Deposit of revenues -- Redemption of unused stamps -- Discount on lump purchases of stamps -- Unlawful acts.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-206(1): The commission may prepare stamps for use on packages and containers of cigarettes according to its specifications, designs, and denominations and shall keep an accurate record of all stamps for which the commission is responsible.  The cost of the stamps shall be charged to any appropriation made to defray the costs of administering this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-206(2): The commission shall sell stamps only to persons holding licenses issued as provided in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-206(2)(a): The money received from the sale of the stamps, and all other money received from penalties, fees, and taxes provided by this chapter shall be deposited in the General Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-206(2)(b): The commission may deliver stamps in face value not to exceed 90% of the penal sum of the licensee's bond to any licensee without payment.  The licensee shall pay for stamps within 60 days of the date the stamps were delivered on credit to the licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-206(2)(c): Unused stamps may be redeemed within three years of their purchase by presentation to the commission of a claim by the person to whom they were originally sold.  The redemption claim shall be accompanied by the unused stamps.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-206(2)(d): The commission shall certify a redemption claim with its approval to the state auditor, who shall draw a warrant upon the state treasurer for the payment of the claim.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-206(3): The commission shall allow a discount of 4% upon the entire amount to each licensee for each single purchase of stamps amounting to $25 or more.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-206(4): It is unlawful for any person to sell or dispose of stamps to any other person.  However, stamps may be distributed to the various places of sale by the main office whenever a person owns or operates more than one place of sale.  Each place of sale shall have a separate license and cancellation stamp.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-207.5 Transactions only with licensed manufacturers, importers, distributors, and retailers.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-207.5(1): A manufacturer or importer may sell or distribute cigarettes to a licensee if that person is located or doing business in the state, including on any tribal lands located in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-207.5(2): An importer may obtain cigarettes only from a licensed manufacturer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-207.5(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-207.5(3)(a): A distributor may obtain cigarettes only from a licensed manufacturer, importer, or distributor.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-207.5(3)(b): A distributor may sell or distribute cigarettes to a person who is a licensed distributor or retailer, if that person is located or doing business in the state, including on any tribal lands in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-207.5(4): A retailer may obtain cigarettes only from a properly licensed person.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-207.6 Unstamped cigarettes.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-207.6(1): A person who ships unstamped cigarette packages into the state, other than to a licensed manufacturer, importer, distributor, or retailer who is authorized to affix stamps, shall first file with the commission a notice of shipment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-207.6(2): (1) Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-208 Rules for stamping and packaging procedures -- Penalty.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-208(1): The commission may by rule provide for the method of breaking packages, the forms and kinds of containers, and the method of affixing or cancelling stamps.  These rules shall allow for the enforcement of payment by inspection.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-208(2): A person is guilty of a class B misdemeanor who:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-208(2)(a): engages in or permits any practice which is prohibited by law and makes it difficult to enforce the provisions of this chapter by inspection;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-208(2)(b): refuses to allow full inspection of his premises by any peace officer or of any agent of the commission upon demand; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-208(2)(c): hinders or in any way delays or prevents inspection when the demand is made.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-208.5 Payment of cigarette tax by consumers.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-208.5(1): (4) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-208.5(2): The payment shall be accompanied by a form prescribed by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-208.5(3): The payment shall be paid on or before the last day of the month immediately following the month during which the cigarettes were purchased.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-208.5(4): 59-14-205 A consumer is not required to pay a cigarette tax under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-208.5(4)(a): 59-14-205 on cigarettes that are stamped pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-208.5(4)(b): if the consumer is a tourist who imports cigarettes for the tourist's own use or consumption while in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-208.5(5): A consumer shall maintain records necessary to determine the amount of tax the consumer is liable to pay under this part for a period of three years following the date the return required by this part was filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-208.5(6): 59-1-401; 59-1-402 In addition to the tax required by this part, a consumer shall pay a penalty as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-208.5(6)(a): pay the tax prescribed by this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-208.5(6)(b): pay the tax on time; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-208.5(6)(c): file a return required by this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-209 Penalty for willful violation -- Counterfeit cigarettes.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-209(1): 59-14-211(4) A person is guilty of a third degree felony if the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-209(1)(a): 59-14-211(4) knowingly, or with intent to defraud the state violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-209(1)(b): knowingly or willfully removes or otherwise prepares any adhesive stamp with the intent to use or cause to be used after it has already been used;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-209(1)(c): knowingly or willfully buys, sells, offers for sale, or gives away any washed or restored stamp to any person;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-209(1)(d): knowingly or willfully uses or has in his possession any washed or restored stamp that has been removed from the package or container to which it had been previously affixed;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-209(1)(e): reuses any stamp that has already been used to pay a tax provided in this chapter, in order to indicate that person's payment of any tax; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-209(1)(f): buys, sells, or offers for sale or has in his possession any counterfeit stamp.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-209(2): 59-14-102 In addition to any other provision of law, the sale or possession for sale of counterfeit cigarettes, as they are defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-209(2)(a): in the seizure by the commission or law enforcement agency of the manufacturer's, importer's, distributor's, or retailer's:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-209(2)(a)(i): counterfeit cigarettes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-209(2)(a)(ii): any personal property used in direct connection with the sale or possession for sale of counterfeit cigarettes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-209(2)(b): the forfeiture of the seized assets to the state.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-210 Prohibited sales of cigarettes.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-210(1): (3); 59-14-202 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-210(1)(a): in a package which:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-210(1)(a)(i): bears a statement, label, stamp, sticker, or other notice that the manufacturer did not intend the cigarettes to be sold, distributed, or used in the United States, including the following and similar notices:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-210(1)(a)(i)(A): "For Export Only";
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-210(1)(a)(i)(B): "U.S. Tax-Exempt"; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-210(1)(a)(i)(C): "For Use Outside the U.S."; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-210(1)(a)(ii): does not comply with federal law, including 15 U.S.C. 1333 of the Federal Cigarette Labeling and Advertising Act, regarding warning labels and other package information;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-210(1)(b): imported to the United States in violation of 26 U.S.C. 5754;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-210(1)(c): the licensee knows or has reason to know were not manufactured for sale, distribution, or use in the United States;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-210(1)(d): for which a list of added ingredients has not been submitted to the federal Department of Health and Human Services pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1335a of the Federal Cigarette Labeling and Advertising Act; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-210(1)(e): known by the licensee to be otherwise in violation of other related federal law.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-210(2): 59-14-202; 59-22-203(3)(c) A person licensed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-210(3): (1) Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211 Penalties for dealing with prohibited cigarettes -- Private right of action.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(1): 59-14-202; 59-14-210; 59-14-210; 59-14-210(1)(a); 59-14-204; Part 3, Tobacco Products; Part 4, Cigarettes and Tobacco Products; 59-14-210; (1)(c); 59-14-604 A person, regardless of whether the person is a licensee under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(1)(b)(i): 59-14-210 described under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(1)(b)(ii): intended for distribution or sale in the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(1)(c): 59-14-210(1)(a) alters the package of any cigarettes prior to their sale or distribution to the ultimate consumer to remove, conceal, or obscure a notice, warning label, or other package information described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(1)(d): 59-14-204; Part 3, Tobacco Products; Part 4, Cigarettes and Tobacco Products; 59-14-210; (1)(c); 59-14-604 affixes a stamp used to pay the tax imposed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(1)(d)(i): 59-14-210 described under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(1)(d)(ii): (1)(c) known by the person affixing the stamp to be altered as described under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(1)(d)(iii): 59-14-604 in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(2): (1)(a); (d); 59-14-202; 59-14-202 If a person knowingly or with reason to know commits an act described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(2)(a): 59-14-202 suspend or revoke a license issued to the person under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(2)(b): 59-14-202 regardless of whether the person is licensed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(2)(b)(i): 500% of the retail value of the cigarettes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(2)(b)(ii): $5,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(3): Any person whose commercial interests have been adversely affected as a result of a violation of this section may bring an action for injunctive relief, damages, or both.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4): (4)(a)(ii); (4)(a)(iii); (4)(a)(iv); (4)(a)(v)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a): (4)(a)(ii); (4)(a)(iii); (4)(a)(iv); (4)(a)(v) The sale or possession for sale of counterfeit cigarettes by a manufacturer, importer, distributor, or retailer is punishable by a court of law as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(i): a first violation involving a total quantity of less than 100 cartons of cigarettes is punishable by a fine in an amount the greater of $500 or five times the retail value of the cigarettes;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(ii): (4)(a)(ii) a subsequent violation involving a total quantity of less than 100 cartons of cigarettes is punishable by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(ii)(A): the greater of a fine of $2,000 or five times the retail value of the cigarettes;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(ii)(B): imprisonment not to exceed one year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(ii)(C): (4)(a)(ii) both imprisonment and a fine imposed by this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(ii)(D): the revocation by the commission of the manufacturer, importer, distributor, or retailer license for a period of up to two years;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(iii): (4)(a)(iii) a first violation involving a total quantity of 100 cartons of cigarettes or more is punishable by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(iii)(A): the greater of a fine of $2,500 or five times the retail value of the cigarettes;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(iii)(B): imprisonment not to exceed five years; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(iii)(C): (4)(a)(iii) both the fine and imprisonment imposed by this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(iv): (4)(a)(iv) a second violation involving a quantity of 100 cartons of cigarettes or more is punishable by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(iv)(A): the greater of a fine of $10,000 or five times the retail value of the cigarettes;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(iv)(B): imprisonment not to exceed five years; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(iv)(C): (4)(a)(iv) both the fine and imprisonment imposed by this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(iv)(D): the revocation by the commission of the manufacturer, importer, distributor, or retailer license for a period of up to five years; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(v): (4)(a)(v) a third and subsequent violation involving a quantity of 100 cartons of cigarettes or more is punishable by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(v)(A): the greater of a fine of $25,000 or five times the retail value of the cigarettes;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(v)(B): imprisonment not to exceed five years; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(v)(C): (4)(a)(v) both the fine and imprisonment imposed by this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(a)(v)(D): the revocation by the commission of the manufacturer, importer, distributor, or retailer license for a period of up to five years; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-211(4)(b): any counterfeit cigarette seized by the commission shall be destroyed.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214 Nonparticipating manufacturer equity assessment.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(1): 59-22-202; 59-22-202 As used in this section, "nonparticipating manufacturer" means a tobacco product manufacturer, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(2): 59-14-205; 59-14-205; 59-14-204
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(2)(a): 59-14-205 There is levied an equity assessment, at the rate of 1.75 cents on each cigarette, for all cigarette packages of nonparticipating manufacturers to which a stamp is affixed as required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(2)(b): The equity assessment imposed by this section is in addition to all other assessments, fees, and taxes levied under existing law.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(2)(c): 59-14-205 The equity assessment imposed by this section shall be paid by affixing a stamp in the manner and at the time described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(2)(d): 59-14-204 Except as otherwise provided in this section, the equity assessment shall be collected, paid, administered, and enforced in the same manner as the tax on cigarettes levied by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(3): 59-22-202; Chapter 14, Part 6, Tobacco Manufacturer Stamping Enforcement Provisions; 59-22-201; 59-22-203 The purposes of this equity assessment are:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(3)(a): to recover health care costs to the state imposed by nonparticipating manufacturers;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(3)(b): to prevent nonparticipating manufacturers from undermining the state's policy of reducing underage smoking by offering cigarettes for sale substantially below the prices of cigarettes of other manufacturers;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(3)(c): 59-22-202 to protect funding, which is reduced as a result of the growth of nonparticipating manufacturer cigarette sales, for programs funded in whole or in part by payments to the state under the Master Settlement Agreement, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(3)(d): to recoup settlement-payment revenue lost to the state as a result of nonparticipating manufacturer cigarette sales; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(3)(e): Chapter 14, Part 6, Tobacco Manufacturer Stamping Enforcement Provisions; 59-22-201; 59-22-203 to fund enforcement and administration of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(3)(e)(i): Chapter 14, Part 6, Tobacco Manufacturer Stamping Enforcement Provisions
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(3)(e)(ii): 59-22-201; 59-22-203 Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(3)(e)(iii): the equity assessment imposed by this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(4): 59-14-205 Each manufacturer, distributor, wholesaler, or retail dealer who under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(5): Part 2, Cigarettes A person required to file a report under this section who fails to timely file the report, or who provides false or misleading information on, or in relation to, the report:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(5)(a): is guilty of a class B misdemeanor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(5)(b): Part 2, Cigarettes is subject to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(5)(b)(i): Part 2, Cigarettes revocation or suspension of a license under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(5)(b)(ii): a civil penalty, imposed by the commission, in an amount that does not exceed the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(5)(b)(ii)(A): 500% of the retail value of the cigarettes for which an accurate report was not filed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-214(5)(b)(ii)(B): $5,000.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-302(1)(b)(i): whether the tobacco product is shipped f.o.b. origin or f.o.b. destination; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-302(1)(b)(ii): who pays the original Utah destination freight charge.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-303 Remittance of tax -- Returns -- Invoice required -- Filing requirements -- Reports -- Exceptions -- Penalties -- Overpayments.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-303(1): The taxes imposed on all tobacco products shall be remitted to the commission together with quarterly returns as prescribed by the commission.  These returns shall be due and payable to the commission quarterly on or before the last day of the month following each calendar quarterly period.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-303(2): Every manufacturer, wholesaler, retailer, or any other person selling tobacco products to persons other than ultimate consumers shall furnish with each sale an itemized invoice showing the seller's name and address, the name and address of the purchaser, the date of sale, the name and price of the product, and the discount, if any.  A notation should be made that the price includes or does not include the tax.  Copies of this invoice shall be retained by the seller and the purchaser and shall be available for inspection by the commission or its agent for a period of three years following the sale.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-303(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-303(3)(a): A consumer who purchases untaxed products subject to the tax imposed by this part for use or other consumption, shall file with the commission, on forms prescribed by the commission, a statement showing the quantity and description of the products and pay the tax imposed by this part on those products.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-303(3)(b): (3)(a) The statement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-303(3)(c): A consumer shall maintain records necessary to determine the amount of tax the consumer is liable to pay under this part for a period of three years following the date the return required by this part was filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-303(4): No report is required from tourists who import any products taxed by this part if the products are for their own use or consumption while in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-303(5): 59-1-401; 59-1-402 In addition to the tax required by this part, a person shall pay a penalty as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-303(5)(a): pay the tax prescribed by this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-303(5)(b): pay the tax on time; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-303(5)(c): file a return required by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-303(6): 59-1-402 An overpayment of a tax imposed by this part shall accrue interest at the rate and in the manner prescribed in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-401 Refund of taxes paid -- Exemption for exported cigarettes and tobacco products.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-401(1): 59-22-202; 59-14-407; 59-22-203; 59-14-206(2)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-401(1)(a): 59-22-202; 59-14-407; 59-22-203 When any cigarette or tobacco product taxed under this chapter is sold and shipped to a regular dealer in those articles in another state, the seller in this state shall be entitled to a refund of the actual amount of the taxes paid, upon condition that the seller in this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-401(1)(a)(i): is a licensed dealer;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-401(1)(a)(ii): signs an affidavit that the cigarette or tobacco product was so sold and shipped;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-401(1)(a)(iii): furnishes from the purchaser a written acknowledgment that the purchaser has received:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-401(1)(a)(iii)(A): the cigarette or tobacco product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-401(1)(a)(iii)(B): the amount of any stamps for which a refund is requested;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-401(1)(a)(iv): reports the name and address of the purchaser; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-401(1)(a)(v): 59-22-202; 59-14-407; 59-22-203 reports the name of the manufacturer of the cigarette, as defined under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-401(1)(b): 59-14-206(2) The taxes shall be refunded in the manner provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-401(2): Wholesalers or distributors in this state who export taxable cigarettes and tobacco products to a regular dealer in another state shall be exempt from the payment of any tax upon the sale of the articles upon furnishing such proof of the sale and exportation as the commission may require.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-402 Reports of imports and exports of taxable cigarettes and tobacco products.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Every common carrier hauling, transporting, or shipping into or out of the state any taxable cigarettes or tobacco products from or to any other state or foreign country shall, when required by the commission, report in writing to the commission all those shipments or deliveries on blanks furnished by the commission.  The report shall give the date, to whom the products were consigned and delivered, the quantity as shown by the bill of lading, and any other information the commission may require.  The commission is expressly authorized to exact this information from common carriers.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-403 Duplicate invoice requirements -- Failure to comply -- Penalties.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
All persons dealing in taxable cigarettes or tobacco products, who purchase or receive these commodities from outside the state, whether the product is delivered through a wholesaler or distributor in this state, or by drop shipment or otherwise, shall mail or deliver a duplicate invoice of all those purchases or receipts to the commission within 10 days after receipt of the commodities if requested by the commission.  Failure to furnish duplicate invoices or receipts as requested is subject to the penalties provided under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-404 Administration of chapter by commission.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission shall administer and enforce the taxes imposed by this chapter and may:Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-404(1): enter upon the premises of any taxpayer and examine or cause to be examined by any agent or representative designated by it for that purpose, any books, papers, records, or memoranda bearing upon the taxes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-404(2): secure any other information directly or indirectly concerned in the enforcement of this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-406 Assistance for commission.
----------------------------------------------------------
The commission may call to its aid the attorney general, any city, county, or district attorney, or any peace officer to enforce any tax laws which it administers.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-407 Reporting of manufacturer name.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-407(1): 59-22-202; 59-22-202 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-407(1)(a): 59-22-202 "Cigarette" has the same meaning as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-407(1)(b): 59-22-202 "Tobacco product manufacturer" has the same meaning as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-407(2): 59-14-205; 59-22-203 Any manufacturer, distributor, wholesaler, or retail dealer who under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-407(2)(a): the quantity of cigarettes in the package or container; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-407(2)(b): the name of the manufacturer of the cigarettes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-407(3): Part 3, Tobacco Products; 59-22-202; 59-22-203 Any manufacturer, distributor, wholesaler, retail dealer, or other person who is required to pay the tax levied under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-407(3)(a): the quantity of cigarettes upon which the tax is levied; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-407(3)(b): the name of the manufacturer of each cigarette.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-407(4): (2); (3); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The reports under Subsections

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-501 Warning labels required.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-501(1): All smokeless tobacco products sold within the state shall be affixed with an adhesive warning label which states: "Use of this product may cause oral cancer and other mouth disorders and is addictive." As used in this part, "smokeless tobacco products" means chewing tobacco and snuff.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-501(2): The distributor, wholesaler, or manufacturer of smokeless tobacco products shall provide and pay for warning labels in accordance with specifications adopted by the Department of Health.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-502 Requirements for placement of warning labels.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Warning labels shall be securely affixed to each individual package of smokeless tobacco products within 72 hours after receipt of the products by any wholesaler, distributor, or retailer within this state.  All smokeless tobacco products shall be affixed with warning labels before sale within the state.  If any smokeless tobacco products are manufactured within the state, they shall be affixed with warning labels by the manufacturer when sold.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-503 Authority of commission.
--------------------------------------------------------
The commission may adopt rules which permit smokeless tobacco products without affixed warning labels to remain in the hands of a wholesaler or distributor until the original case or crate is broken, unpacked, or sold.  The commission may permit a manufacturer, wholesaler, or distributor to sell and export smokeless tobacco products to a regular dealer in smokeless tobacco products outside the state, without affixing the warning labels required by Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-504 Responsibility for placement of warning labels -- One label required.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
It is the intent and purpose of this part to require all manufacturers, jobbers, wholesalers, and distributors to securely affix the warning labels required by Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-505 Separate offenses -- Evidence of intended sale of products.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Each article, package, or container not having a warning label affixed, as required by Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-506 Contraband goods.
-------------------------------------------------
Any smokeless tobacco products without affixed warning labels as required by this part, which have been in the possession of any wholesaler, distributor, or retailer in this state for 72 hours or longer, or which have been sold by the wholesaler, distributor, or retailer, are contraband goods.  Those contraband goods may be seized by the commission or its employees, or by any peace officer of the state or its political subdivisions, without a warrant.  The contraband goods shall be destroyed.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-507 Penalty for violation.
------------------------------------------------------
Violation of this part is a class B misdemeanor.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-508 Federal laws to supersede these requirements.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
In the event federal legislation requiring warning labels on smokeless tobacco products is enacted, the requirements of that legislation shall supersede the requirements of Sections

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509 Restrictions on mail order or Internet sales.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(1): 59-14-409(1) For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(1)(a): "Distributor" means a person, wherever residing or located, who:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(1)(a)(i): is licensed in this state to purchase non-taxed tobacco products; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(1)(a)(ii): stores, sells, or otherwise disposes of tobacco products.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(1)(b): 59-14-409(1) "Licensed person" is as defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(1)(c): "Order or purchase" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(1)(c)(i): by mail or delivery service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(1)(c)(ii): through the Internet or computer network;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(1)(c)(iii): by telephone; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(1)(c)(iv): through some other electronic method.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(1)(d): "Retailer" means any person who sells tobacco products to consumers for personal consumption.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(2): 59-22-202 A person, distributor, manufacturer, or retailer shall not:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(2)(a): 59-22-202 cause tobacco products or cigarettes as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(2)(b): knowingly provide substantial assistance to a person who violates this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(3): 59-22-202; (2); (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(3)(a): 59-22-202; (2) Each order or purchase of a tobacco product or cigarettes as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(3)(b): (4) In addition to the penalties in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(3)(b)(i): a civil penalty in an amount not to exceed $5,000 for each violation of this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(3)(b)(ii): an injunction to restrain a threatened or actual violation of this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(3)(b)(iii): recovery by the state for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(3)(b)(iii)(A): the costs of investigation;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(3)(b)(iii)(B): the cost of expert witness fees;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(3)(b)(iii)(C): the cost of the action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(3)(b)(iii)(D): reasonable attorney's fees.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-509(4): If a person knowingly violates this section, the court shall order any profits, gain, gross receipts, or other benefit from the violation to be disgorged and paid to the state treasurer for deposit in the General Fund.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-601 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-601(1): "Brand family" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-601(1)(a): all styles of cigarettes sold under the same trademark and differentiated from one another by means of additional modifiers or descriptors, including: "menthol," "lights," "kings," and "100s"; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-601(1)(b): any brand name, alone or in conjunction with any other word, trademark, logo, symbol, motto, selling message, recognizable pattern of colors, or any other indicia of product identification identical or similar to, or identifiable with, a previously known brand of cigarettes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-601(2): 59-22-202(4) "Cigarette" has the same meaning as in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-601(3): 59-1-101 "Commission" means the State Tax Commission as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-601(4): "Distributor" means a person, wherever residing or located, who purchases nontax-paid cigarettes and stores, sells, or otherwise disposes of the cigarettes.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-601(5): 59-22-202(5) "Master Settlement Agreement" has the same meaning as in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-601(6): "Nonparticipating manufacturer" means any tobacco product manufacturer that is not a participating manufacturer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-601(7): "Participating manufacturer" has the meaning given that term in Section II(jj) of the Master Settlement Agreement and all amendments thereto.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-601(8): 59-14-205; 59-14-302 "Stamping agent" means a person that is authorized to affix tax stamps to packages or other containers of cigarettes under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-601(9): 59-22-202(6) "Qualified Escrow Fund" has the same meaning as defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-601(10): (10)(b); 59-22-202(9); 59-14-102
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-601(10)(a): (10)(b); 59-22-202(9) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-601(10)(b): 59-14-102 "Tobacco product manufacturer" does not include a cigarette rolling machine operator as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-601(11): 59-22-202(10) "Units sold" has the same meaning as defined in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-602 Certifications -- Directories -- Tax stamps.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-602(1): 59-14-214; 59-22-203 Every tobacco product manufacturer whose cigarettes are sold in this state, whether directly or through a distributor, retailer, or similar intermediary or intermediaries, shall execute and deliver on a form prescribed by the commission a certification to the attorney general and the commission, no later than April 30th each year, certifying that, as of the date of the certification, the tobacco product manufacturer is either:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-602(1)(a): a participating manufacturer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-602(1)(b): 59-14-214; 59-22-203 in full compliance with Sections

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-602(2)(b): update the list 30 calendar days prior to any addition to, or modification of, its brand families by executing and delivering a supplemental certification to the commission and the attorney general.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-602(3): 59-14-605; 59-22-203; 59-14-607; (3)(a); 59-22-203; (3); (3); 59-14-214; 59-22-203; (3)(a)(viii)(D)

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-602(6): Tobacco product manufacturers shall maintain all invoices and documentation of sales and other information relied upon for the certification required by this section for a period of five years, unless otherwise required by law to maintain them for a greater period of time.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-603 Directory of cigarettes approved for stamping and sale.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-603(1): 59-14-602; 59-14-602; 59-14-602; 59-14-602; 59-22-203 No later than August 30, 2005, the commission shall develop and publish on its website a directory listing:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-603(1)(b): 59-14-602; 59-14-602; 59-14-602; 59-22-203 all brand families that are listed in the certifications required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-603(1)(b)(i): 59-14-602; 59-14-602 the name or brand families of any nonparticipating manufacturer:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-603(1)(b)(i)(A): 59-14-602 who failed to provide the certification required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-603(1)(b)(i)(B): 59-14-602 whose certification is determined by the commission to be out of compliance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-603(1)(b)(ii): 59-22-203 a tobacco product manufacturer or brand family of a nonparticipating manufacturer for which the commission determines:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-603(1)(b)(ii)(A): 59-22-203 any escrow payment required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-603(1)(b)(ii)(B): any outstanding final judgment, including interest thereon, for a violation of the Model Tobacco Settlement Act has not been fully satisfied for the brand family or the tobacco product manufacturer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-603(2): The commission shall update the directory required by this section as necessary:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-603(2)(a): to correct mistakes;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-603(2)(b): to add or remove a tobacco product manufacturer or brand family; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-603(2)(c): to keep the directory in conformity with the requirements of this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-603(3):

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-603(3)(b): The stamping agent shall update the electronic mail address as necessary.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606 Reporting by stamping agents.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(1): 59-14-607 A stamping agent shall submit the following information to the commission not later than 30 calendar days after the end of each calendar quarter, or more frequently if required by the commission by administrative rule in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(1)(a): a list by brand family of the total number of cigarettes for which the stamping agent affixed stamps during the reporting period;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(1)(b): the equivalent stick count for roll your own tobacco, for which the stamping agent paid the tobacco product tax during the reporting period;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(1)(c): the equivalent total number of cigarettes or stick count for which the stamping agent paid taxes for the reporting period; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(1)(d): any other information the commission determines is necessary to enforce this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(2): The stamping agent shall maintain, and make available to the commission, all invoices and documentation of sales of all nonparticipating manufacturer cigarettes and any other information relied upon in reporting to the commission for a period of five years.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(3): The commission may share information received under this part with federal, state, or local agencies as necessary for enforcement of this part, the Model Tobacco Settlement Act, or corresponding laws of other states.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(4): For purposes of complying with the Model Tobacco Settlement Act, the commission may require, at any time, from the nonparticipating manufacturer and from the financial institution in which the manufacturer has established a qualified escrow fund, proof of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(4)(a): the amount of money in the fund, exclusive of interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(4)(b): the amount and date of each deposit to the fund; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(4)(c): the amount and date of each withdrawal from the fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(5): 59-14-214; 59-22-203; 59-14-607 In addition to the information required to be submitted pursuant to Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(6): No person shall be issued a license or granted a renewal of a license to act as a stamping agent unless the person has certified in writing, under penalty of perjury, that the person will comply fully with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(7): Part 2, Cigarettes A person required to file a report under this section who fails to timely file the report, or who provides false or misleading information on, or in relation to, the report:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(7)(a): is guilty of a class B misdemeanor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(7)(b): Part 2, Cigarettes is subject to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(7)(b)(i): Part 2, Cigarettes revocation or suspension of a license under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(7)(b)(ii): a civil penalty, imposed by the commission, in an amount that does not exceed the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(7)(b)(ii)(A): 500% of the retail value of the cigarettes for which an accurate report was not filed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-606(7)(b)(ii)(B): $5,000.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-607(2)(g): as authorized by this part or the Master Settlement Agreement.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-608 License revocation and penalties.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-608(1): 59-14-202; 59-14-604; 59-14-606; (1)(a); 59-14-604; (1)(c); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-608(1)(a): 59-14-202; 59-14-604; 59-14-606 The commission may revoke or suspend the license of a stamping agent in the manner provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-608(1)(b): (1)(a) The penalty imposed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-608(1)(c): 59-14-604 Each stamp affixed and each sale or offer to sell cigarettes in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-608(1)(d): (1)(c); (1)(a) For each violation under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-608(2): 59-14-604; 59-14-213; 59-14-213
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-608(2)(a): 59-14-604; 59-14-213; 59-14-213 Any cigarettes that have been sold, offered for sale, or possessed for sale, in this state, or imported for personal consumption in this state, in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-608(2)(a)(i): 59-14-213 contraband under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-608(2)(a)(ii): 59-14-213 subject to seizure and forfeiture as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-608(2)(b): Cigarettes seized and forfeited under the provisions of this section shall be destroyed and not resold.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-608(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-608(3)(a): The commission may seek an injunction to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-608(3)(a)(i): restrain a threatened or actual violation of this part by a stamping agent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-608(3)(a)(ii): to compel the stamping agent to comply with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-608(3)(b): In any action brought pursuant to this section, the state is entitled to recover the costs of investigation, costs of the action, and reasonable attorney fees.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-609 Effective dates for reporting -- Disgorgement of profits -- Recovery of costs.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-609(1): The first report of the stamping agents required by this part are due by June 15, 2005.  The first certifications of the tobacco product manufacturers required by this part are due June 30, 2005.  The directory required by this part shall be published by the commission no later than August 30, 2005.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-609(2): In any action brought by the state to enforce this part, the state shall be entitled to recover the costs of investigation, expert witness fees, costs of the action, and reasonable attorney fees.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-609(3): 59-14-610
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-609(3)(a): 59-14-610 If a court determines that a person has violated this part, the court shall order any profits, gain, gross receipts, or other benefit from the violation to be disgorged and paid to the State Treasurer for deposit in the Tobacco Control Restricted Account which is created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-609(3)(b): Unless otherwise expressly provided, the remedies or penalties provided by this part are cumulative to each other and to the remedies or penalties available under all other laws of this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-610 Creation of Tobacco Control Restricted Account.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-610(1): There is created within the General Fund a restricted account known as the Tobacco Control Restricted Account.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-610(2): 59-14-609(3) The Tobacco Control Restricted Account consists of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-610(2)(a): 59-14-609(3) all profits, gains, gross receipts, or other benefits ordered to be disgorged by the court under the provisions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-610(2)(b): interest on account money.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-610(3): Upon appropriations by the Legislature, money from the account shall be used for the enforcement of this part and the Master Settlement Agreement.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-611 Severability clause.
----------------------------------------------------
If a court of competent jurisdiction finds that the provisions of this part and of the Model Tobacco Settlement Act conflict and cannot be harmonized, then the provisions of the Model Tobacco Settlement Act shall control.  If any section, subsection, subdivision, paragraph, sentence, clause, or phrase of this part causes the Model Tobacco Settlement Act to no longer constitute a qualifying or model statute, as those terms are defined in the Master Settlement Agreement, then that portion of this part shall not be valid.  If any section, subsection, subdivision, paragraph, sentence, clause, or phrase of this part is for any reason held to be invalid, unlawful, or unconstitutional, such decision shall not affect the validity of the remaining portions of this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-701 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Cigarette Rolling Machine Operators Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-702 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-702(1): 59-14-601 "Brand family" is as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-702(2): 59-14-601 "Tobacco product manufacturer" is as defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703 Certification of cigarette rolling machine operators -- Renewal of certification -- Requirements for certification or renewal of certification -- Denial.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(1): A cigarette rolling machine operator may not perform the following without first obtaining certification from the commission as provided in this part:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(1)(a): locate a cigarette rolling machine within this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(1)(b): make or offer to make a cigarette rolling machine available for use within this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(1)(c): offer a cigarette for sale within this state if the cigarette is produced by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(1)(c)(i): the cigarette rolling machine operator; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(1)(c)(ii): another person at the location of the cigarette rolling machine operator's cigarette rolling machine.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(2): A cigarette rolling machine operator shall renew its certification as provided in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(3): The commission shall prescribe a form for certifying a cigarette rolling machine operator under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(4): (1); (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(4)(a): (1) A cigarette rolling machine operator shall apply to the commission for certification before the cigarette rolling machine operator performs an act described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(4)(b): (3) A cigarette rolling machine operator shall apply to the commission for a renewal of certification on or before the earlier of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(4)(b)(i): December 31 of each year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(4)(b)(ii): (3) the day on which there is a change in any of the information the cigarette rolling machine operator provides on the form described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(5): 59-14-603; 59-14-603; (5)(a)(iii); Title 53, Chapter 7, Part 4, The Reduced Cigarette Ignition Propensity and Firefighter Protection Act To obtain certification or renewal of certification under this section from the commission, a cigarette rolling machine operator shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(5)(a): identify:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(5)(a)(i): the cigarette rolling machine operator's name and address;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(5)(a)(ii): the location, make, and brand of the cigarette rolling machine operator's cigarette rolling machine; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(5)(a)(iii): each person from whom the cigarette rolling machine operator will purchase or be provided tobacco products that the cigarette rolling machine operator will use to produce cigarettes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(5)(b): 59-14-603; 59-14-603; (5)(a)(iii); Title 53, Chapter 7, Part 4, The Reduced Cigarette Ignition Propensity and Firefighter Protection Act certify, under penalty of perjury, that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(5)(b)(i): 59-14-603; 59-14-603 the tobacco to be used in the cigarette rolling machine operator's cigarette rolling machine, regardless of the tobacco's label or description, shall be only of a:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(5)(b)(i)(A): 59-14-603 brand family listed on the commission's directory listing required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(5)(b)(i)(B): 59-14-603 tobacco product manufacturer listed on the commission's directory listing required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(5)(b)(ii): (5)(a)(iii) the cigarette rolling machine operator shall prohibit another person who uses the cigarette rolling machine operator's cigarette rolling machine from using tobacco, a wrapper, or a cover except for tobacco, a wrapper, or a cover purchased by or provided to the cigarette rolling machine operator from a person identified in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(5)(b)(iii): the cigarette rolling machine operator holds a current license issued in accordance with this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(5)(b)(iv): Title 53, Chapter 7, Part 4, The Reduced Cigarette Ignition Propensity and Firefighter Protection Act the cigarettes produced from the cigarette rolling machine shall comply with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(5)(b)(v): the cigarette rolling machine shall be located in a separate and defined area where the cigarette rolling machine operator ensures that an individual younger than 21 years old may not be:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(5)(b)(v)(A): present at any time; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(5)(b)(v)(B): permitted to enter at any time; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(5)(b)(vi): the cigarette rolling machine operator may not barter, distribute, exchange, offer, or sell cigarettes produced from a cigarette rolling machine in a quantity of less than 20 cigarettes per retail transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(6): If the commission determines that a cigarette rolling machine operator meets the requirements for certification or renewal of certification under this section, the commission shall grant the certification or renewal of certification.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(7): If the commission determines that a cigarette rolling machine operator does not meet the requirements for certification or renewal of certification under this section, the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(7)(a): deny the certification or renewal of certification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-703(7)(b): provide the cigarette rolling machine operator the grounds for denial of the certification or renewal of certification in writing.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-704 Cigarette rolling machine operator quarterly report to commission.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-704(1): A cigarette rolling machine operator shall each quarter report to the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-704(1)(a): the number of cigarettes, by weight, produced from each of the cigarette rolling machine operator's cigarette rolling machines for the previous calendar quarter;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-704(1)(b): the brand family and the tobacco product manufacturer of the brand family of the tobacco the cigarette rolling machine operator purchased or was provided for use by the cigarette rolling machine operator's cigarette rolling machine for the previous calendar quarter;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-704(1)(c): the ounces of tobacco the cigarette rolling machine operator purchased or was provided for use by the cigarette rolling machine operator's cigarette rolling machine for the previous calendar quarter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-704(1)(d): each person from whom the cigarette rolling machine operator purchased or was provided tobacco for use by the cigarette rolling machine operator's cigarette rolling machine for the previous calendar quarter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-704(2): A cigarette rolling machine operator shall file the report required by this section on the last day of the month immediately following the last day of the previous calendar quarter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-704(3): The commission shall prescribe the form for the report under this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-705 Cigarette rolling machine operator shall maintain a secure meter on cigarette rolling machine.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-705(1): A cigarette rolling machine operator shall maintain a secure meter on each cigarette rolling machine that the cigarette rolling machine operator controls, leases, owns, possesses, or otherwise has available for use.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-705(2): (1) The secure meter described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-705(2)(a): shall maintain an accurate count of the cigarettes, by weight, dispensed by the cigarette rolling machine;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-705(2)(b): may not be accessed except to take a reading of the secure meter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-705(2)(c): may not be reset or otherwise altered.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-706 Revocation of certification -- Denial of certification or revocation of certification appeal procedures -- Removal of cigarette rolling machine from premises.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-706(1): In addition to the penalties provided under this title, the commission shall revoke the certification of a cigarette rolling machine operator if the cigarette rolling machine operator violates this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-706(2): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 59-14-703 The following are subject to review in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-706(2)(a): 59-14-703 the commission's denial of certification or denial of renewal of certification under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-706(2)(b): the commission's revocation of certification under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-706(3): (3)(a) If the commission revokes the certification of a cigarette rolling machine operator:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-706(3)(a): the commission shall send written notice of the revocation to the cigarette rolling machine operator; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-706(3)(b): (3)(a) the cigarette rolling machine operator:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-706(3)(b)(i): may not use the cigarette rolling machine or make or offer to make the cigarette rolling machine available for use; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-706(3)(b)(ii): (3)(a) no later than 10 days after the date the commission sends the written notice described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-707 Commission rulemaking authority.
----------------------------------------------------------------
In accordance with

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-801 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Electronic Cigarette Product and Nicotine Product Licensing and Taxation Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-802 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-802(1): "Licensee" means a person that holds a valid license to sell an electronic cigarette product or a nicotine product.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-802(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-802(2)(a): "Manufacturer's sales price" means the amount that the manufacturer of an electronic cigarette substance, a prefilled electronic cigarette, an alternative nicotine product, a nontherapeutic nicotine device substance, or a prefilled nontherapeutic nicotine device charges after subtracting a discount.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-802(2)(b): "Manufacturer's sales price" includes an original Utah destination freight charge, regardless of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-802(2)(b)(i): whether the electronic cigarette substance, prefilled electronic cigarette, alternative nicotine product, nontherapeutic nicotine device substance, or prefilled nontherapeutic nicotine device is shipped f.o.b. origin or f.o.b. destination; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-802(2)(b)(ii): who pays the original Utah destination freight charge.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-803(1): (2); (5) A person may not sell, offer to sell, or distribute an electronic cigarette product or a nicotine product in this state without first:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-803(1)(a): (2) except as provided in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-803.5 Publication of licensed distributors -- Retailer transaction only with licensed distributor -- Penalty.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-803.5(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-803.5(1)(a): The commission shall maintain a list that includes the identity of each person licensed under this part to distribute an electronic cigarette product or a nicotine product.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-803.5(1)(b): The list shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-803.5(1)(b)(i): published on the commission website; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-803.5(1)(b)(ii): updated by the commission at least once per quarter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-803.5(2): A retailer may obtain an electronic cigarette product or a nicotine product only from a licensed distributor identified on the list described in Subsection (1).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-803.5(3): 59-14-804
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-803.5(3)(a): The commission may impose a penalty against a retailer that purchases an electronic cigarette product or a nicotine product from a person other than a licensed distributor.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-803.5(3)(b): 59-14-804 The penalty is in an amount equal to the tax that is due under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804 Taxation of electronic cigarette substance, prefilled electronic cigarette, alternative nicotine product, nontherapeutic nicotine device substance, and prefilled nontherapeutic nicotine device.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(1)(a): Beginning on July 1, 2020, a tax is imposed upon the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(1)(a)(i): an electronic cigarette substance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(1)(a)(ii): a prefilled electronic cigarette.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(1)(b): Beginning on July 1, 2021, a tax is imposed upon the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(1)(b)(i): a nontherapeutic nicotine device substance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(1)(b)(ii): a prefilled nontherapeutic nicotine device.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(1)(c): Beginning on July 1, 2021, a tax is imposed upon an alternative nicotine product.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(2): (1)(a); (b); (1)(c); (2)(b)(i)(A); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(2)(a): (1)(a); (b) The amount of tax imposed under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(2)(b): (1)(c); (2)(b)(i)(A); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(2)(b)(i): (1)(c) The tax under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(2)(b)(i)(A): at a rate of $1.83 per ounce; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(2)(b)(i)(B): on the basis of the net weight of the alternative nicotine product as listed by the manufacturer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(2)(b)(ii): (2)(b)(i)(A); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act If the net weight of the alternative nicotine product is in a quantity that is a fractional part of one ounce, a proportionate amount of the tax described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(2)(b)(ii)(A): on that fractional part of one ounce; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(2)(b)(ii)(B): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act in accordance with rules made by the commission in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(3): (1); (2) If a product is sold in the same package as a product that is taxed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(4): (1); (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(4)(a): (1) A manufacturer, jobber, distributor, wholesaler, retailer, consumer, or user shall pay the tax levied under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(4)(b): (1) A manufacturer, jobber, distributor, wholesaler, retailer, consumer, or user may not resell an electronic cigarette substance, a prefilled electronic cigarette, an alternative nicotine product, a nontherapeutic nicotine device substance, or a prefilled nontherapeutic nicotine device to another distributor, another retailer, or a consumer before paying the tax levied under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(5): 59-14-807
