Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-804(5)(b): 59-14-807 The commission shall deposit revenues generated by the tax imposed by this section into the Electronic Cigarette Substance and Nicotine Product Proceeds Restricted Account created in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805 Remittance of tax -- Returns -- Invoice required -- Filing requirement-- Exception -- Penalty -- Overpayment.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(1)(a): The manufacturer, jobber, distributor, wholesaler, retailer, consumer, or user that collects the tax imposed on an electronic cigarette substance, a prefilled electronic cigarette, an alternative nicotine product, a nontherapeutic nicotine device substance, or a prefilled nontherapeutic nicotine device shall remit to the commission, in an electronic format approved by the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(1)(a)(i): the tax collected in the previous calendar quarter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(1)(a)(ii): the quarterly tax return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(1)(b): The tax collected and the return are due on or before the last day of April, July, October, and January.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(2)(a): A manufacturer, jobber, distributor, wholesaler, retailer, or any other person selling an electronic cigarette substance, a prefilled electronic cigarette, an alternative nicotine product, a nontherapeutic nicotine device substance, or a prefilled nontherapeutic nicotine device to a person other than the ultimate consumer shall furnish the purchaser with an itemized invoice showing:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(2)(a)(i): the seller's name and address;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(2)(a)(ii): the name and address of the purchaser;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(2)(a)(iii): the date of sale;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(2)(a)(iv): the name and price of the product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(2)(a)(v): the discount, if any.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(2)(b): The invoice shall show whether the price includes the tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(2)(c): The seller and the purchaser shall retain copies of the invoice and make the invoice available for inspection at the request of the commission or the commission's agent for a period of three years following the sale.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(3)(a): A consumer that purchases an untaxed electronic cigarette substance, prefilled electronic cigarette, alternative nicotine product, nontherapeutic nicotine device substance, or prefilled nontherapeutic nicotine device for use or other consumption shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(3)(a)(i): file with the commission, on forms prescribed by the commission, a statement showing the quantity and description of the item subject to tax under this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(3)(a)(ii): pay the tax imposed by this part on that item.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(3)(b): (3)(a) The consumer shall file the statement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(3)(c): A consumer shall maintain records necessary to determine the amount of tax the consumer is liable to pay under this part for a period of three years following the date on which the statement required by this section was filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(4): (3) A tourist who imports an untaxed electronic cigarette substance, a prefilled electronic cigarette, an alternative nicotine product, a nontherapeutic nicotine device substance, or a prefilled nontherapeutic nicotine device into the state does not need to file the statement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(5): 59-1-401; 59-1-402 In addition to the tax required by this part, a person shall pay a penalty as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(5)(a): pay the tax prescribed by this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(5)(b): pay the tax on time; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(5)(c): file a return required by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-805(6): 59-1-402 An overpayment of a tax imposed by this part shall accrue interest at the rate and in the manner prescribed in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-806 Refund of taxes paid -- Exemption for exported electronic cigarettes and nicotine products.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-806(1): When an electronic cigarette substance, a prefilled electronic cigarette, an alternative nicotine product, a nontherapeutic nicotine device substance, or a prefilled nontherapeutic nicotine device taxed under this chapter is sold and shipped to a regular dealer in those articles in another state, the seller in this state shall be entitled to a refund of the actual amount of the taxes paid, upon condition that the seller in this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-806(1)(a): is a licensed dealer;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-806(1)(b): signs an affidavit that the electronic cigarette substance, the prefilled electronic cigarette, the alternative nicotine product, the nontherapeutic nicotine device substance, or the prefilled nontherapeutic nicotine device was sold and shipped to a regular dealer in those articles in another state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-806(1)(c): furnishes, from the purchaser, a written acknowledgment that the purchaser has received the electronic cigarette substance, the prefilled electronic cigarette, the alternative nicotine product, the nontherapeutic nicotine device substance, or the prefilled nontherapeutic nicotine device; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-806(1)(d): reports the name and address of the purchaser.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-806(2): A wholesaler or distributor in this state that exports an electronic cigarette substance, a prefilled electronic cigarette, an alternative nicotine product, a nontherapeutic nicotine device substance, or a prefilled nontherapeutic nicotine device to a regular dealer in those articles in another state shall be exempt from the payment of any tax under this chapter upon furnishing proof of the sale and exportation as the commission may require.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807 Electronic Cigarette Substance and Nicotine Product Proceeds Restricted Account.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(1): There is created within the General Fund a restricted account known as the "Electronic Cigarette Substance and Nicotine Product Proceeds Restricted Account."
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(2): 59-14-804; 59-14-810; 76-10-101 The Electronic Cigarette Substance and Nicotine Product Proceeds Restricted Account consists of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(2)(a): 59-14-804 revenue collected from the tax imposed by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(2)(b): 59-14-810 fees and penalties collected under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(2)(c): 76-10-101 all money received by the attorney general or the Department of Commerce as a result of any judgment, settlement, or compromise of claims pertaining to alleged violations of law related to the manufacture, marketing, distribution, or sale of electronic cigarette products, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(2)(c)(i): if the total amount of the judgment, settlement, or compromise received by the state exceeds $1,000,000; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(2)(c)(ii): after reimbursement to the attorney general and the Department of Commerce for expenses related to the matters described in Subsection (2)(c); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(2)(d): amounts appropriated by the Legislature.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(3): 26A-1-116; 26A-1-116; 59-14-810; 59-14-810; 59-14-810; 26A-1-131; 59-14-810
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(3)(a): 26A-1-116; 26A-1-116; 59-14-810; 59-14-810; 59-14-810; 26A-1-131; 59-14-810 For each fiscal year and subject to appropriation by the Legislature, the Division of Finance shall distribute from the Electronic Cigarette Substance and Nicotine Product Proceeds Restricted Account:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(3)(a)(i): 26A-1-116 $2,000,000, which shall be allocated to the local health departments by the Department of Health and Human Services using the formula created in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(3)(a)(ii): $2,000,000 to the Department of Health and Human Services for statewide cessation programs and prevention education;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(3)(a)(iii): $1,180,000 to the Department of Public Safety for law enforcement officers aimed at disrupting organizations and networks that provide tobacco products, electronic cigarette products, nicotine products, and other illegal controlled substances to minors;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(3)(a)(iv): 26A-1-116 $3,000,000, which shall be allocated to the local health departments by the Department of Health and Human Services using the formula created in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(3)(a)(v): $5,084,200 to the State Board of Education for school-based prevention programs;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(3)(a)(vi): $2,000,000 to the Department of Health and Human Services for alcohol, tobacco, and other drug prevention, reduction, cessation, and control programs that promote unified messages and make use of media outlets, including radio, newspaper, billboards, and television; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(3)(a)(vii): 59-14-810; 59-14-810; 59-14-810; 26A-1-131; 59-14-810 of the money deposited under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(3)(a)(vii)(A): 59-14-810 to the commission, in an amount equal to the amount necessary to create and maintain the registry described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(3)(a)(vii)(B): 59-14-810 to the Department of Health and Human Services, in an amount necessary for completing duties described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(3)(a)(vii)(C): 26A-1-131; 59-14-810 to the Department of Health and Human Services, the remainder to be divided among the local health departments for inspection and enforcement described in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(3)(b): If the amount in the Electronic Cigarette Substance and Nicotine Product Proceeds Restricted Account is insufficient to cover the distributions described in Subsection (3)(a), the distribution amounts shall be adjusted proportionately.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(4): 26B-7-505; 26B-7-505; 26B-7-518; 26B-1-428; 26A-1-129; 53G-10-407; 53G-10-407; 53G-10-406; 53F-2-525
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(4)(a): 26B-7-505; 26B-7-505; 26B-7-518 The local health departments shall use the money received in accordance with Subsection (3)(a) for enforcing:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(4)(a)(i): 26B-7-505 the regulation provisions described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(4)(a)(ii): 26B-7-505 the labeling requirement described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(4)(a)(iii): 26B-7-518 the penalty provisions described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(4)(b): 26B-1-428 The Department of Health and Human Services shall use the money received in accordance with Subsection (3)(a)(ii) for the Youth Electronic Cigarette, Marijuana, and Other Drug Prevention Program created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(4)(c): 26A-1-129 The local health departments shall use the money received in accordance with Subsection (3)(a)(iv) to issue grants under the Electronic Cigarette, Marijuana, and Other Drug Prevention Grant Program created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(4)(d): 53G-10-407; 53G-10-407; 53G-10-406; 53F-2-525 The State Board of Education shall use the money received in accordance with Subsection (3)(a)(v) to distribute to local education agencies to pay for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(4)(d)(i): 53G-10-407; 53G-10-407; 53G-10-406
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(4)(d)(i)(A): 53G-10-407 stipends for positive behaviors specialists as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(4)(d)(i)(B): 53G-10-407 the cost of administering the positive behaviors plan as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(4)(d)(i)(C): 53G-10-406 the cost of implementing an Underage Drinking and Substance Abuse Prevention Program in grade 4 or 5, as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(4)(d)(ii): 53F-2-525 a comprehensive prevention plan, as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(5)(a): The fund shall earn interest.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(5)(b): All interest earned on fund money shall be deposited into the fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(6): Subject to legislative appropriations, funds remaining in the Electronic Cigarette Substance and Nicotine Product Proceeds Restricted Account after the distribution described in Subsection (3) may only be used for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(6)(a): funding commission personnel to enforce compliance with the tax collection requirements of this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-807(6)(b): programs and activities related to the prevention and cessation of electronic cigarette, nicotine products, marijuana, and other drug use.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808 Restrictions on mail order or Internet sales.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(1): 59-14-409 For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(1)(a): "Distributor" means a person, wherever residing or located, who:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(1)(a)(i): is licensed in this state to purchase a non-taxed nicotine product or a non-taxed electronic cigarette product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(1)(a)(ii): stores, sells, or otherwise disposes of a nicotine product or an electronic cigarette product.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(1)(b): 59-14-409 "Licensed person" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(1)(c): "Order or purchase" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(1)(c)(i): by mail or delivery service;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(1)(c)(ii): through the Internet or computer network;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(1)(c)(iii): by telephone; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(1)(c)(iv): through some other electronic method.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(1)(d): "Retailer" means any person who sells a nicotine product or an electronic cigarette product to consumers for personal consumption.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(2): A person, distributor, manufacturer, or retailer shall not:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(2)(a): cause a nicotine product or an electronic cigarette product to be ordered or purchased by anyone other than a licensed person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(2)(b): knowingly provide substantial assistance to a person who violates this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(3): (2); (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(3)(a): (2) Each order or purchase of a nicotine product or an electronic cigarette product in violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(3)(b): (4) In addition to the penalties in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(3)(b)(i): a civil penalty in an amount not to exceed $5,000 for each violation of this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(3)(b)(ii): an injunction to restrain a threatened or actual violation of this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(3)(b)(iii): recovery by the state for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(3)(b)(iii)(A): the costs of investigation;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(3)(b)(iii)(B): the cost of expert witness fees;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(3)(b)(iii)(C): the cost of the action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(3)(b)(iii)(D): reasonable attorney's fees.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-808(4): If a person knowingly violates this section, the court shall order any profits, gain, gross receipts, or other benefit from the violation to be disgorged and paid to the state treasurer for deposit in the General Fund.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-809 Commission study on enforcement and collection of tax.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-809(1): The commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-809(1)(a): implement increased enforcement of the tax imposed by this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-809(1)(b): study issues related to increased enforcement and compliance with the requirements of this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-809(2): 59-14-807 The study shall include a review of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-809(2)(a): the impact of increased enforcement on collections of the tax imposed by this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-809(2)(b): options for long-term funding of increased enforcement of the tax imposed by this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-809(2)(c): 59-14-807 the sufficiency of collections of the tax imposed by this part to fund distributions from the Electronic Cigarette Substance and Nicotine Product Proceeds Restricted Account under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-809(2)(d): impacts of a lack of federal regulation of electronic cigarettes on enforcement and compliance efforts; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-809(2)(e): potential impacts on compliance of changing the incidence of taxation to a tax imposed on the retail sale of an electronic cigarette substance or prefilled electronic cigarette.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-809(3): (2)(a); (d) The commission shall annually report the commission's findings and recommendations on the study items described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-809(4): (2)(e) The commission shall report the commission's findings and recommendations on the study item described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810 Electronic cigarette product registry.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(1): 76-10-101 Beginning on August 1, 2024, every manufacturer of an electronic cigarette product that is sold in this state, whether directly or through a distributor, wholesaler, retailer, or similar intermediary or intermediaries, shall certify under penalty of perjury on a form and in the manner prescribed by the commission, that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(1)(a): the manufacturer agrees to comply with this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(1)(b): 76-10-101 the electronic cigarette product is a premarket authorized or pending electronic cigarette product as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(2): When submitting the certification a manufacturer shall submit a form that separately lists each electronic cigarette product that is sold in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3)(a): Each certification form shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3)(a)(i): the name of the electronic cigarette product, nicotine content level by percentage, and any flavors contained in the product;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3)(a)(ii)(A): a copy of the order granting a premarket tobacco product application of the electronic cigarette product by the United States Food and Drug Administration under 21 U.S.C. Sec. 387j(c)(1)(A)(i); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3)(a)(ii)(B): evidence that the premarket tobacco product application for the electronic cigarette product or nicotine product was submitted to the United States Food and Drug Administration before September 9, 2020, and a final authorization or order has not yet taken effect;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3)(a)(iii): a nonrefundable $1,000 fee for an electronic cigarette product that is being added to the registry in the first instance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3)(a)(iv): information described in Subsection (10) if applicable.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3)(b): The commission shall make the materials submitted under Subsection (3)(a) available to the Department of Health and Human Services for review and approval.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3)(c): A manufacturer required to submit a certification form under this section shall notify the commission and the Department of Health and Human Services in a manner prescribed by the commission within 30 days of any material change making the certification form no longer accurate, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3)(c)(i): the issuance or denial of a marketing authorization or other order by the United States Food and Drug Administration under 21 U.S.C. Sec. 387j; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3)(c)(ii): any other order or action by the United States Food and Drug Administration or any court that affects the ability of the electronic cigarette product to be introduced or delivered into interstate commerce for commercial distribution in the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3)(d): On or before January 31 of each year and in a manner prescribed by the commission, a manufacturer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3)(d)(i): recertify that the information contained in the certification is correct and accurate;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3)(d)(ii): correct or amend information if necessary; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3)(d)(iii): pay a $250 nonrefundable fee for each electronic cigarette product on the registry that is manufactured by the manufacturer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3)(e): A manufacturer may amend a certification, including to add additional electronic cigarette products to the registry, if all requirements of this section are met.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3)(f): The commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3)(f)(i): provide an electronic notification to a manufacturer that has not submitted a recertification under Subsection (3)(d); and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(3)(f)(ii): remove a manufacturer or an electronic cigarette product that is not recertified from the registry by March 15.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(4)(a): The Department of Health and Human Services shall review materials described in Subsection (3)(a) and notify the commission regarding whether an electronic cigarette product should be included in the registry.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(4)(b): On or before October 1, 2024, the commission shall make publicly available on the commission's website a registry that lists each electronic cigarette product manufacturer and each electronic cigarette product for which certification forms have been approved by the Department of Health and Human Services.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(4)(c): An electronic cigarette product may not be listed on the registry unless the Department of Health and Human Services determines the requirements of Subsection (3)(a) are met.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(5)(a): If the Department of Health and Human Services obtains information that an electronic cigarette product should not be listed in the registry, the Department of Health and Human Services shall provide the manufacturer notice and an opportunity to cure deficiencies before notifying the commission to remove the manufacturer or products from the registry.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(5)(b): Except as provided in Subsection (5)(c), the Department of Health and Human Services shall comply with Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act, before notifying the commission to remove an electronic cigarette product or manufacturer from the registry.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(5)(c): Subsection (5)(b) does not apply to a manufacturer failing:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(5)(c)(i): to decertify an electronic cigarette product;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(5)(c)(ii): to provide fees and documentation described in Subsection (3)(a) or (3)(d); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(5)(c)(iii): to comply with Subsection (10).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(6): 26A-1-131
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(6)(a): If a product is removed from the registry, each retailer, distributor, and wholesaler shall have 30 days from the day on which the product is removed from the registry to remove the product from any inventory and return the product to the manufacturer for disposal.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(6)(b): 26A-1-131 After the period described in Subsection (6)(a), any electronic cigarette product of a manufacturer identified in the notice of removal are contraband and are subject to penalties under Subsection (8) and seizure, forfeiture, and destruction under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(7)(a): Beginning on January 1, 2025, a person may not sell or offer for retail sale an electronic cigarette product in this state that is not included in the registry.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(7)(b): A manufacturer may not sell, either directly or through a distributor, wholesaler, retailer, or similar intermediary or intermediaries, an electronic cigarette product in this state that is not included in the registry.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(8): 59-14-803; 13-11-4; 13-11a-3
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(8)(a): A wholesaler, distributor, or retailer who sells or offers for retail sale an electronic cigarette product in this state that is not included in the registry shall be subject to a civil penalty of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(8)(a)(i): $1,000 for each product offered for sale in violation of this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(8)(a)(ii): $100 per day until the offending product is removed from the market or until the offending product is properly listed on the registry.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(8)(b): 59-14-803 The commission shall suspend the person's license issued under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(8)(b)(i): for a second violation within a 12-month period, at least 14 days;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(8)(b)(ii): for a third violation within a 12-month period, at least 60 days; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(8)(b)(iii): for a fourth violation within a 12-month period, at least one year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(8)(c): A manufacturer whose electronic cigarette products are not listed in the registry and are sold in this state, whether directly or through a distributor, wholesaler, retailer, or similar intermediary or intermediaries, is subject to a civil penalty of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(8)(c)(i): $1,000 for each product offered for retail sale in violation of this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(8)(c)(ii): $100 per day until the offending product is removed from the market or until the offending product is properly listed on the registry.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(8)(d): A manufacturer that falsely represents any information required by a certification form described in this section shall be guilty of a class C misdemeanor for each false representation.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(8)(e): 13-11-4; 13-11a-3 A repeated violation of this section shall constitute a deceptive act or practice as provided in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(9): 26A-1-131
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(9)(a): 26A-1-131 To assist in ensuring compliance and enforcement of this section and Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(9)(a)(i): the Department of Health and Human Services;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(9)(a)(ii): a local health department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(9)(a)(iii): the attorney general.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(9)(b): The commission and attorney general shall share with each other information received under this section, or corresponding laws of other states.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(10): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(10)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(10)(a)(i): The commission may not list a nonresident manufacturer of an electronic cigarette product in the registry unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(10)(a)(i)(A): the nonresident manufacturer has registered to do business in the state as a foreign corporation or business entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(10)(a)(i)(B): the nonresident manufacturer appoints and maintains without interruption the services of an agent in this state to receive any service of process on behalf of the manufacturer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(10)(b): The nonresident manufacturer shall provide the name, address, and telephone number of the agent to the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(10)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(10)(c)(i): A nonresident manufacturer shall provide notice to the commission 30 days before the termination of the authority of an agent and shall further provide proof to the satisfaction of the commission of the appointment of a new agent no less than five calendar days prior to the termination of an existing agent appointment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(10)(c)(ii): In the event an agent terminates an agency appointment, the manufacturer shall notify the commission of the termination within five calendar days and shall include proof to the satisfaction of the commission of the appointment of a new agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(11): 26A-1-131 Before May 31 of each year, the commission and the Department of Health and Human Services shall provide a report to the Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee and the Health and Human Services Interim Committee regarding:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(11)(a): the status of the registry;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(11)(b): manufacturers and products included in the registry;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(11)(c): revenue and expenditures related to administration of this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(11)(d): 26A-1-131 enforcement activities undertaken under this section and Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(12): 26A-1-131 All fees and penalties collected under this section shall be used for administration and enforcement of this section and Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-810(13): The commission, in consultation with the Department of Health and Human Services, may make rules in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, to implement this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-811 Reports of illegal product.
-----------------------------------------------------------
If the commission suspects that an electronic cigarette product or a nicotine product is being sold in the state in violation of a law other than a law described in this part, the commission shall report the name of the seller, the type of product, and the county where the product was sold:Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-811(1): to the local health department for the county where the sale occurs;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-811(2): the Department of Health and Human Services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-14-811(3): the Department of Public Safety.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Chapter 15 - Beer Tax
******************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101 Tax basis -- Rate.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(1): 32B-1-102; 32B-1-102 As used in this chapter, "beer" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(1)(a): 32B-1-102 beer as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(1)(b): 32B-1-102 heavy beer as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(2)(a): A tax is imposed at the rate specified in Subsection (2)(b) on beer that is imported or manufactured for sale, use, or distribution in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(2)(b): The rate of the tax imposed under this Subsection (2) is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(2)(b)(i): $13.10 per 31-gallon barrel for beer imported or manufactured before July 1, 2024;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(2)(b)(ii): $13.35 per 31-gallon barrel for beer imported or manufactured on or after July 1, 2024, and before July 1, 2025;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(2)(b)(iii): $13.60 per 31-gallon barrel for beer imported or manufactured on or after July 1, 2025, and before July 1, 2026;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(2)(b)(iv): $13.85 per 31-gallon barrel for beer imported or manufactured on or after July 1, 2026, and before July 1, 2027; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(2)(b)(v): $14.10 per 31-gallon barrel for beer imported or manufactured on or after July 1, 2027.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(2)(c): The tax imposed under this Subsection (2):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(2)(c)(i): shall be imposed at a proportionate rate for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(2)(c)(i)(A): any quantity of beer other than a 31-gallon barrel; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(2)(c)(i)(B): the fractional parts of a 31-gallon barrel; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(2)(c)(ii): may not be imposed more than once on the same beer.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(3): A tax may not be imposed on beer:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(3)(a): sold to the United States and its agencies; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(3)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(3)(b)(i): manufactured or imported for sale, use, or distribution outside the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-101(3)(b)(ii): exported from the state.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-102 Tax delinquency -- Penalty.
-----------------------------------------------------------
If any person fails to pay the amount of any tax at the time it is due, a penalty as provided under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-104 Procedure for contesting assessment.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
If any person, after filing a return and paying the tax provided by this chapter, is aggrieved by the assessment made by the commission, the person may file a request for agency action.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-105 Reports -- Credit -- Records.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-105(1): Every brewer, wholesaler, or distributor manufacturing or importing beer for sale, use, or distribution in the state shall, before the last day of each month, file with the commission a return for the preceding calendar month showing the total number of barrels of beer or fractional parts of barrels manufactured or imported during the preceding monthly period.  The total barrels of beer manufactured or imported with deductions made for the number of barrels exempt under this chapter shall be reported. The report shall also contain other information required by the commission, and the person shall, at the time of filing the report, pay to the commission the amount of tax due at the rate fixed in accordance with this chapter.  Credit is allowed for spoilage, and for taxes already paid on beer, as provided under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-105(2): For purposes of this chapter, beer is considered manufactured when it is placed in containers for use, sale, or distribution, and beer is considered imported when it is first received in the state for use, sale, or distribution.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-105(3): It is the duty of every person manufacturing or importing beer for sale in this state to keep and preserve adequate records for a period of three years showing the amount of beer sold.  These records are open to inspection by the commission, or its authorized representative during reasonable business hours.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-106 Reports by brewers, wholesalers, and distributors outside the state.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Every brewer, wholesaler, or distributor outside the state, shipping beer into the state, for sale, use, or consumption within the state shall, before the last day of each month, file with the commission a return prescribed by the commission for the preceding calendar month and containing any information required by the commission.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-107 Report -- Effect of failure to file.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
If any person who is liable for the tax and is required by this chapter or by the rules of the commission to file a report with respect to the beer tax or to file a report which contains information required to determine the amount of beer tax, fails, neglects, or refuses to file the report, the commission shall estimate the amount of beer upon which the tax is payable, and assess the tax.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-108 Construction and equipment of establishments.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
No brewery or other establishment may be constructed or equipped in a manner which facilitates any breach of this chapter or the rules of the Alcoholic Beverage Services Commission or State Tax Commission.  Any structure or equipment in violation of this section shall be removed by order of the Alcoholic Beverage Control Commission or the State Tax Commission.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109 Commission to deposit beer tax revenue.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(1): 32B-2-403 Except as provided in Subsections (2) and (3), the commission shall deposit revenue collected under this chapter as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(1)(a): 32B-2-403 the greater of the following shall be deposited into the Alcoholic Beverage Enforcement and Treatment Restricted Account created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(1)(a)(i): an amount calculated by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(1)(a)(i)(A): determining an amount equal to 50% of the revenue collected for the fiscal year two years preceding the fiscal year for which the deposit is made; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(1)(a)(i)(B): subtracting $30,000 from the amount determined under Subsection (1)(a)(i)(A); or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(1)(a)(ii): $4,350,000; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(1)(b): the revenue collected in excess of the amount deposited in accordance with Subsection (1)(a) shall be deposited into the General Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(2): 32B-2-403; 59-15-101 The commission shall annually deposit into the Alcoholic Beverage Enforcement and Treatment Restricted Account created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(2)(a): $0.30 per 31-gallon barrel for beer imported or manufactured on or after July 1, 2003; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(2)(b): a proportionate rate to the rate described in Subsection (2)(a) for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(2)(b)(i): any quantity of beer other than a 31-gallon barrel; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(2)(b)(ii): the fractional parts of a 31-gallon barrel.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(3): 32B-2-305; 59-15-101 Beginning fiscal year 2024-25, the commission shall annually deposit into the Alcoholic Beverage Control Act Enforcement Fund created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(3)(a): $13.10 per 31-gallon barrel for beer imported or manufactured on or after July 1, 2024; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(3)(b): a proportionate rate to the rate described in Subsection (3)(a) for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(3)(b)(i): any quantity of beer other than a 31-gallon barrel; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(3)(b)(ii): the fractional parts of a 31-gallon barrel.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(4)(a): The commission shall notify the entities described in Subsection (4)(b) not later than the September 1 preceding the fiscal year of the deposit of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(4)(a)(i): the amount of the proceeds of the beer excise tax collected in accordance with this section for the fiscal year two years preceding the fiscal year of deposit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(4)(a)(ii): an amount equal to 50% of the amount listed in Subsection (4)(a)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(4)(b): The notification required by Subsection (4)(a) shall be sent to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(4)(b)(i): the Governor's Office of Planning and Budget; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-15-109(4)(b)(ii): the Legislative Fiscal Analyst.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Chapter 18 - Charitable Trust Act
******************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-101 Short title.
--------------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Charitable Trust Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-102(1): Section references, unless otherwise indicated, are to the Internal Revenue Code of 1954, as in effect on January 1, 1970.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-102(2): "Charitable organization" means an organization described in Section 501(c)(3) and exempt from tax under Section 501(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-102(3): "Private foundation trust" means a trust (including a trust described in Section 4947(a)(1)) as defined in Section 509(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-102(4): "Split interest trust" means a trust for individual and charitable beneficiaries that is subject to the provisions of Section 4947(a)(2).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-102(5): "Trust" means an express trust created by a trust instrument, including a will.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-102(6): "Trustee" means the trustee, trustees, person, or persons possessing a power or powers referred to in this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-103 Applicability to split interest trust or private foundation trust created before or after effective date.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The provisions of this chapter that are applicable to a split interest trust or to a private foundation trust shall apply to all such trusts, whether they are created before or after the effective date of this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-104 Duties and powers of trustee.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Except as provided in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-105 Trustee's fiduciary obligations and duty not to deprive trust of tax exemption, deduction or credit.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-105(1): In the exercise of his powers including the powers granted by this chapter, a trustee has a duty to act with due regard to his obligation as a fiduciary, including a duty not to exercise any power in such a way as to deprive the trust of an otherwise available tax exemption, deduction, or credit for tax purposes or deprive a donor of a trust asset of a tax deduction or credit or operate to impose a tax upon a donor, trust, or other person.  The word "tax" includes, but is not limited to any federal, state, or local excise, income, gift, estate, or inheritance tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-105(2): 59-18-106 A trustee of a private foundation trust, except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-105(3): (4); 59-18-106 A trustee of a private foundation trust or a split interest trust, to the extent that the split interest trust is subject to the provisions of Section 4947(a)(2), in the exercise of his powers, except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-105(3)(a): engage in any act of self dealing (as defined in Section 4941(d));
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-105(3)(b): retain any excess business holdings (as defined in Section 4943(c));
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-105(3)(c): make any investments in such manner as to subject the foundation to tax under Section 4944; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-105(3)(d): make any taxable expenditures (as defined in Section 4945(d)).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-105(4): (3)(b); (c) Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-105(4)(a): all the income interest (and none of the remainder interest) of such trust is devoted solely to one or more of the purposes described in Section 170(c)(2)(B), and all amounts in such trust for which a deduction was allowed under Section 170, 545(b)(2), 556(b)(2), 642(c), 2055, 2106(a)(2), or 2522 have aggregate fair market value not more than 60% of the aggregate fair market value of all amounts in such trust; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-105(4)(b): a deduction was allowed under Section 170, 545(b)(2), 556(b)(2), 642(c), 2055, 2106(a)(2), or 2522 for amounts payable under the terms of such trust to every remainder beneficiary but not to any income beneficiary.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-106 Trustee's notice to attorney general of inconsistent provisions in trust.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If the trustee determines that the governing instrument contains provisions, in the case of a power to make distributions, which is more restrictive than Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-107 Amendment of governing instrument.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-107(1): 59-18-105(2) In the case of a trust which is solely for a named charitable organization or organizations and as to which the trustee does not possess any discretion with regard to the distribution of income or principal among two or more such organizations, the trustee, with the consent of the named charitable organization or organizations, may amend the governing instrument to comply with the provisions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-107(2): (1); 59-18-105(2) In the case of a charitable trust which is not subject to the provisions of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-108 Court's power to relieve trustee from restrictions on powers and duties.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This chapter does not affect the power of a court of competent jurisdiction for cause shown and upon petition of the trustee, attorney general, or affected beneficiary, and upon appropriate notice to the affected parties to relieve a trustee from any restrictions on his powers and duties that are placed upon him by the governing instrument or applicable law.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-109 Release of power to select charitable donees.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-109(1): The trustee of a trust all of the unexpired interests in which are devoted to one or more charitable purposes, unless the creating instrument expressly provides otherwise, may release a power to select charitable donees.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-109(2): The release of a power to select charitable donees may apply to all or any part of the property subject to the power and may reduce or limit the charitable organizations or classes of charitable organizations in whose favor the power is exercisable.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-109(3): (4) A release shall be effected by a duly acknowledged written instrument signed by the trustee and delivered as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-109(4): Delivery of a release shall be accomplished as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-109(4)(a): if the release is accomplished by specifying a charitable organization or organizations as beneficiary or beneficiaries of the trust, by delivery of a copy of the release to each designated charitable organization;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-109(4)(b): if the release is accomplished by reducing the class of permissible charitable organizations, by delivery of a copy of the release to the attorney general.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-109(5): If a release is accomplished by specifying a public charitable organization or organizations as beneficiary or beneficiaries of the trust, the trust at all times thereafter shall be operated exclusively for the benefit of and supervised by the specified public charitable organization or organizations.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-110 Election and consent to release of trust to specified charitable organization.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A trustee of a trust for the benefit of a public charitable organization or organizations may, with the consent of such organization or organizations, come under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-111 Duties of trustee of trust subject to supervision by specified charitable organization.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The trustee of a trust subject to the supervision by a specified public charitable organization or organizations, as provided in SubsectionUtah Code Annotated § 59-18-111(1): 59-18-109(4); 59-18-110 a trust copy of the governing instrument together with a written report, under oath, setting forth complete information as to the nature of the assets and liabilities with the delivery of the release pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-111(2): an annual report, within 4-1/2 months following the close of each year, setting forth a complete statement of receipts, disbursements, assets (together with cost and market value of each asset), and liabilities; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-111(3): such other information as the public charitable organization or organizations deem necessary to compel proper administration of the trust.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-112 Interpretation of chapter to encourage charitable gifts.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This chapter shall be interpreted to effectuate the intent of the state of Utah to preserve, foster, and encourage gifts to or for the benefit of charitable organizations.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-18-113 Application of chapter to trusts and trust assets established or acquired before or after effective date.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Except as specifically provided in the trust, the provisions of this chapter apply to any trust established before or after the effective date of this chapter and to any trust asset acquired by the trustee before or after the effective date of this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2 Mineral Bonus Account created -- Contents -- Use of Mineral Bonus Account money -- Mineral Lease Account created -- Contents -- Appropriation of money from Mineral Lease Account.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(1)(b): 59-21-1 The Mineral Bonus Account consists of federal mineral lease bonus payments deposited pursuant to Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(1)(d)(i): invest the money in the Mineral Bonus Account by following the procedures and requirements of Title 51, Chapter 7, State Money Management Act; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(1)(d)(ii): deposit all interest or other earnings derived from the account into the Mineral Bonus Account.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(1)(e): 65A-8-204 The Division of Finance shall, beginning on July 1, 2017, annually deposit 30% of mineral lease bonus payments deposited under Subsection (1)(b) from the previous fiscal year into the Wildland Fire Suppression Fund created in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(i): The Legislature shall annually make the following appropriations from the Mineral Lease Account:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(i)(A): an amount equal to 52 cents multiplied by the number of acres of school or institutional trust lands, lands owned by the Division of State Parks or the Division of Outdoor Recreation, and lands owned by the Division of Wildlife Resources that are not under an in lieu of taxes contract, to each county in which those lands are located;

Sec. 6901 et seq., unless the federal payment was equal to or exceeded the 52 cents per acre, in which case a payment under this Subsection (2)(j)(i)(B) may not be made for the transferred lands;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(i)(C): to each county in which federal lands, which are entitlement lands under the federal in lieu of taxes program, are transferred to the school or institutional trust, an amount equal to the number of transferred acres in the county multiplied by a payment per acre equal to the difference between the most recent per acre payment made under the federal payment in lieu of taxes program and 52 cents per acre, unless the federal payment was equal to or less than 52 cents per acre, in which case a payment under this Subsection (2)(j)(i)(C) may not be made for the transferred land; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(i)(D): to a county of the fifth or sixth class, an amount equal to the product of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(i)(D)(I): $1,000; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(i)(D)(II): the number of residences described in Subsection (2)(j)(iv) that are located within the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(ii): A county receiving money under Subsection (2)(j)(i) may, as determined by the county legislative body, distribute the money or a portion of the money to:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(ii)(A): special service districts established by the county under Title 17D, Chapter 1, Special Service District Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(ii)(B): school districts; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(ii)(C): public institutions of higher education.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(iii)(A): Beginning in fiscal year 1994-95 and in each year after fiscal year 1994-95, the Division of Finance shall increase or decrease the amounts per acre provided for in Subsections (2)(j)(i)(A) through (C) by the average annual change in the Consumer Price Index for all urban consumers published by the Department of Labor.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(iii)(B): For fiscal years beginning on or after fiscal year 2001-02, the Division of Finance shall increase or decrease the amount described in Subsection (2)(j)(i)(D)(I) by the average annual change in the Consumer Price Index for all urban consumers published by the Department of Labor.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(iv): Residences for purposes of Subsection (2)(j)(i)(D)(II) are residences that are:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(iv)(A): owned by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(iv)(A)(I): the Division of State Parks;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(iv)(A)(II): the Division of Outdoor Recreation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(iv)(A)(III): the Division of Wildlife Resources;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(iv)(B): located on lands that are owned by:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(iv)(B)(I): the Division of State Parks;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(iv)(B)(II): the Division of Outdoor Recreation; or

Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(iv)(C): are not subject to taxation under:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(iv)(C)(I): Chapter 2, Property Tax Act; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(j)(iv)(C)(II): Chapter 4, Privilege Tax.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(2)(k): The Legislature shall annually appropriate to the Permanent Community Impact Fund all deposits remaining in the Mineral Lease Account after making the appropriations provided for in Subsections (2)(d) through (j).
