Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(3)(b)(i): include actual expenditures for the prior fiscal year, budgeted expenditures for the current fiscal year, and planned expenditures for the following fiscal year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-21-2(3)(b)(ii): be reviewed by the Business, Economic Development, and Labor Appropriations Subcommittee as part of its normal budgetary process under Title 63J, Chapter 1, Budgetary Procedures Act.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Chapter 22 - Model Tobacco Settlement Act
**************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Model Tobacco Settlement Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-201 Findings and purpose.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-201(1): Cigarette smoking presents serious public health concerns to the State and to the citizens of the State.  The Surgeon General has determined that smoking causes lung cancer, heart disease and other serious diseases, and that there are hundreds of thousands of tobacco-related deaths in the United States each year.  These diseases most often do not appear until many years after the person in question begins smoking.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-201(2): Cigarette smoking also presents serious financial concerns for the State.  Under certain health-care programs, the State may have a legal obligation to provide medical assistance to eligible persons for health conditions associated with cigarette smoking, and those persons may have a legal entitlement to receive such medical assistance.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-201(3): Under these programs, the State pays millions of dollars each year to provide medical assistance for these persons for health conditions associated with cigarette smoking.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-201(4): It is the policy of the State that financial burdens imposed on the State by cigarette smoking be borne by tobacco product manufacturers rather than by the State to the extent that such manufacturers either determine to enter into a settlement with the State or are found culpable by the courts.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-201(5): On November 23, 1998, leading United States tobacco product manufacturers entered into a settlement agreement, entitled the "Master Settlement Agreement," with the State.  The Master Settlement Agreement obligates these manufacturers, in return for a release of past, present, and certain future claims against them as described therein, to pay substantial sums to the State (tied in part to their volume of sales); to fund a national foundation devoted to the interests of public health; and to make substantial changes in their advertising and marketing practices and corporate culture, with the intention of reducing underage smoking.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-201(6): It would be contrary to the policy of the State if tobacco product manufacturers who determine not to enter into such a settlement could use a resulting cost advantage to derive large, short-term profits in the years before liability may arise without ensuring that the State will have an eventual source of recovery from them if they are proven to have acted culpably.  It is thus in the interest of the State to require that such manufacturers establish a reserve fund to guarantee a source of compensation and to prevent such manufacturers from deriving large, short-term profits and then becoming judgment-proof before liability may arise.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(1): "Adjusted for inflation" means increased in accordance with the formula for inflation adjustment set forth in Exhibit C to the Master Settlement Agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(2): "Affiliate" means a person who directly or indirectly owns or controls, is owned or controlled by, or is under common ownership or control with, another person.  Solely for purposes of this definition, the terms "owns," "is owned" and "ownership" mean ownership of an equity interest, or the equivalent thereof, of 10% or more, and the term "person" means an individual, partnership, committee, association, corporation, or any other organization or group of persons.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(3): "Allocable share" means Allocable Share as that term is defined in the Master Settlement Agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(4): "Cigarette" means any product that contains nicotine, is intended to be burned or heated under ordinary conditions of use, and consists of or contains:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(4)(a): any roll of tobacco wrapped in paper or in any substance not containing tobacco; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(4)(b): tobacco, in any form, that is functional in the product, which, because of its appearance, the type of tobacco used in the filler, or its packaging and labeling, is likely to be offered to, or purchased by, consumers as a cigarette; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(4)(c): any roll of tobacco wrapped in any substance containing tobacco that, because of its appearance, the type of tobacco used in the filler, or its packaging and labeling, is likely to be offered to, or purchased by, consumers as a cigarette described in clause (a) of this definition.  The term "cigarette" includes "roll-your-own" (i.e., any tobacco that, because of its appearance, type, packaging, or labeling is suitable for use and likely to be offered to, or purchased by, consumers as tobacco for making cigarettes).  For purposes of this definition of "cigarette," 0.09 ounces of "roll-your-own" tobacco shall constitute one individual "cigarette."
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(5): "Master Settlement Agreement" means the settlement agreement (and related documents) entered into on November 23, 1998, by the State and leading United States tobacco product manufacturers.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(6): 59-22-203 "Qualified escrow fund" means an escrow arrangement with a federally or State chartered financial institution having no affiliation with any tobacco product manufacturer and having assets of at least $1,000,000,000 where such arrangement requires that such financial institution hold the escrowed funds' principal for the benefit of releasing parties and prohibits the tobacco product manufacturer placing the funds into escrow from using, accessing, or directing the use of the funds' principal except as consistent with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(7): "Released claims" means Released Claims as that term is defined in the Master Settlement Agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(8): "Releasing parties" means Releasing Parties as that term is defined in the Master Settlement Agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(9)(a): "Tobacco product manufacturer" means an entity that after the date of enactment of this Act directly (and not exclusively through any affiliate):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(9)(a)(i): manufactures cigarettes anywhere that such manufacturer intends to be sold in the United States, including cigarettes intended to be sold in the United States through an importer (except where such importer is an original participating manufacturer (as that term is defined in the Master Settlement Agreement) that will be responsible for the payments under the Master Settlement Agreement with respect to such cigarettes as a result of the provisions of Subsection II(mm) of the Master Settlement Agreement and that pays the taxes specified in Subsection II(z) of the Master Settlement Agreement, and provided that the manufacturer of such cigarettes does not market or advertise such cigarettes in the United States);
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(9)(a)(ii): is the first purchaser anywhere for resale in the United States of cigarettes manufactured anywhere that the manufacturer does not intend to be sold in the United States; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(9)(a)(iii): becomes a successor of an entity described in Subsection (9)(a)(i) or (ii).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(9)(b): "Tobacco product manufacturer" shall not include an affiliate of a tobacco product manufacturer unless such affiliate itself falls within any Subsection (9)(a)(i) through (iii).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(10): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(10)(a): "Units sold" means the number of individual cigarettes sold in the state by an applicable tobacco product manufacturer during the year in question for which the state is not prohibited from taxing under federal law.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(10)(b): "Units sold" includes a cigarette or "roll your own" tobacco product sold by a tobacco product manufacturer through a distributor, a retailer, or a similar intermediary.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-202(10)(c): The State Tax Commission may make rules establishing how to determine the number of units sold in the state.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203 Requirements.
---------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(1): Any tobacco product manufacturer selling cigarettes to consumers within the State (whether directly or through a distributor, retailer or similar intermediary or intermediaries) after the date of enactment of this Act shall do one of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(1)(a): become a participating manufacturer (as that term is defined in Section II(jj) of the Master Settlement Agreement) and generally perform its financial obligations under the Master Settlement Agreement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(1)(b): place into a qualified escrow fund by April 15 of the year following the year in question the following amounts (as such amounts are adjusted for inflation):
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(1)(b)(i): 1999: $.0094241 per unit sold after the date of enactment of this Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(1)(b)(ii): 2000: $.0104712 per unit sold;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(1)(b)(iii): for each of 2001 and 2002: $.0136125 per unit sold;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(1)(b)(iv): for each of 2003 through 2006: $.0167539 per unit sold; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(1)(b)(v): for each of 2007 and each year thereafter: $.0188482 per unit sold.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(2): (1)(b); (2)(a); (2)(a); (b) A tobacco product manufacturer that places funds into escrow pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(2)(a): (2)(a) to pay a judgment or settlement on any released claim brought against such tobacco product manufacturer by the State or any releasing party located or residing in the State.  Funds shall be released from escrow under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(2)(a)(i): in the order in which they were placed into escrow; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(2)(a)(ii): only to the extent and at the time necessary to make payments required under such judgment or settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(2)(b): to the extent that a tobacco product manufacturer establishes that the amount it was required to place into escrow on account of units sold in the State in a particular year was greater than the Master Settlement Agreement payments, as determined pursuant to Section IX(i) of that Agreement including after final determination of all adjustments, that such manufacturer would have been required to make on account of such units sold had it been a participating manufacturer, the excess shall be released from escrow and revert back to such tobacco product manufacturer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(2)(c): (2)(a); (b) to the extent not released from escrow under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(3): (1)(b); (1)(b); (2); (1)(b); (2); (1)(b); (2); (1)(b); (2); (1)(b); (2); (1)(b); (2); (1)(b); (2) Each tobacco product manufacturer that elects to place funds into escrow pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(3)(a): (1)(b); (2); (1)(b); (2) be required within 15 days to place such funds into escrow as shall bring it into compliance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(3)(b): (1)(b); (2); (1)(b); (2) in the case of a knowing violation, be required within 15 days to place such funds into escrow as shall bring it into compliance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(3)(c): in the case of a second knowing violation, be prohibited from selling cigarettes to consumers within the State (whether directly or through a distributor, retailer or similar intermediary) for a period not to exceed 2 years.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(4): (1)(b) Each failure to make an annual deposit required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-203(5): A court shall award the State its costs and attorneys fees incurred in bringing any action in which the State establishes that a tobacco product manufacturer has violated this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-301 Construction of this part.
----------------------------------------------------------
This part sets forth definitions in the Master Settlement Agreement that are cross-referenced in

Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-302 Formula for inflation adjustments.
------------------------------------------------------------------
The formula for calculating inflation adjustments, which is referenced in SubsectionUtah Code Annotated § 59-22-302(1): Any amount that, in any given year, is to be adjusted for inflation pursuant to this Exhibit, the "Base Amount," shall be adjusted upward by adding to such Base Amount the Inflation Adjustment.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-302(2): The Inflation Adjustment shall be calculated by multiplying the Base Amount by the Inflation Adjustment Percentage applicable in that year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-302(3): The Inflation Adjustment Percentage applicable to payments due in the year 2000 shall be equal to the greater of 3% or the CPI%.  For example, if the Consumer Price Index for December 1999, as released in January 2000, is 2% higher than the Consumer Price Index for December 1998, as released in January 1999, then the CPI% with respect to a payment due in 2000 would be 2%.  The Inflation Adjustment Percentage applicable in the year 2000 would thus be 3%.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-302(4): (3) The Inflation Adjustment Percentage applicable to payments due in any year after 2000 shall be calculated by applying each year the greater of 3% or the CPI% on the Inflation Adjustment Percentage applicable to payments due in the prior year.  Continuing the example in subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-302(5): "Consumer Price Index" means the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers as published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics of the U.S. Department of Labor, or other similar measures agreed to by the Settling States and the Participating Manufacturers.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-302(6): The "CPI%" means the actual total percent change in the Consumer Price Index during the calendar year immediately preceding the year in which the payment in question is due.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-303 Allocable share.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-303(1): 59-22-202(3) "Allocable Share," which is referenced in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-303(2): The percentage set forth for Utah in Exhibit A to the Master Settlement Agreement is 0.4448869%.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-303(3): The percentage for calculating "Strategic Contribution Payments" to Utah under subsection IX(c)(2) is to be determined by a three-member Allocation Committee in accordance with Exhibit U of the Master Settlement Agreement.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-304 Released claims.
------------------------------------------------
""Released Claims" means:Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-304(1): 59-22-202(7) "Released Claims," which is referenced in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-304(2): Exhibit D is a list of the titles and docket numbers of the lawsuits brought by states against tobacco manufacturers and the courts in which those lawsuits were filed as of the date that the Master Settlement Agreement was entered into.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-305 Releasing parties.
--------------------------------------------------
"Releasing Parties," which is referenced in SubsectionUtah Code Annotated § 59-22-305(1): "Releasing Parties" means each Settling State and any of its past, present and future agents, officials acting in their official capacities, legal representatives, agencies, departments, commissions and divisions; and also means, to the full extent of the power of the signatories hereto to release past, present and future claims, the following:  (1)  any Settling State's subdivisions, political or otherwise, including, but not limited to, municipalities, counties, parishes, villages, unincorporated districts and hospital districts, public entities, public instrumentalities and public educational institutions; and (2) persons or entities acting in a parens patriae, sovereign, quasi-sovereign, private attorney general, qui tam, taxpayer, or any other capacity, whether or not any of them participate in this settlement, (A) to the extent that any such person or entity is seeking relief on behalf of or generally applicable to the general public in such Settling State or the people of the State, as opposed solely to private or individual relief for separate and distinct injuries, or (B) to the extent that any such entity, as opposed to an individual, is seeking recovery of health-care expenses, other than premium or capitation payments for the benefit of present or retired state employees, paid or reimbursed, directly or indirectly, by a Settling State.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-306 Original participating manufacturer and related terms.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"Original Participating Manufacturer" means Brown & Williamson Tobacco Corporation, Lorillard Tobacco Company, Phillip Morris Incorporated and R.J.  Reynolds Tobacco Company, and the respective successors of each of the foregoing.  Except as expressly providing in this Agreement, once an entity becomes an Original Participating Manufacturer, such entity shall permanently retain the status of Original Participating Manufacturer.Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-306(1): 59-22-202(9)(a)(i) "Original Participating Manufacturer," which is referenced in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-306(2): 59-22-202(9)(a)(i) Subsection II(mm) of the Master Settlement Agreement, which is referenced in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-306(3): 59-22-202(9)(a)(i) Subsection II(z) of the Master Settlement Agreement, which is referenced in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-307 Participating manufacturer.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-307(1): 59-22-203(1) "Participating Manufacturer," which is referenced in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-307(2): Subsection IX(d) relates to Nonparticipating Manufacturer Adjustments.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-308 Payments by subsequent participating manufacturers.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Section XI(i)(2) and IX(i)(3) of the Master Settlement Agreement involve payments by subsequent participating manufacturers and providers as follows:Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-308(1): (2); (3) A Subsequent Participating Manufacturer shall have payment obligations under this Agreement only in the event that its Market Share in any calendar year exceeds the greater of (1)  its 1998 Market Share or (2) 125% of its 1997 Market Share, subject to the provisions of subsection (i)(4).  In the year following any such calendar year, such Subsequent Participating Manufacturer shall make payments corresponding to those due in that same following year from the Original Participating Manufacturers pursuant to subsections VI(c), except for the payment due on March 31, 1999, IX(c)(1), IX(c)(2) and IX(e).  The amounts of such corresponding payments by a Subsequent Participating Manufacturer are in addition to the corresponding payments that are due from the Original Participating Manufacturers and shall be determined as described in subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-308(2): The base amount due from a Subsequent Participating Manufacturer on any given date shall be determined by multiplying (A) the corresponding base amount due on the same date from all of the Original Participating Manufacturers, as such base amount is specified in the corresponding subsection of this agreement and is adjusted by the Volume Adjustment, except for the provisions of subsection (B)(ii) of Exhibit E, but before such base amount is modified by any other adjustments, reductions or offsets, by (B) the quotient produced by dividing (i) the result of (x) such Subsequent Participating Manufacturer's Applicable Market Share, the applicable Market Share being that for the calendar year immediately preceding the year in which the payment in question is due, minus (y) the greater of (1) its 1998 Market Share or (2) 125% of its 1997 Market Share, by (ii) the aggregate Market Shares of the Original Participating Manufacturers, the applicable Market Shares being those for the calendar year immediately preceding the year in which the payment in question is due.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-308(3): (1); (2) Any payment due from a Subsequent Participating Manufacturer under subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-308(4): For purposes of this Subsection (i), the 1997, or 1998, as applicable, Market Share, and 125% thereof, of those Subsequent Participating Manufacturers that either (A) became a signatory to the Agreement more than 60 days after the MSA Execution Date or (B) had no Market Share in 1997, or 1998, as applicable, shall equal zero.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-22-401 Availability of master settlement agreement.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission shall provide a copy of the Master Settlement Agreement for review or purchase to any person upon request and may charge a fee for doing so in accordance with Subsection

Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Chapter 23 - Brine Shrimp Royalty Act
**********************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-1 Title.
------------------------------------
This chapter shall be known as the "Brine Shrimp Royalty Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-3 Definitions.
------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-3(1): "Brine shrimp eggs" means dormant, early stage brine shrimp embryos encapsulated as cysts that are harvested from within the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-3(2): "Tax year" means a one-year period beginning on February 1 and ending on January 31 of the following year.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4 Brine shrimp royalty -- Royalty rate -- Commission to prepare billing statement -- Deposit of revenue.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4(1): A person shall pay for each tax year a brine shrimp royalty of 3.25 cents multiplied by the total number of pounds of unprocessed brine shrimp eggs that the person harvests within the state during the tax year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4(2): 59-23-5
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4(2)(a): A person that harvests unprocessed brine shrimp eggs shall report to the Division of Wildlife Resources the total number of pounds of unprocessed brine shrimp eggs harvested by that person for that tax year on or before the February 15 immediately following the last day of that tax year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4(2)(b): The Division of Wildlife Resources shall provide the following information to the commission on or before the March 1 immediately following the last day of a tax year:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4(2)(b)(i): the total number of pounds of unprocessed brine shrimp eggs harvested for that tax year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4(2)(b)(ii): for each person that harvested unprocessed brine shrimp eggs for that tax year:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4(2)(b)(ii)(A): the total number of pounds of unprocessed brine shrimp eggs harvested by that person for that tax year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4(2)(b)(ii)(B): a current billing address for that person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4(2)(b)(iii): any additional information required by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4(2)(c): 59-23-5
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4(2)(c)(i): The commission shall prepare and mail a billing statement to each person that harvested unprocessed brine shrimp eggs in a tax year by the March 30 immediately following the last day of a tax year.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4(2)(c)(ii): 59-23-5 The billing statement under Subsection (2)(c)(i) shall specify:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4(2)(c)(ii)(A): the total number of pounds of unprocessed brine shrimp eggs harvested by that person for that tax year;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4(2)(c)(ii)(B): the brine shrimp royalty that the person owes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4(2)(c)(ii)(C): 59-23-5 the date that the brine shrimp royalty payment is due as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4(2)(d): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission may make rules prescribing the information required under Subsection (2)(b)(iii).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4(3): 65A-5-1; 23A-3-214 Revenue generated by the brine shrimp royalty shall be deposited as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4(3)(a): 65A-5-1 $125,000 of the revenue generated by the brine shrimp royalty shall be deposited in the Sovereign Lands Management Account created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-4(3)(b): 23A-3-214 the remainder of the revenue generated by the brine shrimp royalty shall be deposited in the Species Protection Account created in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-5 Payment of the brine shrimp royalty.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-5(1): The brine shrimp royalty shall be paid to the commission by the person who harvests the unprocessed brine shrimp eggs.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-5(2): 59-23-4 The payment shall be accompanied by the billing statement prepared by the commission in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-5(3): The royalty is due on the April 30 immediately following the last day of the tax year.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-7 Rules.
------------------------------------
In accordance with

Utah Code Annotated § 59-23-8 Penalties and interest.
-----------------------------------------------------
A person who harvests unprocessed brine shrimp eggs who fails to comply with this chapter is subject to penalties and interest as provided in Sections

Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Chapter 24 - Radioactive Waste Facility Tax Act
********************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Radioactive Waste Facility Tax Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(1)(a): "Alternate feed material" means a natural or native material:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(1)(a)(i): mined for the extraction of its constituents or other matter from which source material may be extracted in a licensed uranium or thorium mill; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(1)(a)(ii): may be reprocessed for its source material content.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(1)(b): "Alternate feed material" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(1)(b)(i): material containing hazardous waste listed under 40 C.F.R. Part 261, Subpart D;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(1)(b)(ii): natural or unprocessed ore; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(1)(b)(iii): naturally occurring radioactive materials containing greater than 15 picocuries per gram of radium-226.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(2): "Byproduct material" is as defined in 42 U.S.C. Sec. 2014(e)(2).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(3): "Class A low-level radioactive waste" means radioactive waste that is classified as class A waste under 10 C.F.R. 61.55.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(4): "Containerized class A waste" means class A low-level radioactive waste that is placed in the portion of a radioactive waste facility that is licensed to receive containerized class A waste.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(5): 19-3-106
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(5)(a): "Gross receipts" means all consideration an owner or operator of a radioactive waste facility receives for the disposal of radioactive waste in the state, without any deduction or expense paid or accrued related to the disposal of the radioactive waste.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(5)(b): 19-3-106 "Gross receipts" do not include fees collected under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(6)(a): "Processed class A waste" means waste that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(6)(a)(i): is class A low-level radioactive waste; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(6)(a)(ii): has been concentrated by a processor.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(6)(b): "Processed class A waste" does not include containerized class A waste.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(7): "Radioactive waste" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(7)(a): alternate feed material;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(7)(b): byproduct material;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(7)(c): containerized class A waste;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(7)(d): processed class A waste; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(7)(e): uncontainerized, unprocessed class A waste.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(8): 19-3-105 "Radioactive waste facility" or "facility" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(8)(a): 19-3-105 a facility licensed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(8)(b): a uranium mill licensed under 10 C.F.R. Part 40, Domestic Licensing of Source Material.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(9)(a): "Uncontainerized, unprocessed class A waste" means class A low-level radioactive waste that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(9)(a)(i): is neither containerized class A waste, nor processed class A waste; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(9)(a)(ii): must be disposed of under rules of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission in a licensed low-level radioactive waste disposal facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-102(9)(b): "Uncontainerized, unprocessed class A waste" does not include alternate feed material.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5 Radioactive waste disposal, processing, and recycling facility tax.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(1): On and after July 1, 2003, there is imposed a tax on a radioactive waste facility, or a processing or recycling facility, as provided in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2): The tax is equal to the sum of the following amounts:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(a): 12% of the gross receipts of a radioactive waste facility derived from the disposal of containerized class A waste;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(b): 10% of the gross receipts of a radioactive waste facility derived from the disposal of processed class A waste;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(c): except as provided in Subsection (2)(e), 5% of the gross receipts of a radioactive waste facility derived from the disposal of uncontainerized, unprocessed class A waste from a governmental entity or an agent of a governmental entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(c)(i): pursuant to a contract entered into on or after April 30, 2001;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(c)(ii): pursuant to a contract substantially modified on or after April 30, 2001;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(c)(iii): pursuant to a contract renewed or extended on or after April 30, 2001; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(c)(iv): not pursuant to a contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(d): except as provided in Subsection (2)(e), 5% of the gross receipts of a radioactive waste facility derived from the disposal of uncontainerized, unprocessed class A waste received by the facility from an entity other than a governmental entity or an agent of a governmental entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(e): .5% of the gross receipts of a radioactive waste facility derived from the disposal of uncontainerized, unprocessed class A waste received by the facility if the uncontainerized, unprocessed class A waste does not exceed 10% of the radioactive concentration limit for class A waste as defined in 10 C.F.R. Sec. 61.55;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(f): 5% of the gross receipts of a radioactive waste facility derived from the disposal of mixed waste, other than the mixed waste described in Subsection (2)(g), received from:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(f)(i): an entity other than a governmental entity or an agent of a governmental entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(f)(ii): a governmental entity or an agent of a governmental entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(f)(ii)(A): pursuant to a contract entered into on or after April 30, 2005;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(f)(ii)(B): pursuant to a contract substantially modified on or after April 30, 2005;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(f)(ii)(C): pursuant to a contract renewed or extended on or after April 30, 2005; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(f)(ii)(D): not pursuant to a contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(g): 10% of the gross receipts of a radioactive waste facility derived from the disposal of mixed waste:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(g)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(g)(i)(A): received from an entity other than a governmental entity or an agent of a governmental entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(g)(i)(B): received from a governmental entity or an agent of a governmental entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(g)(i)(B)(I): pursuant to a contract entered into on or after April 30, 2005;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(g)(i)(B)(II): pursuant to a contract substantially modified on or after April 30, 2005;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(g)(i)(B)(III): pursuant to a contract renewed or extended on or after April 30, 2005; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(g)(i)(B)(IV): not pursuant to a contract; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(g)(ii): that contains a higher radionuclide concentration level than the mixed waste received by any radioactive waste facility in the state before April 1, 2004;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(h): 10 cents per cubic foot of alternate feed material received at a radioactive waste facility for disposal or reprocessing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(2)(i): 10 cents per cubic foot of byproduct material received at a radioactive waste facility for disposal.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(3): For purposes of the tax imposed by this section, a fraction of a cubic foot is considered to be a full cubic foot.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.5(4): Except as provided in Subsections (2)(f) and (g), the tax imposed by this section does not apply to radioactive waste containing material classified as hazardous waste under 40 C.F.R.  Part 261.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.7 Radioactive waste facility disposal tax for concentrated depleted uranium and specific site approved waste.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.7(1): On and after July 1, 2019, there is imposed a tax on a radioactive waste facility as provided in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.7(2): 19-3-103.7(2); 19-3-103.7(2); 19-3-103.7(2) The tax is equal to the sum of the following amounts:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.7(2)(a): 19-3-103.7(2) 12% of the gross receipts of a radioactive waste facility derived from the disposal of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.7(2)(a)(i): concentrated depleted uranium; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.7(2)(a)(ii): 19-3-103.7(2) containerized waste disposed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.7(2)(b): 19-3-103.7(2) 10% of the gross receipts of a radioactive waste facility derived from the disposal of processed waste disposed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-103.7(2)(c): 19-3-103.7(2) 5% of the gross receipts of a radioactive waste facility derived from the disposal of uncontainerized, unprocessed waste disposed under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-104 Payment of tax.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-104(1): 59-24-103.5 The tax imposed by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-104(2): The payment shall be accompanied by the form prescribed by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-104(3): The payment shall be paid quarterly on or before the last day of the month next succeeding each calendar quarterly period.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-105 Deposit of tax revenue.
-------------------------------------------------------
The commission shall deposit the tax revenue collected under this chapter into the Uniform School Fund.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-106 Records.
----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-106(1): An owner or operator of a radioactive waste facility shall maintain records, statements, books, or accounts necessary to determine the amount of tax for which the owner or operator is liable to pay under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-106(2): The commission may require an owner or operator of a radioactive waste facility, by notice served upon the person, or by rule, to make or keep the records, statements, books, or accounts the commission considers sufficient to show the amount of tax for which the owner or operator is liable to pay under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-106(3): (2) After notice by the commission, the owner or operator of a radioactive waste facility shall open the records, statements, books, or accounts specified in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-108 Rulemaking authority.
-----------------------------------------------------
The commission may make rules under

Utah Code Annotated § 59-24-109 Penalties and interest.
-------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Chapter 26 - Multi-Channel Video or Audio Service Tax Act
******************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Multi-Channel Video or Audio Service Tax Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-102(1): "County or municipality franchise fee" means a franchise fee that a county or municipality receives from a multi-channel video or audio service provider.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-102(2): "Franchise fee" is as defined in 47 U.S.C. Sec. 542, except that the term "cable operator" or "cable subscriber" shall be interpreted to include a multi-channel video or audio service provider.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-102(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-102(3)(a): "Multi-channel video or audio service provider" means any person or group of persons that:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-102(3)(a)(i): provides multi-channel video or audio service and directly or indirectly owns a significant interest in the multi-channel video or audio service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-102(3)(a)(ii): otherwise controls or is responsible through any arrangement, the management and operation of the multi-channel video or audio service.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-102(3)(b): "Multi-channel video or audio service provider" includes the following except as specifically exempted by state or federal law:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-102(3)(b)(i): a cable operator;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-102(3)(b)(ii): a CATV provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-102(3)(b)(iii): a multi-point distribution provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-102(3)(b)(iv): a MMDS provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-102(3)(b)(v): a SMATV operator;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-102(3)(b)(vi): a direct-to-home satellite service provider; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-102(3)(b)(vii): a DBS provider.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-102(4): "Municipality" means a city or town.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-103 Imposition of tax -- Rate.
----------------------------------------------------------
Subject to SectionUtah Code Annotated § 59-26-103(1): within the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-103(2): to the extent permitted by federal law.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104 Collection of tax.
--------------------------------------------------
A multi-channel video or audio service provider shall:Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104(1): 59-26-103 collect the tax imposed by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104(2): (1); 59-12-108; Chapter 12, Sales and Use Tax Act; 59-12-107 pay the tax collected under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104(2)(a): 59-12-108; Chapter 12, Sales and Use Tax Act monthly on or before the last day of the month immediately following the last day of the previous month if:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104(2)(a)(i): 59-12-108 the multi-channel video or audio service provider is required to file a sales and use tax return with the commission monthly under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104(2)(a)(ii): Chapter 12, Sales and Use Tax Act the multi-channel video or audio service provider is not required to file a sales and use tax return under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104(2)(b): 59-12-107 quarterly on or before the last day of the month immediately following the last day of the previous quarter if the multi-channel video or audio service provider is required to file a sales and use tax return with the commission quarterly under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104(3): (1) pay the tax collected under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104.5 Nonrefundable credit against tax -- Amounts passed through to customers within the state -- Tax may not be reduced by amounts passed through to customers within the state.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104.5(1): Beginning on January 1, 2008, a multi-channel video or audio service provider may claim a nonrefundable tax credit as provided in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104.5(2): (1) The nonrefundable tax credit described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104.5(2)(a): may be claimed against the tax the multi-channel video or audio service provider would otherwise be required to collect under this chapter from its purchasers within the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104.5(2)(b): is in an amount equal to 50% of the total amount of county or municipality franchise fees that the multi-channel video or audio service provider pays:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104.5(2)(b)(i): to all of the counties and municipalities within the state that impose a county or municipality franchise fee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104.5(2)(b)(ii): for the calendar quarter for which the multi-channel video or audio service provider files a return under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104.5(3): (1) The nonrefundable tax credit described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104.5(4): (4)(b); (c); (4)(a); (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104.5(4)(a): (4)(b); (c) Subject to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104.5(4)(b): (4)(a) The amount that a multi-channel video or audio service provider passes through to its purchasers within the state under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-104.5(4)(c): (4) A tax under this chapter on amounts paid or charged for multi-channel video or audio service may not be reduced as a result of the amount a multi-channel video or audio service provider passes through to its customers within this state under this Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-105 Deposit of tax revenue.
-------------------------------------------------------
The commission shall deposit revenues generated by the tax imposed by this chapter into the General Fund.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-106 Records.
----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-106(1): A multi-channel video or audio service provider shall maintain records, statements, books, or accounts necessary to determine the amount of tax that the multi-channel video or audio service provider is required to remit to the commission under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-106(2): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The commission may require a multi-channel video or audio service provider to make or keep the records, statements, books, or accounts the commission considers sufficient to show the amount of tax for which the multi-channel video or audio service provider is required to remit to the commission under this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-106(2)(a): by notice served upon that multi-channel video or audio service provider; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-106(2)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act by administrative rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 59-26-106(3): (2) After notice by the commission, a multi-channel video or audio service provider shall open the records, statements, books, or accounts specified in Subsection

-----------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Chapter 27 - Sexually Explicit Business and Escort Service Tax
***********************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Sexually Explicit Business and Escort Service Tax."

Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(1): (1)(b) "Escort" means any individual who is available to the public for the purpose of accompanying another individual for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(1)(a): companionship; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(1)(b): (1)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(1)(b)(i): a salary;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(1)(b)(ii): a fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(1)(b)(iii): a commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(1)(b)(iv): hire;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(1)(b)(v): profit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(1)(b)(vi): (1)(b) any amount similar to an amount listed in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(2): (2)(b) "Escort service" means any person who furnishes or arranges for an escort to accompany another individual for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(2)(a): companionship; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(2)(b): (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(2)(b)(i): a salary;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(2)(b)(ii): a fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(2)(b)(iii): a commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(2)(b)(iv): hire;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(2)(b)(v): profit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(2)(b)(vi): (2)(b) any amount similar to an amount listed in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(3): "Nude or partially denuded individual" means an individual with any of the following less than completely and opaquely covered:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(3)(a): genitals;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(3)(b): the pubic region; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(3)(c): a female breast below a point immediately above the top of the areola.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(4): (4)(c) "Sexually explicit business" means a business at which any nude or partially denuded individual, regardless of whether the nude or partially denuded individual is an employee of the sexually explicit business or an independent contractor, performs any service:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(4)(a): personally on the premises of the sexually explicit business;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(4)(b): during at least 30 consecutive or nonconsecutive days within a calendar year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(4)(c): (4)(c) for:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(4)(c)(i): a salary;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(4)(c)(ii): a fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(4)(c)(iii): a commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(4)(c)(iv): hire;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(4)(c)(v): profit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-102(4)(c)(vi): (4)(c) any amount similar to an amount listed in this Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-103 Tax imposed on a sexually explicit business -- Tax imposed on an escort service.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-103(1): 59-12-102; 59-12-102 A tax is imposed on a sexually explicit business equal to 10% of amounts paid to or charged by the sexually explicit business for the following transactions:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-103(1)(a): an admission fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-103(1)(b): a user fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-103(1)(c): a retail sale of tangible personal property made within the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-103(1)(d): 59-12-102; 59-12-102 a sale of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-103(1)(d)(i): 59-12-102 food and food ingredients as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-103(1)(d)(ii): 59-12-102 prepared food as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-103(1)(e): a sale of a beverage; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-103(1)(f): any service.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-103(2): (2)(b); (2)(a); (2)(a); (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-103(2)(a): (2)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-103(2)(b): (2)(a); (2)(a); (1) Notwithstanding Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-105(4): (4); Title 76, Chapter 5, Part 4, Sexual Offenses; Title 76, Chapter 5, Part 4, Sexual Offenses; Title 76, Chapter 5, Part 4, Sexual Offenses

Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-105(4)(b): Title 76, Chapter 5, Part 4, Sexual Offenses The Department of Corrections shall use 60% of the money in the fund, in addition to existing budgets, to provide treatment services to nonworking or indigent adults who:

Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-105(4)(b)(ii): are not currently confined or incarcerated in a jail or prison.

Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-105(4)(c)(i): Title 76, Chapter 5, Part 4, Sexual Offenses have been convicted of an offense under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-105(4)(c)(ii): are not currently confined or incarcerated in a jail or prison.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-105(4)(d): Title 76, Chapter 5, Part 4, Sexual Offenses The Department of Corrections shall use 10% of the money in the fund, in addition to existing budgets, to implement treatment programs for juveniles who have been convicted of an offense under
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-105(4)(e): The attorney general shall use 15% of the money in the fund to provide funding for any task force:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-105(4)(e)(i): administered through the Office of the Attorney General; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-105(4)(e)(ii): that investigates and prosecutes individuals who use the Internet to commit crimes against children.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-106 Records.
----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-106(1): An owner or operator of a sexually explicit business or escort service shall maintain records, statements, books, or accounts necessary to determine the amount of tax for which the owner or operator is liable to pay under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-106(2): (1) The commission may require an owner or operator of a sexually explicit business or escort service, by notice served on the person, to make or keep the records, statements, books, or accounts described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-106(3): After notice by the commission, the owner or operator of a sexually explicit business or escort service shall open the records, statements, books, or accounts specified in this section for examination by the commission or an authorized agent of the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-108 Penalties and interest.
-------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 59-27-108(2): 59-1-402 interest provided in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 59-28-105 Seller or certified service provider reliance on commission information.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A seller or certified service provider is not liable for failing to collect a tax at a tax rate imposed under this chapter if the seller's or certified service provider's failure to collect the tax is as a result of the seller's or certified service provider's reliance on incorrect data provided by the commission in a database created by the commission:Utah Code Annotated § 59-28-105(1): containing tax rates or boundaries regarding a tax under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-28-105(2): 59-12-103(1)(i) indicating the taxability of transactions described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Chapter 30 - Electric Vehicle Charging Tax
***************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-101 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-101(1): "Charging station" means equipment designed to deliver electric energy to an electric vehicle for a fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-101(2): "Charging station operator" means a person who owns or operates a charging station in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-101(3): "Charging station subscription" means a service for which a person pays a charging station operator a subscription fee for a reduced charging rate or unlimited charging during the subscription period.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-101(4): "Electric vehicle" means a qualifying electric vehicle or qualifying plug-in hybrid vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-101(5): 11-42a-102 "Qualifying electric vehicle" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-101(6): 11-42a-102 "Qualifying plug-in hybrid vehicle" means the same as that term is defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102 Imposition -- Rate -- Revenue distribution.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(1): There is levied a tax upon the retail sale of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(1)(a): electric current sold by a charging station operator to charge or recharge an electric vehicle; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(1)(b): a charging station subscription by a charging station operator to charge or recharge an electric vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(2): (1); (4)(a); (4)(a); (4)(b); (2)(a); (c) The tax levied under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(2)(a): (4)(a) per kilowatt hour as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(2)(b): (4)(a) per hour as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(2)(c): (4)(b) a subscription fee for charging services as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(2)(d): (2)(a); (c) a combination of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(3): (1); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(3)(a): (1) A charging station operator shall remit a return on the tax imposed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(3)(b): (3)(a) The tax amount reported on the return described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(4): (4)(a); (b); (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(4)(a): For a charging station operator that charges a fee per kilowatt hour, the charging station operator shall furnish with each sale an itemized invoice, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(4)(a)(i): the name of the charging station operator;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(4)(a)(ii): the date of sale;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(4)(a)(iii): the number of kilowatt hours sold, or the length of time using the charging station;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(4)(a)(iv): the sales price per kilowatt hour, or per hour for use of the charging station; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(4)(a)(v): the total sales price of the transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(4)(b): For a charging station operator that charges a fee for a charging station subscription, the charging station operator shall furnish with each sale an itemized invoice, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(4)(b)(i): the name of the charging station operator;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(4)(b)(ii): the date of sale;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(4)(b)(iii): the subscription price; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(4)(b)(iv): the total sales price of the transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(4)(c): (4)(a); (b); (1) In addition to the information required in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(5): 59-1-401; 59-1-402; (3); (3) In addition to the tax required by this part, a charging station operator shall pay a penalty as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(5)(a): (3) pay the tax prescribed by this section by the due date described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(5)(b): (3) file a return required by this section by the due date described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 59-30-102(6): (1) The commission shall deposit revenue from the tax imposed in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated - Title 59 - Chapter 31 - Cannabinoid Licensing and Tax Act
*******************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-101 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-101(1): 4-41-102 "Cannabinoid product" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-101(2): "Licensee" means a retailer that holds a valid license under Part 2, Licensing, to sell a cannabinoid product.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-101(3): "Retail price" means the amount charged by a retailer for a cannabinoid product.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-101(4): "Retailer" means a person that sells a cannabionoid product to a consumer for personal use.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-201 Prohibition on the sale of a cannabinoid product without license.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-201(1): 59-31-202; 59-31-202 A person may not sell, offer to sell, or distribute a cannabinoid product in this state without first:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-201(1)(a): 59-31-202 obtaining a license from the commission under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-201(1)(b): 59-31-202 complying with the bonding requirement described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-201(2): It is a class B misdemeanor for a person to violate Subsection (1).


Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202 Issuance of license.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(1): 4-41-103.3 The commission shall issue a license to sell a cannabinoid product to a retailer that submits an application, on a form created by the commission, that includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(1)(a): the retailer's name;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(1)(b): 4-41-103.3 the address of the location permitted under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(1)(c): any other information the commission requires to implement this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(2): A license is:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(2)(a): valid at only one fixed business address;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(2)(b): valid for three years;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(2)(c): valid only for a physical location; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(2)(d): renewable if a licensee meets the criteria for licensing described in Subsection (1).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(3)(a): The commission shall require a retailer that is responsible under this part for the collection of tax on a cannabinoid product to post a bond.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(3)(b): Subject to Subsection (3)(c), the commission shall determine the form and amount of the bond.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(3)(c): The minimum amount of the bond shall be $500.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(4): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Rulemaking Authority, the commission may make rules to establish the additional information described in Subsection (1)(c) that a retailer shall provide in the application described in Subsection (1).
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(5): The commission may not charge a fee for a license under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(6): 4-41-103.3 The license under this section is in addition to a license required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(7)(a): The commission shall maintain a public list that includes the identity of each person licensed under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(7)(b): The list shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(7)(b)(i): include the type of license possessed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-202(7)(b)(ii): be updated by the commission at least once per quarter.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-203 License revocation and reinstatement.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-203(1): The commission shall, on a reasonable notice and after a hearing, revoke the license of any licensee violating any provisions of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-203(2): 59-1-401; 59-1-402 A license may not be reissued to a licensee described in Subsection (1) until the licensee has complied with the requirements of this chapter, including paying any:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-203(2)(a): tax due under Part 3, Tax;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-203(2)(b): 59-1-401 penalty as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-203(2)(c): 59-1-402 interest as provided in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-301 Taxation of cannabinoid product.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-301(1): A tax is imposed on a cannabinoid product at a rate of .10 multiplied by the retail price.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-301(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-301(2)(a): A licensee shall collect the tax imposed under Subsection (1) from a purchaser at the time the cannabinoid product is sold.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-301(2)(b): A consumer that purchases or receives an untaxed cannabinoid product shall pay the tax at the time the cannabinoid product is first received in this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302 Remittance of tax.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(1)(a): The licensee that collects the tax imposed on a cannabinoid product shall remit to the commission, in an electronic format approved by the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(1)(a)(i): the tax due in the previous quarter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(1)(a)(ii): the tax return.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(1)(b): The tax collected and the return are due on or before the last day of April, July, October, and January.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(2): A licensee that sells a cannabinoid product to a purchaser shall maintain records to determine the amount of tax due under this part for a period of three years.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(3)(a): A consumer that receives or purchases an untaxed cannabinoid product for use or other consumption shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(3)(a)(i): file with the commission, on a form provided by the commission, a statement showing the quantity and description of the cannabinoid product subject to tax under this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(3)(a)(ii): pay the tax imposed by this part on the cannabinoid product.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(3)(b): The consumer shall file the statement described in Subsection (3)(a) and pay the tax due on or before the last day of the month immediately following the month during which the consumer purchased an untaxed cannabinoid product.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(3)(c): A consumer shall maintain records necessary to determine the amount of tax the consumer is liable to pay under this part for a period of three years after the day on which the consumer filed the statement required by this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(4): A tourist who imports an untaxed cannabinoid product into the state does not need to file the statement described in Subsection (3) or pay the tax if the cannabinoid product is for the tourist's own use or consumption while in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(5): 59-1-401; 59-1-402 In addition to the tax required by this part, a person shall pay a penalty as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(5)(a): pay the tax imposed by this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(5)(b): pay the tax on time; or
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(5)(c): file a return or statement required by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(6): 59-1-402 An overpayment of a tax imposed by this part shall accrue interest at the rate and in the manner provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(7): 59-1-306; 59-31-401
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(7)(a): 59-1-306 The commission shall retain and deposit an administrative charge in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-302(7)(b): 59-31-401 The commission shall deposit 47% of the revenue generated by the tax imposed by this part into the General Fund and the remaining revenue into the Cannabinoid Proceeds Restricted Account created in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-401 Cannabinoid Proceeds Restricted Account.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-401(1): There is created within the General Fund a restricted account known as the "Cannabinoid Proceeds Restricted Account."
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-401(2): 59-31-301 The Cannabinoid Proceeds Restricted Account consists of:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-401(2)(a): 59-31-301 revenue collected from the tax imposed by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-401(2)(b): amounts appropriated by the Legislature.
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-401(3): 77-39-101; 63N-3-1302; 59-12-205 Subject to appropriation, money in the account may be used for the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-401(3)(a): enforcement of Title 4, Chapter 41, Hemp and Cannabinoid Act by the Department of Agriculture and Food;
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-401(3)(b): 77-39-101 investigations described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-401(3)(c): 63N-3-1302 the Industrial Hemp Grant Program created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-401(3)(d): 59-12-205 provided to counties, cities, and towns in proportion to the county's, city's, or town's distribution under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-402 Report to Department of Agriculture and Food of illegal cannabinoid product.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If the commission suspects that a cannabinoid product is being sold in the state in violation of a law other than a law described in this chapter, the commission shall report the name and tax identification number of the seller and the cannabinoid product:Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-402(1): to the Department of Agriculture and Food; and
Utah Code Annotated § 59-31-402(2): within 30 days after the day on which the commission becomes aware of the sale.
